Commentary: Henriques to Kedar Jadhav, out Kedar Jadhav Run Out!! 1 run completed. Cutting has conjured a wicket out of nowhere. That's a sensational throw from the deep. My goodness. He's absolutely nailed the stump from long leg and Jadhav is out of here. This is a huge moment in the context of the match, especially as Jadhav was looking so good. Even this shot which he played was extraordinary. It was a length ball outside off, Jadhav sat on his back knee and scooped it over short fine leg. He was a little slow to decide on the second run, maybe a little hesitant and boy did Cutting make him pay! More than a couple of feet short, even with a dive. Kedar Jadhav run out (Cutting) 31(16) [4s-4 6s-1]

Rashid Khan to Head, out Caught by Yuvraj!! Rashid strikes back! That might have been the googly. Yeah, it seems so. Head went for another slog-sweep, but due to the variation, Rashid managed to generate some extra-bounce which took more of a thick top-edge and lobbed up towards long-on. It still came really close to clearing the boundary though. Yuvraj keeps his cool and takes it smartly. Head c Yuvraj b Rashid Khan 30(22) [4s-3]

Bipul Sharma to Sachin Baby, out Caught by Henriques!! Straight up off a leading edge, taken! SRH taking control. There's no turn on the ball as Bipul fires it on leg-stump from round the wicket, Baby swings across the line and is undone by the sliding delivery. Good catch from Henriques too. He pedalled backwards from mid-wicket and made it much easier than it should have been. Sachin Baby c Henriques b Bipul Sharma 1(3)

Bhuvneshwar to Binny, out Caught by Yuvraj!! Gone this time. Yuvraj makes no mistake at backward point. What a top over this has been from Bhuvneshwar. It may now be a mountain too high for the RCB to climb. Binny backs away to slash a back of a length delivery over point. But this is a leg-cutter which bounces spongily and he slices it up to the fielder. Binny c Yuvraj b Bhuvneshwar 11(10) [6s-1]

Nehra to Watson, out Caught by Henriques!! That's the end of Watson, and of RCB. The little bit of reverse-swing which Nehra uses to curl the ball away from Watson does his undoing. Despite it being another full toss, Watson slices it straight up off the outside half of his bat. Simple catch at extra-cover. Watson c Henriques b Nehra 22(17) [4s-1 6s-1]

Nehra to Aravind, out Bowled!! Terrific yorker from Nehra; a perfect way to seal wicket no. 100 in the IPL for the veteran pacer. The ball tails back in, zips through Aravind before his bat could come down and plants leg-stump into its grave. Nehra on a hat-trick. Aravind b Nehra 0(2)

Bhuvneshwar to Tymal Mills, out Caught by Warner!! Good lord, that's got air miles on it. Way up into the night sky, Warner settles under it at long-on and takes it. Bhuvneshwar had slowed the pace down on the delivery, causing Mills to go through with the hoick too early. Right off the toe-end of the bat. Tymal Mills c Warner b Bhuvneshwar 6(3) [6s-1]

Cutting to Aniket Choudhary, out Chahal Run Out!! Direct-hit and that's it! SRH with a comprehensive win in the IPL 10 opener. Another pull shot from Choudhary, this one's straight to mid-wicket. Chahal comes running down only to be sent back and he had given up. Jordan with the bull's eye. Chahal run out (Jordan) 3(7)

Rashid Khan to Mandeep, out Bowled!! He strikes! The customary celebration follows. One hand up and the finger pointing skywards. The most delighted man in the dugout was his fellow countryman - Mohammad Nabi. He too had his finger up in celebration. The quicker wrong 'un and Mandeep clearly did not pick it, went back for the cut and gets cramped for room, only manages a chop onto the stumps. Mandeep b Rashid Khan 24(16) [4s-5]

Deepak Hooda to Gayle, out Caught by Warner!! It was an experiment from Warner and it has paid off. Completes the catch, turns towards the crowd and does a fist pump. RCB have lost two in quick succession. Both set batsmen gone. Slows it up as Gayle gives the charge, he goes through with the loft even though he isn't to pitch of the ball, miscues it towards long-off and Warner ain't dropping those. Gayle c Warner b Deepak Hooda 32(21) [4s-2 6s-3]

Aniket Choudhary to Warner, out Caught by Mandeep!! The night has changed completely for the 27-year old RCB debutant. Warner has been dismissed for less than fifty for the first time against RCB - when he's playing for SRH. On a good length and well outside off, it was there to be smacked, Warner didn't go through with the shot completely, he was just looking to clear the infield. Mandeep times his jump to perfection at point and completes a good two-handed catch. Warner c Mandeep b Aniket Choudhary 14(8) [4s-2 6s-1]

Binny to Dhawan, out Caught by Sachin Baby!! This was coming. It really was. Tactical aggression here from SD with his dance down the track looking to smoke some into the clouds. Does everything in getting right to the pitch of this fuller one as well, swings mighty too, just that he skews it off the toe end. All the altitude and into the safe palms of Baby at long-on. Dhawan c Sachin Baby b Binny 40(31) [4s-5]

Chahal to Henriques, out Caught by Sachin Baby!! Some normalcy restored. And as always is the case, it is spin that gets on that duty. Chahal doesn't mind giving it some air inviting the big swing. And gets just that. A full-blooded tonk down and skewed away. Almost teases Baby at the long-off fence with this one threatening to fly over, before the bucket hands facing upwards come to the rescue in plucking it out. They're checking the foot's behaviour - just inside the permissable limits. Henriques c Sachin Baby b Chahal 52(37) [4s-3 6s-2]

Tymal Mills to Yuvraj, out Bowled!! The zings light up. The crowd refuses to believe and keep searching for the ball. Nope, that's the end of the fun in store folks. Mills for a change aims for the stumps, going slower as well. Nicely off the back of the hand and foxes him with the seam position. A swat across the line is missed eventually and the top of leg takes the brunt. This has been some serious clock roll back here. Makes me feel 10 years younger. Yuvraj b Tymal Mills 62(27) [4s-7 6s-3]

R Bhatia to Rayudu, out Caught&Bowled!! Thank You! A typical Bhatia wicket. Foxes the batsman with a 116kph delivery and Rayudu is found checking his drive, spoons a straightforward chance and Bhatia accepts the dolly. Once again the Delhi man showing his variety and the key to his success has been the length. It was on a good length and Rayudu thought it was there for the drive. Not to be. Rayudu c and b R Bhatia 10(12)

R Bhatia to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Dhoni!! First Tahir and now Bhatia. The slow bowlers are doing it for RPS. Bhatia lets out a roar as soon as MS completes the catch. He's been exceptional with his variations. This offie was bowled at 96kph, Pandya just didn't have the pace to slog it across the line, the top-edge skies up and Dhoni calls for it. Takes it in his own unique way, one leg up in the air. Krunal Pandya c Dhoni b R Bhatia 3(5)

Zampa to Nitish Rana, out Caught by R Bhatia!! Bhatia has made amends. Put a sitter down early in the innings, this time keeps his eyes on the ball and ends Rana's knock. It was the googly which was drifting away from the southpaw, Rana went down and slog swept it flat, Bhatia didn't have to move at deep mid-wicket to pouch that. Nitish Rana c R Bhatia b Zampa 34(28) [4s-1 6s-2]

Stokes to Pollard, out Caught by Mayank Agarwal!! Stokes gets the better of the West Indian. But credit has to go to Mayank Agarwal, he's pulled off a stunner. Length delivery and Pollard miscued his loft, came more off the base of the bat. It was dropping in front of long-on before Mayank dived full length and grasped it inches from the ground. He didn't allow it to pop out even as he hit the ground. Pollard c Mayank Agarwal b Stokes 27(17) [4s-3 6s-1]

Tahir to Parthiv Patel, out Bowled!! Knocked him over. Tahir is off with his marathon sprint. The crowd go bonkers. It was a slider, just skids on and slaps Parthiv Patel's leg peg as he fails to connect with the slog sweep. Got too greedy and paid the price. Parthiv Patel b Tahir 19(14) [4s-4]

Tahir to Rohit, out Bowled!! And again, Imran Tahir is on fire. He's just unstoppable at the moment. A canny skidder this, just keeps going with the angle and clatters Rohit's stumps. He may have got a bit of inside edge there. He wasn't fully forward, neither backward. Poor feet movement. Rohit b Tahir 3(7)

Tahir to Buttler, out Lbw!! Inside-edge onto pad, but doesn't matter, the umpire has his finger up. No turn, just goes flat and on the stumps, Buttler is stuck inside the crease, tries to block off the front foot and ekes a big edge onto his pad. In real time though it appeared as if it had gone straight towards his pad. Wasn't to be. Big moment in the game? Buttler lbw b Tahir 38(19) [4s-3 6s-3]

Southee to Rahane, out Caught by Nitish Rana!! A slight misjudgement from Rana in the deep but he's recovered really well here. The umpires want to have a second look. But I think the catch was clean enough. Soft signal is out, and we will stay with out. A back of a length delivery, Rahane slogs it across the line and hits it flat and straight towards deep square leg. Rana is slightly guilty of sleeping on it. He doesn't really move from his position, expecting it to carry comfortably, and has to dive forward in the end. Snatches it right off the turf. Southee has struck first ball of a new spell. MI needed that. Rahane c Nitish Rana b Southee 60(34) [4s-6 6s-3]

Hardik Pandya to Stokes, out Caught by Southee!! Another miscue, this time it goes straight to hand. Was it an off-cutter from Pandya? Might have been. It was there on a length though but Stokes doesn't get hold of it and holes out at deep mid-wicket. The crowd erupts with "Dhoni, Dhoni" chants. Stokes c Southee b Hardik Pandya 21(14) [4s-3]

McClenaghan to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by Rohit!! Soft dimissal for Mayank. A daft little shot - to be precise. This was a back of a length delivery outside off, the width was there to cut, instead, he attempted something of a forehand jab, doesn't keep it down and hits it straight into the hands of Rohit at mid-off. Not the start Mayank wanted in his new franchise. Mayank Agarwal c Rohit b McClenaghan 6(5) [4s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Finch, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Second wicket for Kuldeep. One shot too many from Finch. It was the wrong 'un which was on a fuller length, Finch gives himself room to go inside out, the bat turns on impact and the ball skews towards long-off. Suryakumar runs around the circumference and pouches it cleanly. Finch c Suryakumar Yadav b Kuldeep Yadav 15(8) [6s-2]

Boult to Karthik, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! A fine knock ends. He provided the much needed impetus to the innings. Deserved a fifty, but that's cricket. Short delivery that caught Karthik by a bit of surprise, pulled it towards long-on and Suryakumar takes the easiest of catches. Raina pats him on the back as he trudges off. Karthik c Suryakumar Yadav b Boult 47(25) [4s-6 6s-2]

Chawla to Roy, out Caught by Y Pathan!! Roy falls and KKR have struck early. A nothing shot from the England opener. This was another long hop from Chawla, Roy rocked back on the pull, didn't go through with the shot completely - was perhaps just looking to help it on its way, gets a fat top-edge, high and over mid-wicket. Yusuf ran back and completed an easy catch. Roy looks gutted as he walks off. Roy c Y Pathan b Chawla 14(12) [4s-3]

Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, out Lbw!! Kuldeep has his man. This was tossed up on the leg-stump line, McCullum was looking to turn it towards the on-side, the ball straightened and went past his inside edge, struck him low and in front of leg-stump, would have been crashing into the stumps. Easy call for the umpire and it's also time for the strategic break. Brendon McCullum lbw b Kuldeep Yadav 35(24) [4s-4 6s-2]

Rahul Chahar to Amla, out Caught by Stokes!! The young man gets the big fish! A luring delivery tossed up outside off and the batsman looking to thwack it down the ground, finds the able hands of Stokes at long-off. That brings the game back in the balance. Amla was struggling to get the runs and pays the penalty trying to up the ante. Amla c Stokes b Rahul Chahar 28(27) [4s-2 6s-1]

Tahir to Axar, out Caught&Bowled!! Looks to go for the slog sweep, the googly undoes him and he manages a big fat top-edge. The high ball comes down for the bowler to pouch that. The trademark celebration from Tahir follows. That was a disastrous strike for KXIP as they had lost Amla a couple of balls earlier. The promotion didn't really yield the desired results. Axar c and b Tahir 24(22) [4s-1 6s-1]

Dinda to Vohra, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! First wicket down! Dinda sees the batsman charge down and bangs it short. Vohra is cramped for room, but still persists with his pull shot. Doesn't middle it and the ball balloons up on the leg-side. Tiwary, who had a good stint with the bat, runs to his left from deep mid-wicket and gobbles it up. Vohra c Manoj Tiwary b Dinda 14(9) [4s-1 6s-1]

Tahir to Saha, out Bowled!! Tahir strikes! And he is off! His customary celebratory run. He bamboozles Saha with a googly. It tweaked in at pace as well. Saha doesn't pick the wrong 'un and is also late to bring his bat down. The ball cannons onto the stumps. Through the gap between the bat and the pad. Saha b Tahir 14(9) [4s-3]

Sandeep Sharma to Mayank Agarwal, out Bowled!! Cleaned him up!! That was the ferocious inswinger and the batsman without covering the line of the ball looks to play across the line and misses. The sticks go cartwheeling and the bowler takes off with a hand in the air. He does it so often, does Sandeep Sharma. Superb bit of attacking bowling as he got the ball to land on the sticks and put the batsman on a tight leash. Mayank Agarwal b Sandeep Sharma 0(4)

Swapnil Singh to Dhoni, out Caught&Bowled!! A tame dismissal. Quite typical of Dhoni's defences in the early part of his innings. One of those famed stabby defences, just that he cannot keep this one down. But Swapnil decides to help him to an extent, getting his palms and almost grassing it. A three-time juggle before he earns himself a story for a lifetime. The replays show it to be much slower, yeah Dhoni was made to check his defence causing the ball-lob. Dhoni c and b Swapnil Singh 5(11)

Axar to Stokes, out Caught&Bowled!! A smash back. And the perish. Patel smartly keeps denying Stokes the opportunity to go through the on-side by firing it wide outside off. Gets the bat up flat on the slap down the ground. Too early once again and all he manages is the cue end that flies back to the upward palms of Patel. So the change in bats not quite what the side wanted at this point. Stokes c and b Axar 50(32) [4s-2 6s-3]

Sandeep Sharma to Christian, out Caught by Maxwell!! Shovels it to his doom. Only after having done his job to perfection. Sandeep gets the yorker right and Christian gets his bat down off a massive backlift in shovelling it out. Not quite the elevation this time with the ball flying down to long-on. Christian c Maxwell b Sandeep Sharma 17(8) [4s-2 6s-1]

T Natarajan to Rahane, out Caught by Stoinis!! There you go! The young man strikes. Whatta moment for him. A length delivery slanting away, Rahane looks to drive on the up, hits it uppishly and finds the safe hands of Stoinis in the sweeper region on the off-side. The fielder was looking into the sun, so he steadied himself, got a hand up to create a better vision and then gobbled it up. Rahane c Stoinis b T Natarajan 19(15) [4s-1 6s-1]

Stoinis to Smith, out Caught by Vohra!! HUGEEEEE WICKKKETTTT for KXIP. That was a leading edge as the ball held onto the surface for the batsman to not control the whippy pull. The man in the deep - Vohra, this time settles down and takes a smart catch at the edge of the boundary. It almost carried all the way. Pune in trouble now. Smith c Vohra b Stoinis 26(27) [4s-3]

Stanlake to Samson, out Caught by Binny!! Stanlake rushes Samson and gets rid of him. Really tame dismissal actually. He's pulling on the front foot, the ball is onto him quicker than expected and it hits him right on the splice. It spoons up for an easy catch to long-on. Bangalore keep hitting back, they keep fighting. Samson c Binny b Stanlake 13(12) [4s-1]

I Abdulla to Chris Morris, out Lbw!! The ball slides on with the arm, clips both the pads and up goes the finger. Morris was caught in the crease there to a flat ball from round the wicket, and then he made the mistake of playing across the line. That would have hit leg-stump. So Bangalore have struck back as soon as Delhi threatened to surge ahead. It's been that kind of chase. Chris Morris lbw b I Abdulla 4(5)

Chahal to Brathwaite, out Bowled!! Chahal's got him the very next ball and he is absolutely pumped. This is serious drama in Bangalore. A beautifully flighted leg-break which drifts in on leg, the ball dips on Brathwaite, lands away from him as he slogs and sneaks under him. Brathwaite b Chahal 1(5)

Watson to Pat Cummins, out Bowled!! It swings one way, and then the other. Watson hits back with a vengeance. A good length delivery which is in the slot for the slog, but the ball nips in just a touch to cause the error from Cummins. He chops it back on off an inside edge. The crowd is right in this. Pat Cummins b Watson 6(6) [4s-1]

Negi to Pant, out Bowled!! Negi has done it. That is surely the game for the RCB. Pant moves across towards off, Negi may or may not have seen that but he fires it on leg-stump and uproots it. A real valiant effort from Pant comes to an end. He's dragging himself off. Got to feel for him. Pant b Negi 57(36) [4s-3 6s-4]

Negi to Nadeem, out Caught&Bowled!! Negi tosses this up and lands it far enough from Nadeem to make him reach out for the slog. The ball turns, takes a thick leading edge and lobs up. Negi doesn't leave it for anyone else, he runs backwards and grabs it so well. Made it look easy there. Nadeem c and b Negi 0(2)

Tymal Mills to Tare, out Bowled!! Mills has struck. A fierce short of length delivery which skids on, keeps a bit low and nips back in from round the wicket. Tare makes room once more and has a slash at it but he's played over the ball by six inches at least. It pummels the off-stump. Tare b Tymal Mills 18(17) [4s-3]

Stanlake to Nair, out Bowled!! It's game on here at the Chinnaswamy! Nair has played completely down the wrong line of a full ball and is castled comprehensively. The crowd erupts. Rusty footwork from Nair as he presses forward to drive, the ball didn't seem to do a great deal. Might have held its line a touch if anything. Nair played way inside the line of it, maybe anticipating it to come back. The off and middle stumps are clobbered. Nair b Stanlake 4(3) [4s-1]

I Abdulla to Billings, out Caught by Stanlake!! Billings has been completely outsmarted. What clever bowling from Abdulla. He enticingly tosses this on up and ensures to keep it very wide of off. Seeing the flight, Billings is lured into having a go at it but he's not quite to the pitch of the ball and has to reach out for it. The ball turns away further, lobs up off a thick edge and is taken by Stanlake at backward point. Bangalore are making good inroads. Billings c Stanlake b I Abdulla 25(19) [4s-1 6s-1]

Zaheer to Binny, out Caught by Billings!! Lovely shot - but Binny has found deep mid-wicket to perfection. This was full and on his pads, Binny gets forward and whips it beautifully - but unfortunately for him, the placement wasn't right. Straight into the hands of Billings and he doesn't drop those. A small contribution from Binny - but a big wicket under the circumstances for the Daredevils. Binny c Billings b Zaheer 16(18) [4s-1]

Zaheer to Vishnu Vinod, out Vishnu Vinod Run Out!! That was completely unnecessary from Vishnu Vinod and it has cost him his wicket. This was a floaty delivery outside off, Vinod got underneath it and drilled it towards extra-cover. Almost a catch to Nadeem, he doesn't go for it though, instead, stops it on the half-volley, the return to the bowler is good and Zaheer whips the bails off - with Vishnu Vinod miles out of the crease. Vishnu Vinod run out (Nadeem/Zaheer) 9(5) [6s-1]

Zaheer to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by Chris Morris!! That's another huge wicket and RCB are losing their way towards the end. Lovely piece of deception from Zaheer. He followed the slower short ball with another slower ball, rolled his fingers across the seam. Kedar was backing away on the lofted drive, gets it right off the bottom of the bat, plenty of height but not the distance. Morris settles under it and holds on at mid-off. Kedar Jadhav c Chris Morris b Zaheer 69(37) [4s-5 6s-5]

Chris Morris to Negi, out Bowled!! Morris gets his yorker right and Negi's stumps go for a walk. This was fast, this was full and this was on the middle-stump line. Negi backs away on the drive, misses and simply walks back to the pavilion. Negi b Chris Morris 10(8) [6s-1]

Chris Morris to Tymal Mills, out Bowled!! Morris gets another wicket with a juicy full-toss. RCB finish with just 157 on the board. Mills made room on the drive, missed and the off-stump goes for a walk. Tymal Mills b Chris Morris 0(3)

Chris Morris to Gayle, out Caught by Samson!! A high full-toss has got rid of the big Jamaican. Gayle looked surprised, was looking to blast it over the top, can't get on top of the ball, it hit him high on the bat and lobbed over Samson at mid-off. He ran back, kept his eyes on the ball even as it landed beyond his shoulder, dives and clutches it with both hands. Chinnaswamy has been stunned into silence as the big man departs. Gayle c Samson b Chris Morris 6(8) [4s-1]

Pat Cummins to Mandeep, out Bowled!! Mandeep has chopped on for the second straight time in this tournament. On a length and just outside off, Mandeep saw the width, manufactured a bit more by backing away slightly, went with hard hands on the cut, gets an inside edge that bounces back onto the middle-stump. He was looking very good, but it means nothing now. Another promising start, but nothing more for Mandeep. Mandeep b Pat Cummins 12(10) [4s-3]

Nadeem to Watson, out Stumped!! Nadeem has deceived Watson completely in the air. Anticipated that Watson was getting itchy and was looking to dominate him, shortened his length and beats Watson in the air, the extra bounce did the trick. Watson was completely flummoxed on the lofted drive and Pant is quick to whip the bails off. RCB are in a spot of bother now. Watson st Pant b Nadeem 24(24) [4s-4]

Bhuvneshwar to Dwayne Smith, out Caught by (sub)Vijay Shankar!! Kumar strikes! Half the GL side are back in the hut now. Smith runs out of patience, decides to take on Bhuvi. It was a slower delivery and the West Indian didn't pick it. Was early into the shot and went through it, skews it off the toe-end and slices it towards deep mid-wicket. Vijay Shankar, the sub, runs to his left and pouched it safely. Dwayne Smith c (sub)Vijay Shankar b Bhuvneshwar 37(27) [4s-4 6s-1]

Nehra to Karthik, out Caught by Naman Ojha!! Two wickets in two overs and GL are losing gas towards the end. A short ball from Nehra, Karthik went across his sticks and tried to lap/scoop it over short fine, doesn't succeed as he gets a faint nick and Ojha takes a simple catch. Karthik c Naman Ojha b Nehra 30(32) [4s-2]

Nehra to D Kulkarni, out D Kulkarni Run Out!! Third umpire woken up for a run-out check. Kulkarni is struggling and has to take the long walk back to the pavilion. GL are committing hara-kiri. Another one bites the dust. Kulkarni worked it towards mid-wicket and took off blindly for a single, his partner was never interested and sends him back. Rashid Khan, the fielder, swoops down on the ball, takes the aim and fires a direct-hit at the striker's end to catch Kulkarni short of his crease. Rashid Khan's dream day continues. D Kulkarni run out (Rashid Khan) 1(2)

Rashid Khan to Brendon McCullum, out Lbw!! Rashid has struck gold in his first over! This was pushed through flatter and quicker, the wrong 'un from Rashid. McCullum was down on his knees as he went for the sweep and missed, struck pretty adjacent to the stumps and it's an easy call for the umpire. The impact was in front of middle, would have been going on and hitting the stumps. Brendon McCullum lbw b Rashid Khan 5(10)

Bhuvneshwar to Roy, out Caught by Dhawan!! Dhawan has claimed a catch. Roy isn't going anywhere. The third umpire will have a look, the soft call is OUT. He has caught it cleanly, but has the ball touched the ground or did Dhawan get his fingers underneath it? The zoomer has been called for, it looks tricky, but the soft signal is OUT. If there's no conclusive evidence, it will stay with the on-field call. The third umpire is taking numerous looks at it. B2$ is the call. GL have lost two of their overseas batting stars now. Coming to the ball, it was banged short and just outside off, Roy was rocking back on the pull, went low of the bat and looped towards mid-wicket. The ball was dying in front of him, but Dhawan does well to dive forward and holds onto it. Roy c Dhawan b Bhuvneshwar 31(21) [4s-5]

Rashid Khan to Finch, out Lbw!! Rashid is leaving the Lions flummoxed. This was the wrong 'un, pitched just outside off and spun back into the right-hander, Finch didn't read it one bit, played for the straighter one, beaten on the inside edge and struck bang in front of middle. The height wasn't an issue, the ball would have been crashing into the leg-stump. Easy call for the umpire and Gujarat Lions slip into further trouble. Finch lbw b Rashid Khan 3(5)

Rashid Khan to Raina, out Lbw!! Rashid is running through Gujarat Lions. This was the leg-break and Raina had no idea about it. This was tossed up on the off-stump line and spun back in slightly, Raina didn't read it, was playing for the straighter one, gets beaten on the inside edge and is rapped on the pads. The impact was in front of middle, would have been going on and hitting the top of middle. Rashid is on a roll and so are his team. The umpire has called for a strategic break. Raina lbw b Rashid Khan 5(8)

Bhuvneshwar to Dwayne Smith, out Caught by (sub)Vijay Shankar!! Kumar strikes! Half the GL side are back in the hut now. Smith runs out of patience, decides to take on Bhuvi. It was a slower delivery and the West Indian didn't pick it. Was early into the shot and went through it, skews it off the toe-end and slices it towards deep mid-wicket. Vijay Shankar, the sub, runs to his left and pouched it safely. Dwayne Smith c (sub)Vijay Shankar b Bhuvneshwar 37(27) [4s-4 6s-1]

Nehra to Karthik, out Caught by Naman Ojha!! Two wickets in two overs and GL are losing gas towards the end. A short ball from Nehra, Karthik went across his sticks and tried to lap/scoop it over short fine, doesn't succeed as he gets a faint nick and Ojha takes a simple catch. Karthik c Naman Ojha b Nehra 30(32) [4s-2]

Nehra to D Kulkarni, out D Kulkarni Run Out!! Third umpire woken up for a run-out check. Kulkarni is struggling and has to take the long walk back to the pavilion. GL are committing hara-kiri. Another one bites the dust. Kulkarni worked it towards mid-wicket and took off blindly for a single, his partner was never interested and sends him back. Rashid Khan, the fielder, swoops down on the ball, takes the aim and fires a direct-hit at the striker's end to catch Kulkarni short of his crease. Rashid Khan's dream day continues. D Kulkarni run out (Rashid Khan) 1(2)

Rashid Khan to Brendon McCullum, out Lbw!! Rashid has struck gold in his first over! This was pushed through flatter and quicker, the wrong 'un from Rashid. McCullum was down on his knees as he went for the sweep and missed, struck pretty adjacent to the stumps and it's an easy call for the umpire. The impact was in front of middle, would have been going on and hitting the stumps. Brendon McCullum lbw b Rashid Khan 5(10)

Bhuvneshwar to Roy, out Caught by Dhawan!! Dhawan has claimed a catch. Roy isn't going anywhere. The third umpire will have a look, the soft call is OUT. He has caught it cleanly, but has the ball touched the ground or did Dhawan get his fingers underneath it? The zoomer has been called for, it looks tricky, but the soft signal is OUT. If there's no conclusive evidence, it will stay with the on-field call. The third umpire is taking numerous looks at it. B2$ is the call. GL have lost two of their overseas batting stars now. Coming to the ball, it was banged short and just outside off, Roy was rocking back on the pull, went low of the bat and looped towards mid-wicket. The ball was dying in front of him, but Dhawan does well to dive forward and holds onto it. Roy c Dhawan b Bhuvneshwar 31(21) [4s-5]

Rashid Khan to Finch, out Lbw!! Rashid is leaving the Lions flummoxed. This was the wrong 'un, pitched just outside off and spun back into the right-hander, Finch didn't read it one bit, played for the straighter one, beaten on the inside edge and struck bang in front of middle. The height wasn't an issue, the ball would have been crashing into the leg-stump. Easy call for the umpire and Gujarat Lions slip into further trouble. Finch lbw b Rashid Khan 3(5)

Rashid Khan to Raina, out Lbw!! Rashid is running through Gujarat Lions. This was the leg-break and Raina had no idea about it. This was tossed up on the off-stump line and spun back in slightly, Raina didn't read it, was playing for the straighter one, gets beaten on the inside edge and is rapped on the pads. The impact was in front of middle, would have been going on and hitting the top of middle. Rashid is on a roll and so are his team. The umpire has called for a strategic break. Raina lbw b Rashid Khan 5(8)

Krunal Pandya to Y Pathan, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Another dismissal all in the household. In fact it doesn't leave Baroda either. Pathan in his quest to get on with the scoring jumps down the track, barely gets close but cannot pull out of his hoick. Swings hard, miscues big time and Hardik at long-off stretches vertically in plucking it out. Y Pathan c Hardik Pandya b Krunal Pandya 6(11)

Malinga to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Pollard!! The sucker ball. On the umpteenth occasion a set batsman perishes after the team passes on a strategy in the break. Can't blame Yadav for anticipating the toe-crushing yorker. He gets one just that there is no pace at all on this one. Swings through his shot, gets one hand off the handle and eventually watches the ball pick out Pollard to perfection at long-on. Suryakumar Yadav c Pollard b Malinga 17(15) [4s-2]

Malinga to Woakes, out Caught by Pollard!! The wheels falling off here. Looks for his favoured flat batted pull through cow corner. Does get it right but neither manages the elevation nor does he keep it down. Yet another batsman picks out Pollard at the fence. The ploy of keeping it short and slow doing the trick out here. Woakes c Pollard b Malinga 9(8)

McClenaghan to Narine, out Lbw!! Dead straight. Just that it goes onto the pad after smashing the bat. A yorker on the stumps, quite where he should have been right from the start. Narine tries hard in getting his bat down in digging it out. Almost does well in the end, gets right off the toe-end to ricochet onto his boot. Too quick for the umpire to spot it as well. Never mind. KKR finish with 178. Narine lbw b McClenaghan 1(2)

Krunal Pandya to Gambhir, out Caught by McClenaghan!! Gambhir combusts. The ploy of bringing in a spinner early in the innings has paid rich dividends for Mumbai. Gambhir, in an attempt to go big, miscues one and hits it straight to square leg. McClenaghan times his jump to perfection, leaps and takes a smart catch. Pandya exults in delight.Gambhir c McClenaghan b Krunal Pandya 19(13) [4s-3]

Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Two wickets in the over. Uthappa falls cheaply. This was floated up much fuller from KP, tempting Uthappa to go for the big shot. The Karnataka batsman went after it, albeit didn't find the sweet spot in his willow. Skies it as far as deep mid-wicket, where his brother Hardik swallows it up with ease. Pandya roars in joy and sprints up to his brother and leaps onto him. What a start for Mumbai. Uthappa c Hardik Pandya b Krunal Pandya 4(3) [4s-1]

Bumrah to Chris Lynn, out Lbw!! Boom! Bumrah strikes. Its the dangerous Lynn who has to walk back to the hut. The crowd find their voices back. Lynn makes a blunder by walking across his sticks, Bumrah kept it simple, bowled full and raps him low on the pad. Was beaten for pace and was struck right in front of middle. Lynn is disappointed. Big wicket for the home team. Chris Lynn lbw b Bumrah 32(24) [4s-3 6s-1]

Rajpoot to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Uthappa!! Rajpoot has strangled him down leg. What a lucky breakthrough to end a fledgling partnership. Back of a length on leg-stump, Krunal tries to help it along into the fine leg boundary but the deflection is only a small one. A faint little tickle off the inside edge straight to the keeper. Krunal Pandya c Uthappa b Rajpoot 11(6) [4s-2]

Woakes to Pollard, out Caught by (sub)Rishi Dhawan!! What a huge wicket right after the break. The major threat of Pollard is gone, and KKR will really back themselves now to seal this. Not sure if this was the plan, or Woakes just executed it incorrectly. He bowls it short and wide, Pollard throws his bat at and the top-edge flies down for a comfortable catch to third man. Massive moment. Pollard c (sub)Rishi Dhawan b Woakes 17(17) [4s-1 6s-1]

Rajpoot to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Narine!! That roar from Rajpoot drowned the whole of Wankhede by itself. Rana backs away to a low full toss on middle and spears it straight to point. He had timed the pants off it but couldn't have found the fielder any better. His stunning innings comes to an end. Oh what a game! Nitish Rana c Narine b Rajpoot 50(29) [4s-5 6s-3]

Kuldeep Yadav to Parthiv Patel, out Lbw!! Kuldeep can't be kept quiet for too long these days. He provides the first breakthrough for KKR and ends Parthiv's hit-and-miss innings. It was the wrong 'un and Parthiv shuffled across to sweep, missed and is rapped on the pads. The question was whether the impact was in-line, umpire Nandan thought so and raised his finger. Parthiv Patel lbw b Kuldeep Yadav 30(27) [4s-3 6s-1]

Rajpoot to Buttler, out Lbw!! Two wickets in two overs. The bowling change has worked for KKR and GG. The UP lad gets rid of the dangerous Buttler, who makes a start and gets out, again. A full toss that tailed back in, Buttler was beaten for pace as he missed the flick. The ball struck him in front of leg-stump. Not sure if it would have gone on to hit the sticks. But the finger was raised and he walks back. Buttler lbw b Rajpoot 28(22) [4s-1 6s-2]

Narine to Rohit, out Lbw!! Rohit is not walking. He's not pleased with the decision. Has some choice words to say to umpire Nandan. "That's an absolute shocker," says KP on air and he's right. Massive inside edge onto the pad. Two poor decisions in two overs might have just cost MI the game. The off-break which turns back in and cramps Rohit for room, he hurriedly brings his bat down and smashes it into his pads. The umpire didn't spot it and gave it out after a thought. Rohit was fuming after the decision. Even showed his bat to the umpire gesturing he hit it. But you can't overturn an onfield decision unless you have the DRS and that is not available in the IPL. This wicket has to be the game changing moment. Rohit lbw b Narine 2(6)

Tymal Mills to Vohra, out Lbw!! Number one down. A premature end to Vohra's innings. Mills is chuffed to bits, lets out a huge roar. It was full and straight, the back of the hand slower ball from Mills. Vohra misjudged it completely. Shuffled across his sticks and plays down the wrong line. Misses it and is struck low on the pad. Looked pretty adjacent and umpire Anil Chaudhary raises his dreaded finger. Vohra lbw b Tymal Mills 34(21) [4s-4 6s-1]

Chahal to Axar, out Bowled!! Chahal strikes. The experiment of sending Patel up the order fails. It was the googly from Chahal, wasn't quite short. Patel went for the encore, not the ideal length. He misses and the ball rattles the stumps. Chahal exults! Axar b Chahal 9(6) [6s-1]

Axar to Watson, out Bowled!! And that's a beautiful delivery to get rid of Watson. He beat him in the air. Lovely change of pace from Axar. The previous ball came at 100kph, this was nicely floated up, Watson was early into the cut, didn't turn much, anyway was too close to cut and he chops it back onto the sticks off an inside edge. So the ploy to open with Axar works wonders. Disappointment for the RCB skipper. Watson b Axar 1(4)

Aaron to Mandeep, out Caught by Saha!! Can a wicket keeper take a wicket? He sure can. Catches like those should be awarded to the keeper. Short delivery, got big on the batsman, he went for the pull and managed a big plump edge. The ball skied upwards and stayed there till eternity till Saha circled under it after running back and then despite misjudging it, threw himself in the air to take it out of thin air. Superb take from the mitts-man. Mandeep c Saha b Aaron 28(34) [4s-1 6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Vishnu Vinod, out Caught by Maxwell!! Good captaincy from Maxi. Vishnu Vinod hit a boundary that went aerial over mid-on in the previous over. Now he's placed himself in the deep and swallowed an easy catch. Disastrous start for RCB after opting to bat. Credit to Sandeep Sharma as well for dropping it short and cramping the batsman for room on seeing the batsman advance, Vinod wasn't in the best of positions to play, yet he went through with the hoick, totally mistimed it in the end. Vishnu Vinod c Maxwell b Sandeep Sharma 7(12) [4s-1]

Aaron to Kedar Jadhav, out Lbw!! "Aaaaah, aaaaah," goes Aaron and the finger goes up. "Definitely going over," says Pup on air, but quickly corrects himself to add, "maybe umpire's call." Body blow for RCB. Kedar was their hero in Bengaluru, he's out for a 4-ball 1 in Indore. Was that going over the top? Should the benefit of doubt been given to Kedar? This was the nip-backer from Aaron, Kedar was on the hop, impact was just around the off stump and hawk-eye shows the ball missing the stumps. Another poor call from the umpire. We've had a few thus far in the series. Ask Mumbai Indians! Kedar Jadhav lbw b Aaron 1(4)

Chahar to Tare, out Caught by Dhoni!! Look at him go. Surely he's inspired by a certain South African in his team - Imran Tahir. As soon as he sees Dhoni complete the catch, Chahar is off on a celebratory run. Runs past almost all his mates. Good length ball in the channel around off, Tare has a needless poke at that, the hint of away movement takes the edge and Dhoni does the rest behind the stumps. Tare does not trouble the scorers and RPS have an early wicket. Tare c Dhoni b Chahar 0(5)

Stokes to Pant, out Pant Run Out!! That's brilliant stuff from Mayank Agarwal. The excellence cuts short Pant's innings. To start with, Stokes bowled a wide yorker. Pant squeezes it out, finds Mayank at point and sets off. Mayank finds the target directly and Pant is well short of his ground. Pant run out (Mayank Agarwal) 31(22) [4s-1 6s-2]

Zampa to Samson, out Bowled!! Zampa gets his man and Samson walks back raising his bat. Gets a standing ovation from his team mates in the dug-out. It was a flipper that did the trick. Samson looked to pull it through the on-side and failed to make connection. The ball cannons onto the stumps. Samson b Zampa 102(63) [4s-8 6s-5]

Tahir to Billings, out Bowled!! And off he goes. Gets the crowd going as well. Billings is cursing himself off the field. It is yet another start for the Englishman that is not converted. It's always dangerous to shimmy down the wicket for a bowler like Tahir, who generally skids the ball through, and that is what happened. Billings came down the wicket and Tahir pushed it through, by the time the Kent batsman could get his bat down, the ball was past him and crashed into off-stump. The partnership has been broken and just the opening RPS needed. Billings b Tahir 24(17) [4s-4]

Mishra to Dhoni, out Caught by Nair!! When things go wrong, they go hopelessly wrong. Even his favourite helicopter shot has gone wrong tonight, that should snuff out whatever little hopes Pune might have had. This was tossed up invitingly by Mishra, Dhoni cleared his left leg and whipped it off his toes - flat and hard, but straight to Karun Nair at deep mid-wicket. He didn't have to move an inch, accepts the catch gleefully. MS walks off, so do half the Pune crowd. Dhoni c Nair b Mishra 11(14) [6s-1]

Mishra to R Bhatia, out Caught by Chris Morris!! Another wicket for Mishra, he's having a better night. This was a floaty leg-break, went wider of off. Bhatia had to fetch that as he played the slog-sweep, went off the toe of the bat and it's a simple catch to Morris at long-on. Bhatia has a look at his bat and walks away. Mishra is on a hat-trick now. R Bhatia c Chris Morris b Mishra 16(17) [6s-1]

Zaheer to Chahar, out Caught by Pant!! Third wicket for Khan, he's having a ball tonight. Saw Chahar giving him the charge, banged it short and on the stumps, Chahar swung across in hope, gets a thick top-edge - simple catch to Pant. Zaheer has a few words to say as Chahar walks away. The end is nigh for Pune. Chahar c Pant b Zaheer 14(6) [6s-2]

Mishra to Zampa, out Caught by Samson!! Another catch for Samson and another wicket for Mishra. This was another leg-break, bowled slower and on the middle-stump line. Zampa swung across in hope, he had to manufacture all the power himself, doesn't get the elevation either. Samson moves across to his right at deep mid-wicket and takes the offering. The umpire has called for a strategic break with just one wicket remaining. Not sure what the two teams will talk about over the next 150 seconds. Zampa c Samson b Mishra 5(7) [4s-1]

Pat Cummins to Dinda, out Caught by Mishra!! The Daredevils have opened their tally and it's Cummins who has the final wicket. On a good length and on the stumps, Dinda was backing away on the drive, doesn't get hold of the shot and chips it tamely towards cover. Mishra runs forward, dives and completes the catch. A 97-run mauling at home for Pune, they would love to forget today's display as soon as possible. Dinda c Mishra b Pat Cummins 7(7) [4s-1]

Zaheer to Rahane, out Caught by Samson!! Zak attack strikes! Glum faces in the crowd. Rahane falls early in the innings, big wicket for DD. It was on a fuller length around off, it was the off-cutter from Zak. Rahane perhaps went hard at it, the ball seemed to have stopped on the pitch and that must've foiled Rahane's attempt there. Skewed off the toe-end and lobs a sitter to Samson at mid-off, who backtracks and pouches it safely. So, Zak gets the better of his counterpart. Rahane c Samson b Zaheer 10(9)

Zaheer to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by Chris Morris!! The old warhorse gets his second wicket. Agarwal's poor form continues. He was scarced for runs, wanted to throw caution to the winds but doesn't succeed. Went for a on-the-up drive to a good length delivery that probably kicked up a touch. It was the slower ball from Zaheer that did the trick. He slices it straight to extra-cover, who took a couple of steps back and held onto it. Mayank Agarwal c Chris Morris b Zaheer 20(18) [4s-2]

Chris Morris to Tripathi, out Caught by Nadeem!! Short ball consumes Tripathi. Morris picks up his first wicket. A lifter angled at the batsman, Tripathi went for the pull. The ball got big on him and he manages a fat top-edge that went up in the air. Nadeem from fine leg darted in and snaffled it with ease. Tripathi c Nadeem b Chris Morris 10(5) [4s-2]

Nadeem to du Plessis, out Caught by Pant!! "Ahhhh, ahhhhh" goes Pant and S Ravi raises his finger. A big blow for Pune. Stunned silence in the crowd. du Plessis tried to be too cheeky, went low to play the scoop over the keeper's head. Gets a faint tickle and Pant nestles it into the gloves. du Plessis c Pant b Nadeem 8(7) [4s-1]

Pat Cummins to Stokes, out Caught by Pant!! Gone! Three wickets in three overs and Pune are in trouble now. Stokes bites the dirt. Cummins reaps reward for his tidy bowling. Again slants it wide of off, Stokes went for a pull. Wasn't too short and all he could manage was an under-edge that was gobbled up by Pant. Smart catch, must say as it was dying. He bent forward and took it cleanly. Stokes c Pant b Pat Cummins 2(5)

Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, out Caught by Dhawan!! He's whipped a pull straight to square leg. It was an innocuous short of length delivery into the body, not very high, and Pollard usually is pretty adept at dealing with those. But this time it seemed as if he didn't go through with the shot. It's straight down the throat of Dhawan. Can SRH still turn things around? Pollard c Dhawan b Bhuvneshwar 11(11) [6s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Cutting!! He's holed out off a full toss. He swings hard but gets it right off the toe-end. It still goes pretty far and is caught just 5 yards inside the deep mid-wicket boundary. Cutting takes a smart catch running backwards and to his right. Krunal Pandya c Cutting b Bhuvneshwar 37(20) [4s-3 6s-3]

Bhuvneshwar to Nitish Rana, out Bowled!! Bhuvneshwar knocks over Rana's off-bail. It hit nothing else but the bail. Third wicket for Bhuvneshwar. He's been fantastic again today. A little bit of nip from a good length, Rana was backing away looking to create a shot out of nothing and missed it by a long way in the end. He's played a fine knock though. Nitish Rana b Bhuvneshwar 45(36) [4s-3 6s-2]

Nehra to Buttler, out Bowled!! The batsman preempts by dancing down the track but he lost his dancing shoes in the process as the slower ball doled out deceives him. The wily old Nehra rolled his fingers over the ball and the batsman trying for a cross batted swipe completely missed the ball due to the lack of pace on it. SRH get the first blood. Buttler b Nehra 14(11) [4s-3]

Rashid Khan to Rohit, out Lbw!! The wrong 'un and the MI skipper seems to be at the wrong end of it again. First game: Tahir, Now: Rashid. The ball decked in after landing and the meek prodded attempt from Rohit plots his own misery. The impact might have been around off even as Rohit lunged forward on the defensive push. The teen sensation continues to bamboozle the men. Rohit lbw b Rashid Khan 4(4)

Deepak Hooda to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! Length ball tossed up and he has chipped it straight to the man at long-on who dives forward and takes a good catch. He gave the impression to us that it might have stuck onto the wicket a bit. But it was a bizzare shot as he just lofted it without any particular intent on the shot. End of a good knock from Parthiv Patel. Parthiv Patel c Bhuvneshwar b Deepak Hooda 39(24) [4s-7]

Harbhajan to Warner, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Not again! Warner tries for another switch hit and this time it doesn't come off, ends up playing it off the back of the bat as the ball slid onto him and then the heroics of PP. He anticipated the shot, moved quickly to his left and dived full length before nestling it inches above the turf. Stunning catch that. Warner c Parthiv Patel b Harbhajan 49(34) [4s-7 6s-2]

Harbhajan to Deepak Hooda, out Caught by Pollard!! Harbhajan's doosra does the trick, and boy is he happy! Does a cradle like celebration for his daughter, who is in attendance today. That was fired around off and middle, Hooda knelt down on knee and miscued the slog, was trying to clear long-on, but didn't get the distance. Pollard sets himself at long-on and consumes with ease. Deepak Hooda c Pollard b Harbhajan 9(9) [4s-1]

McClenaghan to Dhawan, out Bowled!! No fifties for the openers. Warner misses it by a run and SD by two. It was a loopy full toss which dips under Dhawan's cross-bat hoick to crash into his stumps. Easily done. McClenaghan has a wicket, been expensive thus far but this wicket should sooth his nerves. Dhawan b McClenaghan 48(43) [4s-5 6s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Yuvraj, out Bowled!! Dragged on! Lands on the seam and gets the ball to angle away from Yuvi; making him fetch that far from his reach. Yuvi with his laden-feet went through with the pull and chopped it back onto his stumps, off the thick inside edge firing off the PUMA sticker. Yuvraj b Hardik Pandya 5(7) [4s-1]

Bumrah to Cutting, out Bowled!! The Bumrah special, Cutting can't do much, just drops his head and walks off. Goes a touch wide of the crease and lands a perfect yorker, right at the base of middle stump. By the time Cutting got his bat down, his stumps were already shattered. Phewf! Cutting b Bumrah 20(10) [4s-4]

Malinga to Vijay Shankar, out Caught by Nitish Rana!! Way too early through his shot, played the shot on Monday, and the ball...Um! It arrives on Wednesday. Looking to flick, a healthy leading edge pops up to Rana at backward point. Simple catch. Vijay Shankar c Nitish Rana b Malinga 1(2)

Bumrah to Naman Ojha, out Caught by Pollard!! The wickets keep tumbling. Slower ball, in right-hander's swinging arc, Ojha got under it but he didn't give it a full whack. Relies on timing and chips it high into the night sky, Pollard is safe as a house at long-on. Naman Ojha c Pollard b Bumrah 9(9)

Bumrah to Rashid Khan, out Caught&Bowled!! Bumrah says "It's mine" and he makes no mistake. Charges out of his crease and clatters it, nowhere off the middle, it hung in the air for long and Bumrah had it covered. Caught it around the cover region. Rashid Khan c and b Bumrah 2(4)

Axar to Uthappa, out Bowled!! Uthappa attempts a cheeky lap sweep and ends up self-destructing himself. His captain doesn't look too pleased with it. This was tossed up on the leg-stump line, Uthappa went a long way across his stumps, bent down and was looking to lap it past the keeper, misses and the ball hits the top of leg-stump. Hushed silence at the Eden Gardens as Uthappa walks away. Uthappa b Axar 26(16) [4s-3 6s-1]

Aaron to Narine, out Caught by Axar!! Narine's fun is over, but has he taken this match away from KXIP's grasp? This was banged in short and on the stumps, Narine swivels across and pulls it hard and flat - was struck pretty well but went straight into the hands of Axar at deep mid-wicket. He doesn't drop those and Narine walks off to a nice round of applause. Even his captain enjoyed it, gives a good send-off to his partner. Narine c Axar b Aaron 37(18) [4s-4 6s-3]

de Grandhomme to Amla, out Caught by Gambhir!! Maiden IPL wicket for de Grandhomme. Amla's painful innings is over. The frustration was creeping in, he walked across and tried to nudge it into the on-side, it was an off-pace delivery and Amla was fooled there. Gets a fat leading edge that goes up in the air. The skipper takes a simple catch at cover and the crowd roars in delight. Amla c Gambhir b de Grandhomme 25(27) [4s-4]

U Yadav to Maxwell, out Caught by Uthappa!! Mad max Maxi is gone. This is a body blow for Punjab. Two wickets in two overs and the pendulum swings back in favour of KKR now. It was a pacy back of a length delivery, Maxwell backed away towards the leg-side, perhaps was undone by the bounce there. He is tucked up for room, ends up having a slash at it. Gets a feather and Uthappa makes no mistake behind the stumps. First time Maxi has been dismissed in this IPL. Maxwell c Uthappa b U Yadav 25(14) [4s-3 6s-1]

U Yadav to Miller, out Caught by M Pandey!! There is a notion that full tosses are a bad ball but not on this occasion. Some respite for Umesh and KKR. Slips in a friendly full toss on the stumps, Miller went for a whack across the line, again squirts it high on the bat. Pops it high towards deep mid-wicket. Pandey ran forward, covered good ground and snaffled a good running catch. The umpires checked for a possible no-ball (both crease and height), but it was fine. KKR anthem blares in the background. Miller c M Pandey b U Yadav 28(19) [4s-2 6s-2]

U Yadav to Saha, out Caught by Woakes!! Two in two for Umesh. What an over this is turning out to be for KKR. Umesh is on hat-trick now. A fuller ball on off, Saha sort of checked his shot, ended up hitting it uppishly to mid-off, Woakes dived forward and held onto a smart catch. He ensured that it didn't pop out of his hands when his elbows hit the ground. Saha c Woakes b U Yadav 25(17) [4s-2 6s-2]

U Yadav to Axar, out Caught by Narine!! Three wickets in the over and Punjab are falling apart here. Umesh is on a roll. Spears it on a fuller length on off, straightened a wee bit. Patel was early into his shot, skims a leading edge that balloons straight into the hands of Narine at extra cover, who finally holds onto one today. Axar c Narine b U Yadav 0(1)

Woakes to Mohit Sharma, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Another one bites the dust. Against the run of play, Punjab lose another one. It was a short ball slanted at the body, Mohit went after it, gets it high on the bat and skews it to long-on where Suryakumar Yadav pouches it safely. Mohit Sharma c Suryakumar Yadav b Woakes 10(8) [4s-1]

Woakes to Aaron, out Caught by Gambhir!! Oh goodness! Gambhir nearly made a meal of this catch. He somehow clasps onto it. A full ball outside off, Aaron threw his bat, gets a top-edge that goes high in the air towards extra cover. Gambhir set himself under it, the ball was swirling in the air. The ball popped out of his hand, after juggling with it, he manages to gobble it up. Aaron c Gambhir b Woakes 4(5)

Chawla to Vohra, out Bowled!! Much needed breakthrough for the hosts. Chawla comes on and strikes first ball. Not a big turner of the ball, this bloke, and that skiddiness through the surface accounts for Vohra. May have been the googly. Pushed through the air, lands it on a length, and the ball zips through the gate as Vohra tries to loft it on the up. He was aiming for the inside-out shot with the turn. But the ball goes straight on and knocks over middle and off. Vohra b Chawla 28(19) [4s-4 6s-1]

Narine to Stoinis, out Bowled!! Chopped on! Stoinis doesn't pick this one. He expects the ball to go away to aid his cut shot, but it turns in slightly to cramp him up. A thick under-edge into the pitch before bouncing up to knock over the top of leg stump. Stoinis b Narine 9(12) [4s-1]

Binny to Buttler, out Caught by Gayle!! Binny tears off the wrapping paper and presents RCB with a gift in his first over. Early strike from the home team. Binny was being under used in the last three matches. Makes amends immediately today with a prized scalp of Buttler. It was a fuller length delivery jagging in on leg-stump line, seemed to have stopped on Buttler. He flicks it meekly straight to mid-wicket. Gayle won't drop those. Buttler c Gayle b Binny 2(5)

Chahal to Pollard, out Caught by de Villiers!! The gamble has worked for Kohli. Gives the ball to Chahal, who tosses it up, the batsman takes the aerial route but gets more elevation than distance and ends up being caught at long-off. That again went very high but ABD was all calm under the ball and cupped it without any fuss. Pollard c de Villiers b Chahal 70(47) [4s-3 6s-5]

Badree to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Gayle!! Two in two for RCB. Chinnaswamy breaks the sound barrier. RCB are right back in this contest. Both openers back in the hut now. Badree looped it full outside off, it was the sucker ball and Patel fell into the trap. Drove it on the rise straight to Gayle at short extra cover. The West Indian shows quick reflexes as he pouches an excellent catch. He was alert enough and his natural instincts took over there. Parthiv Patel c Gayle b Badree 3(8)

Badree to McClenaghan, out Caught by Mandeep!! "Mumbai Indians are committing hara-kiri" screams Ravi Shaz on air. Can't disagree. McClenaghan has been promoted up the order and what does he do first ball? Gets underneath a full toss and smacks it straight into the bucket hands of Mandeep at long-on. McClenaghan c Mandeep b Badree 0(1)

Badree to Rohit, out Bowled!! The scoreline reads 7/4. This is surreal from RCB. What an over from Badree. Badree takes a hat-trick. Rohit's woeful form continues. He fails to pick this googly from Badree. The crowd go bonkers. It came back in as Rohit prodded forward to defend, leaves a gap between his bat-pad. Enough for the ball to sneak through to rattle the stumps. Rohit b Badree 0(2)

Badree to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Aravind!! What a dream spell from Badree. Finishes it with a wicket. His fourth of the evening. Rana bites the dirt. Was itching to smack this quicker delivery, it was wider of off. The width was there and Rana went after it with a flashy cut. He forgets to keep it down and hits it straight to point. Aravind dives forward and takes a fine low catch. MI sink further into the mire. Nitish Rana c Aravind b Badree 11(16) [4s-1]

McClenaghan to Kohli, out Caught by Buttler!! The Buttler serves this one up for his team by pouching the big man on the juggle. That was wide and on a length, the batsman threw his hands at that and managed to trample it straight down the throat of the man at deep cover. Buttler came in a few paces, juggled it once as the ball came at chest height to him and then on the juggle managed to grab hold of it. Kohli c Buttler b McClenaghan 62(47) [4s-5 6s-2]

Krunal Pandya to de Villiers, out Caught by Rohit!! The Hit Man does it for the MI side. He flies to his left and flings his left hand to pick that out of thin air. That was chipped away uppishly sans any control from ABD and the ball was picked up inches from the ground as Rohit decided to showcase his wings at extra cover. Third time Krunal has accounted for ABD in the IPL. de Villiers c Rohit b Krunal Pandya 19(21) [6s-1]

Bumrah to Negi, out Kedar Jadhav Run Out!! The yorker blocked back, the bowler picks it up with one hand to his left and then has the mind to strike the sticks down at the bowler's end. That was harakiri from Kedar Jadhav as he was backing up so far on a free-hit delivery. That will hurt RCB but credit to Bumrah as he had the brain to take the opportunity. Kedar Jadhav run out (Bumrah) 9(8)

McClenaghan to Mandeep, out Bowled!! Gone first ball. The length ball, batsman looks to go for the big monty and ends up dragging the ball onto his sticks. He had to throw caution to the winds but manages only a thick inside edge. McClenaghan is finally getting amongst the wickets in this season after a disastrous start to his campaign. Mandeep b McClenaghan 0(1)

Hardik Pandya to Gayle, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Gone! Pandya has struck in his first over. As often is the case, lapse in concentration for Gayle. Hits the deck on a shortish length outside off, Gayle wanted to pull it, he had to fetch it from outside off. He came down a step and wanted to smack the leather off it. All he could do was manifest a faint nick to the keeper. PP went up straightaway and Hardik joined him late. Hushed silence in the crowd. The umpires checked for a possible no-ball but his foot was way behind the crease. Gayle c Parthiv Patel b Hardik Pandya 22(27) [4s-2 6s-1]

Rahul Chahar to Brendon McCullum, out Stumped!! The junior Chahar continues to impress. Some of the fantasy fanatics are cursing_____ you know who! Baz follows his instincts, shimmies down and looks to bash the young man over long-on. Was nowhere near the pitch of the delivery, beaten by length and done in the drift and dip. MS slaps the bails in flash. Brendon McCullum st Dhoni b Rahul Chahar 49(32) [4s-5 6s-3]

Tahir to Karthik, out Bowled!! Tahir strikes and the customary celebrations follow! DK had a great domestic season, looked decent thus far in this IPL, but not today. He was shaping up to cut, perhaps didn't expect Imran Tahir to fire in a googly. Result? He ends up chopping it back onto his stumps, off the inside edge obviously. Karthik b Tahir 3(5)

SN Thakur to Dwayne Smith, out Caught by Rahul Chahar!! Flays one straight down the throat of third man. Dwayne Smith is disappointed, but he has done his job. Was lured by the width on offer and went chasing, makes a mess of the connection though, it slices the thick outside edge and drops as a dolly into the hands of junior Chahar. Dwayne Smith c Rahul Chahar b SN Thakur 47(30) [4s-8 6s-1]

P Kumar to Rahane, out Caught by Raina!! What a way to start your 150th IPL game. First, won the toss and now pulls off a blinder. Even he can't believe that he has plucked that out. A blob for Rahane and early trouble for Pune. This one jagged back in from a shortish length, Rahane thought it would be shaping away and went for a flashy cut, the outside edge flies towards the cordon. Raina, standing at wide slip, reacts quickly and grabs it with his left hand. He caught it when the ball had almost passed him. Rahane c Raina b P Kumar 0(3)

Andrew Tye to Stokes, out Bowled!! The aeroplane takes off. Second wicket for Tye and what a selection he's been for GL. Another biggie for the home side. A set Ben Stokes departs. It was the knuckle ball from Tye, Stokes did not pick it and was early into his drive, the ball catches the inside edge and deflects off the pads onto the stumps. RPS in a spot of bother now. Stokes b Andrew Tye 25(18) [4s-2 6s-1]

Jadeja to Dhoni, out Lbw!! Dhoni's poor run of form continues. He's hit on the back leg as Jadeja slides one on with the arm and the ball would have clipped leg-stump at least. Dhoni wanted to cut loose here and unwinds a hefty swing looking to go downtown but was beaten on the inside edge by the slider. A good phase for Gujarat this. Dhoni lbw b Jadeja 5(8)

Andrew Tye to Ankit Sharma, out Caught by Brendon McCullum!! That's been skied up .. and McCullum takes a really good catch around 5 yards inside the ropes. It was there to be slogged from a length, but Ankit went through it too early and lobbed a leading edge up which surprisingly travelled quite a fair bit. McCullum skirts to his right from long-on, runs backwards and grabs it with both hands while tumbling over. Ankit Sharma c Brendon McCullum b Andrew Tye 25(15) [4s-2 6s-1]

Andrew Tye to Manoj Tiwary, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Two in two. Tye has four. Slower ball at the stumps, Tiwary swings it in the air and is caught at the backward square leg boundary. Lovely deception from Tye. Manoj Tiwary c Ishan Kishan b Andrew Tye 31(27) [4s-2 6s-1]

Andrew Tye to SN Thakur, out Bowled!! Two hat-tricks in a day. The IPL has gone mental. Thakur has absolutely no clue as Tye dips a knuckle ball into the blockhole and he ends up playing all around it. The ball sneaks through to knock leg-stump. Tye is absolutely pumped. It's a five-for as well! SN Thakur b Andrew Tye 0(1)

Andrew Tye to Tripathi, out Caught by Finch!! A breezy innings comes to an end. One shot too many from Tripathi. Should have tried to bat a bit longer, especially with Smith at the other end. Full delivery on off, Tripathi makes a bit of room and lofts it to mid-off. The idea was to go over the fielder, but with the ball being too close to his bat, he did not get the elevation. Finch reverse cups it right on the edge of the circle. Tripathi c Finch b Andrew Tye 33(17) [4s-3 6s-2]

Dwayne Smith to Smith, out Caught by Finch!! Break followed by a wicket. The bowling change has worked for GL. This is a huge wicket. Smith was looking in ominous touch. Short of length delivery just outside off, Smith went for the pull and top edged it towards long-off. Finch had plenty of time to settle under that and he pouches it safely. Just what GL needed after the time-out and not what RPS required. Steven Smith was gutted with himself, smacks the bat onto his glove as he walks back. Smith c Finch b Dwayne Smith 43(28) [4s-6 6s-1]

Cutting to Uthappa, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! The luck runs out. But it's done the damage. On the shorter side, with the pace taken off the ball as well. Uthappa looks to go ahead with his front-footed pulls but wears it high on the bat with the face swaying upwards as well. For a change, the airy ride finds its destination in the hands of Rashid at mid-wicket. Uthappa c Rashid Khan b Cutting 68(39) [4s-5 6s-4]

Bhuvneshwar to M Pandey, out Caught by Warner!! A strike. In the form of Bhuvneshwar. A slower float here outside off and Pandey pretty compulsively reaches out in looking to deposit it out of the park. Is quite early on his slice and the balloon off the cue end goes high but just not long enough. A running in Warner from long-off will not put these down. Not even if he is distracted by Bipul Sharma running back from cover to take it. M Pandey c Warner b Bhuvneshwar 46(35) [4s-3 6s-2]

Nehra to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Naman Ojha!! The umpire spots an edge. And is happy to raise the finger. Sorry, not quite the time to be mean. Nehra bends his back in banging it short, and cramps Yadav all ends up for any room. Despite the shuffle coming in, the swivelling pull only gets the ping on the glove to a diving Ojha to his left. Suryakumar Yadav c Naman Ojha b Nehra 4(3) [4s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, out Bowled!! A mess of the stumps. The pin-point yorker comes out at full pace and Grandhomme without bothering to move his feet just jams his bat down. No connection at all. The off-pole is uprooted. Kolkata just not getting the move-on they'd aspired. de Grandhomme b Bhuvneshwar 0(2)

Bhuvneshwar to Narine, out Bowled!! The off-stump goes flying. Bhuvi has had a fantastic bowling record over KKR and it only gets better. It swings in the air, lands on the seam and shapes just enough to uproot Narine's off-pole. The slash-flash batsman had no clue about that one. By the time the ball dipped in, Narine opened himself up completely and embarassed himself. Narine b Bhuvneshwar 6(9) [4s-1]

Rashid Khan to Gambhir, out Bowled!! Got him! Rashid Khan does it again, he has taken wicket off the first over in every game he played. That's some record. Gambhir exposes all his stumps looking to cut it square, the quicker one skids on and pings the bails in a flash. Gambhir slaps his bat onto his pad as he walks back in disgust. Gambhir b Rashid Khan 15(16) [4s-2]

Woakes to Henriques, out Caught&Bowled!! Things looking bleak for SRH. 3 of their main batsmen are back in the hut now. No change of pace this time around, he spears it in at 136ks on a good length, Henriques checks his drive and chips it back to the bowler. Easily done. He was perhaps expecting the slower one. It came right off the cue end of the bat. Henriques c and b Woakes 13(10) [4s-2]

Narine to Deepak Hooda, out Stumped!! Nah, not again! Looks to fancy his chances against the wily Narine. Not to the pitch and was caught miles short. 83ks, lands on the seam and moves the other way round and beats Deepak Hooda neck and crop. Uthappa does the rest. He was looking to go over long-on/mid-wicket. Booming bat swing, but no dice. Deepak Hooda st Uthappa b Narine 13(7) [4s-1 6s-1]

Woakes to Yuvraj, out Caught by (sub)Rishi Dhawan!! And look what that extra delivery has done, it has fetched KKR the much-needed wicket. Yuvi walks back disappointed and has been asked to wait by the umpires. Oh hang on! What's the wait for? Just a little confusion out there and Yuvi continues his march. It was a slower short ball, Yuvi was through the shot way too early, didn't get hold of the pull and holes out to long-on. Good running catch from the sub fielder. Yuvraj c (sub)Rishi Dhawan b Woakes 26(16) [4s-2 6s-2]

Boult to Cutting, out Caught by de Grandhomme!! The Kiwi combination does the trick. The ever-smiling Boult can smile a little more now. Cutting shuffles a long way across his stumps, premeditates the slog straight down the ground and makes a mess of the connection. Outcome? He tumbles after the half-hearted execution and it goes flat and straight to the man at long-off. Cutting c de Grandhomme b Boult 15(10) [4s-1 6s-1]

Y Pathan to Dhawan, out Caught by de Grandhomme!! That's a soft dismissal. The ploy of giving Pathan the ball has worked. That ball didn't deserve a wicket to be honest. It was floated outside off, Dhawan waltzes down, moving slightly leg-side and chips it towards de Grandhomme at long-off, who runs forward and pouches it. There was no intent there from the southpaw there. Dhawan c de Grandhomme b Y Pathan 23(22) [4s-4]

Kuldeep Yadav to Warner, out Caught by Woakes!! This was coming. Warner was struggling against the spinners and perishes trying to play the big shot. A tossed up delivery that pitched outside off and turned further away. Warner got low and wanted to clear long-off. Doesn't get enough power behind it and a straightforward catch from Woakes at long-off. Lots of revs on that delivery. Warner c Woakes b Kuldeep Yadav 26(30) [4s-4]

Mohit Sharma to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Eoin Morgan!! Catching practice for Morgan. Another partnership that had started to flourish is nipped in the bud. Not the greatest of shots from Iyer. It was a length delivery alright and he wanted to loft it over the long-on fence, the bat turned on impact and the ball went up towards long-on. Second catch for the England ODI skipper. Shreyas Iyer c Eoin Morgan b Mohit Sharma 22(17) [4s-3]

Axar to Billings, out Caught by Miller!! The small little things that you do produce the bigger things. That Vohra stop kept Billings on strike and what happens next? The Kent man miscues a loft to long-on. Takes a couple of steps down, not close to the ball but still goes through with the loft. Right off the toe-end and almost had enough to clear Miller, who set himself up right on the edge of the circle and clasped it. Billings c Miller b Axar 55(40) [4s-9]

Aaron to Pant, out Caught by Eoin Morgan!! Done in for pace. An important wicket for KXIP. Pant was looking to get on with proceedings. Short and angled across off, pulling against the angle is always dangerous, Pant takes it on and splices it towards mid-off. Morgan might be having a rough day with his ground fielding, but not with his catching. Accepts the dolly with ease. Pant c Eoin Morgan b Aaron 15(9) [4s-3]

Sandeep Sharma to Chris Morris, out Caught by Mohit Sharma!! Huge wicket this, especially at this stage of the innings. Morris blasted a 9-ball 38 in the previous game against RPS, coming in at this stage. Short of a length delivery and Morris pulls, he does not bother to keep it down, was planning to clear the fielder. But since it was off the bottom of the bat, it has no wings to fly over Mohit at deep square. Chris Morris c Mohit Sharma b Sandeep Sharma 16(8) [4s-1 6s-1]

Cariappa to Samson, out Caught by Eoin Morgan!! First wicket for Cariappa in IPL 2017. Has struck in his first over. Tosses it up this time, the ball dips in a touch. Samson plays down the wrong line, gets a leading edge that ballons up straight to long-off. Morgan ain't dropping those.Samson c Eoin Morgan b Cariappa 19(18) [4s-2 6s-1]

Aaron to Nair, out Caught by Saha!! That's an excellent catch from Saha. Credit to Varun, kept persisting it with short pitch stuff and it pays off. After conceding 13 runs in his first over, he shows great courage and picks up a wicket. It was short and drifting down leg, Nair, in a bid to tickle it fine, gloves it to the left of Saha. He flings and settles under it. Nair c Saha b Aaron 0(3)

Nadeem to Vohra, out Lbw!! Shahbaz Nadeem strikes in his very first over. He's having a wonderful season. The umpire took his time before raising the dreaded finger. Did that pitch in line? Yes, it did and spun away. Vohra gets down on one knee and in his attempt to lap it fine, misses it completely. He is pinged on the thigh pad in front of middle and leg. HawkEye confirms that would have hit the leg-pole. Good decision from the umpire. Vohra lbw b Nadeem 3(6)

Pat Cummins to Eoin Morgan, out Caught by Nair!! He's cut that straight to backward point this time. That's a big blow. Morgan was starting to find some fluency but he now finds the fielder. Short and wide from Cummins, Morgan goes hard but fails to keep it down and it's straight to Karun Nair. Eoin Morgan c Nair b Pat Cummins 22(20) [4s-3]

Mishra to Maxwell, out Caught by Billings!! Is that the game for DD? The in-form Maxwell is gone for a duck. Too much pressure really. He had to tee off from the word go with the required rate touching 13, and Mishra isn't the most straightforward bloke to take on first up. He cleverly bowls it a little wide of off forcing Maxwell to reach out for his slog-sweep and it comes right off the bottom. It's a top-edge too. Simple catch for Billings at deep mid-wicket. Maxwell c Billings b Mishra 0(2)

Corey Anderson to Miller, out Lbw!! Miller's painful stay at the crease has ended through a full toss. Anderson gets some tail on the delivery and swirls it in on middle, and Miller plays all around it. His head fell over too. The ball crashes into the back leg on the full. Just one of those days for Miller. Never found any timing whatsoever. Miller lbw b Corey Anderson 24(28) [4s-1]

Pat Cummins to Mohit Sharma, out Bowled!! Off the pads and into leg-stump. Cummins followed Mohit with a full ball as he backed away a touch. The delivery is too quick for Mohit. He misses his swipe through mid-wicket and the ball deflects off the pad to knock over the timber. Mohit Sharma b Pat Cummins 13(14) [4s-1]

Chris Morris to Cariappa, out Bowled!! Similar technique from Cariappa - backing away to swish through off. But Morris does him with a yorker. It's too quick for Cariappa. The ball bursts through to crash into the base of middle. Cariappa b Chris Morris 1(2)

Chris Morris to Axar, out Bowled!! The leg-bail flies off its groove and that's the game for Delhi. Massive win. Morris causes Patel to go through with the slog too early as he holds it back in pace and the deception is good enough to fetch him his third for the night. Axar b Chris Morris 44(29) [4s-1 6s-3]

Nadeem to Saha, out Caught by Zaheer!! Zaheer takes a catch and claims it. The umpires decide to go up and the soft signal is out. It was darted in on off, Saha danced down, moved leg-side and went for the inside-out shot. Couldn't get enough elevation on that and finds Zak at extra cover. The ball was dipping when it approached him, but Zaheer had both his hands underneath the ball. Second wicket for Shahbaz Nadeem. Now, it's all down to the four foreign recruits for KXIP to make a match out of this. Saha c Zaheer b Nadeem 7(5) [4s-1]

Chris Morris to Amla, out Caught by Billings!! Would you believe that? Amla perishes to a full toss. There was one fielder in the deep on the leg-side and Amla finds him perfectly. A low full toss on the pads, Amla with a slight shuffle, flicks it in the air and hits it straight down the throat of Billings at long leg. Punjab in a spot of bother. Amla c Billings b Chris Morris 19(12) [4s-4]

McClenaghan to Dwayne Smith, out Caught by Nitish Rana!! The dangerous one is gone and the crowd go wild. McClenaghan is delighted. Smith sees the width outside off on this short of length delivery and slashes hard. Doesn't get enough elevation and finds Nitish Rana at backward point, who jumps and takes a good catch. Smith departs without troubling the scorers. Dwayne Smith c Nitish Rana b McClenaghan 0(2)

Harbhajan to Raina, out Caught by Rohit!! This was on the cards. Raina kept charging down to the spinners without much success, but he didn't stop trying. Shimmies down and Harbhajan being a clever bowler, tosses it up well outside off, Raina has to reach out for the inside out loft, all he could manage was a slice towards cover-point. Rohit tracks back and takes it over his head while tumbling. Good take that by the MI skipper. Raina c Rohit b Harbhajan 28(29) [4s-2]

Malinga to Brendon McCullum, out Bowled!! That roar and fist pump says it all. Just takes one delivery for Malinga to change the tide. A fine knock from McCullum comes to an end. Battled hard and has built a platform for his lower-order. Straight delivery, McCullum plays all round it, the ball sneaks through bat and pad to hit middle stump. Two set batsmen gone and MI keeping the lid over GL. Brendon McCullum b Malinga 64(44) [4s-6 6s-3]

McClenaghan to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Something for the 18000 kids to cheer about. McClenaghan has provided the breakthrough. Kishan has been asked to wait by Ravi. The front leg is fine. Legal delivery that and Ravi raises his finger. The back of the hand slower ball dug in short, Kishan takes it on and top edges it to deep square leg. Krunal misjudged it for a second, but recovered well to pouch it. Ishan Kishan c Krunal Pandya b McClenaghan 11(14) [4s-1]

P Kumar to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Roy!! Parthiv goes for a blob. Praveen Kumar is effective with the new ball and once again he gets the breakthrough. Good seam presentation on this good length delivery. It pitches on middle and jags away off the track. Parthiv gets a leading edge looking to work it through the on-side and finds point. Jason Roy collects it in his third attempt. Parthiv Patel c Roy b P Kumar 0(2)

Munaf Patel to Buttler, out Caught by Brendon McCullum!! First IPL game after three years and Munaf has his first wicket. And it is a vital breakthrough. Another start and another stutter for Buttler. His rope is coming to an end, especially with Simmons waiting in the wings. Short of a length delivery, Buttler pulls and gets it high on the bat, straight down McCullum's throat at long-on. Replays show that it was a slower ball - the leg-cutter and Buttler had to manufacture all the pace, which he couldn't. Buttler c Brendon McCullum b Munaf Patel 26(24) [4s-1 6s-2]

Andrew Tye to Pollard, out Caught by Jadeja!! Not over, yet. Still need 17 runs off 11 balls. Credit must go to Thampi for bowling a tight 18th over. Pollard had to take the risk and he perishes while doing so. Full and slow, on middle and leg, since there was no pace, Pollard could not gather momentum on the flick, skies it towards deep mid-wicket, Jadeja won't drop those. Pollard c Jadeja b Andrew Tye 39(23) [4s-2 6s-3]

Andrew Tye to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Karthik!! Nitish Rana has done his job here. End of a fine knock. The knuckle ball from Tye does the trick. Rana wanted to cut hard and all he managed was a faint tickle. The man with the mitts gobbles it up and the umpire spotted the feather. Nitish Rana c Karthik b Andrew Tye 53(36) [4s-4 6s-2]

SN Thakur to Mandeep, out Caught by Dhoni!! Another chance, and this time there's no mistake. But it's Mandeep, and not Kohli. Not too dissimilar from that Kohli chance actually. It's a bit short, a bit wide, Mandeep has a swish at it but he's done in by extra bounce. Simple catch. Mandeep c Dhoni b SN Thakur 0(3)

Tahir to de Villiers, out Stumped!! Oh what a ball. What a ball. He tosses this on off, gets it to dip on AB to draw him out of the crease and then turns it right across him for the stumping. This is a brilliant piece of leg-spin bowling. AB was ambitiously trying to flick this through mid-wicket but he's beaten in flight and length. Dhoni, quick as ever, hardly takes any time to whip those bails off. That's lightning glovework. This is on. de Villiers st Dhoni b Tahir 29(30) [4s-1 6s-2]

Unadkat to Kedar Jadhav, out Bowled!! Jadhav's dragged on. Time was running away and he had to do something, so he gallops down the pitch with an almighty swing but the ball takes a long time to arrive. He's forced to reach out for it outside off, gets a thick inside edge and plays it onto leg-stump. Kedar Jadhav b Unadkat 18(22)

Stokes to Watson, out Bowled!! Got him. And that's the big one. It's the slower ball again which does the trick. RPS have read this pitch like a book. Stokes takes the pace off, bangs it on a back of a length and the ball dips underneath Watson as he tries to heave it away. The middle stump is floored. Watson b Stokes 14(18) [4s-1]
