Kohli sliced that drive with one hand, flew high over cover, the substitute fielder makes no mistake in the deep. Kohli c (sub)Mayank Agarwal b Christian 55(48) [4s-4 6s-1]

Unadkat to Head, out Bowled!! Unadkat has struck early and it's a poor start for RCB once again! Lack of application did Head there, on a length and angling back into the left-hander, Head was rooted to his crease as he aimed a shovel over mid-wicket, gets an inside edge and the ball just clips the bails - the zing lights are up and RPS celebrate. Head b Unadkat 2(5)

Lockie Ferguson to de Villiers, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! That's a big wicket for RPS, another failure for AB. Massive celebration, they know how big this wicket is. On a good length and just outside off, AB saw the width and creamed it off the back-foot - didn't bother to keep it down though - straight into the bucket hands of Tiwary at short extra-cover. He holds on and RCB have lost their second wicket. de Villiers c Manoj Tiwary b Lockie Ferguson 3(8)

Lockie Ferguson to Kedar Jadhav, out Kedar Jadhav Run Out!! Kohli looks livid, but he has a part in this dismissal. Coming to the ball, it was short and wide from Ferguson, Kedar chopped it to the left of backward point. The fielder dived to his left and made a half-stop. That made Kohli set-off for a quick single before being sent back. The throw is at the bowler and he doesn't make a clean stop. The ball rolls away a few yards away from him, this makes Kedar think there's a run and he hares off - without even having a glance at his partner. Kohli was back to the action, by the time he turned around - he saw his partner near him. Ferguson throws the ball to his keeper who does the rest. Kedar Jadhav run out (Lockie Ferguson/Dhoni) 7(12) [4s-1]

Washington Sundar to Sachin Baby, out Caught by Smith!! Kohli looks upset as another wicket falls down! Baby's comeback is brief and short. This was pushed through flatter and on his pads, Baby went back on the punch, hit it firmly but in the air - just about carried to mid-wicket where Smith slid forward and held on. He wasn't sure that it carried, but the soft call was OUT and it stayed with the original call. Sachin Baby c Smith b Washington Sundar 2(4)

Lockie Ferguson to Binny, out Caught by Washington Sundar!! RCB are falling away, Vettori looks motionless in the dug-out! Binny falls to the short ball and his team have lost half their side now. Are they going to be the first team to be knocked out? The pressure of the dot balls consumed Binny here. This was a well directed short ball, Binny was beaten for pace as he looked to pull, gets a steepling top-edge, high and towards long leg. Sundar settles under it and holds on. Binny c Washington Sundar b Lockie Ferguson 1(7)

Binny to Smith, out Caught by Milne!! How big a wicket is this? You just have to look at the celebrations in RCB camp. Smith throws his head down as he makes a long walk back to the pavilion. Shuffles and takes on the slower ball, looks for the pick-up hoick but gets it too low on the bat. In in the air and it gives ample time for deep square to settle under it. A slight fumble, but Milne had it covered. Smith c Milne b Binny 45(32) [4s-5 6s-1]

Badree to Rahane, out Caught by Milne!! There's the breakthrough! Rahane perishes to a full toss. Rahane wanted to sweep and gets a top edge that lobs up towards short fine leg. Milne, runs back, and gobbles it up with ease. Rahane c Milne b Badree 6(8)

Negi to Tripathi, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!!Edged and gone. Nothing great about this delivery. A wide delivery outside off that was there to be punished. The cut shot was on and Tripathi goes for it. All he manages is a faint top edge that is pocketed by the keeper. Kohli should be a relieved man. Tripathi c Kedar Jadhav b Negi 37(28) [4s-4 6s-1]

Harbhajan to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Pollard!! The pressure got to him! Kept running out of partners and now, decides to throw the kitchen sink against the wily old customer. Bhajji sees him coming down the wicket and aims wide of off, Ishan Kishan had to fetch while not getting close to the pitch of the delivery, goes through with the loft and only succeeds in offering a dolly to KP, at long-off. Ishan Kishan c Pollard b Harbhajan 48(35) [4s-6 6s-2]

Krunal Pandya to Jadeja, out Caught&Bowled!! Jaddu throws it away. Should have showed some maturity with his team a travelling in troubled ship, not to be. Sinks to one knee, slog-sweeps from outside off and top-edges it high into the air. The bowler calls for it and accepts gleefully. Gujarat Lions sink further into the mire. Jadeja c and b Krunal Pandya 28(21) [4s-2 6s-1]

Krunal Pandya to Irfan Pathan, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! The pandya brothers combination doing the trick for Mumbai Indians. Irfan Pathan wanted to have a piece of Krunal, kneels down and attempts a slog-sweep, doesn't get all of it. Definitely not off the middle, it hovers in the air for a long, long time giving Hardik enough time to run in from deep mid-wicket and hold onto it. Irfan Pathan c Hardik Pandya b Krunal Pandya 2(3)

Bumrah to Faulkner, out Andrew Tye Run Out!! A real waste of a wicket, but that's unfortunate. Nothing much Faulkner can do about it. A dipping full toss which Faulkner hits straight back to Bumrah who collects in his followthrough to run Tye out, can't back up that far. Andrew Tye run out (Bumrah) 25(12) [4s-2 6s-2]

Bumrah to Faulkner, out Bowled!! Between his legs and uproots the leg peg. What.A.Sight. Bumrah finally gets his radar right as he springs this through Faulkner's legs. It dips and fizzes to defeat Faulkner's premeditated instincts, he was looking to flick it past 45, but makes no contact. Faulkner b Bumrah 21(27) [4s-2]

Malinga to Brendon McCullum, out Bowled!! BMac misses, Malinga hits. That was an ordinary slog and the bowler despite bowling length gets the big fish. Tried going across the line with the thwack and missed it completely. Malinga punches the air in delight. MI strike early. Second failure in succession for BMac. Brendon McCullum b Malinga 6(4) [4s-1]

Bumrah to Raina, out Caught by Pollard!! Raina comes a cropper today. That was a length ball and the batsman got cramped up, chipped it away and Pollard takes a good tumbling catch over his head. GL have a body blow here. Their in-form skipper is gone. The batsman tried to back away a bit and then played the shot a bit too early. Raina c Pollard b Bumrah 1(3)

Malinga to Finch, out Bowled!! Back of a length delivery and the batsman drags it onto his sticks, after the ball tickled his body. That was another slower delivery I would believe and the batsman was through his shot a bit too early. Malinga is back and how! Mumbai after a stutter against RPS have found their mojo back. Finch b Malinga 0(3)

Faulkner to Rohit, out Caught by Karthik!! A faint tickle off the outer edge and Karthik makes easy amends for the fluffed chance earlier. This is RS's sixth single digit score in the year's IPL. That was just a seam up delivery angling away and Rohit flirted at it to bring an end to his iffy knock. Is there a twist? Rohit c Karthik b Faulkner 5(13)

Faulkner to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Karthik!! No Pollard but Parthiv's wicket do. A big fat birthday gift as the top-scorer of the game departs playing a needless dab. Went for a fish outside off and ended up netting himself. Karthik leaped up and grabbed that out of thin air with aplomb. Can GL roar back into this? Parthiv Patel c Karthik b Faulkner 70(44) [4s-9 6s-1]

Basil Thampi to Pollard, out Caught by Brendon McCullum!! Clips the drive hard and finds the man at long-on. That was a needless hit. It was in the over-pitched zone and the batsman wanted to tonk it over the long-on region but failed to get enough elevation on it. The boundary rider at long-on - BMac cups it easily. Pollard c Brendon McCullum b Basil Thampi 15(11) [4s-2]

Basil Thampi to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Looks to go big on the on-side. Was it needed? He holes out at deep mid-wicket as Kishan gobbles that up. More twist in this gripping contest. That was full and the batsman tried to get undeneath it, but failed to scale substantial distance on it. Hardik Pandya c Ishan Kishan b Basil Thampi 4(5)

Basil Thampi to Harbhajan, out Lbw!! Michael Clarke called it on air. He wanted Basil Thampi to go full and straight. Basil Thampi does exactly that. The finger went up slowly. Bhajji goes for a first baller. That was an inswinging full ball. The ball thudded onto the pad and the rest was easy for the ump. Harbhajan lbw b Basil Thampi 0(1)

Basil Thampi to McClenaghan, out McClenaghan Run Out!! 1 run completed. Lot of action on that. A scoop landed on the half-volley for the man at deep fine to stop it with his body. Then he gets up, hurls the throw and scores a direct-hit at the striker's end as both batsmen wanted a couple. Irfan gets into the action at a crucial time and has given GL a lifeline. McClenaghan run out (Irfan Pathan) 1(1)

Irfan Pathan to Bumrah, out Bumrah Run Out!! Has Jadeja got Bumrah with a direct hit? I feel he has. Yes, OUT in RED. Dabbed the ball away into the off-side and looked for a single. Jadeja came in from point and had a shy at the bowler's end. The bullseye was hit. And GL have another lifeline. Bumrah run out (Jadeja) 0(1)

Irfan Pathan to Malinga, out Krunal Pandya Run Out!! That was a yorker, tailed back in, hit the boot and lobbed away to point. Jadeja roared in, missiled in the throw and found the dive from Krunal Pandya short. A full length pool dive also doesn't do it. The third umpire saw one replay to give his verdict. Fourth direct hit. All southpaws. They have fielded a lifeline for themselves. Krunal Pandya run out (Jadeja) 29(20) [4s-2 6s-1]

Ankit Soni to Parthiv Patel, out Buttler Run Out!! Suicidal running between the wickets. Buttler walks off the field shaking his head. That should have been his response to Parthiv after the stroke was completed. It was a half-tracker outside off, Parthiv goes deep in his crease and cuts it to the left of point. Faulkner dives to his left to stop that. Gets up quickly and hits the target direct at the striker's end. Buttler was OUT by a mile. Buttler run out (Faulkner) 9(7) [4s-2]

Ankit Soni to Nitish Rana, out Lbw!! Nitish Rana isn't happy as he walks off. Not sure about what - the decision or the selection of shot. It was tossed up delivery. Rana gets down and goes for the reverse sweep. He is struck in front of middle. Ah! The replays show that there was glove involved there. So, that was the reason behind his disappointment. Nitish Rana lbw b Ankit Soni 19(16) [4s-1 6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Billings, out Caught by Saha!! Edged and caught! The perfect start for KXIP, a nothing shot from Billings and he has to take the long walk back to the hut. Sandeep shortened his length outside off and got the ball to shape away slightly, drew Billings into playing at that. He was looking to run it down towards third man, gets a thick edge and it's an easy catch to the keeper. Billings' comeback is a short one, the Daredevils have been rocked early. Billings c Saha b Sandeep Sharma 0(2)

Aaron to Corey Anderson, out Bowled!! This doesn't help the Daredevils one bit! Aaron strikes with his first ball as well, this was full and just outside off, Anderson went with hard hands on the drive, the feet went nowhere and the inside edge clattered back onto the stumps. He was their last hope to get past 100 and DD are now struggling for the final push. Corey Anderson b Aaron 18(25) [6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Rabada, out Caught by Shaun Marsh!! Another chance for Marsh and this time he holds on, DD's procession continues. On a good length and on the stumps, Rabada was leaning forward on the lofted drive, the bat turned as he made contact, ends up mistiming it high and towards long-on. Marsh has a long time to settle under it and gobbles it up, fourth wicket for Sandeep and he's having quite an evening. Rabada c Shaun Marsh b Sandeep Sharma 11(20) [4s-1]

Aaron to Shami, out Caught by Sandeep Sharma!! Dravid looks distraught in the dug-out as another batsman self combusts. Can't blame Shami though, DD needed some quick runs, but there's nothing coming today. This was short and wide of off, asking to be smacked. Shami had the right idea, he was looking to crack it over point, but the execution went all awry. Ends up getting too underneath the ball and flat-bats it in the air, Sandeep circled around the skier from cover. Thought about going reverse cupped, decides against it and takes it in the normal way. Shami c Sandeep Sharma b Aaron 2(4)

Mohit Sharma to Nadeem, out Caught&Bowled!! DD have been bundled out for their lowest score in IPL - the 10th edition is bringing in some unwanted records for teams. First it was RCB - now it's the DD. Slower ball from Mohit, Nadeem didn't read it at all, popped his bat forward, closed the face on the tuck, got a leading edge and it's an absolute dolly to the bowler. Not sure if the Mohali crowd enjoyed the show from DD - you don't want to watch a mismatch after having paid big money for the tickets. Nadeem c and b Mohit Sharma 0(1)

Sandeep Sharma to Samson, out Caught by Mohit Sharma!! Sandeep has two now and the Daredevils have lost both openers. On a good length and a hint of shape away from outside off, Samson took a step down the track and was looking to work it towards the on-side, closed the bat-face early, gets a thick leading edge - high and towards mid-off. A simple grab by Mohit and Delhi find themselves in early trouble. Samson c Mohit Sharma b Sandeep Sharma 5(14) [4s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught&Bowled!! That's a spectacular return catch from Sandeep, but Shreyas isn't going anywhere. The third umpire has been called for and the soft signal is OUT. That's as clean as one gets, the decision remains OUT. The Mohali crowd go bonkers as their southern neighbours lose another. Credit must go to the bowler here, he was on his followthrough, bent down low, went with his left hand and pouched a beauty. Coming to the ball, it was a short of a good length delivery outside off, might have stopped on the batsman. Shreyas was early into the drive, went low off the bat and to the left of Sandeep. He moved across on his followthrough, with one-handed and the ball stuck, made sure that it didn't pop out when his elbows hit the ground. Shreyas Iyer c and b Sandeep Sharma 6(7) [4s-1]

Axar to Nair, out Bowled!! Axar has struck first ball and it's been a free-fall for the Daredevils. This was the quicker ball from Axar, pitched on off and went straight on, Karun was playing for a bit of turn, ended up playing inside the line and missed it completely. The ball curled past the outside edge and crashed into the off-stump, Karun looks back in dismay and walks off. DD are in a heap of trouble now. Nair b Axar 11(10) [6s-1]

Maxwell to Pant, out Lbw!! The lovely drift of Maxwell has accounted for yet another young Indian batsman. He came from round the wicket, got this one to slide one with the angle, Pant was playing down the wrong line, ended up pushing his bat outside the line of the delivery, gets beaten on ths inside edge and is rapped right in front. The impact was in front of middle-stump, at worst, would have been crashing into leg. Easy call for the umpire and DD continue to slump. Pant lbw b Maxwell 3(6)

Axar to Chris Morris, out Caught&Bowled!! That's another soft dismissal and DD are seriously threatening RCB's score of 49. Catching practice for Axar, this was pushed through slower and just outside off, Morris rocked back on the punch, might have gone through with the shot a bit too early, lobs a simple return catch to the bowler - he accepts the gift with glee and Morris walks away in disgust. Chris Morris c and b Axar 2(5)

Siraj to Narine, out Caught by Warner!! That will hurt. KKR needed Narine to fire, he does not. Makes room to this short ball and for some odd reason does not go full throttle with the cut. The ball might have held a bit on the pitch, mistimed to the right of Warner at extra cover. Good running catch from the centurion. Narine c Warner b Siraj 1(4)

Bhuvneshwar to M Pandey, out Caught&Bowled!! How good is Bhuvneshwar? Pandey was walking into a chip-drive through mid-on say, Kumar bowls a cutter and has Pandey prodding at the ball way too early. Result: a chip back down to Bhuvneshwar, who tips it up in the air off his fingertips and then holds onto the rebound like a man who knows what he's doing. M Pandey c and b Bhuvneshwar 39(29) [4s-3]

Siraj to Uthappa, out Caught by Warner!! Caught at long-off. This is a big wicket, make no mistake about that. And brought about by a man coming into the side today. Nicely done. Preempts the fact that Uthappa is going for his shots, bowls it short and wide - taking a leaf out from Bhuvi's last over - and has Uthappa toe-end the forehand slap kinda shot to Warner in the deep. Simplest of catches that; Siraj completely undid him with lack of pace. Uthappa c Warner b Siraj 53(28) [4s-4 6s-4]

Rashid Khan to Y Pathan, out Caught by S Kaul!! Gets a wicket off the last ball of his spell and will finish with 1/38. A ball slightly on the shorter length - Rashid has been bowling that all day today - and the length, for once, has Yusuf in a mess. Decides very late to play at it, gives it a good hoick but top-edges it straight - and when I say 'straight', I mean it - to backward point. Game's done. Yawn.[/b] Y Pathan c S Kaul b Rashid Khan 12(13)

Bhuvneshwar to Jackson, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Four singles in a row and bam, we have a wicket. Times have changed. Rotating strike is no longer enough. Bhuvi tries his luck with the shorter length again but takes the pace off, which is the reason why Jackson clubs it straight to Rashid at deep mid-wicket. Jackson c Rashid Khan b Bhuvneshwar 16(17) [4s-1]

S Kaul to Gambhir, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! And with that KKR's hopes suffer another dent. Good judgement there from the SRH fielders. This mistimed pull from Gambhir went high in the air towards mid-wicket. There were at least three fielders in the vicinity, but they communicated well among themselves and it was the Afghan spinner who called for it, eventually taking it reverse-cupped. Gambhir c Rashid Khan b S Kaul 11(11) [4s-2]

S Kaul to de Grandhomme, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Sunrisers Hyderabad make it five in five at home this season. A wicket to end the match, quite fittingly. Dropped slow on a length, Colin de Grandhomme wanted a picture-perfect finish but finds a teenager at long-off. All done. The table-toppers have been tamed. de Grandhomme c Rashid Khan b S Kaul 18(15) [4s-1 6s-1]

Woakes to Dhawan, out Dhawan Run Out!! End of a 139-run stand. They needed a run-out to break this lethal partnership because nothing was working for KKR. Credit to Kuldeep for having the presence of mind to target the sticks at the bowler's end. This was a short slower delivery on the stumps, Dhawan mistimes the pull uppishly to short fine leg, Warner raced across to get back on strike, Dhawan was late to take off. Kuldeep took his time, took aim and hit the bullseye. Dhawan run out (Kuldeep Yadav) 29(30) [4s-2 6s-1]

Woakes to Warner, out Caught by Gambhir!! Woakes gets his man after missing those two chances. But take a moment to stand and applaud this man. Great to see many KKR players go up to Warner and congratulate him for his knock. Slower delivery on the stumps, Warner goes for the slog, mistimes it completely, the ball goes high in the air towards cover. Gambhir settles under it, the ball almost pops out of his hands but he manages to hold on. The crowd give their skipper a grand ovation. So Gayle's 175 is safe! Warner c Gambhir b Woakes 126(59) [4s-10 6s-8]

Coulter-Nile to Yuvraj, out Williamson Run Out!! 1 run completed. What was Yuvraj Singh doing there? Could have attempted the second run, instead puts his arm up, Kane was halfway down the pitch and had no chance. Didn't take the first run briskly and that is why Yuvi said no. Every run is important in this form of the game. Games are won and lost even by a margin of 1 run. Looked like he never was keen for the second. Yorker on the stumps, Yuvraj flicks into the vacant mid-wicket region, could have been two if he was a little quicker, the bowler had to run all the way to mid-wicket, he did well to fire an accurate throw to the keeper. Williamson run out (Coulter-Nile/Uthappa) 40(25) [4s-5]

Aniket Choudhary to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Chahal!! This is just the start RCB wanted. It's a golden duck for Parthiv. Kohli must have had some strong words in the huddle before they walked out and he'd be delighted with this start. Parthiv had a good last match, he tried to be positive first up in this game but this short of length delivery got big on him. Mistimed pull, went off the splice of the bat, Chahal did well to dive forward from short mid-wicket. He slid on those practice pitches but held on to the ball. Parthiv Patel c Chahal b Aniket Choudhary 0(1)

Chahal to Pollard, out Caught by Head!! Chahal's got his man. He almost had Pollard when he managed to hit that mistimed boundary, but this time the batsman has found the fielder. They check for the no-ball, but Chahal just escapes. By a centimetre or so. This is certainly not an easy wicket to bat on against the slower bowlers. It's stopping on the batsman or gripping the surface when the length isn't too full. Pollard stepped out and flicked, no timing and straight to deep mid-wicket. Pollard c Head b Chahal 17(13) [4s-2]

Watson to Karn Sharma, out Caught by Milne!! Watson has his right fist raised in triumph. After getting Karn Sharma. Short ball on the stumps, Karn Sharma didn't do enough on the pull and Milne took it over his head at deep square. Just a bit more and that would be six. Kohli is happy as well. A much needed wicket for RCB. Karn Sharma c Milne b Watson 9(8) [4s-1]

Negi to Buttler, out Caught by Head!! A really soft dismissal and you can tell that from Buttler's reaction. Just wanted to throw that bat away. He was well set and looking good, the introduction of the left-arm spinner does the trick. Not a wicket taking delivery, but you do get wickets in this manner in T20 cricket. Flighted delivery outside off stump, Buttler steps out and drives inside-out, doesn't control the shot, hits it straight to cover. Can RCB work on this opening? Buttler c Head b Negi 33(21) [4s-4 6s-1]

Negi to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Head!! Negi continues to have a good match. 30 odd runs and now two wickets. With the left-arm spinner on, mid-wicket is an easy area to target for a left-hander as he can hit with the spin, Rana went for the big slog-sweep, seemed to have got it on the outside half of the bat. Head was close to the rope at deep mid-wicket. Took the catch, the momentum was taking him beyond the boundary. Released the ball before crossing over and recovered quickly to grab it again. Nitish Rana c Head b Negi 27(28) [4s-4]

Krunal Pandya to Head, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Now finds deep mid-wicket. A drag down and somehow Head has contrived to find the man. Another soft, soft dismissal. Could've and should've hit it to the stands, but walks away gifting his wicket. Krunal Pandya gets a wicket off a delivery which wasn't great by any means. But he won't be complaining. Head c Hardik Pandya b Krunal Pandya 12(15) [4s-1]

Krunal Pandya to de Villiers, out Caught by Bumrah!! No. No. That's what the RCB fans and their faithful will be shouting and screaming now. There goes Krunal Pandya, showing four fingers to the cameras and then signalling a boundary - which implies that he has got de Villiers out four times in the IPL. After hitting the six, de Villiers tried to repeat the shot, a little shimmy outside leg to try and unsettle Krunal Pandya, who kept his cool and fired it on leg, then de Villiers came back into line, but since the ball came to him quickly, by the time he was down for the slog sweep, it was late, the top edge is found and Bumrah won't drop that at short fine leg. Too easy that one. And then Krunal Pandya's celebrations start. Yet another RCB batsmen has flattered to deceive today. This time it is AB. And all this regular wickets won't do the side any good at all. Krunal Pandya has a tale to tell his grandchildren one day. de Villiers c Bumrah b Krunal Pandya 43(27) [4s-3 6s-3]

Bumrah to Watson, out Bowled!! Dreadful from Watson. Looks to swipe a top of middle ball to leg and misses. No conviction nor was it a high percentage shot. The ball doesn't do anything except follow its straight line path and clatters into the top of off and middle. Very poor from such an experienced campaigner. Watson b Bumrah 3(5)

McClenaghan to Negi, out Caught by Pollard!! End of Negi. The back of the hand slower delivery, rolling the fingers across the ball, sits up to be smashed, but Negi can only find long-on with a pull. Negi c Pollard b McClenaghan 35(23) [4s-1 6s-3]

McClenaghan to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by Pollard!! This man makes it look so easy. With the sunglasses and the floppy hat on he takes a high catch and makes it look ridiculously easy. Flat-batted high into the sky as McClenaghan bowled it short, when the ball is anywhere near Pollard, he is expected to take it and he does so, running around to his left, keeping himself inside the playing area. McClenaghan on a hat-trick now. Kedar Jadhav c Pollard b McClenaghan 28(22) [4s-2]

McClenaghan to Milne, out Aravind Run Out!! No hat-trick for McClenaghan. But a team hat-trick. Shortish outside off, Milne cuts and misses. They run for the bye and Aravind isn't even in the frame as Parthiv Patel runs forward to effect the run-out. Aravind run out (Parthiv Patel) 0(0)

Karn Sharma to Mandeep, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Mandeep holes out. To deep mid-wicket. Went down on one knee and tried to slog-sweep that but no connection whatsoever on that hit, easy catch for the fielder. He was going hard on everything and his misery ends. Mandeep c Hardik Pandya b Karn Sharma 17(13) [4s-3]

McClenaghan to Kohli, out Caught by Rohit!! And just like that he is gone. Look at Kohli's expression. One of disbelief. Which we have seen quite often this season. That feeling of how have I done this. A harmless cutter down leg, Kohli has just chipped it head-high to mid-wicket to his opposite number. A dolly and Rohit can't hide his smile. McClenaghan is busy fist pumping his way to glory. That's as soft as it gets. And it has happened repetitively for Kohli's liking this season. When it is not going for you, these things can happen. Kohli c Rohit b McClenaghan 20(14) [6s-2]

Tahir to Dwayne Smith, out Bowled!! "I have missed my morning jog today" kinda sprint from Imran Tahir. Now this is a wicket handed to him, and he's on a hat-trick here. Smith is making a comeback into the side, but decides to slog across a wrong 'un which he hadn't picked by a mile. Biding time is so old-fashioned.. The ball sneaks through the bat-pad gap and bowls him. Shambolic shot, to say the least. Dwayne Smith b Tahir 0(1)

SN Thakur to Brendon McCullum, out Caught by Rahane!! Big wicket for RPS. Baz was looking dangerous. He tried to go over covers by backing away. It was on the stumps and all McCullum could do was slice it to Rahane at deep backward point. Brendon McCullum c Rahane b SN Thakur 45(27) [4s-5 6s-2]

Christian to Jadeja, out Caught by Unadkat!! The short ball does the trick. Christian, at 131kph, darts a bumper on leg. The ball gets big on Jadeja, who is late on his pull. The ball balloons off bat and glove to settles into the hands of Unadkat at short fine leg. Jadeja c Unadkat b Christian 19(12) [4s-3]

Unadkat to Faulkner, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! He dropped twice in the previous game, did Manoj Tiwary, but not today. Faulkner couldn't have hit it straighter to the fielder. He went deep in his crease and backed away to manufacture room. Slaps (middles) this short of length delivery straight to Tiwary at short cover. Faulkner c Manoj Tiwary b Unadkat 6(7)

Unadkat to Sangwan, out Caught by Tripathi!! Another one bites the dust. Sangwan was completely undone by the lack of pace. Unadkat bowled it around 117kph on a short of a good length. Sangwan is early into his stroke - to drive down the ground - and ends up chipping it high in the air off the outside part of the bat. Tripathi at mid-wicket settles under it and takes it with ease. Sangwan c Tripathi b Unadkat 1(2)

Unadkat to Basil Thampi, out Karthik Run Out!! This time MS doesn't miss and his opposite number is well short. Thampi looks to heave this length ball through mid-wicket and misses. MS, who had his right glove taken off, collects it and finds the target direct. OUT by a long way. Karthik run out (Dhoni) 29(26) [4s-3]

Unadkat to Ankit Soni, out Bowled!! GL are bowled out with a ball to spare. The slower ball is too good for Soni. He gives a mighty swing and connects thin air. The ball cannons onto the stumps and the Lions finish on 161. Ankit Soni b Unadkat 0(1)

Tahir to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Washington Sundar!! Bowls a googly last ball, messes up a young head and gets him with a wide one. Age matters. Kishan sees the width and throws his hands at it, only to slash it straight to Washington Sundar at short third man. Straight to him. He was looking good but had to reach out here, meaning he failed to keep the ball down. He's out but manages to impress in his little stint again, doesn't he? Ishan Kishan c Washington Sundar b Tahir 31(24) [4s-3 6s-2]

Tahir to Raina, out Raina Run Out!! 1 run completed. Oh Dhoni, thou friggin' beauty. That was at best a mortal throw from the deep mid-wicket fielder and Dhoni has transfigured it into a wicket-taking one. You have to see it to believe it. Turned towards deep square leg by Raina, Rahane sprinted across and let out a flat throw to his credit, severely threatening the second run there. And then Dhoni takes over. Waited behind the stumps, keeping his hands near the bails and just dislodges them off, like he hates them. Like he loves the red light. Raina is gone. Never take a second with Dhoni behind the wicket. Never. "Dhoni, Dhoni"chants at the stadium. Raina run out (Rahane/Dhoni) 8(8)

Tahir to Finch, out Caught&Bowled!! Two overs, two wickets. Tahir is the late-bloomer we all want to be. He was driven on the up last ball, so drags the length back this time. Just a bit. Finch was looking to nudge a single to mid-wicket at best, but is early into the shot. Perhaps the ball held up and the leading edge was devoured by Tahir. And the celebrations followed. Finch c and b Tahir 13(6) [4s-1 6s-1]

Sangwan to Rahane, out Lbw!! Appeal and umpire Marais Erasmus raises his finger. Oh, the replays suggest it pitched marginally outside leg. But too tough to spot that in real time. Rahane was on the back foot to keep that out. The ball came in off the deck. Sangwan has that extra pace and which is why he was able to evade the bat of Rahane. Was hit around the knee-roll and Gujarat have got the start they wanted. Rahane lbw b Sangwan 4(4) [4s-1]

Sangwan to Smith, out Caught by Ankit Soni!! Sangwan's pace has devoured another one. Good pacy bumper that kept climbing on to Smith, who wanted to hook this one. Was hit on the splice and hence no power behind the shot. The man at short fine leg has to move a few yards to his right to make things a little tricky for Pune. Smith c Ankit Soni b Sangwan 4(2) [4s-1]

Basil Thampi to Manoj Tiwary, out Lbw!! What is happening there. Manoj Tiwary is gone. Stephen Fleming in the dug-out has a sorry look on his face. Manoj Tiwary goes on the back foot to play a full ball. It is a reminiscence of what happened in Australia close to a decade ago. Thampi is not as quick as Brett Lee but has enough venom to catch him in front. The ball would have crashed on to the leg-stump. Manoj Tiwary lbw b Basil Thampi 0(2)

Basil Thampi to Dhoni, out Caught by Brendon McCullum!! From the lanes of Kerala to outwitting Dhoni on the grandest of stages. A slower ball, and the funny bit is that Dhoni did read it. Was wide outside off, so waited before letting out a forehanded slap. Dhoni waits, and then some, and hits but couldn't impart the power that he should have. Straight to McCullum at long-off. Pune might be done here.. but hey, Stokes here. Dhoni c Brendon McCullum b Basil Thampi 26(33) [4s-1 6s-1]

Faulkner to Stokes, out Tripathi Run Out!! 1 run completed. That is farcical from Tripathi. What was he thinking? Called for the second run and then stops mid-way to spoil things for himself because Stokes had committed for the run. Stokes thuds this on-drive down the ground towards long-on. Finch has some distance to cover and Tripathi senses the second run. Withdraws late and digs his grave as Finch hits the target at the bowler's end. Stokes looked angry there. No fault of his though. Tripathi run out (Finch) 6(7) [4s-1]

Siraj to Pant, out Bowled!! Wow! What a reply from Siraj. He did not like the six for sure. Comes back with a peach of a yorker and as Mr Gavaskar informs us this was around 27.4kph quicker than the previous ball - 115kph. A yorker on the legs, too tough to negotiate. Pant's bat comes down late and he deflects it off his leg to the off-pole. Siraj is delighted. Pant b Siraj 34(20) [4s-4 6s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Siraj!! Slower ball on off, on the shorter side as well. Shreyas Iyer has already given himself some room. That's like committing without knowing what is in store. Cannot retreat, it is late for him. Tries to ramp but there is no pace or the bounce to ease things for him. Ends up guiding it into the hands of Siraj at short third man. This is far from over. Delhi have not chased well and because they have not, they will need some extra effort to go past the line here. Time-out in the meantime. Shreyas Iyer c Siraj b Bhuvneshwar 33(25) [4s-1 6s-2]

Siraj to Samson, out Caught by Dhawan!! First breakthrough for SRH totally against the run of play. Once again the familiar culprit doing the trick - the slower ball. It was on a good length and wide of off. Samson is early into his stroke - the slash. In the end, slices it straight into the bucket hands of Dhawan at cover-point. Samson c Dhawan b Siraj 24(19) [4s-2 6s-1]

S Kaul to Nair, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! In the air and taken! The knuckle ball from Kaul does the trick. Nair waltzes down by backing away. Goes through with his crouched slap. Gets reasonable amount of timber on that. He hit it flat and that led to his downfall. Bhuvi at long-off, moves to his left and times his mini-jump to perfection and gobbles it up. A big wicket! Nair c Bhuvneshwar b S Kaul 39(20) [4s-5 6s-2]

Shami to Williamson, out Caught by Chris Morris!! Second wicket for Shami. He's got two big ones - Warner and now Williamson. Slower short delivery, kept climbing on the Kiwi, who went for the pull and only managed a fat top edge towards deep square leg. He was never going to in control of the shot as the ball got big on him. Smart bowling from Shami as well, rolled his fingers across at the last moment. DD have pulled things back nicely after the powerplay. Just 26 runs scored and two wickets taken. Williamson c Chris Morris b Shami 24(24) [4s-1 6s-1]

Shami to Warner, out Bowled!! Missed a few games? No problem. I know how to nail the yorkers. This is such a difficult art for bowlers, but look at Shami, this is just the second ball of his spell and he's bowled one at 141kph to knock Warner's off pole out. The SRH captain didn't look comfortable at all and DD will be delighted with that wicket. Warner was never willing to cover the line against the right-handed pacers, was always looking to back away and open up the off-side. Shami spotted that and outfoxed the batsman with a brilliant yorker. Warner b Shami 30(21) [4s-4 6s-1]

Mishra to Dhawan, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! The moment he tosses one up, he gets a wicket. I was surprised by that first delivery when he chose to bowl flat. Enough in the pitch for a spinner to enjoy his outing. A gentle fist pump from the local lad. This was the googly, Dhawan went for the sweep, went with hard hands, got a top edge and Iyer came forward from deep backward square leg and took a good catch. Big wicket for DD. Dhawan was well set and he needed to carry on. Dhawan c Shreyas Iyer b Mishra 28(17) [4s-4 6s-1]

Unadkat to Narine, out Caught&Bowled!! Wicket-maiden! This over exemplies how a bowler sets up a batsman. After varying stuffs for 5 deliveries, he keeps this one short around off. There is almost no pace off the track and Narine, who is waiting to slap off the back foot, makes a mess of the timing. Chipping it back off the lower half of the bat to the bowler. Unadkat almost grabs it in a hurry. What a start for Pune. Narine c and b Unadkat 0(6)

Christian to M Pandey, out Caught by Rahane!! Rahane has the safest pair of hands in India. He ain't dropping these skiers. An important breakthrough for RPS as the partnership was slowly taking the game away from them. Pandey backed away and Christian followed him with a slower delivery, the batsman still goes through with the pick up shot, no pace on the ball meant he picked out deep mid-wicket. M Pandey c Rahane b Christian 37(32) [4s-3 6s-1]

Unadkat to de Grandhomme, out Caught by Washington Sundar!! Break and a wicket. How many times have we heard that? Even Pathan perished first ball after the first time-out and now it is de Grandhomme. Once more Unadkat resorts to the slower delivery, the Kiwi is completely deceived as he closes the bat face and the leading edge pops up to backward point. de Grandhomme c Washington Sundar b Unadkat 36(19) [4s-3 6s-2]

Christian to Suryakumar Yadav, out Woakes Run Out!! 1 run completed. Dangerous thing to take on Smith and Woakes pays the price. Suryakumar bunts the length delivery to long-on, Smith was quick to swoop down on the ball and released it even quicker. The throw was right on top of the stumps, Christian had got back, collected the throw and light up the stumps. Even a full stretch from Woakes was not enough. Woakes run out (Smith/Christian) 1(3)

Stokes to Coulter-Nile, out Caught by Washington Sundar!! Stokes has his name in the wicket column. Short of length delivery following Coulter-Nile, who had made room to smash one into the on-side, the ball kept cramping him for room and once the bat face was closed, the leading edge lobbed to backward point. Sundar accepts the dolly there. Coulter-Nile c Washington Sundar b Stokes 6(5) [6s-1]

Washington Sundar to Jackson, out Hit Wkt!! That is why you should not use the depth this much. Goes back to tuck and after making the connection steps on the stumps. Dhoni realizes and appeals but Jackson is already walking before the customary check sent upstairs confirms the wicket. What a soft dismissal indeed. Jackson hit wkt b Washington Sundar 10(9) [4s-2]

Washington Sundar to Gambhir, out Caught by Rahane!! And again! Hold on, he is caught in the deep. Sundar tossed up again, as if challenging Gambhir to go after it again. The latter took the offer and slogged across the line. It seemed he had made a good connection but there was a speed-breaker at the deep mid-wicket fence. Rahane timed his jump to perfection and plucked it from above his head. The captain goes and KKR are now in a spot of bother. Gambhir c Rahane b Washington Sundar 24(19) [4s-3 6s-1]

Tahir to Y Pathan, out Lbw!! And he has done it. Pune wanted one of these. They had Tahir and he has managed to get rid of Pathan. Skids this straighter ball. Quicker than what Pathan expected it to be. Though, cannot be justified for playing this one off the back foot. Once he misses, the ball catches his leg right in front. The big appeal, followed by the raise of finger from the umpire and then that famous sprint from the bowler. Y Pathan lbw b Tahir 4(9)

U Yadav to Rahane, out Caught by Jackson!! Eden roars. Rahane has been given the pink slip. What a ball from Umesh, strikes gold in his first over. Cramps him with this short of length delivery that nipped back in a fraction, Rahane was caught in a state of dilemma. Tried to ride the bounce, was too late and ends up feathering it to the keeper. Early strike for KKR. Rahane c Jackson b U Yadav 11(9) [4s-2]

Narine to Stokes, out Caught&Bowled!! Excellent catch by Narine, considering his fielding standards mind you! He is one of the slowest, languid among the KKR fielders, but not on this occasion. Gets the ball to grip as he cuts as much pace as possible, Stokes went for the pull, but was way too early into the shot. A thick top-edge balloons around the mid-wicket area, Narine calls for it, runs around and grabs it. Stokes c and b Narine 14(15) [4s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, out Caught by Jackson!! TWO IN TWO. Dhoni walks. Kuldeep Yadav has dismissed MS both times KKR played RPS this season. The googly, lands it fuller and draws Dhoni forward, he fiddles while striding forward a long way, thin edge through to the keeper. Dhoni c Jackson b Kuldeep Yadav 5(9)

Woakes to Tripathi, out Caught by (sub)Rovman Powell!! Feel for this fella! He deserved a 100 or at least needed to be there till the end. Similar emotions from Smithy as he tweaks his hair in disappointment. Takes on the short ball this time and pulls to the right of short mid-wicket, there's Rovman Powell fielding there? He is from the Caribbean, won't drop catches. Dives full length and takes a blinder. Tripathi c (sub)Rovman Powell b Woakes 93(52) [4s-9 6s-7]

Woakes to Smith, out Bowled!! Woakes has the final laugh. One shot too many for Smith. Just sticks to his basics and targets the stumps, Smith exposed his stumps aiming for a flashy punch through cover. The ball striaghtened a bit and the RPS skipper misses it completely. The ball kisses the top of off. Talk about basics, Laxman Sivaramakrishnan will be a proud man. Smith b Woakes 9(9) [6s-1]

Woakes to Manoj Tiwary, out Bowled!! Gone. Woakes gets his second wicket. A nothing shot from Tiwary, a good length delivery that vaults back in a touch, Tiwary has a feel for it sans any feet. Gets an inside edge that crashes back onto the stumps. The off-stump goes for a cardio training. RPS lose their third. Manoj Tiwary b Woakes 8(9) [4s-1]

Jadeja to Samson, out Caught by Faulkner!! End of a good, good innings. They are checking for the no-ball but Jadeja ushers us to "ooooohhh" and then the back foot somehow manages to be halfway behind the line. Anyway, coming to the wicket, the ball sat up to be hit there. Samson just decided to go across the line, the ball may have spun, and the Samson ended up slicing the slog to towards wide long-off, where Faulkner's present. "Oh he'll drop it". "Gujarat are having a bad day, so this should go down". But it doesn't. Faulkner slides in front and takes a good catch. Samson c Faulkner b Jadeja 61(31) [6s-7]

Basil Thampi to Pant, out Caught by Karthik!! There's an appeal but the umpire has been stunned by this kid. Even the umpire. Thampi appeals, and after eliciting an obvious edge, and appeals again and then gets his man. Rishabh Pant doesn't fall short of a century here; he makes 97. Brutes them. Enthralling innings. Thampi angled this full and across, Pant drives and ekes out an outside edge, that's been nicely taken by Karthik behind. Erred in not using his feet there, and Thampi is quick. But he was in that sort of a mood. He was hitting everything outta here, so can't blame him. Not after 97 runs, can we? Pant c Karthik b Basil Thampi 97(43) [4s-6 6s-9]

Sangwan to Nair, out Caught by Karthik!! Number one down. Kotla goes silent. Nair's failure continues. What was he trying to do there? Awful really. Redemption for Sangwan. Banged it short and it shooted up awkwardly at Nair. He was caught in two minds there. Initially, wanted to leave but then sees it as a scoring opportunity. Arches his back belatedly and tries it periscope it over the keeper. Too late. The ball catches a faint edge and carries to the keeper. Nair c Karthik b Sangwan 12(11) [4s-2]

Rabada to Brendon McCullum, out Caught by Pant!! A peach from Rabada. He recorded the worst bowling figures of the season the other night (4-0-59-0), but he's started with a lovely nut tonight. The hard-hitting Baz McCullum is walking back with just a solitary run to his name. Rabada angled this short of length delivery into the right-hander from wide of the crease, the ball moved away late, just enough movement to take the outside edge of McCullum's bat as he was looking to defend away from the body. Pant dives to his right and takes a good catch. Brendon McCullum c Pant b Rabada 1(3)

Rabada to Raina, out Dwayne Smith Run Out!! This is disaster for Gujarat Lions. Both the openers gone in successive balls. Who is to be blamed here? Raina took a couple of steps out of his crease after playing this ball gently to mid-wicket, Smith thought the skipper was keen on a run, but was shocked when Raina stopped suddenly. The West Indian tried to rush back but a bullet throw from Nadeem meant his bat was on the line when the stumps were disturbed. Dwayne Smith run out (Nadeem) 9(4) [4s-2]

Shami to Karthik, out Raina Run Out!! Direct hit and the skipper has to walk back. Shami bowls one in the blockhole just outside off, Karthik squirts it out to backward point. Raina wanted a quick single and is halfway down. That's when he saw his partner who wasn't interested in the run. Rabada finds the target direct and Raina is well short. The 133-run partnership has been broken. Raina run out (Rabada) 77(43) [4s-5 6s-4]

Pat Cummins to Karthik, out Caught by Corey Anderson!! That's a screamer! Corey Anderson has taken the catch of the tournament. DK has to go. Cummins darts a scrambled seam delivery on a fullish length just outside off. With mid-off inside the circle, the lofted off-drive shot was on. Karthik goes for it, but couldn't quite get the required timing. His bat turns at the point of impact. The Kiwi all-rounder at mid-off, times his jump to perfection and plucks it with his left hand. The ball had almost gone past him. Karthik c Corey Anderson b Pat Cummins 65(34) [4s-5 6s-5]

Pat Cummins to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! The scratchy knock from the youngster comes to an end. He never looked comfortable in his brief stay. Kishan doesn't spot the off-cutter and is early to swipe it across the line. The top edge balloons up high in the air. Sheyas Iyer, from long-on, runs forward and takes a good skier. Ishan Kishan c Shreyas Iyer b Pat Cummins 4(6)

Rabada to Finch, out Caught by Pant!! Finch is gone! Excellent catch by Pant. Finch moves leg-side and Rabada follows him with a sharp bouncer. He isn't in the greatest of positions, but still persists with his pull shot and gets a top edge. The ball lobs up very high. The keeper runs back and calls for it. Nadeem was also approaching towards him from short fine leg. The ball swirls around as it drops down. Pant holds his nerve and dives full-stretched and gobbles it cleanly. Finch c Pant b Rabada 27(19) [4s-4]

Corey Anderson to Faulkner, out Caught by (sub)Brathwaite!! Gone! Trying to play the big shot, Faulkner perishes. It was a slow short ball on the stumps. Faulkner spots it and pulls it. He went at it hard and ended up hitting it flat. Brathwaite at deep square leg, stoops low and catches it safely with both hands. Faulkner c (sub)Brathwaite b Corey Anderson 1(2)

Aniket Choudhary to Amla, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! Clear nick, no appeal from the bowler, even the keeper didn't hear the edge, but Amla walks. Well done sir! It's been short of length from Aniket all over, this time he bowls it slightly wide outside off stump than the previous ones, Amla throws his hands at it to cut it away for four but gets a faint edge. Not sure if the umpire heard that nick too. Would have been interesting if Amla had not walked. Just the start KXIP didn't want in a crunch game. Amla c Kedar Jadhav b Aniket Choudhary 1(3)

Chahal to Vohra, out Caught by de Villiers!! Something had to give and it is a wicket. The sea of red flags flutter around the Chinnaswamy. Another set batsmen doesn't bat through the innings. Nice loop on this leggie, Vohra's eyes lit up and he went to send it into the second tier, cleared his front leg to heave and mistimed it towards long-on. The ball hung in the air for a long time before AB reverse cupped it calmly. Vohra c de Villiers b Chahal 25(28) [4s-1 6s-1]

Chahal to Maxwell, out Caught by Badree!! Oh no! Maxwell has been caught but the umpire is checking for a no-ball. It is touch and go. GO it is for Maxwell. Looked really close and the benefit of doubt has gone to the bowler on this occasion. Nicely tossed up delivery and Maxwell brings out the switch-hit. The top edge skies towards short third man, it was a tough one and the experienced Samuel Badree pouches it and puffs his cheeks. He knew it was a steepler and needed to his eyes on the ball till the last second. Maxwell c Badree b Chahal 6(11) [4s-1]

Watson to Saha, out Bowled!! Third batsman out in the 20s. Watson has a wicket and has his finger up in delight. Wicket-to-wicket stuff from Watto, Saha made room to glide it behind point, was beaten for pace and the ball kissed the off-pole. Crucial wicket for the home side as Saha was looking to get on with proceedings. The off-cutter that skidded off the surface. Saha b Watson 21(25) [4s-1]

Aniket Choudhary to Mohit Sharma, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! This time Kedar Jadhav appealed and so did Aniket, the umpire obliges to their plea. Nothing but a short of length delivery angled across the right-hander, Mohit pulled and got an under edge to the keeper. Mohit Sharma c Kedar Jadhav b Aniket Choudhary 6(4) [4s-1]

Aravind to Guptill, out Caught by Negi!! This was coming. All Kohli needed to do was have a man at sweeper cover. It's very difficult for a right-handed batsman to middle the ball against the away-going ball from a left-handed bowler on a slowish pitch when he is trying to loft on the off-side. Guptill wanted to go over mid-off, but lack of pace on the ball meant the bat turned in his hands on impact with the ball. Ended up slicing it and it's a simple grab for Negi. Credit to Aravind for bowling the slower ball. This is a very sluggish start from KXIP. 18/2 and we are into the fourth over. Guptill c Negi b Aravind 9(10) [4s-1]

Negi to Shaun Marsh, out Caught by Mandeep!! Negi has got a big wicket and KXIP's team owner Preity Zinta is not happy in the stands. On a slowish pitch, a set batsman has to carry on, but in trying to up the ante and with the thought of taking on the left-arm spinner, Marsh has holed out. It's 39 for 3 and the visitors are in deep trouble. Clever bowling from Negi. He knew that anything full and on the stumps would make it easy for Marsh to target mid-wicket, he bowled this full and wide outside off stump, forced Marsh to fetch and it's a mistimed hit to long-off. Shaun Marsh c Mandeep b Negi 20(17) [4s-3]

Sandeep Sharma to Gayle, out Caught by Guptill!! Had to happen. If you read the last delivery's description, you would know. Didn't use his feet to a fullish ball, so he shimmies out this time to compensate. The length's been nicely shortened by Sharma, and also gets it to move away. The result: Gayle is down the track and slices an outside edge to gully -- yes, there was one, for Gayle. Comeback done and dusted. Gayle c Guptill b Sandeep Sharma 0(2)

Axar to Watson, out Caught by Saha!! This is the fifth time Axar Patel has dismissed Watto in IPL, the most he has dismissed any batsman. Just wow! A quicker flatter dart outside off, from Jaddu's book you would think. Watson goes deep inside the crease to flay it square, feeds the faintest of nicks to the keeper. Watson c Saha b Axar 3(6)

Maxwell to Mandeep, out Bowled!! Maxi roars. RCB fans are absolutely shattered. One guy has ran out of expressions, he just tweaks his hair while giving THAT WHAT.THE.____ expression! Oh boy! Things going bad to worse for RCB. No real turn, just stump-to-stump channel and fired it flat, Mandeep rocks back to pull, a big swish across the line. Misses by a long way and the middle pole takes the pasting. Mandeep b Maxwell 46(40) [4s-5 6s-2]

Maxwell to Aravind, out Lbw!! Maxi is having fun out there. He is picking wickets like the way he knocks the switch-hits. 7 down now. Aravind crouches and looks to sweep Maxi through square leg, doesn't pick the line, neither the length. Strikes him low around off and that's smashing into middle. Aravind lbw b Maxwell 4(6)

Axar to Negi, out Caught by Saha!! Three fielders converge for the catch and Saha pouches it safely. Not before a bit of collision though. Natarajan aborted himself at the last second and evaded the dash, but Aaron and Saha didn't. In the end, Saha accepts while gliding into Varun Aaron who was running from backward point. It was a pull that never took off, off the splice of the bat. And then all the drama Negi c Saha b Axar 21(23) [4s-2]
Axar to Badree, out Bowled!! Knocked him over! Down on one knee looking to thump Axar into MG Road. You miss I hit. Knocks the head of off peg. Badree b Axar 8(9)

Mohit Sharma to Aniket Choudhary, out Caught by Guptill!! That's the final nail in the coffin. This is the lowest ever total defended at this venue. KXIP needed to win this badly and they did so with great ease. Fast bowler to fast bolwer. Result? He slaps hard and picks out Guptill at mid-off. Had only so much power. Alas! Aniket Choudhary c Guptill b Mohit Sharma 4(6)

Sandeep Sharma to Kohli, out Bowled!! Go Sandeep, make a GIF out of this and retire. Virat Kohli's been done. Sees Kohli shimmy out and still keeps it straight at the stumps. Kohli overruns, letting the ball sneak through and timbah. The trick was that Sharma stuck to a normal pace delivery. Kohli would have connected had it been a slower one. Wasn't and bam, Kohli is gone. Kohli b Sandeep Sharma 6(6) [4s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, out Caught by Saha!! Sandeep Sharma has Chris Gayle, Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers off consecutive overs. Now that's something to roast others about, in your white picket-fenced villa that you buy from your IPL contract. So, coming back to reality, AB was shimmying out of his crease, high on confidence of bullying the last ball for a six. What Sandeep does is to keep it full but just about adjusts the line to something further outside off. AB gets an edge on the charge and the keeper does so well to anticipate it all and move to his right to pouch that. Big wicket, RCB stuttering. de Villiers c Saha b Sandeep Sharma 10(6) [4s-1 6s-1]

Mohit Sharma to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by Axar!! That's just Mohit playing with the length. And his knuckles, maybe. Clocks 134ks but gets the ball to hold in the pitch, as Kedar charges out in ambition. Tries to check his shot but ends up slicing it off the splice to short cover. Kedar wanted to go leg-side, and go big, but was hoaxed by the ball never arriving at all. Where are we headed? More importantly, where are RCB? Kedar Jadhav c Axar b Mohit Sharma 6(6) [4s-1]

Nehra to Tripathi, out Tripathi Run Out!! A waste. A sheer waste. A nothing line this from Nehra, down leg and Tripathi helps it out to short fine courtesy his clip. Nothing wrong with that. Just that he wants the single desperately after that - something Rahane declines making him return from his adventures half way down the track. A direct hit and you do not need to disturb the third umpire for these. Had given up. Oh what a waste of form. Tripathi run out (Bipul Sharma) 1(4)

Rashid Khan to Stokes, out Bowled!! Got him. Rashid takes matter on his own hands and castles Stokes. Flatter ball, extracted just a bit of turn back in, Stokes sanked down for a blindfold slog, misses and sees his stumps rattled. Much needed breakthrough for SRH. Stokes b Rashid Khan 39(25) [4s-1 6s-3]

S Kaul to Smith, out Caught by Bipul Sharma!! Bipul Sharma has resurrected his karma charts. This should've happened much earlier. He dropped Smith earlier off the same bowler but washes off all the sins now. A very full ball outside off, Smith tried to be smart, opened the bat face and looked to flay it in the pocket between point and short third man. But fails in his endeavour. Picks out Bipul, who settles under it and roars in delight. Smith c Bipul Sharma b S Kaul 34(39)

S Kaul to Christian, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Two wickets in three balls for SRH. What a turnaround. One shot too many for Christian. It was swerving in on off, Christian wanted to go over long-on but messes up his timing. Skews it off the splice and sends it high towards long-on. Rashid Khan runs in and pouches it safely. Too easy for him. Christian c Rashid Khan b S Kaul 4(2) [4s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Manoj Tiwary, out Manoj Tiwary Run Out!! 1 run completed. Horrible mix-up and Tiwary has to depart. A total communication breakdown between Tiwary and Dhoni. A fuller length delivery on the stumps, Tiwary pushes it towards long-off and set off for the second. Dhoni showed signs of interest but on seeing the fielder rush onto the ball, he sent back Tiwary and sold him down the river. The Bengal batsman had no chance of returning back once he took off. Manoj Tiwary run out (Warner/Bhuvneshwar) 9(5) [4s-1]

S Kaul to Dhoni, out Caught by Naman Ojha!! End of Dhoni blitz. But he has done the damage. Very full ball on the stumps, Dhoni swung hard at that, fails to find the sweet spot. Some curl in the air must've done him. Edges it behind and Ojha makes no mistake. Dhoni c Naman Ojha b S Kaul 31(21) [4s-2 6s-2]

S Kaul to SN Thakur, out Caught by Warner!! Safe as houses. If Davy Warner is in the vicinity, you can tuck your arms and walk off. You will rarely see him put a catch down. Two in two for Kaul and he is on a hat-trick. Looked like the slower ball, hurled it wide of off, Thakur meekly chipped it down the ground. Finds long-off and the SRH skipper calmly gobbles it up. SN Thakur c Warner b S Kaul 0(1)

Bipul Sharma to Rahane, out Caught by Yuvraj!! Sweeps and sweeps his way to his doom. Bipul has some sort of a revenge. Keeps flighting it up inviting the aggression. Gets it in the form of an uncontrolled sweep. Rahane doesn't really reach out, takes one hand off the handle as well as he top-edges it to a running in Yuvi from the square leg fence. The second time Bipul has Rahane's number this season. Rahane c Yuvraj b Bipul Sharma 22(20) [6s-1]

Stokes to Warner, out Caught by SN Thakur!! And that's why he was brought back. Huge moment in the game. Third wicket for RPS and all three have been from Stokes. Nothing special about this delivery. Short and outside off, Warner was on the hop trying to play the cut, does not bother to keep it down and picks out the sweeper to perfection. He was aiming to go over point and got it a lot squarer than he would have liked. Warner c SN Thakur b Stokes 40(34) [4s-4 6s-1]

Tahir to Henriques, out Bowled!! Tahir is off. Game on! The wrong 'un from Tahir, Henriques certainly did not pick it as he went back to play the cut shot, the ball spun back in and got the under edge, deflected onto the stumps. Tahir is off on his sprint. Almost ends up near deep square leg. Two wickets in succession and the game is back in balance. Henriques b Tahir 4(6)

Unadkat to Yuvraj, out Caught by Tripathi!! Wow! Is that the game? Unadkat certainly thinks so. Pumps his fist in excitement. The off-cutter on a shortish length. They have been bowling that all evening. Yuvraj goes for the cut and like Warner does not have the power to get it over the man sweeping. Tripathi runs to his right and takes a well-judged catch. Yuvraj has some advice for the incoming Bipul Sharma. Yuvraj c Tripathi b Unadkat 47(43) [4s-4 6s-2]

Unadkat to Naman Ojha, out Caught by Stokes!! You just can't keep Stokes out of the action. Second wicket in the over for Unadkat and he might have just won RPS the game. Another one of his cutters outside off, Ojha went for the loft over long-off, since the ball gripped the surface it took the outer half of the bat and skied towards sweeper cover. Stokes made no mistake. Bit of silence around the ground now. Naman Ojha c Stokes b Unadkat 9(9) [6s-1]

Unadkat to Bipul Sharma, out Caught by Stokes!! Dot followed by a wicket. Stokes with another catch. He's been everywhere today. The slower delivery and Bipul picked it early this time around, went with the angle towards deep square leg. Made a decent connection as well but the big side boundaries don't fetch him a six. Stokes steadies himself near deep square leg and pouches it with ease. Unadkat has a smile on his face. Bipul Sharma c Stokes b Unadkat 8(7)

Unadkat to Rashid Khan, out Caught&Bowled!! Fourth wicket for Unadkat. He's on a hat-trick. Another batsman falls prey to the slower delivery. The key with the off-pace delivery is that you have to hit the right length and Unadkat has managed to do that, Rashid went for the loft and only managed to cue-end beside the pitch. Unadkat runs across and reverse cups it. Rashid Khan c and b Unadkat 3(4)

Unadkat to Bhuvneshwar, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! There it is. Third hat-trick of the season. He is chuffed to bits. Is almost on his knees celebrating the occasion. Also, reaches 100 wickets in T20s. Once more the off-speed delivery on back of a length, Bhuvneshwar stayed leg-side and tried to flat-bat it, spliced it towards extra cover and Tiwary made no mistake. He's been terrifich with his slower balls. Bhuvneshwar c Manoj Tiwary b Unadkat 0(1)

Stokes to Dhawan, out Bowled!! Stokes strikes first ball, did the ball stay a bit low? Stokes wouldn't complain though. He came from round the wicket and angled one back into the left-hander, Dhawan was lazy in getting forward, his bat came down way too late - but by that time the ball had gone past him and pegged the off-stump back. Stokes exults in delight, Dhawan was looking in good touch, but it's only a cameo from him today. Dhawan b Stokes 19(12) [4s-2 6s-1]

Stokes to Williamson, out Caught by Dhoni!! Stokes is pulling his team back into the contest once again. He did with the bat earlier, he now has two in an over. This is a huge wicket, KW was the man who could have anchored the chase on this pitch, he's been done in by some extra bounce. Was late in getting forward on the drive, the ball seamed just enough to catch the shoulder of the bat - a bit of glove as well and MS doesn't drop those. Williamson c Dhoni b Stokes 4(2) [4s-1]

McClenaghan to Samson, out Caught by Simmons!! This is not how you climb a Mt Everest. This is not the start you dream of. A fuller ball and Samson swings across the line. Wants to dominate with ball one. The bat turns a bit in the hands, taking the power off the shot. Carries to the man at deep square leg. The fielder moves a bit to his right and grabs that with ease. Samson c Simmons b McClenaghan 0(1)

Malinga to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Harbhajan!! Not for once in this innings did he look at ease and eventually hands a dolly to Harbhajan at mid-wicket. Short ball, Shreyas Iyer is clearly done in by the pace. Is late on the pull, the ball hits the splice and skies. Second one down for Delhi. They are not helping their cause. The move to send him up the order falls on its face. 150 wickets in the IPL for the great Sri Lankan. Shreyas Iyer c Harbhajan b Malinga 3(6)

Harbhajan to Shami, out Caught by Pollard!! Goes with the turn again. No, not really. It is the attempted doosra from Bhajji. Does not turn much but does the trick, Shami miscues the big loft. Pollard gets under it at long-on and pushes Delhi closer to embarrassment. Shami c Pollard b Harbhajan 7(4) [6s-1]

Karn Sharma to Zaheer, out Caught by Nitish Rana!! Delhi lose by 146 runs and it's an IPL record. Zaheer tries to clear the straight boundary but mistimes in the air for Nitish Rana to run across from long-on and catch it. Juggled a few times but managed to hold on. Zaheer c Nitish Rana b Karn Sharma 2(11)

Bumrah to Pant, out Caught by Simmons!! You got to look at Pant. He cannot believe it. Looks dejected. As if has been robbed of hope. The scoreboard pressure gets the better of him. A shortish ball that he tries to help with the pull, does not quite manoeuvre it well. Ends up hitting in the air at deep mid-wicket. The fielder onrushes a few yards and accepts the offer. Pant c Simmons b Bumrah 0(3)

Harbhajan to Nair, out Caught by Rohit!! Now Nair departs. Wheels coming off the chase. Nair, like the previous occasion, stepped down again. This time Harbhajan is smart enough to shorten the length. However, that does not deter Nair who goes with the shot, whips it well but does not get the elevation. Rohit Sharma at mid-wicket leaps a bit and plucks it. Nair c Rohit b Harbhajan 21(15) [4s-3 6s-1]

Malinga to Corey Anderson, out Caught by Karn Sharma!! Short ball and it devours Corey Anderson. He was trying to make some room but saw that the line was pretty close to his body. Decided to go for the pull, but the ball skid on. Could not get enough power behind the shot and found long-on to his left. Corey Anderson c Karn Sharma b Malinga 10(8) [4s-2]S

Karn Sharma to Samuels, out Caught by Rohit!! Where did this come from? Rohit Sharma has taken a catch that for me qualifies as the grab of the tournament, at least so far. Samuels goes back to cut this leg-break, outside edges that flies to right of Rohit at slip. He spots it, not sure what was the reaction time, and plucks it one-handed when it has almost gone past him. Blinder from the Mumbai skipper. Samuels c Rohit b Karn Sharma 1(5)

Harbhajan to Pat Cummins, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Mumbai are running through Delhi. Pat Cummins stays back to defend, plays for the extra turn. There is not much, takes the edge and settles into the gloves of the keeper. Pat Cummins c Parthiv Patel b Harbhajan 10(10) [6s-1]

Karn Sharma to Rabada, out Caught by Rohit!! Nothing shot from Rabada. Goes back to cut a googly that is not short by any stretch of imagination. Gets a thick edge and Rohit Sharma is catching everything tonight. How can he drop something destined to go into his lap!? Rabada c Rohit b Karn Sharma 0(5)

Corey Anderson to Simmons, out Caught by Samuels!! Catching practice for Samuels and Simmons falls after a fine knock. Relief on the faces of the Daredevils fielders, this was short and on the stumps - asking to be smacked. Simmons shuffled inside the line and was looking to help it fine, went off the middle and straight into the pouch of Samuels - at short fine leg. He doesn't drop those, juggles and takes it on the second attempt. Simmons walks off to a good ovation. Simmons c Samuels b Corey Anderson 66(43) [4s-5 6s-4]

Rabada to Rohit, out Caught by Mishra!! That's the pace of Rabada. Rohit is one of the finest pullers in India and still he's undone by the South African's speed. Dug in short and gets a nice lift on this, Rohit goes for the pull tad too late, the top-edge pops towards short fine leg and Mishra completes the formalities. Big wicket for DD at this stage of the game. They need few more to take control. Rohit c Mishra b Rabada 10(6) [4s-1]

Mishra to Parthiv Patel, out Stumped!! This was coming. Parthiv Patel was not quite able to find the fence despite his regular attempts. This time curmudgeonly steps down to go down town. The googly was always going across him. Once he did not meet the pitch of the ball, the doom was waiting. Pant did not do anything silly, collected the ball and whipped the bails. Parthiv Patel st Pant b Mishra 25(22) [4s-3]

Negi to de Grandhomme, out Stumped!! Oh beautifully bowled. That's wonderful deception in flight. He slows it down, gives it some air to lure de Grandhomme out of his crease and then gets it to dip and turn past him. de Grandhomme runs past the ball. Lovely. Easy stumping for Jadhav. de Grandhomme st Kedar Jadhav b Negi 31(28) [4s-1 6s-2]

Chahal to Gambhir, out Caught by Negi!! Another wicket. It's brought a smile on a couple of faces for RCB. Chahal drifts this wide of off, Gambhir chases it for the drive wanting to smash it through the covers but because it's so wide, he gets it close to the bottom of the bat which spoils his timing. Skews it to short cover. Gambhir c Negi b Chahal 14(16)

Aniket Choudhary to Narine, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! Wicket after the break. It will not matter for KKR. Narine has done the job he was sent out to do. In fact might have done more than they would have expected. Quick short delivery and Narine takes it on, feathers an edge and Jadhav had to jump up to glove that. Some respite for RCB from all the madness. Narine c Kedar Jadhav b Aniket Choudhary 54(17) [4s-6 6s-4]

Negi to Chris Lynn, out Bowled!! Got him. That's scooted through to shatter the stumps as Lynn lines up a pull. Darted in short, Lynn expects the ball to get up so he can pummel it into the stands. Not quite. RCB can chew the leftovers of their carcass. Chris Lynn b Negi 50(22) [4s-5 6s-4]

U Yadav to Gayle, out Caught by Gambhir!! Oh dear! Back-to-back ducks for Gayle, he is OUT first ball in his 100th IPL match. On a good length and a hint of shape back into the left-hander, Gayle was looking to work it towards the on-side. Did the ball stop on him, he closed the bat face early, the leading edge popped in the air and Gambhir raced in from cover to gobble it up. Worst possible start for RCB as Gayle walks away. Gayle c Gambhir b U Yadav 0(1)

Narine to Mandeep, out Caught by U Yadav!! If the rain break didn't bring about a wicket, the strategic break did. Mandeep does not kick-on. Perishes while trying to up the ante. The off-break from Narine, Mandeep makes a bit of room, sits down and slog sweeps, made a decent enough connection, at least I thought with the sound when ball made contact with the bat, but it towards deep square leg. Umesh judged the boundary rope to perfection and hung on. Mandeep c U Yadav b Narine 52(43) [4s-4 6s-1]

Woakes to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by U Yadav!! And Jadhav mistimes one. The trap had been set from Woakes. The full wide delivery outside off, Jadhav was up for it, moved across to get close to the swinging range, the loft comes off the toe-end and skies up to long-off. Umesh jogs to his left and takes it comfortably. Kedar Jadhav c U Yadav b Woakes 8(9) [4s-1]

U Yadav to Negi, out Caught by Chris Lynn!! Third wicket for Umesh. Negi had no other option than to go for it. The off-pace delivery and Negi went for big hit down the ground, got it right off the base of the bat and sent it a long way into the sky. Lynn from extra cover called for it and made the catch look utterly easy. Negi c Chris Lynn b U Yadav 5(3) [4s-1]

U Yadav to Kohli, out Lbw!! Piyush can be relieved now, yet another failure for Kohli. Superbly bowled by Umesh, this was the back of the hand slower ball, Kohli didn't pick it up at all, swung across the line and missed it completely. Rapped on the pads (back thigh) and it's a simple call for the umpire. Umesh exults in delight, RCB are struggling early once again. Kohli lbw b U Yadav 5(9)

Narine to de Villiers, out Bowled!! This has been the story of the season for RCB, says Sanjay Manjrekar on air - can't be wrong. This was tossed up on the stumps, AB was once again shuffling across, as a result - he left his leg-stump exposed, the ball drifted in, went past his attempted sweep and crashed into the leg-stump. A stunned AB has to walk back to the hut. de Villiers b Narine 10(8) [4s-2]

Maxwell to Dwayne Smith, out Caught by Guptill!! Drags the length and gets rewarded. Dwayne Smith goes for the slog on this flatter ball, fails to generate enough momentum. Finds one of the tallest members on field stationed at deep mid-wicket boundary. Dwayne Smith c Guptill b Maxwell 74(39) [4s-8 6s-4]

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, out Caught by Gurkeerat Singh!! Mann is the man for Punjab, finally. Takes one at deep mid-wicket. Raina went for the glory shot, the bat turned in his hand as he attemped the swing on this fuller ball. Skied it high and Mann, who was not having a great day before this catch of course, manages to reverse-cup it. Relieved, that was the look on his face. Raina c Gurkeerat Singh b Sandeep Sharma 39(25) [4s-4 6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Finch, out Caught by Saha!! Sandeep is behind what happened earlier in the day and he is trying his best to change things on his own. Short ball that kicked off and beat the pull of Finch, took the top edge en route to the keeper. Two wickets in the over and Punjab might feel resurrected after this. Finch c Saha b Sandeep Sharma 2(2)

T Natarajan to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by (sub)Miller!! Finally the catch has been taken. Ishan Kishan goes for the heave again, was on the move a bit and hence no transfer of weight to impart enough power on the shot. Ends up hitting it low towards the man patrolling the fence at mid-wicket. Was a slower ball and that might have made things a touch different for the youngster. Ishan Kishan c (sub)Miller b T Natarajan 29(24) [4s-3]

Sangwan to Guptill, out Caught by Basil Thampi!! This was coming. The approach to the pitch when he came out to bat wasn't that positive. He got a friendly ball on the pads first up, only managed to flick it behind square without power, then mistimed a hat-trick of balls before this one and Sangwan has got him with a bumper. Guptill wasn't expecting this from the pacer. Was looking to come forward, surprised by the bouncer, tries to pull off the back foot, Sangwan has a man at deep mid-wicket precisely for the top-edge and the man in the deep made no mistake as it came off the outside half of the bat. Guptill c Basil Thampi b Sangwan 2(5)

D Kulkarni to Shaun Marsh, out Caught by Finch!! High into the night sky and straight into the bucket hands of Finch at long-on. Perfect length from Kulkarni, didn't let Marsh plan his swing, just held it back a touch and ensured he messed up the timing. Marsh lofted it straight, no distance, regulation catch. Shaun Marsh c Finch b D Kulkarni 58(43) [4s-6]

Basil Thampi to Amla, out Lbw!! Some respite, finally. A yorker that tails in a bit around middle and leg, Amla with his back leg deep inside, looking to swing over mid-wicket. Misses due to the dip and is caught plumb in front. Raina walks up to him to congratulate what has been a tremendous ton from one of the modern greats. Amla lbw b Basil Thampi 104(60) [4s-8 6s-5]

Nabi to Simmons, out Bowled!! This was coming. He wanted to target the offie right from the word go. But Nabi a clever operator and out goes the middle pole. The key to this dismissal was once again Nabi opting to bowl a flatter trajectory, knowing that the batsman was targetting the on-side boundary. Simmons was nowhere close to this ball, a wild swing it was, ended up playing outside the line and made a mess of the stumps. Simmons b Nabi 1(5)

Rashid Khan to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Henriques!! There you go! Rashid Khan strikes and breaks the partnership. Hardik Pandya was never comfortable against Rashid. Doesn't pick the wrong 'un that doesn't spin much and goes for a wild slog sweep. The bat turns at the point of impact and he ends up slicing it high in the air. Henriques at extra cover calls fot it and catches it calmly. Hardik Pandya c Henriques b Rashid Khan 15(24)

S Kaul to Rohit, out Bowled!! The slower ball does the trick. It was an off-pace short ball well outside off, Rohit is early into his pull shot. He gets an inside edge and it also came off the bottom portion of the bat. Hits his boot and cannons onto the stumps. He could have gone with a stroke through the off-side. Anyway, end of a fine knock. Rohit b S Kaul 67(45) [4s-6 6s-2]

Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, out Caught by Vijay Shankar!! Seam-up full toss that tailed into the right-hander. Pollard goes for his favourite shot - the slog over mid-wicket. Goes hard and ends up mistiming it. Finds the man at deep mid-wicket to perfection. Shankar didn't have to move an inch. Pollard c Vijay Shankar b Bhuvneshwar 5(9)

Bhuvneshwar to Karn Sharma, out Caught by Naman Ojha!! Had he let that go it would have been deemded as a wide. Seeing the batsman back away, Bhuvneshwar darts one well outside off from a good length. Sharma has to reach out for it with a stretched arms. In the end, nicks it into the mitts of Naman Ojha who collects it with ease. Karn Sharma c Naman Ojha b Bhuvneshwar 5(5) [4s-1]

S Kaul to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! There you go, the pressure telling on the Mumbai batsmen and the youngster succumbs. He wanted to take the attack to the new bowler, in the process, he has played a false shot. This was a short of a length delivery outside off stump, it was never there to be pulled away, had to fetch it, an off-side shot would have been ideal, in the end slices it high in the air - the bat turned in his hands on impact - and only goes as far as mid-off. Nitish Rana c Bhuvneshwar b S Kaul 9(11) [4s-2]

S Kaul to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Warner!! Look at that fist pump from Davey Warner. Why not! He's taken an excellent catch and Mumbai aren't getting a hang of things here. Kaul gets his second wicket, it was the slower delivery, looked like the knuckle ball, Parthiv flicked uppishly, was beaten by the change of pace, hence couldn't control the shot, the ball wasn't comfortably carrying to the fielder. Warner ran forward and timed his dive to perfection to take a good low catch. Parthiv Patel c Warner b S Kaul 23(17) [4s-1 6s-1]

McClenaghan to Warner, out Lbw!! And he strikes first ball! What a great asset he has been for Mumbai Indians this season. This is a big, big wicket and a wicket that Mumbai needed badly. Warner was on the back foot expecting some short stuff, wasn't to be. McClenaghan spears in a full one that keeps tailing in to hit Warner on the back pad. Dead in front. Warner was looking to play straight...oh wait! Snicko shows that he seem to have got a faint inside edge on that. Warner lbw b McClenaghan 6(6) [4s-1]

Bumrah to Henriques, out Caught by Rohit!! Here comes the leading edge. The Bumrah slower one on this sticky wicket finally consumes a wicket for Mumbai - too late in the day one would reckon. After a few checked defences, Henriques looks to pile on the angle coming in off a fullish length as he turns his bat looking to flick it away. A balloon to extra cover, who snatches it from the hands of mid-off. Henriques c Rohit b Bumrah 44(35) [4s-6]

Malinga to Yuvraj, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Now go and ice those fingers. Malinga keeps up with the slower ones, this time changing the line to one angling outside off. Yuvraj swings his bat through the line, realizes he is way too early and has to settle for a chipped loft. Miscued. Pandya at sweeper cover meanwhile runs in and settles to cause some jitters. Yuvraj c Hardik Pandya b Malinga 9(11) [4s-1]

Matt Henry to M Pandey, out Caught by Axar!! This is big. What hoodwinked Pandey was the length - full and on leg-stump. Guess he had read the slower ball, for he was waiting with his stance open but the length was such that he couldn't get right under it. So ends up scooping it high in the air. So high that Axar could sprint to his left at deep mid-wicket and station himself into a simple catch. M Pandey c Axar b Matt Henry 18(23) [4s-1]

Matt Henry to Chris Lynn, out Chris Lynn Run Out!! 1 run completed. Korbo - yes. Lorbo - just there. Jeetbo - iffy, now. This is a death blow, or feels like it. Lynn had the room made, swats at a back of a length delivery and hacks it to deep mid-wicket. And then coaxes de Grandhomme into a second. Is running back to the danger end. Axar darts a throw back to Saha; he's having that kinda day. He's having a field. On the bounce to Saha, who takes the bails off and Lynn is just short. Wow. Just the wicket KXIP needed.
