Chris Lynn run out (Axar/Saha) 84(52) [4s-8 6s-3]

Mohit Sharma to Y Pathan, out Caught by Maxwell!! Chuck the '13 Reasons Why' on Netflix -- here's one reason why Mohit Sharma is so good. Pathan takes on the pacer.. like he would a spinner. And pays the penalty. Pathan uses his feet, goes for the big wind-up but this is a slower ball, needed more biceps. Pathan doesn't have it. Holes out to long-on. Perfection. Auction Mohit's knuckles in the next auction, will you? Y Pathan c Maxwell b Mohit Sharma 2(3)

Mohit Sharma to Narine, out Bowled!! Round the wicket slower ball. Narine knows what is coming, waits and decides to swing across the line. Is still early on the shot and misses it completely. The stumps get shattered off this off-cutter. Punjab get a window and the breather they needed desperately. Narine b Mohit Sharma 18(10) [4s-4]

Rahul Tewatia to Gambhir, out Caught by Shaun Marsh!! And he is gone. Wrong 'un does the trick. It is a little bemusing to see why did Gambhir go for the big hit instead of Chris Lynn! The boundaries were not coming for a while now and Gambhir departs trying to up the ante. Slogs and gets the height on it. Not quite the distance he wanted. Marsh settles under it at deep mid-wicket. Gambhir c Shaun Marsh b Rahul Tewatia 8(18)

Rahul Tewatia to Uthappa, out Caught by Axar!! Axar takes a beauty diving to his right at deep mid-wicket. Googly and Uthappa goes with the turn. But this is the first ball he is facing. Not sure what was he thinking. Does not quite time it and hits in the air towards the right of the man in the deep. Axar attacks the ball and dives in time to get his fingers underneath the ball. Uthappa c Axar b Rahul Tewatia 0(1)

Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, out Caught by Woakes!! The greed. Oh it really is. Brings about his downfall. Tossed up wide, floating googly and inviting Maxwell to take matters into the off-side. And he cannot resist it. Throws his hands out, with a lean and a reach out as he lofts it. Off the toe end and some clean diving at the fence seem to be enough to send him back. Maxwell c Woakes b Kuldeep Yadav 44(25) [4s-1 6s-4]

Woakes to Swapnil Singh, out Bowled!! Drags it on. Bends his back does Woakes in bumping it in. And it skids on to stay a touch low for the anticipated lined up pull from Swapnil to come out right. Too high in the end and takes the inside edge to light up the night sky with some red again. Punjab falling apart in search of their catapult at the end. Swapnil Singh b Woakes 2(2)

U Yadav to Vohra, out Caught by Uthappa!! Umesh Yadav persists with the short ball stuff and that pays dividends for him. Removes the dangerous Vohra with a 139kph bouncer on leg. Vohra didn't go whole-heartedly against it on his hook shot. He shuffled across a bit and ended up giving a simple catch to Uthappa. It came off the glove. Vohra c Uthappa b U Yadav 25(16) [4s-4]

Narine to Guptill, out Lbw!! A vociferous appeal for lbw and up goes the finger. Guptill isn't happy with the decision. The impact outside off maybe? No. Guptill got low on one knee to play the sweep shot and missed a straight ball. He is struck adjacent to the off-stump. That's crashing onto the stumps. Good call from the umpire. Guptill lbw b Narine 12(16) [4s-1]

Woakes to Shaun Marsh, out Bowled!! Shaun Marsh is clean bowled. Seam-up delivery from Woakes from a goodish length that snakes in a tad. Marsh doesn't account for it and attempts the drive. The ball sneaks in beating his inside edge and cannons onto the stumps. Shaun Marsh b Woakes 11(10) [4s-2]

Sangwan to Samson, out Bowled!! He's played on. Big blow for Delhi up front. Short of length from Sangwan, hits the pitch hard and rushes Samson on the pull. It was there to be put away, the height didn't seem an inconvenience, but I think what unraveled Samson was the skid on the ball. He's late on the shot and under-edges it into the furniture. Middle stump floored. Samson b Sangwan 10(7) [4s-2]

Sangwan to Pant, out Pant Run Out!! Waste, a complete waste. Pant has had a brainfade. He's completely caught up in the LBW call, so much so that he forgets to plonk his bat inside the crease. Excellent comeback from Sangwan, spearing it full on leg, Pant plays across the line and it appears to hit him on the back leg. Maybe an inside edge, maybe going down leg, whatever it is, it isn't out. Meanwhile, Pant is anxious about the decision, wanders out of the crease and Raina capitalizes from slip. Pant run out (Raina) 4(2) [4s-1]

Faulkner to Shreyas Iyer, out Samuels Run Out!! Slower ball from Faulkner, Iyer taps it towards backward point again, a little bit in front of the fielder this time and they decide to go through for the single. Turns out, it's not a good decision after all. The man they are taking on is Ravindra Jadeja, one of the best fielders in this tournament, and if he hits, more often than not his arm will catch you short. Samuels is a yard out. Samuels run out (Jadeja) 1(4)

Basil Thampi to Corey Anderson, out Corey Anderson Run Out!! Third run out of the innings. Once again it's the rocket from Rajkot. Why do you take a chance against him? He is so good there. Coming to the ball, it was a short of length delivery just outside off, Anderson chops the cut to backward point and wanders out of his crease for a non-existent single. He is sent back by his partner. By the time he turns back and tries to return, Jaddu does the thing he often does. Finding the target direct at the striker's end. Corey Anderson run out (Jadeja) 6(6) [4s-1]

D Kulkarni to Brathwaite, out Caught&Bowled!! Carlos Brathwaite has been bounced out by the Mumbai seamer. Brathwaite underestimates the pace of Kulkarni and is late to play the pull shot against this back of a length delivery that kept following him. The ball lobs off the outside part of the bat. The bowler calls for it, moves to his left and takes it with ease. Brathwaite c and b D Kulkarni 11(10) [4s-2]

Faulkner to Pat Cummins, out Caught by Dwayne Smith!! Cummins departs looking to play the full shot. It was in the slot for Cummins to slog it over long-on. He cleared his front leg, but unfortunately mistimed the tonk. Straight into the bucket hands of Smith at long-on. Pat Cummins c Dwayne Smith b Faulkner 24(13) [4s-2 6s-1]

Basil Thampi to Shreyas Iyer, out Bowled!! Gone! This man from Ernakulam is too good at this stage of the innings. Full and tailing in, hint of reverse swing. Iyer walks across in his crease and looks to clip it through the on-side. Gets an inside edge that cannons onto the stumps. Shreyas Iyer b Basil Thampi 96(57) [4s-15 6s-2]

Faulkner to Nair, out Caught by Dwayne Smith!! Faulkner's done him with lack of pace. Really canny bowling. Cuts his fingers across, the ball holds up on Nair as he tries to loft inside out and ends up slicing it in the air. Smith backpedals at least 10-15 yards from extra-cover, eyes on the ball all the time, and grabs it. Nair c Dwayne Smith b Faulkner 30(15) [4s-5 6s-1]

Brathwaite to Karthik, out Caught by Corey Anderson!! Wicket right after the break and it is Anderson, who has pulled another terrific catch. Full and on the stumps, bit too full for Karthik to get underneath that, but he still goes through with it and spoons it towards long-on. The ball was dying in front of an onrushing Anderson, but he gets there with a dive. Takes it inches from the ground. The umpires send it upstairs and it is an easy one for the TV ump. Karthik c Corey Anderson b Brathwaite 40(28) [4s-4 6s-1]

Shami to Finch, out Bowled!! Shami makes a mess of the stumps. The off and middle are uprooted completely. But Finch has done his job. A quickfire 69 has set GL up for a strong finish. This was a full delivery and had Finch not given himself room, he would have been in a position to put it away, not to be and the ball crashed into the stumps after beating the swinging willow. Finch b Shami 69(39) [4s-6 6s-4]

Shami to Dwayne Smith, out Dwayne Smith Run Out!! Is Dwayne Smith short there at the bowler's end? Yes he is. He was a sloth there, has to pay in the end. Got hurried on the short ball and mistimed the pull to short fine leg. Ishan Kishan wanted the single and set off. Dwayne Smith reacted late and despite Shami not being in a good position to collect the throw, he could not make it in the end. Did not even attempt the dive there. Might have lost his bat as well. Will confirm soon. Dwayne Smith run out (Mishra/Shami) 8(8) [4s-1]

Pat Cummins to Raina, out Bowled!! Raina has been cleaned up. Makes room again but the length is much fuller and laced with pace (146kph). Raina's bat is late to come down on the inside-out drive, loses his stumps. Big wicket in the context of the game. Raina b Pat Cummins 6(5) [4s-1]

Mishra to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Zaheer!! One shot too many for Ishan Kishan. Another googly but it has a lot of flight. Ishan Kishan goes for the sweep again and top edges to Zaheer at short fine leg. Mishra has struck soon and once he gets a wicket early in the spell he can be lethal, especially on these kind of tracks. Ishan Kishan c Zaheer b Mishra 34(25) [4s-5 6s-1]

Bumrah to Maxwell, out Bowled!! Look at Bumrah. He is hardly this pumped. Knows he's got the big man. Maxwell makes room, tries to cut, but the ball is not that short. On top of that it's a seam up ball that skids through and uproots the off-stump. Crowd goes mental. Little window that Mumbai needed, have they got that? We shall see. Maxwell b Bumrah 47(21) [4s-2 6s-5]

McClenaghan to Shaun Marsh, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! A bowler always has the last laugh. One of those things. Shaun Marsh is gone. McClenaghan gets him, not sure how big that one will be. But at least it's a dot ball and a wicket. Another off-pace ball that is going across Shaun Marsh. He tries the cross-batted swing, slices it in the air. Parthiv Patel runs forward towards his left. Has to stretch a bit to snaffle this one. Shaun Marsh c Parthiv Patel b McClenaghan 25(16) [6s-2]

Karn Sharma to Guptill, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Guptill gets greedy and throws his wicket away! Lovely ball from Karn, slowed down the pace on this leg-break, Guptill was setting himself up for the slog sweep, gets a fat top-edge, high and towards long-on. Hardik kept back-pedalling, didn't lose sight over the ball and completes a fine two-handed overhead catch. Much needed wicket for MI, the two openers were threatening to take this game away. Guptill c Hardik Pandya b Karn Sharma 36(18) [4s-5 6s-1]

Rahul Tewatia to Rohit, out Caught by Guptill!! Punjab are fighting back into this contest. A big, big wicket in the context of the game. Hold on! They are checking for a possible no-ball but he's fine and Rohit has to continue the long walk back to the pavilion. The Mumbai skipper's destiny doesn't last long. Totally fails to connect this flatter delivery and ended up hitting it straight to Guptill at long-on. Too easy for him and he ain't dropping those. Stunned silence in the crowd. Rohit c Guptill b Rahul Tewatia 5(7)

Axar to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Guptill!! Gone! Another one bites the dust. Rana hasn't been in the best of touch lately and he departs cheaply today. Axar pushed it through quicker, perhaps Rana was hustled for pace. Went back and looked to clear deep mid-wicket but messes up with his timing. Skies it straight to Guptill near the rope and he gobbles it up nicely. Nitish Rana c Guptill b Axar 12(12) [4s-2]

Sandeep Sharma to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Saha!! Has that been taken? It has. Up goes the umpire's finger. End of Pandya's cameo. Again bowled it full and outside off, Pandya threw his bat at it, gets an outside edge and flew to Saha. He flung to his right and pulled off a blinder. Is this the spark that can lighten Punjab back into this game? Hardik Pandya c Saha b Sandeep Sharma 30(13) [6s-4]

Mohit Sharma to Karn Sharma, out Bowled!! Bowled him. Just when Mumbai keep belting boundaries, Punjab manage to strike back with plucking wickets. Let's call it a nomenclature, Mohit's back-of-the-hand slower ball, aiming at the stumps. Karn swung at it wildy, misses and is castled. Mohit roars in joy. Karn Sharma b Mohit Sharma 19(6) [4s-3 6s-1]

Mohit Sharma to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Vohra!! That's the end of the fun. Continues moving away, but for a change Mohit learns his bit following him with a pacy length stuff. Gets too big on him as he tries powering it away once again with a loft. Miscues it all ends up and the balloon in the air is taken. Finally. At cover. Something's arrested. Parthiv Patel c Vohra b Mohit Sharma 38(23) [4s-7]

Maxwell to Simmons, out Caught by Guptill!! A bird, a plane. Oh no. That's Martin Guptill. What in every world could only have been a smoke down the ground with Simmons in his mood dancing and tonking sucked out by the only man who could have taken this. And he does it with a jump, a one-handed raise and taking it as cleanly as it could. Forget the boundary run-ins and throw outs. This is sheer timing. Simmons c Guptill b Maxwell 59(32) [4s-5 6s-4]

Unadkat to Nair, out Samson Run Out!! Poor running. Absolutely poor. Nair steers it to the left of backward point. The ball goes at a good bounce for Stokes to pick it up and hit the stumps direct. Sanju Samson was nowhere in the frame and Ananthapadmanabhan has his finger up. Sanju Samson walks back disappointed and an end of a good first over. Samson run out (Stokes) 2(4)

Christian to Samuels, out Caught by Dhoni!! 101st dismissal for MS and he took it as cool as a cucumber. He's still one of the best keepers in the game - and this catch shows why. This was another slower short ball from Christian, Samuels made room outside leg and was looking to flay it through mid-wicket, played the shot a tad too early, got a fat top-edge. For a moment he seemed to be safe, but there was that man. MS ran backwards, kept his eyes on the ball, timed his leap well and completed a one-handed catch - with his right glove. Christian clenches his fists in delight - as much as a keeper's wicket as it was for the bowler there. Samuels c Dhoni b Christian 27(21) [4s-1 6s-2]

Washington Sundar to Corey Anderson, out Stumped!! Dhoni is confident about a stumping. When he's confident, it means he's got his man. Looks like Anderson's foot is in the air, he did well to drag back in, but couldn't get his feet down. OUT is the call. Excellent work from MS, quick hands did the trick, but that was very well bowled by Sundar as well. He slowed down the pace, dragged Anderson forward on the drive and did him in with the turn. Anderson was a long way out of the crease, he did try to drag his foot back in - but comes second best to the Indian keeper. Corey Anderson st Dhoni b Washington Sundar 3(5)

Stokes to Pat Cummins, out Bowled!! That's a terrific comeback from the England star all-rounder, he slips in the leg-stump yorker - bowled at pace as well. Cummins was making room for the shot, has to jam his bat down - too late and the leg-pole goes for a walk, first wicket of the night for Stokes and Pune continue to chip away. Pat Cummins b Stokes 11(6) [6s-1]

Stokes to Nair, out Caught by Unadkat!! Excellent catch from Unadkat - he seemed to have lost it under the lights, puts in the full-stretch dive and just about holds on. Second wicket for Stokes and Pune are finishing strong. It was a length ball from Stokes, Nair backed away on the heave, ended up getting a fat top-edge that spiralled in the air and behind Dhoni. Unadkat ran across to his left from short third man, called for the catch, seemed to have misjudged it - but held on with a dive. Nair c Unadkat b Stokes 64(45) [4s-9]

Unadkat to Shami, out Caught by Stokes!! That's a superb catch from Stokes - he hasn't just saved a six, but he has got Unadkat a wicket as well. Watches the ball all the way at the deep mid-wicket boundary, lunges behind, holds onto the overhead catch - realises that he was going over the ropes, chucks the ball back into play, crosses the ropes, comes back in and takes the catch. Coming to the ball, it was a length delivery on the stumps, Shami backed away and swung hard - looked like he had got plenty behind it - only for Stokes to spoil his party. Shami c Stokes b Unadkat 2(4)

Unadkat to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Dhoni!! Second wicket goes down and Delhi are in trouble early on. Poor shot selection from Shreyas Iyer. Flashes away from the body with no feet movement to a back of a length delivery outside off and gets a thick outside edge through to Dhoni, who won't drop those. Unadkat has his hands up in joy. Shreyas Iyer c Dhoni b Unadkat 3(4)

Zampa to Pant, out Caught by Christian!! Pant tries it again and loses his wicket. He will be disappointed with that after being batting so well for his 36. Tries to get under the ball and slog sweep. Wasn't to be. The ball came right of the toe end for Christian to settle under it wide of long-on. Pant c Christian b Zampa 36(22) [4s-4 6s-2]

Zaheer to Rahane, out Bowled!! What a ball. Cleans up Rahane. Has this man retired, Zaheer? Wowed I am. Pitches up and swings it in to find the gap between Rahane's pad and bat. For all that peach from Zaheer, Rahane too is slightly responsible there. Went for the drive and pushed the defence a bit, leaving the space for the ball to sneak in. What a start for DD! Rahane b Zaheer 0(1)

Shami to Stokes, out Caught by Corey Anderson!! Shami misses the blockhole and delivers a full toss, Stokes advances and converts it into a slightly higher full toss than he would have liked. It takes him by surprise a bit. He swings hard, it hits him high on the bat and he ends up slicing it straight down to long-off. Had he stayed his ground, would have been a much simpler ball to hit. Stokes c Corey Anderson b Shami 33(25) [4s-3 6s-2]

Pat Cummins to Dhoni, out Dhoni Run Out!! That's a very, very rare occurence. MS Dhoni caught napping is not something which happens very often. It doesn't happen at all. The slower ball deflects off Dhoni's thigh towards short fine leg, and Dhoni is just ambling across not expecting Shami to go at his end. Once Dhoni realizes the danger, he motors through and even puts in a dive, but he's caught short by a few inches or so as Shami rockets the stumps down. Big wicket. Dhoni run out (Shami) 5(5)

Shami to Christian, out Lbw!! Christian looks surprised by the decision, but that's absolutely dead in front. That's crashing into the middle of middle. Full and straight from Shami, Christian tries to lap it fine but misses and the ball crashes into his pad. Gone! Christian lbw b Shami 3(3)

Pat Cummins to Manoj Tiwary, out Bowled!! That's it. Bang into middle stump. Cummins seals it and can afford a smile. Those two sixes cranked up the pressure but the young Aussie recovered well. Manoj Tiwary b Pat Cummins 60(45) [4s-5 6s-3]

Zaheer to Tripathi, out Caught by Pant!! Loud appeal for caught behind from the keeper, given. Zaheer did not look interested at first but joined later seeing the men from behind yell their throats out. Was a back of a length delivery that went across Tripathi, who wanted to cut closer to his body. Top edges to the keeper. Tripathi c Pant b Zaheer 7(6) [4s-1]

Nadeem to Smith, out Lbw!! Smith is dejected. Cannot believe his luck. Was there some edge? It definitely hit him high on leg there. But he was on the back foot having missed this skidder from Nadeem, who pumps his fist as soon as the umpire acknowledges the lbw appeal. What a wicket. Was there a time-out before this ball? Never mind. Smith lbw b Nadeem 38(32) [4s-4 6s-1]

Rashid Khan to Dwayne Smith, out Lbw!! Gone. The Nelson has struck. A fast skidding delivery that rushes past Dwayne Smith's pull and strikes him bang in front of middle. Too quick for Smith's shot. Easy decision for the umpire. Dwayne Smith lbw b Rashid Khan 54(33) [4s-7 6s-2]

Siraj to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Naman Ojha!! Two down. The slower delivery and Ishan Kishan can only slog it high up in the air, a fat top edge, Naman Ojha calls for it and takes it with ease. Ishan Kishan c Naman Ojha b Siraj 61(40) [4s-5 6s-4]

Siraj to Raina, out Caught by Dhawan!! What a wicket that is. Two in the over for Siraj. A game-changing over? Will only know once the match is done. But certainly SRH now get a chance to come back into the game. Wasn't a great delivery, off-pace and down leg, but Raina found Dhawan at deep backward square. After taking the catch, he puts a finger to his lip and points to the crowd suggesting to keep quiet. Typical Dhawan. Raina c Dhawan b Siraj 2(5)

Rashid Khan to Karthik, out Caught by Deepak Hooda!! Wow. Wow. Three wickets in quick time and suddenly the score isn't looking that great. High full toss, was meant to be hit for six but Karthik mistimed that and looked like it was falling in front of the fielder, but Hooda came in and snaffled that low and diving forward. Rashid Khan can't contain his smile. Can't believe his luck either. DK just puts his head down in disappointment, unable to believe the shot he played. Karthik c Deepak Hooda b Rashid Khan 0(1)

Rashid Khan to Finch, out Bowled!! Atrocious batting from Finch. Utterly and truly hopeless. His side have lost three wickets inside two overs and him being so experienced, is expected to bat till the 20th over. But what does he do? Swings across the line, without picking the googly. Past his shot and into the stumps. Rashid Khan goes off on his trademark celebration. Some collapse this is. Finch b Rashid Khan 2(3)

Siraj to Faulkner, out Bowled!! Cleaned up. Full and straight, with a late tail back in. Faulkner swings to leg and can't connect. The ball clips the leg stump and Siraj punches the air in delight. Faulkner b Siraj 8(10) [4s-1]

Siraj to Sangwan, out Bowled!! Two in two. Before this ball, Siraj was talking to Bhuvi as he set the field. Whatever he spoke, he executed to perfection. Inswinger, lands on a length and goes through the bat and pad gap of Sangwan. Too big a gap and the ball finds its way through to the stumps. Siraj ends with a four-fer. What a story he has been this IPL. The whole of Old City in Hyderabad will be tucking into their biriyanis watching this. Certainly made his folks proud. Sangwan b Siraj 0(1)

S Kaul to Ankit Soni, out Bowled!! Brilliant yorker from Kaul. Late swing back in, Ankit Soni tried to squeeze it out, but the ball escaped past the bat, may have even kissed it, not too sure about that and then hit the off stump. Too good for a tailender. Ankit Soni b S Kaul 0(6)

Bhuvneshwar to P Kumar, out Bowled!! Exceptional from Bhuvneshwar. Jadeja is on his haunches at the other end. Looking disappointed. Full and swinging back in, through the attempted whip of Praveen Kumar. Rushed past the bat. I predict a first baller for Munaf too. LBW or bowled. P Kumar b Bhuvneshwar 1(2)

Bhuvneshwar to Munaf Patel, out Bowled!! You don't need to be a genius at this. Anyone can see that Munaf Patel has no chance against the swinging and pacy Bhuvneshwar. Especially at the death. Munaf Patel doesn't get in line, just stands outside leg and wafts his bat through the line. The late reverse swing takes the leg stump out and sends it out of its groove. That's clinical execution at the death. Perhaps the best exponent with the ball when bowling at the end in the world. Munaf Patel b Bhuvneshwar 0(1)

Rashid Khan to Dwayne Smith, out Lbw!! Gone. The Nelson has struck. A fast skidding delivery that rushes past Dwayne Smith's pull and strikes him bang in front of middle. Too quick for Smith's shot. Easy decision for the umpire. Dwayne Smith lbw b Rashid Khan 54(33) [4s-7 6s-2]

Siraj to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Naman Ojha!! Two down. The slower delivery and Ishan Kishan can only slog it high up in the air, a fat top edge, Naman Ojha calls for it and takes it with ease. Ishan Kishan c Naman Ojha b Siraj 61(40) [4s-5 6s-4]

Siraj to Raina, out Caught by Dhawan!! What a wicket that is. Two in the over for Siraj. A game-changing over? Will only know once the match is done. But certainly SRH now get a chance to come back into the game. Wasn't a great delivery, off-pace and down leg, but Raina found Dhawan at deep backward square. After taking the catch, he puts a finger to his lip and points to the crowd suggesting to keep quiet. Typical Dhawan. Raina c Dhawan b Siraj 2(5)

Rashid Khan to Karthik, out Caught by Deepak Hooda!! Wow. Wow. Three wickets in quick time and suddenly the score isn't looking that great. High full toss, was meant to be hit for six but Karthik mistimed that and looked like it was falling in front of the fielder, but Hooda came in and snaffled that low and diving forward. Rashid Khan can't contain his smile. Can't believe his luck either. DK just puts his head down in disappointment, unable to believe the shot he played. Karthik c Deepak Hooda b Rashid Khan 0(1)

Rashid Khan to Finch, out Bowled!! Atrocious batting from Finch. Utterly and truly hopeless. His side have lost three wickets inside two overs and him being so experienced, is expected to bat till the 20th over. But what does he do? Swings across the line, without picking the googly. Past his shot and into the stumps. Rashid Khan goes off on his trademark celebration. Some collapse this is. Finch b Rashid Khan 2(3)

Siraj to Faulkner, out Bowled!! Cleaned up. Full and straight, with a late tail back in. Faulkner swings to leg and can't connect. The ball clips the leg stump and Siraj punches the air in delight. Faulkner b Siraj 8(10) [4s-1]

Siraj to Sangwan, out Bowled!! Two in two. Before this ball, Siraj was talking to Bhuvi as he set the field. Whatever he spoke, he executed to perfection. Inswinger, lands on a length and goes through the bat and pad gap of Sangwan. Too big a gap and the ball finds its way through to the stumps. Siraj ends with a four-fer. What a story he has been this IPL. The whole of Old City in Hyderabad will be tucking into their biriyanis watching this. Certainly made his folks proud. Sangwan b Siraj 0(1)

S Kaul to Ankit Soni, out Bowled!! Brilliant yorker from Kaul. Late swing back in, Ankit Soni tried to squeeze it out, but the ball escaped past the bat, may have even kissed it, not too sure about that and then hit the off stump. Too good for a tailender. Ankit Soni b S Kaul 0(6)

Bhuvneshwar to P Kumar, out Bowled!! Exceptional from Bhuvneshwar. Jadeja is on his haunches at the other end. Looking disappointed. Full and swinging back in, through the attempted whip of Praveen Kumar. Rushed past the bat. I predict a first baller for Munaf too. LBW or bowled. P Kumar b Bhuvneshwar 1(2)

Bhuvneshwar to Munaf Patel, out Bowled!! You don't need to be a genius at this. Anyone can see that Munaf Patel has no chance against the swinging and pacy Bhuvneshwar. Especially at the death. Munaf Patel doesn't get in line, just stands outside leg and wafts his bat through the line. The late reverse swing takes the leg stump out and sends it out of its groove. That's clinical execution at the death. Perhaps the best exponent with the ball when bowling at the end in the world. Munaf Patel b Bhuvneshwar 0(1)

Southee to Narine, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! End of Narine and it is for a duck. Backed away to lift this shortish ball, which was rising, could only loft it straight up and Hardik moved to his left at extra cover to grab the skier. Not the sort of shot to be trying in the first over when the ball is bouncing. But that's how Narine plays. Mid-off left it for Hardik and that was a good pressure catch. Narine c Hardik Pandya b Southee 0(4)

Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, out Bowled!! Knocked him over and Gambhir shakes his head. Hardik Pandya is over the moon. Nipped in off the surface, de Grandhomme was late in getting his bat down and the inside edge rattled back on. That turns the game again. de Grandhomme b Hardik Pandya 29(16) [4s-4 6s-1]

Hardik Pandya to M Pandey, out Caught by (sub)J Suchith!! Huge sigh of relief. From Suchith. He flashes a smile. Is happy that he has caught this mistimed pull at deep mid-wicket. Hardik Pandya angling the short ball into Pandey and cramping the batsman for room. Replays show that he almost dropped this one as well. Just about hung on. M Pandey c (sub)J Suchith b Hardik Pandya 33(33) [4s-2]

Southee to Kuldeep Yadav, out Caught by Rayudu!! Rayudu almost threatened the umpire into raising the finger with his loud shrieks for a caught behind appeal. Poor Nand Kishore had no other option but to agree. But a clear edge on that. So well done. UltraEdge shows nothing though. But the seam changed direction after passing the bat which is an indicator. Kuldeep Yadav backed away to squeeze it out and looked like there was a clear deflection. We will never know the truth. Kuldeep Yadav c Rayudu b Southee 16(15) [4s-2]

Johnson to Gambhir, out Caught by Karn Sharma!! You can only see the Aussies and the Kiwis hugging in the IPL. Big wicket and Rohit pumps his fist in joy. A fat top edge on the pull as Gambhir was hurried by the back of a length delivery, went miles up in the air, looked a tough catch, Karn at short fine though judged it beautifully and took it the conventional way. He didn't go for the reverse cup. Johnson did Gambhir for pace. Gambhir c Karn Sharma b Johnson 21(16) [4s-3 6s-1]

Karn Sharma to Uthappa, out Caught by Rohit!! Don't know what to say about this from Uthappa. I'm speechless. Last ball of the powerplay and he has gifted his wicket away. Didn't try to take advantage early in the over, decides to do off the last ball and pays the price. Backed away to smash it over cover, just horribly mistimed it to extra cover. That's another big blow to KKR. Uthappa c Rohit b Karn Sharma 2(4)

Vinay Kumar to Chris Lynn, out Caught by (sub)J Suchith!! You don't take on the legend of Vinay Kumar and hope to get away with it. Not even if you are Chris Lynn. What a wicket that is. Could be match winning and a record ending one as well. Look at Vinay Kumar's reaction - he raises both arms in triumph and lets out a roar. Slightly short and coming in, pulled straight to deep mid-wicket. Lynn didn't get any power behind that. Chris Lynn c (sub)J Suchith b Vinay Kumar 26(14) [4s-3 6s-2]

Vinay Kumar to Y Pathan, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! The fun doesn't last long for Pathan. Gambhir wears a desolate expression on his face. Pathan was going to play only one way tonight and that's to go after everything. Huge risk associated with that strategy and this match it doesn't come off. Right off the bottom of the bat and an easy take at long-on. KKR are self-destructing at the Garden. Y Pathan c Hardik Pandya b Vinay Kumar 20(7) [6s-3]

U Yadav to Rayudu, out Saurabh Tiwary Run Out!! Tiwary and his run-out saga. Slips into this season as well. Just a drop off the toe end on the pull from Rayudu around the corner and he wants to pinch the single. Tiwary meanwhile takes a couple of steps and freezes. Umesh meanwhile runs, collects the ball and sprints away to the striker's sticks. Tiwary gives up, succumbs and walks back. Not the worst result for Mumbai though. Saurabh Tiwary run out (U Yadav) 52(43) [4s-9]

Kuldeep Yadav to Rayudu, out Stumped!! The bait does its bit. Rayudu stays true to his gallops down the ground, goes mighty with another bat swing. Just that Kuldeep this time has spotted this and has fired this wide. Very wide. In the form of the wrong 'un as well. Rayudu cannot connect - despite his best attempts to stretch out - and Robbie does the rest. Rayudu st Uthappa b Kuldeep Yadav 63(37) [4s-6 6s-3]

Boult to Pollard, out Caught by Y Pathan!! Brings about his end. In the quest of going hard after everything. Another low dipping full toss this and Pollard swings, hard abut has to do with just a toe end. Only the height, not the distance. As far as a back-pedalling cover at the edge of the circle. Not quite the assualt from Pollard tonight. Pollard c Y Pathan b Boult 13(11) [6s-1]

Boult to Simmons, out Caught by Narine!! Simmons' misery is over, never got going on this spicy pitch. This was pitched up and angled across the right-hander, Simmons was looking to go over the top, doesn't get anywhere near the middle of the bat and it's a simple grab for his West Indies teammate - Narine holds onto the dolly at mid-off and MI have lost an early wicket. Simmons c Narine b Boult 0(5)

Rajpoot to Rohit, out Lbw!! That's the curtains for Rohit and his affair with the Eden. A brave call this - quite a few doubts on the first impression but boy o boy, ump Ravi has turned around his form from the earlier goof up. A sharp in-cutter from Rajpoot, at nippy pace as well. Jags back in from a length to just about go past the bat searching for the defence and take the front pad. On top of middle shows HawkEye. Rohit lbw b Rajpoot 27(21) [4s-4 6s-1]

Unadkat to Guptill, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! Disastrous start from KXIP. Dream start for RPS. A gentle floater first-up from Unadkat, on a good length and well wide of off, Guptill went for the drive, can't keep it down and it's a simple catch for Tiwary - at short extra-cover. Delight amongst the crowd, despair for the KXIP supporters. Guptill c Manoj Tiwary b Unadkat 0(1)

Christian to Axar, out Caught by Dhoni!! Very loose. Just not what you'd expect at this stage. Teases him with a wide fuller length delivery does Christian enticing the drive. Axar cannot resist. Throws his hands out and chases it with a drive. Gets a fat outside edge in the process and this time Dhoni doesn't even have to dive. Pune are tired of their celebrations as well. Just smiles around. The 100th dismissal for Dhoni this. Axar c Dhoni b Christian 22(20) [4s-1 6s-1]

Unadkat to Swapnil Singh, out Caught by Dhoni!! Relay stuff. Executed to perfection. Dhoni adds a few more to his tally. For the first time in this over, Unadkat goes full and gives Swapnil the opportunity to swing his arms. And he cannot resist. Throws his hands out, toe ends it and Dan, at first slip reverse cups of some sort and the pop out is plucked out by the keeper. Ah, kind. Swapnil Singh c Dhoni b Unadkat 10(17)

Zampa to Ishant, out Caught by Smith!! All too easy. All too familiar. The tried and tested ploy to a tail-ender and for the umpteenth time in history, it pays off. Zampa lets out one of the floatiest of leg-breaks tossing it very wide outside the sticks. Ishant sinks on a knee, slogs it big time. It grows big on him, takes the outside half of the bat and all it finds is cover. Ishant c Smith b Zampa 1(5)

Zampa to Mohit Sharma, out Caught by Christian!! That's curtains. Mohit doesn't believe in knocking the ball around and playing out his quota of overs. Apparently. Buries down with a stoop looking to slog it out of the park. Done in the flight and the agricultural hoick manages only a miscue off the under edge to tonk high in the air. Only towards extra cover. Mohit Sharma c Christian b Zampa 6(12)

SN Thakur to Shaun Marsh, out Caught by Smith!! That's a dolly and Smith has gobbled up his Australian teammate. On a good length and angling across the left-hander, Shardul bowled this one with a scrambled seam. The ball once again looked like it stopped on the batsman - Marsh was committed on the drive, couldn't keep it down, went off the splice of the bat and spoons a simple catch to Smith at mid-off. Shaun Marsh c Smith b SN Thakur 10(13) [4s-2]

Stokes to Eoin Morgan, out Eoin Morgan Run Out!! Brilliant work from Unadkat and KXIP have lost their third wicket. Exceptional piece of fielding from the Pune pacer, attacked the ball after Morgan had pushed it in front of mid-on. It was Morgan's call and he comes second best as Unadkat is quick on the ball and makes a direct hit - even as he was sliding onto the ground. Eoin Morgan run out (Unadkat) 4(4) [4s-1]

SN Thakur to Rahul Tewatia, out Caught by Unadkat!! Unadkat is having a dream day in the field - follows up the direct hit with an acrobatic catch at short fine leg. KXIP are in doldrums now and the move to promote Tewatia up the order has failed. This was banged in short and on his body, Tewatia was late on the pull, the ball ballooned off the top-edge and lobbed behind the keeper. On another day it could have dropped down in no man's land - but not today. Unadkat moves across to his left, goes with both hands and completes a fine diving catch. Rahul Tewatia c Unadkat b SN Thakur 4(3) [4s-1]

SN Thakur to Maxwell, out Caught by Rahane!! It is going from bad to worse for KXIP, Maxwell clips one in the air and finds Rahane to perfection at deep backward square leg. Out for a duck and KXIP have lost half their side now. A nothing ball from Shardul, leg-stump half-volley, Maxwell got inside the line and clipped it firmly - he didn't bother to keep it down and found Rahane to perfection in the deep. He can't believe it as he trudges off. Maxwell c Rahane b SN Thakur 0(3)

Christian to Saha, out Caught by Dhoni!! KXIP slump into further trouble, Christian strikes in his first over. This was full and wide of off, Saha was lunging forward - he was looking to dab it down towards third man - gets a thick edge, to the right of MS. Dhoni doesn't drop it this time around, dives to his right and clutches it safely. Six wickets down and KXIP are pretty much done and dusted at the moment. Saha c Dhoni b Christian 13(17) [6s-1]

Axar to Tripathi, out Bowled!! Tripathi has to go. Outrageous attempt from him. Got a long way across to help the sweep over the infield on the on-side. Missed it completely and the ball crashed the bails. Tripathi b Axar 28(20) [4s-4 6s-1]

Avesh Khan to Samson, out Caught by Kohli!! Wicket of the second ball for Avesh Khan. Another short of length delivery that cramps Samson for room. He tries to take him on with a pull. The ball gets big on him and he splices it straight to mid-on. Kohli takes a dolly. Samson c Kohli b Avesh Khan 0(2)

Harshal Patel to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Watson!! The plan has worked. The plan to bowl short and slow to these two. Once again Shreyas Iyer fails to get the timing right. Backs away a touch to slap past cover. That's actually not a bad shot, but ends up hitting it straight to the fielder at extra cover. So straight that the man there did not have to move an inch. Shreyas Iyer c Watson b Harshal Patel 32(30) [4s-2 6s-1]

Harshal Patel to Samuels, out Bowled!! Back to back wickets for Harshal Patel. What did Samuels do there? Perhaps was not expecting the slower ball first up. But gets one, is committed on the defence and by the time tries to adjust by slightly taking the bottom hand of the handle, it is late. Crashes the off-stump. If Bangalore were looking for a window to seal things, this is the one. AAAR CEE BEE is back here. Hat-trick ball coming up. Samuels b Harshal Patel 0(1)

Head to Corey Anderson, out Stumped!! This is reckless from Corey Anderson. Just treks down to heave it across. Has no clue about where it has pitched. The ball scoots under his bat and the keeper does not have buttery gloves.. so that is the end of Anderson's IPL this year. Corey Anderson st Vishnu Vinod b Head 3(9)

Head to Pat Cummins, out Caught by Kohli!! That is a case of not realizing the importance of the wicket and attempting to send everything out of the park. Is a flighted delivery outside off and Pat Cummins tries to loft over long-off. Gets off the bottom part of the bat and the RCB captain does not have to move much at the fence. Pat Cummins c Kohli b Head 7(3) [6s-1]

Harshal Patel to Pant, out Bowled!! Harshal Patel has got the wicket that might just seal things for RCB tonight. The crowd goes mum. Slower ball on off, Pant launches into the heave. Swings the bat too early and the ball scoots under to uproot the off-stump. Harshal Patel roars and alongside him roar the millions of RCB fans who finally have a reason to celebrate. Pant b Harshal Patel 45(34) [4s-3 6s-2]

Negi to Mishra, out Bowled!! Mishra won't do it for Delhi tonight. Cannot resist his tailender skills and attempts one shot too many. Steps down and makes room, only a littl though, and misses the lofted drive and the ball clatters his stumps. Mishra b Negi 7(4) [6s-1]

Negi to Shami, out Stumped!! Stumping appeal, this looks close. Has he stepped out? Front foot is fine. His back foot is out but has he got it back in time? Zoomer comes in. Looks out to me, not sure about the man upstairs. He wants to check all the angles. Might just be in the air. Out that is and the roar tells me Kotla has shifted to Bangalore. Shami wanted to swing this one out of the park after stepping down, Negi's darter was too good to be meted with that kind of a treatment. Shami st Vishnu Vinod b Negi 21(9) [4s-3 6s-1][/b]
Negi to Nadeem, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! Slogs across the line and finds the man at deep square leg. Bangalore end their 2017 IPL campaign with a 10-run win. Nadeem c Kedar Jadhav b Negi 2(6)

Watson to Nair, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! Nair perishes. One shot too many. Shane Watson digs it in short. The ball didn't get up as much as he wanted it to. Hurries onto Nair's pull and all he manages to do is to miscue it to mid-wicket. An easy catch for Kedar Jadhav. Nair c Kedar Jadhav b Watson 26(22) [4s-5]

Nadeem to Gayle, out Caught by Zaheer!! Yes, the break does its job. The leg-spinner from Nadeem, spinning the other way and Gayle's committed slog-sweep has him holing out. The air on this one makes him lose his timing as well with the ball only managing the toe-end as he swings it down the throat of mid-wicket. Delhi needed this big time, pouching Gayle just when he was about to explode. Gayle c Zaheer b Nadeem 48(38) [4s-3 6s-3]

Zaheer to Kohli, out Head Run Out!! 1 run completed. Matters taken upstairs. Some confusion while wanting the second run and Head sacrifices his head for his skipper. Is forced to run back and even a wide throw gives Zaheer enough time to grab and catch him short. RCB lose another. Was a walking flick through mid-wicket and Kohli always wanted the second. The only problem - there never was two there. Head bears the brunt. Head run out (Shreyas Iyer/Zaheer) 2(2)

Zaheer to Kohli, out Caught by Nadeem!! Holes out before the final finish as well. That's the end with the bat for Kohli this season. After a favour of a full toss from Zak, he decides to return the favour. Another slower one on the driving length and the lofted drive through the off-side has the bat turning in his palms as he balloons it to long-off. Kohli is angry, no he is furious. Takes out the anger on himself slapping his legs with his bat. Kohli c Nadeem b Zaheer 58(45) [4s-3 6s-3]

Shami to Kedar Jadhav, out Kedar Jadhav Run Out!! Freaky. Oh absolutely. When Shami doesn't get a wicket off a pin-point accurate yorker, the Gods align themselves to get a run-out. Right on the base of middle and Jadhav just about digs it away somehow to short third man. Cummins out there, gathers and catches Jadhav in a lazy mood to finish the run. Has a shy at the bowler's end and Shami mid-way gets his hands out of the way. Not before giving it a faint tickle and directing it onto the stumps. Kedar Jadhav run out (Pat Cummins) 12(9) [6s-1]

Pat Cummins to Sachin Baby, out Caught by Corey Anderson!! A miscue. Plucked just inside the ropes. Gets a length delivery and unleashes a violent swing of the blade. Slices it high but not beyond the reach of Corey, who positions himself right at the edge of the ropes at long-on, and collects it without breaking into a sweat. Reverse cupped too. Talk of swagger. Sachin Baby c Corey Anderson b Pat Cummins 12(8) [4s-2]

Pat Cummins to Vishnu Vinod, out Bowled!! Cummins has made a mess of Vinod's stumps. This was pitched on a good length and held its line outside off, Vinod was in no position on the pull - went through with the shot and looked real ugly on replays, gets an inside edge and the ball clatters into the middle-stump. RCB have lost an early wicket once again. Vishnu Vinod b Pat Cummins 3(9)

Lockie Ferguson to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Christian!! Look at Lockie Ferguson chuckle. He thinks it's too easy. Goes wide of the crease and angles a ball in, enticing Hardik Pandya into a punch. And one he plays, just that he does it uppishly, and early, with this 139ks ball sticking in the pitch. Straight to long-on, who reverse-cups it. And now you know why Lockie Ferguson was smiling. Hardik Pandya c Christian b Lockie Ferguson 14(10) [4s-1 6s-1]

SN Thakur to McClenaghan, out Caught by Unadkat!! Cutting away, this slower full ball, and lobs off the cue-end to short third man. McClenaghan wanted to go big downtown but hey, this is Mumbai, with its pace all sold off to neighbouring pitches, you feel. McClenaghan c Unadkat b SN Thakur 12(11) [6s-1]

SN Thakur to Parthiv Patel, out Simmons Run Out!! Oh, unlucky! Knuckle ball straight at the stumps, PP hits it back the bowler who manages to get some finger after stretching his right hand, it bounces and knocks the bails before crashing into the stumps. Simmons was backing up too far and was caught napping. Wasn't even in the frame. Simmons run out (SN Thakur) 5(13)

Washington Sundar to Rohit, out Lbw!! Ah! Rohit Sharma and his struggles against spinners this season. Oh wait! There seems to have a big inside edge. Yes there is. Gets down low to sweep Washington Sundar past square leg, edged and onto the pads. Looked close to the naked eye, just that the umpire didn't pick the edge. Rohit Sharma walks back disappointed. Rohit lbw b Washington Sundar 1(2)

Washington Sundar to Rayudu, out Caught by Smith!! Gone without scoring. No heroics from Rayudu tonight. He takes on a short ball, but doesn't get his timing right on the pull, hits the top-half and Smithy takes a sharp catch diving forward at short mid-wicket. Rayudu c Smith b Washington Sundar 0(3)

Washington Sundar to Pollard, out Caught by Smith!! That's a poor shot, real horror of a shot. Very very lazy from KP. Steve Smith Stationed himself at short mid-wicket lurking for an opportunity, he was waiting for that brain-fade moment from the big man. And it didn't take long. A languid flick, no real intent on the shot, just playing it in more of hope. It went flat and low to the right of Smudge who had it covered with his bucket hands. Pollard c Smith b Washington Sundar 7(10) [4s-1]

McClenaghan to Tripathi, out Bowled!! The full swinging in delivery does the trick. That was pitched up and the batsman trying to play across the line of the ball, misses and is cleaned up. Tripathi is gone for a blob and Mumbai have jolted RPS early. McClenaghan takes off as his joy knows no bounds. Tripathi b McClenaghan 0(2)
Malinga to Smith, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Malinga strikes now. Smith c Hardik Pandya b Malinga 1(2)

Karn Sharma to Rahane, out Lbw!! The partnership is broken and Rahane is dismissed. It's the googly from Karn Sharma. Rahane looks to work it through the on-side, but fails to make connection as the ball sneaked past the inside edge. Pitched outside off, impact on off, hitting off and middle, confirms HawkEye. Loud cheers, not for the wicket. MS is walking in. Rahane lbw b Karn Sharma 56(43) [4s-5 6s-1]

Bumrah to Dhoni, out Manoj Tiwary Run Out!! Two dot balls to end the over. Still 15 off it. Another pinpoint yorker, Dhoni squirts it out to the bowler. Manoj Tiwary is a long way down backing up. Bumrah easily removes the bails. Manoj Tiwary run out (Bumrah) 58(48) [4s-4 6s-2]

Coulter-Nile to Williamson, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! The ploy to bring in NCN has worked. He has been superb at the death, but GG needed a wicket here. Fullish length delivery outside off, Williamson doesn't get underneath it and goes hard on his lofted extra drive. Finds extra cover to perfection. Williamson c Suryakumar Yadav b Coulter-Nile 24(26) [4s-2 6s-1]

Chawla to Warner, out Bowled!! Two big wickets within a span of three balls. This will hurt the defending champions. Piyush Chawla gets the big fish. Warner probably misjudged the length. Did that keep low? Not sure. It was a slider from a good length, Warner went back to pull it away. Misses it by a long way and the ball crashes the middle stump. Gauti is animated in his celebration. Warner b Chawla 37(35) [4s-2 6s-2]

U Yadav to Yuvraj, out Caught by Chawla!! In the air and taken. Yuvraj has to depart. The short ball does the trick. Goes for the pull shot, doesn't time it as well as he would have liked it to. Finds deep square leg, who gobbles it up. Umesh Yadav is delighted. Yuvraj c Chawla b U Yadav 9(9) [4s-2]

Coulter-Nile to Vijay Shankar, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Wicket off the first ball of the over and Shankar has to take the long walk back. Shortish ball from NCN, Shankar comes forward and looks to go downtown. Ends up slicing it miles up in the air. Yadav, at long-on takes it calmly. Vijay Shankar c Suryakumar Yadav b Coulter-Nile 22(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

Coulter-Nile to Jordan, out Caught&Bowled!! Another one bites the dust. Three wickets in four balls for Coulter-Nile. The ball stuck a bit on the surface. It was a shortish delivery, Jordan is a bit early to close his bat face. The leading edge flies to the left of the bowler, who times his dive to his left to perfection. A terrific catch in his followthrough. Jordan c and b Coulter-Nile 0(1)

Boult to Naman Ojha, out Caught by Chris Lynn!! The off-pace delivery from a goodish length, Ojha wants to hoick it across the line, gets a fat outside edge that goes straight into the palms of Lynn at short third man. Naman Ojha c Chris Lynn b Boult 16(16) [6s-1]

U Yadav to Dhawan, out Caught by Uthappa!! There you go. I have called it. Umesh Yadav has good memories the last time he played here. Got a 3-fer I reckon. Hits the deck hard and gets good bounce which keeps rising en route to Dhawan, he looks to loft high over the infield, but he has mistimed it big time. Uthappa calls for it, steadies himself with a forward dive to complete the catch. Dhawan c Uthappa b U Yadav 11(13) [4s-1]

Coulter-Nile to Williamson, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! The ploy to bring in NCN has worked. He has been superb at the death, but GG needed a wicket here. Fullish length delivery outside off, Williamson doesn't get underneath it and goes hard on his lofted extra drive. Finds extra cover to perfection. Williamson c Suryakumar Yadav b Coulter-Nile 24(26) [4s-2 6s-1]

Chawla to Warner, out Bowled!! Two big wickets within a span of three balls. This will hurt the defending champions. Piyush Chawla gets the big fish. Warner probably misjudged the length. Did that keep low? Not sure. It was a slider from a good length, Warner went back to pull it away. Misses it by a long way and the ball crashes the middle stump. Gauti is animated in his celebration. Warner b Chawla 37(35) [4s-2 6s-2]

U Yadav to Yuvraj, out Caught by Chawla!! In the air and taken. Yuvraj has to depart. The short ball does the trick. Goes for the pull shot, doesn't time it as well as he would have liked it to. Finds deep square leg, who gobbles it up. Umesh Yadav is delighted. Yuvraj c Chawla b U Yadav 9(9) [4s-2]

Coulter-Nile to Vijay Shankar, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Wicket off the first ball of the over and Shankar has to take the long walk back. Shortish ball from NCN, Shankar comes forward and looks to go downtown. Ends up slicing it miles up in the air. Yadav, at long-on takes it calmly. Vijay Shankar c Suryakumar Yadav b Coulter-Nile 22(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

Coulter-Nile to Jordan, out Caught&Bowled!! Another one bites the dust. Three wickets in four balls for Coulter-Nile. The ball stuck a bit on the surface. It was a shortish delivery, Jordan is a bit early to close his bat face. The leading edge flies to the left of the bowler, who times his dive to his left to perfection. A terrific catch in his followthrough. Jordan c and b Coulter-Nile 0(1)

Boult to Naman Ojha, out Caught by Chris Lynn!! The off-pace delivery from a goodish length, Ojha wants to hoick it across the line, gets a fat outside edge that goes straight into the palms of Lynn at short third man. Naman Ojha c Chris Lynn b Boult 16(16) [6s-1]

U Yadav to Dhawan, out Caught by Uthappa!! There you go. I have called it. Umesh Yadav has good memories the last time he played here. Got a 3-fer I reckon. Hits the deck hard and gets good bounce which keeps rising en route to Dhawan, he looks to loft high over the infield, but he has mistimed it big time. Uthappa calls for it, steadies himself with a forward dive to complete the catch. Dhawan c Uthappa b U Yadav 11(13) [4s-1]

Bumrah to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Pollard!! This is a big wicket -- make no mistake about it. Bumrah was bowling from over the wicket, angles this in to cut the room on this preempted hoick over mid-wicket from Lynn. There's no arm-swinging space in front, the ball skids on to make it worse and Lynn holes out to the fielder at long-on, something Kevin Pietersen is ecstatic about on air. Chris Lynn c Pollard b Bumrah 4(8)

Karn Sharma to Jaggi, out Caught by Johnson!! The end of the rebuilding. Courtesy a stunner in the deep. And some greedy batting to go with it. Karn after a few carters doesn't really mind floating it up and he does it again. Entices Jaggi into some feet dancing. Is obliged with the same. Just that in the process he gets too close to the pitch of the delivery and the tonk-slog attempted grabs only the toe-end of the blade to fly towards long-on. A jump, an arm raise and a reverse cup - as clean as a whistle executed by the man who claims to be 35. The best Karn Sharma figures in the IPL. A time-out with that. Jaggi c Johnson b Karn Sharma 28(31) [4s-3]

Johnson to Chawla, out Caught by Rayudu!! Ends a troubled stay. Without getting his timing right, Chawla tries an uppish loft. Doesn't bother moving his feet though. Doesn't bother reaching out as well. Doesn't even bother to read the slower one. Stands, swings, toe-ends and mid-off does the rest. Kolkata innings falling apart. More to their own self-ignition. Chawla c Rayudu b Johnson 2(6)

Johnson to Coulter-Nile, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Howrah bridge is falling down. Without repair. After the softening blow, Johnson goes for his ideal sucker delivery. Full, slowed up and Coulter-Nile once again looks to use the pace with his lofted slog. Nope, none of it coming this time. Flies off the cue-end down the throat of deep mid-wicket. Coulter-Nile c Hardik Pandya b Johnson 6(4) [6s-1]

Bumrah to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Malinga!! Talk of dreamy bowling figures. 3 wickets, 2 runs. This is a T20 mind you. And a qualifier too. Bumrah helps himself to a few free ones. Bangs it in short, Yadav wants to pull it into the river. The sluggish pitch makes him wait and then spits the ball up too. Just the top edge but Malinga swirls all under it at long leg, almost messes it up and then dives to bring about a massive smile on his face. Suryakumar Yadav c Malinga b Bumrah 31(25) [4s-2 6s-1]

Malinga to Rajpoot, out Bowled!! Three slower death rattles - Rajpoot hoodwinks the first two. But the third one lights up Chinnaswamy. Whoa, talk of the ball dipping. Gets it straight on the stumps this time does Malinga, gets it slow and right on the base. Nothing that can be done with it but play all around it and Kolkata come to a grinding halt. Rajpoot b Malinga 4(7) [4s-1]

Karn Sharma to Narine, out Stumped!! Hoodwinked by the wrong 'un. No heroics from Narine then, who stormed to IPL's fastest fifty at this very ground in the league stage. Shimmies out ambitiously but Karn Sharma's bowling in the powerplay for a reason. Sees him doing that, bowls a tossed-up googly and gets him stumped. Easy take for the keeper and a disparaging flick of the bails. Narine st Parthiv Patel b Karn Sharma 10(10) [6s-1]

Bumrah to Uthappa, out Lbw!! 144ks inducker nails him in front. Gets the ball to skid on after bowling the last ball a tad slower, and hurries him into a surprise. Nipped back in and rapped the pad above the knee-roll, but since Uthappa was caught so deep in the crease - having read neither the line, length or the pace - he looks plumb. Umpire thinks for a few seconds and raises his finger. Ball tracking: shows it clipping the top of leg-stump. Uthappa lbw b Bumrah 1(3)

Karn Sharma to Gambhir, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Now he's set him up beautifully. Fired the last one flatter and quicker, and bowls this loopier. Gambhir, to his credit, looked to have middled it - well, it sounded like that - but he finds the deep mid-wicket fielder like how you would when things aren't going your way. A struggle of an innings, coming on the day KKR least required it. Where from here for KKR? Gambhir c Hardik Pandya b Karn Sharma 12(15) [4s-2]

Karn Sharma to de Grandhomme, out Lbw!! This is anticlimactically entertaining. Didn't read the googly at all. Was bowled flat and straight on off, the ball cut in and pinned de Grandhomme in front. He had no clue. Was making room and the ball skid on to pin the back pad. What a good selection he's turning out to be. Big game, so there was every temptation to go for Harbhajan but Rohit persisted with him and see what he's done. Third wicket for just 8 runs. And he has two overs left for goodness sake. de Grandhomme lbw b Karn Sharma 0(1)

Bumrah to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Pollard!! This is a big wicket -- make no mistake about it. Bumrah was bowling from over the wicket, angles this in to cut the room on this preempted hoick over mid-wicket from Lynn. There's no arm-swinging space in front, the ball skids on to make it worse and Lynn holes out to the fielder at long-on, something Kevin Pietersen is ecstatic about on air. Chris Lynn c Pollard b Bumrah 4(8)

Jaggi c Johnson b Karn Sharma 28(31) [4s-3]

Chawla c Rayudu b Johnson 2(6)

Coulter-Nile c Hardik Pandya b Johnson 6(4) [6s-1]

Rajpoot b Malinga 4(7) [4s-1]

Umpire thinks for a few seconds and raises his finger. Ball tracking: shows it clipping the top of leg-stump. Uthappa lbw b Bumrah 1(3)

Gambhir, to his credit, looked to have middled it - well, it sounded like that - but he finds the deep mid-wicket fielder like how you would when things aren't going your way. A struggle of an innings, coming on the day KKR least required it. Where from here for KKR? Gambhir c Hardik Pandya b Karn Sharma 12(15) [4s-2]

He had no clue. Was making room and the ball skid on to pin the back pad. What a good selection he's turning out to be. Big game, so there was every temptation to go for Harbhajan but Rohit persisted with him and see what he's done. Third wicket for just 8 runs. And he has two overs left for goodness sake. de Grandhomme lbw b Karn Sharma 0(1)

Zampa to Rohit, out Caught by SN Thakur!! What a moment in the game. Look at the celebrations in the RPS camp. They reckon they've pocketed the game. Rohit is livid with himself. Swings his bat hard in disappointment. He knows that he's hit a long hop to the fielder. Short and on the stumps, Rohit went back, lost balance while playing the pull shot, didn't middle it, Thakur jumped at deep mid-wicket and took the catch. The momentum was taking him back, took a couple of steps back, just managed to stay away from the rope and the third impire was convinced he didn't touch the boundary. Rohit c SN Thakur b Zampa 24(22) [4s-4]

Zampa to Pollard, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! Is there MS Dhoni's mind behind this dismissal? CSK fans would know. In 2010, he had a straightish mid-off to dismiss the dangerous Pollard in the final. Now RPS got a very straight long-off - a field placement you normally don't see in cricket - and Pollard hits it straight to him. This was full and in the slot from Zampa, Pollard was in the mood to murder the ball, he went hard, hit it flat and hard, but little did he know that he fell in the trap. It's 65 for 5 now. Pollard c Manoj Tiwary b Zampa 7(3) [6s-1]

Christian to Hardik Pandya, out Lbw!! People were talking about slower balls, spinners doing the damage, but this bloke has run in, bowled fast and found reverse swing to trap Hardik plumb in front. A great choice of delivery with Hardik walking across the stumps. Credit to the bowler if it was a deliberate ploy to opt for the full pace delivery. This was on a good length, tailed back in, batsman played across the line and the impact was right in front of middle stump. Would have at least clipped the top of middle and off. Hardik Pandya lbw b Christian 10(9) [6s-1]

SN Thakur to Karn Sharma, out Karn Sharma Run Out!! Dropped, but Karn Sharma is run-out. An absolute pandemonium out there. Who would have thought that a team that played so well and topped the league stage would find themselves at 79 for 7 in the 15th over of the final. And that too after opting to bat first. Rohit Sharma can't watch from the sidelines. Coming to the delivery, this one swung away from the left-hander, Karn got a thick outside edge which went low to Christian's left at first slip. He couldn't hold on, meanwhile Karn thought of stealing a run, his partner wasn't sure and in the end he was stranded in the middle of the pitch. Great presence of mind from the bowler to run towards the striker's end and effect the run-out. Karn Sharma run out (Christian/SN Thakur) 1(5)

Unadkat to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by SN Thakur!! The early pressure has resulted in the fall of Parthiv. This was a back of a length delivery on the stumps, it was the slower one as well. Parthiv was in no position on the pull, went high off the bat and lobbed towards Shardul at mid-on. He runs forward and accepts the catch gleefully. Just the start RPS wanted - they have been on the dot and created the pressure on the batsmen. Parthiv Patel c SN Thakur b Unadkat 4(6)

Unadkat to Simmons, out Caught&Bowled!! 'Phenomenal catch', says Matthew Hayden on air. That's a catch that might well tilt this final towards RPS. Unadkat is having a ball at the moment, this was another slower ball, he rolled his fingers across the seam. Simmons was looking to nudge it towards the on-side, was through with the shot even before it arrived, gets a thick leading edge that popped back towards the bowler. Unadkat was on his followthrough, pushes his left hand across - it was dropping down on him, he bends down really low and completes a fine one-handed catch. The momentum was always going across him, but he held on - even as his elbow hit the ground. Mobbed by his mates, rightly so. Simmons c and b Unadkat 3(8)

Christian to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Rahane!! No such luck for Pandya. The short ball is banged in slow. The batsman tried to fetch it from outside off and only manages to sky it up in the air. The man from deep mid - Rahane charges in and takes it easily. Pune need 130 to win! Krunal Pandya c Rahane b Christian 47(38) [4s-3 6s-2]

Lockie Ferguson to Rayudu, out Rayudu Run Out!! Excellent cricket from the RPS captain and MI have lost their third wicket. Coming to the ball, it was full and just outside off, Rayudu came down the track, made room and drove it towards mid-off. There was a single there - at least Rayudu thought as he called for a quick single. Smith moved across to his left, turned around and broke the stumps at the bowler's end - all in one motion. Rayudu was scrambling across, but falls well short. Rayudu run out (Smith) 12(15) [4s-1]

Zampa to Rohit, out Caught by SN Thakur!! What a moment in the game. Look at the celebrations in the RPS camp. They reckon they've pocketed the game. Rohit is livid with himself. Swings his bat hard in disappointment. He knows that he's hit a long hop to the fielder. Short and on the stumps, Rohit went back, lost balance while playing the pull shot, didn't middle it, Thakur jumped at deep mid-wicket and took the catch. The momentum was taking him back, took a couple of steps back, just managed to stay away from the rope and the third impire was convinced he didn't touch the boundary. Rohit c SN Thakur b Zampa 24(22) [4s-4]

Zampa to Pollard, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! Is there MS Dhoni's mind behind this dismissal? CSK fans would know. In 2010, he had a straightish mid-off to dismiss the dangerous Pollard in the final. Now RPS got a very straight long-off - a field placement you normally don't see in cricket - and Pollard hits it straight to him. This was full and in the slot from Zampa, Pollard was in the mood to murder the ball, he went hard, hit it flat and hard, but little did he know that he fell in the trap. It's 65 for 5 now. Pollard c Manoj Tiwary b Zampa 7(3) [6s-1]

Christian to Hardik Pandya, out Lbw!! People were talking about slower balls, spinners doing the damage, but this bloke has run in, bowled fast and found reverse swing to trap Hardik plumb in front. A great choice of delivery with Hardik walking across the stumps. Credit to the bowler if it was a deliberate ploy to opt for the full pace delivery. This was on a good length, tailed back in, batsman played across the line and the impact was right in front of middle stump. Would have at least clipped the top of middle and off. Hardik Pandya lbw b Christian 10(9) [6s-1]

SN Thakur to Karn Sharma, out Karn Sharma Run Out!! Dropped, but Karn Sharma is run-out. An absolute pandemonium out there. Who would have thought that a team that played so well and topped the league stage would find themselves at 79 for 7 in the 15th over of the final. And that too after opting to bat first. Rohit Sharma can't watch from the sidelines. Coming to the delivery, this one swung away from the left-hander, Karn got a thick outside edge which went low to Christian's left at first slip. He couldn't hold on, meanwhile Karn thought of stealing a run, his partner wasn't sure and in the end he was stranded in the middle of the pitch. Great presence of mind from the bowler to run towards the striker's end and effect the run-out. Karn Sharma run out (Christian/SN Thakur) 1(5)

Unadkat to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by SN Thakur!! The early pressure has resulted in the fall of Parthiv. This was a back of a length delivery on the stumps, it was the slower one as well. Parthiv was in no position on the pull, went high off the bat and lobbed towards Shardul at mid-on. He runs forward and accepts the catch gleefully. Just the start RPS wanted - they have been on the dot and created the pressure on the batsmen. Parthiv Patel c SN Thakur b Unadkat 4(6)

Unadkat to Simmons, out Caught&Bowled!! 'Phenomenal catch', says Matthew Hayden on air. That's a catch that might well tilt this final towards RPS. Unadkat is having a ball at the moment, this was another slower ball, he rolled his fingers across the seam. Simmons was looking to nudge it towards the on-side, was through with the shot even before it arrived, gets a thick leading edge that popped back towards the bowler. Unadkat was on his followthrough, pushes his left hand across - it was dropping down on him, he bends down really low and completes a fine one-handed catch. The momentum was always going across him, but he held on - even as his elbow hit the ground. Mobbed by his mates, rightly so. Simmons c and b Unadkat 3(8)

Christian to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Rahane!! No such luck for Pandya. The short ball is banged in slow. The batsman tried to fetch it from outside off and only manages to sky it up in the air. The man from deep mid - Rahane charges in and takes it easily. Pune need 130 to win! Krunal Pandya c Rahane b Christian 47(38) [4s-3 6s-2]

Lockie Ferguson to Rayudu, out Rayudu Run Out!! Excellent cricket from the RPS captain and MI have lost their third wicket. Coming to the ball, it was full and just outside off, Rayudu came down the track, made room and drove it towards mid-off. There was a single there - at least Rayudu thought as he called for a quick single. Smith moved across to his left, turned around and broke the stumps at the bowler's end - all in one motion. Rayudu was scrambling across, but falls well short. Rayudu run out (Smith) 12(15) [4s-1]

Mustafizur to Jadeja, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Mustafizur is too clever for Jadeja here. He saw him coming down and bowled this cutter pretty wide. Jadeja still throws his bat at it, only managing to lob it off the toe-end. No troubles for Surya at mid-off. You never say never, but it would take something sensational for CSK to turn this around. Jadeja c Suryakumar Yadav b Mustafizur 12(13) [4s-1]

Markande to Chahar, out Stumped!! Oh dear. It's easy to be critical of players sometimes, but what was Chahar thinking here. First ball against a bowler who's bowling so well, he comes galloping down for an ugly slog. Completely done in by the length as this googly slips through the inside edge for an easy stumping. Chahar st Ishan Kishan b Markande 0(1)

McClenaghan to Harbhajan, out Caught by Bumrah!! Strange shot from Harbhajan, almost waving this short ball down to third man. Probably he got a bit too cramped for room, so he couldn't go through with this upper cut. Nothing shot in the end, just gliding it down the fielder's throat. Bravo has started well at the other end, but he's now in danger of running out of partners. Harbhajan c Bumrah b McClenaghan 8(5) [4s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Mark Wood, out Caught by Mustafizur!! Oh boy, how lucky is Pandya! Filthy drag-down on leg-stump, but instead of hitting it into Churchgate station, Wood hits it straight down fine leg's throat. Pandya is struggling though as he immediately bends over in evident pain. Absolutely no joy on his face for the wicket. Mark Wood c Mustafizur b Hardik Pandya 1(3)

Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught by Rohit!! A 20-run over from Bumrah has been redeemed right at the end. Bravo's gone. But has the damage been done? Short ball, Bravo swings hard but slices it up to extra-cover. Seven needed from six. Get ready to lose your mind. Dwayne Bravo c Rohit b Bumrah 68(30) [4s-3 6s-7]

Hardik Pandya to Watson, out Caught by Lewis!! Watson holes out in the deep. The slower ball does the trick. It was bowled at 120kph and Watson didn't pick that. Covered the line and moved across to flick. Plays a touch too early and that leads to his downfall. Off the lower protion of the bat. The ball settles straight into the hands of Lewis at long leg. Straightforward catch. Mumbai have the breakthrough! Watson c Lewis b Hardik Pandya 16(14) [4s-1 6s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Raina, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! The Pandya brothers have scalped Raina here. Normal-paced hit-the-deck-hard back of a length delivery from Hardik. Raina backwed away and wanted to go over the in-field, with this being the last ball of the powerplay. Mistimes it off the top poetion of the bat and finds mid-on. Krunal takes a step back and grabs it over his head. Raina c Krunal Pandya b Hardik Pandya 4(6)

Markande to Rayudu, out Lbw!! Two dots and Rayudu is trapped lbw. He has a chat with his partner and takes the right call - doesn't review. What a start for Mayank Markande! After two leg-breaks, he bowls a googly and gets a wicket off the third ball in his IPL career. A premeditated shot attempted by Rayudu. Got down on his knee and tried to play the booming sweep shot. Missed and got hit on the back thigh in front of middle. That's plumb. Rayudu lbw b Markande 22(19) [4s-4]

Markande to Dhoni, out Lbw!! Dhoni doesn't spot the googly and pinned in front of middle. Chris Gaffaney shakes his head in denial. That looked plumb. Mumbai Indians review. Fair delivery. Nothing on the UltraEdge. Three reds and Dhoni is gone for a single digit score. Markande is having a ball here at the Wankhede. Second wicket for him with the wrong 'un. Should have been three. The quickish googly and Dhoni wasn't commited - either on the front foot or on the back foot. Didn't pick it at all and got beaten on the inside edge by a fair margin. The impact was on the back leg adjacent to off and middle. Can't get more plumb than that. Dhoni lbw b Markande 5(5)

Watson to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Harbhajan!! Second wicket for Watto and a much-needed one for CSK. Watson doesn't deviate from his tried and tested ploy which is to dig it short at a subtle, slower pace, Suryakumar Yadav falls into the trap and mistimes the pull into the mitts of Bhajji at long leg. A set trap this and Suryakumar Yadav departs after an entertaining knock. Suryakumar Yadav c Harbhajan b Watson 43(29) [4s-6 6s-1]

Tahir to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Mark Wood!! Aimless swing at the ball and the result? Caught at short third man. Walks across, gets down on one knee and swings hard at a googly, always a risk playing against the turn and thus, the top-edge lands as a dolly in the hands of the Durham lad. Ishan Kishan c Mark Wood b Tahir 40(29) [4s-4 6s-1]

Chahar to Lewis, out Lbw!! A duck on his IPL debut for Lewis, but he wants a review. It's for a LBW call, umpire Gaffaney was quick to raise his finger, it's a fair delivery, the ball swung back in and thudded into Lewis's pads, he fell over on the flick and missed. Ultraedge confirms that there's no bat. Hawk-Eye in and it's umpire's call on hitting. Stays with the original decision and Lewis is OUT. A piece of history created in the IPL, Lewis becomes the first player to use DRS. This was full and swung back into the left-hander, Lewis fell across on the flick and missed, Chahar was on all fours as he turned back in appeal, the impact was in front of middle and leg, the ball was skimming the outer half of leg-stump. Good enough for the decision to stand. Lewis lbw b Chahar 0(2)

Watson to Rohit, out Caught by Rayudu!! This was coming, Rohit never looked at home and he's sent packing, huge blow for the Mumbai Indians, they have been rocked early in their fortress. On a good length and a hint of shape away from the right-hander, Rohit was looking to clout it over mid-wicket, doesn't cover for the movement, gets a thick top-edge, high and towards backward point. Rayudu - his partner until last season, calls for the high catch, keeps his cool and holds onto it. Dream start for the Super KIngs on their return from wilderness. Rohit c Rayudu b Watson 15(18) [4s-1 6s-1]

Mohit Sharma to Vijay Shankar, out Caught by Axar!! In the air.....gone! Went miles up in the air but unfortunately for Shankar, he hasn't got the distance on this one. It was banged in short by Mohit and Shankar went for the pull. Struck him high on the blade and flew towards deep mid-wicket where Axar settled under the skier. Easy catch. Shankar was trying to force the pace a bit but just couldn't execute the stroke well. Vijay Shankar c Axar b Mohit Sharma 13(13)

Mujeeb to Pant, out Caught by Andrew Tye!! Mujeeb has his revenge! Must say this was an ugly stroke from Pant, lost his shape completely on the slog after using his feet. It was looped up nicely and was the one that spun across him, too much to do for the southpaw and all he managed to do was slice it high towards extra cover. What about the catch though? Tye had to backtrack with his back to the ball but judged it beautifully and timed the slide really well. Massive wicket for KXIP. Pant was looking deadly. Pant c Andrew Tye b Mujeeb 28(13) [4s-4 6s-1]

Andrew Tye to Rahul Tewatia, out Gambhir Run Out!! Brilliance from Mujeeb! Direct hits are always dangerous and it's proven this time. Slower ball on leg, Tye got away with this delivery as fine leg was up in the ring. Mujeeb was quick to attack the ball and threw down the stumps at the keeper's end in a flash. Initially seemed like Gambhir made it but he was just short. These direct hits I tell you. This Afghan lad is a champion, isn't he? What a debut! Gambhir run out (Mujeeb) 55(42) [4s-5 6s-1]

Ashwin to Rahul Tewatia, out Lbw!! Another reverse sweep dismissal! Tewatia started his innings with a similar one but this time, like Munro earlier in the afternoon, misses it to be trapped LBW. Tewatia tries to repeat the stroke but ends up losing his balance and is all over the place as he gets pinged before the stumps. Looked dead plumb. Probably didn't pick the leg break at all. KXIP chipping away at the wickets here at the back end. DD need a strong finish. Rahul Tewatia lbw b Ashwin 9(7) [4s-1]

Mujeeb to Munro, out Lbw!! There's that early wicket that Mujeeb is so used to. Takes three balls to take his first wicket in IPL. Munro preempts the reverse-sweep but loses his balance altogether in doing so. Mujeeb ripped the ball a little extra with his index finger, meaning the ball was drifting in and gaining pace off the deck. Skids on and pins Munro on the thigh. Munro lbw b Mujeeb 4(6)

Mohit Sharma to Christian, out Bowled!! Kaboom! Who says the yorker has gone out of fashion? It never has and it never will. Lovely yorker from Mohit, on the base of off stump and Christian was making room to slam it through cover. Too good a nut for him and he fails to get his bat down in time. Timber it is! DD finish on 166/7. Is it enough? Christian b Mohit Sharma 13(13) [6s-1]

Axar to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Rahul!! Gone. Hit a six earlier in the over and now perishes in trying to drive along the ground. That's modern cricket in a nutshell. A bit of drift away from the batsman, which is why Shreyas Iyer stretched his front foot right across, but a bit of spin did him in. Something that you didn't expect out of Axar but he's produced it. Shreyas Iyer c Rahul b Axar 11(11) [6s-1]

Mohit Sharma to Vijay Shankar, out Caught by Axar!! In the air.....gone! Went miles up in the air but unfortunately for Shankar, he hasn't got the distance on this one. It was banged in short by Mohit and Shankar went for the pull. Struck him high on the blade and flew towards deep mid-wicket where Axar settled under the skier. Easy catch. Shankar was trying to force the pace a bit but just couldn't execute the stroke well. Vijay Shankar c Axar b Mohit Sharma 13(13)

Mujeeb to Pant, out Caught by Andrew Tye!! Mujeeb has his revenge! Must say this was an ugly stroke from Pant, lost his shape completely on the slog after using his feet. It was looped up nicely and was the one that spun across him, too much to do for the southpaw and all he managed to do was slice it high towards extra cover. What about the catch though? Tye had to backtrack with his back to the ball but judged it beautifully and timed the slide really well. Massive wicket for KXIP. Pant was looking deadly. Pant c Andrew Tye b Mujeeb 28(13) [4s-4 6s-1]

Andrew Tye to Rahul Tewatia, out Gambhir Run Out!! Brilliance from Mujeeb! Direct hits are always dangerous and it's proven this time. Slower ball on leg, Tye got away with this delivery as fine leg was up in the ring. Mujeeb was quick to attack the ball and threw down the stumps at the keeper's end in a flash. Initially seemed like Gambhir made it but he was just short. These direct hits I tell you. This Afghan lad is a champion, isn't he? What a debut! Gambhir run out (Mujeeb) 55(42) [4s-5 6s-1]

Ashwin to Rahul Tewatia, out Lbw!! Another reverse sweep dismissal! Tewatia started his innings with a similar one but this time, like Munro earlier in the afternoon, misses it to be trapped LBW. Tewatia tries to repeat the stroke but ends up losing his balance and is all over the place as he gets pinged before the stumps. Looked dead plumb. Probably didn't pick the leg break at all. KXIP chipping away at the wickets here at the back end. DD need a strong finish. Rahul Tewatia lbw b Ashwin 9(7) [4s-1]

Munro preempts the reverse-sweep but loses his balance altogether in doing so. Mujeeb ripped the ball a little extra with his index finger, meaning the ball was drifting in and gaining pace off the deck. Skids on and pins Munro on the thigh. Munro lbw b Mujeeb 4(6)

Mohit Sharma to Christian, out Bowled!! Kaboom! Who says the yorker has gone out of fashion? It never has and it never will. Lovely yorker from Mohit, on the base of off stump and Christian was making room to slam it through cover. Too good a nut for him and he fails to get his bat down in time. Timber it is! DD finish on 166/7. Is it enough? Christian b Mohit Sharma 13(13) [6s-1]
