Axar to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Rahul!! Gone. Hit a six earlier in the over and now perishes in trying to drive along the ground. That's modern cricket in a nutshell. A bit of drift away from the batsman, which is why Shreyas Iyer stretched his front foot right across, but a bit of spin did him in. Something that you didn't expect out of Axar but he's produced it. Shreyas Iyer c Rahul b Axar 11(11) [6s-1]

Woakes to Chris Lynn, out Caught by de Villiers!! This was always coming. Lynn never looked in tonight. Struggled a tad initially and throws his wicket away eventually. It's a slower delivery, shortish in length too. The big man goes after it with a single handed shot and gets no sort of connection. Miscues it over mid-off where de Villiers sprints to his left and gulps it down. Chris Lynn c de Villiers b Woakes 5(8) [4s-1]

Washington Sundar to Nitish Rana, out Lbw!! Nitish Rana has been given out lbw. He reviews after a brief contemplation with his skipper. Legal delivery. Nothing on the UltraEdge which means no bat involved. Waiting for ball-tracking... Nitish Rana though isn't waiting for anyone. He keeps walking back to the pavilion and rightly so. Umpire's call on hitting clubbed with a couple of reds. KKR won't lose the review, but they lose Nitish Rana. Cleverly bowled by Sundar there. Went wide of the crease and bowled the slider on a goodish length, beat Rana on the sweep and pinged him in line with middle stump. Looked rather close to the naked eye, but technology always finds ways to surprise us. Just brushing the top of leg peg according to HawkEye. Nitish Rana lbw b Washington Sundar 34(25) [4s-2 6s-2]

Woakes to Rinku Singh, out Caught by de Kock!! RCB review: Rinku Singh pulled and seemed to have missed it IMO, but the opinion that matters is that of the TV umpire. So, let's wait and go through the process. Legal delivery. QDK wasn't excited after grabbing the ball. Virat Kohli and a couple of ring fielders got excited and the RCB skipper wasted no time in posing a T-sign to the onfield umpire, and he is absolutely right in doing so. A spike on the UltraEdge and Rinku Singh is gone. A very faint one that and hard to spot amidst the fuzzy environment. The decision has been reversed. OUT. This is a classic case of both batsman and bowler refusing to alter their plans. Woakes dished out a short ball and made life difficult for Rinku Singh by cutting it across him, the angle was always going against him. He ran down the pitch and fed a faint nick on the pull. Rinku Singh c de Kock b Woakes 6(6) [4s-1]

Woakes to A Russell, out Caught by de Villiers!! Terrific catch from AB running back. Avoided a massive collison with B-Mac there. It was bowled full and wide, asking Russell to fetch from that far, he goes after it and clubs it high into the night sky. AB from extra cover runs back, keeps his eyes on the ball and completes a splendid catch running back. B-Mac was charging from long-on, but he did well to stay low and dive to avoid bombarding into AB. A Russell c de Villiers b Woakes 15(11) [4s-2 6s-1]

U Yadav to Narine, out Bowled!! Umesh Yadav strikes. It's the ex-Knight Rider who gets his former team mate. Bowls a low full toss outside off and that's enough for Umesh to get him a wicket. Narine goes ahead with his drive and ends up getting an inside edge on to the sticks. Entertaining knock, neverthess. Some breather for the Challengers! Narine b U Yadav 50(19) [4s-4 6s-5]

U Yadav to Uthappa, out Caught by Brendon McCullum!! Umesh is making a huge impact on this game. Has got two big wickets so far and is looking good to get a few more, believe me. Bowls a short and quick delivery around off, Uthappa who was committed into the shot goes ahead with it. Slaps it horizontally and gets a top-edge. McCullum at point has all the time in the world to settle under the skier and take it. Uthappa c Brendon McCullum b U Yadav 13(12) [6s-1]

Chawla to de Kock, out Caught by Vinay Kumar!! That's a soft dismissal and Chawla blows a kiss to the batsman on his way to the dressing room. In trying to fetch another boundary, de Kock goes for the fancy looking reverse sweep and completely mistimes it. Get a top edge and it flies slowly to short third man. A great opportunity wasted by de Kock. de Kock c Vinay Kumar b Chawla 4(4) [4s-1]

Nitish Rana to de Villiers, out Caught by Johnson!! What do you know, he's bowled another short ball and has got the dangerous AB. Massive break for the KKR. Probably it wasn't as short as AB thought. He went back to pull and ended up skying it off a thick top-edge. Johnson takes it nonchalantly at deep mid-wicket. de Villiers c Johnson b Nitish Rana 44(23) [4s-1 6s-5]

Nitish Rana to Kohli, out Bowled!! The part-timer gets AB de Villiers and Virat Kohli in consecutive balls. Floats a seam-up yorker which slips under Kohli's bat and rattles the stumps. Rana is pumped as he punches the air in delight. He'll be telling his grandchildren about this. Kohli b Nitish Rana 31(33) [4s-1 6s-1]

Johnson to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by Rinku Singh!! Sarfaraz looks to break free, but holes out at long-on. He was getting stuck out there, so wanted to release the pressure with a big shot. It was a full ball, probably a cutter, but Sarfaraz's bat twists in his hands as he swings down the ground. He miscues it off the inside half straight to long-on, who catches it at the edge of the ropes. Sarfaraz Khan c Rinku Singh b Johnson 6(10)

Vinay Kumar to Mandeep, out Caught by Kuldeep Yadav!! Better plans from Vinay Kumar with these last couple of deliveries. He's gone back to round the wicket and bowled this pretty wide outside off. Mandeep has to stretch out to reach it, and as he does, the timing is not the same. He slices this up into the accepting hands of sweeper cover. Mandeep c Kuldeep Yadav b Vinay Kumar 37(18) [4s-4 6s-2]

Vinay Kumar to Woakes, out Caught by A Russell!! This has gone high, not long. Russell pedals back from extra-cover, and takes a really good catch falling backwards. Good finish to the over from Kumar. Another full and wide delivery which is skied off the toe-end by Woakes. Woakes c A Russell b Vinay Kumar 5(5) [4s-1]

Narine to Brendon McCullum, out Bowled!! It's turned and gone through the gate. Came slower than McCullum expected and he was through his pull shot early. Short and turning back in, McCullum targeted the mid-wicket boundary, but lost his sticks. Anyway, has done his job as an opener in his first outing for RCB. Brendon McCullum b Narine 43(27) [4s-6 6s-2]

Bhuvneshwar to D Arcy Short, out D Arcy Short Run Out!! Oh, that looks out! They've gone up to the third umpire, but I think he's as dead as a dodo. A fullish one outside off, push-driven to mid-off where the cat-like Williamson runs in and scores a direct-hit at the non-striker's end. Short nods at Rahane, but not in a reassuring way. Nope, the other thing. Death knell for D'Arcy. And that's Williamson for you, after a few blinders in whites a few weeks ago. The aggression comes from within. D Arcy Short run out (Williamson) 4(4) [4s-1]

Shakib to Tripathi, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! That's a soft dismissal, the pressure of getting quick runs does Tripathi in. He came down the track to a floater outside off, perhaps would have served him better had he gone down the ground, instead, he was looking to drag it wide of long-on, hits it a lot straighter and down the throat of Manish, who ran in from long-on. Tripathi c Manish Pandey b Shakib 17(15) [4s-2]

Shakib to Samson, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! The wheels are falling off, both the set batsmen have been dismissed, this is a smart catch from Rashid at deep cover, runs in, slides forward and takes a good catch - right in front of his chest. Nice bit of bowling from Shakib, threw this one slower and wider of off, Samson jumped down the track, was looking to go over extra-cover, ended up chipping it high and towards deep cover. Rashid does the rest and RR have lost half their side. Samson c Rashid Khan b Shakib 49(42) [4s-5]

S Kaul to Gowtham, out Caught by Saha!! The Royals are falling away in Uppal. Exceptional bowling from Kaul, banged in short and at Gowtham, he had nowhere to go as he fended rather awkwardly. The ball ballooned off his gloves, popped straight up and it's an easy catch for Saha. The umpire wants to check for the front-foot no-ball, but Kaul is just about fine on that count. A duck on his IPL debut for Gowtham. Gowtham c Saha b S Kaul 0(2)

Rashid Khan to Buttler, out Bowled!! That's that for Buttler, he was very circumscept, but the finishing touches never came. The leg-break from Rashid, skids through after pitching, Buttler was cramped for room on the pull, went through with the shot, the ball grazed the inside edge and the off-stump is on the floor. The Royals have never got going tonight, the Sunrisers have been all over them. Buttler b Rashid Khan 6(9)

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Gopal, out Caught by Y Pathan!! The extra ball gets Bhuvneshwar a wicket. This was a slower knuckle ball, Gopal had to go for runs, looks to tonk it over long-on, doesn't get anywhere near the middle of the bat and it's a simple catch for Yusuf - right in front of the ropes at long-on. Shreyas Gopal c Y Pathan b Bhuvneshwar 18(18) [4s-2]

S Kaul to Unadkat, out Unadkat Run Out!! 1 run completed. Saha has demolished all the three stumps and I reckon Unadkat is short of his ground. OUT by a long way. Terrific keeping from Saha, on a good length and well wide of off, Unadkat sliced the drive behind square on the off-side. He was always coming for the second run, but was too slow in doing so. Pathan was quick on the ball and although his throw was well wide, Saha does well to gather it, turns across and throws down all the three stumps. Unadkat run out (Y Pathan/Saha) 1(2)

S Kaul to Rahane, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Excellent catch! Fuller one outside off, Rahane gets across and VVSes a lofted whip towards deep mid-wicket where Rashid runs across and takes a commendable sliding catch. He seems surprised that he took that! Rahane departs for a run-a-ball 13. Rahane c Rashid Khan b S Kaul 13(13) [4s-2]

Stanlake to Stokes, out Caught by Williamson!! Length ball outside off, Stokes drags a lofted drive through the line towards long-on where Williamson, for a fleeting moment, nearly fluffs it and you can see the look of pure terror in his eyes. But his cat-like reflexes make sure he latches on during his second attempt. He - is - pumped! Stokes c Williamson b Stanlake 5(8)

Unadkat to Saha, out Caught by Laughlin!! And Unadkat strikes. So, Saha's promotion doesn't work for SRH. Fuller and slanted well outside off, Saha in quest to clear the in-field on the off-side - slices it tamely off the outer half and skies it to mid-off. Safe as houses is Laughlin. One of SRH's supporters has his hands on his mouth. Just the start RR wanted. Saha c Laughlin b Unadkat 5(5) [4s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, not sure what prompted Rahane to take the review. Always seemed like pitching outside leg and the replays confirm it. Loopy and full around leg, Dhawan missed the sweep and was rapped on the pad. Never looked close at all. Desperation perhaps. The batsmen crossed during the appeal

Narine to Raina, out Caught by Vinay Kumar!! The cramp derailed him of the momentum. He was really struggling. Limps off to a quiet stadium. The delivery was short alright and Raina picked the length early, but his feet could not make the adjustment to rock back and the pull was off the top-edge, Vinay ran across to his left from long-on and completed a straightforward catch. Might be a good thing for CSK as Raina was not able to run as well and we know that Dhoni needs someone to sprint along with him. Raina c Vinay Kumar b Narine 14(12) [6s-1]

Chawla to Dhoni, out Caught by Karthik!! Dhoni walks. Pin drop silence at Chepauk. Is that the match? Well, there is still Bravo - last game's match-winner. Dhoni waits as the umpire checks for a front foot no-ball, Chawla is fine and Dhoni continues walking. Clever bowling from Chawla, slowed it up a touch and kept it outside off, Dhoni was down on his knee to play the sweep, through the shot early and the under edge is found. Karthik has a juggle before completing the catch. Dhoni didn't even wait for the umpire. Started walking as soon as he saw the catch taken. Dhoni c Karthik b Chawla 25(28) [4s-1 6s-1]

Tom Curran to Billings, out Caught by Uthappa!! Uthappa pumps his fists. KKR find a lifeline once again. Full delivery and right in the slot, had Billings stayed put without moving to the leg-side, he could have connected with the loft better, instead he had to reach out and managed only a toe-end to long-off. Uthappa ran across to his left to pouch that. Nevertheless, Billings has given CSK a chance to pull this off and Chepauk might have found a new hero in him. Billings c Uthappa b Tom Curran 56(23) [4s-2 6s-5]

Tom Curran to Watson, out Caught by Rinku Singh!! Maiden wicket for Tom Curran in IPL. A breather for KKR there. Short of a length delivery around off and Watson pulls it hard again. But there's a fielder in the deep, it's Rinku Singh out there. He moves to his left and grabs it eventually to bring an end to Watson's blitzkrieg. CSK couldn't have asked for a better start from the Aussie all-rounder. Wait on.. the crowd at Chepauk welcomes Raina with a loud cheer. The highest run scorer for CSK in history of IPL is at the crease. Watson c Rinku Singh b Tom Curran 42(19) [4s-3 6s-3]

Kuldeep Yadav to Rayudu, out Caught by (sub)Shivam Mavi!! Both the set openers are back in the hut now. That was bowled outside off and was spinning away from the batsman, Rayudu goes ahead with his chip shot and times it straight to the subsitute fielder who comes running in and takes it. Are KKR getting back in this match? With two new batsmen at the crease getting those odd boundaries might get a bit difficult. Rayudu c (sub)Shivam Mavi b Kuldeep Yadav 39(26) [4s-3 6s-2]

Harbhajan to Narine, out Caught by Raina!! The ploy to bring the spinner has worked straightaway. So, Narine is gone! A dot, six, six and OUT. Good ball that from Harbhajan. A nicely tossed up delivery above the eyeline of the batsman wide of off. Narine looks to slog it over mid-wicket from there and all he manages is a top-edge, that goes miles up in the air. Raina sprinted to his left from cover and took a sharp running catch. Tumbles on the ground, but ensured that the ball didn't pop out of his hand. Narine c Raina b Harbhajan 12(4) [6s-2]

SN Thakur to Rinku Singh, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! There's the jig from DJ. CSK fans will start practicing that. KKR lose their fifth wicket, with 10 overs still left. It was hurled fuller outside off and Rinku Singh goes hard on the drive. The bat turned at the point of impact and he ended up slicing it to backward point off the bottom part of the bat. Bravo won't drop those. Rinku Singh c Dwayne Bravo b SN Thakur 2(4)

Watson to Karthik, out Lbw!! Karthik has been given OUT LBW. He talks with Russell and reviews it. Was it slipping down the leg-side? Don't think there's any bat on that, struck DK in front of leg-stump, but he's so back that the ball didn't have far to travel. Umpire's call on Hawk-Eye and Karthik is OUT. A handy knock from Karthik comes to an end, lovely yorker from Watson, followed Karthik slightly and struck him bang in front of leg-stump, it was the back-pad as well. The impact was in front of leg and would have been clipping the stumps. Karthik lbw b Watson 26(25) [4s-2 6s-1]

Jadeja to Chris Lynn, out Bowled!! You miss, I hit! CSK needed this and Chepauk finds its voice. Flat ball lasered in on the stumps at 92kph, Lynn comes down the track and is beaten in the trajectory. Looked to hack across the line and the ball just sneaked through the gap between bat and pad. Crashes into the leg pole. Chris Lynn b Jadeja 22(16) [4s-4]

Watson to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Dhoni!! Dhoni pouches, up goes the umpire's finger and there's the roar from the Chepauk crowd. A soft dismissal. An innocuous short of length delivery on middle and leg, Rana moved across to help it along its way. Gets a faint under-edge onto his thigh and the ball lobs up in the air. MS moves to his right to snaffle that. A straightforward catch for the captain. Nitish Rana c Dhoni b Watson 16(14) [4s-2]

Watson to Uthappa, out Uthappa Run Out!! KKR have gifted away a wicket here. Bad communication between two senior members. Length ball around off and Uthappa punched it towards cover from the crease. Raina stopped it with a dive with his left hand, picks the ball and hits the bullseye at the bowler's end. Uthappa was ball-watching and Karthik was halfway down. One had to go at the danger's end, and Uthappa went for it. This is a big wicket. Raina has his arms aloft. Uthappa run out (Raina) 29(16) [4s-2 6s-3]

Gowtham to Maxwell, out Munro Run Out!! The shortish ball skidded on and the batsman trying to pull, gets hit on the pads for the ball to roll away into the on-side. Munro wanted a steal but was sent back. The keeper ran to his left, picked it up and threw it to the bowler, who whipped off the bails. Dreadful start for Delhi. Munro run out (Buttler/Gowtham) 0(0)

Laughlin to Maxwell, out Caught by Buttler!! Looks to swing hard and is gone. He was never in today. The bowler cut his fingers over the ball and that tricked the batsman, who was early into his stroke. A thick edge and the keeper did the rest. Maxwell was again trying to drag it away into the on-side and lost shape completely trying to strike it hard. DD looking down the barrell. Maxwell c Buttler b Laughlin 17(12) [4s-2 6s-1]

Unadkat to Pant, out Caught by Gowtham!! The fielder takes a good one behind square on the leg-side. It's a full ball and the batsman never got really under it. Got more altitude than distance -- as Pant has today on more than one occasion -- and Gowtham charged in from the deep to take it. Good catch actually, flinging his body in front and plucking it above the ground. More importantly it is a dot ball. That might well have been another delivery where Unadkat ran his fingers on the ball. Pant c Gowtham b Unadkat 20(14) [4s-3]

Laughlin to Vijay Shankar, out Caught by Stokes!! Another skier, another good take. The fielder at long-on came in running in and took it. The length ball was another swirler. The ball sliced up from the outer half of the blade and the fielder did the rest. Vijay Shankar c Stokes b Laughlin 3(3)

Nadeem to D Arcy Short, out D Arcy Short Run Out!! 1 run completed. Mix up and D Arcy Short is run out yet again! Holy Molly, what's with the running between these two? Waste of a wicket really but the Daredevils won't mind it at all. It was a drifter into middle and leg, Short nudged it towards deep mid-wicket and took the first run with ease. Crazy mix up on the second run and he went for it eventually but Vijay Shankar was alert. The direct hit at the keeper's end caught the southpaw well short. D Arcy Short run out (Vijay Shankar) 6(3) [4s-1]

Nadeem to Samson, out Bowled!! Oh no! Unfortunate! Tossed up temptingly on middle, angling in from round the wicket, Samson gets forward and tries to go through with the slog-sweep to negate the spin, ends up getting an inside edge onto his thigh, which then ricochets onto the off-stump. On another night, it might have missed the wickets, but the stars up above aren't aligned for him tonight. Samson b Nadeem 37(22) [4s-2 6s-2]

Nadeem to Rahane, out Caught by Chris Morris!! No no no! What are you doing Jinx? Not too short, no turn, but a little too quick and skiddy. Rahane is stuck between and pull and a flick with a bit of a swat and gets a leading edge towards Morris at point to hand him a mango dolly. Rahane c Chris Morris b Nadeem 45(40) [4s-5]

Shami to Buttler, out Bowled!! Off-cutter/yorker combo, not an easy one to get right, especially under duress, on middle, Buttler gets across to lap/ramp it away towards fine leg, misses it completely as the bails light up - and so do Shami's eyes. Brilliant delivery under pressure. Buttler b Shami 29(18) [4s-2 6s-2]

Boult to Stokes, out Caught by Pant!! What a ripper! The decision to persist with Boult has paid dividends for Gambhir. Good aggressive captaincy. But what a ball though! Phew! One of those jaffas that you get in Test cricket generally and Stokes must be wondering where it came from. Angled into him from a good length and shaped away with a spit of extra bounce. Unplayable by any means and it flies off the outside edge. Pant reacted sharply too and flung himself to his left to take a good diving catch. What a huge wicket this is! RR are jolted early. Stokes was looking to up the ante, has to depart. Stokes c Pant b Boult 16(12) [4s-1 6s-1]

Stanlake to Pollard, out Caught by Dhawan!! What was that? Pollard puts his hand up in an apologetic manner towards Yadav, I guess. Back of a length delivery, clocked at 143kph, Pollard stays back in the crease and is through the shot even before the ball arrived, the ball takes the cue-end and skies to sweeper cover. Dhawan completes the catch and does his thigh slap. Pollard was so much early that his bottom hand came off the bat handle as he made contact with the ball. Timely wicket for Hyderabad and not for Mumbai as Pollard was looking in ominous form. Pollard c Dhawan b Stanlake 28(23) [4s-3 6s-2]

Rashid Khan to Cutting, out Bowled!! Just too good. It is hard enough for a proper batsman to pick Rashid, imagine how hard it would be for an Australian all-rounder. Cutting shimmies down the wicket without knowing what delivery it is, the wrong 'un spins in and sneaks past the swinging blade before crashing into the stumps. A well-deserved wicket for Rashid, who has bowled brilliantly without any luck. Cutting b Rashid Khan 9(9) [4s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Deepak Hooda!! And another one gone. This knuckle ball epidemic is getting to every Indian pacer. Sharma the latest to show it off. Lands it on a length and Yadav thinking it was a normal length delivery, goes through the line with the loft, miscues it completely and Hooda runs forward from long-on to pouch that. Yadav was the key and even he is sent back. Suryakumar Yadav c Deepak Hooda b Sandeep Sharma 28(31) [4s-2 6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Sangwan, out Lbw!! You can't get more plumb LBW decisions than that. Umpire Nandan messed it up. The knuckle ball once again from Sharma, Sangwan is through his slog early and is struck on the back leg, yes back leg. The ball was crashing into middle stump as per ball-tracking and for some reason Nandan didn't give that out. Sharma was quick to ask KW to take the review and the skipper obliged. Sangwan lbw b Sandeep Sharma 0(4)

Stanlake to Rohit, out Caught by Shakib!! Smart catch from Shakib and Hooda can breathe easy. On a good length and angling into Rohit's pads, he was looking to tuck it towards the on-side, perhaps played a tad too early, the ball looped in the air and was dropping in front of short square leg. Shakib was alert though, dives forward, got both hands underneath and scooped the catch. Rohit falls cheaply once again and MI have lost an early wicket. Rohit c Shakib b Stanlake 11(10) [4s-1 6s-1]

S Kaul to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Y Pathan!! Oh dear! This is terrible cricket from Kishan, another blind swing and this time, he isn't reprieved. Yusuf was the fielder in the deep and he takes a good low catch. Coming to the ball, on a good length and angling across the left-hander, Kishan was eyeing the mid-wicket boundary as he hacked across the line, gets a thick edge that flew towards third man. Yusuf was perhaps unsighted by the floodlights, but does well to bend forward and takes it inches off the turf. Ishan Kishan c Y Pathan b S Kaul 9(9) [4s-2]

S Kaul to Lewis, out Bowled!! Kaul has two in the over and he's chuffed to bits. He's running all around the ground in jubilation, three wickets in the powerplay for SRH and all those dropped chances will be forgotten. This was the slower knuckle ball, pitched on middle and shaped across the left-hander, Lewis didn't spot it, went for the big heave over mid-wicket, he missed and heard the sound of clatter. Lewis b S Kaul 29(17) [4s-3 6s-2]

Shakib to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Williamson!! Shakib has his man and MI find themselves in further trouble. This was tossed up and held its line just outside off, Krunal was looking to play with the turn, closed the bat-face early and pops a leading edge, straight to KW at cover. It's a dolly and the SRH captain doesn't need a second invitation. Krunal Pandya c Williamson b Shakib 15(10) [4s-2]

Markande to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Rohit!! Almost a horrible bit of miscommunication between Markande and Rohit, but the Mumbai skipper just about takes it in the end. He can see the funny side now, won't have been so funny had it gone down. But what a horrible shot from Pandey. All SRH need to do here is knock Markande around, the rate is under control. But Pandey charges out for a big hit. He's done in by the flight, and skies it up off a leading edge. It was Markande's catch, but the youngster leaves it to the skipper without any indication. At the very last moment, Rohit sinks low and snaffles it off the turf. Phew. The 20-year old is inspiring the visitors and keeping them in it. Manish Pandey c Rohit b Markande 11(8) [4s-1]

Markande to Shakib, out Bowled!! What a soft, soft dismissal. He had so much time on the back foot, how did he even edge it! Shortish googly from Markande, sits up outside off. Shakib is back in the crease to tamely pat it away through point, but all he does is chop it back onto the stumps. What a spell from Markande to give Mumbai hope from a pretty hopeless situation. He's done though, will the others rise? Shakib b Markande 12(12) [4s-1]

Bumrah to Y Pathan, out Caught by Pollard!! SRH are close, but this is still not over. Bumrah rushes Pathan with this short of length delivery which hurries onto his attempted pull shot. He was caught on the swivel as it spooned up off the splice, before nestling into the bucket hands of Pollard at mid-wicket. Y Pathan c Pollard b Bumrah 14(14) [4s-2]

Bumrah to Rashid Khan, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Oh my, what do we have here! Bumrah has ripped the game open once more with two in two. Pacy full ball outside off, the punchy fellow that Rashid is, he goes for an ambitious cover drive but can only nick it to the keeper. Hat-trick ball coming up. Rashid Khan c Ishan Kishan b Bumrah 0(1)

Mustafizur to S Kaul, out Caught&Bowled!! Taken one-handed. The Mumbai supporters in the crowd erupt. Kaul was probably surprised by the line from Mustafizur here - it was full at the stumps after the previous two which were wide of him. He chips the off-cutter straight back, where Mustafizur sticks a hand out and the ball sticks. This will be some comeback from MI if they pull it off. S Kaul c and b Mustafizur 0(4)

Mustafizur to Sandeep Sharma, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Sandeep does in fact look for the boundary. He walks across, bends his back knee and tries for the same scoop that Kedar Jadhav hit for six a few nights back against Mustafizur. But what Sandeep achieves is very different. He doesn't get it anywhere near the middle, and spoons it up to short fine leg. Mustafizur raises his arms as the MI fans go wild. Sandeep Sharma c Krunal Pandya b Mustafizur 0(2)

Markande to Saha, out Lbw!! An appeal for lbw against Saha and umpire Nigel Llong shakes his head in denial. Well, MI have decided to review. Fair delivery. It was the quicker googly and Saha was way out of his crease and the impact is above the knee-roll. What does the ball-tracker say? Three reds and Saha has to go. Llong can't belive it and so can't I. Brilliant review from Mumbai. Saha misses the clip as he didn't the pick the wrong 'un and was also late to bring his bat down. HawkEye showed it be hitting the leg stump. There's the breakthrough and it's the 20-year-old who does the job for the visitors. Saha lbw b Markande 22(20) [4s-3]

Mustafizur to Williamson, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Another review from MI. This time against KW for caught behind. Fair delivery. There's a sound. We'll have Ultraedge in a short while to confirm. There's a little spike. Is that enough for the on-field call to be reversed? I wouldn't want to be the third umpire. Well, the call has been made. Overturned! Two overs, two reviews and two wickets. Mumbai are coming back. It was the cutter from Mustafizur and Williamson tried to run it down to third man. Gets a faint outside edge and Ishan Kishan pouched it with ease. The keeper and the bowler heard it. Williamson c Ishan Kishan b Mustafizur 6(4) [4s-1]

Markande to Dhawan, out Caught by Bumrah!! In 35 balls that he has bowled in IPL, Mayank Markande has dismissed Dhoni and Dhawan. His CV will look good, for sure. So, Dhawan plays a high-risk shot and perishes. Was a quick and flattish leg-break, Dhawan goes down for the big slog sweep and top-edges straight to the man at long leg. Bumrah, the man in the deep, held his ground and took a calm catch. He was inches in front of the boundary rope. Went a couple of steps back, but looked back to find himself just in. Dhawan c Bumrah b Markande 45(28) [4s-8]

Washington Sundar to Rahul, out Caught by Sarfaraz Khan!! Oh dear! That's a horror shot from KL, he was looking so good and now plays an atrocious heave, pushed through quicker and wider of off, KL was looking to mow it over the mid-wicket fence, doesn't get anywhere near the pitch of the ball, the fat top-edge loops towards short third man where Sarfaraz takes it with glee. End of a handy knock from the KXIP opener. Rahul c Sarfaraz Khan b Washington Sundar 47(30) [4s-2 6s-4]

Kulwant Khejroliya to Nair, out Bowled!! Khejroliya has his first IPL wicket and that's a big one as well. Nair was looking in good touch, decides to up the ante and instead has to walk back to the hut. Short of a length and on the stumps, wasn't short enough for the pull, Nair went through with the shot, connected with thin air and the ball clattered into the top of middle. RCB are beginning to boss this match now, can KXIP find an answer? Nair b Kulwant Khejroliya 29(26) [4s-3]

Washington Sundar to Stoinis, leg byes, 1 run, loud shout for LBW and RCB want a review. Kohli looked very keen to challenge the call. It's a fair delivery from Sundar, it has pitched in line, but is it spinning down leg? There's no bat and Ultraedge confirms it. I don't think it straightened enough, Hawk-Eye in and it's missing the leg-stump. RCB have lost their review. This was tossed up on middle and was spinning into the right-hander, Stoinis swept and missed, was struck on the pads, in front of leg and the angle was traking it down the leg-stump. The ball rolls away towards the off-side, the fielder has a shy at the bowler's end and concedes an overthrow

Washington Sundar to Stoinis, out Stumped!! This is poor cricket from KXIP, they are losing wickets in clusters. Another unnecessary shot from Stoinis and he's stranded way outside the crease, gave away his intentions way too early, stepped down the track, allows Sundar to shorten his length. He still didn't accept defeat, swung recklessly across the line and missed, an easy stumping for de Kock. Stoinis st de Kock b Washington Sundar 11(9) [6s-1]

Kulwant Khejroliya to Axar, out Lbw!! Axar has been given OUT LBW and he wants a review. This looked adjacent to the naked eye. It's a fair delivery and there's no bat as well. The impact seems to be in front of middle, the height isn't an issue. No edge, says Ultraedge. Hawk-Eye in, three reds and Axar is OUT. Simple call for umpire Ravi and Khejroliya has struck with his last ball. This was full and came back with the angle, Axar shuffled a long way across on the flick, once he missed, it was curtains, decided to take a chance as he reviewed, but to no avail. Axar lbw b Kulwant Khejroliya 2(3)

Woakes to Andrew Tye, out Caught by Kohli!! This was always coming! Tye was looking to slog everything out of the park, on a good length and just outside off, might have been the slower ball, Tye swung through the line, went off the toe-end of the bat, got plenty of height but not the distance. Kohli ran across to his left from long-on and held on to a simple catch. Andrew Tye c Kohli b Woakes 7(7)

Chahal to Ashwin, out Stumped!! Has Ashwin been stumped? de Kock certainly seems confident. It's a fair delivery, the bat is in the air, Ashwin is way short as well and he's OUT. That's the end of a mighty fine cameo from the KXIP captain, will it be the clinching factor in this match? Smart bowling from Chahal, sensed that Ashwin was coming down the track, threw in a loopy leg-break, Ashwin came down the track, doesn't get anywhere near the ball, swung across the line in hope and missed, de Kock did the rest. Ashwin st de Kock b Chahal 33(21) [4s-3 6s-1]

Woakes to Mujeeb, out Caught by Sarfaraz Khan!! KXIP have been bowled out for 155. RCB will feel they have done a good job with the ball. This was short and at the stumps, Rahman was backing away on the pull, the ball was just too quick for him, gets a top-edge that lobs behind square on the off-side. de Kock went for the catch, but Sarfaraz called for it and holds on safely. Mujeeb c Sarfaraz Khan b Woakes 0(2)

U Yadav to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by de Kock!! Stunning catch by de Kock behind the wicket. Full length delivery in the zone around off, Agarwal goes for it, swings hard at it and ends up getting a healthy edge. de Kock flies to his right and pulls off a beauty. So just like always, Agarwal departs after getting off to a flier. Good entertaining cameo! Mayank Agarwal c de Kock b U Yadav 15(11) [4s-3]

U Yadav to Finch, out Lbw!! Golden duck for Finch! Umesh is on a hat-trick as the umpire's call stays. It was a length delivery around middle and Finch who tried to flick it off his toes missed it and got struck on the pads. Pitching in line, impact in line and clipping - umpire's call. Can he bag the hat-trick now? Finch lbw b U Yadav 0(1)

U Yadav to Yuvraj, out Bowled!! Third wicket of the over. Umesh Yadav is on fire! Cleans up Yuvraj with a beautiful delivery. Comes from round the wicket and fires in a length delivery from wide off the crease. Yuvraj who looks to fend it, misses it altogether and the middle-stump is out of here. Look at Umesh's celebration, he's absolutely delighted. Just look at him. Fist pump and all! Yuvraj b U Yadav 4(4) [4s-1]

Washington Sundar to Rahul, out Caught by Sarfaraz Khan!! Oh dear! That's a horror shot from KL, he was looking so good and now plays an atrocious heave, pushed through quicker and wider of off, KL was looking to mow it over the mid-wicket fence, doesn't get anywhere near the pitch of the ball, the fat top-edge loops towards short third man where Sarfaraz takes it with glee. End of a handy knock from the KXIP opener. Rahul c Sarfaraz Khan b Washington Sundar 47(30) [4s-2 6s-4]

Kulwant Khejroliya to Nair, out Bowled!! Khejroliya has his first IPL wicket and that's a big one as well. Nair was looking in good touch, decides to up the ante and instead has to walk back to the hut. Short of a length and on the stumps, wasn't short enough for the pull, Nair went through with the shot, connected with thin air and the ball clattered into the top of middle. RCB are beginning to boss this match now, can KXIP find an answer? Nair b Kulwant Khejroliya 29(26) [4s-3]

Washington Sundar to Stoinis, leg byes, 1 run, loud shout for LBW and RCB want a review. Kohli looked very keen to challenge the call. It's a fair delivery from Sundar, it has pitched in line, but is it spinning down leg? There's no bat and Ultraedge confirms it. I don't think it straightened enough, Hawk-Eye in and it's missing the leg-stump. RCB have lost their review. This was tossed up on middle and was spinning into the right-hander, Stoinis swept and missed, was struck on the pads, in front of leg and the angle was traking it down the leg-stump. The ball rolls away towards the off-side, the fielder has a shy at the bowler's end and concedes an overthrow

Washington Sundar to Stoinis, out Stumped!! This is poor cricket from KXIP, they are losing wickets in clusters. Another unnecessary shot from Stoinis and he's stranded way outside the crease, gave away his intentions way too early, stepped down the track, allows Sundar to shorten his length. He still didn't accept defeat, swung recklessly across the line and missed, an easy stumping for de Kock. Stoinis st de Kock b Washington Sundar 11(9) [6s-1]

Kulwant Khejroliya to Axar, out Lbw!! Axar has been given OUT LBW and he wants a review. This looked adjacent to the naked eye. It's a fair delivery and there's no bat as well. The impact seems to be in front of middle, the height isn't an issue. No edge, says Ultraedge. Hawk-Eye in, three reds and Axar is OUT. Simple call for umpire Ravi and Khejroliya has struck with his last ball. This was full and came back with the angle, Axar shuffled a long way across on the flick, once he missed, it was curtains, decided to take a chance as he reviewed, but to no avail. Axar lbw b Kulwant Khejroliya 2(3)

Woakes to Andrew Tye, out Caught by Kohli!! This was always coming! Tye was looking to slog everything out of the park, on a good length and just outside off, might have been the slower ball, Tye swung through the line, went off the toe-end of the bat, got plenty of height but not the distance. Kohli ran across to his left from long-on and held on to a simple catch. Andrew Tye c Kohli b Woakes 7(7)

Chahal to Ashwin, out Stumped!! Has Ashwin been stumped? de Kock certainly seems confident. It's a fair delivery, the bat is in the air, Ashwin is way short as well and he's OUT. That's the end of a mighty fine cameo from the KXIP captain, will it be the clinching factor in this match? Smart bowling from Chahal, sensed that Ashwin was coming down the track, threw in a loopy leg-break, Ashwin came down the track, doesn't get anywhere near the ball, swung across the line in hope and missed, de Kock did the rest. Ashwin st de Kock b Chahal 33(21) [4s-3 6s-1]

Woakes to Mujeeb, out Caught by Sarfaraz Khan!! KXIP have been bowled out for 155. RCB will feel they have done a good job with the ball. This was short and at the stumps, Rahman was backing away on the pull, the ball was just too quick for him, gets a top-edge that lobs behind square on the off-side. de Kock went for the catch, but Sarfaraz called for it and holds on safely. Mujeeb c Sarfaraz Khan b Woakes 0(2)

U Yadav to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by de Kock!! Stunning catch by de Kock behind the wicket. Full length delivery in the zone around off, Agarwal goes for it, swings hard at it and ends up getting a healthy edge. de Kock flies to his right and pulls off a beauty. So just like always, Agarwal departs after getting off to a flier. Good entertaining cameo! Mayank Agarwal c de Kock b U Yadav 15(11) [4s-3]

U Yadav to Finch, out Lbw!! Golden duck for Finch! Umesh is on a hat-trick as the umpire's call stays. It was a length delivery around middle and Finch who tried to flick it off his toes missed it and got struck on the pads. Pitching in line, impact in line and clipping - umpire's call. Can he bag the hat-trick now? Finch lbw b U Yadav 0(1)

U Yadav to Yuvraj, out Bowled!! Third wicket of the over. Umesh Yadav is on fire! Cleans up Yuvraj with a beautiful delivery. Comes from round the wicket and fires in a length delivery from wide off the crease. Yuvraj who looks to fend it, misses it altogether and the middle-stump is out of here. Look at Umesh's celebration, he's absolutely delighted. Just look at him. Fist pump and all! Yuvraj b U Yadav 4(4) [4s-1]

Krunal Pandya to Pant, out Caught by Pollard!! That's Pollard for you. Freak on the field. And Krunal roars in delight. Dangerous 69-run stand broken. This was a flighted delivery wide outside off stump, something that left-arm spinners do against left-handed batsmen to take the leg-side out of play, Pant tries to muscle the ball hard through the off-side, wanted to hit towards cover, but he hit straight and Pollard ran quickly to his left, dived and took it air-borne. Pant misses a deserved fifty by three runs. Pant c Pollard b Krunal Pandya 47(25) [4s-6 6s-2]

Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Oh that's a stunning grab from brother Hardik. Unbelievable. The catch of the tournament so far. This is exactly what Markande should have done in the previous over. Turn it away outside off stump like Krunal did this time. Maxwell tries to go for a big hit, but the bat turns in his hands on impact with the ball and it's a slice that flies more towards deep extra-cover. But Hardik put his skating boots on, got there and flew full length to his left and took it with both hands horizontal to the ground. Just amazing! Krunal has given a lot of hope for MI with 2 wickets in 8 balls. Maxwell c Hardik Pandya b Krunal Pandya 13(6) [4s-1 6s-1]

Mustafizur to Gambhir, out Caught by Rohit!! The Fizz strikes, gets the DD skipper. Gambhir was struggling and his struggle finally comes to an end. Short of a length around off and the opener goes ahead with the pull. As there's a bit extra bounce on the delivery, it catches the top edge and Rohit Sharma at short mid-wicket does the rest. Should have given the strike to Roy who's striking the ball so well. This wicket might affect Roy's mindset now! Gambhir c Rohit b Mustafizur 15(16) [4s-2]

Rahul Tewatia to Suryakumar Yadav, out Lbw!! Big, big appeal from the keeper more so than anyone else. Given. Now then, Suryakumar deliberates with his partner for a reasonable amount of time, before taking the review. Did the ball straighten enough, or was it sliding down? It's clipping leg-stump according to ball-tracking. So the umpire's call will stay. What a precious spell this has been from Rahul Tewatia, standing out amid the carnage to remove both the opening batsmen. Suryakumar was quickly down on his knees to sweep this hard, but failed to connect. It didn't grip the pitch much after drifting in, but gripped just enough to be clipping the stump. Suryakumar Yadav lbw b Rahul Tewatia 53(32) [4s-7 6s-1]

Christian to Ishan Kishan, out Bowled!! Switches his legs, looks for the reverse-sweep again but completely misses this full toss. It rams into middle and leg stump from round the wicket. He was doing a decent job of hitting straight, probably didn't need to do that. But a superb knock nevertheless. Ishan Kishan b Christian 44(23) [4s-5 6s-2]

Christian to Pollard, out Bowled!! Would you believe it, Christian now has two in two. Pollard walks out to him first ball, tries to work this length ball round the corner but misses it. The ball gets stuck in his thigh pad and dips behind to knock over off-stump. These are crucial strikes as Delhi hope to reign things back. Pollard b Christian 0(1)

Boult to Rohit, out Caught by Roy!! Sliced up in the air, Roy lumbers across from long-off and takes it comfortably. Lovely bowling from Boult. He slanted this off-cutter away from Rohit's swiping zone, and it gripped further away from him after pitching. Despite that, Rohit doesn't quite smarten up. He swings cross-batted and slices it off the outside half. Rohit c Roy b Boult 18(15) [4s-2]

Shami to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! What is happening? It's been lapped straight into the hands of short fine leg, but the umpire has gone upstairs for some reason. Oh wait, his decision was not out, and so Delhi reviewed it immediately. Bizarre. It looked like it came straight off the bat-face. Krunal walks across for the scoop, gets a thick inside edge onto thigh pad and it spoons up to Tewatia. So the decision will be overturned. Krunal Pandya c Rahul Tewatia b Shami 11(10) [4s-1]

Boult to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Another one falls. An off-cutter from Boult, Hardik mistimes the slog off the inside half and holes out. Iyer, it seemed like, had lost it in the sun initially. But he picked it up in time and then sunk low for the grab. Hardik Pandya c Shreyas Iyer b Boult 2(3)

Rahul Tewatia to Lewis, out Caught by Roy!! Looked like a googly but replays show it's a quick slider, angling across from over the wicket, which gets the wicket. Lewis shimmies down the track, isn't quite to the pitch of the ball and ends up slicing it to long-off, where Jason Roy runs in and takes the catch reverse-cupped. Lewis c Roy b Rahul Tewatia 48(28) [4s-4 6s-4]

Shakib to Narine, out Caught by Williamson!! This is just a culmination of what was brewing. Shakib's getting the ball to drift away, Narine's throwing his bat and getting lucky. Not this time. Off the toe-end, there's Williamson at wide long-on, having covered some ground from mid-wicket and tumbling behind to take this one. Lovely catch. He's on fire in the field, is Williamson, this IPL. Narine c Williamson b Shakib 9(10) [4s-1]

Shakib to Chris Lynn, out Caught&Bowled!! Shakib's stretched into double his height with this sideways dive and taken this left-handed inches above the ground. A bit of replays there to ascertain the dismissal but that's out. Kolkata crowd knows it. Arm-ball again that sticks a bit in the pitch, Chris Lynn's making room down leg and can only tamely pop it back down the pitch. And then Shakib takes over. Chris Lynn c and b Shakib 49(34) [4s-7 6s-1]

Stanlake to A Russell, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Manish Pandey, that's some catch. But what's Russell upto? Another one that he totally wanted to hit into the stands. Stays leg-side of the ball and wafts, and ends up slicing it. Into the night sky, Manish Pandey runs back from backward point, with his back to the ball, and leaps in front to take that. There was third man in the vicinity too but he just leaves it to Manish, and for the right reasons. A Russell c Manish Pandey b Stanlake 9(5) [6s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Shakib!! Bhuvneshwar is too good for a debutant. Takes the pace off again with his knuckles and gets the ball to dart away. And Shubman Gill, overcommitted on the front foot, reaches out, only to slice that over to extra cover. Shubman Gill c Shakib b Bhuvneshwar 3(9)

Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, out Caught by Saha!! These knuckle balls are sticking in the pitch and darting away. Karthik gets a top-edge on his attempted flat-batted swish, for the keeper to take a good catch few paces to his right. Karthik c Saha b Bhuvneshwar 29(27) [4s-2 6s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Uthappa, out Caught by Saha!! Uthappa thought that he would get away with it but DRS comes to Sunrisers' rescue. Short delivery outside off, Robin tries to run that down to third man but ends up getting a slight edge to that. UltraEdge confirms the same and the ploy to open with Uthappa has back fired. Uthappa c Saha b Bhuvneshwar 3(8)

S Kaul to Shivam Mavi, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! Imagine Bhuvneshwar escaping a collision with Stanlake.. he offers a smile but I think it's for more than just pulling off this catch. It's relief personified. Another knuckle ball this from Kaul, Shivam Mavi reaches out and pops it behind off the toe-end. It's Bhuvi's catch at short fine leg but there's Stanlake, rushing past the keeper to attempt to take this. Just about evades his teammate to my relief. Shivam Mavi c Bhuvneshwar b S Kaul 7(8)

Stanlake to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Excellent grab by Manish that, fumbles on the first attempt but manages to hold on as he's about to hit the ground. Was short and wide outside off, Rana cut that hard to point where a rather sharp Manish pulled off a screamer. Replays confirm that the catch was taken and SRH strike right aftter the break. Stanlake is absolutely loving this, bounce and pace has helped him put the pressure on Rana as he gets his scalp. Nitish Rana c Manish Pandey b Stanlake 18(16) [4s-2 6s-1]

Chawla to Shakib, out Bowled!! Through him. Flat through the air from Chawla, zoots it through Shakib who's on the prowl down the pitch. Never allowed him to get anywhere close to the ball, cramped him up and it deflected off his pad onto middle stump. Do KKR still have hope here? Shakib b Chawla 27(21) [4s-2 6s-1]

Johnson to Williamson, out Caught by A Russell!! Williamson flicks this straight into the hands of square leg, what a soft dismissal! He immediately throws his head back, not able to believe what he's just done. Good length ball on leg-stump, and this is a loose shot from the captain. Just so lacklustre. This could get interesting. Williamson c A Russell b Johnson 50(44) [4s-4 6s-1]

Narine to Saha, out Caught by Karthik!! KKR gets the much needed breakthrough. Saha doesn't even wait for the finger to go up as he walks back. It was an off-spinner down the leg-side, Saha gets a faint tickle to it and Karthik behind the stumps makes no mistake. Saha c Karthik b Narine 24(15) [4s-5]

Narine to Dhawan, out Bowled!! Narine is on fire! His second wicket in that many overs. He is ensuring that KKR remains in the game. It was an off-spinner and Dhawan was late onto it, trying to play across the line. Ball hits his pads and goes onto hit the stumps. Dhawan will be gutted with this shot. Dhawan b Narine 7(7) [4s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Manish Pandey, out Lbw!! Pandey was chatting with Williamson regarding the review but umpire says time is up and Manish Pandey will have to depart. It was a flighted delivery which turned in after pitching, Manish Pandey's bat was behind the pads and ball raps him on the pads. It looked adjacent, the only question was whether it was going down the leg-side. Umpire thinks it wasn't and he raises his finger slowly in a stylish manner. Manish Pandey lbw b Kuldeep Yadav 4(11)

Gowtham to Brendon McCullum, out Caught by Stokes!! Whatta catch that! Eye-candy that take was. Was a short delivery around off, McCullum rocked back and pulled it hard to deep mid-wicket where Stokes timed his jump and he was in the air as he reverse cupped it. Probably one of the best catches of the season. Brendon McCullum c Stokes b Gowtham 4(4) [4s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, out Caught by D Arcy Short!! He's got him, he's got him. Shreyas Gopal is running around with an arm raised. Pretty much a half-tracker which Kohli pulls in the vicinity of deep mid-wicket. It's D'Arcy Short there, who leaps across for an excellent take. Oh what a game-changer this. Kohli c D Arcy Short b Shreyas Gopal 57(30) [4s-6 6s-2]

Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, out Caught by Unadkat!! Shreyas Gopal has turned this game right on its head. First Kohli, and now de Villiers. RR should really back themselves from here. Another half-tracker really, but de Villiers doesn't get hold of his pull and hits it straight towards long leg. Unadkat seemed to have misjudged it initially, but he's able to make amends by taking an excellent low catch. Wry smile on de Villiers's face. He could have hit this anywhere. Just not his day. de Villiers c Unadkat b Shreyas Gopal 20(18) [4s-1 6s-1]

Laughlin to Negi, out Caught by Buttler!! Done in by the off-cutter. Negi tries flicking it through mid-wicket, but there was enough cut on the ball to take a thick outside edge. Good take from Buttler diving forward, should help his bruised confidence. Negi c Buttler b Laughlin 3(4)

Stokes to Washington Sundar, out Bowled!! How unlucky is this for Sundar. He's lapped this full toss right off the bat-face onto middle stump. Walked across, got down low, and set himself up perfectly. But just couldn't get under it unfortunately to gain the elevation needed. Washington Sundar b Stokes 35(19) [4s-1 6s-3]

D Arcy Short to de Kock, out Caught by Unadkat!! Failed with the bat earlier today but makes up for it with this huge wicket. Bowls a shortish delivery on the pads and de Kock who looks to put it away with a pull finds the fielder in the deep, it's Unadkat who grabs it. Wait on... it's AB who walks out to bat in next. Get ready for some more fireworks! de Kock c Unadkat b D Arcy Short 26(19) [4s-4]
batsman: D Arcy Short to de Kock

Commentary: Chahal to Stokes, out Bowled!! Chopped on! Massive strike from Chahal, just like he did in his previous over. The leg spinner to a left-hander is always a double-edged sword, this wicket proves it. Slows this down and drags it wider outside off, Stokes wanted to fetch it with a slog sweep but only managed a thick under edge that clattered onto the woodwork. Just when this partnership was gearing up to go up another level, it was been halted. Stokes b Chahal 27(21) [4s-2 6s-1]

Woakes to Buttler, out Caught by Kohli!! Soft dismissal! Woakes tried the yorker but ended up delivering a pacy low full toss. Buttler just tried to check the lofted stroke, perhaps got a touch late on it and ended up chipping it straight to mid-off where the RCB skipper swallowed it up. He's wearing an animated look on his face as well. Vital wicket this for RCB, Buttler could easily have a made a difference of about 10 runs. Buttler c Kohli b Woakes 23(14) [4s-2 6s-1]

Woakes to Rahane, out Caught by U Yadav!! There's the miscue. It was coming. This entire stay was so un-Rahane. Slogging, but with good reason. So he gets a fuller-slower one now, he's camping on his back foot, goes to smoke it straight over. Doesn't time, gets it off the bottom half, flies high. And down mid-on's backtracking reverse cup. Rahane c U Yadav b Woakes 36(20) [4s-6 6s-1]

Chahal to D Arcy Short, out Caught by de Kock!! Oh dear. A teasing half-tracker, with generous width, asking to be slapped. Short does the needful, gets deep in the crease, lines up and throws his bat out in looking to cut it away. There's a hint of spit up, enough to grope a fat chunk on the top-edge. And Quinton's ever-so-sharp. D Arcy Short c de Kock b Chahal 11(17) [4s-1]

Barinder to Rayudu, out Rayudu Run Out!! Mix-up and the captain fires a direct-hit from extra-cover. Look at him roar. CSK's best batsman on show thus far has been sent back. Massive setback. Rayudu drove this full ball straight to Ashwin at extra-cover and set off, Dhoni said no straightaway - probably because of the niggle on the lower back. But Rayudu had already covered a lot of distance and Ashwin's throw was spot on. Rayudu run out (Ashwin) 49(35) [4s-5 6s-1]

Andrew Tye to Jadeja, out Caught by Ashwin!! That's mistimed and only goes as far as cover. Normal seam-up delivery, full again for a big hit, Jadeja wanted to go over long-off, sliced it high in the air and the KXIP makes no mistake. Important thing is Dhoni has crossed over and will be on strike now. Jadeja c Ashwin b Andrew Tye 19(13) [4s-1 6s-1]

Mohit Sharma to Watson, out Caught by Barinder!! Too cute, and that's never ideal. Mohit gets his line wrong, slipping into the legs, but he's neatly disguised this slower back-hander. Watson's fooled as he loads up and commits to swipe it, knowing there's nobody at fine leg. Goes through early, gets a fat splice and short fine pockets the balloon. Watson c Barinder b Mohit Sharma 11(9) [4s-2]

Andrew Tye to Vijay, out Caught by Barinder!! So damn ungainly. Vijay sheds his grace, well you have to when you are chasing 200, ends up one-handed. So it was the knuckle ball, Tye's staple, Vijay gets down the track in trying to dispatch it into long-off. Loses shape, loses timing, and Sran's there at mid-off, waiting to gobble up the skier. Vijay c Barinder b Andrew Tye 12(10) [6s-1]

Ashwin to Billings, out Lbw!! Ashwin runs to appeal. He wants an LBW. But the umpire's given runs. When you are the skipper and the bowler, you don't consult anybody. We're upstairs. It started with Billings shuffling, exposing his stumps and sweeping. Ashwin smartly slips in the quicker one, bang in line with the stumps. UltraEdge shows no edge. And HawkEye shows it to crash into off. Massive review. Massive moment. Billings lbw b Ashwin 9(8) [4s-1]

Watson to Gayle, out Caught by Tahir!! Watto strikes! Removes his former RCB teammate. It was banged short by the Australian and the line was on leg. Gayle went for the pull half-heartedly as he was slightly cramped form room and all he could manage was a top-edge that lobs straight to short fine leg. A dolly for Tahir. Watson has his arms aloft. End of a superb knock from 'Universe Boss'. Gayle c Tahir b Watson 63(33) [4s-7 6s-4]

Tahir to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by Jadeja!! Agarwal holes out! A mistimed loft and he finds one of the safest pairs in the world. The leg-break on the stumps and Agarwal moved leg-side to go downtown. The bat face turned at the point of impact and hence lost his timing. Goes miles up in the air, but straight to RJ at long-on. Mayank Agarwal c Jadeja b Tahir 30(19) [4s-1 6s-2]

Tahir to Finch, out Lbw!! Aaron Finch is given OUT lbw. Back-to-back golden ducks for him. He has reviewed. That looked plumb. Let's see. Fair delivery. No bat. Three reds and he is outta here. Here's the comeback from CSK. It was the quick googly from Tahir and Finch definitely didn't pick that. Presses forward to block and got rapped on the front leg in front of off. That's plumb. Tahir is pumped. Runs with the arms aloft and slaps the CSK symbol with on his shirt. That's the passion with which he plays. Finch lbw b Tahir 0(1)

SN Thakur to Yuvraj, out Caught by Dhoni!! The CSKians go up, Yuvraj starts to walk. Doesn't wait for the umpire's decision. The cross-seamed short ball from Shardul Thakur and that's the reason for the extra bounce. Yuvraj read the length and line, but couldn't account for that tad extra bounce. Looked to ramp it towards third man and got a feather on it. MS won't drop those. Yuvraj c Dhoni b SN Thakur 20(13) [4s-2 6s-1]

SN Thakur to Ashwin, out Caught by Dhoni!! Dhoni catches and Ashwin has to walk back to the dressing room. That's not something we are used to. A shortish ball, slightly off-paced and Ashwin was back and across to pull it away. Top-edges and MS runs towards the square leg region to snaffle that. Ashwin c Dhoni b SN Thakur 14(11) [6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Nair, out Caught by Jadeja!! Dwayne Bravo is good. He is too good, specially at the death. It's the slower back of a length delivery from Bravo. Nair knew that was coming, still couldn't put it away. Went deep in his crease and went too hard on the pull. Mistimed to deep mid-wicket. Straightforward catch for RJ. Nair c Jadeja b Dwayne Bravo 29(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

Harbhajan to Rahul, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! That is a steal. Full toss outside off and the batsman chips the drive to cover. DJ Bravo takes it and breaks into a jig. For a moment he has forgotten about the damage done. That was a poor delivery but Rahul got carried away and lifted the ball aerially for the man at cover, who was on the edge of the circle, to take it. CSK have a small ray of hope. Rahul c Dwayne Bravo b Harbhajan 37(22) [4s-7]

A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Nitish Rana!! The Daredevils have been rocked early, excellent ball from Russell, hit the deck hard and got the ball to deviate away from outside off, drew Shreyas Iyer into a limp poke, the edge was found and it was travelling quickly. Rana dived across to his left at first slip, went with both hands and holds on. Shreyas Iyer c Nitish Rana b A Russell 4(3) [4s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, out Caught by Uthappa!! Tries to go for the third maximum on the trot and perishes. Hey bowlers, need a wicket? Bowl half-trackers. That's what Kuldeep did. He's bowled two and has two wickets. Was the short leg-break from the left-arm spinner, Maxwell spotted it and went deep in his crease. Pull too hard and loses his shape. Miscued and picked Uthappa at deep mid-wicket. A big wicket, this. Maxwell c Uthappa b Kuldeep Yadav 47(22) [4s-3 6s-4]

Narine to Chris Morris, out Bowled!! 100 IPL wickets for Sunil Narine! No reaction from the Caribbean; as usual. The off-break from Narine doesn't spin much. Goes straight and crashes into the off-pole. And what was Morris doing? He backed away a long way to loft it over covers. Missed it by a mile. Beaten on the outside edge. Seven down. Chris Morris b Narine 2(3)

Narine to Vijay Shankar, out Lbw!! Vijay Shankar is given out lbw and he reviews. Fair delivery. No bat involved. The impact was just above the kneeroll in front of off. What does the ball-tracker say? Three reds and Shankar goes off taking the only review with him. DD are falling apart here, without a fight. Turns in from a short of length and beats Shankar's clip/flick. He wasn't forward as well. The umpire raised the finger quickly. Vijay Shankar lbw b Narine 2(4)

Narine to Shami, out Caught by A Russell!! Shami departs. This was on the cards. He slogged from ball one and perishes. Chips down the track to smash the offie over deep mid-wicket. No timing whatsoever - courtesy the bat turned at the point of impact. Russell runs to his left from mid-wicket and pouches it with ease. Shami c A Russell b Narine 7(6) [4s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Boult, out Caught&Bowled!! It's over. Flighted delivery attacking the stumps, Boult chips it straight back to the bowler. Kuldeep Yadav gobbles it just above his head. Kolkata Knight Riders win by 71 runs. Boult c and b Kuldeep Yadav 0(2)

Shivam Mavi to Gambhir, out Bowled!! First IPL wicket for Mavi and he's chuffed to bits. Short of a length and angling across the left-hander, Gambhir was cramped for room as he went for the cut, gets an inside edge and the ball clatters into the stumps. Mavi is pumped and so are KKR. DD in dire straits now. Gambhir b Shivam Mavi 8(7) [4s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Pant, out Caught by Chawla!! Oh dear! We saw this yesterday for RCB, now Pant falls to a long hop. Dropped short and on the stumps, begging to be smacked, Pant swivelled across and nailed the pull, hard and flat - straight into the hands of Chawla at deep mid-wicket. The Eden Gardens finds its voice once again, Pant falls after an impressive knock. Pant c Chawla b Kuldeep Yadav 43(26) [4s-7 6s-1]

Tom Curran to Rahul Tewatia, out Caught by A Russell!! That's a tame dismissal for Tewatia and the Daredevils have lost half their side. This was full and this was wide of off, Tewatia saw the opportunity for a few runs, got his left leg out of the way and was looking to smash it over cover. He went so hard that he lost all the poise and flow, ended up slicing it straight to Russell at short extra-cover. As easy as it comes. Rahul Tewatia c A Russell b Tom Curran 1(2)

Shami to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Roy!! Good catch by Roy at long-on and another set KKR batsman departs. Got under the full delivery too much - that's why couldn't get the elevation he wanted. It was the knuckle ball as well - something Shami has developed recently, it swings away too, coming to the catch, Roy made it look easy - that's because he judged it to a nicety and took it with both hands without breaking a sweat. Chris Lynn c Roy b Shami 31(29) [4s-4 6s-1]

Chris Morris to Karthik, out Caught by Boult!! That is so poor from DK. No game awareness at all. Switched off at the wrong moment and didn't spot the change in field. Flicks and holes out to deep mid. Went for the same shot that got him two boundaries, but found the fielder. Chris Morris raises his arms in delight and sports a big smile on his face. Had his man finally. Karthik c Boult b Chris Morris 19(10) [4s-2 6s-1]

Boult to A Russell, out Bowled!! Gone now. If anyone needed a sample of how to get Russell out, just watch this from Boult. No fuss or drama. The old-fashioned yorker - still gets you wickets even today. Will do so after 100 years as well. Just that you have to get it right. Boult did, slipped it under A Russell's swinging bat and it clipped middle and leg. Superb bowling and that wicket could mean a difference of 20 at least to the eventual score. No big celebrations from Boult, just a fist pump. Replays show that it was delivered cross-seam as well. A Russell b Boult 41(12) [6s-6]

Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Gambhir!! Deception from Chris Morris and he dismisses Nitish Rana. The slower delivery just outside off, Nitish Rana this time scooped it straight up in the air and Gambhir tracked back from cover to settle under that. Nitish Rana c Gambhir b Chris Morris 59(35) [4s-5 6s-4]

Rahul Tewatia to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Chris Morris!! "Catch it buddy" shouted someone and it has been caught at point. All too simple really. Short and wide outside off, Shubman Gill fails to keep the cut down and gives Morris an easy opportunity inside the ring. Shubman Gill c Chris Morris b Rahul Tewatia 6(5) [4s-1]

Rahul Tewatia to Chawla, out Caught by Pant!! Chawla comes and goes. Without scoring. Cleverly bowled by Rahul Tewatia, saw Chawla charging out, pulled his length back, Chawla skies the lofted hit straight up and Pant calls for it to take it. Chawla c Pant b Rahul Tewatia 0(3)

Boult to Narine, out Caught by Maxwell!! Tag-team work and Narine is gone. They are checking the height on this. But Boult is fine on that count. Narine didn't get bat on the last delivery, this one he gets a thick edge on the slash and Pant tipped it over the bar, but great anticipation from Maxi at slip who tracked back and pouched it. Alert mind and good cricketing nous from the Australian. Deserved wicket for Boult. Narine c Maxwell b Boult 1(4)

Rahul Tewatia to Tom Curran, out Caught by Maxwell!! Rahul Tewatia is pumping his fist and punching the air. Three wickets in that over and just one run off it. Fantastic effort from the leggie. Tom Curran too like Chawla charges the bowler and can only find long-on. Tom Curran c Maxwell b Rahul Tewatia 2(3)

Nadeem to Uthappa, out Caught&Bowled!! That is Nadeem's wicket. Full marks for slowing it down and getting purchase from the wicket, which brought about Uthappa's downfall. He had swept Nadeem last over for a big six over mid-wicket, but this turns slightly and the top edge goes straight up. This time into the hands of Nadeem. Just when Uthappa was looking dangerous he gets out. Has been the story of his life. Uthappa c and b Nadeem 35(19) [4s-2 6s-3]

U Yadav to Suryakumar Yadav, out Bowled!! What a cracker to start! It's a golden duck for Suryakumar Yadav. A beaut from Umesh to begin, gets this to nip in a touch from a straightish off stump line. It was full and drew Suryakumar forward but he didn't anticipate the late movement. As a result, ended up playing around it and missed it completely. The woodwork is disturbed and up go the RCB players in jubilation. Umesh is absolutely pumped. Suryakumar Yadav b U Yadav 0(1)

U Yadav to Ishan Kishan, out Bowled!! Got himmmmm, yess goneeee! Umesh is breathing fire I tell you. If the first one was a good nut, talk about this one! What a corker! Goes full and it's almost the ideal inswinger that lands around off, Kishan plays around it, quite like Suryakumar did and sees the off stump go for a walk. Fab sight for any fast bowler and Umesh is on a hat-trick now, folks! RCB have started this game with a bang. Pressure mounting on the hosts. Ishan Kishan b U Yadav 0(1)

Corey Anderson to Lewis, out Caught by de Kock!! And the twist comes from a stress-fractured off-cutter. They've realized there's no point in bowling your best ball, and Anderson smartly floats up a slower change up. Lewis can't wait, he commits to a lofted slice, loses timing, has the ball grab the upper half of his bat and fly. Fly higher. Over Quinton, who's already messed up a few. He runs behind, under the swirl, comes back and collects. Lewis c de Kock b Corey Anderson 65(42) [4s-6 6s-5]

Corey Anderson to Rohit, out Krunal Pandya Run Out!! 1 run completed. More running troubles. Anderson standing in the way and Krunal has to take a step away to ensure he doesn't collide again. Can't afford getting injured. Well the tournament can't afford anyone else getting injured, the replacements aren't leaving their Counties. Right, Rohit smashed it down the ground, wants the strike. Pandya has to sacrifice. Hesitated for the second, stopped and takes the longer route. Alas, the dive is too late. Krunal Pandya run out (Woakes/Corey Anderson) 15(12) [4s-1 6s-1]

Woakes to Pollard, out Caught by de Villiers!! Smart slower stuff. Pollard never comfortable when he has to slog without getting set. Today's no different. Doesn't quite get his power right on the cutter that Woakes digs into the pitch on length. Tries whacking it over long-on, but AB's there. And he's good to take it reverse-cupped. Pollard c de Villiers b Woakes 5(7)

Corey Anderson to Rohit, out Caught by Woakes!! Real quick. Talk about timing even when you are getting out. Rohit backs away, smacks it down long-on's throat. And it's so flat that Pandya can't even cross over. Rohit c Woakes b Corey Anderson 94(52) [4s-10 6s-5]

Krunal Pandya to Washington Sundar, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! He got smashed in the first over, but he's got three wickets now. The widish delivery across the left-hander, Sundar mistimes the lofted drive over cover, hits it high and straight to long-off. Celebration time for Krunal Pandya. Washington Sundar c Suryakumar Yadav b Krunal Pandya 7(8) [4s-1]

Markande to Sarfaraz Khan, out Stumped!! Blind swinging from Sarfaraz Khan. Advances and goes for an almighty swing, but Markande is clever enough to bowl this wide outside off stump and force the batsman to reach out, completely missed and Tare, the sub keeper, does the rest. Sarfaraz Khan st (sub)Tare b Markande 5(6) [4s-1]

Bumrah to Woakes, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Soft dismissal. Slower delivery outside off stump, Woakes plays early and slices it straight to short third man. Bumrah gets his name into the wickets column to please himself and the ones who have taken him in their fantasy teams. By the way, that was Bumrah's 50th IPL wicket. Woakes c Krunal Pandya b Bumrah 11(11) [6s-1]

Bumrah to U Yadav, out Caught by Rohit!! Another one. Catching practice. They are checking for the no-ball. Oh no! More than half of his foot is inside the line. Why check that? It was a shortish delivery, Umesh slices the slog and skies it to cover. Hang on, the replay looks like it's not the wicket taking delivery. Umesh is at the non-striker's end. U Yadav c Rohit b Bumrah 1(2)

McClenaghan to de Kock, out Bowled!! And call it the text commentator's curse. McClenaghan snuffs out de Kock and Wankhede erupts. Nothing shot from de Kock. It was full and a semblance of tail back in. The batsman stepped forward and swung, completely down the wrong line and enough gap for the ball to sneak through to knock the off-stump. RCB lose their first wicket. de Kock b McClenaghan 19(12) [4s-2 6s-1]

McClenaghan to de Villiers, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! de Villiers perishes. Huge blow for RCB. Two wickets in the over and McClenaghan is turning it on here. Seemed like a certain ploy and de Villiers fell into the trap. Dug in short and there was a fielder positioned at deep mid-wicket. AB forgets, goes for the pull, doesn't bother to keep it down either. Flat and straight to Hardik, who cupped it. Straight down the gullet, didn't even had to move there. MI on top. de Villiers c Hardik Pandya b McClenaghan 1(2)

Krunal Pandya to Corey Anderson, out Caught by (sub)Duminy!! Anderson departs for a blob. Not a sweet IPL 2018 debut for the Kiwi all-rounder. Pandya gets two in two. Slowish and lured Anderson into a big shot. The batsmen went low and slogged, no timing whatsoever and he ended up hitting it straight to deep mid-wicket. Pandya is chuffed, so are rest of his team-mates. RCB digging a hole for themselves here. Corey Anderson c (sub)Duminy b Krunal Pandya 0(1)

Gowtham to Chris Lynn, out Bowled!! Duck for Chris Lynn! Couldn't have been a better start for the Royals, this. Lynn not having a great time, dropped a catch earlier and departs without troubling the scorers. It's a short delivery and with a bit of off-spin, Lynn goes back to cut and gets undone due to the lack of bounce and spin on that. No Lynn special tonight and the crowd at Jaipur erupts. Chris Lynn b Gowtham 0(2)

Gowtham to Uthappa, out Caught by Stokes!! Superb catch at the boundary from Stokes, showing great awareness here. It was drilled back hard by Uthappa, and Stokes had plenty to do at long-on. Initially, he had to take a brilliant overhead catch while making sure that he times his jump nicely. And then he had to toss the ball back in as his feet were going to encroach the cushions. He judges the situation to a nicety and the execution is spot on. Uthappa c Stokes b Gowtham 48(36) [4s-6 6s-2]

Shreyas Gopal to Narine, out Narine Run Out!! Poor piece of running there. First of all he tried to reverse sweep it and as it went off the pads to short third man. Narine wanted the run but Uthappa sent him back. There was no chance that Uthappa would have completed the run. Unadkat is the man who throws it at the keeper's end to catch Narine well short of his crease. Narine run out (Unadkat/Buttler) 35(25) [4s-5 6s-1]

Nitish Rana to D Arcy Short, out Bowled!! D Arcy Short's painful innings comes to an end. A fist pump from Nitish Rana. Bowled the slider and it rushed past the cross-batted hoick of D Arcy Short. Clipped off and credit to DK for getting Nitish Rana back on. The bowler has justified that move with another wicket. D Arcy Short b Nitish Rana 44(43) [4s-5 6s-1]
batsman: Nitish Rana to D Arcy Short

Commentary: Kuldeep Yadav to Tripathi, out Caught by A Russell!! Good catch by Russell at short cover. Leapt at the right time to catch. Tripathi went inside out but couldn't keep the in-to-out shot down, bit more elevation and he would've got a couple at least. Tripathi c A Russell b Kuldeep Yadav 15(11) [4s-2]

Chawla to Stokes, out Caught by Nitish Rana!! Chawla has bowled very well tonight and gets the dangerous Stokes out. To the left-hander he has been bowling mainly googlies and this one is the same as well. Stokes was charging Chawla and it kept on going away from him. Sliced it high up in the air and Rana backtracking from cover takes a good catch. Not easy to judge that in the lights. Stokes c Nitish Rana b Chawla 14(11) [6s-1]

Tom Curran to Gowtham, out Caught by Shivam Mavi!! Easy for backward point. Back of the hand slower delivery, Tom Curran bowls that well. He is so confident with that delivery that he regularly and surprisingly bowled it in the Ashes Test. To not great effect it must be said. But here he gets Gowtham slicing it off a thick outside edge and grabs a wicket. Gowtham c Shivam Mavi b Tom Curran 12(7) [6s-1]

Tom Curran to Shreyas Gopal, out Bowled!! Both Karnataka men gone in consecutive balls. To Tom Curran. He takes off his aeroplane and Mitch Johnson is seen clapping from the dugout. Pacy length delivery, on off, Shreyas Gopal was late on the defence and it knocked the stump out of the ground. Played a bit inside the line and had no footwork to deal with that sharp delivery. Tom Curran is now on a hat-trick. Shreyas Gopal b Tom Curran 0(1)

Shivam Mavi to Buttler, out D Kulkarni Run Out!! 1 run completed. Almost a royal mess-up. But Shivam Mavi recovers to run Kulkarni out. Driven to long-off. No way the second was on, not with Kulkarni running like that. Shivam Mavi fumbled the throw but recovered to run Kulkarni out, who couldn't make it. But importantly Buttler will be on strike. D Kulkarni run out (Shubman Gill/Shivam Mavi) 3(3)

Nitish Rana to Rahane, out Stumped!! Brilliant from DK but felt that Rahane gave up all too easily. Could've put pressure on DK by attempting to dive, none of that and he goes. Was down the track looking to flick, richocheted off the pad and went in front of DK who calmly collects the ball and then backflicks to hit direct. One glove was off quickly and that made it easier for DK. Can't understand why it has been changed to stumped. According to the laws of the game, when a batsman is attempting a run - Rahane surely was - it should be declared run-out. Weird! Rahane st Karthik b Rana 36(19) [4s-5 6s-1]

Shivam Mavi to Samson, out Caught by Kuldeep Yadav!! Gone now. As soon as he hit that, Samson knew he had made a mistake. Good short of length delivery on the hips, rising, Samson cannot keep the short-arm jab pull down and picks out deep square to perfection. Kuldeep didn't move a muscle there. Samson c Kuldeep Yadav b Shivam Mavi 7(8) [4s-1]

S Kaul to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by Deepak Hooda!! Such a soft dismissal! Often been the story with Agarwal, gets a good looking start and then weirdly, throws it away. Slower ball from Kaul and it was a bit short, Agarwal was in two minds whether to go hard at it or just use his touch. In the end, all he managed was to spoon it straight to Hooda at backward point. A dolly that is and once again, SRH get a wicket at just about the right time. Mayank Agarwal c Deepak Hooda b S Kaul 18(9) [4s-2 6s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Nair, out Caught by Dhawan!! Nair targets the longest boundary and holes out. Bhuvneshwar gets his man, finally. Length delivery just outside off, Nair moved across and whiplashed it. Needed to generate more power to clear the ropes. Fails and hits it straight to Dhawan at deep mid-wicket, who grabs it and does the thigh-five celebration. Nair c Dhawan b Bhuvneshwar 31(21) [4s-3 6s-1]

Rashid Khan to Rahul, out Lbw!! Rashid draws first blood! SRH needed this and not surprisingly, it's their star spinner who does the job. The slider that shoots through a touch low, Rahul wasn't anticipating the lack of bounce and went through with a pull. Got pinged on the pad and that's as plumb as it gets. End of a smooth opening stand but KXIP haven't really been allowed to get away. Rahul lbw b Rashid Khan 18(21) [4s-3]

Mohit Sharma to Saha, out Bowled!! Saha wasn't timing it at all and this was always on the cards. It was a good length delivery at the stumps, Saha wanted to play it across the line, his willow misses it totally and ball disturbs the furniture. Punjab are off to a dream start here. The ball just brushes the off stick. Saha b Mohit Sharma 6(7) [4s-1]

Andrew Tye to Williamson, out Caught by Finch!! Williamson will now know that this is a big, big ground. Steps out to a slower delivery -- knuckle ball, actually -- but can you blame him? Mistimes this attempted loft and there's long-off waiting, secretly thanking the big dimensions that this ground entails. Williamson c Finch b Andrew Tye 54(41) [4s-3 6s-2]

Andrew Tye to Deepak Hooda, out Caught by (sub)Manoj Tiwary!! That's been hit high but SRH here are unravelling, surrendering to Mohali's big dimensions. Knuckle ball, another one yeah, and Deepak Hooda finds long-on with this big loft. Manoj Tiwary there, who takes it and then kicks the ball away in celebration... Deepak Hooda c (sub)Manoj Tiwary b Andrew Tye 5(5)

Mohit Sharma to Y Pathan, out Bowled!! Chops it back onto the stumps. This is a back of the hand slower ball from Mohit Sharma and Pathan was completely foxed by it. He wanted to drive it through the off-side but gets a thick inside edge and ball comes back in the direction of the stumps. Clever variation in pace from Mohit Sharma, he is having a good night thus far. Y Pathan b Mohit Sharma 19(13) [4s-3]

Shreyas Gopal to Raina, out Caught by Gowtham!! Stunner! Needed something like this to break this partnership and the two Karnataka lads combine to send Raina back. Another wrong 'un from Gopal and Raina once more spotted it early, sat down on his knee to play the slog and sweep, struck it powerfully and flat towards deep mid-wicket, the ball was dying in front of Gowtham, who covered good ground, dived full length and took it inches from the ground. Raina c Gowtham b Shreyas Gopal 46(29) [4s-9]

Shreyas Gopal to Dhoni, out Caught by Gowtham!! Juggled and taken. Gowtham must be a relieved man. For a second it seemed like he parried it over.
