Dhoni shimmies down and gets close to the wrong 'un, smokes it flat and hard towards long-on, Gowtham times his jump and goes reverse cup, but the ball bursts out and luckily for him goes straight up, he gathers himself and completes the catch. Dhoni c Gowtham b Shreyas Gopal 5(3) [4s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to Billings, out Caught by Stokes!! Third for Gopal. He's been exceptional today. Standout bowler by far for Royals. It was the sort of half-tracker that got Kohli and de Villiers couple of matches ago, Billings went deep in the crease to play the pull and hit it straight to deep mid-wicket. The big England all-rounder ain't dropping that. RR fighting back with a couple of wickets. Billings c Stokes b Shreyas Gopal 3(7)

Laughlin to Watson, out Caught by Buttler!! Edged and taken. Some of the RR players run up to Watto and congratulate him. He was one of them for eight years and walks off to a standing ovation from the yellow army. Fine innings from the Australian. Fuller and outside off, Watson with his typical bent knee looks to smoke it over long-off, only manages an outside edge to Buttler. Watson c Buttler b Laughlin 106(57) [4s-9 6s-6]

Laughlin to Rayudu, out Caught by Buttler!! Laughlin strikes in his first over and sends Rayudu back to the hut. It was a length delivery outside off, too close to the body and Rayudu attempted a cut, he got an edge to it. Buttler behind the wickets makes sure to hold on to it. The batsman was in two minds there, whether to guide it to third man or play a cut shot. The dilemma resulted in his downfall. Rayudu c Buttler b Laughlin 12(8) [4s-2]

SN Thakur to Klaasen, out Bowled!! Gone! Shardul Thakur strikes. A nothing shot from the South African. No feet movement either. A cross-seamed length ball attacking the stumps, Klaasen stays leg-side of the ball and plays down the wrong line. The stumps get shattered. CSK have an early breakthrough. Klaasen b SN Thakur 7(7) [4s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Buttler, out Caught by Tahir!! Bravo is on his way with those celebrations, shaking it real nice. Completely deceived Buttler with this slower ball. It was a short of length delivery well wide of off, Buttler was looking to drag it away through the on-side. But by the time it arrived, he had completely lost his shape. The top-edge balloons towards short third man where Tahir moves a few yards back and settles under it comfortably. Buttler c Tahir b Dwayne Bravo 22(17) [4s-1 6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to R Tripathi, out Caught by Billings!! Goes down on the back knee, wanting to unleash a big slog-sweep against this slower ball, but he's miscued it off a thick top-edge. He'll be taken at deep mid-wicket. Yes. So Bravo has his second, and there's more moves from him. R Tripathi c Billings b Dwayne Bravo 5(5)

Tahir to Stokes, out Caught by Billings!! Stokes's head dropped as soon as this left his bat. Knew he hadn't got it off the middle. Flighted leg-break from Tahir, it comes off a thick top-edge as Stokes looks to slog-sweep and it's calmly taken at the mid-wicket boundary. Stokes c Billings b Tahir 45(37) [4s-3 6s-1]

Watson to Gowtham, out Caught by Dhoni!! Slower short ball, Gowtham swings into a pull but all he manages is a top-edge through to Dhoni. The Royals sinking rapidly now. Hardly any celebrations from CSK. Dhoni just throws the ball back and waves his players to their respective positions. Gowtham c Dhoni b Watson 1(2)

SN Thakur to Binny, out Caught&Bowled!! This is a brilliant one-handed return catch from Thakur, who is absolutely fired up. He rushed Binny with the short ball, and then rushed forward in his followthrough before diving and taking it with his right hand. It was flapped up off the splice by Binny, after getting severely cramped. Binny c and b SN Thakur 10(8) [4s-1]

Karn Sharma to Unadkat, out Bowled!! Clatters the stumps with a googly. Unadkat has had his fun, no more. Tries for another slog-sweep but probably didn't pick the variation. Unadkat b Karn Sharma 16(10) [4s-3]

Karn Sharma to Laughlin, out Caught by Dhoni!! Faint tickle from Laughlin, and that's it. RR bowled out with nine balls to go. Flat leg-break, Laughlin makes room to drive off the back foot but it climbs on him due to the overspin imparted. Dhoni takes care of the edge. Laughlin c Dhoni b Karn Sharma 0(1)

Chahar to Samson, out Caught by Karn Sharma!! Two down! Samson is distraught as he walks off. He has picked the man in the deep perfectly. Short of a length delivery on the body and Samson went aerial on the heave. Got it off the top portion of the bat and found Karn Sharma at deep backward square leg. As he walks off, mocks the pull shot (to be played along the ground). Too late! Samson c Karn Sharma b Chahar 2(3)

Chahar to Rahane, out Bowled!! Another knuckle ball, another wicket. Simple, right! Rajasthan are now in deep trouble. Chahar changed the position of the ball in his hand at the last moment and Rahane had no clue about it. Waltzed down the track and wanted to pull it away. Early to swing the bat and the ball scoots under the blade. 32/3! Rahane b Chahar 16(11) [4s-1 6s-1]

Mujeeb to Narine, out Caught by Nair!! No Narine show today. Falls cheaply and it's the youngster from Afghanistan, who has struck in his first over. Full credit to Ashwin, perfectly set a trap and Narine has fallen into it. It was the googly from Rahman, Narine cleared his front leg and whacked across the line, forgets there is a fielder in the deep. Nair nearly made a hash of it as he misjudged it initially. Recovers in time by diving head first at deep mid-wicket and pouched it superbly. Narine c Nair b Mujeeb 1(4)

Andrew Tye to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Rahul!! Edged and caught! A pre-meditated slog from Lynn as he shuffled right across the stumps, Tye saw it coming and fired it wide of off, Lynn was aiming for the mid-wicket fence, gets a thick and audible edge through, KL doesn't drop those and it's a much needed wicket for KXIP. They have got rid of one dangerman, but here comes the bigger danger - it's Andre Russell. Chris Lynn c Rahul b Andrew Tye 74(41) [4s-6 6s-4]

Barinder to A Russell, out Caught by Nair!! That's a big wicket for KXIP! That might turn out to be a difference of 20-30 runs. This was another yorker from Sran, he missed his length by a bit, Russell brought his bat down like a sledge-hammer and heaved it back over the bowler's head. Only the timing wasn't as great as it normally is. Good captaincy from Ashwin to have long-off fine as well, straight down the throat of Karun and KKR have lost their fifth wicket. A Russell c Nair b Barinder 10(7) [4s-2]

Barinder to Karthik, out Caught by Andrew Tye!! KKR are not finishing on a high! Karthik falls after a fine cameo, this was a slower length ball from Sran, Karthik was deep in the crease as he shovelled it towards the on-side, went off the inner half of the bat and straight to Tye at deep backward square leg. He takes it reverse cupped and KXIP continue to chip away at the wickets. Karthik c Andrew Tye b Barinder 43(28) [4s-6]

Andrew Tye to Tom Curran, out Caught by Rajpoot!! KKR are losing some momentum towards the end. Tye has another wicket to his name, this was a yorker length delivery outside off, Curran jammed his bat down hard, gets a thick outside edge and the ball loops to Rajpoot at short third man. Some other day, it might have gone either to his left or right, but not today. Tom Curran c Rajpoot b Andrew Tye 1(3)

Ashwin to Uthappa, out Caught by Nair!! Straight down the gullet of Nair. The time-out has broken Uthappa's concentration. Was looking so good and has thrown it away. Flat and shorter from Ashwin, Uthappa rocked back and hammered it off the sweet spot. Hit it flat and didn't have enough wings to clear the ropes. Nair didn't have to move an inch at deep mid-wicket as he cupped it. Eden Gardens has been muted. The half-trackers working well for the spinners throughout this tournament so far. Uthappa c Nair b Ashwin 34(23) [4s-5 6s-1]

Mujeeb to Nitish Rana, out Nitish Rana Run Out!! Oh, what happened there? KKR have gifted a wicket away to the visitors. Hare-brained running from the duo. Complete break in communication results in a run-out. Flatter outside off, Rana went back and laced the cut to backward point. Rana set off without even looking at his partner. Lynn wasn't interested and sends him back. Both were ball-watching and Rana had no chance of returning there. Rajpoot gathers it and fires a neat throw to the keeper, who does the rest. Rana, the man in form for KKR has to depart. Punjab clawing back here. Nitish Rana run out (Rajpoot/Rahul) 3(5)

Narine to Rahul, out Caught by Tom Curran!! He's mistimed this high in the air and deep mid-wicket takes it. Short ball, Rahul went for the pull, came off the bottom of the bat as the ball came slowly onto him. Walks off to a great applause, raises the bat to the crowd. He really wanted to end this game in a hurry. What a top knock though. It was so good to watch him score quick runs with proper cricketing shots. Rahul c Tom Curran b Narine 60(27) [4s-9 6s-2]

Washington Sundar to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Siraj!! Soft soft dismissal. And the sea of red is alive again. The momentum is broken and Iyer has himself to blame. That would have been a wide had he let go, instead reaches out for the full delivery and slices it to short third man. There was no need for him to play that. Could have picked up a wide and then made use of the extra delivery. Instead he loses his wicket. RCB needed that wicket as the partnership had started to flourish and was looking dangerous. Shreyas Iyer c Siraj b Washington Sundar 52(31) [4s-4 6s-3]

Chahal to Maxwell, out Caught by Siraj!! Chahal has his bunny. He has made it a habit of removing the Aussie. Had the better of him during the ODI and T20 leg in 2017. Now also was held back by Kohli specifically for this. Flighted leg-break on off and middle, Maxwell tries the fancy reverse sweep and is undone by the extra bounce, the top-edge balloons towards short third man, Siraj runs to his right, dives full length and manages to cling on. Maxwell c Siraj b Chahal 4(6)

Corey Anderson to Pant, out Caught by de Villiers!! AB clings on to the skier and a fine knock comes to an end. He has put his team in the ascendancy here. The cross seamer from Anderson, seemed to have held up on the surface, Pant went for the loft back over the bowler, skewed it off the base of the bat to long-on. AB ain't dropping those. Tewatia also pats his partner on the back as he walks off. Pant c de Villiers b Corey Anderson 85(48) [4s-6 6s-7]

U Yadav to Gambhir, out Caught by Chahal!! This was bound to happen. Gambhir was struggling to get going and finally throws it away. Probably the pressure of the dot balls created by the pacers. This was short in length and hurried on to the batsman, and although Gambhir picked the length early he couldn't middle the pull. Gets it off the splice towards short mid-wicket where Chahal completes an easy catch. Gambhir c Chahal b U Yadav 3(10)

Chahal to Roy, out Bowled!! Knocked him over. Gambhir departed early and it's Roy who departs now. That was a flat and quick delivery on leg, Roy goes back in his crease to drag it away but gets undone due to the lack of bounce. The ball skids on and takes down his leg-stump. Fine display of bowling by RCB this has been so far. Both DD openers are back in the pavilion now. Onus on the middle order batsmen to get them out of trouble. Roy b Chahal 5(16)

Harshal Patel to Kohli, out Caught by Boult!! Just the worst of full tosses. No forget that. It's never going to be remembered. Boult has clinched that 10 lakh cheque for the end of the season. It's a catch for the ages. A viral catch. So Kohli quite obviously whips the innocuous, without bothering to keep it down. Over square leg. Boult comes out of nowhere, sticks his right hand up. And it sticks. With him eventually falling in a millimeter in front of the FBB prismic sponsor on the rope. Nobody can seem to believe. Yeah, muggles, it's true. Kohli c Boult b Harshal Patel 30(26) [4s-2 6s-1]

Boult to Corey Anderson, out Bowled!! Another twist. That ideal ball in the times of misery. Full, straight, bang in the blockhole. Anderson backs away, gives himself some room to go downtown. Misses. Big time. And the ball sneaks under to make a mess of the timber. And they take the time-out. The only strategy RCb need now is to find ways of giving AB his strike. And his century. Corey Anderson b Boult 15(13) [6s-1]

Maxwell to Vohra, out Caught by Roy!! Roy almost makes a mess of this at long leg, but he's recovered fantastically to take a superb low catch diving forward. They've referred it upstairs, but there's nothing wrong with it. Clean catch. His fingers are underneath it. The Englishman initially misjudged this top-edged sweep from Vohra, stalled in his position when he should have been moving forward. But makes up with a dive. Vohra c Roy b Maxwell 2(5)

Nadeem to Kohli, out de Kock Run Out!! De Kock is gone by a mile. Dreadful running. There's a tremendous mix-up between the two batsmen and de Kock ends up around halfway down the pitch before the bails are taken off. The ball was patted towards backward point, Kohli started running, stuttered to look at his partner, and then ran through. But de Kock never really took off. de Kock run out (Vijay Shankar/Pant) 18(16) [4s-1 6s-1]

S Kaul to Rayudu, out Rayudu Run Out!! 1 run completed. What just happened there? "One of the very best from Rayudu," says Sanjay Manjrekar on air and I couldn't agree more. He lifts the back of a length delivery on the bounce to long-off, settles with a single as Pandey lobs the ball back to Kaul, who fumbles and Rayudu thought there was a chance to steal a second. Raina stands his ground and by the time Rayudu turns back, Kaul gets to the ball and throws it to KW to remove the bails. There was never a second and Rayudu knew that, he walks up to Raina with a smile on his face, hugs him and trudges off to a standing ovation. Rayudu run out (S Kaul/Williamson) 79(37) [4s-9 6s-4]

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, out Caught by Deepak Hooda!! Bhuvneshwar has his man now! That's a big wicket for the Sunrisers, this was the knuckle ball and Watson didn't pick it, he was done in by the change of pace as well, went through with the flick far too early, the ball lobbed off the splice of the bat and it's a simple low catch for Hooda - at short mid-wicket. The crowd finds its voice, no heroics from Watson today. Watson c Deepak Hooda b Bhuvneshwar 9(15) [6s-1]

Rashid Khan to du Plessis, out Stumped!! .. and Rashid strikes with his first ball. A different day and some different results already. du Plessis was struggling to get a move, doesn't spot the leg-break, lunged forward on the sweep and missed, to make things worse - he slipped as he tried to get back into the crease. Saha whipped the bails off with du Plessis well outside the crease, Anil Chaudhary doesn't need the help of the third umpire, off he goes, a poor start for du Plessis in IPL 2018. du Plessis st Saha b Rashid Khan 11(13) [4s-1]

Chahar to Bhui, out Caught by Watson!! Edged and taken! Watson put one down in the previous contest but makes sure to take one today. It's a full length delivery outside off, Bhui pokes at it and gets a thick outside edge to Watson at first slip. The youngster walks back to the hut without troubling the scorers. Excellent start for CSK and Chahar. Bhui c Watson b Chahar 0(5)

Karn Sharma to Shakib, out Caught by Raina!! Gets him with the googly. 100th T20 wicket for Karn Sharma. It was flighted up on leg-stump, once Shakib saw that line he knelt down to sweep. But there was a bit of extra bounce with this delivery which produced the top-edge. Raina accepts the dolly at short fine leg. Shakib c Raina b Karn Sharma 24(19) [4s-2 6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Williamson, out Caught by Jadeja!! Taken. Taken, taken, taken. It's a brilliant catch from Jadeja, sprinting forward from long-on and diving in front with two hands. Oh Williamson. He's done in by this slower ball. Back of length from Bravo, the ball stops on Williamson who miscues his flat-batted swipe off the splice. Bravo shows off with his dance moves. CSK will back themselves from here. Williamson c Jadeja b Dwayne Bravo 84(51) [4s-5 6s-5]

SN Thakur to Y Pathan, out Caught by Raina!! Sliced up in the air, and that should be it. Raina isn't dropping that at extra cover. It's the knuckle ball in action again, Pathan swings hard at this length delivery but it comes right off the outside half. He immediately hangs his head. SRH running out of gas. Y Pathan c Raina b SN Thakur 45(27) [4s-1 6s-4]

Chahar to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Karn Sharma!! That's the second duck of this innings. First it was Bhui and now it's Manish. Was a full length delivery outside off and swinging away from the batsman, Manish went ahead with his shot and ended up slicing it to the man at third man. Surprising to see that it carried all the way to third man. Probably there was a bit of extra bounce on that. Manish Pandey c Karn Sharma b Chahar 0(2)

Chahar to Deepak Hooda, out Caught by Jadeja!! Third wicket for Chahar. He's steaming in here. Bowls a full length delivery around off with not much pace in it, Hooda is a tad early in his flick as the ball hits the back of the willow before it spoons up towards wide mid-off. Jadeja won't miss those. SRH in trouble. They're feeling the absence of Dhawan already. Deepak Hooda c Jadeja b Chahar 1(7)

D Kulkarni to Lewis, out Bowled!! This is what swing up front will bring you. Such a blunder it was from RR to bench Dhawal against CSK on a wicket that had a bit of grass. Lovely inswinger outside off stump, Lewis is not a keen mover of the front foot, just throws his bat at it to thrash the ball through cover, only manages an inside edge that shatters the sticks. Dream start from Dhawal Kulkarni. Lewis b D Kulkarni 0(1)

D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Buttler!! Oh my word, unnecessary cheekiness from Kishan doesn't come off well. Tried to emulate Rishabh Pant's reverse scoop and fails miserably. Nonetheless, brilliant innings from him comes to an end. Second wicket for Kulkarni. Went full and wide, turned out to be a low full toss. Kishan was ready to scoop it over short fine, but messes it up and spoons it up in the air. Easy-peasy for Buttler. Ishan Kishan c Buttler b D Kulkarni 58(42) [4s-4 6s-3]

Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Buttler!! RR are pegging back MI here. Suryakumar Yadav has looked out of sorts since a last couple of overs and finally, he decides to throw his wicket away to Unadkat. Again the off-cutter, slanted around off. Suryakumar Yadav in a bid to step up the pedal, miscues it totally. Top-edges it into the night sky, was swirling in the air. Buttler called for it, moved across to his left and safely grabbed it. Suryakumar Yadav c Buttler b Unadkat 72(47) [4s-6 6s-3]

Unadkat to Rohit, out Rohit Run Out!! Now, now. Two wickets in a span of three balls and this is a prized scalp for Rajasthan. Rohit is livid with himself, punches his bat in anger. It was his call and he has to pay the price. You just cannot underestimate Rahane in the field. A meeky tap to the right of Rahane. He moved across in a flash, picked it up with one-hand and released the throw in one-motion to break the stumps. Only one stump to aim at and bingo! Rohit wasn't even in the frame. Goner! Rohit run out (Rahane) 0(1)

Jofra Archer to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Klaasen!! Maiden IPL wicket for Archer. Archer will be chuffed to bits. Krunal loses shape as he winds up for a slog. Archer slips in a knuckle ball that holds up a touch on the pitch. Krunal went for the longer boundary - the deep mid-wicket area. Lacked timing and power, straight to Klaasen. Look at Archer, he breaks into a jig. Krunal Pandya c Klaasen b Jofra Archer 7(6) [4s-1]

Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, out Bowled!! Jofra has his revenge. Sweet. Rip roaring yorker, angling on leg. Hardik is beaten for sheer pace (145.6kph). Couldn't get his bat down in time, the ball slams his pad and deflected back onto the stumps to clatter the middle stump. MI losing steam towards the end. Hardik Pandya b Jofra Archer 4(2) [4s-1]

Jofra Archer to McClenaghan, out Bowled!! Wow. Wow. 149.2 thunderbolt from Archer. Demolishes the stumps. What an over this is turning out to be. Two wickets in two balls and he's on a hat-trick now. Harpooned it full and at the stumps, McClenaghan had no clue and failed to negate it. Straight through him to shatter the stumps. McClenaghan b Jofra Archer 0(1)

Hardik Pandya to Stokes, out Bowled!! It's in the blockhole. Stokes has been walking all across, but has been getting down in time to dig things out. Until this one. It's full, it's into the base of leg, and Stokes' walked across, freezing in front of the stumps as he tries using the angle to swipe it behind square. Done in for pace. Done in for dip. This is exactly where Rajasthan need to avoid doing a Mumbai. Stokes b Hardik Pandya 40(27) [4s-3 6s-1]

Bumrah to Samson, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! It was all timing till it lasted. The moment it deserts him, he falls. It was Bumrah's famed slower gripper, Samson tries hoicking it into cow corner. Gropes only the toe-end, spoons high and Hardik runs in. Nah, he ain't messing these up. Samson c Hardik Pandya b Bumrah 52(39) [4s-4]

Bumrah to Buttler, out Bowled!! Perfect peach. And Rajasthan are well and truly doing a death over Mumbai. Bumrah's the Jofra in the remake. Nothing slow here, full paced, 144kph, hitting the good length, seaming in sharply and staying low to go through the bat and pad on Buttler's meek prod forward. Buttler b Bumrah 6(8)

Mustafizur to Klaasen, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! The bridge is falling. The fortess is falling in dramatic fashion. Klaasen gets himself a golden duck on his home debut. Fizz comes up with his go-to ball - a cutter slanting across. Klaasen with flat feet looks to drive away from his body, gets the customary edge and Ishan's diving low to his right to collect. Yes his black eye doesn't stop him from judging these perfectly. Klaasen c Ishan Kishan b Mustafizur 0(1)

Hardik Pandya to Jofra Archer, out Caught&Bowled!! Another twist. Agatha Christie would be so damn proud. Pandya lets out the bouncer, neatly directed into the head, and Archer's pulls in desperation, top-edging it high. Pandya takes matters into his own hands. Calls and holds his nerve. Jofra Archer c and b Hardik Pandya 8(9) [4s-1]

Krunal Pandya to R Tripathi, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Even Krunal Pandya cannot believe it. Gets that rainbow-from-this-palm-to-other pose dead right. A bit of loop after that first ball, and Tripathi middles this straight to mid-on. Straight to him. Would have wanted to go over the fielder but times it right into his hands. Well, this debut at the top doesn't go so well.. R Tripathi c Suryakumar Yadav b Krunal Pandya 9(8) [4s-1]

McClenaghan to Rahane, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! McClenaghan had pared down Rajasthan with pace, or the lack of it. Three slower deliveries in a row and that was it for Rahane. Takes it on with a flat-batted swat and all he manages is a toe-end to mid-wicket. Krunal's tall and leaps a little to take this screamer. It's a pun alright, because you should have seen Krunal screaming. Rahane c Krunal Pandya b McClenaghan 14(17) [4s-1]

Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, out Christian Run Out!! 1 run completed. Ashwin was confident after whipping the bails off and he was spot on. Shortish from Ashwin, Shreyas flicks it wide of long-on, Mayank rushed to the ball and fired in a perfect through on the bounce and adjacent to the sticks. Ashwin shatters the stumps. The second run was on and Christian should have been a touch more quicker. TV umpire has a look and catches Christian a few inches short. Christian run out (Mayank Agarwal/Ashwin) 6(11)

Andrew Tye to Rahul Tewatia, out Caught by Rahul!! Got to be a slower into the pitch and it's done the trick. Maybe Andrew Tye won't mind about bowling the extra ball now with the wide call earlier. This was cleverly angled across the left-hander on a good length, Tewatia goes for a big slog and gets an edge that goes slowly to Rahul. Rahul Tewatia c Rahul b Andrew Tye 24(21) [4s-1 6s-1]

Barinder to Plunkett, out Caught by Nair!! And what does he do first ball? Advances and connects well, but finds the fielder at deep backward square leg. It was a short slower ball, Plunkett wanted to flick that in the gap wide of deep mid-wicket, but hit it too square and too well. Plunkett c Nair b Barinder 0(1)

Rajpoot to Prithvi Shaw, out Bowled!! That's not a bad debut at all. Dropped a catch in the first innings but walked in to bat in all his elements. Was a bit overamibtious here, you could say, and Rajpoot has beaten him with a 134ks delivery. Shaw tried a hack across the line, missed the seam-up delivery and lost the top of his off-stump. Prithvi Shaw b Rajpoot 22(10) [4s-4]

Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Finch!! In the air, hasn't hit this well and Finch runs around to his left from long-off to take the catch. What a squeeze this is from KXIP. Shreyas Iyer is distraught and he looks towards the sky. The flatter delivery outside off stump, Shreyas slices the loft high in the air as the ball spun away from him. He wanted to go over long-off. Shreyas Iyer c Finch b Mujeeb 57(45) [4s-5 6s-1]

Rajpoot to Maxwell, out Caught by Andrew Tye!! They're checking Rajpoot's front foot but he's fine. A bit of a sudden rush of blood from Maxwell, but he bats like that, doesn't he? Didn't read the cutter that was pitched on a back of a length, went for the mightly hack across the line and sliced it off the toe-end to deep mid-wicket. There were two other fielders running back from inside the ring but that was Tye's catch all the way. Maxwell c Andrew Tye b Rajpoot 12(10) [4s-1 6s-1]

Andrew Tye to Gambhir, out Caught by Finch!! They all want to go home. Gambhir is a bit early into tucking this seam-up delivery on a back of a length, and pops a leading edge to mid-off. Sticky Kotla? Certainly for Delhi, now. Gambhir c Finch b Andrew Tye 4(13)

Mujeeb to Pant, out Bowled!! Through 'im! Carrom ball from round the wicket this, and it spins in to cleave Pant into two. He's trying to clip it through mid-wicket, doesn't have his head around this variation (or Mujeeb's stock ball?) and succumbs. Pant b Mujeeb 4(7)

Avesh Khan to Finch, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Huge wicket! Just like Rahul, Finch is also beaten for pace in his first ball against Avesh and the young lad has knocked the Aussie off. Superb stuff and he is pumped up. Back of a length outside off, clocked 148.7kph and it did seem really fast off the surface as well. Finch too didn't help his cause as he just tried to use his hands to lift this away down the ground. Wasn't there for that shot, not with this kind of pace and he was late as well. Popped an easy catch towards extra cover. Finch c Shreyas Iyer b Avesh Khan 2(4)

Avesh Khan to Yuvraj, out Caught by Pant!! The inside-edge luck runs out. And eventually the inside-edge takes him to his doom. Blame it on his feet refusing to move, yet again. Avesh keeps it on a back of a length, Yuvraj loads up again to flat-bat across the line. Inside-tickle, and no matter how loud Kotla is, the nick is louder. Yuvraj c Pant b Avesh Khan 14(17) [4s-1]

Plunkett to Nair, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! The time-out syndrome. Nair had to kick on, and he decides to do it with a lofted whip. The ball just doesn't come on, sticks, grabs the inside half of his bat and for a change somebody can catch. But Iyer almost keeps up with the trend - running across from long-on and juggling. Just. Nair c Shreyas Iyer b Plunkett 34(32) [4s-4]

Christian to Miller, out Caught by Plunkett!! Add another to his repertoire. When he doesn't have the ball in hand, the ball will follow him in the field. A full floater from Christian, inviting an away from the body drive. Sliced uppishly, flat and Plunkett at deep sweeper dives forward. The catches can be taken again. Miller c Plunkett b Christian 26(19) [4s-1 6s-1]

Boult to Ashwin, out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! Wide yorker, well in the allowed-zone this time. Ashwin stretches, and he knows there's nobody square of the wicket in the deep. All he has to do is clear point. Tries squeezing his steer, but ends up spooning it out to backward point, where Tewatia times his jump superbly, reverse cupping. Ashwin c Rahul Tewatia b Boult 6(7)

Boult to Andrew Tye, out Bowled!! Dragged on. Boult goes back to his trusted full-wide yorker. Tye loads up for yet-another-hoick, giving it his all in his swing. Gets some bat for a change, it's the inside-edge and it's chopped onto off. A four-run-wicket final over, you really can't get greedier. Andrew Tye b Boult 3(9)

Plunkett to Rahul, out Caught by Avesh Khan!! Excellent catch! It's the young man Avesh Khan, you cannot keep him out of the action and this is a massive wicket for DD. The dangerous Rahul needs to depart. Clever from Plunkett, the slower ball on a shorter length and I don't think that Rahul picked this variation. Went across on the back foot for the short arm jab but got no pace to work with at all. Mistimed it badly and Avesh at short fine leg judged it brilliantly with a dive forward. Plucked it inches above the ground. Brilliant! Rahul c Avesh Khan b Plunkett 23(15) [4s-3 6s-1]

Plunkett to Mayank Agarwal, out Bowled!! The off pole has gone for a walk! What a sight for any fast bowler and Plunkett is thrilled! Horror stroke from Mayank though and he has wasted another start. Slightly short of a good length around off, this was just above 145kph and that's what probably foxed Mayank who was expecting the slower ball. No excuse for the shot though, a wild slog across the line and misses it completely. Ruffled his pad before crashing into the stumps. DD are right on top here. Mayank Agarwal b Plunkett 21(16) [4s-3]

Rashid Khan to Krunal Pandya, out Lbw!! Much-needed wicket for SRH. Never looked close to the naked eye, but technology - as ever - always finds a way to surprise us. That quick release off the wrists from Rashid Khan, that canny variations off the front of the hand... Krunal Pandya unfortuantely didn't read it well. Was playing for the ball spinning into him and was a tad late in bringing his bat down. The ball zoomed back in at a rapid pace to catch him close for a lbw call. Not a confident appeal, but SRH make full use of the DRS system. Krunal Pandya lbw b Rashid Khan 24(20) [4s-4]

Rashid Khan to Pollard, out Caught by Dhawan!! Reminiscent of Sarfaraz Khan's dismissal against KXIP. Neatly guided down to lone slip. KP hung back to this legbreak and was wanting to glide the ball past the slip, the ball arrives much quicker and lobs low off the splice off the bat. Five down MI. Well judged catch from SD considering the pace and height on that. Pollard c Dhawan b Rashid Khan 9(6) [6s-1]

Basil Thampi to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Huge wicket in the context of the game. Back of a length, angling into the hip, SKY's eyes lit up on seeing the short ball in that channel and he fell back onto his favourite shot in the cricket dictionary - the whip pull. Hit it too good and looped up in the air for deep square to take a straightforward catch. Suryakumar Yadav c Rashid Khan b Basil Thampi 34(38) [4s-4]

S Kaul to McClenaghan, out Lbw!! Nowhere near the line of the delivery, played all around it and was a dead duck. Siddarth Kaul got the ball to hold its line around middle stump and the ball didn't rise as much, McClenaghan was searching for it but couldn't prevent the ball from smashing his pads. Plumb. Just below the knee roll. Umpire S Ravi's finger went up instantly and in the meantime the duo looked to steal a non-existent single. McClenaghan was sent back and had to put in a dive. McClenaghan lbw b S Kaul 0(2)

S Kaul to Markande, out Lbw!! Can't get more plumb than that. Easier one for the umpire too. Full and straight from Siddarth Kaul, Markande went for the cross bat shot and missed the line completely. Gets hit low on the pad and looked guilty straightaway. No reviews left for MI. Siddarth Kaul is pumped up and so is the entire SRH team. Markande lbw b S Kaul 1(2)

S Kaul to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Basil Thampi!! Caught at third man. That's the end of Hardik Pandya and most probably the game for MI? Sid Kaul, you bewdy. Look at him go. Oh, give him a machine or else he might end up digging the pitch with his fists. Nice change of pace from him, bowls it far from off-stump of Hardik Pandya asking him to fetch from there. Pandya slogs and could only lob it as far as third man. Good running catch from Thampi. Hardik Pandya c Basil Thampi b S Kaul 3(19)

Basil Thampi to Mustafizur, out Caught by (sub)Deepak Hooda!! Sunrisers have pulled this off miraculously. Fifth loss for MI. Second lowest ever total defended in IPL history. What.A.Thriller. Final wicket razzmatazz: Short ball angled in, Mustafizur top-edged the pull before mid-wicket swallowed the swirling ball. Easy as you like. Mustafizur c (sub)Deepak Hooda b Basil Thampi 1(3)

Sandeep Sharma to Lewis, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! That's a well deserved wicket for Sandeep. Lewis never looked comfortable against him. This was another full length delivery with away swing written on it, as Lewis tried to flick it away, he got a leading edge to the man at point. Manish wouldn't miss out on that. Another failure for Lewis in his maiden IPL season, second on the trot. Lewis c Manish Pandey b Sandeep Sharma 5(9) [4s-1]

Nabi to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by (sub)Deepak Hooda!! Duck for Kishan! This is why Nabi is in the team. There are many left handed batsmen in Mumbai's batting line-up, gets one of them. Tosses it up nicely and invites the batsman to come down the track. Kishan does so, goes for it and ends up spooning it up to long-off where the sub calls for it and hangs on to it. These wickets are making the match interesting. So far, so good. Ishan Kishan c (sub)Deepak Hooda b Nabi 0(3)

Shakib to Rohit, out Caught by Dhawan!! Edged and taken! Shakib likes that, claps hard after getting the MI skipper. A flighted delivery outside off, Rohit looks to go big, tries to loft it over the in-field but as the ball turns away, it catches his outside edge and flies straight to the lone fielder in the slip. Dhawan makes no mistake and takes it. Mumbai Indians need a Pollard special tonight, it seems. Rohit c Dhawan b Shakib 2(6)

McClenaghan to Dhawan, out Bowled!! End of Dhawan's painful innings. No feet and he is bowled off a thick inside edge onto pad and then falls on the off-stump. McClenaghan is absolutely thrilled to bits. Shouting and screaming in delight. Length delivery on off-stump, Dhawan gets forward to drive, is late on the shot and the rest is history. Dhawan b McClenaghan 5(6) [4s-1]

Markande to Nabi, out Bowled!! Nabi doesn't want to go. But he has to. He has been bowled here. He can't believe that the ball has hit the stumps. Superb googly, tossed up and invited Nabi to play the big shot. An almighty hoick to leg but only after the ball has missed the inside edge and clipped the top of middle and leg. Top-class bowling. Nabi b Markande 14(10) [4s-2]

Bumrah to Rashid Khan, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Gone. Bumrah jumps up and down in delight. Angled in on a short of length on off, Rashid Khan was trying to run it down between the keeper and the wide slip. But finds Ishan Kishan who hangs on. He is catching all the snicks tonight, apart from those, his keeping has been shoddy. Rashid Khan c Ishan Kishan b Bumrah 6(9)

Markande to Basil Thampi, out Bowled!! Looks like Basil Thampi has only one shot in his arsenal. The cut. Very risky against a promising Markande. The leg-spinner fizzes off the deck and beats the late-cut, knocks the off-stump back. Not a very wise shot when he should be looking to give the strike to Pathan. Basil Thampi b Markande 3(6)

Mustafizur to S Kaul, out S Kaul Run Out!! Confusion. Chaos. Gone. Long way out too. Finally Kaul gets bat on ball, driven to backward point where there's a slight fumble, Kaul is desperate to get to the other end, Pathan sends him back but Pandya has all the time to direct his throw back to Ishan Kishan who does the rest, even as he almost lost the ball while attempting the run-out. After he flicked the bails off, the ball slipped out. The third umpire completes the formalities. S Kaul run out (Hardik Pandya/Ishan Kishan) 2(9)

Mustafizur to Y Pathan, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Good catch and that's the end of the innings. Pathan really smashed the pull but Rohit has kept all his athletic fielders on the fence. Hardik at deep mid judges it to a nicety as he takes it reverse-cup over his head. A smile breaks out after he completes the catch. Pathan can't believe that he hasn't cleared the fielder. Y Pathan c Hardik Pandya b Mustafizur 29(33) [4s-2 6s-1]

McClenaghan to Saha, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Saha walks. And Mumbai erupt. No need for the review as well. Similar to the last delivery, but a bit wide, Saha again reached out with his hands with the feet stuck, all he managed was an edge to the keeper. Ishan Kishan makes no mistake and the ploy to send Saha at 3 has backfired badly. Saha c Ishan Kishan b McClenaghan 0(2)

Hardik Pandya to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Rohit!! "Story of Manish Pandey" is the comment from Sanjay M on air. Apt. Finds cover. Down the track and right off the toe of the bat, can only find the MI skipper there. Clever from Hardik Pandya, may have seen the batsman coming and bowled it just a bit wide from his reach. An innings which promised so much has been nipped in the bud. Manish Pandey c Rohit b Hardik Pandya 16(11) [4s-3]

McClenaghan to Williamson, out Shakib Run Out!! Williamson has sold Shakib down the river here. Williamson turned this to the short mid area and said an yes, Shakib too responded and then the SRH skipper belted out a loud no. By then Shakib was almost halfway down and Surya took his time, aimed and hit direct. What a waste of a wicket. Shakib is too disappointed to say anything. Just walks off. Shakib run out (Suryakumar Yadav) 2(4)

Hardik Pandya to Williamson, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Williamson walks. Clear inside edge and the umpire's finger is up too. Nipped in a tad, from a good length, Williamson had his bat face open to play the dab to third man, but it kissed the inside edge and went to the keeper. That's a wicket SRH ill-afforded to lose. Massive blow. Williamson c Ishan Kishan b Hardik Pandya 29(21) [4s-5]

Negi to Watson, out Caught by Siraj!! How often have you seen Watson get out, mistiming a pull? His staple shot is the pull. Made a career out of it as a batsman even fetching length balls and muscling them over mid-wicket. But Negi has him again. Credit to Kohli for throwing the ball to the left-arm spinner, he has a good record against Watson and gets him with a short ball. May have skidded on a wee bit to catch Watson's inner half, Siraj takes a dolly at mid-on and flings the ball away. Negi raises his arms in triumph. Watson c Siraj b Negi 7(4) [6s-1]

Corey Anderson to Rayudu, out Rayudu Run Out!! 1 run completed. They say you don't run on a misfield and Rayudu's excellent knock has been ended by a brilliant piece of fielding by Umesh. Brilliant first with the full length dive to get a hand on the attempted square-drive to save the boundary, and then brilliant with recovery time and more importantly smash the stumps with a bullet throw and he had one stump to aim at from a side on angle. RCB are back in it! Rayudu doesn't want to leave. He got greedy and hoped for a poor throw from the fielder but Umesh has a good throwing arm and was out by miles despite a dive. Rayudu run out (U Yadav) 82(53) [4s-3 6s-8]

U Yadav to Raina, out Caught by Mandeep!! The shouts of Ceeee-Sssss-Kkkkkkk have been drowned out by that wicket. Now Aaaaarrrrr-Ceeeeee-Beeeeeee back on. Leg-stump full delivery, hint of shape on that, Raina flicked too early and the leading edge landed safely in backward point's grasp where Mandeep catches and tumbles over in delight. The ploy of giving Yadav another over has worked. 100th IPL wicket for Umesh as well. Raina c Mandeep b U Yadav 11(9) [4s-2]

Chahal to Billings, out Stumped!! Gone. Chahal is shushing Billings as he puts his finger to his lips. Magnificent bowling. Done Billings in with his quickish, flattish leggie, Billings was down the track and looking to play across the line, dangerous, deadly dangerous when it spins past you like that leaving you hopeless and helpless. Easy for de Kock to complete the formalities. Chahal is jumping up and down like a young child who has been denied his icecream. Billings st de Kock b Chahal 9(7) [4s-2]

Chahal to Jadeja, out Bowled!! He is punching the air as if he was a boxer beating the hell out of your defeated opponent. What bowling from Chahal. He is turning it on for RCB. That's as comprehensive as it gets. Sets Jadeja up for the cut but the ball fizzes off the pitch and beats the shot to clatter the stumps. Jadeja is not a bad player of spin, just the quality of Chahal outshining and outsmarting the spinner. Now RCB are well on top. Jadeja b Chahal 3(5)

Dwayne Bravo to de Kock, out Caught&Bowled!! Right off the toe of the bat and Dwayne Bravo catches it. Out comes the dance. A slower ball, de Kock had to wait an age for the ball to arrive, by the time he completed the shot, it chalked the cue end and found the bowler. A wicket CSK so desperately needed. They break the stand that was threatening to consume them. de Kock c and b Dwayne Bravo 53(37) [4s-1 6s-4]

Tahir to de Villiers, out Caught by Billings!! Someone please stop Tahir. Or he will run all the way from the Stadium to Chennai. Thankfully a CSK teammate does stop him. He has gone mental. But deserved wicket for him and credit to MS too for giving the field to him. Wanted Tahir to toss it up outside off, out of de Villiers's reach. Must have expected de Villiers to go for it after just four came off the last ten balls. And it works. de Villiers wants to go in-to-out, but the spin away forces the miscue, and they have one of the best fielders in the team in Billings at deep cover, running in to settle under that. Pressure catch but he hangs on and sends the CSK section into pangs of uncontrolled emotion. de Villiers c Billings b Tahir 68(30) [4s-2 6s-8]

Tahir to Corey Anderson, out Caught by Harbhajan!! Tahir does run this time, but only halfway of the ground. Two in two and how quickly has this game turned. Googly, on a punching length, but it turns just a wee bit more than Corey Anderson expected, catches the edge and surprisingly there's a slip in for the Kiwi at this stage. Another masterstroke by MS and Bhajji is only too happy to gobble it up. Again what emotion and what drama at the Chinnaswamy. Corey Anderson c Harbhajan b Tahir 2(8)

SN Thakur to Mandeep, out Caught by Jadeja!! Straight up in the air and caught at deep mid. Mandeep slogs the slower delivery and doesn't have the elevation to clear the fielder in the deep. Respite for Thakur who has had an absolute mare tonight - removing the wicket-maiden against Kohli and AB. Mandeep c Jadeja b SN Thakur 32(17) [4s-1 6s-3]

Dwayne Bravo to Negi, out de Grandhomme Run Out!! de Grandhomme isn't the quickest between the wickets. MS hits direct and there's no dive from the Kiwi. Negi is beaten on the dab to the slower delivery, MS does the rest with the gloves on. de Grandhomme run out (Dhoni) 11(7) [4s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Washington Sundar, out Negi Run Out!! 1 run completed. Madness from RCB and they have lost three in three. Team hat-trick. Lofted by Washington Sundar without any power, to the right of long-off. Negi wanted to come back for the second, but is sent back and can't beat the accurate throw on the bounce to MS. Flat and rocket-like by Jadeja. Negi isn't happy and is seen chuntering away in the dug-out. Negi run out (Jadeja/Dhoni) 0(1)

Dwayne Bravo to U Yadav, out Caught by Billings!! It is four in four, in between a wide too. Manic this. Madness. Sheer madness. Yadav skies the slower delivery way up in the air, when it came down, it was Billings under it at deep mid. U Yadav c Billings b Dwayne Bravo 0(1)

SN Thakur to Kohli, out Caught by Jadeja!! Thakur strikes. What a big wicket too. Quite uncharacteristic from Kohli to get out to one of his favorite shots. Took a step down the track and whipped that with lots of bottom hand power, failed to keep it down and found CSK's best fielder Jadeja at mid-on. He judges it beautifully and slides to take it with two hands. If there was one fielder, Kohli didn't want the ball to go to, then it must have been Jadeja. Kohli is livid with himself, bangs the bat hard into his pad and trudges off. The CSK contingent erupt. Kohli c Jadeja b SN Thakur 18(15) [4s-3]

Shakib to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Down the pitch and gone! Wasn't anywhere near the pitch of the ball, but refuses to arrest his momentum; goes through with the shot and skies it off the cue end for long-on who takes the simplest of catches. Manish Pandey it is with bucket hands. Mayank's intent was to clear long-on with the loft, but Shakib did well to drag it back. Mayank Agarwal c Manish Pandey b Shakib 12(15)

Rashid Khan to Nair, out Lbw!! Nair doesn't review. Plumb in front. Googly from Rashid Khan, Nair got forward to block ala classic Test match style, but he didn't read it too well. Was totally befuddled after he got pinged below the kneeroll. Nair walks off instantly. Nair lbw b Rashid Khan 13(17)

Shakib to Finch, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Gone this time. Headless batting from Finch? Rush of blood? Preempts the lofted swing and smashes it as hard as he can, puts all his body power behind it after clearing the front leg. Manish Pandey sets himself up at long-on and judges it to perfection. Taken inches inside the rope. Finch c Manish Pandey b Shakib 8(4) [6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Manoj Tiwary, out Caught by Williamson!! Give Williamson 10 bowlers and he'll win matches. Gee, how good is this SRH bowling? KXIP 6 down. Sheer panic. Manoj Tiwary got across to this off-cutter and couldn't control his flick shot on the move, foxed by the lack of pace I reckon. It smacks the toe-end and loops up to KW at mid-wicket who gobbles up with supreme ease. Manoj Tiwary c Williamson b Sandeep Sharma 1(5)

Sandeep Sharma to Andrew Tye, out Lbw!! They are crumbling like nine pins. One after the other. There's no room to breathe. Knuckle ball from Sandeep Sharma, Tye played across the line and got hit in line with middle and leg. Loud appeal and given out straightaway. Tye went for the review after a brief consultation with his skipper, thankfully they didn't lose the review. Andrew Tye lbw b Sandeep Sharma 4(2) [4s-1]

S Kaul to Barinder, out Barinder Run Out!! This is possibly the worst batting display from KXIP this season. They are inviting panic ball after ball. Sran slogs once again, gets it off the toe-end and it dribbles to Saha to his left; he puts in the dive, collects cleanly and clatters the timber at the striker's end. Both the batsmen were stranded in the middle, Ashwin took a couple of strides and stood stoned midway waiting to see the procession. Barinder run out (Saha) 2(5)

Rashid Khan to Ashwin, out Caught by Williamson!! Running out of words to describe this shambolic batting from KXIP. Ashwin goes for the hack and had to drag it off the toe-end, the ball was spinning away from him and that made it all the more difficult to execute the shot. Skies up off the toe-end and KW takes a sitter at cover. Ashwin c Williamson b Rashid Khan 4(6)

Basil Thampi to Rajpoot, out Bowled!! Stumps shattered, so is the KXIP dug-out. SRH win, by 13 runs. What an outstanding bowling effort this. This (the final wicket) was coming; Basil Thampi gets his line right and attacks the stumps with a full one, it was pacy and too hot to handle for Ankit Rajpoot, he went across his stumps to try the funky scoop over short fine and missed. Nailed, done and dusted. Timbahhhh...Rajpoot b Basil Thampi 8(9) [4s-1]

Rashid Khan to Rahul, out Bowled!! Rahul has this weakness against legspin. He does have a history of getting out to googlies in the past. Perhaps that could be playing on his mind while playing the wily Rashid Khan. Got forward defensively expecting a wrong 'un, but the ball held its line enough before straightening past his outside edge to hammer the off pole. Excellent set up from Rashid. A much-needed wicket for SRH and with that, they take the time-out! Rahul b Rashid Khan 32(26) [4s-4 6s-1]

Basil Thampi to Gayle, out Caught&Bowled!! Guess what, the young man from Kerala has beaten Chris Gayle for pace. The advantage of that busting action and jump. Gets the short ball to climb awkwardly onto Gayle who miscues the ambitious pull round the corner, just a few yards to the left of nonexistent square leg. Basil Thampi says mine, runs around and controls his momentum to take a clean catch. Boy, is he pumped or what... Gayle c and b Basil Thampi 23(22) [4s-1 6s-2]

Rajpoot to Williamson, out Caught by Ashwin!! The SRH supporters look stunned as the captain departs. That's a poor looking shot from KW, but it was the extra bounce that was his undoing. Banged in short and a hint of away movement from outside off, KW was in a terrible position as he went for the pull, would have been better had he tried to cut, gets a top-edge that lobbed in the air and Ashwin has a simple catch at mid-off. Williamson c Ashwin b Rajpoot 0(3)

Mujeeb to Shakib, out Caught by Mayank Agarwal!! This was coming! Shakib was struggling to get the young Afghan away, goes for the big mow over mid-wicket and holes out to long-on. He didn't pick this wrong 'un, came down the track, didn't get anywhere close to the ball, was eyeing the mid-wicket fence, got a fat leading edge on the lofted drive, high and towards long-on. Mayank settled under it and holds on. Shakib c Mayank Agarwal b Mujeeb 28(29) [4s-3]

Rajpoot to Manish Pandey, out Bowled!! Brilliant bowling. Turning out to be a great final over so far. He's varied it up nicely, so as to not become predictable. This one's almost in the blockhole and it's tailing in at a good pace. Slips under Pandey's slog and crashes into the stumps off the pad. Manish Pandey b Rajpoot 54(51) [4s-3 6s-1]

Rajpoot to Dhawan, out Caught by Nair!! Edged and caught! That bounce from Rajpoot, it's the undoing of yet another SRH batsman, they have lost both openers now. Banged in short and curving away from the left-hander, Dhawan didn't cover for the angle as he fended at that, doesn't get on top of the bounce and gets a thick outside edge. The ball looped and was dying on its way to Karun, but he bends forward and takes a good low catch. Dhawan c Nair b Rajpoot 11(8) [4s-2]

Rajpoot to Nabi, out Caught by Mayank Agarwal!! Lofted up, not much timing, and a good catch running in from Agarwal. He covered decent ground at long-off before diving forward with both hands. Five-fer for Ankit Rajpoot. Nabi c Mayank Agarwal b Rajpoot 4(2) [4s-1]

Rajpoot to Saha, out Caught by Andrew Tye!! Another terrible slog and Rajpoot has three now. Change of pace has done Saha in, this was a slower ball outside off, Saha was looking to slog it over mid-wicket, he has no pace to work with, hit high on the bat and lobs a simple catch to Tye, jogging back from mid-wicket. Rajpoot is on a roll and SRH's batting looks very flaky once again. Saha c Andrew Tye b Rajpoot 6(9) [4s-1]

Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, out Bowled!! Chawla strikes! KKR badly needed this one because this partnership was getting ready to go bonkers. This was the quicker one from Chawla and it skidded through low, Shaw didn't expect it to keep that low and his wild pull across the line didn't help his cause either. Misses it completely and the woodwork is disturbed. Nevertheless, a top quality innings from the young man. He's made a statement here in the IPL. This dismissal might actually worry KKR as they have to chase and it has started to keep low. Prithvi Shaw b Chawla 62(44) [4s-7 6s-2]

A Russell to Pant, out Caught by Karthik!! What was that, Mr.Pant? We have seen Indian batsmen get out to the bouncer but trust me, this has to be one of weirdest ways of getting out. Lovely bouncer and Pant was stuck on the crease, probably beaten for both pace and bounce. Fails to drop his wrists in time and it flies high off the glove. It's a dolly for the KKR skipper and suddenly, the visitors are right back in this with the twin strikes. The in-form Pant has to go. He has a wry smile on his face as he walks back. Knows that it looked comical. On second viewing, the ball didn't bounce much at all but Pant wasn't looking at the ball in any case. 'Never take your eyes off the ball', they say. Pant c Karthik b A Russell 0(1)

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, out Maxwell Run Out!! Sharp from Mavi! Was quick to gather this in his followthrough from Karthik's throw and threw the stumps down at the bowler's end. Maxwell was backing away for the single and was never going to make it back. Slow off cutter outside off, Iyer tried to slog across the line but only got a bottom edge towards Karthik. Maxwell wanted the bye but in the end, had to go. Maxwell run out (Karthik/Shivam Mavi) 27(18) [4s-1 6s-2]

Shivam Mavi to Munro, out Bowled!! Lovely delivery from Mavi and he gets rid of the dangerous Munro. This was very full and on the stumps, bowled at 143 kmph. Not quite the yorker, but good enough for Munro, he was making room for the slog, gets a bottom-edge and the ball clatters into the base of middle-stump. A send off from the youngster and KKR get their first wicket. Munro b Shivam Mavi 33(18) [4s-4 6s-2]

Maxwell to Chris Lynn, out Bowled!! Wah! Look at beaming smile on Maxi's face. Boy, is he delighted! Lands this on a length and gets the ball to drift back slightly around off, Lynn wasn't fuly committed on the forward push, plays tentatively and inside-edges it back onto his stumps. Chris Lynn b Maxwell 5(6) [4s-1]

Mishra to A Russell, out Shubman Gill Run Out!! The young man is gone. The calling between the two had been poor and Shubman Gill to suffer. That was chopped away into the off-side, sans any timing and despite not a great throw and desperate dive, Gill does not make it. The keeper did well to whip the bails off. Shubman Gill run out (Shreyas Iyer/Pant) 37(29) [4s-3 6s-1]

Mishra to Shivam Mavi, out Bowled!! This has been a nightmare. Finally, it ends for Shivam Mavi. That was a slow googly, the batsman was too early into the pull and misses it. The ball takes its time to tickle the leg-stick. To make matters worse for KKR, maiden over from Mishy! The three dots also would not have helped the equation for KKR. DD look set to break their jinx. Shivam Mavi b Mishra 0(3)

Avesh Khan to A Russell, out Bowled!! The base of the off-pole has been struck hard. Yorkerish delivery and the batsman trying to create room, misses it. Avesh Khan gets carried away as well after the wicket. Shouts a mouthful at the batsman. Can't interpret that. But that is GAME.SET.MATCH for DD. First Shaw, then Iyer, now Avesh Khan. DD being pulled along by the young guns. A Russell b Avesh Khan 44(30) [4s-3 6s-4]

Maxwell to Chawla, out Caught by Munro!! The DD boys can do nothing wrong tonight. Slog swept and the man at deep backward square leg jumps up and grabs it with the tip of his fingers. Superb take at the boundary line. That was hit flat and well but the fielder did well to keep his balance at the fence and grab it. In the end, the momentum on the shot almost meant the ball would explode through his fingers but it did not. Chawla c Munro b Maxwell 2(4)

Boult to Uthappa, out Caught by Prithvi Shaw!! Trent Boult is such a good operator with the ball. Does have plenty of variations to nip out wickets at will. Bowls it short and creates that uncomfortable angle for Uthappa - around middle and off - no room whatsoever. A horrible mistimed shot that, the pull, spoons straight to Prithvi Shaw at mid-wicket. Uthappa c Prithvi Shaw b Boult 1(2)

Boult to Narine, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Boult seems to have come out with a clear plan against Narine which is to bowl short and only short. One swing too many from Narine, not in the best of positions (having cleared the front leg) to flay the ball over the off-side ring; goes for it and lobs it off the toe-end. Iyer calls in early from mid-off, runs forward and grabs it with a slide. Narine c Shreyas Iyer b Boult 26(9) [4s-1 6s-3]

Avesh Khan to Nitish Rana, out Caught&Bowled!! KKR are falling apart. Another wicket off a short ball. Nitish Rana was in no position to play the pull, still goes for it and pays the ultimate price. It came onto him quickly and was cramped for room to play the pull; loops up off the splice and the bowler takes the simplest of catches running forward. Nitish Rana c and b Avesh Khan 8(7) [4s-1]

Mishra to Karthik, out Caught by Boult!! Plays against the spin and perishes. Looks to go over long-on/mid-wicket with a wild swing and ends up slicing a dolly of a catch to backward point. Half the side back in the hut now. Karthik c Boult b Mishra 18(18) [6s-1]

Krunal Pandya to Rayudu, out Caught by Cutting!! Andre Gomes hangs on. Cutting if you are confused. No power on the slog-sweep by Rayudu, knelt down to slog it, but found deep mid to a nicety. Krunal Pandya held back the length a little and got his man. Looked a tired shot to me. Rayudu c Cutting b Krunal Pandya 46(35) [4s-2 6s-4]

McClenaghan to Dhoni, out Caught by Lewis!! Dhoni falls into the trap. There's a deep cover in place for the lofted hit and Dhoni has found the man. Low full-toss outside off, it looked like Dhoni was in two minds, whether to go full-blast or not, eventually he chips it to the West Indian on the fence. That is such a massive wicket and MI's ploy has worked. Dhoni c Lewis b McClenaghan 26(21) [4s-3 6s-1]

McClenaghan to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught by Markande!! Dwayne Bravo goes for a golden duck. MI are fighting back here. We saw Bravo miscue a few in the last game against RCB as well, but those fell in no-man's land, this sliced cut lands in Markande's hands at backward point. Beaten for pace as McClenaghan found some extra bounce off a short of length. Dwayne Bravo c Markande b McClenaghan 0(1)

Hardik Pandya to Billings, out Caught by Cutting!! Another slower ball and Billings is gone. Was down the track to hit it over long-on but skewed it off the base of the bat. Easy take for Cutting. The MI dugout erupt after that wicket. Turning out to be a top, top last over this. Billings c Cutting b Hardik Pandya 3(5)

Krunal Pandya to Watson, out Caught by Markande!! Watson goes and credit to Krunal Pandya for that wicket. Slower and loopier, on off, Watson had to fetch the sweep, can only get a top edge and Markande at square leg almost made a meal of it. Manages to clutch the ball onto his chest and holds on. Important wicket in the powerplay. Watson c Markande b Krunal Pandya 12(11) [4s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Lewis, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Slices it up a mile in the air, really cool pressure catch from Thakur at long-off. Big wicket for CSK, straight after the time-out. Good length ball wide of off, gets it out of the batsman's swinging arc. Lewis flings his hands at it, slicing it up right off the bottom. Excellent bowling. Bravo coming to the fore again. Lewis c SN Thakur b Dwayne Bravo 47(43) [4s-3 6s-2]

Harbhajan to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Jadeja!!Gone! There's the breakthrough and is that the opening CSK were looking for? Game on. What a catch that was from Jaddu. It was a shortish ball and Yadav struck it pretty well. Went back in his crease to pull and got it off middle of the bat. But, in comes Ravindra Jadeja, CSK's best fielder. Sprinted across to his left from deep mid-wicket, had his eyes on the ball and slided to snaffle with both hands. Bhajji runs towards the fielder to applaud the effort. Suryakumar Yadav c Jadeja b Harbhajan 44(34) [4s-5 6s-1]

Y Pathan to Stokes, out Bowled!! My word. He's brought on as a roller, to sneak an over under the radar, but such is the power that practically anybody in a Hyderabadi jersey can pick wickets. Pathan holds the ball back in his palm as he fires in a slider. Yes it was short, but certainly not for Stokes to rock back as deep as he did in trying to heave it away. Misses big time, sneaking under the bat. Well under. And yeah, off's uprooted. Stokes b Y Pathan 0(3)

Rashid Khan to Buttler, out Caught by Dhawan!! They're falling. Buttler tries forcing the run-rate, but against Rashid, seriously? Gets a floater around off, tries going downtown with a full-blooded swing. Mistimes, and Dhawan's waiting at long-off, with a pre-loaded thigh slap celebration ready to come out. Buttler c Dhawan b Rashid Khan 10(11)

S Kaul to Lomror, out Caught by Saha!! Wide knuckle ball, angling way across -- tempting Lomror to chase, take on the big boundary. Well he has to. Throws his bat out .. he wouldn't have had a problem even with some sort of a big edge. Gets it off the outside, yes, but not past a flying Saha to his left. Lomror c Saha b S Kaul 11(12)

Basil Thampi to Gowtham, out Caught by Dhawan!! There's the nail. The unlikeliest of ties is out of the equation too. Quite a half volley this, Gowtham can't get under the length though, drills it uppishly, without elevation. This time Dhawan at long-off need not tumble, he can stay and collect. Gowtham c Dhawan b Basil Thampi 8(5) [4s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to R Tripathi, out Bowled!! Bowled 'em! Horror stroke from Tripathi and his woes this season continue. On a good length around middle, kept low as well and Tripathi premeditated the charge down the pitch. In the end, he couldn't do much and had to adjust to keep it out. Couldn't and heard the rattle of timber behind him. Just the start SRH would have wanted. R Tripathi b Sandeep Sharma 4(5)

S Kaul to Samson, out Caught by Hales!! Times his way to Hales. He just can't look ugly, and the overdose of timing he's got in him isn't quite on par with the fields put out. Kaul brings out his knuckle ball, with a late tail inwards. Samson tries punching it through the on-side, gets it off the middle too, but can't keep it down. Right where short mid-wicket's waiting. Samson c Hales b S Kaul 40(30) [4s-3 6s-1]

Gowtham to Hales, out Caught by Samson!! Gowtham has another! He's bowled exceptionally well today and has started this spell with a bang as well. Hales was moving around the crease and Gowtham smartly dragged this wider outside off. Asked the Englishman to fetch it and he could only slice it high in the air. Easiest of catches for Samson at backward point. Decent start to the IPL for Hales but he would have wanted to kick on and make a really big one. Timely strike for RR because this partnership was starting to open up. Hales c Samson b Gowtham 45(39) [4s-4]

Ish Sodhi to Williamson, out Caught by Buttler!! Huge wicket! Maiden IPL wicket for Sodhi! And it's his NZ skipper that he has sent back. Vital breakthrough for RR because the SRH captain was batting like a dream. This one shot through low shockingly from a good length as Williamson tried to play the cut from the crease. It was a great take from Buttler and S.Ravi felt there was a bottom edge. KW didn't and went for the review. The replays didn't show anything to be honest but the snicko has a different story to tell. Tiniest of spikes or murmurs to be precise and Williamson had to go. Williamson c Buttler b Ish Sodhi 63(43) [4s-7 6s-2]

Jofra Archer to Shakib, out Bowled!! Cleans him up! Excellent yorker from Archer and that's the end of Shakib. This was on the base of off stump and although the southpaw could see it coming, he was beaten for pace. Ended up just brushing the off bails. Fantastic comeback from RR, they are dragging things back in spectacular fashion here. Archer was unlucky not to get Williamson earlier with a yorker and was even unfortunate that a catch was put down as well of the Kiwi. Not this time. Shakib b Jofra Archer 6(6) [4s-1]

Jofra Archer to Y Pathan, out Caught by D Kulkarni!! Double strike from Archer! He turned it on at the death against the Mumbai Indians and is at it here as well. What a boost RR have got with his inclusion! Terrific death bowler and this over has been further proof of it. Pacy short ball and although it was a tad wide, Pathan was in no position to play it. Ends up trying to just guide it. Flies straight to the fielder stationed at third man. Y Pathan c D Kulkarni b Jofra Archer 2(3)

Unadkat to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Rahane!! SRH are coming apart here in the death overs. Must say that the RR bowlers have been smart as well in reading the surface and executing the plans. Unadkat does what he does best, a slower ball on a good length that Pandey wants to biff by making room. He has no other choice at this stage, does he? However, doesn't connect it well at all and slices it high towards backward point where the RR skipper does the rest. Manish Pandey c Rahane b Unadkat 16(15) [4s-1]

Jofra Archer to Rashid Khan, out Caught by Stokes!! Archer is having fun here at the death. Gets this third and this is another canny delivery. After a series of fullish balls, he drags back the length and takes all the pace off this one. Rashid was shuffling across for the slog but this got big on him. All he managed was to sky it towards deep mid-wicket. Stokes won't drop those. Rashid Khan c Stokes b Jofra Archer 1(3)

Gowtham to Dhawan, out Bowled!! Bowled 'em. Gowtham sends Dhawan packing back to the hut. Very, very poor shot from the southpaw. Totally misjudged the length there. It was rifled quick outside off, the ball was skidding off the pitch. Dhawan with his knee bent first tried to sweep and then as an afterthought tried to open his bat face to guide it past the solitary slip. But the ball just fizzed off the deck, took his inside edge and deflected back onto the stumps. Gowtham breaks into a celebratory jig. Just the wicket RR wanted, the dangerous Dhawan back to the hut early. Dhawan b Gowtham 6(4) [4s-1]

Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, out Caught by Southee!! The dangerous Uthappa falls. He's lured into the big shot due to the flight, but gets it right off the toe-end. Had to reach out for the loft, as the line was wide from Ashwin. It's very smartly bowled actually. The ball grips away further to take the bottom of the bat. Southee hangs on at long-on. Uthappa c Southee b Murugan Ashwin 36(21) [4s-3 6s-3]

Siraj to A Russell, out Caught by de Kock!! This is huuuuuuuuge. Golden duck for Russell on his birthday and the Chinnaswamy finds its voice. Siraj bends his back as he bangs it in, rushes Russell on the pull and balloons off a top-edge. Well taken by de Kock running back. Massive blow. A Russell c de Kock b Siraj 0(1)

Siraj to Karthik, out Caught by Kohli!! Breathtaking catch from Kohli. Phew. It's a mistimed loft from Karthik down the ground and it would have landed short for most fielders at long-on. But Kohli races in and then comes up with some stunning acrobatics. Karthik c Kohli b Siraj 23(10) [4s-2 6s-1]

Murugan Ashwin to Narine, out Caught by de Grandhomme at long-off!!.. and Murugan Ashwin strikes with his first ball. This was tossed up nicely outside off, right in Narine's hitting zone, he took up the bait and was looking to cream it back over the bowler's head. The bat turned in his hands at the point of impact, he ended up slicing it high and towards long-off. de Grandhomme completes a fine catch. He had to make sure that he didn't step onto the ropes as he completed the catch - which he did. Relief for RCB and Chinnaswamy finds its voice back. Narine c de Grandhomme b Murugan Ashwin 27(19) [4s-3 6s-1]

A Russell to Vohra, out Bowled!! Bowled him. Russell strikes again. Does a little jig to celebrate his second wicket on his birthday. Tailed in late and took the inside edge before cannoning off the back boot onto the stumps. Vohra was giving the charge and was late on the shot, the incoming delivery sneaked through. A bit unlucky but that's how it can go in this format. Vohra b A Russell 0(1)

A Russell to Mandeep, out Caught by Shivam Mavi!! Can Mandeep clear deep mid? No he can't. Caught right at the edge of the boundary. A slower delivery on off, Mandeep swings and doesn't get the elevation he needs. Bit more power and it would've been six. Mandeep c Shivam Mavi b A Russell 19(14) [6s-2]

Kuldeep Yadav to de Kock, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Gone first ball after the break. Slower and turns away from the advancing de Kock, who still goes through with the inside out hit, can only lift it up in the air for sweeper to run around to his left and take. A fist pump from Kuldeep Yadav to celebrate the wicket. de Kock c Shubman Gill b Kuldeep Yadav 29(27) [4s-3 6s-1]

A Russell to Brendon McCullum, out Caught by Karthik!! Quick short ball and he gets Brendon McCullum. McCullum actually was intending to send the ball to Banshankari, was through with the pull too early and it took the toe of the bat and looped to DK. No need for the umpire to make any decision on that. Off walks McCullum. Brendon McCullum c Karthik b A Russell 38(28) [4s-4 6s-2]

Vijay Shankar to du Plessis, out Caught by Boult!! This time, Faf holes out! He struggled to get going barring a couple of boundaries and finally, perishes in a bid to up the ante. Fuller ball and a bit wide outside off, he tried to go over the man at long-off but didn't middle this at all. Easiest of catches for Boult near the ropes. Finally the partnership is broken and DD will want to drag things back a bit now. Won't be easy though as there is some serious firepower to come for CSK. du Plessis c Boult b Vijay Shankar 33(33) [4s-3 6s-1]

Maxwell to Raina, out Bowled!! One brings two for DD and this is a massive wicket. The in-form Raina departs second ball. It's a first-ball wicket for Maxwell as well. Drifts this in just around off, straightens a tad off the deck as Raina went for a wild hoick across the line. Bizarre shot to play very early in the innings but he probably thought that the surface is good to start blasting straight away. Got burnt eventually. Just the kind of momentum DD were looking for. Raina b Maxwell 1(2)

Mishra to Watson, out Caught by Plunkett at long-off!! Respite for DD! The Watson show is over for the night. But boy, what an innings it was! Pure carnage and ruthlessness from the Australian who certainly was at his vintage best. Cleverly bowled by Mishra though, flighted it up invitingly, might have been the googly and the lofted stroke went flat towards long-off. Plunkett won't drop those. This is a good passage of play for the Daredevils. They are quietly chipping away at the wickets. Watson c Plunkett b Mishra 78(40) [4s-4 6s-7]

Boult to Dhoni, out Rayudu Run Out!! That's the end of Rayudu, wanted to get on strike as Dhoni had missed the pull but the CSK captain remained unmoved. Pant was quick to throw it towards Boult who fired a direct hit at the other end. Rayudu was way short and was never going to make it. Another valuable contribution from him nevertheless. Rayudu run out (Pant/Boult) 41(24) [4s-5 6s-1]

KM Asif to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Jadeja!! Adrenaline rush and Shaw falls. One shot too many for the youngster. Told you, Asif can hoodwink the batsmen with his skiddy short balls, here's the evidence. A short of length that kicks onto Shaw, he looked for a cross-batted smash across the line. Is hurried by the pace and ends up slicing it towards mid-on. Jaddu, the best fielder in the CSK set-up leaps across, times his jump to perfection and pouches the dolly at mid-off. Prithvi Shaw c Jadeja b KM Asif 9(5) [4s-2]

Lungi Ngidi to Pant, out Caught by Jadeja!! Maiden IPL wicket for Lungi Ngidi and he's been mighty impressive. Ends an excellent innings from Pant. Shortish slower delivery outside off stump, Pant slices it high in the air, Jadeja runs forward from sweeper cover and swallows it. Pant c Jadeja b Lungi Ngidi 79(45) [4s-7 6s-4]

KM Asif to Munro, out Caught by Karn Sharma!! Munro combusts. Asif raises his hands aloft in joy. The bowler wins the battle and has the last laugh. Second wicket for Asif, nips out both openers. Looked like it was a certain trap, plotted by MSD and Asif. Much like the last ball, ushered it short and this was closer to the body. Munro swung across, only height as it went a long way into the night sky. There was a fielder waiting at deep mid-wicket and he set himself under it to gobble it up. Safe hands from Karn Sharma. Munro c Karn Sharma b KM Asif 26(16) [4s-3 6s-2]

Jadeja to Shreyas Iyer, out Shreyas Iyer Run Out!! Kamikaze running and Iyer perishes. Tragedy for DD. Iyer was looking good but a miscommunication leads to his dismissal. Push-driven towards extra cover, there was never a single there. Iyer kept running, Pant took a couple of strides down the pitch before he stopped. The DD skipper was just a handshaking distance away from his partner and no way Iyer was returning. A clean pick and throw from Watto to MS, easy-peasy. Shreyas Iyer run out (Watson/Dhoni) 13(14) [4s-1]

Jadeja to Maxwell, out Bowled!! Lock, stock and two smoking barrels. You-miss-I-Hit stuff from Jadeja. Maxwell's form seems to be like that mythical creature which just cannot be found. Rifled fast, coming in with the arm. Maxwell lined up for a heave across the line, fails to counter for the drift. The ball snakes in and clatters the stumps. DD in strife now. Maxwell b Jadeja 6(5) [4s-1]

McClenaghan to Brendon McCullum, out Brendon McCullum Run Out!! Gone. Brendon McCullum is quick but not as quick as he was in his international playing days. Even then this single may have been tight. Smeared it to mid-off and ran, hoped Hardik would miss but he didn't. End of story. Brendon McCullum run out (Hardik Pandya) 37(25) [4s-4 6s-2]

Hardik Pandya to Mandeep, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Off the base of the bat and caught by Surya at deep mid. Mandeep is unhappy at himself, screams and then taps the bat onto the helmet in despair. Was a slower delivery and in the slot for the mow over deep mid, but miscued it to the man. Mandeep c Suryakumar Yadav b Hardik Pandya 14(10) [4s-1 6s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Kohli, out Caught by Pollard!! The crowd are stunned. A hush of silence and disappointment descends on the Chinnaswamy. Their favorite son of the non-soil is gone. Ok - I made that up. Back to the wicket. This was another cutter on a short of length, trouble was Kohli looking to power it over long-on off the front foot. Such a difficult shot that one - even if you are Kohli. He holes out to long-on. Polly won't drop that. Kohli is shocked to say the least, makes his emotions known before trudging off. That's a difference of at least 20 in my book. Now Hardik Pandya suddenly is on a hat-trick. Kohli c Pollard b Hardik Pandya 32(26) [4s-2 6s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Washington Sundar, out Caught by Rohit!! This is a dream dream over for MI. Now Washington Sundar goes. No real emotions or celebrations from Hardik Pandya. He is cool amidst all this. But familiar expressions on the RCB fans and players's faces. Washington Sundar finds deep mid-wicket with a slog off a slower delivery. No power behind the blow. All three batsmen have expertly found the fielder in this over. Washington Sundar c Rohit b Hardik Pandya 1(3)

Bumrah to Southee, out Caught by Cutting!! Southee goes now. Off-pace slower delivery outside off, Southee stands a foot outside off and then slugs this high up in the air, Cutting at deep mid actually misjudged it for an instant or two, but recovers to take it over his head and then tumbles over. Made a simple catch look difficult. Southee c Cutting b Bumrah 1(2)

McClenaghan to de Kock, out Caught by Rohit!! Rohit takes the catch and signals to the umpire to check upstairs. He is not sure. Soft signal is out. Good low catch at mid-wicket by Rohit. Slugged by de Kock and taken near his bootlaces. Looks like the fingers are under the ball. Let's wait for the third umpire's call. Who is having a look from different angles. Should be given out I guess. OUT it is. McClenaghan strikes and the pressure has told on de Kock. He was struggling and has made his way back. Didn't get enough elevation on this hit. de Kock c Rohit b McClenaghan 7(13) [4s-1]

Markande to Vohra, out Lbw!! Given out lbw. Vohra immediately reviews. Has it pitched in line? No under edge on the sweep. UltraEdge throws that up. Umpire's call and Vohra is gone. Erasmus the umpire who was happy to oblige that appeal from Markande. Pitched in line with leg stump and straightened just enough to clip leg. Vohra was beaten on the sweep and has to make his way out. Vohra lbw b Markande 45(31) [4s-2 6s-4]

McClenaghan to Brendon McCullum, out Brendon McCullum Run Out!! Gone. Brendon McCullum is quick but not as quick as he was in his international playing days. Even then this single may have been tight. Smeared it to mid-off and ran, hoped Hardik would miss but he didn't. End of story. Brendon McCullum run out (Hardik Pandya) 37(25) [4s-4 6s-2]

Hardik Pandya to Mandeep, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Off the base of the bat and caught by Surya at deep mid. Mandeep is unhappy at himself, screams and then taps the bat onto the helmet in despair. Was a slower delivery and in the slot for the mow over deep mid, but miscued it to the man. Mandeep c Suryakumar Yadav b Hardik Pandya 14(10) [4s-1 6s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Kohli, out Caught by Pollard!! The crowd are stunned. A hush of silence and disappointment descends on the Chinnaswamy. Their favorite son of the non-soil is gone. Ok - I made that up. Back to the wicket. This was another cutter on a short of length, trouble was Kohli looking to power it over long-on off the front foot. Such a difficult shot that one - even if you are Kohli. He holes out to long-on. Polly won't drop that. Kohli is shocked to say the least, makes his emotions known before trudging off. That's a difference of at least 20 in my book. Now Hardik Pandya suddenly is on a hat-trick. Kohli c Pollard b Hardik Pandya 32(26) [4s-2 6s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Washington Sundar, out Caught by Rohit!! This is a dream dream over for MI. Now Washington Sundar goes. No real emotions or celebrations from Hardik Pandya. He is cool amidst all this. But familiar expressions on the RCB fans and players's faces. Washington Sundar finds deep mid-wicket with a slog off a slower delivery. No power behind the blow. All three batsmen have expertly found the fielder in this over. Washington Sundar c Rohit b Hardik Pandya 1(3)

Bumrah to Southee, out Caught by Cutting!! Southee goes now. Off-pace slower delivery outside off, Southee stands a foot outside off and then slugs this high up in the air, Cutting at deep mid actually misjudged it for an instant or two, but recovers to take it over his head and then tumbles over. Made a simple catch look difficult. Southee c Cutting b Bumrah 1(2)

McClenaghan to de Kock, out Caught by Rohit!! Rohit takes the catch and signals to the umpire to check upstairs. He is not sure. Soft signal is out. Good low catch at mid-wicket by Rohit. Slugged by de Kock and taken near his bootlaces. Looks like the fingers are under the ball. Let's wait for the third umpire's call. Who is having a look from different angles. Should be given out I guess. OUT it is. McClenaghan strikes and the pressure has told on de Kock. He was struggling and has made his way back. Didn't get enough elevation on this hit. de Kock c Rohit b McClenaghan 7(13) [4s-1]
