Markande to Vohra, out Lbw!! Given out lbw. Vohra immediately reviews. Has it pitched in line? No under edge on the sweep. UltraEdge throws that up. Umpire's call and Vohra is gone. Erasmus the umpire who was happy to oblige that appeal from Markande. Pitched in line with leg stump and straightened just enough to clip leg. Vohra was beaten on the sweep and has to make his way out. Vohra lbw b Markande 45(31) [4s-2 6s-4]

D Kulkarni to Munro, out Caught by Buttler!! Huge strike and Rajasthan pocket Munro for a first-baller. That was full, swung in a bit and the batsman ended up playing down the wrong line. The inside edge was found and carried low to the keeper. Buttler went up and the umpire had no hesitation in giving it out. Munro on his part also did not want to review it as he knew he had edged it. The bowler did not appeal straightaway. He only went up after he saw the keeper appealing so confidently. Munro c Buttler b D Kulkarni 0(1)

Unadkat to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by R Tripathi!! Finally, a wicket for RR! Some respite from the carnage but it's not the man they would have wanted although Iyer also was striking them really well. Slower ball from Unadkat and the length is a touch shorter, the DD captain wanted to launch down the ground but only got height on this one. Went up to the night sky for ages towards long-off where Tripathi held his nerve to settle under it. Another fine knock from the skipper, he's set it up nicely for DD to score a really imposing total. Shreyas Iyer c R Tripathi b Unadkat 50(35) [4s-3 6s-3]

Unadkat to Pant, out Caught by Stokes!! Vital, vital breakthrough! Might easily make a difference of about 10-15 runs to the eventual total. The deadly Pant has to depart but not before he has produced another thrill-a-minute epic. Backed away to make room for the big shot but one hand comes off in the process. Didn't get hold of it and skied this high towards long-on where Stokes moved to his left a fair bit to judge the skier perfectly. Two massive wickets in the over for RR, just the comeback they were looking for. Pant c Stokes b Unadkat 69(29) [4s-7 6s-5]

Unadkat to Vijay Shankar, out Caught by R Tripathi!! Holes out this time! Gee, some seriously high skiers tonight and RR are doing well to get under them without spilling. Unadkat gets his third and not surprisingly, it's with another slower ball. Shankar wanted to up the ante, rightfully so, but could not middle this loft at all. Tripathi at long-off does well to take it with ease. Vijay Shankar c R Tripathi b Unadkat 17(6) [4s-2 6s-1]

Jofra Archer to Maxwell, out Lbw!! Needless review from Maxwell and he has to go. Pinpoint yorker from Archer and the Australian couldn't get his bat down on time. Pinned on the back pad and it rolled towards short fine leg. Umpire Nandan was quick to raise his finger and so was Maxwell to signal the T. That suggested that perhaps he might have got some bat on it but no, replays clearly show he hadn't and the rest is just a formality. Three Reds on HawkEye. It's started to rain as well!!! Could well be the end of the innings. Maxwell lbw b Jofra Archer 5(5)

Shreyas Gopal to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught&Bowled!! Soft dismissal. And against the run of play. That turned a bit, stopped as well on the batsman, who on his part had his feet glued to the crease and just tamely pushed it back to the bowler. A smirk on the face of Gopal after he takes the catch. Prithvi Shaw is gutted. Prithvi Shaw c and b Shreyas Gopal 47(25) [4s-4 6s-4]

Boult to R Tripathi, out R Tripathi Run Out!! Boult calmly takes off the bails at the non striker's end and Tripathi will have to depart. This match is going Delhi's way now. Coming back to the ball, it was a perfect yorker outside off, Tripathi swings and misses; the ball goes to the keeper who balloons it to the bowler and he does the rest. Some headless running distilled in panic to be honest. Non-striker almost at the other end by the time Tripathi realizes that he has to run -- basically bullied into it -- and pays the price for it. R Tripathi run out (Pant/Boult) 9(8) [4s-1]

Mishra to Buttler, out Stumped!! Mishraji will be a popular man at the Kotla now. It was a terrific delivery from him, he brings his experience to the fore and drags his length back. Buttler, on the charge, was nowhere close to the pitch of this widish leg break and he misses it totally, running past it in his shimmy. Pant behind the stumps takes off the bails, delaying it stylishly because Buttler was so far down the track, and thus a blistering innings from Buttler comes to an end. He came in like thunder and went back like lighting. Buttler st Pant b Mishra 67(26) [4s-4 6s-7]

Boult to Samson, out Caught by Munro!! This ball went into the stratosphere, thankfully it came down and Munro takes a really good catch at cow corner. Again a change in pace from Boult, it has become a stock ball for the pacers these days in this format. Samson's timing was dismal, he lofts it in the air and was cleanly caught by the Kiwi opener in the deep. Swirled under it and then positioned himself under the trajectory with a last-minute adjustment. Chest bump with Maxwell and all follow. Samson c Munro b Boult 3(5)

Boult to Stokes, out Caught by Vijay Shankar!! Poor IPL for Stokes continues. He has been in filthy form this season. It was a full toss, Stokes mistimes the heave and he has been caught at deep mid-wicket. He is going nowhere and is standing in his crease even after the catch is taken. He thinks it's a no-ball for being above the waist. The umpires have gone upstairs to check for the no-ball. The replay however shows it is below the waist height and Stokes will have to depart. Stokes c Vijay Shankar b Boult 1(2)

Maxwell to D Arcy Short, out Caught by Avesh Khan!! Maxwell will have the last laugh in the battle of the Australians. D Arcy Short loses his shape, he wanted to slog across the line, gets an outside edge and ball scoops up in the air to Avesh, who takes a fine catch at short third man. D Arcy Short c Avesh Khan b Maxwell 44(25) [4s-2 6s-4]

Narine to Watson, out Caught by Shivam Mavi!! Watson couldn't have picked the fielder out any better. He knows, can't believe his luck. Punches his bat in anger. Narine provides the breakthrough for KKR. Landed short and asked Watson to go for it. Watto rocked back and smoked it flat, forgets there is a fielder set for the trap. Hits it straight to Mavi, who takes it at the edge of the bounce. Didn't have to move an inch. Like Faf, Watto also fails to convert his start into a big-score. Watson c Shivam Mavi b Narine 36(25) [4s-4 6s-2]

Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, out Caught by Johnson!! In the air and taken at long-on. Two wickets in two overs for KKR, they are plotting a turnaround here. Both set batsmen dismissed. Well-flighted delivery outside off, Raina grounds his knee and smacked it - skews it off the toe-end - finds long-on. It was in the slot but Raina couldn't connect it well. Raina c Johnson b Kuldeep Yadav 31(26) [4s-4]

Narine to Rayudu, out Bowled!! Narine is bowling a fine spell today. Gets the dangerous batsman, the highest run getter of CSK with this peach of a delivery. It's the offie that does the trick. Rayudu waited for it and tried to run it down but the ball spins in sharply, flicks his pads and takes down the sticks. Second scalp of the match for Sunil Narine and the crowd at Eden erupts in joy. Rayudu b Narine 21(17) [4s-3]

Chawla to Jadeja, out Caught by Karthik!! Top-edge and DK takes it. Was short and quick around off, Jadeja tried to pull it but all he could manage is a top edge. DK sprinted back, called for it and took it. Jadeja c Karthik b Chawla 13(12) [4s-1]

Chawla to du Plessis, out Bowled!! Cleaned up. du Plessis is hoodwinked by Chawla's googly. He was strugging to pick earlier as well. Credit to DK for bringing back the leggie. KKR draw first blood. It was dropped a tad shorter - the googly - du Plessis stayed back, waiting for the leggie perhaps. The ball spun back in, goes through the bat-pad gate and crashes the stumps. The South African skipper is absolutely clueless. Eden Gardens roars. du Plessis b Chawla 27(15) [4s-4 6s-1]

Lungi Ngidi to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Watson!! Was a short of a length delivery on middle and leg, Lynn went for a pull and got an inside edge before the ball clipped his pads and carried to Watson in the slip. The on field umpire couldn't pick that up in the background noise but UltraEdge comes to Ngidi's rescue. Lynn is back to the hut and all of a sudden there are CSK, CSK chants at the ground. Chris Lynn c Watson b Lungi Ngidi 12(6) [6s-2]

Harbhajan to Rinku Singh, out Bowled!! Gone! Harbhajan Singh likes it. The quick delivery does the trick. Fired full and on the stumps. Rinku moves leg-side and swings his bat hard; misses completely. He attempted the big heave. Crashes into middle and leg. Rinku Singh b Harbhajan 16(18) [4s-2]

KM Asif to Uthappa, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! The skiddy pace of Asif gets Uthappa. Was a short and quick delivery around off, Uthappa went ahead with his pull and got a top edge to mid-on. DJ Bravo won't miss those as he settles underneath and reverse cups it. Two of KKR's finest batsmen are back to the hut. Uthappa c Dwayne Bravo b KM Asif 6(8) [4s-1]

Jadeja to Narine, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! Dropped him twice, conceded a six and finally Jadeja removes Narine. Much-needed breakthrough. The West Indian perishes trying to deposit another one into the stands. The length was on the shorter side and Narine was a touch early to swing his bat. He wanted to go over deep mid-wicket, ended up lofting it to long-on. Bravo won't drop those. Yet another important knock from Narine. He's done his job. Narine c Dwayne Bravo b Jadeja 32(20) [4s-4 6s-2]

Cutting to Gayle, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Cutting's gotten rid of Gayle in his first over. Prized scalp this for the Australian. Seemed like the off-paced delivery once again. Gayle picked it and went back to mow it over deep mid-wicket. In the process, loses his shape completely and skies it as far as SKY, who settles under it. Throws the ball up in the air, that says a lot of how desperate they were to see the back of Universe Boss. Gayle c Suryakumar Yadav b Cutting 50(40) [4s-6 6s-2]

Krunal Pandya to Nair, out Yuvraj Run Out!! Third umpire called in for a run-out check but Yuvi has already started walking. Oh jeez! Yuvraj is nowhere in the frame. Goner! Unnecessary wicket. There was never a run there, to be honest. "Crazy running" was the comment from Haydos on air. There was a mix-up between both batsmen in the last over as well. Dropped in front of point, they set off for a single. Yuvi's bat got stuck in the turf and a flat, neat throw from Lewis to the keeper. Kishan does the rest. Yuvraj run out (Lewis/Ishan Kishan) 14(14) [6s-1]

McClenaghan to Nair, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Nair was iffy with his running right from the start, rode his luck but finally perishes now. Fullish on off, Nair backed away aiming to go inside-out over extra cover. Doesn't get the timing right and ends up hitting it towards Harik at long-off, who had to run to his left and gobbles it up. Made that look so easy, didn't he? Punjab continue to lose wickets in clusters. Nair c Hardik Pandya b McClenaghan 23(12) [4s-1 6s-2]

Bumrah to Axar, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Bumrah has been exceptional today. Deceives Patel with an off-cutter that gripped off the deck. Patel checked his loft, didn't go full throttle and ended up chipping it tamely to Hardik at long-on. Safe as houses! Another one bites the dust. This is superb comeback by MI. Axar c Hardik Pandya b Bumrah 13(12) [6s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Caught by Senior Pandya. Mayank combusts. Had to go for it simply; full and outside off, Agarwal was backing away and had to reach out for it. Threw his bat and lost his shape. Slices it up in the air to short third man. The ball was swirling and Krunal judges it well to hold onto it without much fuss. Mayank Agarwal c Krunal Pandya b Hardik Pandya 11(7) [6s-1]

Markande to Rahul, out Caught by Duminy!! That's a rank long hop and Rahul is gutted as he walks back to the hut. This was the attempted wrong 'un by Markande, dropped it way too short though, might have stuck slightly on the pitch, Rahul had to wait that extra second as he pulled, enough to mess up with his timing and he struck it hard, flat and straight to Duminy at deep mid-wicket. Rahul c Duminy b Markande 24(20) [4s-1 6s-2]

Stoinis to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Rahul!! Huge wicket! Massive blow for Mumbai as the well-set Suryakumar has to depart. Have to say that this was a result of the slow scoring by Lewis and Kishan at the other end. Slower ball and the length is dragged back as well, Suryakumar went for the slog but only managed to sky it high in the air. Rahul was quick to call for it and trekked back nicely to sit under it. High pressure catch and it's been taken. Mumbai in a spot of bother here. They need their skipper to take charge. Suryakumar Yadav c Rahul b Stoinis 57(42) [4s-6 6s-3]

Mujeeb to Ishan Kishan, out Bowled!! Excellent comeback from Mujeeb! Got carted for two biggies but the Afghan lad has held his nerve brilliantly. Saw Kishan give the charge and hung it back a bit in the air. Pulled the length back just a touch and that meant that the wild slog was never really on. Kishan misses and finds the stumps in a mess. Back to back overs where the runs have come but so have the wickets and that's what KXIP will be concerned with as MI bat deep. Ishan Kishan b Mujeeb 25(19) [6s-3]

Andrew Tye to Hardik Pandya, out Bowled!! The stumps are in a mess! This is excellent stuff from Tye and this is why he is sought after in the T20 format. Loves bowling at the back end of the innings. This is a big strike for KXIP as the dangerous Hardik Pandya has to depart. He did get going tonight from the word go but his cameo has been nipped in the bud. The cutter from Tye and he did smartly to attack the stumps, a wild slog attempted and once Hardik missed it, he knew the result. Woodwork destroyed! Hardik Pandya b Andrew Tye 23(13) [4s-2 6s-1]

Mujeeb to Lewis, out Caught by Rahul!! Gets Lewis with the back-of-the-hand delivery. But to be honest, that wasn't what defeated the batsman; it was more the drift that was taking the ball away. Lewis went for the cut, played out of sync with the lack of pace on the ball, and edged it behind. Sharp catch by KL Rahul, it must be said. Lewis c Rahul b Mujeeb 10(13)

Murugan Ashwin to Rayudu, out Caught by Siraj!! .. and he strikes first ball. It's the big wicket of Rayudu, dropped short and wide of off, Rayudu's eyes lit up as he saw the width, went way too hard on the cut, lost his poise and the thick top-edge lobbed gently to Siraj at short third man. Relief for RCB, but still need 7 wickets to pinch this match. Rayudu c Siraj b Murugan Ashwin 32(25) [4s-3 6s-2]

de Grandhomme to Shorey, out Caught by Mandeep!! Short, wide and OUT. Looks like RCB have found a way of taking wickets, another soft dismissal for CSK. Shorey is the man to go, he saw the width, went with hard hands on the cut, nailed the shot but didn't bother to keep it down. Straight into the bucket like hands of Mandeep at backward point. DO RCB stand a chance here? Shorey c Mandeep b de Grandhomme 8(9) [6s-1]

U Yadav to Watson, out Bowled!! The perfect set-up from Umesh. Couple of short of length deliveries before the full one, Watson's feet went nowhere as he tried to get bat on ball, beaten for sheer pace and the ball uproots the off-stump. The direction is what mattered and Umesh got it spot on. Aimed right for the base of off-stump. There's the wicket RCB were looking for. Watson b U Yadav 11(14) [4s-2]

U Yadav to Raina, out Caught by Southee!! Raina is waiting. He has been asked to walk back. Fine take by Southee. With a leg slip in place, Raina had to find other areas to play the short ball, so he moves away to leg and tries to flat-bat it over long-on, got it off the toe-end and it still almost cleared long-on. Southee first held on to the catch, then saw himself overbalancing, threw the ball up and went out before coming back in to complete the catch. Raina c Southee b U Yadav 25(21) [4s-2 6s-1]

Lungi Ngidi to Brendon McCullum, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Ngidi runs his fingers across for some magic. Helped by Brendon McCullum, who came down the track and backed away early, allowing Lungi Ngidi to take pace off the ball. Checked the flat-batted smack that he intended to clear cow corner with, toe-ended it to mid-on, where Shardul made a somewhat easy catch look difficult. Probably the wind. Stuttered on the first attempt but managed to hold onto it. Brendon McCullum c SN Thakur b Lungi Ngidi 5(3) [4s-1]

Jadeja to Mandeep, out Caught by Willey!! Jadeja has his second! He doesn't celebrate like he usually does. Just stares at the batsman. Not sure why he has been subdued today despite getting the wickets. Probably the pressure leading upto today is the reason. Coming to the wicket, not the kind of shot Mandeep should be playing when you are trying to rebuild. Tries to take Jaddu on with a slog sweep but doesn't quite get hold of it. There is a deep backward square leg in place, precisely for this and he gobbles to up. More problems for RCB. Mandeep c Willey b Jadeja 7(13)

Jadeja to Parthiv Patel, out Caught&Bowled!! Another one bites the dust. Jadeja is having a field day. What a spell! The slowness of the surface does Parthiv in here. He was early into the flick stroke on seeing the flight and only managed a leading edge straight back to Jaddu who accepts it. Again no real celebrations from Jadeja. This has been a fantastic spell from the left-arm spinner. Fair to say that he has made a fine comeback after all the criticism. A nice innings from Parthiv but he knew that he should have batted through. Parthiv Patel c and b Jadeja 53(41) [4s-5 6s-2]

Harbhajan to Murugan Ashwin, out Stumped!! RCB are being spun to the dumps here. Harbhajan's turn to sneak a wicket now, his second. Wonderfully bowled this, slowed it up and got a bit of drift as well. Lured Ashwin into pushing at it and this just straightened a tad to beat the edge. Dhoni has super quick to whip off the bails and as replays showed, the back leg was just on the line. That was never going to be enough. RCB sink further .Murugan Ashwin st Dhoni b Harbhajan 1(2)

Willey to de Grandhomme, out Caught by Raina!! It's all falling apart here for RCB. First IPL wicket for Willey and he is thrilled. What a horror stroke from de Grandhomme though? He knew that all the responsibility was now down to him and instead of playing through, he decides to go for broke. Never the pitch for that kind of batting and he departs. A cutter on a good length and he tried to slog this away but only managed to skew this high towards extra cover. Raina charged forward to take it with ease. de Grandhomme c Raina b Willey 8(8) [4s-1]

Lungi Ngidi to U Yadav, out U Yadav Run Out!! Bulls eye from Willey at mid-off. Charged to attack the ball and fired in an accurate throw at the bowler's end. Umesh was always struggling to get in and eventually was well short. Fullish ball that was driven off the front foot past the bowler and they were looking to sneak a quick single. Not to be. That sort of day for RCB when nothing goes right. U Yadav run out (Willey) 1(5)

Dwayne Bravo to Siraj, out Siraj Run Out!! 1 run completed A wicket to cap the innings. Full toss that Siraj mistimed towards long-on and they were going for the second run. Had to with this being the last ball but Rayudu's throw at the keeper's end was on target. Dhoni whipped off the bails in a flash and even the dive couldn't save Siraj. RCB end with an underwhelming total. Siraj run out (Rayudu/Dhoni) 3(7)

Jadeja to Kohli, out Bowled!! Umm, let me watch it again. Jadeja is so shellshocked that he takes all the time in the world to make sense of what has happened, and forgets to celebrate. That's what we'll assume. Note the pace: 100.7kmph. Hits a length and straightens it just enough to castle Kohli, who was looking to glide it down to third man. Beaten by the pace off the pitch. Just hurried at Kohli that. Happens. Kohli b Jadeja 8(11) [4s-1]

Harbhajan to de Villiers, out Stumped!! Kohli out, and de Villiers follows him into the pavilion the next over. Bizarre way to get out actually. He's trying to reverse-paddle an off break from Harbhajan. Stretches way in front to meet that, is beaten by a bit of turn down the leg-side, and then Dhoni is quick. Doesn't even allow de Villiers a chance. de Villiers st Dhoni b Harbhajan 1(4)

Sandeep Sharma to Prithvi Shaw, out Maxwell Run Out!! Can you believe it? Maxwell has been run out, what an unfortunate way to get out. Nothing's going right for Maxwell this year. Was a full length delivery around off and Shaw drove it straight back to the bowler. Sandeep in his followthrough got his hand to it and parried it on to the stumps at the bowler's end. Maxwell is well short of the crease and he has to walk back. Got to feel for the Aussie batsman! Maxwell run out (Sandeep Sharma) 2(3)

Rashid Khan to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by S Kaul!! Sunrisers' best bowler strikes, gets the young opener. Tossed up delivery around off, Shaw goes after it with a slog and gets a top edge to short third man. Kaul stationed in the position goes down on his knee and reverse cups it. Fine knock by Shaw, nevertheless. He has laid the foundation for the likes of Pant and other Delhi batsmen. Prithvi Shaw c S Kaul b Rashid Khan 65(36) [4s-6 6s-3]

S Kaul to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Dhawan!! Told ya! Shikhar is a good fielder, compensates for the early fault of his in the previous over as he holds onto a catch and does the 'Thigh five' to get the Hyderabad crowd into a frenzy. Full and on leg, Iyer had the license to go for it. Picked it off his pads and whacked hard, no real timing behind it and hits it straight to Dhawan at deep mid-wicket. Shreyas Iyer c Dhawan b S Kaul 44(36) [4s-3 6s-2]

Rashid Khan to Naman Ojha, out Naman Ojha Run Out!! Suicidal running and DD lose another wicket. Remember, Pant was involved in a run-out against CSK as well where he ran his skipper out. Today, it's the turn of Ojha, who has to depart early. Defended to the right of the bowler and Ojha took off, Pant responded and stopped, throwing his partner under the bus. Rashid Khan moves across quickly and lasers a throw to the keeper, who does the rest. Naman Ojha run out (Rashid Khan/Saha) 1(4)

Rashid Khan to Pant, out Lbw!! Pant has been given out LBW, he reviews. No issues with the front foot. Clearly no bat there. Only factor that could favour Pant is the height. Hit in-line as well. Ball-tracker is out: 2 reds. Pitched - in-line. Impact - in-line. Wickets - umpire's call. Clipping the top of middle. What a fightback from SRH this has been. Skiddy leg-break from Rashid on a short of length, Pant went back for the pull and it didn't rise much as he expected. Misses and is rapped on the back thigh. Was given out on-field, he reviewed in hope but in vain. Pant lbw b Rashid Khan 18(19) [4s-1]

Mishra to Dhawan, out Bowled!! A long stare to the batsman, followed by a loud roar - that's Mishra's reaction. He has removed both the openers. Beautiful bowling. Tosses this well above the batsman's eyeline and that entices Dhawan into a false stroke. He cleared his front leg to hack it over the leg-side and missed it completely. Was bowled full and Dhawan was beaten in the flight. Middle stump takes the brunt. Replay shows that it was a wrong 'un. Dhawan b Mishra 33(30) [4s-2 6s-1]

Plunkett to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Prithvi Shaw!! The teenager takes a high-pressure catch. The cross-seamed fuller length ball, Pandey went too hard on his lofted shot and lost all his shape in the process. Wanted to go downtown and the bat face turned at the point of impact. Went miles up in the air and Shaw settled under it after running back from extra cover. Reverse-cupped. Manish Pandey c Prithvi Shaw b Plunkett 21(17) [4s-2]

Mishra to Hales, out Bowled!! That's an absolute peach. Hales had no clue, still doesn't. Stands in his crease and stares at his stumps in total disbelief. That ball reminded me of the famous ball bowled by Warne to Gatting. Mishra gives air on this occasion, gets it to drift in and beats him with the away-turn. Pitched around middle and leg, beat the outside edge and crashed into the off-stump. There's the breakthrough DD were looking for. Hales not happy with Mishy's celebration in his face. Maybe something was said. Kept looking back while walking. Hales b Mishra 45(31) [4s-3 6s-3]

Markande to Uthappa, out Caught by Cutting!! The cameras rightly pan to Hardik Pandya, who was furious when Markande had dropped Uthappa on four. Redemption for the young leggie here. First ball to Uthappa in this new spell and he's taken him out with a leg break. Got it to spin, which meant that Uthappa, on his front foot and going for the big hit, had to slice it. Carries nice and high to long-off. Uthappa c Cutting b Markande 54(35) [4s-6 6s-3]

Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Bumrah!! Mumbai have found a way past their ex. Nitish Rana, as strong as he's through square on the off-side, has a few issues against the short ball. So Hardik Pandya does exactly that. Angles this seam-up short ball across from over the wicket, has Nitish Rana fetching the pull from outside off, and has him top-edging. Taken at deep square leg by Bumrah, who drops down to take it one-handed amidst fears of a spill. Nitish Rana c Bumrah b Hardik Pandya 31(27) [4s-3 6s-1]

Bumrah to A Russell, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! That's a terrific catch from Krunal and Russell falls to a top-edged pull. Hurried by the pace, so looked in no position to play the shot. Backed away, and met the ball with weight on his front foot. Krunal swerved in the deep, anticipating the trajectory and then dived in front at deep backward square to take the catch. Good effort, running back from short fine leg. A Russell c Krunal Pandya b Bumrah 9(10) [4s-1]

Krunal Pandya to Narine, out Caught by Rohit!! Oh, that's it for Narine. Three consecutive boundaries from KKR and here's the wicket. KP angles this across Narine, who was always going for it. Gets a toe-end and Rohit nicely traces a few yards back at extra cover to take this. Narine c Rohit b Krunal Pandya 5(4) [4s-1]

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Bumrah!! A soft dismissal, this came from nowhere but MI will gladly take it. The short ball has got them a wicket, Lynn is gutted as he walks away. Banged in short and at the stumps, Lynn had all the time in the world as he pulled, just didn't pick the gap, hits it straight into the hands of Bumrah at short fine. Relief for McClenaghan and MI. There's the customary check for the front-foot no-ball, but McClenaghan is fine on that count as well. Chris Lynn c Bumrah b McClenaghan 17(13) [4s-4]

Hardik Pandya to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! The Pandya brothers in action and KKR have lost both openers now. This is a horrendous shot from young Gill though, the slower off-cutter from Hardik, Gill was looking to hoist it out of the stadium, the bat turned on impact as the ball gripped on the surface, the steepling toe-end went high and towards mid-off. The elder Pandya was under the ball, completes it with great composure and all of a sudden - KKR have lost two. Shubman Gill c Krunal Pandya b Hardik Pandya 7(5) [4s-1]

Narine to Rohit, out Caught by (sub)Rinku Singh!! Big wicket for KKR. Another failure for Rohit this season. Only three times he has gone past 20 this season and Mumbai have won on all three occasions. They need someone now to take them close to that 200-mark. An off-spinner and it was too full to be sweeping, Rohit could not get underneath it completely and the top-edge skies towards deep mid-wicket. Rinku on as a substitute takes it calmly. Rohit c (sub)Rinku Singh b Narine 11(11) [4s-1]

A Russell to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Karthik!! Russell might not be bowling at full tilt but he's provided crucial wickets for KKR throughout the tournament. Got Lewis earlier in the innings and now accounts for a well-set Yadav. A tired shot from Yadav though. Sees the short of length delivery outside off and looks to play the back cut, thin edge and Karthik does the rest behind the stumps. Suryakumar Yadav c Karthik b A Russell 59(39) [4s-7 6s-2]

Narine to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Not happening this time. Similar kind of delivery and similar kind of stroke from Pandya, but he finds the man at long-on. Narine bowls the off-break with a dragged back length, Pandya with his weight back looks to muscle it over Gill, doesn't get enough and the youngsters takes it calmly. Krunal Pandya c Shubman Gill b Narine 14(11) [4s-1 6s-1]

A Russell to Lewis, out Caught by Chris Lynn!! Andre Russell provides the breakthrough. The slower ball - off the back of the hand - does the trick. On a fullish length outside off and Lewis was early into his shot. Looked to biff it downtown and could only get an outside edge that ballooned straight to Lynn at short third man. The 91-run stand has been broken. Lewis c Chris Lynn b A Russell 43(28) [4s-5 6s-2]

Anureet Singh to Nair, out Bowled!! Looked like the knuckle ball. Banged in on a back of a length outside off, Nair looked to pull and chops an inside edge onto his stumps. Another pretty Karun Nair innings that cries for more deliveries at the crease. Nair b Anureet Singh 31(23) [4s-2 6s-2]

Gowtham to Axar, out Caught by D Arcy Short!! Excellent catch! We've seen a few crackers already in this match and here is another one. The pressure was telling on the aggressive Axar and with a spinner on, he decides to take a chance. Slogs this over mid-wicket but only gets height on it and not the distance. Well, actually almost cleared Short who took the catch calmly and ensured that his foot didn't touch the ropes. Smart work. RR are clawing their way back here. Axar c D Arcy Short b Gowtham 4(5)

Jofra Archer to Gayle, out Caught by Samson!! Jofra Archer has the last laugh in this mini battle. It was another short of length ball, Gayle stays put and smashes the cut shot straight to Samson at point. Ball came at a lighting speed and Samson does really well to hold on it. Universe boss will have to depart without contributing much. Gayle c Samson b Jofra Archer 8(11) [4s-2]

Stokes to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by R Tripathi!! Dismal IPL for Mayank Agarwal continues. He will consider himself massively unlucky, a meter to the fielder's right or left and that was a four. It was a short of length ball, Mayank Agarwal gets in a good position, connects well, he does everything well but finds the fielder at deep square leg. This just get to show how imperative placement is in cricket. Mayank Agarwal c R Tripathi b Stokes 2(3)

Ashwin to D Arcy Short, out Caught by Andrew Tye!! Skipper strikes!! Aimless slog from D Arcy Short, stays low and hacks across the line; Ash slowed it up nicely to get that extra rip, it catches the top-edge and flies high for mid-on who takes a tumbling catch after a swirling dance. Tye it is. D Arcy Short c Andrew Tye b Ashwin 2(2)

Andrew Tye to Samson, out Caught by Nair!! That was middled to perfection, but right to the fielder near the fence at the same time. Shortish delivery around off, Samson picks the length early and pulls it nicely but Nair stationed at deep square leg moves to his right and reverse cups it just near the fence. Samson fails to capitalise on the start as Royals lose their third wicket. Samson c Nair b Andrew Tye 28(23) [4s-2 6s-1]

Mujeeb to Stokes, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! This is an excellent catch! Brilliant work by the two fielders in the deep. A tag-team effort by Mayank Agarwal and Manoj Tiwary results in his down fall. Stokes came down the wicket and towered it to long-off where Mayank grabbed it and just as he was about to lose balance he parried it to Tiwary who comes running in from long-on and takes it. Stokes stands there in disbelief but he has to walk back. Was looking so good but nothing to take away from the fielders there. Stokes c Manoj Tiwary b Mujeeb 12(9) [4s-2]

Mujeeb to Buttler, out Caught by Rahul!! Buttler departs soon after reaching his fifty. Maybe a lapse in concentration there. This was darted outside off and as Buttler tried to run it down to third man he got a thick outside edge. Rahul behind the wickets takes a sharp catch as Royals lose their fifth wicket. Mujeeb gets his second wicket. Buttler c Rahul b Mujeeb 51(39) [4s-7]

Mujeeb to Jofra Archer, out Bowled!! What a jaffa! Mujeeb is on a hat-trick. Archer had no clue about this, stands there in disbelief just like Stokes did earlier when that catch was taken. This pitched on off and came back sharply to go through Archer's defence. Takes down the middle stump and Royals are in danger of getting bowled out well within the 20 overs. Jofra Archer b Mujeeb 0(1)

Rajpoot to Gowtham, out Caught by Stoinis!! Another one bites the dust. Was a short delivery around off, Gowtham went for a pull but the pace was too good for him and the batsman ended up splicing it to short mid-wicket. Can't get any easier for Stoinis who grabs it with both hands. This is why Rajpoot was brought back into the attack and he gets a wicket, doesn't disappoint his skipper. Gowtham c Stoinis b Rajpoot 5(3) [4s-1]

Andrew Tye to R Tripathi, out Caught by Ashwin!! Punjab continue to chip at the wickets. It was the slower delivery this time around. Full without much pace in it, Tripathi lofts it but is too early in his shot. The ball spoons up to wide mid-off where Ashwin completes a safe catch. Can Punjab clean up Rajasthan's tail? Or will we get to see a fight from the Royals? R Tripathi c Ashwin b Andrew Tye 11(13) [4s-1]

Andrew Tye to Unadkat, out Shreyas Gopal Run Out!! Wicket to end the innings. That sums up the innings for Royals as Rahul denies them the bye. It was a slower delivery around off, Unadkat was early in his pull again, got beaten and as Gopal tried to sneak in a bye, Rahul had a direct hit at the striker's end. Shreyas Gopal run out (Rahul) 24(16) [4s-3]

Axar to Rahane, out Caught by Gayle!! Chris Gayle is claiming a catch and the replays suggest it is O-U-T. Rahane's struggles continue. Dropped short and ripped away from Rahane's reach, he goes for the cut and slashes it hard in front of backward point and guess who? It's the Universal Boss, Chris Gayle. Dives full length and nestles it inches above the turf. Good reflexes. Rahane c Gayle b Axar 5(7)

Rashid Khan to de Villiers, out Bowled!! He's got him this time and off goes Rashid. Oh what celebrations. It's the big wicket of AB de Villiers, who goes for the cut shot again off the googly and perishes. Tried backing away to it, but the ball kept creeping in to deny the room. Eventually, crashes into the stumps off the under-edge. This game has come alive. de Villiers b Rashid Khan 5(8)

S Kaul to Moeen Ali, out Caught by Saha!! Given. Sunrisers bowlers roaring back into this. They could be ahead in the game now actually. Back of length delivery angled away from off, Moeen fancies a front-foot pull but all he does is get a faint under-edge through to Saha. Didn't look comfortable during his stay at all. Moeen Ali c Saha b S Kaul 10(7) [4s-2]

Shakib to Parthiv Patel, out Lbw!! Okay, I take my words back. Masterstroke it has turned out to be from KW. There was risk in bringing the left-arm spinner but the idea was to tempt Parthiv into a rash stroke. He did get a couple away but not this time. It was pushed through quicker in line of the stumps and he went for a slog sweep across the line. Missed and it pinged him flush on the pads. Easy call for the umpire as far as the LBW is concerned. Parthiv did wonder about the review but then rightfully continued walking. Parthiv Patel lbw b Shakib 20(13) [4s-4]

Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, out Bowled!! Sensational bowling from Bhuvneshwar Kumar. Just brilliant. No way anyone's hitting this ball for six. De Grandhomme anticipates the yorker, walks across premeditatedly but he still can do nothing about it. Drags it off the inside edge and leaves his stumps in a mess. Leaves RCB's season in a mess. de Grandhomme b Bhuvneshwar 33(29) [4s-1 6s-2]

Sandeep Sharma to Vohra, out Bowled!! The drop doesn't cost SRH at all in the end. Atrocious stroke from Vohra though and is undone by some wily bowling from Sandeep. Slower ball and Vohra was early into the sweep by moving across the stumps. Took a piece of the bat, the pad and then disturbed the stumps. Vohra stood there in disbelief, probably wondering how he got out. I reckon he should wonder why he tried this shot. Vohra b Sandeep Sharma 8(10)

Shakib to Kohli, out Caught by Y Pathan!! One-handed ripper from Yusuf! What's with IPL these days? Gayle picked up one yesterday and another big man does today. Huge wicket for SRH and Shakib has picked this up with a nothing ball to be honest. Skidded through off a good length and Kohli wanted to go across the line. Got hurried into it and ended up spooning it towards short third man where the big Pathan leapt, stretching his right hand. And it stuck folks, it stuck. Look at the joy on the SRH fielders' faces. Game on, then. Kohli c Y Pathan b Shakib 39(30) [4s-5 6s-1]

U Yadav to Williamson, out Caught by Mandeep!! High in the air and caught at long leg. Very tight call. As far as no-ball is concerned. Umesh has an inch of the spike behind the line. That should do. Williamson walked across to this slower delivery, aimed to go leg-side, but it looped off a thick top edge and Mandeep made no mistake. Just when Williamson was changing gears he gets out. RCB needed that. Williamson c Mandeep b U Yadav 56(39) [4s-5 6s-2]

Southee to Shakib, out Caught by U Yadav!! Southee gets Shakib. Good bowling. Bowled the cutter outside off, made Shakib fetch the slog and he cannot clear backward square. Last over he managed a boundary, not this time. Shakib c U Yadav b Southee 35(32) [4s-5]

Siraj to Y Pathan, out Bowled!! That's pace and it has knocked Pathan's leg stump out of the ground. Siraj leaps and punches the air to celebrate. Big wicket that. Hint of tail on this angled in delivery, beats the heave and takes out the stump. Y Pathan b Siraj 12(7) [4s-2]

Siraj to Saha, out Bowled!! The stumps are a royal mess. 146 clicks this one and it has beaten Saha for sheer pace. Fired in on middle and leg, Saha was looking to scoop and saw two of his pegs splattered. Siraj jumping and punching the air for joy. End of a very good spell. Saha b Siraj 8(5) [6s-1]

Southee to Rashid Khan, out Rashid Khan Run Out!! 1 run completed. No chance of two and Rashid Khan is miles out. Spliced pull by Rashid Khan, lands in the mid-wicket area, Kohli charges and fires in an accurate throw to Parthiv Patel who does the rest. Rashid Khan run out (Kohli/Parthiv Patel) 1(3)

Southee to Bhuvneshwar, out S Kaul Run Out!! 1 run completed. Confusion and Kaul is gone. Swiped to deep mid, again Kohli is quick and a bit of an yes-no situation, accurate throw on the bounce to Parthiv Patel who whips the bails off, leaving Kaul out. He needed to dive but didn't. RCB finishing strongly. S Kaul run out (Kohli/Parthiv Patel) 1(1)

Southee to Hales, out Bowled!! The middle stump goes for a toss. Southee does it again. A cross-seam delivery on middle, which Hales missed. Pretty ordinary as he was looking to turn it to leg, closed the bat face too early and saw his middle stump flattened. Hales b Southee 5(5) [4s-1]

Southee to Sandeep Sharma, out Lbw!! Review off the last ball. Would you believe it? It is Southee who has asked Kohli for it. Has Sandeep got outside the line? The original call was not out. Hawk-Eye in and it shows that Sandeep hasn't got outside the line. Three reds and gone. Cheeky from Sandeep, tried to reverse-sweep a full ball on off, missed and once he didn't get bat on that he was dead. Strong final over from Southee and RCB. Sandeep Sharma lbw b Southee 0(1)

Siraj to Dhawan, out Caught by Southee!! Dhawan holes out and the local boy Siraj has his arms raised in triumph. Short at the body, Dhawan pulls but this is a big ground, so didn't have the power to clear Southee at deep backward square. He is a very good fielder and won't drop those. An important wicket for Dhawan is one man who can score at a fast clip. Dhawan c Southee b Siraj 13(19) [4s-1]

Chahal to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Kohli!! What a soft dismissal. And full credit to Kohli for placing himself there. Chipped in the air and straight to the RCB skipper. Did Manish Pandey not realise Kohli was right in his face? He swings the air with his bat in frustration. Held up on the pitch and tamely played by Manish. Chahal was surprised as well as how easily he got that wicket. Manish Pandey c Kohli b Chahal 5(7)

Stokes to Manoj Tiwary, out Caught by Rahane!! Half the side back in the hut. RR are back in this!! A nothing shot from Manoj Tiwary, sits back and looks to loft-drive Stokes over cover, but he hadn't quite read the pace on this. It did stop a tad and he ended up spooning it towards cover where Jinks dives full length to grab it cleanly. Manoj Tiwary c Rahane b Stokes 7(8)

Anureet Singh to Axar, out Axar Run Out!! 1 run completed. Run out appeal here. Slower and wider, Axar dragged it to long-on, where the fielder ran across and fired a throw to Buttler, with the batsmen trying to go for the second. Axar wasn't sure about the second, even put his hand up but Rahul was through, and he had to oblige. That's touch and go actually, the run out. Diving Axar's bat is just about at the line when Buttler takes the bails off. Oh dear, that's a tough one for the third umpire. And it's been given out.. Small margins and it goes against the batsman this time. Axar run out (Binny/Buttler) 9(5) [4s-1]

Unadkat to Stoinis, out Caught by Gowtham!! Sehwag's smiling in the dug out, perhaps because he's seen Gowtham take the catch and put the ball in his pocket. Very cool. A full toss outside off that Stoinis timed well but this is a big ground, we must remember. So there's Gowtham waiting at a square deep cover, timing his leap just perfect to reverse-cup the ball above his head. Stoinis c Gowtham b Unadkat 11(16)

Gowtham to Ashwin, out Bowled!! Ashwin had taken a couple of brilliant decisions this season, but this was an absolute disaster. Dream of a delivery from Gowtham, his confidence was high after taking Gayle and he gives this ball ample air; the ball turned, gripped and went through the bat-pad gap of Ashwin. Ash was trying to mow across the line and it ended up looking silly. Ashwin b Gowtham 0(2)

Jofra Archer to Nair, out Caught by Unadkat!! Oh dear! What are Punjab doing here, self-destruction of the highest order. It was a short ball at the body, Nair was hurried by the extra pace as he wanted to pull it, but the ball got big on him and he ends up slicing it. Unadakat from mid-wicket goes back and takes a brilliant catch, it is never easy taking such catches, but Unadkat made it look easy. Nair c Unadkat b Jofra Archer 3(5)

Ish Sodhi to Akshdeep Nath, out Caught by Gowtham!! Ish Sodhi was bowling beautifully and this was always on the cards. It was a flighted delivery at the stumps, Akshdeep Nath went for a wild swing against the turn, he ends up mistiming it high in the air, long-off comes under it and takes it easily. Punjab are in real trouble now. Akshdeep Nath c Gowtham b Ish Sodhi 9(13) [4s-1]

Mujeeb to Samson, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! Mujeeb strikes. Suckered Samson by tossing it up and the Kerala lad fell into the trap. It was in the slot for Samson, he cleared his front leg and whacked hard - the bat face turns on impact and he ends up slicing it straight to long-on. Dolly for Tiwary and Punjab break the stand. Rahman, with the golden arm. Samson c Manoj Tiwary b Mujeeb 22(18) [4s-1 6s-1]

Mujeeb to Buttler, out Stumped!! And Buttler doesn't make use of the reprieve. His watch is ended, however has done his job. The wily mystery spinner from Afghanistan picks up his second wicket. Saw the batsman advancing, pushed it through quicker and held it short too. Buttler didn't get to the pitch and misses his attempted slog. Easy stumping for Rahul. Two set batsmen back in the hut for the Royals. Rahman tops the wicket-takers chart with this scalp. Buttler st Rahul b Mujeeb 82(58) [4s-9 6s-1]

Andrew Tye to Stokes, out Binny Run Out!! 1 run completed. Another one falls. Royals in a bit of strife here. A fuller length delivery outside off, Stokes blasted it to long-off. Karun Nair, the fielder was a little squarer and the second run was on. But after collecting it with a sliding stop, Nair released the throw in a flash accurately to the bowler. Binny was too casual and didn't bother to dive, which would've saved him. Not to be today. Binny run out (Nair/Andrew Tye) 11(7) [6s-1]

Andrew Tye to Stokes, out Caught by Ashwin!! A wicket against run of play and Tye nets the big fish. Stokes gone. The wheels are coming off for Rajasthan Royals. Tye hurls a low full toss outside off, Stokes goes for the across-the-line swipe and loses his shape completely. Skews it off the bottom to extra cover. Skipper Ash swallows it up. Tye is chuffed to bits. Stokes c Ashwin b Andrew Tye 14(11) [4s-1]

Andrew Tye to Jofra Archer, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! RR continue to lose wickets in clusters. Two wickets in three balls now. Superb bowling from Tye. Unleashes the knuckle ball and dupes Archer, who swung high in the air. Only height. Skies it into the dark sky towards long-off. Tiwary is safe as houses. Jofra Archer c Manoj Tiwary b Andrew Tye 0(1)

Andrew Tye to Unadkat, out Caught by Nair!! A wicket to cap off the innings. Fourth scalp for Tye - who's had a field day with the ball. Lands the knuckle ball on a fuller length at the stumps. Unadkat had to go for it and lifted it high. Straight into the gullet of Nair at long-on. Catching has been really good from Punjab today. Unadkat c Nair b Andrew Tye 0(1)

Andrew Tye to Rahane, out Caught by Akshdeep Nath!! His lack of runs continue. And the first change up of the day - the knuckle ball has an instant reward. Rahane doesn't spot, tries going airy over mid-wicket with his flick. Runs down as well as he does so, closes early, spooning up the leading edge. Only as far as extra cover. And Akshdeep has a calm auspicious start. Rahane c Akshdeep Nath b Andrew Tye 9(10) [4s-1]

Stoinis to Gowtham, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! The promotion experiment to force things along doesn't pay off. Gowtham has a role to slog, he clears his front leg and tries hoicking the fuller length into long-on. But the pace is just not there, sticks into the surface, spits up, miscues and finds long-on to perfection. Gowtham c Manoj Tiwary b Stoinis 8(6) [6s-1]

McClenaghan to Narine, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Narine gone. This was always on the cards. The short of length delivery has caused problems for Narine and he succumbs to it. McClenaghan angled it into the left-hander and Narine went through with the flat-batted pull, high on the bat and a skier to mid-on. Krunal steadies himself under the night sky and pouches it calmly. Perfect start for MI and not so for KKR. Narine c Krunal Pandya b McClenaghan 4(2) [4s-1]

Bumrah to Rinku Singh, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Very loose shot, especially with a slip in place. He's trying to steer this back of length delivery with an open face down to third man. All he does is poke it off the outside edge to Ishan Kishan. KKR going down in a heap. Rinku Singh c Ishan Kishan b Bumrah 5(3) [4s-1]

Cutting to Chawla, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Holes out in the deep. Swiped across the line of this slower ball, but got it right off the toe-end. The line was a touch wide of off, which didn't work in his favour either as he had to fetch it. Right down the throat of Suryakumar at deep mid-wicket. Chawla c Suryakumar Yadav b Cutting 11(13) [4s-1]

Krunal Pandya to Tom Curran, out Caught by Duminy!! Not quite to the pitch of the ball as he dances down, goes through with the loft nonetheless and lobs it off the inside half to long-on. Krunal gets on the wickets column as KKR lose their ninth. Tom Curran c Duminy b Krunal Pandya 18(17) [4s-3]

Krunal Pandya to Kuldeep Yadav, out Lbw!! Kuldeep reviews a leg-before call, inadvertently extending KKR's misery by a couple of minutes. Went for a reverse-sweep and missed it by quite a bit. The ball pitched around middle and leg, straightened and would have knocked the stumps over comfortably. KKR go down to their eighth consecutive loss against MI. Kuldeep Yadav lbw b Krunal Pandya 5(15)

Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, out Chris Lynn Run Out!! Yes-no and Lynn is gone. Massive wicket for Mumbai. Lynn was looking in good form and Uthappa has sold him down the river. Made room to punch the flatter delivery to cover-point, called for a single and took a couple of steps out, then said no and by that time Lynn was more than halfway down the wicket. All Suryakumar had to do was throw the ball to Krunal and he did the rest. Lynn is fuming as he walks back. Chris Lynn run out (Suryakumar Yadav/Krunal Pandya) 21(15) [4s-3 6s-1]

Markande to Uthappa, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Markande strikes in his first over. Uthappa scored a fifty in the reverse fixture but not today. And like the previous game, he falls to the leg-spinner. Backs away slightly to the leg-side, Markande pushed it through a bit and hence the slog sweep is not connected properly, hit it flat and straight to deep mid-wicket. Yadav did not have to move much to take that. Uthappa c Suryakumar Yadav b Markande 14(13) [6s-2]

Hardik Pandya to A Russell, out Caught by Markande!! Is that the game? Small moments make such a big difference. Rana wanted the single off the previous ball, but Russell was not interested. Had he crossed over, then he would not have been on strike. Off-cutter outside off, Russell was backing away and expecting another short delivery, then has to reach out to play the lofted drive, doesn't get the elevation and offers a simple catch to Markande at extra cover. A Russell c Markande b Hardik Pandya 2(4)

Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, out Karthik Run Out!! Huge moment. The ball kissed the stumps but the LEDs didn't light up then, but it did when Hardik got his fingers to it with the ball still in contact with his forefinger. So the third umpire had a few replays and gave it in favour of Hardik. Very poor running this from KKR. Second run-out of the innings. Rana tapped the slower delivery towards backward point and took a few steps out, the ever eager Karthik was more than halfway down before being sent back, Duminy was the one who threw the ball and the rest as mentioned above. Karthik put in the dive but still was well short of the crease. Karthik run out (Duminy/Hardik Pandya) 5(3) [4s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Cutting!! That surely should be the game. Two in two for MI. Fantastic catch from Cutting. Short delivery angled across the left-hander, Rana had to fetch the pull and all he could manage was a toe-end towards deep square leg, Cutting had to cover a lot of ground, he got there and slid across to complete the catch. He was out in similar fashion in the previous game as well. Problem area for Rana? Nitish Rana c Cutting b Hardik Pandya 21(19) [4s-2 6s-1]

Chawla to Ishan Kishan, no run. An lbw appeal against Ishan Kishan and the umpire isn't interested. The fielding side decide to go up. Fair delivery. No bat. Pitched outside leg. No need to go further. Was a shortish ball that zipped through and Kishan missed the sweep after going down on a leg. Struck on the back thigh. Would have missed off too

Narine to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Uthappa!! End of an entertaining knock. Rohit knows the value of it. He pats Kishan's back as the latter walks off. Premeditated slog-sweep goes wrong this time, as he didn't generate sufficient power. He dragged it straight down Uthappa's throat at deep backward square leg. Takes just in front of the boundary rope. Ishan Kishan c Uthappa b Narine 62(21) [4s-5 6s-6]

Tom Curran to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Rinku Singh!! Hardik Pandya is caught at long-on. A full toss and Pandya went too hard at it. The bat turns at the point of impact. Easy catch for Rinku Singh. The umpires go upstairs to check if it's a no-ball. Just below the waist height. Hardik Pandya c Rinku Singh b Tom Curran 19(13) [6s-2]

Prasidh to Rohit, out Caught by Uthappa!! Maiden IPL wicket for Prasidh Krishna! Bowls the off-cutter at 113.4 and deceives the Mumbai captain. Rohit was early to swing his bat - an attempt to loft downtown. The bat turns and the ball lobbed to long-off off the cue end. Uthappa ran back from mid-off to gobble that. Rohit c Uthappa b Prasidh 36(31) [4s-2 6s-1]

Chawla to Cutting, out Caught by A Russell!! Russell takes a calm catch just in front of the boundary rope. The quick wrong 'un that zipped through and Cutting gave a mighty heave. Doesn't get the required elevation and Dre Russ snaffles it at deep mid-wicket. Cutting c A Russell b Chawla 24(9) [4s-1 6s-3]

Chawla to Lewis, out Caught by Chris Lynn!! What an unlucky dismissal this for Evin Lewis. Was a short delivery on leg, Lewis tried to drag it away but got beaten and struck on the pads. The momentum of the bat was such that as the ball lobs after clipping the pads, it flicks the back of the willow and deflects towards short third man. Lynn is the man who takes it. Lewis c Chris Lynn b Chawla 18(13) [4s-3]

Chawla to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Rinku Singh!! Rohit Sharma is livid with this dismissal. The skipper thinks Surya should have carried on after getting off to such a good start. A short delivery around off, Suryakumar goes back in his crease and pulls it away. Fails to middle it though, not much power on that shot too. Easy forward catch for Rinku Singh at deep mid-wicket as the umpire signals time-out! Suryakumar Yadav c Rinku Singh b Chawla 36(32) [4s-5 6s-1]

Rashid Khan to Pant, out Harshal Patel Run Out!! 1 run completed. What is Pant doing? That's the second run-out he's involved in tonight. Flicks the flatter delivery to short mid-wicket and gets the single. Calls for the second too but as the throw comes in at the striker's end he sends Harshal back. Goswami fumbles on the first attempt - doesn't gather the ball cleanly - but reacts quickly and gets the direct hit right on the second one with an underhanded flick onto the stumps. Harshal Patel run out (Shikhar Dhawan/Goswami) 24(17) [6s-2]

Bhuvneshwar to Maxwell, out Caught by Hales!! Maxwell looks to go big but misses. Was a back of a length delivery around off, Maxwell went at it with hard hands, swung at it only to get a top edge to wide long-off. Hales is the man who settles underneath and takes it. More importantly Pant is back on strike. Maxwell c Hales b Bhuvneshwar 9(8) [4s-1]

Shakib to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Dhawan!! Shakib strikes! It's a huge wicket as well, that of the in-form Prithvi Shaw. This skid off the track from a good length and Shaw wanted to smash this over mid-wicket. Got it off the toe end and it spooned high up towards extra cover where there were a few fielders vying for it. Dhawan called for it and took the skier with glee before letting out his trademark slap on the knee. Prithvi Shaw c Dhawan b Shakib 9(11) [4s-1]

Shakib to Roy, out Caught by Goswami!! 2 in 2 for Shakib! This is an absolute jaffa that leaves Roy clueless. Drifted into him from a good length and spun away sharply to square him up. He tried to reach out but could only get a feather on it and Goswami was sharp to pouch it behind the stumps. Even if there wasn't an edge, Roy would have been stumped as he had got out of the crease in the bid to reach it. Excellent start for the Sunrisers. DD have been starting well of late but today, have been jolted early in the Powerplay. Alarm bells ringing for the hosts on this tricky surface. Roy c Goswami b Shakib 11(13) [4s-2]

Sandeep Sharma to Pant, out Shreyas Iyer Run Out!! Disaster for DD! For the second time in the tournament, Pant has ran Shreyas Iyer out due to some terrible running between the wickets. Waste of a wicket really and now, the Daredevils are in serious trouble. Another cutter and Pant got a thick inside edge onto the pad as the ball rolled to the left of an alert Goswami. Shreyas Iyer wanted the run and by the time it was denied, he was almost near a shakehand distance from Pant. Too late to go back and Goswami's throw is on the money to Sandeep who does the rest. Out by a countrymile. Shreyas Iyer run out (Goswami/Sandeep Sharma) 3(8)

Harshal Patel to Hales, out Lbw!! You can see why Harshal Patel is pumped here. Was taken to the cleaners with two back-to-back fours and now comes up with a very full cutter, that skids on and raps Hales low on the pad. That was as out as the appeal suggested. Hales was as much beaten by the fullish length as he was by the slowness of the delivery. P-L-U-M-B. Hales lbw b Harshal Patel 14(10) [4s-3]

Jofra Archer to Watson, out Caught by Buttler!! Quite similar to the previous delivery. Another short delivery around off, Watson goes for the pull once again, gets the top-edge too. But this time around it skies up towards short fine leg and Buttler has plenty of time to settle underneath and gulp it down. Second wicket of the match for Archer. Got Rayudu earlier, gets his opening partner now. Watson c Buttler b Jofra Archer 39(31) [4s-2 6s-2]

Ish Sodhi to Raina, out Caught by Binny!! The googly it is. Got away with earlier in the over but falls this time around. Was a googly around leg, Raina went for the sweep and got a top-edge. Binny at short fine leg somehow manages to hold on to the catch. That swirled in the air but Binny makes sure to not disappoint the leggie. Raina c Binny b Ish Sodhi 52(35) [4s-6 6s-1]

Stokes to Billings, out Billings Run Out!! A direct-hit by Buttler and Billings has to depart. He failed to dig out the yorker and tried to sneak in a bye. Before he could turn back and get into the crease Buttler had done his job. The batsman had given up! Billings run out (Buttler) 27(22) [4s-3]

Jofra Archer to Rayudu, out Bowled!! Dragged on! First ball wicket for Archer. And it is the dangerous Rayudu who has been sent back. He lets out an ooh as he sees the stumps disturbed. Back of a length delivery outside off, Rayudu stays leg-side of the ball to carve it through off, but the slow nature of the surface does not get the ball quickly to him and hence the inside edge onto the stumps. Much needed wicket for RR. Rayudu b Jofra Archer 12(9) [4s-2]

Dwayne Bravo to Samson, out Samson Run Out!! Oh dear, total breakdown between the two batsmen, so much so that they were almost caught together at one end at one point. Back of length delivery, Samson pats it towards backward point and takes a couple of steps down the pitch, which lured Buttler for the single. However, Samson was guilty of ball-watching and quickly turned his back to him, while Buttler ran through to the striker's end. Eventually, Samson may have sacrificed himself. Raina passes the ball onto Bravo who under-arms it back onto the stumps to catch the struggling Samson short. Samson run out (Raina/Dwayne Bravo) 21(22) [4s-2]

SN Thakur to Chopra, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! The big back-lift probably works to his detriment here. Full at the pads again, the ball slightly stops on him, but due to the velocity at which the bat comes down, he's unable to check the flick shot enough. Chips it off a soft leading edge straight to short mid-wicket. Chopra c Dwayne Bravo b SN Thakur 8(6) [4s-2]

Dwayne Bravo to Binny, out Caught by Watson!! Full toss at the stumps, should have disappeared too. Instead, Bravo's got very lucky. Binny swung across it too early, and lobbed it up off a leading edge. No mistake from Watson at extra cover, with his hands like buckets. Binny c Watson b Dwayne Bravo 22(17) [4s-1 6s-1]

Willey to Gowtham, out Caught by Dhoni!! Back of length outside off, width on offer, Gowtham slashes at it but only gets an edge through to Dhoni. Precious little cameo though. It's got the equation down to 12 off the final over. Gowtham c Dhoni b Willey 13(4) [6s-2]

Harbhajan to Stokes, out Bowled!! Stokes is livid, yells out all the frustration after he missed the shot. Looks to charge at the bowler and exposes his cards way too early in the process, Bhajji fires it in quickly to defeat Stokes's bat swing and hit the middle of middle. Stokes b Harbhajan 11(7) [4s-1 6s-1]

Jadeja to Rahane, out Caught by Raina!! Spin, spin and spin. Ah, this is going to be some contest. Jaddu gets enough rip off the pitch, lands it around the ideal length and gets some purchase off the surface, hits the seam and turns just enough to kiss the outside edge. Raina at first slip has bucket hands, he doesn't miss many, does he? Rahane was caught in two minds there, wasn't fully forward neither back, just hung in there and poked at it. Late spot: The ball deflected off Dhoni's glove before it lobbed up to Raina. Rahane c Raina b Jadeja 4(3) [4s-1]

Andrew Tye to Narine, out Caught by Rahul!! Tye gets the second wicket too. Bowls a short delivery around off, Narine tries to pull that away but ends up getting a top edge. Easy take for Rahul to hold on. It's Andre Russell who walks out to bat at Narine's fall. Was such an entertaining knock by the all-rounder. Has left the Kings stunned and speechless. Narine c Rahul b Andrew Tye 75(36) [4s-9 6s-4]

Andrew Tye to Uthappa, out Caught by Mohit Sharma!! Double strike in the same over for Tye. This spell might help the Kings to get back in the game. Was a fullish delivery outside off but Uthappa got deceived due to the slower one. He reaches for it and ends up slicing it to Mohit Sharma at backward point. Has been the story of the season for Uthappa. Has got his eye in and thrown it away more often than not. Uthappa c Mohit Sharma b Andrew Tye 24(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

Andrew Tye to A Russell, out Caught by Rahul!! He's finally picked him with a seam-up back of a length ball. Russell preps for a big swing over mid-wicket but doesn't get hold of the ball. Miscued high in the air, and back, and Rahul takes care of the steepler with a little swirl. A Russell c Rahul b Andrew Tye 31(14) [4s-2 6s-3]

Mohit Sharma to Nitish Rana, out Caught by (sub)Miller!! That was a wide.. had Nitish Rana left it. But he doesn't. Goes after the slower ball, slices it up in the air, and Miller comes in a few yards from long-off to catch it. Nitish Rana c (sub)Miller b Mohit Sharma 11(4) [4s-1 6s-1]

Barinder to Karthik, out Caught by (sub)Miller!! He's done two things wrong here: a) gone against the angle on this slow short ball from over the wicket, and b) played the slog-pull off the front foot. Misuced to Miller at long-on but he's done his job, has Karthik. Karthik c (sub)Miller b Barinder 50(23) [4s-5 6s-3]

Andrew Tye to Chris Lynn, out Bowled!! Lynn finally runs out of luck. Got lucky on quite a few occasions earlier but not this time. This was a short one around leg, he tried to pull it away but the ball clips his thigh, then it deflects off his glove to disturb the stump. He has given the start KKR required though. Chris Lynn b Andrew Tye 27(17) [4s-2 6s-2]

Kuldeep Yadav to Axar, out Caught by Searles!! Wicket for Kuldeep. That should get back his confidence, especially after what Ishan Kishan did in the previous game. Switched to round the wicket and fired the full delivery outside off, Axar moved a bit and lofted it to long-off. The length was tad too full and hence Axar could not get underneath it. A well-judged catch by Searles, who timed his jump to perfection. Axar c Searles b Kuldeep Yadav 19(11) [4s-2 6s-1]

Searles to Finch, out Caught by Kuldeep Yadav!! And he's gone.. Finch is livid. Lets out a grunt before storming off. Searles went round the wicket and hurled it across the right-hander, Finch shuffled across and did well to get under the ball to play the scoop, couldn't find the elevation and Kuldeep takes a good catch at short fine. Either side and that would have been a boundary. FYI, maiden IPL wicket for Searles. Finch c Kuldeep Yadav b Searles 34(20) [6s-3]

Prasidh to Andrew Tye, out Caught by Karthik!! Excellent take! Sharp short delivery on middle and leg, Tye moved across, got inside the line and attempted the pull, the pace was just too quick for him, kissed the glove and flew to the left of DK, who flings full length to glove that. Andrew Tye c Karthik b Prasidh 14(10) [4s-1 6s-1]

Prasidh to Ashwin, out Lbw!! Ouch! Ashwin is limping off the field. DK helped his state mate compose himself. He was struck on the right knee. Length delivery right on the stumps, Ashwin with a cleared front leg missed the slog to the on-side, hit flush on the back knee in front of middle. The umpire took a while before raising his finger, but he made the right decision. Ashwin grunted in pain after the blow and was on his haunches for a bit. Ashwin lbw b Prasidh 45(22) [4s-4 6s-3]

A Russell to Gayle, out Caught by Karthik!! He had to fall to a short ball, didn't he? Fast bowling mostly wins. Got his front leg outta way to similarly hack the ball open-stanced over square leg -- like he had done first ball of this over -- but he's in a horrible shape, is Gayle. Gets a top-edge that carries nicely to Karthik behind the stumps. Gayle c Karthik b A Russell 21(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

A Russell to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by Searles!! Mayank falls for a first-ball duck, and gets Russell on a hat-trick. Another short ball does the trick. He's pulling a short ball that's climbing at him off the front foot. Gee, that deserves to be punished with a wicket. They're checking Russell's front foot, but he's landed well behind the line. You'll have to question the on-field umpiring here. Oh wait, I'm told that they also checked for the second bouncer for the over, and Russell was okay there too. Mayank Agarwal c Searles b A Russell 0(1)

A Russell to Nair, out Caught by Prasidh!! Dre Russ doing all the damage for KKR. Third wicket for him. The off-cutter on a length, Nair spots it early and goes through with the lofted on-drive, seemed to have struck it enough before Krishna came into the frame, ran to his left from long-on, went with two hands over his head, but the ball got stuck in his left hand. Lucky! But that will do. Nair c Prasidh b A Russell 3(6)

Narine to Rahul, out Bowled!! Narine has his man. Big moment in the game. That might be the match. Even Narine enjoyed out. He lets out a roar. Never seen him express his delight after picking a wicket. The round the wicket ploy has worked, carrom ball on the stumps, Rahul kneels to play the slog sweep, gets an inside edge onto the front thigh, the backspin on the ball takes it onto the stumps. Unfortunate way to get out. Rahul b Narine 66(29) [4s-2 6s-7]

Chahal to Prithvi Shaw, out Bowled!! What a rippah! Chahal shows who's the boss here. Imparts loads of revs on this and gets the ball to straighten at a rapid pace to bamboozle the 18-year old. Prithvi Shaw clearly didn't pick that. Was standing languidly on the back foot hoping to milk that across the line, wasn't to be. Pegs are back... Prithvi Shaw b Chahal 2(4)

Moeen Ali to Pant, out Caught by de Villiers!! That's a sliding specky from AB. Makes up for the catch he dropped earlier. Pant went for his go-to shot - agricultural slog - and couldn't quite manage it off the middle. Flew off the bottom hand to the left of long-on where AB covered great distance to slide and gobble it before tripping over with a tumble. All of that inches inside the rope. It certainly needed some brilliance to end Pant's blitzkrieg. Pant c de Villiers b Moeen Ali 61(34) [4s-5 6s-4]

Siraj to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Kohli!! No, no. None of his late antics tonight. The innings was always painful .. to play, to watch. And it ends painfully. It's quick from Siraj, zipping in a little too straight. But Iyer decides to swing him over cow corner. Barely connects, gets the elevation. And Kohli's waiting. Shreyas Iyer c Kohli b Siraj 32(35) [4s-3]

Chahal to Roy, out Bowled!! Chahal is doing what he's been asked to. Bowls the wrong 'un and catches Roy by surprise; no clue. Knocked him over. Roy was prodding forward to drive, thought it was a conventional legbreak, wasn't to be. The ball lands on a good length and snakes in viciously to sneak through the bat-pad gate. RCB couldn't have asked for a better start. Roy b Chahal 12(9) [4s-1 6s-1]

Boult to Moeen Ali, out Caught by Prithvi Shaw!! Nope, the Mo experiment ain't coming good today. Boult hits his hard good length, Moeen tries crashing through the line as he goes to loft an uppish drive. The ball though gets big, gets the fat miscue and Prithvi Sahw at cover can catch, tonight. Moeen Ali c Prithvi Shaw b Boult 1(3)

Mishra to Kohli, out Caught by Pant!! Now then, now then. Is this a bit of a turning point? Look at the turn for Mishra. Pitched just outside off stump and spun big, sucked Kohli into the drive and he went for a big drive targetting cover. He couldn't counter for the spin and got an edge, Pant somehow managed to cling on. Kohli walks without waiting for the umpire. He's done his part, but he's livid with himself because he normally loves finishing games when set. Kohli c Pant b Mishra 70(40) [4s-7 6s-3]

Boult to Mandeep, out Bowled!! Oopsy! Why would you swipe across the line from a good length on this pitch. Made it look as if it stayed low. The scrambled seam delivery and the ball ignited the stumps after beating the ugly swipe from the batsman. Dan Vettori gestures to someone to go out now from the dugout. Okay, it's Sarfaraz! Mandeep b Boult 13(14) [6s-1]

Harshal Patel to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by Prithvi Shaw!! You got to be kidding me. Take a bow Shreyas Iyer. He's placed a man very straight behind the keeper and this ball goes to him. For a moment it looked a brilliant, cheeky scoop shot from Sarfaraz Khan to this low full around off stump, until the little fella - Prithvi Shaw - sneaked across to his right into the frame. He almost made a mess of it, juggled and took it on the second attempt. Don't be harsh on Sarfaraz Khan people, he actually played a good shot, but fell in the trap set by Iyer. Sarfaraz Khan c Prithvi Shaw b Harshal Patel 11(8) [4s-2]

Lamichhane to Parthiv Patel, out Lbw!! There comes Nepal on a scoreboard -- you've officially been inducted. Sandeep after being smacked down gets it quicker, fuller, on middle. Parthiv done in for the length, it's just not there to be sweeping, but he tries, misses, and finds himself struck plumb. A rewind of his fall in Pune. Doesn't even bother considering a review, walks, quickly. Parthiv Patel lbw b Lamichhane 6(8) [4s-1]

Shakib to Rayudu, out Watson Run Out!! Shane Watson was moving slowly as he went for that run, wonder if he was carrying a niggle there. Rayudu pushed this flatter delivery towards extra-cover and set off, Watson was slow to take off, captain Kane threw it to the keeper, who did the rest. Finally a breakthrough for SRH, but Watson has done his job. Watson run out (Williamson/Goswami) 57(35) [4s-5 6s-3]

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, out Caught by Williamson!! Now then, is there a change in the tale? SRH are masters at staging comebacks from nowhere. Don't write them off yet. Short of a length delivery it was from Sandeep Sharma, Raina wanted to play across the line, but he ended up slicing it towards mid-off, hit high on the bat, Kane ran to his left from extra-cover and put in the dive to complete the catch. Raina c Williamson b Sandeep Sharma 2(3)

Dwayne Bravo to Dhawan, out Caught by Harbhajan!! The breakthrough has been achieved. End of the 123-run stand between Dhawan and Williamson. Bravo, the man, with the much-needed wicket for CSK. Change of pace deceives Dhawan, who was into his cheeky lap way too early. Had to generate some power to get it over short fine leg, couldn't and ended up hitting it straight to Harbhajan, who pouches it at the edge of the ring. Dhawan c Harbhajan b Dwayne Bravo 79(49) [4s-10 6s-3]

SN Thakur to Williamson, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! Woah. Screamer from DJ Bravo. This wicket purely belongs to him. Two wickets in two balls for CSK and they are fighting back here. Both set-batsmen back in the hut. Thakur went wider of off, Williamson sliced it airly, there was a fielder at deep point. Bravo had to run across to his left, does so and brilliantly gobbles it up. He's a mighty fine fielder, breaks into a jig as well. Williamson c Dwayne Bravo b SN Thakur 51(39) [4s-5 6s-2]

SN Thakur to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Willey!! Pandey perishes. SRH lose their fourth wicket. Cross-seam full ball from Thakur, Pandey went hard at it and the bat turned on impact in his hands. Hence, skies it towards long-off. Willey steps forward and grabs it with ease. The visitors are losing steam here. Manish Pandey c Willey b SN Thakur 5(6)

Chahar to Hales, out Caught by Raina!! First blow of the match for Sunrisers. His struggle finally comes to an end. Never looked comfortable at the crease. Throws his hands at an away swinging length ball and ends up chipping it straight to Raina at cover-point. He wont miss those and reverse cups it in that region. Another fine start for the pacer. How often have we seen him doing this? Hales c Raina b Chahar 2(9)

Jofra Archer to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Unadkat!! All it required was for Archer to come back. Bends his back, digs it into the surface, climbing into Yadav, who given the pace is predictably late into his pull. Off the splice and Unadkat at fine leg almost makes a mess -- loses it in the light, spots it very late and plucks it right off the grass. Suryakumar Yadav c Unadkat b Jofra Archer 38(31) [4s-7]

Jofra Archer to Rohit, out Caught by Unadkat!! And another. Oh Rohit can't score against the Royals .. it's certified. A golden duck in Jaipur. A golden one now. Archer's bouncer ploy consumes him, with Rohit being the compulsive puller going through with the swivelling flat-bat, timing it rather well in fact, but just not right when fine leg is that square. Another wobble, carrying on from the SMS? Rohit c Unadkat b Jofra Archer 0(1)

D Kulkarni to Lewis, out Caught by Samson!! Big wicket for Rajasthan. A well-set Lewis throws it away. Kulkarni is delighted and his hands arm up. He had a chat with Unadkat before this delivery and whatever it was, it has worked. Nothing but an away angler outside off, Lewis throws his hands at that and slices it towards sweeper cover, Samson covers ground to his right and clings on to a good catch. Royals fighting back after that opening partnership. Lewis c Samson b D Kulkarni 60(42) [4s-4 6s-4]

Stokes to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Samson!! Another one down. What are you doing Mumbai? From 86/0 they have slipped to 119/4. Slower short of length delivery and Kishan didn't have the required room to free his arms on the pull shot, miscues it towards deep mid-wicket. Samson almost overran it, but then leaped back and took it reverse cup. Ishan Kishan c Samson b Stokes 12(11) [4s-1]

Unadkat to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Gowtham!! Gowtham juggles but manages to hang on. Krunal never looked in. Yes, seven deliveries is enough to judge that. The off-cutter from Unadkat, Pandya had to for the heave and all he could do was sky it up towards long-on. Gowtham settled under it and almost made a mess. Luckily for him it didn't go far from his body and he took it on the second attempt. Krunal Pandya c Gowtham b Unadkat 3(7)

Stokes to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Samson!! Stunner from Samson. Wow! The replays show it to be even better. Should be in the top five list. Full and angled in, Pandya whips it with plenty of bottom hand towards deep mid-wicket, Samson runs across to his right, but the ball seemed to be out his reach, that is when he decides to put in the full length dive and the ball sticks in his right hand when he is parallel to the ground. Simply superb! Hardik Pandya c Samson b Stokes 36(21) [4s-3 6s-2]

Bumrah to D Arcy Short, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Short is gone. He's had a forgettable IPL season. Could not play spin and now has succumbed to pace as well. Back of a length and seaming away around off, Short goes feeling for the ball and the outside edge is found, it was carrying to first slip, but Kishan decides to dive across and glove it. The much needed early breakthrough for Mumbai. D Arcy Short c Ishan Kishan b Bumrah 4(5) [4s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Rahane, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! That's a crucial wicket. Rahane's found long-off, where SKY takes the catch and has a pratfall. Just lost his balance a bit and slipped backwards. Was a front footed power-punch but there's not enough wattage in the shot. So much for being a touch player. And here's Pandya picking a wicket just when you least expect him to. Rahane c Suryakumar Yadav b Hardik Pandya 37(36) [4s-4]

Hardik Pandya to Samson, out Caught by (sub)Rahul Chahar!! With 4 needed, he goes for the glory hit and falls. Slow cutter, Samson went for the all-hands loft over cover and found Chahar in the deep. Samson c (sub)Rahul Chahar b Hardik Pandya 26(14) [4s-2 6s-2]

Moeen Ali to Finch, out Caught by Kohli!! Moeen Ali strikes. Each of Kohli's moves have paid off today. Brought in Siraj got a wicket, de Grandhomme did the same and Moeen Ali follows. Bit of air on this one and Finch is down on one knee to play the slog sweep, does not get the required elevation to clear deep mid-wicket and finds Kohli to perfection. The skipper had moved himself there after the third ball. KXIP slip further and their chances of getting a good total are gone with Finch. Finch c Kohli b Moeen Ali 26(23) [4s-1 6s-2]

Moeen Ali to Ashwin, out Ashwin Run Out!! That's what wickets and pressure do. There was never a single in it and Ashwin wanted the run, Axar was tad late in sending him back and the skipper's dive was in vain. Nothing but a tossed up delivery which Ashwin taps to the left of cover, Axar took a step out before aborting from the run. And with Ashwin not being the swiftest he was always in trouble. Put in a desperate dive but was still short by some distance. Ashwin run out (Negi/Parthiv Patel) 0(1)

U Yadav to Andrew Tye, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! What happened there? Looks like Tye wanted to review. But he's walking back. Not sure what happened. Banged in and with Umesh's pace the ball climbs up awkwardly, Tye goes for the pull and a faint top-edge settles into Parthiv's mitts. Did he run out of time to review? That might be the only reason. Nonetheless, there was a sound as the ball passed the bat. Andrew Tye c Parthiv Patel b U Yadav 0(3)

Moeen Ali to Mohit Sharma, out Mohit Sharma Run Out!! A typical number 10 run-out. Mohit works the off-break past mid-wicket, but was not sure whether to go for the run or not, he decides late and AB from mid-wicket runs back, slides and fires a throw to Mo, who deflects the ball onto the stumps. Brilliant bit of work from AB and Mo. Mohit Sharma run out (de Villiers/Moeen Ali) 3(5)

Moeen Ali to Axar, out Rajpoot Run Out!! 1 run completed. KXIP have been bowled out for 88. Axar wanted to keep the strike and pushed Rajpoot for a non-existent second. In fact, it was Rajpoot who wanted the second. Axar worked the flatter delivery towards wide long-on, he was content with the single but upon seeing Rajpoot charge across, he relcutantly went for it, nice flat throw right next to the stumps from Southee and Mo did the rest. Rajpoot run out (Southee/Moeen Ali) 1(5)
