U Yadav to Rahul, out Caught by de Grandhomme!! The short ball does it. You live by the sword and you die by it as well. The short balls had been disappearing but not this one. This came on slightly quicker on to the batsman, skidded on and Rahul went for it by hitting it flat. The man at deep square leg raced to his right and took it really well as the momentum on the ball threatened a drop from CDG. But that is a huge wicket!! Rahul c de Grandhomme b U Yadav 21(15) [6s-3]

U Yadav to Gayle, out Caught by Siraj!! The short ball is doing the trick here. The batsman got a huge top edge and Siraj at deep square leg gobbles it up. Banged in short at a good pace and again the batsman never got a lot of distance on it. The ball went really high and the fielder did well to munch on it. KXIP have already got their back broken. And RCB are looking to inflict more wounds. Gayle c Siraj b U Yadav 18(14) [4s-4]

Siraj to Nair, out Caught by Kohli!! Catching practice! And taken to his left at slip by the skipper. That was an away going short of length delivery and the batsman just opened his bat face to run it down. Cardinal sin it was with a slip in place. RCB are all over KXIP like a rash. The battle of the reds certainly has seen the visitors having the upper hand in the powerplay period. Nair c Kohli b Siraj 1(3)

Chahal to Stoinis, out Bowled!! The yorker from Chahal. Played it too late and did not pick the length to york himself. The ball sneaking under the bat. How on earth?! That was the googly. KXIP in deep waters now. Stoinis can't believe his luck. That was just a well flighted ball and he fails to pick it up. The LED bails sparkled red and RCB rejoiced more. Where is the fight KXIP? Stoinis b Chahal 2(3)

de Grandhomme to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! It cannot get any worse for KXIP and Mayank Agarwal. He is having a terrible season and has only dashed the hopes of a KXIP revival in this game as well. Gentle delivery on the pads and the batsman ended up nicking it to the keeper. The keeper went up almost instantly and RCB have their man. Mayank Agarwal c Parthiv Patel b de Grandhomme 2(6)

Stokes to Narine, out Caught by Gowtham!! Gowtham is dramatic in his celebration. If you don't know why, scroll down and see how he was taken for runs in the last over. Takes the catch at extra cover and flings the ball at the stumps, and aggressively. A little OTT, the celebrations, but RR will take it. A short ball from Stokes does the trick. Narine is awkward as he goes back but is not really in a position to swat that across. Miscues that in the air and is caught. Narine c Gowtham b Stokes 21(7) [4s-2 6s-2]

Stokes to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Anureet Singh!! Strokes has another. Oh where was he hiding all this while? Anyway, it takes him to dish out a short-slower sticker into the pitch. Lynn as usual can't resist, loads up with a leg-cleared-cut. But doesn't quite adjust to the time the ball takes in getting there, slices off the top-edge and deep point couldn't have been placed better. Chris Lynn c Anureet Singh b Stokes 45(42) [4s-5 6s-1]

Stokes to Uthappa, out Caught by R Tripathi!! This is not over yet, folks. Second short ball from Stokes that gets the wicket. Got a little big on Uthappa, who agreeably was pirouetting well on the back toe. Ended up top-edging it high to deep backward square, where Tripathy was waiting. Uthappa c R Tripathi b Stokes 4(6)

Ish Sodhi to Nitish Rana, out Lbw!! Loud shout for LBW. And Rajasthan go upstairs with the review. Drifted across from over the wicket and it spun into the left-hander, surprising him with the turn. Pitching just outside off-stump -- slowmo replays suggest -- and rapping the front leg near the knee-roll. Impact on middle and that's crashing into the top of leg-stump, says ball-tracking. So Nitish Rana will have to go, as RR hold on to their review. Nitish Rana lbw b Ish Sodhi 21(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

Narine to Samson, out Lbw!! The flattish ball spun in sharply and hit the batsman high on the back leg. Looks a little high. Was there an inside edge? NO! The height is not an issue. Three Reds. RR are going down like a lead balloon. The ball skidded on and the batsman was late on the attempted swat on the on-side. This is tragedy for RR. From 59 in 4 overs to this. T20 cricket and its speed taking a toll on RR. In dire straits. Samson lbw b Narine 12(10) [4s-2]

Kuldeep Yadav to Binny, out Stumped!! The googly and RR implode further. The batsman predictably does not read it. Looks to whip a flighted ball outside off and misses it. The ball turned away past the blade and DK does the rest. He whipped the bails off in a flash. Kuldeep leaps up in his celebratory jump. The spinners are choking their opponents here. You have seen this script from KKR. Haven't you?
Binny st Karthik b Kuldeep Yadav 1(4)

Shivam Mavi to Gowtham, out Caught by Karthik!! The pace has the last laugh. Disconcerting bounce coupled with it forces an almost evasive action from Gowtham, who fails to get his gloves out of the way. The ball flicked the gloves and went up for the keeper to take it with ease. The Eden is alive and noisy. Eden has witnessed many collapses and this one is dear to KKR. Gowtham c Karthik b Shivam Mavi 3(5)

Kuldeep Yadav to Stokes, out Caught&Bowled!! The last straw is gone. RR will drown it seems. Too full, flighted as well and the toe-ended push finds the bowler. The bowler stays low and pouches it. DK and team erupt. A hattrick against Aussies and now this. Kuldeep can't do anything wrong at the Eden. A 4-fer in a big game. Stokes ends a horron run in the IPL. He has been off-color throughout and it has ended like that as well. Stokes c and b Kuldeep Yadav 11(13)

Prasidh to Ish Sodhi, out Caught by Karthik!! The yorkerish delivery was jammed out and it popped up. KKR think it went off the boot and into the keeper's gloves. They may be right!! It seems the batsman did jam it out off the inner half of the bat but into his boot. And then it went up for DK to take it and bring to the notice of the umpires that they should go upstairs. They did, the soft signal was not out but was not to be as the replays were conclusive enough for the third umpire to make the decision. Ish Sodhi c Karthik b Prasidh 1(6)

A Russell to Jofra Archer, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Another one bites the dust. KKR fans find their voices again. Short ball, rising up and the batsman trying to pull it away, managed only a lot of height. The man at deep square leg came in and took it, not exactly with a lot of ease but effectively in the end. Might have lost it in the lights. Jofra Archer c Shubman Gill b A Russell 6(5) [4s-1]

Prasidh to Unadkat, out Bowled!! RR won't play out their quota of overs. That was a slower delivery and the batsman went for the slog sweep but was outdone by the lack of pace on it. The batsman knelt down, may be guessed the pace right, but could not connect at all for the LED bails to lighten up. KKR camp is chuffed. So is the crowd and the entire team. The on-field umpire did check for a no-ball but it is KKR's evening and nothing can go wrong. Unadkat b Prasidh 26(18) [4s-3 6s-1]

A Russell to R Tripathi, out Caught by Karthik!! Gone! A sigh of relief for the hosts! Short one angling towards the leg-side, and the side-on stance of Tripathi gives him that fraction of a second less to get into the hook. Beaten for pace, and he gets a feather of a glove on it to DK behind the stumps. Is this the breakthrough, or the rhythm-breaker that KKR needed? The crowd would certainly hope so! R Tripathi c Karthik b A Russell 27(15) [4s-4 6s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, out Bowled!! Oh, it's ugly when a batsman with a Test hundred in almost every country tries circus tricks. Kuldeep fires in the googly on middle and leg, Rahane gets across his stumps and tries to whack it away behind point with a reverse sweep, misses it altogether and ends up making a fool of himself. The furniture is knocked over, and a the flashing red bails reflect ominous signs for RR. Rahane b Kuldeep Yadav 11(12) [4s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, out Caught by Searles!! Massive moment! Fullish one, too full to reverse, Buttler goes for it anyway, and gets it off the top half of the bat, and lobs it to Searles at short third man. A tame end to an otherwise excellent innings, and Buttler's streak of 5 consecutive 50s comes to an end. 3 down, and Kuldeep has made an important breakthrough. Buttler c Searles b Kuldeep Yadav 39(22) [4s-5 6s-2]

Bumrah to Finch, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Outstanding pressure catch from Hardik Pandya in the deep. Finch had skied this up a mile off a top-edge, he had Evin Lewis in the corner of his eye - converging towards him, but Pandya calls for it and takes it much to the delight of the roaring fans at the Wankhede. Length ball, Finch saw the opportunity and cleared his front leg to make the most of it. But his heave came right off the toe-end. Finch c Hardik Pandya b Bumrah 46(35) [4s-3 6s-1]

Bumrah to Stoinis, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Hoho, Stoinis doesn't have a clue of what's happened. He's too slow. This bumper from Bumrah hurries on from the middle of the pitch, and even as Stoinis tries sitting down to it, he leaves his gloves up there. The ball kisses them enroute to Ishan Kishan. A gamechanger this Bumrah over. Stoinis c Ishan Kishan b Bumrah 1(2)

Bumrah to Rahul, out Caught by Cutting!! Bumrah wins the battle with Rahul. He has sent Wankhede rocking. Slower ball, it deceives Rahul as he lofts it right off the toe-end into the grateful hands of Cutting at long-off. So then, is that it for Punjab? Rahul c Cutting b Bumrah 94(60) [4s-10 6s-3]

McClenaghan to Yuvraj, out Caught by Lewis!! Full ball outside off, Yuvraj slices it straight to Lewis at sweeper cover. He was right back in the crease expecting the fuller length, and was probably aiming to go inside out over extra cover. But the bat twisted in his hands. A fist-pump from McClenaghan. Yuvraj c Lewis b McClenaghan 1(3)

McClenaghan to Gayle, out Caught by Cutting!! A short one, outside off, Gayle tries to fetch it and attempts a pull, gets a top-edge. The ball crosses the stratosphere, makes a trip to heaven and lands up in the lap of Ben Cutting coming in from deep mid-wicket. Made it look rather easy. Universe Boss departs. Gayle c Cutting b McClenaghan 18(11) [4s-2 6s-1]

Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Rajpoot!! Deceived him with the slower short ball there. It never arrived. Krunal decided to go for the pull and he fails to arrest the momentum, ends up feeding the top-edge and offers a dolly of a catch to Rajpoot at short fine. Krunal Pandya c Rajpoot b Stoinis 32(23) [4s-1 6s-2]

Ashwin to Pollard, out Caught by Finch!! Skipper strikes! Lovely stuff from Ash, didn't get great turn on this but ensured there's no pace and made KP fetch for that by tossing it far of off-stump; KP made room and went hard with his flat-bat swing, straight into the pocket of Finchy at wide long-on. Pollard c Finch b Ashwin 50(23) [4s-5 6s-3]

Ashwin to Cutting, out Caught by Axar!! Poor shot selection from Ben Cutting. Carrom ball bowled wide of off-stump, Cutting drags the slogsweep from there and hits it straight to the man at deep mid-wicket. Axar trundles forward and gobbles it with ease. Cutting c Axar b Ashwin 4(7)

Andrew Tye to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Ashwin!! Third fourth wicket haul in four games for Andrew Tye. He is increasing the gap for the leading wicket takers tally. Pitched the ball short and got it to grip off the surface, it kept decking away from Hardik's reach, he slapped hard and got a thick toe-edge to short third man. Hardik Pandya c Ashwin b Andrew Tye 9(12)

Andrew Tye to Lewis, out Bowled!! Brilliant from Tye and he has his 21st wicket of IPL 2018. This is deception at its very best, the knuckle ball, pitched around off and seamed back into the left-hander, the length drew Lewis into an expansive drive, the gap between bat and pad was created, the ball snuck through and the off-stump went for a walk. Lewis b Andrew Tye 9(7) [6s-1]

Andrew Tye to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Stoinis!! Kishan's streaky innings comes to an end and it's that man - Tye, who takes the wicket once again. This was another knuckle ball that angled across the left-hander, Kishan was looking to heave it over mid-wicket, doesn't cover for the angle, gets it high on the bat and spoons it over mid-on. Stoinis was the fielder there - he kept his eyes on the ball as he back tracked and completed a simple catch. Ishan Kishan c Stoinis b Andrew Tye 20(12) [4s-1 6s-2]

Andrew Tye to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Rahul!! Back to back wickets and Tye is on fire. This was short and just outside off, Suryakumar was looking to help it on its way with a flap pull, gets a big inside edge that pops up off his knee-roll. KL runs forward and completes the catch, silence at the Wankhede as Tye scalps his 23rd victim of the season, he's on a hat-trick as well. Suryakumar Yadav c Rahul b Andrew Tye 27(15) [4s-3 6s-2]

Rajpoot to Rohit, out Caught by Yuvraj!! Another low score for Rohit, he's been undone by the short ball once again. This was banged in short and just outside off, skidded through and hurried Rohit with pace, he was in a terrible position as he pulled, got a top-edge and all he managed to do was to find Yuvraj at mid-on. He accepts the chance gleefully and his reaction suggests how pumped up he's for this match. The customary check for the front-foot no-ball and Rajpoot is fine on that count. Off he goes, Rohit. Rohit c Yuvraj b Rajpoot 6(10)

Sandeep Sharma to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by S Kaul!! Top edge and gone. Parthiv Patel wasn't going to die wondering. He was going to play his shots, here he pays the price, short of length on the stumps with steepling bounce, Parthiv Patel gets a fat top edge and third man takes a good catch. That was a skier and not easy under the lights. But Kaul hangs on. Sandeep Sharma strikes in the first over. Parthiv Patel c S Kaul b Sandeep Sharma 1(4)

Rashid Khan to de Villiers, out Caught by Dhawan!! Rashid Khan has done the double over AB this season. Got him both times. This wicket the credit has to go to Dhawan. What a catch under extreme pressure. Could mean a difference of 30 easily. de Villiers slogs and doesn't get the elevation, Dhawan at deep backward square was on the edge, but leapt at the right time, caught it and ensured that the left leg didn't trod on the cushion. He raises his finger Ricky Ponting Sydney style to say it's out. Kohli is anxious and cranes his neck out to check whether this is a legal catch. It is and de Villiers walks. Again silence at the Chinnaswamy. 150th wicket for Rashid in T20s. de Villiers c Dhawan b Rashid Khan 69(39) [4s-12 6s-1]

Rashid Khan to Moeen Ali, out Caught by Goswami!! Brain-melt from Moeen Ali. Nothing more than that. Suddenly he has kicked the door wide open for SRH to come back into the game. Rashid Khan's last over and with AB gone, he decides to play a cute reverse paddle, when he was hitting them so well straight down the ground. Such a low-percentage shot and one must applaud Goswami's take. On the rebound and it was a clear deflection too. Moeen Ali walked as soon as Goswami took it. That shot could potentially send RCB out of the tournament. But Moeen Ali plays that way and has got out many times previously very softly. Fantastic innings nonetheless. Moeen Ali c Goswami b Rashid Khan 65(34) [4s-2 6s-6]

S Kaul to Mandeep, out Caught by Dhawan!! The slower delivery does the trick. Dhawan takes it at long-off and does his trademark thigh-slap. Would make a good South Indian hero in movies. With that move of his. Mandeep getting under that slower delivery a bit too much. Dhawan does the rest. Mandeep c Dhawan b S Kaul 4(6)

S Kaul to de Grandhomme, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Has to go as one of the best catches in the IPL this season. On par with Boult. So similar. One-handed and behind him too. A pure reflex effort from Rashid at deep mid. Takes it and falls flat on the ground, can't believe has plucked that out of thin air. That was hit so powerfully and flat by de Grandhomme, but Rashid pulled off a blindy! de Grandhomme c Rashid Khan b S Kaul 40(17) [4s-1 6s-4]

Rashid Khan to Kohli, out Bowled!! The RCB fans are stunned into deathly silence. Deathly. While Rashid Khan celebrates with a finger-twirling celebration. Kohli doesn't pick Rashid Khan, slogs in hope to a googly which is bowled on a fuller length and sees the stumps re-arranged. Difficult to say whether Rashid Khan has the wood over Kohli - a very small sample size for that. But for sure Rashid has the bragging rights over the RCB skipper. Kohli was so disappointed at missing that. Rarely does he miss those, but tonight he did. Massive massive wicket too. Kohli b Rashid Khan 12(11) [4s-2]

Siraj to Williamson, out Caught by de Grandhomme!! The swirler has been taken at deep fine leg, inches inside the fence. The batsman shuffled across the sticks and swept the ball away high up in the air. The ball went skywards and when it came down, it had a nervous Kiwi under it. The fielder took it really away from his body. He was inches inside the fence though and that played on his mind. Williamson c de Grandhomme b Siraj 81(42) [4s-7 6s-5]

Chahal to Dhawan, out Caught&Bowled!! It is Chahal makes the breakthrough. Soft dismissal it must be said. Down the track and chipped back to the bowler. Who throws the ball away in delight. Wakes the crowd up who were starting to get restless. Dhawan c and b Chahal 18(15) [6s-2]

Moeen Ali to Hales, out Caught by de Villiers!! No way. He didn't just do that. It's all about the Avengers now, but AB is the only one keeping DC alive. A toss-up outside off, Hales gets down the wicket and bottom-hand swats that flat towards deep mid-wicket, seems to have cleared it till the last moment until Superman arrives from Krypton to pluck that out of thin air. Leaps and grabs that one-handed. Absolutely ridiculous. The right foot was in fact extremely close to the rope and he landed on the right foot and had enough balance at the age of 34 to hold on and he was dancing like a teenager. Absolute magic. Hales c de Villiers b Moeen Ali 37(24) [4s-2 6s-3]

Harshal Patel to Rayudu, out Caught by Maxwell!! Oh, may I just say that could've hit a plane. A length ball on middle, Rayudu comes down the track and isn't quite to the pitch of it, gets it off the meat but gets the timing just wrong on the lofted whip which makes it gain more height than distance as Maxwell does phenomenally well to sight the ball and settles under it at deep mid-wicket. Lies out on the grass under the heavens, a relieved man. Made it look much easier than it actually was. That went a kilometer up in the air. Rayudu c Maxwell b Harshal Patel 50(29) [4s-4 6s-4]

Lamichhane to Raina, out Caught by Vijay Shankar!! Loopy googly on leg-stump, Raina predictably goes for his almighty heave over mid-wicket which has brought him much success over the years. Not tonight though as he flat-bats it straight down the throat of Vijay Shankar at cow corner. That's the end of a the most un-Raina innings of all time. An innings of more than ten balls, with a strike-rate below hundred. *Shaking my head* Raina c Vijay Shankar b Lamichhane 15(18) [4s-1]

Mishra to Billings, out Caught by Abhishek Sharma! Mishraji wins the mind-game. Leg-break just a tad wide outside off, Billings goes for an ill-advised sweep trying to drag it into the on-side, gets a feeble top-edge that lobs into the hands of short fine leg. Mishy is pumped. Billings c Abhishek Sharma b Mishra 1(5)

Boult to Dhoni, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! And the mentalist fails to pull off the unfathomable tonight! Low full toss, Dhoni finally nails the timing on this with a bottom-hand whip, flat and fittingly straight the his opposite number at long-on. A sigh of relief for DD. Dhoni c Shreyas Iyer b Boult 17(23) [4s-1]

Boult to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught by Vijay Shankar! Half-volley on off, Dwayne Bravo swings through the line, once again gets far too much height and hardly any distance, holes out to Vijay Shankar running in from long-off. That ball must have little drops of heaven on it by now, the number of times it has crosses the earth's atmosphere tonight. Dwayne Bravo c Vijay Shankar b Boult 1(2)

Mishra to Watson, out Caught by Boult!! The old warhorse has broken through for DD. Must say that this was on the cards with Watson really struggling to get going. Needed a move on and perishes in the process. The leg break from Mishra and invites the Australian to slog against the turn. Risky shot when there is some spin and it skews high off the outer half towards long-off. Boult ain't dropping those. Watson c Boult b Mishra 14(23) [6s-1]

Lungi Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, out Bowled!! Knocked him over. An ordinary shot from the DD captain. It was bowled at 139.5kph and Iyer was backing away to cut. It was neither short nor wide. A skiddy short of length delivery on off. Iyer can't make contact and the ball crashes into the off-pole. Beaten for pace. The partnership has been broken. Shreyas Iyer b Lungi Ngidi 19(22) [4s-3]

Lungi Ngidi to Pant, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! Two wickets within a span of four balls. Ngidi sports a bright smile. A pacy short of length delivery slanted across the left-handed batsman, Pant tries to fetch it from outside off and heave over the leg-side. The edge flies and settles into the safe hands of Bravo at third man. And, of course, the jig follows it. Pant c Dwayne Bravo b Lungi Ngidi 38(26) [4s-3 6s-2]

Jadeja to Maxwell, out Bowled!! Horrible shot! Not the first time this season that Maxwell has departed playing an atrocious stroke. Here is another example of it. The previous ball sowed the seeds of doubt in his mind and he went for a reverse sweep. Except that this was a dart from Jadeja aimed at middle and leg. 'You miss, I hit' type and it crashes into the stumps. Perhaps was too full for the stroke as well. Either ways, poor dismissal. Maxwell b Jadeja 5(7)

SN Thakur to Abhishek Sharma, out Caught by Harbhajan!! Another one bites the dust. No heroics tonight from Abhishek Sharma after his impressive debut the other night. Sharp bumper from Thakur and the southpaw is rushed into the pull. Only manages a fat top edge that bobbles high towards mid-on. Bhajji settles under it merrily. DD have lost half their side now. Abhishek Sharma c Harbhajan b SN Thakur 2(4)

Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Thakur doesn't drop it this time. A simple catch, and he will be a relieved man. A short of a length delivery around off, Shaw loading his back foot decided to hoick over cow corner. Gets it off the bottom part of the bat and the ball settles into the hands of the long-on fielder. Thakur moved to his right and reverse-cvupped it. Way too many high risk shots from Shaw. Prithvi Shaw c SN Thakur b Chahar 17(17) [4s-1 6s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to Mandeep, out Stumped!! Loopy leggie and the batsman is stumped. Jumped out of the crease and tried to go aerial on the off-side but missed it by a mile. Beaten in flight and the rest was done by the keeper. RCB are messing up the chase here. Third wicket for Gopal. The ball dipped on him and the preempted movement deserted him. Mandeep st Klaasen b Shreyas Gopal 3(4)

Ish Sodhi to de Grandhomme, out Caught by Rahane!! Gone. RCB are impoding here. That was a typical leggie's dismissal. Landed outside off and turned away, lured the batsman for a drive to catch the edge. There was a slip fielder and the captain can give himself a pat on the back. For taking the catch and for having a slip in place. Superb bit of passage for RR. Kohli looks on in shock and dismay. de Grandhomme c Rahane b Ish Sodhi 2(3)

Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, out Stumped!! Game. Set. Match. That is a hugeeeeeeee wicket. The googly is misread. Looks to drive and misses it. The batsman tried to drive it but the ball bent in and the keeper did the rest as the back foot dragged out of the crease. Kohli is shocked. RCB camp cannot believe it. More than that, Gopal has hands on his mouth. He has shocked himself to a massive wicket. RR all over RCB like a rash. One should compliment Klaasen for his sharp work, so quick with the gloves ala MSD. de Villiers st Klaasen b Shreyas Gopal 53(35) [4s-7]

Laughlin to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by Klaasen!! The fat lady's whisper can be heard. That was a terrific take from Klaasen. The slower delivery and the batsman backed away to steer the cut, the shot was not too away from the keeper, who leapt to his right and takes it. Superb day behind the sticks for the RR keeper. First with the bat and now with the ball. RCB fans continue to wear a disappointed look. Sarfaraz Khan c Klaasen b Laughlin 7(8) [4s-1]

Laughlin to U Yadav, out Bowled!! Golden duck for Umesh. A taste of his own medicine. That was fuller, on a length and the batsman never covered the line of the ball. A little gap was found and the ball traverses between the bat and pad to strike timber. The RR fans erupt. Early finish? Hat-trick ball coming up. U Yadav b Laughlin 0(1)

Unadkat to Southee, out Caught by Gowtham!! Final nail in the coffin. Shortish, slower ball and the batsman heaved the pull away to be taken at cow corner. The batsman never connected properly and the mistimed hit was taken. RR only a wicket away from staying in contention for a place in the play-offs. RCB's dreams are over. Well almost. Southee c Gowtham b Unadkat 14(17) [4s-2]

Unadkat to Siraj, out Caught by Gowtham!! What just happened there? A relay catch! Kohli looks bemused. The length ball and the batsman slogged it away to send it skywards. Samson came charging in and dropped it, but the ball popped up. But Gowtham, who almost collided with his mate kept his wits and took it low and one-handed. Tremendous reflexes after the ball ricocheted off Samson's palm. Siraj c Gowtham b Unadkat 14(12) [4s-2]

Gowtham to Kohli, out Bowled!! Kohli is bowled to a spinner. Seen that so often in this IPL. I can recollect Mujeeb, Rashid and now Gowtham. The bowler does a cool fist pump to celebrate the wicket. Kohli knew he had to do something against Gowtham, struggled in the first over, and decided to step out, but cleverly bowled by Gowtham, going wide of the crease and darting in a fast offie, which breaks in through the bat-pad gap to take Kohli's off stump out. They check for the no-ball on the side crease, but Gowtham had his leg up in the air and didn't land. A body blow to RCB. Kohli b Gowtham 4(9)

Shreyas Gopal to Parthiv Patel, out Stumped!! Parthiv Patel is walking. Because he knows that he has not got the back foot back inside. A toppie, from the front of the hand, slides on quicker, beats the backing away Patel on the cut, he overbalanced and when Klaasen whipped the bails off, the foot was on the line. Superb keeping from the South African as well. RR needed that wicket. Parthiv Patel st Klaasen b Shreyas Gopal 33(21) [4s-3 6s-2]

Shreyas Gopal to Moeen Ali, out Caught&Bowled!! Moeen Ali closes his eyes and grimaces. While Shreyas Gopal is being mobbed by his mates. A thick leading edge and Shreyas Gopal timed his leap to perfection and came up with the return catch in two hands. The catch was all about the leap. Two wickets in an over and the pressure multiplies many times on de Villiers. Moeen Ali c and b Shreyas Gopal 1(2)

U Yadav to Jofra Archer, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Umesh Yadav strikes. The ploy to send Archer up the order hasn't worked. He's gone for a duck - third this season. A bumper down leg from Umesh and Archer goes for a pull - looked like a half-hearted one. Only manages a glove and Parthiv Patel snaffles it with ease. The RCBians knew it straightaway and the umpire got it right too. Jofra Archer c Parthiv Patel b U Yadav 0(4)

U Yadav to Rahane, out Lbw!! The impact was marginal but enough to go against Rahane. It was the off-cutter outside off, Rahane moved inside and went for a wild heave. Got beaten and was struck on the pads. The umpire took his time to give his decision but in the end he's right. So, finally Rahane' struggle comes to an end. Might be a blessing in disguise for the Royals. They need someone who can strike the ball well. Rahane lbw b U Yadav 33(31) [4s-3]

U Yadav to Samson, out Caught by Moeen Ali!! Two in two for Umesh. His third wicket of the match, he's on a roll in the past few games. Getting better with every game. Bowls a gentle length delivery first up and Samson flicks it straight to the man at short mid-wicket. A soft dismissal, indeed. Scored 90-odd against RCB earlier in the tournament, walks back for a duck today. Samson c Moeen Ali b U Yadav 0(1)

Siraj to Klaasen, out Caught by Moeen Ali!! Siraj has the last laugh! Conceded a boundary and six earlier in the over but does well to get the better of the South African. Bowls a slower delivery outside off, Klaasen goes ahead with his aggressive loft and holes out at long-off. Moeen Ali won't drop those and he doesn't. Klaasen c Moeen Ali b Siraj 32(21) [4s-3 6s-1]

Southee to Gowtham, out Gowtham Run Out!! An anti-climax to end the innings. A yorker outside off that's too quick for Gowtham to squeeze it out. They try to steal a bye but the keeper parries the ball to Southee who does the rest. RR end on a competitive score, nevertheless. Gowtham run out (Parthiv Patel/Southee) 14(5) [6s-2]

S Kaul to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Pandey's run in an arc at long-on and taken an in-out-in catch right at the boundary ropes. It's been referred upstairs, with the soft signal being out. It is out indeed. Just one of Chris Lynn's slogs that goes wrong. Hits it flat and across, seemed to have miscued it -- triggered by the lack of room -- and there Pandey was, running and plucking it out. Realizes he's going to run over the ropes, parries the throw in, hops out, hops back in and then almost steals that out of the hands of Rashid, who was lurking around. Rashid's hands cupped Pandey's -- so close. Chris Lynn c Manish Pandey b S Kaul 55(43) [4s-4 6s-3]

Brathwaite to Uthappa, out Caught by Goswami!! Brathwaite is riding a horse in celebration. Or something like that. He's undone Uthappa with a short ball. Weight not quite back, the bounce getting big on the batsman, and we have a top-edge, that the keeper runs around and collects it near say leg gully. Uthappa c Goswami b Brathwaite 45(34) [4s-3 6s-2]

S Kaul to A Russell, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Russell has been baited here. All he got until now was a barrage of incoming short balls, so he was going to want to take full toll of this one. Slogs across, totally misreading the slower delivery and offering a steepler to long-on. Manish had to come in a few paces but he was right under the ball. Brilliantly taken. A Russell c Manish Pandey b S Kaul 4(4) [4s-1]

Brathwaite to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! Now this finds the fielder. More like a hoick-pull that Nitish Rana's fallen to. Takes the short ball on, swivels into an attempted glory hit and succumbs to the placement of the fielder at fine leg. Nitish Rana c Bhuvneshwar b Brathwaite 7(5) [4s-1]

Shakib to Narine, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Not this time. Not again. Narine throws his head down in disappointment. Tried for a encore and failed to find the sweet-spot of the blade, enough air-time for Manish Pandey to run forward and claim a simple catch at long-off. Narine c Manish Pandey b Shakib 29(10) [4s-4 6s-2]

Searles to Williamson, out Caught by A Russell!! Williamson could'nt have picked the fielder out any better. Surely, will be disappointed. Anyway, Searles retaliates and gets his revenge. Went wide of off, Williamson slashed it hard and straight to deep cover. Russel was under it and he won't drop those. It was an off-pace ball and KW had to generate some power to elevate it over the fielder's head. 2 or 3 inches away from Russel, it would've been a boundary. Nonetheless, KKR will breathe a sigh of relief as they break this dangerous stand. Williamson c A Russell b Searles 36(17) [4s-1 6s-3]

Prasidh to Dhawan, out Lbw!! Dhawan is given OUT lbw, he's having a discussion with Pandey before eventually walking off. Krishna roars back strongly in his new spell after leaking 11 in his first over. Cuts back in from round the wicket, seemed like the slower ball. Dhawan was lining up for a mow across the line, misses it totally and is hit on the back thigh. Looked pretty adjacent and umpire S Ravi took his time before raising the dreaded finger. so, Dhawan falls right after his fifty. Dhawan lbw b Prasidh 50(39) [4s-5 6s-1]

Narine to Y Pathan, out Caught by Uthappa!! Stunned silence among the Orange army supporters. Pathan departs early as he fails to clear the long-on fence. Floated up and wooed Pathan into a biggie, who fell for the trap. Lofted it high, only height and it sailed into the black sky to long-on. Uthappa sets under it and swallows it. Excellent comeback this from KKR after being under the pump. Y Pathan c Uthappa b Narine 2(4)

A Russell to Brathwaite, out Caught by Karthik!! KKR are chipping away with wickets as Brathwaite perishes. Russell gets the better of his countryman. Skiddy short ball that tucks Brathwaite for space and hurries onto him, went for the pull and failed to get any timing on it. Splices it up in the air and DK prances forward to grab it. SRH losing gas at the death. Brathwaite c Karthik b A Russell 3(4)

Prasidh to Manish Pandey, out Caught by (sub)Rinku Singh!! Has that been taken? Oh, it has. It has. The default Sub fielder for KKR - Rinku Singh takes a stunning catch. Another one falls and SRH are losing the plot here. Second wicket for Krishna, who's been brilliant in his fresh spell. The slower ball, that dips and Pandey takes it on the full to mow it towards deep mid-wicket. Doesn't get it off the middle and the ball was dying in front of Rinku - who dives forward and gobbles it up. Manish Pandey c (sub)Rinku Singh b Prasidh 25(22) [4s-2 6s-1]

Prasidh to Shakib, out Caught by Narine!! And Shakib combusts. Krishna has been pretty impressive today. The slower short ball, angling at Shakib, who in a bid to pull - gets it high on the bat. Skes it to square leg and Narine ain't dropping those. Shakib c Narine b Prasidh 10(7) [4s-2]

Prasidh to Rashid Khan, out Caught by Karthik!! Raining wickets for Kolkata. Two in two for Krishna and he becomes the second player from Karnataka to take four wickets so far today, informs my colleague Varun Dixit. Banged in short just outside off, Rashid slogs across the line and gets a thick top-edge that goes high in the air. Skipper takes the matter in his own hands and backtracks, keeps his eyes on the ball and nestles it safely in his glove. Rashid Khan c Karthik b Prasidh 0(1)

Prasidh to Bhuvneshwar, out Bhuvneshwar Run Out!! Wow. Wow. This is exceptional finish from Krishna and KKR. 4 wickets and just 4 runs in the over. Take a bow, Krishna. Ushered it short and gets it to rise over Kumar's attempted hoick. Fails to connect and they try to sneak in a bye. But DK hits the bulls-eye and catches the batsman well short of his crease. Bhuvneshwar run out (Karthik) 0(1)

Kuldeep Yadav to Goswami, out Caught by A Russell!! Catching practice for Russell at long-on and SRH have lost their first wicket. This was tossed up nicely by Kuldeep, Goswami came down the track, didn't get close to the ball as he went through with the lofted drive, went off the inside half of the bat and looped towards long-on. Goswami has played his part though, walks off to a decent round of applause. Goswami c A Russell b Kuldeep Yadav 35(26) [4s-4 6s-1]

Krunal Pandya to Pant, out Caught by Pollard!! This was coming, not many runs in the over and Pant was getting increasingly agitated, deserving reward for the elder Pandya. This was tossed up on the stumps, perhaps a bit slow off the surface as well, Pant slogged hard and flat, no real elevation behind the shot, straight into the bucket hands of Pollard at long-on. Pant gets a pat on his back by his former U-19 captain, Kishan, as he walks back. Pant c Pollard b Krunal Pandya 64(44) [4s-4 6s-4]

Mustafizur to Maxwell, out Prithvi Shaw Run Out!! Looks like it's a run-out! Just an off-cutter, sliced away off the front-foot towards backward point where Pandya picks up and throws at the non-striker's end. Shaw sees the ball coming, and is still walking towards the crease, assuming that the ball will miss the stumps! Absolutely abominable from Shaw. He wants the ground to swallow him up, does Shaw. Prithvi Shaw run out (Hardik Pandya) 12(8) [4s-2]

Bumrah to Maxwell, out Bowled!! That's quick stuff @144km/h. Bumrah is no sulker! No LBW? No problem. Leave nothing to the umpire. Length delivery, seaming in just enough, Maxwell tries to loft through the line, gets an inside edge onto his pad and it finally ricochets onto his stumps. Huge breakthrough for the Mumbaikars, as their stump-vanquisher uproots the sticks of the Big Show one last time. Maxwell b Bumrah 22(18) [4s-4]

Markande to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! The wrong 'un on off, a tad short, Shreyas Iyer gets deep in the crease and has enough time to check out the leg-side field and then go for the shot. Pulls it straight down the throat of Krunal at deep mid-wicket who takes it comfortably. Is the foot on the rope? Nope, apparently not. Captain Capital's got to go. Shreyas Iyer c Krunal Pandya b Markande 6(10)

Lamichhane to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Vijay Shankar!! The adrenaline rush from Suryakumar, was never going to clear long-on. The googly from Lamichhane, skidded off the surface and Suryakumar was on the back foot. In a bid to unleash his bottom-handed whip, mistimes, gets a leading edge and picks out Vijay Shankar, who sprinted forward and tumbles. Importantly holds onto it. Sandeep roars, for he gets his revenge. Suryakumar Yadav c Vijay Shankar b Lamichhane 12(4) [4s-1 6s-1]

Harshal Patel to Rohit, out Caught by Boult!! It is the Maxwell-Boult partnership again. Seemed like a replay of the Pollard dismissal. The duo even have a laugh together. This was much more easily done by Maxwell. The third umpire has a check and there's nothing to overturn the soft signal. Another failure for Rohit. He's had a terrible season. More importantly leaves his team in a spot of bother. The slower off-cutter grips the surface and deceives Rohit compeletly, he was into the shot early and went through with it, the bottom hand comes off and the ball skies towards long-on, Maxwell runs across and takes the catch, but with the momentum taking him out, he lobs the ball to Boult, who came running from long-off. Rohit c Boult b Harshal Patel 13(11) [4s-1]

Mishra to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by (sub)Rahul Tewatia!! Is that the game? Ishan Kishan thinks so as he has his hands on his head. One of the MI cheerleaders did not like Pandya's shot selection either. Needless from Pandya. Last over for Mishra and he should have tried to play him out, but that is not the sort of batsman he is. Saw the floaty delivery outside off and went for the big loft downtown, sliced it off the outer half to backward point, where Tewatia picks up his second catch. Hardik Pandya c (sub)Rahul Tewatia b Mishra 27(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

Boult to Markande, out Bowled!! Bowled 'im. Top over under pressure from the Kiwi. Mumbai could get only 5 runs off it. Round the wicket and though he misses the yorker length, his pace makes up for it, Markande does not lay bat on the pacy full toss and has his off-stump uprooted. Markande b Boult 3(10)

Harshal Patel to Cutting, out Caught by Maxwell!! Patel pumps his fist. Cutting hangs his head down and trudges off. The Mumbai supporters are in shock. That must be the match? The slower delivery and it was right in the arc, but the slow nature made Cutting generate all the power and he could only heave it as far as deep mid-wicket. Maxwell keeps his cool and takes it calmly. Settled nicely under it. Cutting c Maxwell b Harshal Patel 37(20) [4s-2 6s-3]

Harshal Patel to Bumrah, out Caught by Boult!! Mumbai have been knocked out. Cutting and Rohit take a moment to soak in what has transpired. The Mumbai skipper then gathers himself and shakes hands with his team mates. It is only the fourth time that Mumbai have not made the playoffs. Some happy faces in the Delhi camp as they finish with back to back wins. Another slower delivery and Bumrah had to go for it, miscued it towards long-on and Boult ran in to complete the catch. Bumrah c Boult b Harshal Patel 0(1)

Mishra to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Vijay Shankar!! First ball wicket after the break. Mishra strikes gold. But wouldn't have been possible without Vijay Shankar - who has pulled off a blinder at long-on. Compensates for his earlier blip where he dropped Lewis at cover. Flighted teasingly from Mishra, Kishan took the bait -- had to because he was struggling a bit. Meets the pitch in a hurry and smashed it flat towards long-on. Vijay Shankar at the edge of the ropes, judges it well and clings onto it above his head. Made sure, he didn't topple over the ropes despite one leg balancing in the air. Ishan Kishan c Vijay Shankar b Mishra 5(13)

Mishra to Lewis, out Stumped!! Mishra has the last laugh and pumps his fists. Just when Lewis was looking more threatening, DD have sent him packing back to the hut. The wrong 'un from Mishra that foxes Lewis, stepped forward and aimed to for a cross-batted slog over long-on. The ball dips and turns in to slider under his bat. Pant was waiting behind and breaks the stumps in time. Lewis st Pant b Mishra 48(31) [4s-3 6s-4]

Lamichhane to Pollard, out Caught by Boult!! Wowza! Maxi-Boult combo pulls off a replica of Mayank-Tiwary's catch. But hang on, they have referred it to the third umpire. No issues with the front foot and no issues with the catch too, looks pretty clean and Pollard can continue his long walk back to the pavilion. Two in two for Delhi and what a comeback. Jitters in the Mumbai camp as they lose their fourth. Tossed up on the stumps, Pollard lifts it with a straight bat. Doesn't get enough power to clear long-on. Maxi stays at the edge of the ropes, grabs it and realises that he is going over the ropes. Throws the ball to Boult - who was waiting to gobble it up. Talk about tag-team effort. Outstanding. Pollard c Boult b Lamichhane 7(7)

Lamichhane to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by (sub)Rahul Tewatia!! In the air and taken. Mumbai crumbling as they lose half their side. Phew! Look out for Lamichhane, he's off for a celebratory run. Googly again, in the driving spot. Krunal went for it and spooned it uppishly to cover. The sub fielder Tewatia, does a fine job. Sprawls across and pouches it safely. Krunal Pandya c (sub)Rahul Tewatia b Lamichhane 4(3) [4s-1]

Mohit Sharma to Rayudu, out Caught by Rahul!! Edged and taken! Mohit gets the man in form. Swing does the trick once again. Short of a length around off, with a bit of away swing written on it. Rayudu tries to fend it down but gets an outside edge and Rahul doesn't make any mistake. Can Mohit get one more? Rayudu c Rahul b Mohit Sharma 1(3)

Ashwin to Harbhajan, out Lbw!! Ashwin strikes first ball! This was plumb. A carrom ball which pitches in line with middle and straightens. Harbhajan kneeled down to slog-sweep but in vain, to be hit on the back leg. Only one way that was headed. Harbhajan lbw b Ashwin 19(22) [4s-2 6s-1]

Ashwin to Chahar, out Caught by Mohit Sharma!! Sliced up off a thick edge, Mohit Sharma gets underneath it comfortably at cover. So Chahar's joyride comes to an end. The carrom ball was cleverly fired out of his arc, and his leg-side swipe was always vulnerable to the ball turning away. He's done his job though. He's done more than what could've been asked of him. Chahar c Mohit Sharma b Ashwin 39(20) [4s-1 6s-3]

Rajpoot to du Plessis, out Caught by Gayle!! That's gone! Have to give full marks to Gayle for this effort. Both openers are back in the pavilion without doing much. Was short of a length and outside off, du Plessis went hard at it and got an outside edge. Gayle at first slip was quick to get down and reverse cup it just before the ball was about to hit ground. Had his fingers beneath and the replays confirm it. du Plessis c Gayle b Rajpoot 14(15) [4s-3]

Rajpoot to Billings, out Bowled!! Jaffa. Peach. Ripper. Call it whatever. This was unplayable, indeed. Pitched on off and snakes away a tad to beat Billings defence. Hits the top of off and Billings is a dead duck. Rajpoot is on a hat-trick and he can might well get it. It's Harbhajan Singh who walks out to bat ahead of Dhoni, Bravo and Jadeja. Billings b Rajpoot 0(1)

Lungi Ngidi to Gayle, out Caught by Dhoni!! What was that? A half-hearted appeal for caught-behind, the umpire doesn't raise his finger, but Gayle walks. Well, CSK have the breakthrough. And, it's a big wicket. A harmless ball sliding down leg from a back of a length, Gayle gets a glove on it, trying to tuck. The Jamaican stood for a while and decided to go off. Gayle c Dhoni b Lungi Ngidi 0(2)

Jadeja to Manoj Tiwary, out Caught by Dhoni!! Have CSK forgotten to appeal? Didn't appeal for Gayle, he walked. This time a timid appeal for the sake of it from RJ and the umpire raises his finger. A wicket off his first ball for Ravindra Jadeja. Gave a bit of flight on this ball from round the wicket did RJ and the ball doesn't spin much after pitching outside off. Tiwary is down on his knee to swipe and gets a faint edge to the keeper. Off the toe end. That threatened to bobble out of the keeper's hand, but MS doesn't make any mistake. Manoj Tiwary c Dhoni b Jadeja 35(30) [4s-3 6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Miller, out Bowled!! The zing bails light up and then there's the jig from Bravo. Perfect yorker from the West Indian, Miller slightly moved leg-side to create room. He is too late to bring his bat down and the ball crashes into the middle stump. KXIP in deep trouble here - 80/5! Miller b Dwayne Bravo 24(22) [4s-1 6s-1]

SN Thakur to Axar, out Caught by Billings!! Terrific catch by Billings! Short delivery around off, Axar goes for the pull and miscues it to deep mid-wicket. Billings comes running in and just as the ball is about to die in front of him, he puts in a dive and pulls off a ripper. The wicket belongs to the fielder, more than the bowler. Axar c Billings b SN Thakur 14(12) [6s-1]

Lungi Ngidi to Ashwin, out Caught by Dhoni!! Full marks to the bowler there. He was sure that the batsman had nicked it and Ashwin has to walk back for a golden duck. Short delivery outside off, Ashwin tries to run it down to third man but gets a slight feather on its way to the keeper. Even he wasn't sure that if had nicked it. UltraEdge confirms with a spike! Ashwin c Dhoni b Lungi Ngidi 0(1)

Lungi Ngidi to Andrew Tye, out Caught by Raina!! Another one for Ngidi. He's taking down Punjab single handedly tonight. Got Rahul and Gayle earlier, gets Ashwin and Tye now. This was short of a length around off, Tye tried to punch it off his back foot but his bottom hand came off and he ended up miscuing it to mid-off. Can't get any easier for Raina! Andrew Tye c Raina b Lungi Ngidi 0(2)

Dwayne Bravo to Nair, out Caught by Chahar!! He's disappointed, disappointed at throwing his wicket away. He has done his job though. Tries to chip the low full toss over mid-off but gets it off the toe end and Chahar at mid-off completes the formalities. Should have waited for the last over, would have made some difference to the end score. Nair c Chahar b Dwayne Bravo 54(26) [4s-3 6s-5]

SN Thakur to Rajpoot, out Caught by du Plessis!! du Plessis takes a clean catch at long-on and that's the end of Punjab. Reckon, this total is not good enough to take them through to the playoffs. Was a short delivery that was swatted away to long-on by Rajpoot. du Plessis was the man near the fence who took it and managed to stay inside the boundary. Rajpoot c du Plessis b SN Thakur 2(4)

Chahar to Finch, out Caught by Raina!! Superb catch from Raina at first slip. Moved swiftly to his left and catches it above his head. A nothing shot from Finch. He knew that the ball is swinging, still flirts with a ball outside off sans any feet movement. Short of good length and nipping away from the right-hander, Finch gets squared up and can only manage an outside edge that finds the safe palms of Raina. Finch c Raina b Chahar 4(6) [4s-1]

Lungi Ngidi to Rahul, out Bowled!! Wow! This is excellent bowling from Lungi Ngidi. After all those away-going deliveries, he gets one to shape in. Rahul shoulders arms and loses his off-stump. Top-class bowling. A goodish length from over the wicket and Rahul anticipating the ball swing away raised his bat. It was however,, the inswinger. Hits the top of off. KXIP's best batsman this season departs for a cheap score. Rahul b Lungi Ngidi 7(11) [4s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, out Caught by Goswami!! Edged and caught! The perfect start from Bhuvneshwar, an absolute peach and he has gobbled Watson up. Fraction short in length and a hint of shape away from outside off, made Watson feel for the ball, found the tiniest of bat and Goswami does the rest. Defending 140, they needed early wickets and Bhuvneshwar has just got them one. Watson c Goswami b Bhuvneshwar 0(5)

Rashid Khan to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught by Dhawan!! Pouched at slip by Dhawan. Rashid Khan jogs away with his arms spread. Oh he loves bowling at the Wankhede. The extra fizz off the surface works wonders for him. Pushed through on a good length outside off, Bravo wafts at it and perishes to the turn and bite. SRH on a roll. Dwayne Bravo c Dhawan b Rashid Khan 7(11)

Sandeep Sharma to Jadeja, out Caught&Bowled!! Not anymore he's not. Dear me. He's chipped this knuckle ball straight back to Sandeep, completely bamboozled. Beautifully disguised on a good length around middle, Jadeja tries working it through the on-side but he's way too early into the shot. SRH are turning a defence of 140 into a one-sided affair. Quite unbelievable turn of events here. Jadeja c and b Sandeep Sharma 3(5)

Sandeep Sharma to Chahar, out Caught by Brathwaite!! Has Brathwaite taken this? It will be a sensational catch if he has. Tom Moody gets on his feet in the dugout. Big moment. The soft signal is out. And it doesn't take long for the third umpire to uphold the onfield call. Dhoni looks a bit miffed as he crosses his arms. Full ball, not an easy length to get under, which is why Chahar's loft hardly finds much elevation. It's a flat hit in front of long-on, with the ball dipping on Brathwaite and making him the second favourite. But he charges in while covering great ground and dives forward to get his fingers underneath. What a game he's had. Chahar c Brathwaite b Sandeep Sharma 10(6) [6s-1]

Brathwaite to du Plessis, out Harbhajan Run Out!! 1 run completed. This is stunning bit of work in the outfield from Rashid Khan. Faf had absolutely drilled this drive to his right at deep extra cover. But not only does he race across and slide to stop it, he also fires in a rocket throw back to Brathwaite to catch Harbhajan well short. Harbhajan run out (Rashid Khan/Brathwaite) 2(9)

S Kaul to Raina, out Bowled!! Oh dear! The fear of the short ball has consumed Raina once again, a nice little cameo, but nothing else. He pre-empted that Kaul would bowl a short ball and shuffled across his stumps, in the process, he left the leg-stump exposed. This wasn't a short ball, just a length delivery that was heading towards the leg-stump, once Raina clipped and missed, it was curtains for the left-hander. Raina b S Kaul 22(13) [4s-4]

S Kaul to Rayudu, out Bowled!! Two in two for Kaul and SRH are back in business. Not sure what Rayudu could have done here, this is simply sensational from Siddarth, the slower ball yorker, moved away off the seam as well, opened up Rayudu completely as he played for the original angle. The ball curved in and then shaped away beautifully, Rayudu was through with the shot, the ball gently seamed past the closed bat face and crashed into the base of middle and off-stump. A duck for Rayudu and Siddarth is on a hat-trick. Rayudu b S Kaul 0(1)

Rashid Khan to Dhoni, out Bowled!! That's big, that's huge and that might have just won this match for SRH. The wrong 'un from Rashid and MS didn't read it, he was lunging forward, was perhaps looking to push it too square, the ball grazed the inside edge, went through the huge gap between bat and pad and disturbed the stumps. Rashid is thrilled to bits, so are the SRH camp. They are defending a modest target with elan once again. Dhoni b Rashid Khan 9(18) [4s-1]

Chahar to Dhawan, out Bowled!! Chopped on! Out first ball. Whoa! What.A.Start. Gabbar gone for nought. It was a classic away-swinger, Dhawan went chasing after that and ended up dragging it back onto his stumps, off the inside edge of course. No room for error from Chahar, bowled it on a good length and arrested Dhawan's feet movement to force an error. A mere push from Dhawan, just feeling for the ball. Dhawan b Chahar 0(1)

Jadeja to Manish Pandey, out Caught&Bowled!! Easy peasy! SRH lose another. Pandey's woeful season continues. Nothing but a dart on middle and leg, might have slightly gripped the surface, Pandey wanted to work it into the on-side and closed the bat face, the leading edge lobs up to the right of Jadeja, who moves across and ahead of Pathan to gobble that up. Manish Pandey c and b Jadeja 8(16)

Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, out Caught&Bowled!! You go boy! That is a stunner and deserves the dance moves. Bravo starts his trademark Run The World jig as soon as he completes the catch. Full delivery and Pathan's eyes lit up on seeing it, went full throttle on the drive and didn't even bother to keep it down the ground, struck it hard and low towards Bravo, who had very little time to react, but he did. Went down with both hands but the force was such that it got stuck in the right hand. Another crucial breakthrough for CSK as they get rid of a set batsman. Y Pathan c and b Dwayne Bravo 24(29) [4s-3]

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, out Bhuvneshwar Run Out!! Bhuvneshwar is run-out trying to steal a bye. MS does not miss out on the opportunity. Bouncer on middle and leg, Brathwaite shuffled across, got inside the line and failed to connect with the pull shot, Bhuvneshwar called for the run and he was caught well short. Dhoni hitting the sticks with an under-arm throw. Excellent finish to the SRH innings though, 20 runs off the final over. Bhuvneshwar run out (Dhoni) 7(11)

Lungi Ngidi to Goswami, out Caught&Bowled!! Excellent return catch from Ngidi. Ensured he didn't offer any room to Goswami there, bowled it on a length and extracted some zip off the pitch; Goswami had nowhere to go, went flat and hard, ended up splicing it straight to Ngidi who bent down to claim a clean, low catch. Ngidi is pumped and so is CSK. Goswami c and b Lungi Ngidi 12(9) [4s-2]

SN Thakur to Williamson, out Caught by Dhoni!! Is that the game for CSK? Tom Moody looks stunned. An absolute gift of a wicket this. Short and drifting down leg, Williamson senses a boundary-scoring opportunity and gives it a real whack, no bat. It spooned up off the glove and travelled straight into the bucket hands of MS behind the stumps. Williamson c Dhoni b SN Thakur 24(15) [4s-4]

Dwayne Bravo to Shakib, out Caught by Dhoni!! Strangle down leg episode 2!! CSK are literally strangling SRH here. Another SRH batsman gets out to a poor delivery. It was slow, down leg and asking to be whacked, Shakib swivels and tries to oblige, ends up dragging it off his glove which makes a tiny tickle off his thigh pad before nestling into Dhoni's mitts. CSK are on fire.... Shakib c Dhoni b Dwayne Bravo 12(10) [4s-2]

Gowtham to Narine, out Stumped!! Gowtham has his revenge instantly! After the last boundary, I was beginning to think that RR have missed a trick by giving Gowtham the new ball, again, with Narine on strike. But hasn't the off spinner justified the decision or what! Clever bowling, expected Narine to give the charge and hung it up in the air a touch more on a slightly shorter length. The West Indian didn't bother adjusting to the length, that's not his way anyway and goes through with the shot. A bit of grip off the surface and whizzes past the edge. Easy for Klaasen. Narine st Klaasen b Gowtham 4(2) [4s-1]

Jofra Archer to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Klaasen!! And does him next ball. Archer retaliates. Sticks to his strengths. Keeps it short and cramps Gill for room and space. Gill was backing away, in a bid to slash it through point. Is defeated by the extra bounce and zip. Gets a faint nick and Klaasen nestles it in his gloves. The partnership has been broken and KKR lose half their side. Shubman Gill c Klaasen b Jofra Archer 28(17) [4s-3 6s-1]

Laughlin to Karthik, out Caught by Rahane!! Eden Gardens is shellshocked. Reason - Karthik perishes. Laughlin strikes gold and is pumped. The top-of-the-hand slower ball, on a fuller length. Karthik was shaping up for a biff across the line, loses his shape and loses his timing as well. Slicing it up in the air towards extra cover. Rahane keeps his eyes on the ball, back-pedals and holds on. Karthik c Rahane b Laughlin 52(38) [4s-4 6s-2]

Laughlin to Searles, out Caught by Jofra Archer!! Laughlin hoodwinking the batsmen with his canny slower balls. This was on a length around off, Searles swung it hard, lost his shape and skied it as far as long-off. Two fielders were converging and Archer completes the catch in the end running forward. A dot ball but Russell gets back on strike. Blessing in disguise? Eh? Searles c Jofra Archer b Laughlin 2(5)

Gowtham to Uthappa, out Caught&Bowled!! Soft, soft dismissal! Gowtham is on a roll here! It's Uthappa who has to go and another massive blow to KKR. This was tossed up generously and perhaps held onto the pitch a tad. Uthappa didn't help his cause by trying to work across the line. The leading edge balloons towards Gowtham who just has to leap a touch from his tall frame to grab the return catch. The hosts have been jolted here at Eden Gardens. It's all happening. Uthappa c and b Gowtham 3(7)

Jofra Archer to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Unadkat!! Atrocious from Rana! Another one bites the dust and KKR are clearly struggling at the moment. They aren't helping their cause either by not adapting to this surface. Short of a length from Archer and Rana once again backs away, like he did previous ball. What he also did, was to try a weird slog that was never a percentage stroke on this pitch. Only manages it high, off the inside half of the bat, towards mid-on. Nitish Rana c Unadkat b Jofra Archer 3(5)

Shreyas Gopal to Chris Lynn, out Caught&Bowled!! Another return catch. There were a few at the Wankhede yesterday and the Eden surface is creating the same havoc. The googly from Gopal which sticks onto the pitch a touch, Lynn wanted to work it away off the back foot but could only spoon it back to the leg spinner. A scratchy innings from the Australian. Never looked comfortable on this pitch. Right then, that means more responsibility for DK. Chris Lynn c and b Shreyas Gopal 18(22) [4s-2]

Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, out Caught&Bowled!! The time-out has struck. That was a flighted ball, the batsman skews the sweep back and the bowler does the rest. Caught and bowled is trending. The googly dipped, spun a little and the lack of pace from the wicket also helped. Huge strike for KKR. They are back in this. Rahane c and b Kuldeep Yadav 46(41) [4s-4 6s-1]

Chawla to Samson, out Caught by Searles!! Gone. Taken at long-on. That was dragged short, quicker as well. The batsman went for the pull but there was no distance on it. A lot of elevation though and was taken in the deep. Huge strike again from KKR. They keep dragging this back. The batsman got a bit carried away with the length I guess but the half-trackers have done the job in this edition of the IPL. Samson c Searles b Chawla 50(38) [4s-4 6s-2]

Prasidh to Binny, out Caught by Chris Lynn!! Slower dipping full toss and the slog sweep, sans any power, finds the man at square leg. Huge wicket or a blessing in disguise for KKR? Tough to say. It would bring in Gowtham. Three dot balls from him will hurt RR. But my word, this boy is special. Nailed the blockhole stuff and slower balls to perfection. Binny c Chris Lynn b Prasidh 0(3)

Chawla to R Tripathi, out Caught&Bowled!! Oh Chawla. Ignore that stout frame, he has a habit of plucking one-handed stunners - surely when he's the bowler. Tripathi couldn't have defended it with harder hands, he gets all traditional in a front foot block. And the ball instead of dying down, ends up being the wrong 'un, takes the splice and pops up to Chawla's right, who's palm stuck out is enough. R Tripathi c and b Chawla 20(13) [4s-1 6s-2]

Rashid Khan to Uthappa, out Bowled!! That's not very smart from Uthappa, his flattened leg-stump tells him the same. The very first ball he faces from Rashid, he tries to reverse-sweep him premeditatedly. It was too full to be doing that. The ball slid on under his bat and crashed his wicket away. Off you go, says Rashid with a twirl of his wrist. Uthappa b Rashid Khan 2(8)

Shakib to Karthik, out Bowled!! What a massive wicket! Sunrisers are absolutely pumped, with Shakib furiously swinging his hand in celebration. Oh, this form. Such a tricky thing. Karthik gets carried away a touch, tries cutting a ball from off-stump and chops it back onto leg. The length wasn't short either, and his balance just wasn't there as he was leaning backward in trying to manufacture the room which wasn't there. This match is well and truly alive. Karthik b Shakib 8(6) [4s-1]

Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, out Lbw!! Lynn falls sweeping. That was his ploy against spin. He was aware of the dangers associated with it, and was willing to take them anyway. Rashid's googly skids back in sharply and hits him on the knee-roll in front of off and middle. Plumb. What a turnaround this. Chris Lynn lbw b Rashid Khan 48(31) [4s-6 6s-2]

Rashid Khan to A Russell, out Caught by Dhawan!! What has Russell done here. What has he done? He can't believe it. Takes a moment to himself, before striding back into the pavilion. Flat googly turning in from outside off, Russell decides to go for a big cut, just unable to resist his attacking instincts. He's too cramped up to get it away, the ball fizzes off the edge, straight into the hands of Dhawan at slip. Rashid Khan, wow. A Russell c Dhawan b Rashid Khan 3(7)

S Kaul to Chawla, out Bowled!! Off-stump ripped off! Kaul points to the heavens. Williamson claps. SRH leap closer. Full ball on middle, Chawla eyes an inside-out drive after clearing his front leg but only gets an outside edge to send the ball smashing into the off pole. Chawla b S Kaul 12(12) [6s-1]

Brathwaite to Shivam Mavi, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Slogs, connects hard and flat, but picks out deep mid-wicket, and who should it be there. Of course Rashid Khan. To Brathwaite's credit, he bowled this pretty full and prevented Mavi from getting much elevation. KKR will at least have Gill on strike. Shivam Mavi c Rashid Khan b Brathwaite 6(4) [4s-1]

Brathwaite to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Rashid Khan has gobbled this up like a candy in the deep. What ridiculous ease. Full ball on leg stump from round the wicket, Brathwaite's round the wicket angle cramped Gill up meaning that there was no power behind the shot. He merely chipped it up. Rashid settles under it, around five yards in front of the boundary, and swallows it. Shubman Gill c Rashid Khan b Brathwaite 30(20) [4s-2 6s-1]

S Kaul to Narine, out Caught by Brathwaite!! Knuckle ball by Kaul does the trick! Full delivery on middle and leg, Narine was always trying to get under it and loft it away over long-on, but gets a mile of height on it, but not distance. Brathwaite settles under it and lets out a roar, and somewhere hidden underneath it, a sigh of relief. Narine c Brathwaite b S Kaul 26(13) [4s-4 6s-1]

Shakib to Nitish Rana, out Nitish Rana Run Out!! 1 run completed. You've gotta be kidding me! Full ball nurdled away towards deep mid-wicket, Rashid (who can't be kept out of the game) fires in the throw at the keeper's end. Rana, who slipped at the non-striker's end, ran to the danger end (the striker's end) for the fatal second run and was caught just marginally short. Throws his bat in disgust as he walks back, embarrassed. Nitish Rana run out (Rashid Khan/Saha) 22(16) [4s-1 6s-2]

Chawla to Saha, out Stumped!! Saha is waiting. Not sure why? They are checking whether Karthik has the ball in his gloves, he does. It pops out after the stumps are broken. So that is fine. TV umpire is having multiple looks. Why is he taking so much time? The square leg umpire had raised the finger and just because Saha stood his ground, the umpires went upstairs. Finally, we have a decision and it is OUT. The Eden crowd had to wait for almost three minutes to start their celebration. The googly and Saha hung back to nudge it into the on-side, gets an inside edge onto the under side of the thigh pad and the ball rolls back towards Karthik, Saha was taking off for the run and by the time he saw where the ball was, DK had broken the stumps. The ball did slip out of his grasp, but that was after he had lit the LEDs. Saha st Karthik b Chawla 35(27) [4s-5]

Kuldeep Yadav to Deepak Hooda, out Shakib Run Out!! KKR keep chipping away at the wickets. Just when the partnership had started to built, they have got rid of the set batsman. Floaty delivery and Deepak clears his front leg to have a clean swing at that, drills it straight back and Kuldeep gets a fingertip on it before the ball crashes into the stumps. Shakib was backing up and he had no time to make his way back. Caught well short of the crease. Shakib is disappointed and keeps shaking his head as he makes his way to the dugout. Shakib run out (Kuldeep Yadav) 28(24) [4s-4]

Narine to Deepak Hooda, out Caught by Chawla!! Well, the conventional sweep didn't work so lets try the reverse sweep. It still doesn't come off and Hooda has to go. The off-break from Narine and kept turning into Hooda, who shaped to play the reverse sweep/pull, fetched it from outside leg and spliced it towards backward point. Chawla ran back a few yards and reverse cupped it. In fact, Hooda changed his grip and tried the switch hit. Deepak Hooda c Chawla b Narine 19(19) [6s-1]

Prasidh to Brathwaite, out Brathwaite Run Out!! 1 run completed. Brilliant bit of work from Rana. Brathwaite is down on the floor and he takes ages to make his way back. Very full and almost close to the yorker length, Brathwaite slices it with an open bat face wide of short third man, Rana runs to his left from deep backward point, flings full length to stop the ball and then bullets a flat throw right next to the stumps to Karthik. There was never a second and even though Brathwaite put in the dive, he was well short. Huge wicket at this stage for KKR. They have removed one of the big hitters. Brathwaite run out (Nitish Rana/Karthik) 8(4) [6s-1]

Shivam Mavi to Y Pathan, out Caught by Chawla!! Now Pathan is gone. KKR are on fire. They are catching everything, running batsman out and bowling to their fields. Full and outside off, Pathan thought it was in his range and went for the loft over long-off, got it off the toe-end and skied it towards deep cover. It was in the air for a long time and Chawla held his nerve to cling on. Y Pathan c Chawla b Shivam Mavi 3(7)

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhawan, out Lbw!! Kuldeep is on all fours and on the ground, but he has a wicket first-ball. This is as plumb as it gets, Dhawan is gutted with himself as he walks back to the hut, didn't even consider reviewing it, it was as dead as one gets. Coming to the ball, this was nicely floated around middle, a hint of shape and that was enough to beat the batsman, Dhawan was shaping for the sweep, the ball was too full for that, he missed and was struck on the back-thigh, adjacent to middle-stump. It was going to crash into middle and umpire Nitin Menon has one of the easier LBW decisions of his career. Dhawan lbw b Kuldeep Yadav 34(24) [4s-4 6s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, out Caught by Karthik!! Two wickets in the over and Kuldeep is on a roll. The wrong 'un and Williamson has been done in completely. He has a word with his partner, but decides against a review, off he goes. Is this the game turning over? Coming to the ball, this was nicely tossed up around off, Williamson prodded forward on the drive, but unlike the previous ball - he didn't get to the pitch of it. The bat hit the ground, the ball caught the outside edge and Karthik completes a fine catch. Williamson c Karthik b Kuldeep Yadav 3(3)

Brathwaite to Raina, out Caught by Goswami!! That's the end of a fantastic 117-run stand. Sharp bouncer from Brathwaite. We all know Raina has a problem with the short ball, glad SRH thought about it too. This was a really good steepler cramping Raina on the half-hook shot, was almost trying to evade, the ball catches the glove and Goswami jumps to catch the ball. The appeal was confident, umpire Marais Erasmus said no. SRH went for the review and Raina walked off without waiting for the replays because he knew he hit that. Raina c Goswami b Brathwaite 32(24) [4s-3 6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, out Caught&Bowled!! The slower ball and that lands a wicket. The ball holds up thanks to knuckle ball and the lifted hit finds the bowler's hands. The bowler called for it and takes it. He charged out and tried to go aerial but never timed it. Watson's dot ball a reason for this? Might well be. CSK are off to the worst possible start. du Plessis c and b Sandeep Sharma 10(11) [4s-1]

Lungi Ngidi to Goswami, out Goswami Run Out!! 1 run completed. Needless! This is a gift from SRH. Never a second in it and Goswami is well short of the crease. The CSK fans at Wankhede explode. Short of length delivery, Goswami jumps and tucks it backward of square leg, he wanted the second and pushed Dhawan for it, Karn ran in from long leg and fired a flat throw right next to the stumps, easy peasy for Dhoni. Goswami was couple of yards short. Goswami run out (Karn Sharma/Dhoni) 5(5)

Karn Sharma to Williamson, out Stumped!! That's why you need these leggies. So all Williamson can manage is going past Gayle and Hussey. And no more. Karn is watching Williamson's feet, he's reading his head, he knows it's his time to charge down. And fires it wide, well outside off, spinning big. Under the desperate attempt in the end to squeeze it out. Well MS has a deal with the speed of light, and an equally good equation with stumpings. Williamson st Dhoni b Karn Sharma 47(36) [4s-5 6s-2]

Dwayne Bravo to Shakib, out Caught by Raina!! All the muscle. But all the placement. Too bad it had to come off a full toss too. Yea, blame the timing, for Shakib couldn't have picked out extra cover any better. He drives, doesn't bother keeping it down and who better than Raina to take these tracer bullets. Shakib c Raina b Dwayne Bravo 23(15) [4s-2 6s-1]

Lungi Ngidi to Deepak Hooda, out Caught by (sub)Shorey!! There's the cutter, finally. Ngidi digs it into the pitch, taking pace off but Hooda's loaded himself up early, is into his heave well before the ball can get there. Nah, can't pull out either. Goes through, miscuing and popping into deep square leg. Well you can't blame Hooda, he had to go for everything. Deepak Hooda c (sub)Shorey b Lungi Ngidi 3(4)

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, out Caught by Rayudu!! Holes. Predictable lines from Thakur, short-outside off and predictable from Brathwaite, swinging and aiming for the Western Railway trains outside. The pitch steals some timing, gets his toe-end and a running long-on cleans up. Brathwaite c Rayudu b SN Thakur 21(11) [6s-3]

Jadeja to Dhawan, out Bowled!! Timbah! Turns back and points to someone in the crowd. Huge wicket for CSK. The timeout as it does so often brings a wicket along with it. Nothing but a dart from Jadeja, hard to get under it and sweep, Dhawan does just that, kneels down to play the sweep and is beaten by the length and pace, misses it altogether and the ball takes a deflection off the back thigh before crashing into the stumps. The partnership is broken and CSK have an opening. Dhawan b Jadeja 26(25) [4s-2 6s-1]

Jadeja to de Grandhomme, out Caught by Dhoni!! Bangalore are falling apart here. Colin de Grandhomme always finds it difficult to bat against spin early in the innings and the difficulty goes up in these sorts of pitches. Ravindra Jadeja gave a bit of flight on this occasion and CdG was half-forward for a tentative push. Gets a faint outside edge and Dhoni makes no mistakes. de Grandhomme c Dhoni b Jadeja 4(6) [4s-1]

Tahir to Navdeep Saini, out Caught by Watson!! A big shout for lbw as Navdeep Saini is struck on the pad. Not given. Tahir persuades Dhoni to go for the review! Legal ball. It was the googly and Navdeep Saini was pressing forward for the push. Is the impact outside off? Before that, was there an inside edge? Yes, confirmed by UltraEdge. The ball brushed the pad and carried to first slip. A review for lbw, given out caught! Got to give credit to Tahir here. He forced MS to go upstairs and it's a successful one. Navdeep Saini c Watson b Tahir 2(3)

Tahir to Chahal, out Caught by Harbhajan!! Another one bites the dust. It was the googly from Tahir and Chahal dragged that from outside off with his sweep shot. No timing behind it and he holes out at deep mid-wicket. Harbhajan gobbles it up above his head and has his arms aloft. Chahal c Harbhajan b Tahir 4(12)

Jadeja to U Yadav, out Bowled!! Nine down! This is a trademark Jadeja wicket. This one spins slightly, just enough to beat the outside edge and disturb the wood. A flat out-turner that pitched on middle and Umesh was playing for the angle. He had prodded forward to block, the ball though had other ideas. Hit the deck and turned away to bamboozle the batter. U Yadav b Jadeja 1(10)

Dwayne Bravo to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! Dwayne Bravo gets a wicket off his very first ball and out comes his little jig. An off-pace delivery at 101kph from a short of length. Parthiv Patel was a touch early into his pull shot and ended up dragging it straight to Jaddu at backward square leg. Parthiv Patel c Kedar Jadhav b Dwayne Bravo 29(35) [4s-2]

Harbhajan to Kohli, out Caught by Jadeja!! Oh dear! This is a huge moment in the match. Virat-the-run-machine-Kohli has departed in single digits. It was a shorter delivery, Kohli rocks back and takes out the pull shot. He hits it straight to the Jadeja at deep mid-wicket and Jaddu is safe as a house. He takes it with utmost ease. Kohli c Jadeja b Harbhajan 6(12)

Harbhajan to Moeen Ali, out Caught&Bowled!! This is a soft soft dismissal. I am afraid to say, it is not the ideal track for the opening match of the IPL. Harbhajan gives this one lots of air, it sticks in the wicket, comes slowly and bounces extra off the deck. Moeen Ali was on the back-foot, he wanted to work it to the on-side. He closes the face of the blade early, it hits his leading edge and pops up in the air. Bhajji takes a sitter of sitters. RCB in a spot of bother. Moeen Ali c and b Harbhajan 9(8) [6s-1]

Harbhajan to de Villiers, out Caught by Jadeja!! Harbhajan has his man. This is similar to OVAL 2017. Kohli was given a life there but he gifted a catch on the very next ball. Same has happened with ABD today. de Villiers attempts a slog sweep again, it stops in the wicket and de Villiers's timing was in a mess. This time the ball went squarer and Jadeja was the fielder at deep mid-wicket, he gets in a good position and takes a fine catch. RCB in serious trouble. de Villiers c Jadeja b Harbhajan 9(10)

Harbhajan to Hetmyer, out Hetmyer Run Out!! Hetmyer departs for a duck and RCB are in a total mess in the Lion's den. Hetmyer taps it to the off-side and charges for a single, there was no response from Parthiv Patel and Hetmyer was stranded in the middle. Raina at cover comes quickly and hurls the ball to MS who knocks off the bails. Hetmyer was nowhere close to coming back. Hetmyer run out (Raina/Dhoni) 0(2)

Tahir to Shivam Dube, out Caught by Watson!! Another bites the dust. And Shivam Dube is gutted with himself, absolutely gutted. He smashes the bat in air after he edged it. Oh these young players! It was a normal leggie wide of off, Shivam Dube plays a nothing shot. He wanted to steer it wide of slips, ends up playing too fine and hands a simple catch to Watson at slip. Half of the team is back in the hut now. Shivam Dube c Watson b Tahir 2(5)

Jadeja to de Grandhomme, out Caught by Dhoni!! Bangalore are falling apart here. Colin de Grandhomme always finds it difficult to bat against spin early in the innings and the difficulty goes up in these sorts of pitches. Ravindra Jadeja gave a bit of flight on this occasion and CdG was half-forward for a tentative push. Gets a faint outside edge and Dhoni makes no mistakes. de Grandhomme c Dhoni b Jadeja 4(6) [4s-1]

Tahir to Navdeep Saini, out Caught by Watson!! A big shout for lbw as Navdeep Saini is struck on the pad. Not given. Tahir persuades Dhoni to go for the review! Legal ball. It was the googly and Navdeep Saini was pressing forward for the push. Is the impact outside off? Before that, was there an inside edge? Yes, confirmed by UltraEdge. The ball brushed the pad and carried to first slip. A review for lbw, given out caught! Got to give credit to Tahir here. He forced MS to go upstairs and it's a successful one. Navdeep Saini c Watson b Tahir 2(3)

Tahir to Chahal, out Caught by Harbhajan!! Another one bites the dust. It was the googly from Tahir and Chahal dragged that from outside off with his sweep shot. No timing behind it and he holes out at deep mid-wicket. Harbhajan gobbles it up above his head and has his arms aloft. Chahal c Harbhajan b Tahir 4(12)

Jadeja to U Yadav, out Bowled!! Nine down! This is a trademark Jadeja wicket. This one spins slightly, just enough to beat the outside edge and disturb the wood. A flat out-turner that pitched on middle and Umesh was playing for the angle. He had prodded forward to block, the ball though had other ideas. Hit the deck and turned away to bamboozle the batter. U Yadav b Jadeja 1(10)

Dwayne Bravo to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! Dwayne Bravo gets a wicket off his very first ball and out comes his little jig. An off-pace delivery at 101kph from a short of length. Parthiv Patel was a touch early into his pull shot and ended up dragging it straight to Jaddu at backward square leg. Parthiv Patel c Kedar Jadhav b Dwayne Bravo 29(35) [4s-2]

Harbhajan to Kohli, out Caught by Jadeja!! Oh dear! This is a huge moment in the match. Virat-the-run-machine-Kohli has departed in single digits. It was a shorter delivery, Kohli rocks back and takes out the pull shot. He hits it straight to the Jadeja at deep mid-wicket and Jaddu is safe as a house. He takes it with utmost ease. Kohli c Jadeja b Harbhajan 6(12)

Harbhajan to Moeen Ali, out Caught&Bowled!! This is a soft soft dismissal. I am afraid to say, it is not the ideal track for the opening match of the IPL. Harbhajan gives this one lots of air, it sticks in the wicket, comes slowly and bounces extra off the deck. Moeen Ali was on the back-foot, he wanted to work it to the on-side. He closes the face of the blade early, it hits his leading edge and pops up in the air. Bhajji takes a sitter of sitters. RCB in a spot of bother. Moeen Ali c and b Harbhajan 9(8) [6s-1]

Harbhajan to de Villiers, out Caught by Jadeja!! Harbhajan has his man. This is similar to OVAL 2017. Kohli was given a life there but he gifted a catch on the very next ball.
