Same has happened with ABD today. de Villiers attempts a slog sweep again, it stops in the wicket and de Villiers's timing was in a mess. This time the ball went squarer and Jadeja was the fielder at deep mid-wicket, he gets in a good position and takes a fine catch. RCB in serious trouble. de Villiers c Jadeja b Harbhajan 9(10)

Harbhajan to Hetmyer, out Hetmyer Run Out!! Hetmyer departs for a duck and RCB are in a total mess in the Lion's den. Hetmyer taps it to the off-side and charges for a single, there was no response from Parthiv Patel and Hetmyer was stranded in the middle. Raina at cover comes quickly and hurls the ball to MS who knocks off the bails. Hetmyer was nowhere close to coming back. Hetmyer run out (Raina/Dhoni) 0(2)

Tahir to Shivam Dube, out Caught by Watson!! Another bites the dust. And Shivam Dube is gutted with himself, absolutely gutted. He smashes the bat in air after he edged it. Oh these young players! It was a normal leggie wide of off, Shivam Dube plays a nothing shot. He wanted to steer it wide of slips, ends up playing too fine and hands a simple catch to Watson at slip. Half of the team is back in the hut now. Shivam Dube c Watson b Tahir 2(5)

S Kaul to Uthappa, out Bowled!! Off-cartwheel. It's a well-documented strategy -- soften up a batsman with a bumper, and then nail the yorker. Kaul's read that book, and he goes quick, full, on the base of off. Uthappa clearly hasn't, running down the pitch, making room as well to make matters worse and then is too slow in jamming his attempted-driving-bat down. Uthappa b S Kaul 35(27) [4s-3 6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Karthik, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! Perfectly disguised slower one, and nobody's dropping them now. Sandeep has his moral victory, correcting a horrible start and messing around with Karthik's head, who was waiting for it to get quicker. But it sticks in the pitch, with DK committing to his drive, and eventually trying to pull out. The result - a one-handed nothing chip, easy to extra cover close-in. Karthik c Bhuvneshwar b Sandeep Sharma 2(4)

Rashid Khan to Nitish Rana, out Lbw!! Thank the lights Rashid, it's successfully broken Rana's momentum. A slower leg-break by his standards and Rana tries to carefully nurdle it away after plonking his front leg in front of middle. But no, loses his timing, misses all ends up and the umpire is convinced enough. Rana's convinced to walk off as well, but the ball's striking him in front of leg, could it have spun down? Nitish Rana lbw b Rashid Khan 68(47) [4s-8 6s-3]

Shakib to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! That looked ugly, but Shakib has his man. A pre-empted charge from Lynn, Shakib saw it coming and fired the slider - kept coming with the angle and cramped Lynn for room - he looked very awkward as he tried to force it away - off the toe-end of the bat and scooped in the air towards cover-point. Rashid under the ball and he doesn't drop those. Chris Lynn c Rashid Khan b Shakib 7(11) [6s-1]

Chawla to Bairstow, out Bowled!! This was coming, Bairstow was getting edgy with every dot delivery - this was the wrong 'un, slower and spinning back into the right-hander, think Bairstow picked it as he rocked back on the pull - beaten by the lack of pace, went through with the shot a fraction too early and ended up losing his off-stump. But he has played his role, not a bad first knock at the IPL. Bairstow b Chawla 39(35) [4s-3 6s-1]

A Russell to Warner, out Caught by Uthappa!! That's a smart catch from Uthappa and didn't KKR need this - Warner will be kicking himself though, a wide half-volley and he creamed it sweetly - the timing was sweet, but Warner didn't hit the gap - was travelling to his left, but Uthappa slid across, got both hands to it and holds on. Can this make a difference of 15-20 runs? Warner c Uthappa b A Russell 85(53) [4s-9 6s-3]

A Russell to Y Pathan, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! A nothing shot from Yusuf and KKR are coming back strongly into the contest. Change of pace and Yusuf was done in like a kipper. The slower off-cutter, rolled his fingers across the seam, Yusuf went nowhere on the swing, feet rooted to the crease as he swung across in hope - missed it completly, the ball clipped the back-pad before smashing into the middle-stump. Y Pathan b A Russell 1(4)

McClenaghan to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by de Kock!! Edged and gone! McClenaghan provides the early breakthrough for MI. How often has he done this? The away angler that's full and moves away just a bit, Shaw is stuck on the crease as he opts for that flamboyant drive of his. Looks good when it comes off but not here, as he only gets an edge that's taken sharply by de Kock moving to his right. Prithvi Shaw c de Kock b McClenaghan 7(6) [4s-1]

Cutting to Ingram, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Ingram fails to get a fifty in his comeback match in the IPL. There was pressure on him after getting such a heavy paycheck from DC this year in the auction. And he has certainly lived upto the expectations. It was a slower delivery wide of off, Ingram goes back and wanted to pump it over deep mid-wicket. He fails to time it as well as he would have liked and ends up gifting at catch to the younger Pandya at deep mid-wicket. Ingram c Hardik Pandya b Cutting 47(32) [4s-7 6s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Dhawan, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Dhawan's fighting innings comes to an end. Not the most ravishing knock but may be he was given the role of anchoring the innings. It was a slower delivery wide of off, Dhawan wanted to clear deep mid-wicket, mishits it and Suryakumar takes a dolly at deep mid-wicket. Dhawan c Suryakumar Yadav b Hardik Pandya 43(36) [4s-4 6s-1]

McClenaghan to K Paul, out Caught by de Kock!! Paul's debut wasn't that fruiful. And McClenaghan has his third. He is a wicket-machine for the Mumbai Indians in the IPL. It was banged in half way down the track and was going across the right-hander, it climbs onto K Paul who attempts a pull shot. Only manages to top-edge it and it goes back to QDK who takes it with utmost ease. K Paul c de Kock b McClenaghan 3(5)

Bumrah to Axar, out Caught by Rasikh Salam!! In the air and taken. Bumrah strikes back! It was banged in on a short of length, was on the face of Axar. He attempts a cheeky upper cut and finds third man where the 17-year-old Salam takes it easily. Axar c Rasikh Salam b Bumrah 4(2) [4s-1]

McClenaghan to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Pollard!! McClenaghan has his revenge! Must say that Pollard owns the credits for this wicket, a sharp catch diving to his right. Iyer will be disappointed, looked really good while he was there and this wasn't a wicket-taking ball either. Was pitched up for the drive and he couldn't keep the shot down. Was travelling towards the extra cover region where KP plucks it out. DC have been dented early. Shreyas Iyer c Pollard b McClenaghan 16(10) [4s-2 6s-1]

K Paul to Pollard, out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! Excellent thinking from Paul! Goes for the knuckle ball, brave option against the big hitting Pollard who is clearly foxed by the variation. He was making room for a lofted stroke but had to adjust. Too late and the result is a chip that goes all the way to sweeper cover. Tewatia didn't have to budge. Pollard c Rahul Tewatia b K Paul 21(13) [4s-2 6s-1]

Axar to Hardik Pandya, out Caught&Bowled!! What a soft dismissal! Hardik is generally good against spin, not this time. Quickish slider and he pats it back down the track. Couldn't keep it down and a dolly of a return catch for Axar who accepts it like a craving kid who gets a candy. Falling apart now, the Mumbai Indians. Hardik Pandya c and b Axar 0(2)

Boult to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! The fun is over. Boult cleverly took pace off after a barrage of pacy deliveries. Krunal had to slog at everything, given the match situation and he hasn't connected this well at all. Mistimed and finds deep mid-wicket to perfection. Tewatia has been a busy man tonight near the fence. Is that the game? Krunal Pandya c Rahul Tewatia b Boult 32(15) [4s-5 6s-1]

Rabada to Cutting, out Caught by Pant!! Another one bites the dust and MI's already declining hopes are further dented. Pacy and full from Rabada, Cutting is quite late on the drive and there is a noise as this goes through to Pant. The appeal for caught behind is approved and Cutting goes for a review. Almost a forced one, considering the situation. It did seem like bat hitting ground and replays show that but, there's also a spike on UltraEdge as ball passes the bat. Cutting c Pant b Rabada 3(4)

Rabada to Yuvraj, out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! Fourth catch for Tewatia. He's having a field day in the deep. Yuvraj's show is over, wasn't at his best really, rode his luck quite a bit but the important part was that he stuck in. Nobody else did barring Krunal and to an extent Pollard. This was a slog without any timing. Picked out deep mid-wicket with precision. Yuvraj c Rahul Tewatia b Rabada 53(35) [4s-5 6s-3]

Rahul Tewatia to McClenaghan, out Stumped!! Razor sharp work from Pant! Was a googly from Tewatia and McClenaghan went across the line for a big hit. Missed it and the DC keeper was lightning quick to dislodge the bails. McClenaghan st Pant b Rahul Tewatia 10(8) [4s-2]

Ishant to Rohit, out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! Ishant strikes! For a moment Tewatia had misjudged this in the deep but does really well to keep his eyes on the ball and take it just when it's about to dip in front of him. Rohit was down on his knee as he picked up the length delivery towards the deep square leg fence. Got the elevation but not the distance he was looking for. Rohit c Rahul Tewatia b Ishant 14(13) [4s-2]

Ishant to Suryakumar Yadav, out Suryakumar Yadav Run Out!! Iyer nails a direct-hit and it's curtains for Suryakumar Yadav! Challenges the opposition skipper's arm and has to pay the price for it. Played this one towards mid-off and called for a single but he was never going to make it. Not the kind of start Mumbai Indians were looking for. Suryakumar Yadav run out (Shreyas Iyer) 2(6)

Ishant to de Kock, out Caught by Boult!! Mumbai sink further as Ishant bags his second wicket. Was a short ball that was pulled nicely by de Kock but it flew quickly to the man at fine leg. Boult is the man stationed in the deep who plucks it out of thin air. He's taken blinders on numerous occasions previously. Compared to those, this was just a regulation catch for the Kiwi speedster. de Kock c Boult b Ishant 27(16) [4s-4 6s-1]

D Kulkarni to Rahul, out Caught by Buttler! Oh oh oh! That's the Rahul who's taken guard with the scars of the SENA year sinking deeper into his conscience. A back of a length delivery jagging away slightly, swerving a little as well, and Rahul is on the backfoot, with a perfect set-up to punch it towards the covers, but tries to withdraw at the final moment, only to end up getting a thick outside edge to the right of the 'keeper who dives full-stretch to his right to grab a fantastic catch! That's the end of KL for the night, then. Rahul c Buttler b D Kulkarni 4(4) [4s-1]

Stokes to Gayle, out Caught by R Tripathi!! It needed a blinder, it gets a blinder. Tripathi's ruined the fun with his brilliance. It was another flashy pull, just as crunchy-sounding and just as clean-looking. And make no mistake, there's plenty of legs on this. But, but, it's all too flat. And Tripathi, waiting at the deep mid-wicket boundary leaps up, judges it as perfectly as it could get. Nevertheless, Gayle's put on a proper show, and he's helped himself to his highest ever score against the Royals. Gayle c R Tripathi b Stokes 79(47) [4s-8 6s-4]

Stokes to Pooran, out Caught by Rahane!! Pooran picks out Rahane at long-off. Trimmed the pace and kept it wider of off, Pooran went hard at it and ended up mistiming it to Royals' captain. Pooran scratchy knock comes to an end. It came off the toe-end, hence lacked the timing. Also, lack of pace meant that he had to generate some power but the southpaw failed on that occasion. Pooran c Rahane b Stokes 12(14) [4s-1]

Gowtham to Agarwal, out Caught by D Kulkarni!! Yea, you can't let your state-mate have a moral internal laugh, even if it's only for a ball, can you? Well, Agarwal surely can't let him do. He clears out his front leg, looks to go lofted over mid-off, but in his desperation gets a little too much wood under the ball. Hence - great elevation, but distance = a damn alert long-off. Kulkarni, judges it perfectly, going right to the edge of the rope, and then balances himself superbly as well to ensure his over-head attempt doesn't take him over. Agarwal c D Kulkarni b Gowtham 22(24) [4s-1 6s-2]

Sam Curran to Smith, out Caught by Rahul!! That's the catch of this season so far. KL Rahul is absolutely pumped, he thumps his chest and lets out a few emotions. Well, it's been a game full of emotions thus far. This was full and angling away from Smith outside off, he went for the lofted hit over extra cover but ended up skewing it off the cue end. KL Rahul from long-off covered a lot of miles to his left and never lost the sight of the ball, dived full length and caught it air-borne with two hands. I'm told he nearly ran 50 metres to catch that. Smith c Rahul b Sam Curran 20(16) [4s-1 6s-1]

Sam Curran to Samson, out Caught by Ashwin!! Excellent final over from Sam Curran. Removed two set batsmen and this could be the game for KXIP? Once again kept it wide from Samson's reach who went chasing after the delivery and much like Smith, he too toe-ended it into the air. Ash runs back from extra cover and clings onto a dolly of a catch. Samson c Ashwin b Sam Curran 30(25) [6s-1]

Mujeeb to Stokes, out Caught by (sub)Nair!! Rush of blood! Mujeeb's done him with the googly, this time Stokes gave himself plenty of room and wanted to go over long-on, hasn't quite middled it and picks out the sub fielder Karun Nair in the deep. Stokes c (sub)Nair b Mujeeb 6(2) [6s-1]

Mujeeb to R Tripathi, out Caught by Rahul!! The Royals are falling apart. It's been some crumble. Tripathi danced down the pitch and met the ball on the full, only to spoon the easiest of catches to KL Rahul at long-on. R Tripathi c Rahul b Mujeeb 1(4)

Shami to Jofra Archer, out Jofra Archer Run Out!! Trouble. More trouble for RR. Another pinpoint yorker from Shami, Archer couldn't lay bat on ball and he tried to steal a bye after it snuck past the leg stump, Pooran throws and misses, Shami doesn't miss it this time though. Collects the ball mid-pitch and sees both batsmen stranded in the middle. Walks forward and disoldges the bails at the striker's end with supreme ease. Jofra Archer run out (Pooran/Shami) 2(2)

Rajpoot to Unadkat, out Caught&Bowled!! Short ball, Unadkat top-edges it high into the air, both keeper and the bowler go for it without any sort of communication. Ankit Rajpoot charges and clasps it safely before crashing into Pooran who seems to have taken some serious knock on the head from the big man. Good effort from Rajpoot to keep his eyes on the ball and not fumble despite tumbling after the crash. Unadkat c and b Rajpoot 1(2)

Rajpoot to Gowtham, out Caught by Shami!! Low full toss and it's been chipped off the toe-end to Shami at mid-off who gathers the ball after a slight fumble on the first attempt. I'm afraid this is all but over for RR. Gowtham c Shami b Rajpoot 3(4)

Ashwin to Rahane, out Bowled!! The carrom ball bowled quicker and it hits the target as it explodes into the top of off. A wicket out of nowhere for KXIP and it is their skipper who has provided it. That might have skidded on after landing on the grassier part of the wicket. Rahane tried to dab it and missed. Rahane b Ashwin 27(20) [4s-4]

Tahir to Shreyas Iyer, out Lbw!! Gonzo! Terrible misjudgement from Iyer and he pays the price. Made room to a slider from Tahir, ended up getting too close for comfort as it zips through and crashes his front pad first. The appeal was spontaneous and only question there was whether it was pad first as Iyer did make contact with the bat later. Umpire Nitin Menon was sure about it and raised his finger. Iyer also knew it and started walking. HawkEye says that it's smashing the off-stump. Shreyas Iyer lbw b Tahir 18(20) [6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Pant, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Killer blow! Shardul Thakur has made a tough catch look very simple. Pant's cameo comes to an end and DC have lost an important wicket. Length delivery, straighter at the stumps and jerked his lower body, unfurling a whippy-pull uppishly towards deep square leg. Thakur ran swiftly to his right, cushions it neatly and slides before completing the catch. They have also called for a time-out. Pant c SN Thakur b Dwayne Bravo 25(13) [4s-2 6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Ingram, out Caught by Raina!! Catching practice for Raina at extra cover. Bravo breaks into a jig and CSK on top now. Two wickets in three balls and DC are in trouble. It was fuller and just outside off, seemed to have stopped on the wicket a tad and Ingram checks his shot early and airly to Raina, who makes no mistake. Could this be the game-changing over? Ingram c Raina b Dwayne Bravo 2(2)

Jadeja to K Paul, out Bowled!! Off-stumps takes a beating! Typical Jadeja delivery. It was a faster one, it spins away sharply from Paul who plays inside the line of it and it rips past the outside edge. Paul hasn't been able to find his groove in the IPL so far. K Paul b Jadeja 0(4)

Dwayne Bravo to Dhawan, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Third wicket for Dwayne Bravo in a span of 6 balls. He is having a whale of a time at Kotla. The pitch is tailor-made for his style of bowling and he is making full use of it. It was a slower one on the stumps, Dhawan was taken aback by how slowly it came off the deck. He was way too early on the hoick, it comes off the leading edge and Shardul takes a fine catch near deep mid-wicket. Dhawan c SN Thakur b Dwayne Bravo 51(47) [4s-7]

Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Watson!! This is very good limited overs bowling from Chahar. We saw him adjust very well to Dhawan when he was given the charge, now Shaw runs down the pitch to smash the bowler, but Chahar takes pace off, shortens the length and also follows the batsman, leaving Shaw nowhere to go. The batsman backs himself to play the pull shot, only mistimes it as far as mid-wicket. A dolly for Watto! Prithvi Shaw c Watson b Chahar 24(16) [4s-5]

Tahir to Shreyas Iyer, out Lbw!! Gonzo! Terrible misjudgement from Iyer and he pays the price. Made room to a slider from Tahir, ended up getting too close for comfort as it zips through and crashes his front pad first. The appeal was spontaneous and only question there was whether it was pad first as Iyer did make contact with the bat later. Umpire Nitin Menon was sure about it and raised his finger. Iyer also knew it and started walking. HawkEye says that it's smashing the off-stump. Shreyas Iyer lbw b Tahir 18(20) [6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Pant, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Killer blow! Shardul Thakur has made a tough catch look very simple. Pant's cameo comes to an end and DC have lost an important wicket. Length delivery, straighter at the stumps and jerked his lower body, unfurling a whippy-pull uppishly towards deep square leg. Thakur ran swiftly to his right, cushions it neatly and slides before completing the catch. They have also called for a time-out. Pant c SN Thakur b Dwayne Bravo 25(13) [4s-2 6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Ingram, out Caught by Raina!! Catching practice for Raina at extra cover. Bravo breaks into a jig and CSK on top now. Two wickets in three balls and DC are in trouble. It was fuller and just outside off, seemed to have stopped on the wicket a tad and Ingram checks his shot early and airly to Raina, who makes no mistake. Could this be the game-changing over? Ingram c Raina b Dwayne Bravo 2(2)

Jadeja to K Paul, out Bowled!! Off-stumps takes a beating! Typical Jadeja delivery. It was a faster one, it spins away sharply from Paul who plays inside the line of it and it rips past the outside edge. Paul hasn't been able to find his groove in the IPL so far. K Paul b Jadeja 0(4)

Dwayne Bravo to Dhawan, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Third wicket for Dwayne Bravo in a span of 6 balls. He is having a whale of a time at Kotla. The pitch is tailor-made for his style of bowling and he is making full use of it. It was a slower one on the stumps, Dhawan was taken aback by how slowly it came off the deck. He was way too early on the hoick, it comes off the leading edge and Shardul takes a fine catch near deep mid-wicket. Dhawan c SN Thakur b Dwayne Bravo 51(47) [4s-7]

Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Watson!! This is very good limited overs bowling from Chahar. We saw him adjust very well to Dhawan when he was given the charge, now Shaw runs down the pitch to smash the bowler, but Chahar takes pace off, shortens the length and also follows the batsman, leaving Shaw nowhere to go. The batsman backs himself to play the pull shot, only mistimes it as far as mid-wicket. A dolly for Watto! Prithvi Shaw c Watson b Chahar 24(16) [4s-5]

Chakravarthy to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Agarwal!! Maiden IPL wicket for Varun Chakravarthy! A moment he'll remember for a long, long time. Rana just had one aim: to slog and slog big. Goes for it but doesn't quite get it off the middle and his attempt to go over cover fails miserably. Skews it off the cue-end and Mayank Agarwal takes a brilliant catch running in from long-off. Nitish Rana c Agarwal b Chakravarthy 63(34) [4s-2 6s-7]

Tye to A Russell, out Caught by Agarwal! Short ball angling in but still outside off, Russell needs no distance parameter to get leverage on that - the force is more than enough - but then, Agarwal at the cow corner fence, hops up to take a magnificent catch. Absolute carnage once again, and he's done his job, has DreRuss. Misses out on a fifty for the second time in a row. A Russell c Agarwal b Tye 48(17) [4s-3 6s-5]

Shami to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Miller!! One shot too many? But, that's how Lynn plays. A seam-up back of a length delivery at 144.3kph, Lynn goes for another straight-pull from the crease. Went too hard and in the process lost his shape. The ball ballooned up off the top-edge. It went up a long way and Miller called for it. The South African settled under it by moving to his right from extra cover and completed a very good catch. KXIP have the breakthrough! Chris Lynn c Miller b Shami 10(10) [4s-2]

Viljoen to Narine, out Caught by Rahul!! KKR have lost both their openers now. A hit-the-deck-hard back of a length delivery that cramps the batsman for room. Narine clears his front leg for a pull shot, gets a top-edge that pops up a long way in the air. KL Rahul, the man with the gloves, moves backwards to snaffle it. Narine c Rahul b Viljoen 24(9) [4s-1 6s-3]

Ferguson to Rahul, out Caught by Kuldeep Yadav! An abomination fo a shot for an Indian Test opener. Rahul backs away into the on-side, picks up a length ball from middle-stump, 145.7km/h, and tries to run his hands through the ball in chipping it over mid-off, miscues and and ends up lobbing it straight to the man at mid-off, succumbing in a rather soft manner. That was pressure. Pressure talking. Rahul c Kuldeep Yadav b Ferguson 1(5)

Chawla to Agarwal, out Bowled!! The googly and it takes out the leg stump. Agarwal on one knee to slog-sweep it for six, but missed the ball completely and lost the pole. A fine fifty from Agarwal, but KXIP needed him to push a little more hard chasing 219. Agarwal b Chawla 58(34) [4s-6 6s-1]

A Russell to Gayle, out Caught by Prasidh! What can't you do DreRuss? Have you got a deal cut out with the God of fortune? A short one at the body, not particularly quick @130.8km/h, Gayle gets his weight on the backfoot to pull it away, but with that bat-face turning upwards, gets it off the splice, skywards, as Prasidh runs in to pick it up at mid-on. Huge moment in the game, as both the openers depart. Gayle c Prasidh b A Russell 20(13) [4s-2 6s-2]

A Russell to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by Karthik!! Slower delivery gets the scalp here. That was down leg, Sarfaraz Khan ended up closing the face of the bat a bit too early and the leading edge was taken by the keeper, who moved to his left by quite a few paces to take it. Dre Russ continues his impact on this game. And have the deliveries started to hold on more now? Might well be the case. Sarfaraz Khan c Karthik b A Russell 13(13) [4s-2]

U Yadav to Rohit, out Caught by Siraj!! This is a big wicket for RCB! The home crowd knows that. They go berserk. Umesh Yadav has a beaming smile on his face. A hit-the-deck-hard back of a length delivery wide of off and Umesh induces a rare miscued pull shot from Rohit. The ball ballooned up off the top-edge. Siraj comes forward from long-off to gobble it up. Rohit c Siraj b U Yadav 48(33) [4s-8 6s-1]

Chahal to Yuvraj, out Caught by Siraj!! Yuvraj wanted to go for the fourth six, but holes out. A fullish googly marginally outside off, it was in the slot for the lefty to go over long-off. But, the bat turned at the point of impact. Siraj, at long-off, initially misjudged as he was a couple of yards inside the boundary rope. However, he recovered well and timed his jump perfectly to take a pressure catch. Yuvraj c Siraj b Chahal 23(12) [6s-3]

Chahal to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Moeen Ali!! An away-turning leg-break at 82.4kph, a backing away Suryakumar Yadav had to reach out for it. He was trying to carve it over the covers, but ended up slicing it off the cue end. Moeen Ali settles under it at point and takes a calm catch. Suryakumar Yadav c Moeen Ali b Chahal 38(24) [4s-4 6s-1]

Chahal to Pollard, out Caught by Hetmyer!! The extra ball has benefited the home side. The previous ball was wrongly wided and Chahal has dismissed the dangerous Pollard off his last ball of the spell. Another floated leggie outside off and Pollard decided to go for the inside-out loft. Off the outer half and also bottom part. Hetmyer gathers it with both hands at sweeper cover. Pollard c Hetmyer b Chahal 5(6)

U Yadav to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Navdeep Saini!! A bumper and Krunal Pandya plays a hook shot. He's been caught at fine leg by Saini. But, has he made contact with the boundary rope? The umpires send it upstairs. It's a legal ball. And, no part of the boot/pant has touched the ad-cushions. Krunal has to walk back. RCB continue to take wickets. It was a pacy bumper and Krunal made decent contact after getting inside the line. However, Saini timed his jump to perfection. Once again, cricket shows you the value of an inch or two! Krunal Pandya c Navdeep Saini b U Yadav 1(2)

Siraj to McClenaghan, out Bowled!! Another one bites the dust. A seam-up ball from a short of length, McClenaghan stands tall to heave across the line when he could have cut it through the off-side. All he manages is an inside edge that cannons onto the stumps. McClenaghan b Siraj 1(4)

Siraj to Markande, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! In-slanter at 135kph just outside off, Markande tries to run it down to third man and gets a faint inside edge. The RCB players went up straightaway and umpire S Ravi was late to raise his finger. The fielder from the off-side and threw the ball towards the bowler's end to effect a run-out. In the end, Ravi confirmed that it was caught-behind! Markande c Parthiv Patel b Siraj 6(5) [4s-1]

Siraj to Bumrah, leg byes, 1 run, 144.7kph, very full ball on the pads, Bumrah misses the flick and is struck on the front leg in front of leg. RCB went up for a review, but that was more out of desperation. The batters stole a run and Hardik will be on strike

Chahal to de Kock, out Bowled!! 50th scalp for Chahal at the Chinnaswamy. Told ya! He's RCB's trumpcard and straightaway gets his team the breakthrough. CDG will be a relieved man for sure. Poor shot from de Kock, especially having tried this off the first ball of the over. Spinning into him and the Southpaw went for the fancy reverse after taking his front foot forward. Was in no position to play that shot and gets an under-edge which deflects back onto the stumps. The home crowd goes bonkers as RCB pick up their first wicket. de Kock b Chahal 23(20) [4s-2 6s-1]

Bumrah to Kohli, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Bumrah gets the better of Virat Kohli! Gets him with a short ball. Pounds it into the pitch and gets it to angle in into the body, Kohli hadn't really moved back, but still goes through with the shot (pull) and the top-edge lands in the bucket hands of Hardik Pandya at square leg. Kohli c Hardik Pandya b Bumrah 46(32) [4s-6]

Bumrah to Hetmyer, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Needless stuff from Hetmyer. Wanted to go for the glory hit and perished; was fullish and angling in, Hetmyer made room early and cleared his front leg to go over the leg-side, slices it off the toe-end and Hardik Pandya takes the simplest of catches at mid-off. Hetmyer c Hardik Pandya b Bumrah 5(6)

Bumrah to de Grandhomme, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Similar lines again: wide of off, CDG thumps it into the air sans any conviction and KP at sweeper cover runs forward to snaffle a dolly of a catch. de Grandhomme c Krunal Pandya b Bumrah 2(7)

Bumrah to Parthiv Patel, out Moeen Ali Run Out!! This is a big moment. What a direct-hit from the skipper. Mo was starting to time the ball well, a stutter has cost him. Parthiv flicked this slower ball in front of short mid-wicket and set off, Ro attacked the ball and knocked the sticks over with a rocket through. The crowd, disappointed for a fleeting moment with the dismissal, yells out a loud roar. Enter King Kohli! Moeen Ali run out (Rohit) 13(7) [4s-1 6s-1]

Markande to Parthiv Patel, out Bowled!! A chop on from Chota Gayle. He gets a start, but throws it away. We have seen that way too many times. Did the job though. Googly from Markande, Parthiv goes back to cut, looked too close for the shot and ended up dragging it back onto the sticks. Parthiv Patel b Markande 31(22) [4s-4 6s-1]

Nadeem to Rahane, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Gone! The partnership has been broken. But it might be a good thing for Rajasthan. Rahane has done his job - setting it up for the likes of Stokes and Gowtham. He shimmies down and is deceived by Nadeem's dragged back length, still goes through with the loft and gets more height than distance, Pandey takes it easily near long-on. Rahane c Manish Pandey b Nadeem 70(49) [4s-4 6s-3]

Rashid Khan to Buttler, out Bowled!! Yeah, that's how you halt rampagers -- with drift. Rashid starts wide of his crease, entices Buttler to go sweeping with the angle. But he gets a little too greedy, shuffling way across, sweeping, and getting fully foxed by the dip, which sneaks under the bat, kisses the glove and is still quick enough to uproot leg. Buttler b Rashid Khan 5(8) [4s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to Bairstow, out Caught by D Kulkarni!! Dhawal Kulkarni dropped a relatively easy one last over, but he's taken a blinder at long-off. He was close to the boundary, had to jump to grab the ball, got the timing right and managed to hold on and also stay inside the rope. Bairstow was running back for the second and stood midway in disbelief that the catch was taken. It was a flighted delivery outside off stump, Bairstow steps out and toe-ends the lofted drive, holes out in the end. So both the set batsmen have been removed in quick succession. Bairstow c D Kulkarni b Shreyas Gopal 45(28) [4s-6 6s-1]

Unadkat to Williamson, out Caught by R Tripathi!! This is going to hand. Slower delivery, Williamson jumped out of the crease to cut, but this one bounced a tad extra, so Williamson couldn't keep it down, easy grab at backward point. Williamson c R Tripathi b Unadkat 14(10) [4s-2]

Shreyas Gopal to Shankar, out Caught by (sub)Chopra!! He's mistimed this loft and long-on swallows the ball. This is an area Shankar has to work on. He gets set, looks so good, but throws it away. It's something that will be on his mind. Lovely googly from Shreyas Gopal, gave it a lot of air, Shankar wanted a maximum, but the bat turned in his hands on impact with the ball and the timing was messed. Anyway, such a good innings from Shankar. Shankar c (sub)Chopra b Shreyas Gopal 35(15) [4s-1 6s-3]

Shreyas Gopal to Manish Pandey, out Lbw!! Appeal and given. Shreyas Gopal wins the Karnataka battle and he's on a hat-trick. Pandey knew he was plumb, didn't bother reviewing. The googly from the bowler, Pandey was lunging forward in his defence, ball hits the pad first and then the bat. Impact in line and it would have crashed into leg at least. Middle and leg according to HawkEye. Manish Pandey lbw b Shreyas Gopal 1(4)

Stokes to Warner, out Caught by D Kulkarni! When Warner departs in an away venue, you can hear the combined sound of a city sighing in relief - but at home, you can hear a pin drop. Bangs it in short this time, Warner gets under it by shuffling across to hook, gets a bit of a top-edge and spoons a catch to Kulkarni at the fine leg boundary! The God of Carnage departs. Warner c D Kulkarni b Stokes 69(37) [4s-9 6s-2]

Krunal Pandya to Agarwal, out Caught&Bowled!! An excellent innings from Agarwal comes to an end. He is a disappointed, looks upwards after giving the catch. It was a flatter one on the stumps and Agarwal smashes it straight back to the bowler. It was hit at a ferocious pace and Krunal Pandya did really well to grab the catch. He takes off the bails at the non striker's end too, not sure why. Agarwal c and b Krunal Pandya 43(21) [4s-4 6s-2]

Krunal Pandya to Gayle, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Pandya brothers come together to get rid of the Universe Boss! This is excellent captaincy from Rohit. He was brave enough to bring his left-arm spinner against Gayle and the man from Baroda hasn't disappointed him. It was wide of off and Gayle wanted to clobber it down the ground. Doesn't get it off the sweet spot and it went a long way up in the air. Hardik at long-on takes it with ease in the end. It wasn't the easiest of catches. Gayle c Hardik Pandya b Krunal Pandya 40(24) [4s-3 6s-4]

Shami to de Kock, out Lbw!! Much-needed breakthrough for KXIP. de Kock was getting into overdrive and this shot perhaps, was a result of that. Premeditated by walking across the stumps and Shami did the basics right, full and straight. de Kock couldn't connect the sweep and once he got hit on the pad, it was always going to be out. The umpire felt so too and although the South African opted for the DRS, there was nothing on UltraEdge to save him. Three Reds on HawkEye to compound the misery and MI have lost the review. Excellent innings nevertheless. de Kock lbw b Shami 60(39) [4s-6 6s-2]

Murugan Ashwin to Yuvraj, out Caught by Shami!! This was coming - Yuvraj was being tied down and he falls while trying for that big hit - picked the wrong 'un as he went down on the sweep, couldn't roll his wrists over and ended up swiping it in the air. Shami was the man running across to his right from deep backward square leg, gets himself into a good position and holds on. MI are stuttering once again in the middle overs. Yuvraj c Shami b Murugan Ashwin 18(22) [4s-2]

Tye to Pollard, out Caught by Agarwal!! That's a high catch and Mayank has judged it to perfection at long-off. 'This went to the moon and came back' chirps Danny Morrison on air. Pollard got this one very high and it took an age to come down - but it looked like it didn't have enough legs to clear the fielder, Mayank was the man under it, he held his cool, waited for the ball to arrive and pouched it with both hands. The knuckle ball and Pollard didn't spot, was way too early on the lofted drive - plenty of height but not the distance. Pollard c Agarwal b Tye 7(9)

Viljoen to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Murugan Ashwin!! That's a good wicket at this stage of the innings - Krunal was opening up, but Viljoen has his man. Short and angling down the leg-side, Krunal was looking to help it on its way with the shovel - didn't get hold of the shot and popped it in the air over square leg. Murugan Ashwin ran across to his left from the deep and completed the catch with soft hands. Krunal Pandya c Murugan Ashwin b Viljoen 10(5) [4s-2]

Shami to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Mandeep!! That's the end of Hardik, but he has played another fine hand for his team. Short and just outside off, he got into a good position on the pull, but doesn't get hold of the shot. Went high and straight into the hands of mandeep - who was standing in front of the ropes at mid-wicket. Hardik has his bat on his shoulder as he walks away in disappointment. Hardik Pandya c Mandeep b Shami 31(19) [4s-3 6s-1]

Viljoen to Rohit, out Lbw!! Massive strike from Viljoen! Rohit was looking ominous and if KXIP needed him gone, it was right here right now and that's exactly what the South African has done. Must say it wasn't a great shot from the MI skipper, stood rooted on the crease to an extremely full in-angler, attempted to just slog across the line, only to get struck on the back leg. Looked plumb in real time itself unless there was an inside edge but there wasn't. Rohit lbw b Viljoen 32(18) [4s-5]

Murugan Ashwin to Suryakumar Yadav, out Lbw!! The other Ashwin gets into the act! Just two balls to take the wicket and it's another vital one as Yadav can be dangerous. This was slider and kept a trifle low perhaps as he tried to whip-pull across the line. Once he missed it, there was no doubt on the LBW. As plumb as it gets and Yadav knew it too as he continued the walk to the dugout. Suryakumar Yadav lbw b Murugan Ashwin 11(6) [4s-2]

A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Catching confusion. Gill - in redemption - has done a Dinesh Karthik, plucking pretty much one he would've been forgiven for putting down after dropping one he couldn't have been forgiven for. Iyer whips again, airily, Gill, at cow corner's boundary goes reverse cupped right at the edge over his head. But, but, is his foot touching the cushions? The umpires aren't taking a chance, they go up. And gee, this is really tight. The soft signal wins - OUT. Shreyas Iyer c Shubman Gill b A Russell 43(32) [4s-4 6s-2]

Kuldeep Yadav to Pant, out Caught by Chawla!! Miss. Miss. Connect. And when he does, it picks out the man in the deep. Pant refuses to ditch his failed slog sweep from a ball earlier, goes through but Kuldeep very smartly has dragged his length back on this one, making Pant eventually go one-handed in his followthrough. Miscued severely, to deep mid-wicket. Pant c Chawla b Kuldeep Yadav 11(15) [4s-1]

Ferguson to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Karthik!! Kotla heartbreak. A quicker bumper, Shaw can't resist, but for once doesn't find his bat's middle. Big fat top-edge, ballooning high, where DK calls, and nearly makes a mess under the skier, eventually having to take his tummy's help in holding on. So Shaw may have missed out on becoming the youngest IPL centurion, but he becomes the second in these 12 seasons to get out on 99. It's all about getting into trivia books after all, right?! Prithvi Shaw c Karthik b Ferguson 99(55) [4s-12 6s-3]

Kuldeep Yadav to Hanuma Vihari, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! It will twist, ever so slowly, but it will twist. Short, skiddy, heaved, and it's straight down deep mid-wicket's throat. The favourites have turned, clearly. Hanuma Vihari c Shubman Gill b Kuldeep Yadav 2(3)

Chawla to Dhawan, out Caught by A Russell!! Gone! One shot too many from the southpaw. KKR have got their early wicket. He cleared mid-off a couple of deliveries ago but not this time. He advances and once more gets very close to the ball, spoons the loft straight into the bucket hands of Russell at mid-off. Dhawan c A Russell b Chawla 16(8) [4s-2 6s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Ingram, out Ingram Run Out!! 1 run completed. Swipes behind square. And he runs. He HAS TO. Beats short fine leg. But all his desperation is good enough for a single. Uthappa swooped in there, and capped it with a flat throw at the striker's. And DK turns the lights up .. SUPER OVER. Oh Kolkata have stolen this, right under Delhi's nose. Ingram run out (Uthappa/Karthik) 10(7) [4s-1]

Chris Morris to A Russell, out Caught by (sub)Rahul Tewatia!! A collision between the fielders but more importantly the catch is taken. A brutal innings from Russell comes to an end. He's put his side in the ascendancy here. The slower short of length delivery and Russell was a tad early into the pull shot, the top-edge flew up towards deep square leg and Tewatia ran in to catch it. Rabada was the one who collided as he ran back from short fine with his eyes on the ball. A Russell c (sub)Rahul Tewatia b Chris Morris 62(28) [4s-4 6s-6]

Mishra to Karthik, out Caught by Pant!! He walks! Some respite for Mishra, who has taken a beating in this over. This would have been a wide had Karthik let go but instead he goes chasing after it. The leg-break trying to keep it away from the batsman's range, but DK reaches out and feathers an outside edge to Pant. He does not even wait for the umpire to raise his finger. Karthik c Pant b Mishra 50(36) [4s-5 6s-2]

Rabada to Chawla, out Chawla Run Out!! 1 run completed. Confusion and it results in a run out. Chawla mistimes the loft towards long-on and he was never interested in the second, Kuldeep pushed for it and Chawla decided to go, but the batsmen didn't cross each other when Rabada removed the bails which means Chawla was the one to be dismissed. Chawla run out (Dhawan/Rabada) 12(5) [4s-1 6s-1]

Lamichhane to Nikhil Naik, out Lbw!! Nikhil Naik's struggle comes to an end. Walks back after consuming 16 deliveries for his 7. Scored a boundary that too off an inside edge. Hard luck. Was the wrong 'un around middle and the batsman got beaten due to the googly. Struck in front of middle and going on to hit the leg-stump. Lamichanne makes an impact in his first game of the season. Nikhil Naik lbw b Lamichhane 7(16) [4s-1]

Harshal Patel to Uthappa, out Lbw!! That's P.L.U.M.B! If that's not out, nothing else can be. Patel outfoxes Robbie with the off-cutter. He was looking to flick across the line but he gets beaten due to the lack of pace. Struck in front of middle and it would have crashed into middle and leg. Middle, probably. No reviews left and even if there was one, it wouldn't have made a difference. Uthappa lbw b Harshal Patel 11(6) [4s-2]

Rabada to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Pant!! That's a terrific catch by Pant. Is there anything, he can't do? Flies to his left and plucks this one with his left glove. Knight Riders in trouble with three of their top-order batsmen back to the hut. A short delivery down the leg side and Chris Lynn gets a glove as he looks to play the pull shot. The run rate is well under 6 at the moment. Can they stitch in a partnership? Chris Lynn c Pant b Rabada 20(18) [4s-3]

Harshal Patel to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Rabada!! Wickets continue to tumble at the Kotla. KKR struggling big time in their first away game of the season. Patel bags his second wicket! This was a back of a length delivery down the leg side and Nitish Rana flicks it straight to fine leg. The ball flew of the blade and Rabada in the deep took a well judged catch running to his right. 44/4 stands the score. The crowd at Delhi is lovin' it. Nitish Rana c Rabada b Harshal Patel 1(2)

Lamichhane to Shubman Gill, out Shubman Gill Run Out!! 2 runs completed. KKR sink further! Not their day, perhaps. All credit to Rabada though, he dived full stretch to his left after he sprinted across from sweeper cover. Gill had square driven it through point and was expecting a boundary but is denied that due to some brilliance it the field. KG had parried the ball to Patel in the deep and the throw came in at the bowler's end. The batsman was ball watching while going for the third run and has to pay the price for it. Shubman Gill run out (Harshal Patel/Lamichhane) 4(5)

Sandeep Sharma to Prayas Barman, out Caught by Hooda!! Sandeep Sharma foxes the young Barman with a knuckle ball but he's showed his skills with the bat. It was full and Barman was early into the shot, ends up chipping it Hooda at short mid-wicket, who takes the sitter. The spirited partnership has been broken and RCB have lost their seventh wicket. Prayas Barman c Hooda b Sandeep Sharma 19(24) [4s-2]

Shankar to U Yadav, no run. Bairstow appeals but umpire S Ravi signals it a wide. The wicket-keeper has a word with his bowler and the captain, off they go for a review. Nothing wrong with the front foot and there's a certain deflection but I think it's come off the trousers. Clearly missed the bat and it's a smart review from SRH because S Ravi changes his decision about the wide and it's deemed a legitimate delivery. Full and nipping down leg, Umesh lines up for the swipe and it brushes his trousers on the way to the keeper

Rashid Khan to de Grandhomme, out U Yadav Run Out!! 1 run completed. This is suicidal. Chipped away towards sweeper cover and Grandhomme wanted the second. Just went through without looking at his partner who was busy ball-watching. They stumbled mid-pitch and Umesh eventually paid the price. Vijay Shankar fires a clean throw to Rashid, who waits before dislodging the bails. Umesh was not even in the frame and this sums up RCB's day. U Yadav run out (Shankar/Rashid Khan) 14(9) [4s-1 6s-1]

Shankar to Siraj, no ball, out de Grandhomme Run Out!! Low full toss outside off, Siraj drives it to extra cover and went for the single. Grandhomme took a few yards before backing out. Both batsmen tries to return back to the crease and the throw from the fielder comes to the non striker's end. The Kiwi all-round was pretty lazy in grounding his bat and Shankar breaks the stumps to catch him short of his crease. There was also another run-out chance at the striker's end as Siraj was struggling to make his ground. Shankar lasers the throw to Bairstow, who ends up crashing into the stumps. Total confusion there. Phew! de Grandhomme run out (Bhuvneshwar/Shankar) 37(32) [4s-3 6s-2]

Sandeep Sharma to Chahal, out Caught by Hooda!! End of RCB's misery. Chahal surrenders. Short delivery, too pacy and Chahal went for the pull, launches it into the night sky as far as mid-wicket. Hooda cups it easily and that's the game in the bag for SRH. Chahal c Hooda b Sandeep Sharma 1(3)

Nabi to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! That's a gift from Parthiv and Manish takes it with glee - a low full-toss from Nabi, Parthiv backed away as he looked to clear the infield - doesn't get hold of the shot and pops it straight to cover. Not the start RCB wanted - their little pocket dynamo falls early. Parthiv Patel c Manish Pandey b Nabi 11(8) [4s-2]

Nabi to Hetmyer, out Stumped!! One shot too many and Nabi has two-in-two. He's on a hat-trick now. Gave his intentions away quite early, came charging down the pitch, allowed Nabi to shorten his length - once past the swinging blade of Hetmyer, there was no coming back. Quick work from Bairstow and Hetmyer is well short of his ground. Hetmyer st Bairstow b Nabi 9(9) [6s-1]

Nabi to de Villiers, out Bowled!! Nabi is running through RCB single-handedly - the dangerous AB falls and the Banglaore franchise are in a mess. Lovely loopy delivery on off, dragged AB forward as he looked to go inside out over cover, the ball drifted away and then dipped past the outside edge - clatters into the stumps and that's the end of AB - End of RCB? Think so. de Villiers b Nabi 1(2)

Sandeep Sharma to Kohli, out Caught by Warner!! If it wasn't over, it's definitely over now. Kohli falls and RCB are staring at humiliation. Length ball and it was there to be smacked - Kohli leant into the drive and drilled it towards cover - didn't bother to keep it down - straight into the hands of Warner who made it look easy - a head-high catch and he clasps it with ease. The misery continues for RCB. Kohli c Warner b Sandeep Sharma 3(10)

Sandeep Sharma to Shivam Dube, out Moeen Ali Run Out!! Make it five down now. I'm pretty sure that Moeen is short of his ground, his bat is in the air and he already looks downcast. Well short, Moeen is OUT. Oh dear, RCB are batting and now running like senseless chickens. On a good length and just outside off, Dube clipped it towards mid-wicket and took a start, that prompted Moeen Ali to make a dash, sent back late - too late though - Nabi shies and misses, sandeep has time to break the stumps with the batsman well short. Moeen Ali run out (Nabi/Sandeep Sharma) 2(8)

Nabi to Shivam Dube, out Caught by Hooda!! It's getting worse and worse for RCB. Nabi is having a dream spell as he picks up his fourth wicket. Dube had a chance to prove his mettle but he just miscues one into the hands of long-on. Nothing shot really and the nightmare continues for the visitors. It was flighted just outside off and kind of held up on the pitch, Dube was deluded by the flight as he went after it and could only succeed in finding Hooda. Shivam Dube c Hooda b Nabi 5(7) [4s-1]

Chahal to Bairstow, out Caught by U Yadav!! There's the wicket for RCB - ends an outstanding knock from Bairstow. It's not a no-ball, so Chahal can relax, the leg-break, slower and turning away from off, Bairstow was down on his knees as he hoicked, gets a thick top-edge, it looped in the air and looked like was falling short of backward point. Umesh charged in athletically, dived forward with both hands and holds on. A standing ovation as Bairstow walks away. Bairstow c U Yadav b Chahal 114(56) [4s-12 6s-7]

Siraj to Warner, out Shankar Run Out!! 1 run completed. Has Vijay Shankar run himself out? Has the dive saved him, NO - he's well short and RCB have a second wicket. Warner got lucky, but his partner wasn't. Siraj followed Warner as he backed away, induced a thick outside edge on the heave - was in the air for a long time, but dropped right in between AB - who was running back from cover and Hetmyer - running in from long-off. Shankar wanted the second run, but didn't spot that his partner wasn't coming back - stranded in the middle, he made a dash towards his end, put in the dive, but all in vain. Shankar run out (Hetmyer/Parthiv Patel) 9(3) [6s-1]

Unadkat to Raina, out Bowled!! The partnership has been broken. Unadkat yells out a loud roar. Change of pace does the trick. Fullish ball at 116.5kph, Raina backed away a long way and exposed all his stumps. The southpaw didn't pick the slower one and wafted his bat at it, probably looking to go over the covers. Connected with thin air and the ball smashed into the sticks. Raina b Unadkat 36(32) [4s-4 6s-1]

Jofra Archer to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught by D Kulkarni!! Bravo perishes trying to play a good shot. Archer banged it in short at 132kph and Bravo went through with his pull shot despite not being in a good position to play it. The top-edge balloons up and settles into the safe hands of long-on. He went too hard and in the process lost his shape. Dwayne Bravo c D Kulkarni b Jofra Archer 27(16) [4s-3 6s-1]

Jofra Archer to Rayudu, out Caught by Buttler!! 0.0.0.0.0 and Rayudu - injured forearm and all - can't stay patient any longer. Archer stays quick on a back of a length, but it sticks on the surface as it kicks up, making a real mess of Rayudu's attempted upper-steer to third man. All he gets is a thick feather on the outside edge, straight to the keeper. Rayudu c Buttler b Jofra Archer 1(8)

Stokes to Watson, out Caught by Jofra Archer!! Short again. And this time Watson can't resist not poking. He goes back in the crease, goes up tall and tries half a cut, half a punch, and a full flirt after getting tied up with the zip in. Ends up with a thick outside splice, flying straight to the fine short third man placed perfectly out there. Watson c Jofra Archer b Stokes 13(13) [4s-1 6s-1]

D Kulkarni to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by Buttler!! A wide innocuos delivery does what all the variations haven't. It's full, way outside off and Jadhav stretches out to drive. Hard. The problem though are his feet, which are stuck in the crease, just not getting close as he ends up getting a fat outside edge. And Chennai are officially on a top-order collapse. Kedar Jadhav c Buttler b D Kulkarni 8(3) [4s-2]

Chahar to Rahane, out Caught by Jadeja!! Ideal start for the hosts. A corker from Jaddu at backward point. Another outswinger and Rahane drives with hard hands. Only gets an outside edge that dips as it approached the backward point fielder. Don't think many would have taken it. But, Jadeja is one of the best fielders in world cricket. He swoops forward and takes a diving catch inches above the ground. Rahane asked the fielder and decided to walk off. But, the umpires wanted to be 100% sure and hence went upstairs. Legal ball and a clean catch. A 2-ball duck for the Rajasthan skipper. Rahane c Jadeja b Chahar 0(2)

Tahir to R Tripathi, out Caught&Bowled!! It's a leading edge, and taken! The cross-seamed leg-break, fired in full @90ks, full and outside off, Tripathi tries to get forward and flick it away against the spin, gets a leading edge back to the bowler who throws it right up into the humid skies in glee to see the back of Tripathi. An important partnership broken, and the aggressor, Tripathi, departs. R Tripathi c and b Tahir 39(24) [4s-5 6s-1]

Tahir to Smith, out Caught by (sub)Shorey! GONE! That's a key wicket! The leg-break, very full, Smith charges down the track, feeling the pRRRessure, and takes it on the full - tries lofting it straight into the sightscreen, but literally plays right into the hands of Shorey at the long-off boundary. Tahir is thrilled to bits. He knows how important this wicket is. Smith c (sub)Shorey b Tahir 28(30) [4s-2]

SN Thakur to Gowtham, out Caught by Raina! GONE! A very full one outside off, Gowtham, in a bid to up the ante, throws it all behind that carve over cover, ends up scooping it towards Raina at cover, who picks up yet another catch for himself. RR's morale is inversely proportional to the RRR. Six down. Gowtham c Raina b SN Thakur 9(8) [6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Stokes, out Caught by Raina! GONE! Let the DJ's party begin. Off he goes, on his turntable - a yorker length delivery on off, Stokes tries getting under his, with the bottom-hand dominating, scoops it, gets his wrists over it, and Raina is waiting at cover - straight to him, and he holds on to yet another low catch today. A pressure catch! A key wicket, this, and this is going to be interesting. Surely, not another late-night/early-morning super-over. Stokes c Raina b Dwayne Bravo 46(26) [4s-1 6s-3]

Dwayne Bravo to Shreyas Gopal, out Caught by Tahir! The Yellow Army explodes! Another one @130.7km/h, on a length and angling into the body, Shreyas Gopal clears his leg and backs away going for a wild heave, gets a massive top-edge towards third man where Tahir gets under the pressure catch - pouches it and sets off on a celebratory run. Shreyas Gopal c Tahir b Dwayne Bravo 0(3)

Chahar to Samson, out Caught by Raina!! The centurion in the previous game is gone! A 134.1kph fullish ball outside off and Samson threw his bat at it. The bottom hand comes off the handle and hence the miscue. Raina takes a sharp catch bending forward, but Samson stands his ground. The on-field umpires send it upstairs with OUT being the soft decision. An easy one for the TV umpire as Raina had both his palms underneath the ball. Samson c Raina b Chahar 8(10) [4s-1]

SN Thakur to Buttler, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! Rajasthan Royals lose their best batter and are in deep trouble. A fuller-than-a-good-length ball on the stumps and Buttler wanted to bash it over mid-on. The ball might have held up into the wicket and that robbed the batter's timing. The bat turned at the point of impact and Buttler ended up slicing it over mid-off. Bravo takes a couple of steps backwards and snaffles it with ease. Buttler c Dwayne Bravo b SN Thakur 6(7) [4s-1]

Chris Morris to Rahul, out Lbw! Rahul's been given LBW! He's gone for a review straightaway! Now that the umpire has given it out, I think this is clipping leg. Just a hunch. A full delivery angling into the pads, he's missed a juicy half-volley, attempting a cross-batted flick. Pitching in line, hitting him in line, and clipping the leg-stump. Yep, I was right - not for the first time (wink) - it's the umpire's call taking a toll again as the batting side are left with the consolation prize of a retained review. Rahul lbw b Chris Morris 15(11) [4s-2 6s-1]

Lamichhane to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by Pant!! Gone! That is the problem with Sarfaraz. He will give you those cute little 30s and 40s but never a man for a big innings. Nothing but a leg-break with a hint of turn, Sarfaraz stays flat-footed and has a poke at it, very casual in his approach and the ball finds a feather of the outside edge. Pant does well to hold on to the catch as it almost popped out. Sarfaraz Khan c Pant b Lamichhane 39(29) [4s-6]

Chris Morris to Miller, out Caught by Pant!! And Morris wins the battle.. Huge wicket at this stage. Miller shuffled across and aimed to go across the line, Morris cleverly rolled his fingers across the ball, the top-edge went straight up and Pant settled under it. Punjab have kept losing wickets at the wrong time today. Miller c Pant b Chris Morris 43(30) [4s-4 6s-2]

Rabada to Viljoen, out Caught by Chris Morris!! Punjab's innings is coming apart. Rabada is just too good for Viljoen. Short of length and climbs up awkwardly onto the batsman, Viljoen tries to turn it into the leg-side but only manages a leading edge to cover. Morris completes the dolly. The umpire checks for front foot error but Rabada is fine. Viljoen c Chris Morris b Rabada 1(3)

Chris Morris to Ashwin, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! It has all gone downward in the last 20 minutes or so. Morris picks up his third. A juicy full toss and Ashwin could have hit it anywhere, he backs away and is beaten for pace, the ball brushes the off-stump to light it up. Ashwin b Chris Morris 3(4)

Rabada to Murugan Ashwin, out Caught by Avesh Khan!! Collision, a pop out and taken in the end. Pant and Avesh almost made a meal of it. Rabada sees the funny side of it. Ashwin wanted to heave it into the cow corner fence and the top-edge went straight up towards point, Pant ran across even as Avesh steadied himself under it, the ball hit Pant's gloves and then popped up, Avesh was the first to react and he claims the catch. Murugan Ashwin c Avesh Khan b Rabada 1(2)

Rabada to Shami, out Shami Run Out!! Shami is made to sacrifice his wicket. Short ball at the body, Shami takes his eyes off as he aims to pull, the ball hits him on the shoulder and drops down, Mandeep races to the other end and Shami just crosses him to ensure he's out. Rabada does the easy part of collecting the ball, walking back and removing one bail. Shami run out (Rabada) 0(1)

Lamichhane to Sam Curran, out Lbw! Doesn't even wait to review! Angles it across after pitching in on leg and middle, straightens, does the leg-spinner, and Sam Curran is trapped on the backfoot, trying to tuck across the line - but the whippy action and the lack of backspin means that it will hurry on and he is trapped in front. He's on his way back after an impressive cameo up top. Sam Curran lbw b Lamichhane 20(10) [4s-3 6s-1]

Harshal Patel to Sarfaraz Khan, out Agarwal Run Out! Already a slower one @116.8km/h on a good length, Sarfaraz Khan delays a transfer-of-weight punch to Dhawan, and Agarwal tries to recover after backing up, but a direct-hit from Dhawan (and a thigh slap to follow it up) with one stump to aim at, has sent Agarwal packing! Fantastic throw by Dhawan, and certainly nothing iffy about that dismissal, with KXIP on the receiving end this time. Just a moment of brilliance. Agarwal run out (Dhawan) 6(9)

Chris Morris to Rahul, out Lbw! Rahul's been given LBW! He's gone for a review straightaway! Now that the umpire has given it out, I think this is clipping leg. Just a hunch. A full delivery angling into the pads, he's missed a juicy half-volley, attempting a cross-batted flick. Pitching in line, hitting him in line, and clipping the leg-stump. Yep, I was right - not for the first time (wink) - it's the umpire's call taking a toll again as the batting side are left with the consolation prize of a retained review. Rahul lbw b Chris Morris 15(11) [4s-2 6s-1]

Lamichhane to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by Pant!! Gone! That is the problem with Sarfaraz. He will give you those cute little 30s and 40s but never a man for a big innings. Nothing but a leg-break with a hint of turn, Sarfaraz stays flat-footed and has a poke at it, very casual in his approach and the ball finds a feather of the outside edge. Pant does well to hold on to the catch as it almost popped out. Sarfaraz Khan c Pant b Lamichhane 39(29) [4s-6]

Chris Morris to Miller, out Caught by Pant!! And Morris wins the battle.. Huge wicket at this stage. Miller shuffled across and aimed to go across the line, Morris cleverly rolled his fingers across the ball, the top-edge went straight up and Pant settled under it. Punjab have kept losing wickets at the wrong time today. Miller c Pant b Chris Morris 43(30) [4s-4 6s-2]

Rabada to Viljoen, out Caught by Chris Morris!! Punjab's innings is coming apart. Rabada is just too good for Viljoen. Short of length and climbs up awkwardly onto the batsman, Viljoen tries to turn it into the leg-side but only manages a leading edge to cover. Morris completes the dolly. The umpire checks for front foot error but Rabada is fine. Viljoen c Chris Morris b Rabada 1(3)

Chris Morris to Ashwin, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! It has all gone downward in the last 20 minutes or so. Morris picks up his third. A juicy full toss and Ashwin could have hit it anywhere, he backs away and is beaten for pace, the ball brushes the off-stump to light it up. Ashwin b Chris Morris 3(4)

Rabada to Murugan Ashwin, out Caught by Avesh Khan!! Collision, a pop out and taken in the end. Pant and Avesh almost made a meal of it. Rabada sees the funny side of it. Ashwin wanted to heave it into the cow corner fence and the top-edge went straight up towards point, Pant ran across even as Avesh steadied himself under it, the ball hit Pant's gloves and then popped up, Avesh was the first to react and he claims the catch. Murugan Ashwin c Avesh Khan b Rabada 1(2)

Rabada to Shami, out Shami Run Out!! Shami is made to sacrifice his wicket. Short ball at the body, Shami takes his eyes off as he aims to pull, the ball hits him on the shoulder and drops down, Mandeep races to the other end and Shami just crosses him to ensure he's out. Rabada does the easy part of collecting the ball, walking back and removing one bail. Shami run out (Rabada) 0(1)

Lamichhane to Sam Curran, out Lbw! Doesn't even wait to review! Angles it across after pitching in on leg and middle, straightens, does the leg-spinner, and Sam Curran is trapped on the backfoot, trying to tuck across the line - but the whippy action and the lack of backspin means that it will hurry on and he is trapped in front. He's on his way back after an impressive cameo up top. Sam Curran lbw b Lamichhane 20(10) [4s-3 6s-1]

Harshal Patel to Sarfaraz Khan, out Agarwal Run Out! Already a slower one @116.8km/h on a good length, Sarfaraz Khan delays a transfer-of-weight punch to Dhawan, and Agarwal tries to recover after backing up, but a direct-hit from Dhawan (and a thigh slap to follow it up) with one stump to aim at, has sent Agarwal packing! Fantastic throw by Dhawan, and certainly nothing iffy about that dismissal, with KXIP on the receiving end this time. Just a moment of brilliance. Agarwal run out (Dhawan) 6(9)

Shreyas Gopal to Hetmyer, out Caught by Buttler!! Gopal is on fire. Third wicket and all big ones. Hetmyer's struggles in IPL continue.. RCB in a spot of bother now. The wrong 'un spinning across the left hander, Hetmyer stays back and has a tentative poke at that, feathers an outside edge and Buttler does the rest behind the wicket. That is 9 wickets in 3 games now for Gopal against RCB. Hetmyer c Buttler b Shreyas Gopal 1(9)

Jofra Archer to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Rahane!! Gone! But Parthiv has done more than his job. A fine knock from the 'keeper. Slower delivery at 125.4ks and Parthiv does not have the power to clear this big boundaries, he still goes through and makes a decent connection, holes out just in front of the long-on rope. Parthiv Patel c Rahane b Jofra Archer 67(41) [4s-9 6s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, out Bowled!! No need to appeal for this - a corker from Gopal and he has got rid of the RCB and India captain - A loose shot from Kohli, another wrong 'un and he didn't read it, lazily pressed forward on the drive - big gap between bat and pad and the ball found its way through, crashed into the off and middle stump and Kohli has to go. Not the most convincing of knocks from the captain - 23 off 25 is plain average at this level. Replays suggested a thin inside edge. Kohli b Shreyas Gopal 23(25) [4s-3]

Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, out Caught&Bowled!! Gopal got rid of Kohli, he now gets rid of AB - this is simply sublime stuff from the Karnataka leg-spinner - and he's doing all the damage to his home based franchise. Another wrong 'un, think AB read as he went back, stayed a bit low and that meant the ball caught the leading edge on the flick. It was dying down on the bowler who does remarkably well to dive forward and grab it. After the fine start, RCB have lost their two big guns. de Villiers c and b Shreyas Gopal 13(9) [4s-2]

Chahal to Buttler, out Caught by Stoinis!! Second wicket for Chahal. Needless from Buttler. The asking rate is under control and he wants to go after RCB's best bowler. Pays the price for doing so. Smart bowling from Chahal, though. A slow, tossed up ball outside off, which spun further away from the right-handed batsman. Buttler decides to thump it over long-off, miscues and Stoinis takes a calm catch well in front of the boundary ropes. Buttler c Stoinis b Chahal 59(43) [4s-8 6s-1]

Siraj to Smith, out Caught by U Yadav!! Siraj bowls length outside off, Smith clears his front leg and backs himself to clear the fence. Doesn't get the timing right and spoons a simple catch to Umesh at long-on. Smith c U Yadav b Siraj 38(31) [4s-2 6s-1]

Chahal to Rahane, out Lbw!! Chahal strikes. Gets the breakthrough for RCB which should give them some respite. Googly, spinning in and Rahane was trying to make room to cut. Was late to get his bat down and fails to read it. It thuds him on the pad - in-line with the stumps. Total misjudgement from the RR skipper, looked plumb straightaway and the umpire was spot on. Would've crashed into the middle stump. Rahane knew that he was in trouble and didn't bother it review it. Rahane lbw b Chahal 22(20) [4s-4]

Behrendorff to Rayudu, out Caught by de Kock!! There's a noise and Rayudu's gone. His poor form continues and it's a first-baller for the opener. But what a corker from Behrendorff this was. Pounded it short, sprang up like a spitting Cobra after hitting the deck just outside off. Rayudu was just pushing his bat forward aiming to defend. Scary extra bounce scraps the shoulder of the bat and carries to QDK. Behrendorff is elated and Mumbai have struck early. Rayudu c de Kock b Behrendorff 0(1)

Malinga to Watson, out Caught by Pollard!! In the air and taken. Straight to Pollard at cover-point, who juggles a bit and holds onto it. Both openers back in the shed for CSK and it's been a wonderful start for Mumbai. Short and well wide of off, Watson cuts and doesn't keep it down. Hits it airly and finds Pollard, who leaps and it bobbled out of his hands, but he keeps his calm and grabs it on the second attempt. Wankhede explodes.. Watson c Pollard b Malinga 5(6) [4s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Dhoni, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Dhoni departs! Never got going today and with the required rate soaring, he had to take a risk. Tries but doesn't work. Stepped out in a premeditated manner and Hardik smartly dug it short, at the body, cramping MS completely. The result is a forced pull and it's aerial too. Dolly for Surya at square leg. Massive dent to CSK's already fading chances in the game. Dhoni c Suryakumar Yadav b Hardik Pandya 12(21)

Hardik Pandya to Jadeja, out Caught by de Kock!! Second in the over for Hardik! What a game he is having! A blitzing cameo earlier in the night and now two strikes with the ball. Pounded this on the hard length with good pace, Jadeja was backing away for the slash but got done in by the speed. Too late and gets a healthy nick that's pouched by a beaming de Kock. Wheels coming off for CSK. Not far away from hearing the fat lady sing. Jadeja c de Kock b Hardik Pandya 1(2)

Malinga to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by de Kock!! Jadhav's defiance ends. Fought hard but with this kind of a target, he needed support which he never got. Slower ball from Malinga and Jadhav went for a wild heave across the line. Only manages a thin feather through to de Kock who is having a good time behind the sticks. Kedar Jadhav c de Kock b Malinga 58(54) [4s-8 6s-1]

Malinga to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught by de Kock!! Stunner from QDK! Brilliance from the South African and that's the end of a forgettable night for Bravo. Made room for the big shot but this was in the blockhole, cramped him as well and he got a faint inside edge. De Kock was initially blinded, as keepers usually are in such a scenario, but reacted sharply with a two-handed diving catch to his left. Excellent work indeed and that's the third of the night for Malinga. Dwayne Bravo c de Kock b Malinga 8(9) [6s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Chahar, out Caught by Bumrah!! Another one bites the dust. The hard length has done the trick many a time on this pitch tonight and here is another example of it. Well-directed pacy bumper and Chahar gets into a tangle on the pull after having backed away early. Gets a top edge towards deep backward square leg where Bumrah takes a running catch, having covered decent ground from fine leg. Chahar c Bumrah b Hardik Pandya 7(7) [4s-1]

Behrendorff to Raina, out Caught by Pollard!! Oh my word! There's that customary stunner from Pollard for the season. His batting form may have dipped but not his fielding and catching. This is smart field placement from Rohit and Behrendorff executed it well. Dug it short and offered width, Raina forgets there's a fielder at sweeper cover. Slashed it on the up and Pollard was waiting for it. Though he kind of charged in a bit early, he made sure he kept his calm and stretched his giant right hand to nonchalantly grab it. Dives and thumps his chest towards the MI fans in the stands. Blinder from the big man and CSK in trouble now. Raina c Pollard b Behrendorff 16(15) [4s-2 6s-1]

Mohit Sharma to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Jadeja!! A scratchy innings from Krunal Pandya comes to an end. But it was an important innings. It was a slower one on a length, Krunal Pandya wanted to clobber it to the on-side. He swings it down the wrong line, it clips the outside half of the bat and was in the air for a long time. Jadeja at long-on comes under it and takes it with utmost ease. Krunal Pandya c Jadeja b Mohit Sharma 42(32) [4s-5 6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Jadeja!! A brilliant innings from Surya comes to an end. His knock has ensured that Mumbai reach close to the par score on this wicket. He fails to get under the yorker, but still goes through with the hit. Ends up skying it in the air and Jadeja at long-on makes no mistake. Suryakumar Yadav c Jadeja b Dwayne Bravo 59(43) [4s-8 6s-1]

Chahar to de Kock, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! He does it again, Chahar! Bowls tight, builds pressure and forces the mistake. Such as asset he's turned out to be for Dhoni and Co. This is an inswinging short of length delivery, de Kock wanted to smash this to the mid-wicket boundary as the runs weren't coming, the bat turned in his hands as he slogged at this and it went straight to square leg. Chahar roars in delight. Mind you, QdK is in great form and it's not easy to keep him calm. de Kock c Kedar Jadhav b Chahar 4(7) [4s-1]

Jadeja to Rohit, out Caught by Dhoni!! What a start for Jadeja. Gets a faint edge and Dhoni manages to cling on. Flighted delivery pitching on the off stump and spinning away sharply, Rohit tried defending but the feet were stuck in the crease. Dhoni made no mistake and also checked the bails off to be doubly sure about the dismissal as Ro was close with his back foot in the crease. Tough catch because the ball almost shaved the off stump as well. Oh they are checking for the no-ball, Raina blocks the side angle from deep cover, but the other angle shows a very minute portion of the heel to be behind the crease when Jadeja landed. Third umpire is convinced and it will be OUT. A sluggish start from Rohit, he needs to be a lot more positive as an opener. Rohit c Dhoni b Jadeja 13(18) [4s-1]

Tahir to Yuvraj, out Caught by Rayudu!! Tahir takes off on his celebratory run. Fullish delivery outside off stump, Yuvraj lofts looking for a six, targetted the long-off region, but Rayudu was stationed perfectly under it. He was very close to the rope, but did exceedingly well to balance himself just inside the boundary. Umps check with the third umpire with the soft signal being OUT, replays confirmed it was a clean catch. Yuvraj c Rayudu b Tahir 4(6)

Sandeep Sharma to Rahul Tewatia, out Caught by Nabi!! Gone! The promotion does not work out for Delhi. Another knuckle and this time there is no bounce to save Tewatia, he is completely fooled by it and just leaves his bat hanging in front, the ball pops towards cover and Nabi completes the dolly. Rahul Tewatia c Nabi b Sandeep Sharma 5(7) [4s-1]

S Kaul to Ingram, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Pandey has his man this time. Missed the direct hit but makes up with a terrific catch. Delhi slip further as the experienced Ingram departs. He sees the shortish length and the width outside off, cracks the cut towards backward point and the ball was dying in front of the Pandey, who dived across and caught it centimeters from the ground. Ingram c Manish Pandey b S Kaul 5(8)

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, out Bowled!! Cleans him up! Body blow to Delhi's chances of posting a fighting total. It's the skipper who's fallen. Iyer looked alright in his stay tonight but won't be there for the final flourish. Not the wisest of shots either, goes for a wild slog sweep against Khan, was the googly and hence, the shot was on. But it needed better execution as well which didn't happen. Sneaks through to ruffle the sticks. Shreyas Iyer b Rashid Khan 43(41) [4s-3 6s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Chris Morris, out Caught by Nabi!! Another one falls prey to the slower ball. On such a sluggish surface, it's expected really but even then, DC's batsmen have mostly failed to apply themselves. Can't fault Morris though for going big with less than two overs left. Tries to go over cover but it's the slower ball that's well wide outside off, he had to reach it and mistimed it horribly. Spoons a dolly to extra cover. Chris Morris c Nabi b Bhuvneshwar 17(15) [4s-1 6s-1]

S Kaul to Rabada, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! That's the end of Rabada. Had to try the big shot with this being the final over but Kaul outsmarts him with an off cutter that's quite wide outside off. Was always a risk to go across the line and the result is a miscue that goes up in the air for a while towards short third man. Bhuvi calls for the catch and takes it comfortably. Rabada c Bhuvneshwar b S Kaul 3(4)

Bhuvneshwar to Prithvi Shaw, out Bowled!! Finally, Bhuvneshwar Kumar has a wicket against his name this season, in his fourth game. Well disguised slower delivery, not the knuckle ball, the traditional off-cutter, Shaw didn't read this and played an ugly swipe across the line, only to see the off pole cartwheeling. Will be interesting to see if Bhuvi refrains from bowling the knuckle ball. People have been picking them easily of late off his hand! Prithvi Shaw b Bhuvneshwar 11(11) [4s-2]

Nabi to Dhawan, out Caught by Sandeep Sharma!! This is astute planning from Nabi. Dhawan plays the sweep to the spinners. He knows this is a spinning surface, so pushed backward square leg back and kept fine leg in to invite Dhawan, who fell in the trap top-edging a sweep to short fine leg. The length was full enough to play the shot, but it turned to take the edge. The line was also slightly outside off. Dhawan c Sandeep Sharma b Nabi 12(14) [4s-1]

Nabi to Pant, out Caught by Hooda!! Wicket right after the break. How many times have we seen that! And it is a big one. Pant, who scored a hundred against this team last yer at the same venue, holes out in the deep. Flighted outside off, Pant bends forward and does not go through with the loft, just a check-lift and it still ends up near the long-off rope, Hooda used his height well and took it over his head right on the edge of the fence. Pant c Hooda b Nabi 5(7)

Ishant to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Prithvi Shaw!! Pick. Heave. And perfectly picking out the fielder. Ishant Sharma - hidden all this while for some strange reason - comes, keeps hitting his trademark back of a length on the tummy. Pandey tries making some room to this and swipes it in quite an agricultural hack. Can't keep it down. Can't get the distance on it either. Bang. Deep square leg. Manish Pandey c Prithvi Shaw b Ishant 10(13)

Axar to Shankar, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! The pitch-grip does its bit. And add to it Shankar's attempt to go a little too powerfully at this. It was short, innocuous-looking, and then it sticks in the surface, making Shankar lose all shape as he commits to his slap -- eventually dragging it tamely to extra cover, where life gives Iyer a second chance, and he doesn't mess it up. Shankar c Shreyas Iyer b Axar 16(21) [4s-1]

Lamichhane to Hooda, out Caught by Rabada!! Lamichhane ends with a googly. Lamichhane ends with a wicket. Hooda hasn't been reading it well all innings, so does what the manual teaches on such occasions - sweep - and so what if the line is well outside off? Hooda commits, gets a big top-edge and Rabada's waiting there at deep mid-wicket. Delhi making Hyderabad pull off a Delhi? Hooda c Rabada b Lamichhane 10(11) [4s-1]

Rahul Tewatia to Bairstow, out Lbw!! Rahul Tewatia gets the all-important breakthrough. But is it too late for Delhi? It was a slider on a fuller length, it skids off the deck. Bairstow was late on the shot, it misses his bat and raps him on the pads. Umpire raised his finger straightaway but optimistic Jonny challenged that decision (I don't know why) and was proved wrong within minutes. He misses his fifty by 2 runs. But has done enough damage at the top to put his team in the driver's seat. Bairstow lbw b Rahul Tewatia 48(28) [4s-9 6s-1]

Rabada to Warner, out Caught by Chris Morris!! Two quick wickets for Delhi and they are still alive in this match, only just though. The middle-order of SRH hasn't been tested yet so the next phase can be an interesting one. It was a fuller length delivery attacking the stumps, Warner was getting restless. He goes back and wanted to lift it over mid-off, no timing on it and ends up hitting to Morris at mid-off who takes a good low catch. Warner c Chris Morris b Rabada 10(18)

Navdeep Saini to Narine, out Caught by Negi!! Chinnaswamy breaks the sound barrier because Narine's dismissed. Hang on! They are checking for the no-ball but Saini's foot is fine on this occasion. So, Narine can continue his long walk back to the pavilion. Ushered it short at an awkward height for Narine - tucking him for room, who tamely pulls it without any timing. Loops up to Negi at fine leg who has to cover some ground and also mind the ad cushions. Keeps his calm and snaffles it in front of his face, making sure he doesn't make any contact with the boundary. Outstanding catch and KKR have lost their first wicket. Good comeback from Saini. Narine c Negi b Navdeep Saini 10(8) [4s-2]
