Negi to Chris Lynn, out Bowled!! Absolute ripper from Negi! Negi had been getting it to turn since ball one and with Lynn not being great against spin, this was on the cards. He was premeditating the charge down the track and Negi smartly held the length back. Kept it straighter too on middle and leg, spun sharply past the outside edge to make a mess of the stumps. The left arm spinner might well be the difference between the two sides. Lynn was looking threatening but has been removed at the right time as far as RCB are concerned. Chris Lynn b Negi 43(31) [4s-4 6s-2]

Chahal to Nitish Rana, out Caught by (sub)Klaasen!! Chahal has his man! He's deserved a wicket and has got a timely big strike. The ploy of bowling googlies against Rana pays dividends. The left hander charged down and wanted to go with the spin on the off-side but skewed it aerially towards sweeper cover. The sub, Klaasen, clings onto the chance, much to the relief of his mates and the energetic home crowd. Nitish Rana c (sub)Klaasen b Chahal 37(23) [4s-1 6s-2]

Navdeep Saini to Karthik, out Caught by Chahal!! Gone this time. Can't clear Chahal on this occasion. Was again in the slot from Saini but Karthik didn't get the timing right on the slog. Could only skew it high towards deep mid-wicket where the RCB leggie is waiting for it. Pouches the catch safely and celebrates wildly. VK is also chuffed, as he usually is when he gets excited. RCB are slowly going towards the finish line. Karthik c Chahal b Navdeep Saini 19(15) [4s-1 6s-1]

Negi to Uthappa, out Caught by Southee!! This was on the cards. The pressure was building on and Uthappa perishes. Excellent from Negi, kept hitting the right length and forced Uthappa into playing a bad shot. Looped up temptingly just outside off, the batsman was early into the loft and didn't go with full conviction. Ended up checking it and offers a sitter to Southee at long-off. Virat roars in delight. Much-needed wicket for RCB, just to lift their spirits. Uthappa c Southee b Negi 33(25) [4s-6]

Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, out Caught&Bowled!! Ah, the perils of timing them so damn well. But Kuldeep - to his credit - is really brave to toss it up despite the carnage, and is really full as well. Kohli doesn't get under, just whipping it down the pitch, hard, flat, and Yadav's stuck out palms come in between. THIS is silence. Kohli c and b Kuldeep Yadav 84(49) [4s-9 6s-2]

Narine to de Villiers, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Mis-pumped. Narine goes back to keeping them short, which AB actually does well to pick up and try and launch over long-off. But no, there's only SO much even a superhero can do. Gets it off the under half, without a lot of bottom-hand and Gill waits at the boundary, reverse-cupped. de Villiers c Shubman Gill b Narine 63(32) [4s-5 6s-4]

Nitish Rana to Parthiv Patel, out Lbw!! Gamble to give Nitish Rana the ball has worked for DK. Parthiv was trying a little to hard, he was looking to smash everything. But was not able to time most of the shots. This one was a slider on a good length, it skids off the deck. Parthiv Patel was late on the hoick. It misses his balde and raps him on the pads. Plumb infront! Parthiv Patel lbw b Nitish Rana 25(24) [4s-3]

Ashwin to du Plessis, out Caught by Miller!! Carrom ball and Faf is gone. Second wicket for the skipper. He spotted Faf clearing that front leg and kept the carrom ball close to him, the South African could not get underneath it and hence the mistime, Miller claims it comfortably near the long-on fence. The crowd erupts at Chepauk and that is because Thala Dhoni has walked out. du Plessis c Miller b Ashwin 54(38) [4s-2 6s-4]

Ashwin to Raina, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! Two in two for Ashwin. Third in the game and he's delighted. On a hat-trick as well. Very poor from the experienced Raina. Just had lost Faf and he tries to slog sweep this ball, it is slower through the air and beat Raina for lack of pace, missed and the furniture is left in a mess. Wrong time for CSK to lose wickets. Two new batsmen at the crease now, advantage KXIP. Raina b Ashwin 17(20) [4s-1]

Ashwin to Watson, out Caught by Sam Curran!! Watson has picked out cow corner - the longest part of this ground - and Ashwin knows this, so ends up bowling a carrom ball forcing him to go across the line and against the spin. But once a Watto commitment stays a Watto commitment, ending up in the slog sweep leading to a big top-edge, which Curran - a cool few yards inside the boundary - runs across to gather. Watson c Sam Curran b Ashwin 26(24) [4s-3 6s-1]

Harbhajan to Gayle, out Caught by Dhoni!! It's throwback to 2011 IPL finals. Ravi Ashwin got rid of Gayle in a similar fashion and 8 years later, Bhajji repeats it again. Big scalp for CSK and the crowd are delighted. Harbhajan loads it up with flight, extracts some turn after pitching just outside off and Gayle wields his bat ungainly. Slight nick and MSD grabs it and knew it straightaway. Throws it up and Gayle is a goner. Gayle c Dhoni b Harbhajan 5(7) [4s-1]

Kuggeleijn to Rahul, out Caught by Jadeja!! Kuggeleijn's first wicket in the IPL is a huge one of Rahul. This is a match-changing event for sure. Rahul was waiting for the seamers to come on. And it was a given that he will go after them. He sets himself to slog this one out of the park. Kuggeleijn again is smart enough to bowl an off-cutter. He gets the desired help from the deck and Rahul's timing was in a mess on the slog. He could only hit it to deep mid-wicket and Jadeja there makes no mistake. He takes it with utmost ease. Rahul c Jadeja b Kuggeleijn 55(47) [4s-3 6s-1]

Chahar to Miller, out Bowled!! That word of advice from MSD after two shockers from Chahar has made a massive difference. And he has probably won the match for CSK. It was a length delivery on the stumps, Miller swings and misses and it smashes the stumps. The leg-stump goes for a toss. Miller b Chahar 6(5) [4s-1]

Kuggeleijn to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by du Plessis!! Kuggeleijn on debut has won the match for CSK with some excellent death bowling. He has bowled slower ones after slower ones and that has worked for him brilliantly on this deck. Kuggeleijn = Replica of Bravo. It was on a good length and Sarfaraz Khan wanted to clobber it over long-on not enough willow behind it and Faf takes an easy one at long-on. Sarfaraz Khan c du Plessis b Kuggeleijn 67(59) [4s-4 6s-2]

Harbhajan to Agarwal, out Caught by du Plessis!! What an over this. Double-wicket maiden. KXIP have been jolted early and it's the in-form Agarwal who departs. Another tempting tossie, Agarwal stepped out and doesn't quite time his loft. Skies it up as far as long-on and there was a fielder waiting for this. Faf doesn't make any mistake and Agarwal shakes his head in disappointment. Harbhajan roars. Agarwal c du Plessis b Harbhajan 0(2)

S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Bairstow!! Krunal is not resurrecting the innings today like he did against CSK. Kaul celebrates ala Afridi - with the legs spread and the arms aloft. Mumbai sink further. A sharp short ball and Krunal is rushed on the pull, the top-edge goes straight up and Bairstow accepts the dolly. The front foot is checked again and Kaul is fine, again. Krunal Pandya c Bairstow b S Kaul 6(13)

Rashid Khan to Ishan Kishan, out Ishan Kishan Run Out!! Excellent awareness from Bairstow. He even fooled Warner at slip, who gestured that it was not out. Kishan pats it towards cover and sets off, Pollard doesn't move and the young man has to turn back, run and puts in the dive as well. By this time, Bairstow had disturbed the stumps with his pad before the throw came but he ensured he uprooted one of the stumps with the ball in his hand. Kishan's dive meant the bat popped up and he was caught short of the crease. If the stumps were not uprooted, Kishan would have survived this. Ishan Kishan run out (Shankar/Bairstow) 17(21) [4s-2]

Rashid Khan to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Shankar!! The case of Rashid winning the battle, it's not the first time and the arms go wide in celebration. Pandya is stunned but has to go. This could dent MI's prospects of posting a par total. Tosses it outside off and forces the batsman to fetch for it. Pandya goes on one-knee and clouts it across the line, airy and Vijay Shankar, manning the deep mid-wicket fence moves across and takes a smart catch. Hardik Pandya c Shankar b Rashid Khan 14(14) [6s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Rahul Chahar, out Caught by Bairstow!! Edged and gone. Slower balls in loop from Kumar, this was much fuller and Rahul swings blindly. Is too early into the shot and ends up nicking it to the keeper. Bhuvneshwar picks up his first wicket and MI lose another wicket. Rahul Chahar c Bairstow b Bhuvneshwar 10(7) [4s-2]

Nabi to Rohit, out Caught by Hooda!! Hangs the ball in the air by bowling it slower, Rohit fails to control the hack and holes out at deep mid. He inner-halved the stroke and never timed it. The ball was tossed up at 82.9kph and all the power in the shot had to be invested by the batter. That is where he lost his shape trying to hit it hard and the length also was dragged back. Huge wicket for SRH. Rohit c Hooda b Nabi 11(14) [6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, out Lbw!! He plays such unorthodox shots but falls prey tonight. Looked to slog a slower delivery and missed it completely. The impact looked a little dicey at first but was umpire's call as Suryakumar Yadav decided to review. SRH are on top now. Suryakumar Yadav lbw b Sandeep Sharma 7(8) [4s-1]

S Kaul to de Kock, out Caught by Hooda!! Gone! Mumbai's in-form batsman has been sent back. Front foot no-ball - check. QdK has to continue his walk back. The well-disguised knuckle ball and de Kock thought it was in his slot, so he went through with the heave but the slowness didn't allow him to clear the rope, Hooda settles under it at deep mid-wicket. de Kock c Hooda b S Kaul 19(18) [4s-1 6s-1]

Behrendorff to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Rohit!! Manish Pandey absolutely belted that but hits it straight into the hands of Rohit Sharma at mid-wicket. Sharp reflexes from Rohit though, a meter to the right or left of him would have been a boundary. But this sport is all about few centimeters. And this dismissal was just a vindication of that. It was a back of a length delivery on the stumps, Manish Pandey got a lot of willow behind the pull shot but when luck is not going your way you tend to find fielders. And that's exactly what happened there with Pandey. Manish Pandey c Rohit b Behrendorff 16(21)

Rahul Chahar to Y Pathan, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! SRH are committing a harakiri here. They are five down now. It was a googly which was wide of off, Pathan goes down on his knees and wanted to slog-sweep over deep backwad square leg. It comes off the top-half of the bat and ballons up in the air. Ishan Kishan in the deep makes no mistake. Y Pathan c Ishan Kishan b Rahul Chahar 0(4)

Alzarri Joseph to Hooda, out Bowled!! It was a troubled stay, and the end is just as troubling. Joseph anticipates some more shuffling extravaganza here from Hooda and keeps it dead straight on middle. Hooda - this time - isn't as creative, sits down trying to slog it out over cow corner. But it's too quick. Too full. Under the bat and leaving a mess behind. Hooda b Alzarri Joseph 20(24) [4s-1]

Alzarri Joseph to Rashid Khan, out Caught&Bowled!! There's the virtual nail into Hyderabad's coffin. It's quick, it's bouncy and it's into Rashid's shoulder. Poor Rashid, he didn't even get a sighter to deserve this brute. So he backs away, tries to get some bat, somehow in a weird pull of sorts. Ends up with the bat's shoulder, onto his shoulder for Joseph to run under the balloon up. Rashid Khan c and b Alzarri Joseph 0(1)

Bumrah to Nabi, out Caught by Rohit!! Remember what SRH did to MI last year at the Wankhede? Well, this is revengeful payback. JUST AS COLD. Bumrah bangs it in, continues cramping Nabi up for room, for height as he continues swinging desperately -- this time for the bat face to turn in his palms, get a big fat top-edge, as far as mid-off. Nabi c Rohit b Bumrah 11(14) [6s-1]

Alzarri Joseph to Bhuvneshwar, out Bowled!! WWWWW -- IPL debut you say! It's easier than an EA Sports Cricket '07 debut. He needed Malinga to return home, and he's perhaps even nudged him further into Sri Lanka here. So it was the same old usual stuff, full, on middle and Bhuvneshwar's tried funky scoop does him no good. Only uproots middle. Bhuvneshwar b Alzarri Joseph 2(6)

Alzarri Joseph to S Kaul, out Caught by de Kock!! Sorry Sohail Tanvir, Joseph's knocked you out -- It's the BEST IPL figures by a bowler. EVER. And it's taken 12 years and a 22-year-old from Antigua to do it. Again, a Ripley's Believe-It-Or-Not fact, he's on debut. Hits the hard heavy back of a length just outside off, which Kaul sticks his bat out in a poke to - and the feather to the keeper will do. S Kaul c de Kock b Alzarri Joseph 0(1)

Rahul Chahar to Bairstow, out Caught by Bumrah!! No Bairstow show today. Perks of having a leggie in your team. Leg-spinners might go for a few runs but on most occasions will fetch you a wicket. Rahul Chahar has just done that and gives MI the first breakthrough. Serves the googly on a luring length outside off, Bairstow went for it, gets deceived by the flight and lost his shape completely. The outcome is a top-edge which spoons up to Bumrah at short third man, who takes the sitter. Bairstow c Bumrah b Rahul Chahar 16(10) [4s-3]

Alzarri Joseph to Warner, out Bowled!! Wow! First ball in IPL cricket and Alzarri Joseph gets one of the most successful batsmen in the history of IPL. Stuff of dreams! It was on a fuller length and was wide of off, Warner throws his bat at it in a clumsy fashion perhaps some overconfidence. It clips his inside edge and comes back to disturb his timber. Warner b Alzarri Joseph 15(13) [4s-2]

Alzarri Joseph to Shankar, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! The decision to play Alzarri Joseph is proving to be a masterstroke for Mumbai Indians so far. It was a back of a length delivery and was wide of off, it skids off the deck. Shankar was a week late on the pull shot. It comes off the upper half of the blade and pops up in the air. Hardik Pandya at backward point won't do a Pollard. He takes a sitter of sitter. Shankar c Hardik Pandya b Alzarri Joseph 5(10) [4s-1]

Southee to Dhawan, out Caught by Navdeep Saini!! Dream start for RCB as Dhawan departs for a duck. Pitches this one up and tempts the batsman to go after it. The left-handed batsman goes for a booming drive and gets an outside edge that flies to short third man. Saini is swift to move across as he plucks this one nicely before he hits the ground. The crowd is ecstatic as the Kiwi pacer strikes early. Dhawan c Navdeep Saini b Southee 0(1)

Moeen Ali to Ingram, out Lbw!! What happened there? Against the run of play, DC have lost Ingram. Looks to play the scoop and misses it completely. The ball hits the front pad and it looked quite adjacent to the sticks. Good decision from umpire S Ravi to give it out. It looked like there might have been some bat but wasn't to be and Ingram was happy to walk off. Ingram lbw b Moeen Ali 22(21) [4s-2 6s-1]

Navdeep Saini to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Chahal!! The short ball gets big on him and the top-edge has been taken at cover. That was a close call for the bowler as he almost was on the line while delivering it but a dew millimetres saved him. A wicket too late in the evening for RCB. The formalities have been delayed. Shreyas Iyer c Chahal b Navdeep Saini 67(50) [4s-8 6s-2]

Navdeep Saini to Chris Morris, out Caught by de Villiers!! Slammed on the up and it finds the man at mid-off. That was a back of a length delivery and Chris Morris tried to flat-bat it but ended up finding ABD at mid-off. Soft dismissal. Chris Morris c de Villiers b Navdeep Saini 0(3)

Siraj to Pant, out Caught by Southee!! Cross-seam length ball and has been slapped straight to the man at mid-off. Pretty much like Morris, Pant also tried to power the ball down the ground but ended up hitting it straight to the fielder at mid-off. Still 3 needed. Some atrocious batting from DC again. Pant c Southee b Siraj 18(14) [4s-2]

Negi to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Akshdeep Nath!! The juicy long hop does what a bunch of tight lines couldn't. Negi drags his length back, and Shaw's eyes light up in a big agricultural mow getting deep in the crease. However, gets a big fat top-edge, and Akshdeep at cow corner, after all the initial misjudgement is sitting under. Prithvi Shaw c Akshdeep Nath b Negi 28(22) [4s-5]

Axar to Stoinis, out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! Gone! One thing you can't do on a slow track is play the pull. Remember RCB's first game? Kohli and AB getting out playing the pull. This was short alright but the surface robs the pace off the ball, Stoinis pulls it straighter than he would have liked and picks out long-on. Good catch from Tewatia - he ran forward and pouched the flat hit. Stoinis c Rahul Tewatia b Axar 15(17) [6s-1]

Lamichhane to Moeen Ali, out Stumped!! And Lamichhane has his man.. Brave bowling from the youngster. He was not afraid to toss it up even after getting hit for a six. It was the wrong 'un and Mo could not reach the pitch of the ball, still swings through the line and is beaten by the away turn. A nice little cameo but RCB needed more than a cameo here. Moeen Ali st Pant b Lamichhane 32(18) [4s-1 6s-3]

Rabada to Kohli, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Rabada comes back in the attack and strikes. How often do we see that? Got de Villiers earlier, gets another big wicket now. A length delivery around off and Kohli holes out to long-on as he looks to clear the fence this time around. Kohli c Shreyas Iyer b Rabada 41(33) [4s-1 6s-2]

Rabada to Akshdeep Nath, out Caught by Pant!! Rabada has bagged three wickets now! Akshdeep was looking to play a similar shot. Opens his bat face late and guides this one straight to Rishabh Pant. Got a boundary on the previous ball but the same shot has brought about in his downfall. Can Rabada take a five-wicket haul? Akshdeep Nath c Pant b Rabada 19(12) [4s-4]

Rabada to Negi, out Caught by Pant!! Superb over by Rabada! Claims his third wicket of the over as Negi perishes for a golden duck. A short ball around off, Negi tries to scoop it over the keeper but all he can manage is a feather to it. Pant leaps, gets his glove to it initially and takes it on the second attempt. All of sudden, there is pin drop silence at the stadium. Negi c Pant b Rabada 0(1)

Chris Morris to Siraj, out Lbw!! Siraj has been adjudged lbw and he has decided to challenge the umpire's call. This probably is hitting the leg-stump, hence the batsman will have to walk back to the pavilion. Three reds and another wicket goes down. Siraj was trying to play a cheeky scoop shot, gets struck on the pads instead. Pitching in line, impact on leg and hitting the leg stump. Dead. Siraj lbw b Chris Morris 1(5)

Chris Morris to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Lamichhane!! The extra ball has got Morris a wicket - this was full and this was wide of off - Parthiv's eyes lit up as he saw the width, went hard on the slash, gets a thick edge and the ball is swallowed by Lamichhane - running in from third man. Parthiv walks off to loud cheers and that's because the new man is AB. Parthiv Patel c Lamichhane b Chris Morris 9(9) [4s-1]

Rabada to de Villiers, out Caught by Ingram!! The extra ball has got the Capitals another wicket - AB was been done in by his fellow countryman - the slower ball from Rabada, think AB spotted it as he looked to go back over the bowler's head - didn't get hold of the shot as much as he would have liked - was in the air for a long time and a third South African - Colin Ingram - completes the catch even as he ran back from mid-on. de Villiers c Ingram b Rabada 17(16) [4s-1 6s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to Chris Lynn, out Caught by S Midhun!! Top-edge on the sweep and is taken by the man at deep backward square leg. You live by the sword and you die by it as well. The sweep had been beneficial for him but this time the top-edge was found and was taken by the fielder coming in. Easy take in the end. Chris Lynn c S Midhun b Shreyas Gopal 50(32) [4s-6 6s-3]

Shreyas Gopal to Narine, out Caught by Smith!! The googly gets the powerhitter here. Slashes at the away going ball and ends up edging it. The slip fielder had to react quickly and he did so to pouch it. RR have finally something worth celebrating. It was supposed to be a tough wicket to bat on but Narine had other ideas tonight. Going back to that ball, it was slightly flatter that googly. Narine c Smith b Shreyas Gopal 47(25) [4s-6 6s-3]

Prasidh to Rahane, out Lbw!! Loud shout for LBW and Rahane decides against a review. A little bit of a nibble and Rahane was caught right in front. On a good length and shaping back in, Rahane was shuffling across on the tuck, gets beaten on the inside edge and is struck around the knee-roll - adjacent to middle and leg, was going on to crash into the top of middle-stump and umpire Gaffaney has an easy call to make. Rahane has a chat with his partner and off he goes. Rahane lbw b Prasidh 5(7) [4s-1]

Gurney to Buttler, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Nope. He's gone. Maiden IPL wicket for Gurney. He sends back his fellow countryman. The slower delivery which is fuller than the previous one, Buttler targets cow corner this time, but he was hitting against the wind and to the longest part of the ground, only succeeded in getting it to Gill at the edge of the rope. Buttler c Shubman Gill b Gurney 37(34) [4s-5 6s-1]

Gurney to R Tripathi, out Caught by Chawla!! Never easy for a new batsman to play his shots on this surface. Till now Tripathi was just nudging around but it was time for him to go. Takes on Gurney's slower ball and can only sky the loft straight up, plenty of air time and Chawla settles under it near cover. R Tripathi c Chawla b Gurney 6(8)

Sandeep Sharma to Agarwal, out Caught by Shankar!! Mayank perishes trying to seal things early. Slower short ball outside off, was dug into the pitch with plenty of effort, and therefore Mayank's ill-timed pull shot couldn't clear the ropes. Straight down the throat of Vijay Shankar at deep mid-wicket ala Manish Pandey's dismissal. Agarwal c Shankar b Sandeep Sharma 55(43) [4s-3 6s-3]

Sandeep Sharma to Miller, out Caught by Hooda!! Another greedy dismissal. Knuckle ball bowled a shade outside off stump, Miller doesn't pick the variation and lofts it high into the night sky, Hooda had a week's time before catching that around his throat at long-on. Easy! Miller c Hooda b Sandeep Sharma 1(3)

S Kaul to Mandeep, out Caught by Hooda!! Excellent final over from Sid Kaul. Kept his composure and bowled a slower full ball outside off asking Mandeep to take a risk from there, Mandy obliges and goes for the smack over long-off. Doesn't quite get the elevation and Hooda claims his third catch of the game. Did well to run a few yards to his left from long-off. Mandeep c Hooda b S Kaul 2(3)

Rashid Khan to Gayle, out Caught by Hooda!! They've played with his ego, and Gayle's fallen right into it. A leg-breaking skidder in the slot inviting Gayle to go over long-on. He does just that, gets it flat, but with the lofted drive coming off the inside half. And Hooda steals the show, spotting it quickly from a wide long-on and sliding under it in front of the sightscreen. The show's over boys. Gayle c Hooda b Rashid Khan 16(14) [4s-1 6s-1]

Mujeeb to Bairstow, out Caught by Ashwin!! Big wicket! It is not swing but spin that breaks this dangerous pair. The carrom ball drifts in and Bairstow wanted to clip it off the pads, he does not keep it down the ground and Ashwin at mid-wicket takes a good low catch. He dived forward and scooped it inches off the ground. Bairstow c Ashwin b Mujeeb 1(6)

Ashwin to Shankar, out Caught by Rahul!! Ashwin strikes! Bowls a carrom ball in the channel outside off, Shankar looks to slice it but all he can manage is a feather to it. Sharp catch by Rahul and the gritty partnership has been broken. Probably a blessing in disguise for the batting team as the pair was consuming too many deliveries. Shankar c Rahul b Ashwin 26(27) [4s-2]

Ashwin to Warner, out Nabi Run Out!! That's a fine effort by Ashwin as he's ran Nabi out. Warner had smashed the short ball back to the bowler and Ashwin stops it with his right hand. Nabi was backing away and he was miles outside his crease. Ashwin parries the ball on to the stumps and the Afghan all-rounder is gone. Nabi run out (Ashwin) 12(7)

Shami to Manish Pandey, out Caught by (sub)Nair!! The field was set for the short stuff and it has worked. Manish Pandey despite waiting on the back foot could not place the pull past the man at deep mid, who hardly moved to cup that. Short ball bereft of room and the pull despite being decently timed wasn't placed in the gap. Manish Pandey c (sub)Nair b Shami 19(15) [4s-2]

Chawla to Rayudu, out Caught by Nitish Rana!! Goes for the slog sweep, gets a top-edge and Rana at short cover calls for it and takes it. That was unneccesary. May be at the break they decided one of them will go for it but this hasn't worked for CSK. Is the game still alive? Too tough for KKR. Rayudu c Nitish Rana b Chawla 21(31) [4s-2]

Narine to Watson, out Caught by Chawla!! The bonus off a half-tracker. Narine produces another sitting up off-spinner, but that manages to confuse Watto whether to go uppishly or keep it along the floor. Ends up doing a bit of both, dragging it in the end and picking out square leg perfectly. Watson c Chawla b Narine 17(9) [4s-2 6s-1]

Narine to Raina, out Caught by Chawla!! In the air and taken. Brilliant catch by PC, he charged back from mid-on, kept his eye on the ball and takes a beauty. It was a flighted delivery wide of off, Raina wanted to loft it over long-on, it comes off the bottom half of the willow and goes a long way up in the air. And PC there did exactly what the KKR wanted him to do in the outfield. Raina c Chawla b Narine 14(13) [4s-1 6s-1]

Chahar to Chris Lynn, out Lbw!! Chahar draws first blood! Was getting the ball to shape inwards and Lynn was never going to die wondering irrespective of the surface. Sits back to this nip backer and goes for an agricultural slog, only to miss it altogether. Past the inside edge and raps him on the back leg. Looked quite plumb in real time and I don't think a review would have saved Lynn. Hence, he walks back to the hut. Chris Lynn lbw b Chahar 0(5)

Harbhajan to Narine, out Caught by Chahar!! Harbhajan has the last laugh! He is just too good on such surfaces and you can't just slog him away, which is what Narine does to spinners anyway. Used his feet early and made room but Harbhajan cleverly dragged the length back with no pace whatsoever. The result is a miscue that bobbles over the backward point region and Chahar trekked back to take a good tumbling catch. Both the openers sent back to the hut really early. Narine c Chahar b Harbhajan 6(5)

Tahir to Shubman Gill, out Stumped!! Oh goodness! Has he got another one? Has MSD pulled off a stumping here? Tahir is already celebrating and yes, Gill has started to walk. KKR in complete disarry now with six down. It was the googly from Tahir, such deception that Gill is foxed by the spin. Goes searching for the drive away from his body and doesn't read it at all. It beats his inside edge and overbalances himself by dragging his back leg out of his crease. MSD was quick to spot it and whips the bails off in a flash. No need to go upstairs as well. CSK all over KKR like a rash. Shubman Gill st Dhoni b Tahir 9(12)

Harbhajan to Chawla, out Stumped!! The wheels are coming off for KKR. Another one goes and Harbhajan picks up his second wicket. Saw the batsman skip out, so Bhajji smartly slowed it up and pulled his length in addition to getting some spin off the deck. Chawla was nowhere near the pitch and flashed his bat in vain after getting beaten by the flight. MSD collects it and breaks the stumps. Easy stumping and CSK on top. Chawla st Dhoni b Harbhajan 8(13) [6s-1]

Harbhajan to Kuldeep Yadav, out Kuldeep Yadav Run Out!! Kuldeep has been dismissed off his first ball. Mix-up between both batsmen and Kuldeep was not even in the frame there. Gee! Another one bites the dust. Flighted outside off, Kuldeep pokes it to backward point and Russell wanted a single. Kuldeep was ball-watching and was late to kick-start. The fielder collects the ball and fires a throw to the bowler, who takes the bails off to catch the batsman short of his crease. Kuldeep Yadav run out (Rayudu/Harbhajan) 0(1)

Jadeja to Prasidh, out Caught by Harbhajan!! Kolkata are dominos and Harbhajan - if not pushing them out on his own, continues having himself in some form or the other on the scorecard. This time, courtesy a lame flick uppishly off his legs, picking out a funky silly mid-on perfectly. Prasidh c Harbhajan b Jadeja 0(2)

Chahar to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Rayudu!! Sharp stuff from Rayudu! KKR are falling apart quite early here. The shot selection is going awry at the moment. This was slightly short but not much bounce as Rana looked to whip this away aerially on the leg-side. Didn't get the required timing as it dipped on short mid-wicket where Rayudu took a really sharp catch. Nitish Rana c Rayudu b Chahar 0(3)

Chahar to Uthappa, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! Outrageous shot from Uthappa! Was looking in good touch but just when he should have started to kick on, falls to a terrible stroke. Despite a deep mid-wicket in place, he goes for the aerial pull off the shortish length ball that had no pace at all. Gets it off the top half of the blade and it's a rather easy catch for Jadhav stationed there, precisely for this kind of a stroke. It's one-way traffic in Chepauk at the moment. KKR don't seem to have turned up yet. Uthappa c Kedar Jadhav b Chahar 11(9) [4s-2]

Tahir to Karthik, out Caught by Harbhajan!! Redemption for Tahir. Sombre faces among KKR fans in the stands and Tahir unleashes the Baby-in-the-arms celebration for a change. No celebratory run on this occasion. But poor shot this from Karthik. Just runs out of patience and goes hard on the whippy flick, hits it airly and finds Bhajji at short mid-wicket, who takes a sharp catch. Tahir gave more flight and it kind of dipped which tempted the KKR captain into playing that false shot. Karthik c Harbhajan b Tahir 19(21) [4s-3]

Behrendorff to Gayle, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Behrendorff's got Gayle, or maybe the Mumbai heat has. This is the exact kind of delivery that was disappearing earlier in the night when the Jamaican got stuck into Behrendorff. But after a brief delay where he was attended by the physio, Gayle - even Gayle - fails to find the strength to clear deep midwicket. It's right in the slot for him, but he drags it off the inside half to Krunal Pandya. Gayle c Krunal Pandya b Behrendorff 63(36) [4s-3 6s-7]

Hardik Pandya to Miller, out Caught by de Kock!! Full and wide, Miller has a go, only to get it through off the outside edge. This wasn't in his arc to hit outta the park. Well bowled by Hardik Pandya who lets out some steam in his celebrations, probably still angry with himself for the previous wide. Miller c de Kock b Hardik Pandya 7(8) [4s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Nair, out Caught by Rahul Chahar!! This has been a superb comeback from Hardik Pandya, and from Mumbai Indians indeed. He was taken for 17 in his first over, but has come back strongly. Low full toss at the stumps, Nair attempts a cross-batted swing - more like a sweep, and skies it up off a thick top-edge. No problems for Chahar at long leg. Nair c Rahul Chahar b Hardik Pandya 5(6)

Bumrah to Sam Curran, out Caught by de Kock!! Yeah, Bumrah has the final laugh, as he so often does. Slower ball, probably a response to Curran going for a scoop. And scoop he does, straight up and to the keeper with there being no pace to work with. Sam Curran c de Kock b Bumrah 8(3) [4s-2]

Sam Curran to Pollard, out Ishan Kishan Run Out!! Sharp work from Curran! He lets out a roar too. Surely might have been frustrated at the onslaught in the over and although it's not the wicket KXIP wanted, it's definitely potential danger out of the way. Was a good full ball that cramped up Pollard on leg stump. He squeezed it to the left of Curran who was quick to get to the ball and fired a direct hit at the bowler's end. Ishan Kishan was always going to be in trouble if the throw hit and that's what happened. Ishan Kishan run out (Sam Curran) 7(10) [4s-1]

Shami to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Miller!! There's the wicket that KXIP were looking for. Precisely why Shami was brought on, in this over. Not a wicket-taking ball, was actually in the slot but was pacy from Shami and Hardik didn't get hold of it. Never really got going tonight to be honest and the miscue finds a gleeful Miller at long-on. Dolly it is and that's the end of HP. Hardik Pandya c Miller b Shami 19(13) [4s-2]

Shami to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Miller!! Clever from Shami! Second strike in the over and he's doing exactly what he was asked to do. Removes the Pandyas and now, Pollard is stranded with the tail left. This was a slower ball, comfortably slower than his stock pace and Krunal got early into the loft. Ends up chipping it towards extra cover where it's that man, Miller, again. Another sitter for the South African. Krunal Pandya c Miller b Shami 1(2)

Rajpoot to Pollard, out Caught by Miller!! Stunned silence at the Wankhede! Pollard falls! Gee, what an anti-climax! The big man thought he had hit another six, the match-winning one but nope, he's found Miller at deep mid-wicket. Was a short ball outside off, had to really fetch it but Pollard rode his luck on the pull. Could only sky it high and not long enough. What a turnaround! Rajpoot could still be the hero. Wowza! Pollard c Miller b Rajpoot 83(31) [4s-3 6s-10]

Shami to Lad, out Bowled!! Lad walks across his sticks and misses the clip to be clean bowled. Quick yorker and Lad was late on it. The leg pole was pegged back. The pressure of 3 dot balls got to Lad and he tried something different. Shami had been bowling the wicket-to-wicket channel and slips in the yorker to out do the batter. Silence prevails at Wankhede. Lad b Shami 15(13) [4s-1 6s-1]

Sam Curran to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by (sub)Henriques!! Flicked off the pads and taken superbly by the man at deep backward square. That was on the pads and Suryakumar Yadav nonchalantly clipped it away without even thinking of keeping it down. The ball kept flying away before being plucked out by the substitute fielder. Suryakumar Yadav c (sub)Henriques b Sam Curran 21(15) [4s-4]

Ashwin to de Kock, out Caught by Miller!! Charges out, slams it down the ground and Miller makes amends for the drop by taking a good catch here. Miller covered some good ground to his left, then put in the slide with his knees dug into the ground and plucked it out of thin air. KXIP making this game their own with a couple of good catches here. de Kock c Miller b Ashwin 24(23) [4s-2]

D Kulkarni to Watson, out Bowled!! That is a peach, an absolute peach. Give Kulkarni the new cherry and more often than not he will deliver. It was on a good length and it shapes away from Watson a bit, he wanted to whip it across the line, ends up playing it down the wrong line. It breaches his defence and clatters the stumps. The horrible season for Watson continues. Watson b D Kulkarni 0(4)

Unadkat to Raina, out Raina Run Out!! Stephen Fleming shakes his head in the dug-out. And this is probably the first time he is showing discontentment in this IPL season. It was on a length and Raina tucks it straight to Archer at short fine, Faf charges for a single and Raina for some reason instead of running was ball-watching ( A criminal thing to do). Archer picks it up cleanly and smashes the stumps at the non striker's end where Raina was short of the crease. RR are off to a perfect start. Raina run out (Jofra Archer) 4(4) [4s-1]

Stokes to Rayudu, out Caught by Shreyas Gopal!! That's turned out to be a superb catch from Shreyas Gopal. He may have misjudged it initially, came running in, but then has to cut back to the right, almost going zig-zag. Eventually takes it behind his body. It's the slower ball from Stokes that brings out the miscue from Rayudu, and these long square boundaries ensure that it doesn't go over. Rayudu c Shreyas Gopal b Stokes 57(47) [4s-2 6s-3]

Stokes to Dhoni, out Bowled!! He probably won't bowl a better yorker than this one. That's just perfect from Ben Stokes as he cannons it on middle and has Dhoni playing over it. Smashes into the base of middle stump. Phew, what drama! Dhoni b Stokes 58(43) [4s-2 6s-3]

Unadkat to du Plessis, out Caught by R Tripathi!! Oh dear! Oh dear! What is happening! CSK have turned ON the HARAKIRI mode! This is rare, very rare. And look at Unadkat, he is pumped. It was a short of length delivery around hip-height, du Plessis pulled and he gave the impression that he got decent amount of willow behind it. But square boundaries at SMS are massive and Faf picked up the man in the deep to perfection. Tripathi dives forward and takes a terrific catch. Fielding has been top-notch from the Royals! du Plessis c R Tripathi b Unadkat 7(10)

Jofra Archer to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by Stokes!! Wow! What a moment in the match. Stokes you beauty! David de Gea would have been proud of that effort. It was a short of length delivery wide of off, Kedar Jadhav cuts and cuts hard. It was in the air, Stokes flies in the air, times the jump to perfection and pulls off a stunning catch. Catch for the ages! He charges towards third man and punches the air in delight. Such moments can change the match, such moments can turn around the tournament for your team. CSK are in huge huge trouble now. Kedar Jadhav c Stokes b Jofra Archer 1(6)

Jadeja to Smith, out Caught by Rayudu!! It's not happening on the night for the Royals. An ugly looking slog for Smith and he becomes RJ's 100th IPL wicket. A nothing shot from one of the premier batsman across every format - this was tossed up around middle, Smith bent down on the slog sweep, didn't get close to the ball and only managed to shovel it into the safe hands of Rayudu at deep mid-wicket. A disappointing shot and the Royals have lost half their side. Smith c Rayudu b Jadeja 15(22) [4s-1]

SN Thakur to Riyan Parag, out Caught by Dhoni!! Edged and caught! Shardul can buy a lottery ticket today - this was a cross-seam delivery that was short and wide of off, Parag's eyes lit up as he saw the width, went hard on the cut and only managed a thick audible edge. Straight through to MS and young Parag walks. Six down and the Royals are struggling to set a competitive score. Riyan Parag c Dhoni b SN Thakur 16(14) [4s-2]

Chahar to Stokes, out Bowled!! A big heave and Stokes has missed it completely - the leg-stump is on the ground and Chahar continues to be impressive. The knuckle ball, pitched on off and kept coming back with the angle, Stokes backed away on a mighty heave and missed - stumps in a mess and so are the Royals' hopes of getting to 150. Stokes b Chahar 28(26) [4s-1]

Chahar to Rahane, out Lbw!! MS has a chat with the bowler and decides to review .. in the nick of time. Rahane shuffled across and missed the flick. A fair delivery. Clearly no bat. The impact is on middle and ball-tracking shows it to be hitting leg! Bruce Oxenford has overturned his original decision. The bowler had a lengthy chat with skipper and a jovial-looking MS Dhoni signalled 'T' only at the last second. Turned out to be the correct move. A fuller-than-a-good-length ball and Rahane had walked across a long way to work it square on the leg-side. Three reds on HawkEye! Rahane lbw b Chahar 14(11) [4s-3]

SN Thakur to Buttler, out Caught by Rayudu!! Shardul Thakur has the last laugh. MS applauds. A horror shot from Buttler, though. After hitting three successive boundaries, Buttler tries to play another biggie. He hung back and wanted to thump it downtown - this short of length delivery - similar to the shot he played off Chahar. But, this time, Jos lost his shape in the process and the ball ballooned up a long way off the top part of the bat. Rayudu settles under it at the extra cover region and snaffles with both hands. The danger man has thrown his wicket away here. Buttler c Rayudu b SN Thakur 23(10) [4s-4 6s-1]

Santner to Samson, out Caught by (sub)Shorey!! One, two, three and taken in the end. The substitute fielder takes a juggling catch. Rajasthan lose their third wicket. Hint of away-spin, and Samson doesn't get the timing right on his one-legged sweep. It was on the leg-stump line and hence Samson went for that shot. Shorey ran in from deep square leg and almost made a mess of it. It brushed the cap and made contact with his right arm too. In the end, he pouched that. Samson c (sub)Shorey b Santner 6(6) [4s-1]

Jadeja to R Tripathi, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! Kedar takes a smart catch and Rajasthan lose their fourth wicket. Tripathi tries to play another inside-out drive against this 94.6kph fullish ball. The ball spins away and flies off the outside edge. Kedar Jadhav at backward point, jumps and goes for a one-handed catch. Doesn't succeed in the first attempt, holds his nerves and gobbles it with both the hands in the end. R Tripathi c Kedar Jadhav b Jadeja 10(12) [4s-1]

Nitish Rana to Pant, out Caught by Kuldeep Yadav!! And the move works. Pant has again thrown it away and failed to finish. Not what DC wanted. Not what Ponting wanted either and not what he himself wanted ahead of the WC selection. All these little things matter. Fantastic knock but he has thrown it away at the brink of it. 17 still needed. Was loopy ball, Pant charged out, threw his weight behind the shot with one hand off and the ball landed straight into the hands of the man at long-on. Pant c Kuldeep Yadav b Nitish Rana 46(31) [4s-4 6s-2]

Prasidh to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Karthik!! Terrific catch by a flying DK! Excellent delivery too. Short of a length around off and jags away a tad. Shaw tries to defend it off his back foot, gets squared up somewhat and gets a thick outside edge. The KKR skipper flies to his right and plucks it out of thin air. Not for the first time have we seen him take such a blinder. Quite an eventful over that. 17 runs and a wicket to cap it off. Prithvi Shaw c Karthik b Prasidh 14(7) [6s-2]

A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Karthik!! Is there anything that Dre Russ can't do on the cricket field? Wasn't that great a delivery but Kolkata will take it. A short ball down the leg side, Iyer tries to play a leg glance but gets a feather as the ball swings away. A much easier catch for DK this time around and Iyer doesn't wait for the umpire's call. Starts walking straight away. Probably the reason why they're ranked first in the Fairplay points table. Shreyas Iyer c Karthik b A Russell 6(6) [4s-1]

Ishant to Denly, out Bowled!! A first-ball duck on IPL debut for Denly - a perfect start to the game for Ishant, this was pitched up and nipped back in sharply - Denly hasn't had an idea about the conditions, went with hard hands on the drive - the ball burst past the inside edge and rattled the off-stump. It goes for a walk and the celebrations start in the DC camp. Denly b Ishant 0(1)

Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, out Bowled!! Yorks him! Brilliant riposte from Morris. Nails the yorker with perfection and Rana who was backing away to make room, had to get his bat down in time. Couldn't due to the pace and precision of the delivery. Timber. DC are keeping a squeeze on this game with some superb planning in the bowling department. Nitish Rana b Chris Morris 11(12) [6s-1]

K Paul to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Axar!! What an anti-climax for Gill! For someone who batted with so much authority, he's got out to a poor delivery, a scoring delivery. Was fed down the leg-side and he went for an aerial flick. Just had to beat short fine leg to get another boundary but picks out Axar stationed in the ring. Soft dismissal and Gill knows it. Superb innings nevertheless from the young man. Shubman Gill c Axar b K Paul 65(39) [4s-7 6s-2]

Rabada to Karthik, out Caught by Dhawan!! Another soft dismissal. Rabada has his second and DC are pressing the advantage home here. Pacy full ball on the pads and Karthik goes that favorite aerial flick of his. Only that this time, there is a deep square leg in place for such kind of an adventure. Dhawan gobbles it up and gives his signature thigh slap. Rabada was brought to break this potentially threatening pair and he does precisely that, although Russell is still there. Karthik c Dhawan b Rabada 2(3)

Chris Morris to A Russell, out Caught by Rabada!! Massive wicket! Good planning from DC for this wicket. Morris went round the wicket and wanted to execute the wide yorker from that angle. Didn't get it fully right and was a low full toss but induced the slice from Russell who didn't get the desired connection. It's flat and towards deep backward point where Rabada accepts it with glee. This wicket will definitely make a difference of 15-20 runs to the eventual total and DC know it. A Russell c Rabada b Chris Morris 45(21) [4s-3 6s-4]

K Paul to Brathwaite, out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! Brathwaite's innings ends. Rightly played second fiddle to Russell earlier although he could have tried at least one big shot. Now, in an attempt to up the ante, doesn't get the placement right on the slog. Timing wasn't great either and holes out to deep mid-wicket. Brathwaite c Rahul Tewatia b K Paul 6(7)

Rabada to Uthappa, out Caught by Pant!! That's a top catch from Pant and Rabada has got his man - followed the slower yorker with a fiery bouncer - short and angling down the leg-side, Uthappa was looking to help it on its way - all that he managed was a glove. The ball was travelling, but Pant tumbled to his left, leapt high and completed a fine catch. Uthappa c Pant b Rabada 28(30) [4s-4 6s-1]

Jofra Archer to Rohit, out Caught by Buttler!! Jofra Archer finds the breakthrough. A length ball at 146.3kph, Rohit tries to smash across the line by fetching it from outside off. Loses his timing - courtesy the extra pace - and spoons a straightforward catch to Buttler at long-on. Rohit isn't happy with himself. He knows that he has gifted his wicket away here on a belter. Rohit c Buttler b Jofra Archer 47(32) [4s-6 6s-1]

D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, out Bowled!! Bowled 'em! 'You miss, I hit' stuff. It was a cutter from Dhawal Kulkarni, not sure if Suryakumar Yadav picked that. He backed away to crash it through the off-side. But the ball sneaked under his blade to dislodge the off-bail. Suryakumar Yadav b D Kulkarni 16(10) [6s-1]

Jofra Archer to Pollard, out Caught by Shreyas Gopal!! Archer wins the battle straightaway! Massive strike, considering Pollard's recent hitting form. He never got going today though, seemed scratchy and even disinterested a bit. Had to launch now with enough batting in the shed and opts for the muscular slog of his. The length isn't there and the result is a miscue that goes miles in the air. Brilliant catch from Gopal who steadied himself nicely at mid-wicket to take it with a tumble. Never easy these catches, especially if they are of a dangerous batsman, the pressure just adds up. Pollard c Shreyas Gopal b Jofra Archer 6(12)

Jofra Archer to de Kock, out Caught by Buttler!! Stunner of a catch from Buttler! Wow! Had to cover a lot of ground from long-off, did so and timed the dive to perfection as well. Mind you, he didn't have the reaction time to do it with ease and so had to really rush. But that's the hallmark of a superb fielder, made it look like regulation stuff. Ends a fine knock from de Kock who was visibly jaded. Went for the loft but was undone by the slower ball this time. Sliced it down the ground and on some days, might have survived but not today. Not with Buttler manning that area. de Kock c Buttler b Jofra Archer 81(52) [4s-6 6s-4]

Unadkat to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Buttler!! Buttler is having a field day with his catching. This is a dolly though. Was a low full toss and Kishan couldn't quite get the desired distance on the loft. Skewed it more off the toe-end and it went flat to long-off where Buttler made no mistake. Hardik Pandya has got back on strike though as the batsmen crossed and that's a positive for MI. Ishan Kishan c Buttler b Unadkat 5(3) [4s-1]

Rahul Chahar to Buttler, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! He's skied this up off the outside half and is caught down at long-off. No hundred for Jos Buttler, who wasn't playing for it either. Saw the flight and went for it. This is very well bowled from Chahar as he slowed it up and teased him with a leg-break well outside off. Buttler c Suryakumar Yadav b Rahul Chahar 89(43) [4s-7 6s-7]

Bumrah to Samson, out Lbw!! Samson steps across the stumps, swipes across the line and misses. Given out leg-before. But is this slanting down leg? That's what he's hoping for while going for the review. But as is the case, the ball's just clipping the side of leg-stump to make it stay with the onfield call. Samson lbw b Bumrah 31(26) [4s-2 6s-1]

Krunal Pandya to R Tripathi, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! This is poor from Rahul Tripathi. Really unnecessary. Looks to slog-sweep Krunal Pandya and top-edges it to deep midwicket. From nowhere, Mumbai's celebrations show that they haven't given it up yet. R Tripathi c Hardik Pandya b Krunal Pandya 1(2)

Krunal Pandya to Livingstone, out Bowled!! There's going to be drama here, make no mistake. This is getting a bit too uncomfortable for the Royals, and when you see shots like this, you understand why. Livingstone has swiped right across the line of this delivery, missed it completely and lost his stumps. Livingstone b Krunal Pandya 1(2)

Bumrah to Smith, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Huge appeal from Bumrah, and Smith walks. Don't think the umpire was raising his finger initially. Anyway, this is unbelievable from the Royals. How they've found themselves in such a position after that Buttler innings is just... Back of a length, gains pace of the pitch and takes a faint outside edge through to Ishan Kishan. Massive blow to lose someone with Smith's experience. Now into the lower-order. Smith c Ishan Kishan b Bumrah 12(15) [4s-1]

Krunal Pandya to Rahane, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Gone! How many times have we witnessed that? Wicket right after the break. Big one for Mumbai as Rahane looked in his elements today. Slowed up and got a bit of purchase as well, Rahane goes for the slog sweep, the ball turns away with some bounce, the top-edge balloons towards deep mid-wicket, where SKY takes a sitter. Rahane c Suryakumar Yadav b Krunal Pandya 37(21) [4s-6 6s-1]

Siraj to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Gone! Siraj learns quickly from his mistake this time. He also gives a send off to Sarfaraz. Dug in short and it was pacy, Sarfaraz swivels to play the pull but only manages a glove to Parthiv, who takes a good catch over his head. Sarfaraz Khan c Parthiv Patel b Siraj 15(13) [4s-1 6s-1]

Moeen Ali to Sam Curran, out Lbw!! Mo has deserved this wicket. The promotion to send Curran up the order does not work for KXIP. The offie kept it simple, pushed it through and attacked the stumps, Curran tries a cheeky reverse sweep and is beaten for pace, struck right in front of the stumps and the umpire had no doubt. Sam Curran lbw b Moeen Ali 1(3)

Chahal to Rahul, out Stumped!! That's a fine comeback from the leggie. The leg-break and he has got rid of the dangerous KL. Was it the adrenaline that was pumping inside KL? He lost his head and he has lost his wicket now. Came rushing forward, didn't spot the leg-break, beaten in the flight and the drift - swung all over the place and Parthiv has an easy stumping to his name. Rahul st Parthiv Patel b Chahal 18(15) [4s-2 6s-1]

Chahal to Agarwal, out Bowled!! Timbah! What a response. He's pumped. Celebrates the wicket with a fist pump on his knee. Agarwal is left clueless with this delivery. Drifts in the air and lands near leg and middle-stump, Agarwal is caught in the crease because of the length, he then tries to maneuver with his hands, but the ball spins across to hit top of off-stump. Dream delivery for any leg-spinner. Agarwal b Chahal 15(9) [4s-1 6s-1]

Shami to Kohli, out Caught by Murugan Ashwin!! Kohli absolutely smashes this pull shot, but it goes straight to Murugan Ashwin who was standing at least 15-20 yards inside the boundary. That positioning was probably to stop the second run, which this pair has so frequently charged for to exploit the long boundary. But it works brilliantly in a separate context here. Short ball, hammered off the front foot well in front of square, it goes flat and hard - straight to deep midwicket. Ashwin comes charging across in celebration. There might yet be some more chapters to write before this game is done. Kohli c Murugan Ashwin b Shami 67(53) [4s-8]

Ashwin to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Agarwal!! Clever from Ashwin! Sensed Parthiv giving the charge and slowed it down considerably, while also dragging the length back ever so slightly. The attempted lofted stroke ended up as a miscue and Mayank at long-off accepted the sitter with joy. KXIP have broken through, courtesy their skipper who is actually having a fine season so far. Parthiv Patel c Agarwal b Ashwin 19(9) [4s-4]

Chawla to Kedar Jadhav, out Lbw!! Jadhav's been trapped in front but he walks down the pitch to have a chat with Raina in quest for a review but nope, the Southpaw advises him against going for the review and off he goes. Eden explodes. Chawla picks up his second wicket and he's keeping KKR in the game. Such a vital wicket this because Jadhav was looking ominous. Quicker delivery, skidded through after pitching and KJ misjudged it, ended up playing it down the wrong line and it pings him on the front pad. HawkEye's in and it says the ball is crashing the leg-stump. Good call from umpire Rod Tucker. Kedar Jadhav lbw b Chawla 20(12) [4s-3 6s-1]

Narine to Dhoni, out Lbw!! Dhoni given out leg-before. Now then, this is a big moment. He has gone for the review. Oh this looks close on the front-on replay. There's some turn, and Dhoni is well forward. So there's a chance it might go down. No, it doesn't. Per ball-tracking, it's crashing leg stump - three reds. KKR needed this desperately to have any hope of getting back. And they're surely back in it now. Like the previous delivery, this one turned in as well with Dhoni having little clue on the front foot. And this was much more adjacent. Dhoni lbw b Narine 16(13) [6s-1]

Gurney to Watson, out Lbw!! That was a length ball and has trapped Watson plumb in front of the sticks. Nipped in from a length, Watson was trapped on the back leg and missed the line to be adjudged LBW. His bad form with the bat continues. CSK lose their first wicket. That was the pacy and skiddy delivery from Gurney which angled in from round the wicket. Watson lbw b Gurney 6(7) [4s-1]

Narine to du Plessis, out Bowled!! Narine gets his man and sends the dangerous du Plessis packing back to the hut. He's been short on confidence with the ball in this tournament but this wicket is a much-needed boost. Poor shot from du Plessis, perhaps was tempted by the flight there as he leant forward aiming for an agricultural heave, didn't fully commit himself as the ball dipped in after pitching. Sneaks in with a hint of spin and rattles the off-pole. du Plessis b Narine 24(16) [4s-5]

Chawla to Rayudu, out Caught by Uthappa!! Talk about lapse in concentration. It happened with KKR and now with Rayudu. Just throws it away, probably has thrown his spot away as well in the Indian team for the World Cup. Chawla with the golden arm; tosses it luringly outside off and Rayudu chases with hard hands. Slaps it uppishly and finds Uthappa at cover, who takes a good catch. Rayudu c Uthappa b Chawla 5(11)

Tahir to Nitish Rana, out Caught by du Plessis!! Rana looks to up the ante and falls in the process. It's turning out to be another season where Rana gives it away in the middle and latter half. He spotted the leg-break, made room for the lofted on-drive, didn't quite get hold of the shot, off the inner half of the bat and dragged it down the throat of du Plessis at long-on. A simple catch and the South African holds on. Nitish Rana c du Plessis b Tahir 21(18) [4s-3]

Tahir to Uthappa, out Caught by du Plessis!! A ripper from Faf du Plessis - but what was Uthappa doing? First ball and he was looking to smash Tahir out of the park, it was the leg-break and he didn't spot it, ended up slicing across the line, gets a thick edge that goes high and over the bowler's head. Faf charged in from the deep, kept his eyes on the ball and held on - despite sliding forward. KKR are losing the plot in the middle overs. Uthappa c du Plessis b Tahir 0(1)

Tahir to Chris Lynn, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Wickets keep coming for Tahir and this is his trademark celebration on show. Pushed through with a flatter trajectory, Lynn bent down on the slog-sweep, struck it hard and flat, but didn't find the placement that he wanted. Shardul was the man at deep backward square leg, bends down low and accepts the catch gleefully. Exit Lynn, but enter Andre Russell. Chris Lynn c SN Thakur b Tahir 82(51) [4s-7 6s-6]

Tahir to A Russell, out Caught by (sub)Shorey!! One shot too many and the celebrations start in the CSK camp - Look at Tahir go, he got Lynn first and now Russell - surely has cut short KKR's final score by at least 25 runs if not more. Another leg-break and Russell brought out an ambitious slog-sweep - Didn't get hold of the shot, off the toe-end and dragged it towards long-on. It was dying onto him, but Dhruv Shorey bent forward and held on. A Russell c (sub)Shorey b Tahir 10(4) [4s-1 6s-1]

SN Thakur to Karthik, out Caught by du Plessis!!Jinxed! Poor from the skipper. Length delivery and he just skied it up in the air for Faf, the ball magnet for the day, to take it at mid-off. That was a nothing shot. The bat face turned in the hands of the batsman for it to sky up. Fourth catch of the day for Faf. Karthik c du Plessis b SN Thakur 18(14) [4s-2]

SN Thakur to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Jadeja!! And a tough learning curve for Shubman Gill is over. Slaps a shortish ball straight down the throat of the man at deep mid. That was slower and Shubman Gill despite timing it found the fielder. KKR have lost the plot here. Shubman Gill c Jadeja b SN Thakur 15(20)

SN Thakur to Chawla, out Kuldeep Yadav Run Out!! Swinging in yorker and a run-out as the keeper lobbed the ball to the bowler who whipped the bails off with the non-stiker stranded in the middle of the crease. Chawla almost fell down failing to wood the yorker and Dhoni behind the sticks did the rest. KKR has derailed pretty badly here. Kuldeep Yadav run out (Dhoni/SN Thakur) 0(0)

Santner to Narine, out Caught by du Plessis!! Santner strikes in his first over! A tossed up delivery around middle and leg, Narine looks to clear long-on with this loft but finds the fielder stationed near the fence. du Plessis is the man who takes a safe catch. Just like his previous match against CSK, Narine fails to fire yet again. The bowling change works for Dhoni. Narine c du Plessis b Santner 2(7)

Khaleel Ahmed to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Bairstow!! Khaleel Ahmed gets a wicket in his first over of the season. Short of a length delivery just outside off stump, Shaw tries to punch off the back foot, the ball bounces, hits him high on the bat and the edge goes straight to the keeper. Prithvi Shaw c Bairstow b Khaleel Ahmed 4(5)

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Bairstow!! Kumar's worked Iyer out with a short ball. The DC captain doesn't even wait for the umpire to raise his finger as he trudges off the field. It's Bhuvi's 100th scalp for SRH. Followed a full ball with a spicy short delivery, Iyer was backing away and tried to ramp it over the keeper but failed in execution. Gets a slight edge and Bairstow makes no mistake. The partnership has been broken. Shreyas Iyer c Bairstow b Bhuvneshwar 45(40) [4s-5]

Khaleel Ahmed to Pant, out Caught by Hooda!! Proving to be a fruitful night for Khaleel Ahmed. Comes back into the attack and gets the big fish. Bowls a low full toss and Pant looks to lift it over long-on. Gets it off the bottom end of the bat as it's miscued towards the man charging in. Hooda is the man in the deep who takes it. Pant c Hooda b Khaleel Ahmed 23(19) [4s-3]

Rashid Khan to Chris Morris, out Bowled!! Rashid ends his spell with a wicket. Pitches this one on a tad fuller length and bowls a quicker legbreak, Chris Morris with lack of footwork tries to punch it, can't get any connection however. The ball knocks the top of off stump and Morris is gone! Chris Morris b Rashid Khan 4(8)

Sandeep Sharma to K Paul, leg byes, 1 run, SRH review against Keemo Paul! Doesn't look out though as the impact was outside leg and it was clearly sliding down the leg side. Was a slower delivery on leg and Keemo got beaten as the ball moved away to an extent. Impact - umpire's call and it's missing leg confirm the replays

Bhuvneshwar to K Paul, out Lbw!! Bhuvi has the last laugh as he gets his man. Concedes a six and comes back strongly to dismiss Keemo. Nails his yorker to perfection and traps the batsman in front of the wickets. He was looking to swing his bat but got beaten due to the hint of inswing. Out from the moment it struck his pads and the batsman doesn't even think of reviewing it. K Paul lbw b Bhuvneshwar 7(4) [6s-1]

Khaleel Ahmed to Dhawan, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! Top edge, oh Bhuvi juggles but manages to take it on the second attempt. Lovely short delivery, Dhawan goes for the hook shot, gets a thick edge, Bhuvi takes a few steps forward and manages to hold on. Great start from Khaleel Ahmed, got both the openers. Dhawan c Bhuvneshwar b Khaleel Ahmed 7(8) [4s-1]

Abhishek Sharma to Munro, out Caught by Bairstow!! And he nicks off immediately. Full and wide outside off stump, Munro tries to square-drive, but gets a thick edge and he doesn't wait for the umpire. Abhishek Sharma gets his first IPL wicket. Munro c Bairstow b Abhishek Sharma 40(24) [4s-4 6s-3]

K Paul to Williamson, out Caught by Rabada!! Done in by the slower ball, chips it up to the right of mid-off where Rabada comes flying across for the catch. Clings onto it. Then clings onto Prithvi Shaw who jumps right onto him. Brilliant from Paul to turn it around for Delhi. Pressure on the vulnerable SRH middle-order again. Williamson c Rabada b K Paul 3(8)

K Paul to Bhui, out Caught by Axar!! This is proving to be a match defining spell by Keemo Paul. Ricky Bhui never looked settled and his struggle comes to an end. Was a slower delivery outside off, the batsman swung his bat and got it off a thick leading edge towards backward point. Axar Patel sprints across towards his left, puts in a dive and pulls off a brilliant catch. This match is going right down to the wire. Bhui c Axar b K Paul 7(12)

Rabada to Warner, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! The slower delivery does it again. Dada and Ponting at the dug out are roaring out loud as well. Big moment in the game. Warner looked to slap it, toe-ended it and the man at midoff back-pedalled a bit to take it. Huge, huge wicket for DC in the circumstances. Warner c Shreyas Iyer b Rabada 51(47) [4s-3 6s-1]

Rabada to Shankar, out Caught by Pant!! The short ball does it now. The quick short ball, no room for the batter and only musters a top-edge for the keeper to cover some distance and take it at the short third cordon. Back-to-back wickets have almost sealed the game for DC. Shankar could have been the man for SRH but not to be. The ball skidded on to him and he was late on the shot. Shankar c Pant b Rabada 1(2)

Chris Morris to Hooda, out Bowled!! The corker yorker has got the leg pole cartwheeling here. Looked to open the face of the bat on that yorkerish delivery but missed it and the leg-stick went for a toss. SRH are crumbling too quickly here. Perfect yorker and the perfect result as well. Hooda b Chris Morris 3(4)

Chris Morris to Rashid Khan, out Caught by K Paul!! And another South African is on a hat-trick. Slower delivery, Rashid Khan got under the ball and slammed the slog sweep for it to be taken at deep mid. Keemo Paul in the deep mid region gobbled it up. Chris Morris is on a hat-trick now. Rashid Khan c K Paul b Chris Morris 0(1)

Chris Morris to Abhishek Sharma, out Caught by K Paul!! Keemo Paul is like air. He is everywhere. An easy catch around the mid-off region. Length delivery and was heaved away off the toe-end of the blade, never went anywhere and the catch was taken easily. SRH going down like a lead balloon here. Totally messed up the chase in the second part of the innings. Abhishek Sharma c K Paul b Chris Morris 2(3)

Rabada to Bhuvneshwar, out Caught&Bowled!! What's happening here? They keep getting sucked into more miseries SRH. Short ball, looks to pull and the top-edge was taken by the bowler himself. The keeper also went for it as no one called for it. But Rabada kept his balance to take it. Bhuvneshwar c and b Rabada 2(4)

Rabada to Khaleel Ahmed, out Bowled!! Backs away, creates room and misses the fullish ball for DC to complete the formalities. From 101 for 2 to 116 bowled out. DC jump to second in the points table. Khaleel Ahmed b Rabada 0(1)

K Paul to Bairstow, out Caught by Rabada!! Fuller, slower and wider, Bairstow reaches out for it and drills it straight down long-off's throat. That's the opening Delhi needed. Because he was stretching for it, Bairstow wasn't as balanced as he would've liked to be. And so, that affected - or rather hindered - the power he was able to generate. Went flat to Rabada who made no mistake. Bairstow c Rabada b K Paul 41(31) [4s-5 6s-1]

Chahal to Ishan Kishan, out Stumped!! Gets greedy does Ishan Kishan and throws his wicket away. Didn't pick the top-spinner outside off and his wild bat swing only meets with thin air, PP completes the formalities behind the stumps sans any fuss. Ishan Kishan st Parthiv Patel b Chahal 21(9) [6s-3]

Chahal to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Navdeep Saini!! This is a big wicket for RCB, the move to bowl Chahal has worked. Just as SKY was looking very determined to take MI home, he gifts his wicket. Flighted delivery spinning away outside off stump, not easy to loft the away-spinning ball on this surface, goes for the extra-cover region but hits it too high and very straight. Long-off moves to his left and swallows the ball to delight the away camp. Suryakumar Yadav c Navdeep Saini b Chahal 29(23) [4s-2 6s-1]

Siraj to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by (sub)Milind Kumar!! Yikes! That was an ugly hit with no real intent from Krunal. Ugly because his front foot was pointing towards cover and when you do that, there's no way you can flick the ball with control. Just a chip in the end to this back of a length delivery and deep mid-wicket ran forward to take the catch. In fact he caught that with one hand despite going with both hands. Crowd cheers as they see Pollard walk out. Krunal Pandya c (sub)Milind Kumar b Siraj 11(21) [4s-1]

Moeen Ali to Rohit, out Bowled!! Wicket off the first ball for Moeen Ali. He can do no wrong today. Lands the offbreak miles outside off stump and thus, Rohit Sharma thinks he can cut that off the back foot, wasn't to be. The ball spins a long way and clatters quickly into middle and leg. Rohit b Moeen Ali 28(19) [4s-2 6s-2]

Moeen Ali to de Kock, out Lbw!! Plumb. de Kock's caught on the crease and Moeen Ali is chuffed to bits. Pitches this on a length and gets just the right amount of turn into the left-hander, de Kock's stranded on the back foot and that's crashing into middle and leg. Played all around it and paid the price. de Kock lbw b Moeen Ali 40(26) [4s-5 6s-2]

Malinga to Moeen Ali, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Fifty and gone. Slower delivery and Moeen Ali was early into his uppish tuck. Moeen Ali was through with his shot too early and the ball soared away for it to be taken at deep mid by Pandya, who moved across to his left and took it. End of a game changing innings from Mo! MI will take this with both hands. Moeen Ali c Hardik Pandya b Malinga 50(32) [4s-1 6s-5]

Malinga to Stoinis, out Caught by Rohit!! The slower delivery does the trick. Tucked the batsman up with an off-cutter, which bounced on the batter, who got a leading edge and was taken by the man at cover. tried to close the face of the bat a bit but was undone by the clever change of pace. Top-clas from Malinga. Stoinis c Rohit b Malinga 0(2)

Malinga to de Villiers, out de Villiers Run Out!! 1 run completed. That was superb from Pollard. A bullet of a throw from deep long-on and has found ABD short. de Villiers slogged it away towards the long-on area and wanted to come back for a second only for him to sent back by Akshdeep Nath. ABD tried to turn back but the direct hit found him short. de Villiers run out (Pollard) 75(51) [4s-6 6s-4]

Malinga to Akshdeep Nath, out Caught by de Kock!! Charges out, looks to loft the slower ball away and top-edges it for the keeper to run towards the short fine area and take it. This again won't please the skipper. QDK had his eyes on the ball and took it nicely despite the ball going away from him. Akshdeep Nath c de Kock b Malinga 2(3)

Malinga to Negi, out Caught by de Kock!! And another one for the Slinga! Slower delivery cutting across, Negi throws his bat at it and skies it up. The keeper again calls for it and catches it near the point region. This is extremely poor from RCB. Throwing it away at the end of it. Negi c de Kock b Malinga 0(2)

Behrendorff to Kohli, out Caught by de Kock!! Body blow by Behrendorff! Cracking delivery and Kohli has been sent back early. Was angling across from a good length around off, held its line after pitching and bounced just a bit more than Kohli anticipated it to. He was looking to force it through the off-side and got cramped, thereby getting an inside edge through to de Kock who took it with ease. Just the kind of start MI were looking for. Kohli c de Kock b Behrendorff 8(9) [4s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! What a soft dismissal! For all the shots he's played so far, Parthiv departs in tame fashion. It's been the story of his IPL career by and large. Gets attractive starts but perishes after the Powerplay. This was a cleverly bowled off cutter from Hardik and Parthiv wanted to go aerial through his favorite region square through the off-side. Misread the pace and ended up chipping it straight to Yadav at backward point. Parthiv Patel c Suryakumar Yadav b Hardik Pandya 28(20) [4s-4 6s-1]

Unadkat to Rahul, out Caught by Jofra Archer!! Unadkat has the last laugh! Was carted around in the last over but responds by breaking the partnership. Was the slower ball and quite full as well, Rahul wanted to carve this through the gap square through the off-side but ended up slicing it straight to Archer at backward point. Simple catch and it ends a decent knock from KLR. So, the gamble works for RR and Rahane. Rahul c Jofra Archer b Unadkat 52(47) [4s-3 6s-2]

Jofra Archer to Pooran, out Caught by Rahane!! Mistimed and picks out extra cover. Pooran has been done in for pace here, it's a low full toss but quite brisk and hence, isn't able to connect properly. Ends up cue-ending the shot towards the off-side where the RR skipper takes a tumbling catch, diving forward. This is a fine passage of play for the visitors. Pooran c Rahane b Jofra Archer 5(6)

Jofra Archer to Mandeep, out Bowled!! The leg stump has been flattened! Outstanding over from Archer, just three runs and has taken two wickets too. After a series of fiery pacy deliveries, he opts for the slower one, the back-of-the-hand option and Mandeep clearly hasn't picked it at all. Saw the length very short and backed away for the pull but the ball never really arrived. Ends up getting an inside edge that damages the woodwork. Brilliant fightback from the Royals. Mandeep b Jofra Archer 0(2)

D Kulkarni to Miller, out Caught by Buttler!! The KXIP innings is falling apart at the final leg, thereby derailing that flourish that they were looking for. The well-set Miller is the latest casualty. Made room for the big shot but Kulkarni followed him with a slower ball on a good length. Couldn't free his arms properly and ended up skewing the loft high into the night skies at deep mid-wicket. Not easy, these high catches but Buttler is a pro in the outfield. Pouches the skier with ease. Miller c Buttler b D Kulkarni 40(27) [4s-2 6s-2]

Jofra Archer to Gayle, out Caught by Samson!! Archer gets the prized scalp of Gayle. He's such a smart operator and gives RR the first breakthrough. It was on a back of a length, decked away with some extra bounce. Gayle with a tentative and loose poke at that, it brushes the outside edge and Samson makes no mistake this time. Stunned silence in the crowd as KXIP have lost the in-form Gayle. Gayle c Samson b Jofra Archer 30(22) [4s-2 6s-3]

Ish Sodhi to Agarwal, out Caught by Jofra Archer!! Agarwal perishes in his quest to clear long-on. Goes down on his knee to thump this one over the fence but miscues it completely. The ball goes miles up in the air and Jofra in the deep settles underneath the skier. Waits for an eternity but does well to position himself under the night sky as he reverse cups it to perfection. Agarwal c Jofra Archer b Ish Sodhi 26(12) [4s-1 6s-2]

Ashwin to Samson, out Bowled!! The sweep has brought about his downfall this time. After crunching the previous two straight to the fielder, Samson goes for it again but misses it completely. That it was a carrom ball that straightened on off may have had to do with the error. Or it may not have. But it's floored the off stump all right. Samson b Ashwin 27(21) [4s-2]

Ashwin to R Tripathi, out Caught by Agarwal!! The carom ball has done the trick again! It was pushed around fifth stump channel and Tripathi intended to clear the fielder in the deep, went for the loft but sliced it off the bottom half straight into the mitts of Mayank Agarwal at long-off. R Tripathi c Agarwal b Ashwin 50(45) [4s-4]

Murugan Ashwin to Turner, out Caught by Miller!! No Mohali heroics from Ashton Turner tonight. Unfortunately he doesn't have the time to play the nudge-and-nurdle game, prefers to attack and uses his long levers to tonk Murugan Ashwin into the stands, wasn't to be. Connects right off the cue end and Miller ain't dropping that at long-off. Turner c Miller b Murugan Ashwin 0(1)

Shami to Jofra Archer, out Caught by Rahul!! KL Rahul is such a brilliant fielder and boy, he makes catching look so easy. A pacy short ball outside off, Archer's so tall that he could actually stay flat-feeted and swipe at it with full throttle, hit that real hard but flat it went to the right of long-on. KL Rahul sprints across and controls the slide before tumbling over to complete the catch. Jofra Archer c Rahul b Shami 1(3)

Arshdeep Singh to Rahane, out Caught by Shami!! Rahane's ordeal comes to an end and the 20-year old is absolutely pumped. Couldn't have asked for a better debut. Rolled his fingers over this full delivery and asked Rahane to fetched it from outside off, the aimless slog loops up high in the air where Shami runs around to take a fine catch from short third. Rahane c Shami b Arshdeep Singh 26(21) [4s-1]

Shami to Shreyas Gopal, out Caught by Agarwal!! Pacy full ball from Shami, followed the batsman and fired it around the pads, Gopal had made room outside off but the extra pace from Shami skid onto the bat and hit the toe-end on the loft, a simple chance for Mayank at long-off. Shreyas Gopal c Agarwal b Shami 0(1)

Arshdeep Singh to Buttler, out Caught by Pooran!! Arshdeep Singh has got Jos Buttler as his maiden IPL wicket. What a moment for the 20-year-old left-arm seamer. He's deceived him with the off-cutter here. It was slanted across well wide of off, Buttler - almost premeditatedly - wanted to slug it through midwicket but goes through with it too early. Went up off the toe-end and the keeper Pooran took a fine catch running back towards fine leg. Big celebrations from Punjab, particularly Ashwin. Buttler c Pooran b Arshdeep Singh 23(17) [4s-1 6s-2]

Shankar to du Plessis, out Caught by Bairstow!! One brings two!! Shankar uses his height and bowls the scramble seam short of length delivery outside off, Faf made room early and was looking to go over cover, gets a faint outside edge and YJB does the rest behind the stumps. du Plessis c Bairstow b Shankar 45(31) [4s-3 6s-3]

Rashid Khan to Raina, out Lbw!! Raina has been given out lbw off Rashid. CSK review: Fair delivery, looks to be pitching in line and no bat involved. Umpire's call on hitting and he has to go. Hasn't been at his fluent best and this shot is a firm proof of that. Just looks to slog without having a real sense of where the ball pitched and he loses his shape in the process, swings way too early and Rashid's floaty legbreak clonks him in front of middle. Technology shows it to be brushing the leg bail. Just enough. Raina lbw b Rashid Khan 13(13) [4s-2]

Rashid Khan to Kedar Jadhav, out Lbw!! Kedar Jadhav's out lbw. Another review from CSK: Legal delivery and there seems to be no bat involved. Has it done too much though, the googly? He's struck in line with off and there's another umpire's call on hitting. Shaving the top of leg peg. OUT!! A rather simple set-up this from Rashid, bowled the wrong 'un and gave it ample flight to draw Jadhav on the front foot. The batsman clearly didn't pick the variation and his forward stride meant he was struck adjacent to middle and leg. Kedar Jadhav lbw b Rashid Khan 1(2)

Khaleel Ahmed to Billings, out Caught by Shankar!! Nought for Billings. Been strangled with a slew of dots and he lets the pressure get better off him. A slower full ball outside off, Billings didn't really have the pace to force the uppish drive but he goes for it and chips a dolly of a catch to Vijay Shankar at cover. Billings c Shankar b Khaleel Ahmed 0(4)

Nadeem to Watson, out Bowled!! A hint of uncertainity consumes Shane Watson. He was on the back foot, trying to cut this off his off-stump but the ball doesn't turn as expected and grips a touch before crashing into off peg. Smart bowling from Nadeem as he landed it in line with off to keep Watson honest. Watson b Nadeem 31(29) [4s-4]

Tahir to Shankar, out Caught by Billings!! The RRR may be in the 3s, but that's not bad enough for Tahir to deny himself the marathon-to-nowhere celebration. And he's earned it with a ripper of a leg-break - pitching on a length, drawing Shankar forward in classical style, only to spit up a touch more off the pitch and take the splice through to the keeper. Shankar c Billings b Tahir 7(11)

Karn Sharma to Hooda, out Caught by du Plessis!! Ah, that desire to unleash your inner Dhoni, I0$ desire to smack big when singles could do just as well. Well Hooda falls for just I0$. So he rushes down, tries to hoick one downtown, but in the end ends up just too close to the pitch of it, miscuing it big time to a backtracking mid-off. Hooda c du Plessis b Karn Sharma 13(16) [4s-1]

Chahar to Warner, out Caught by du Plessis!! Fuller, slower delivery and has hit it straight to the man at mid-off. Backed away, toe-ended it and could not infuse any momentum on the shot to hole out. But he has done his job. CSK strike but seems a little too late in the context of the game. Change of pace has accounted for another wicket though. Warner c du Plessis b Chahar 50(25) [4s-10]

Tahir to Williamson, out Caught&Bowled!! That has happened all evening long.
