Flatter outside off, stopped and bounced on the batter, Williamson goes through with his punch and hits it back to the bowler. Tahir does his celebratory run. CSK get a quick second wicket. But they need a horde of them now to even think of making a match of it from here. Williamson c and b Tahir 3(5)

Rahul Chahar to Shreyas Iyer, out Bowled!! Quite a ripper from Chahar, pitching leg and hitting off. Along the way, it brought Iyer tentatively forward, then beat him with the dip, before spinning past his outside edge. Mumbai Indians are all over the Capitals. Shreyas Iyer b Rahul Chahar 3(6)

Bumrah to Pant, out Bowled!! Knocked up clean. Pant goes for a very un-Kotla-approved drive - you know, away from his body, on the up - missing the line completely and with Bumrah making it worse with the extreme jag back in off the pitch. And off-stump's on a cartwheel. And so are Delhi's hopes tonight. Pant b Bumrah 7(11)

Malinga to Chris Morris, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Yup, the slog was always on the way. Malinga knew, oh he surely did, taking pace off his millionth full-cutter tonight. Surely Morris knew THIS was coming too, but with the RRR touching 20, he had to go for the smash. So he clears his front leg, doesn't really get under the length but still swings, dragging it off the under-edge to a running in long-on. Chris Morris c Hardik Pandya b Malinga 11(9) [6s-1]

Bumrah to Axar, out K Paul Run Out!! Well it can get worse. Bumrah - if his yorker doesn't get you, his direct hit will. Axar just dug it out down the pitch but Paul nevertheless was half way down the pitch. Bumrah fielded, lined up, aimed, waited, aimed better and nailed the throw at the non-striker's. It helps when Paul gives up and stands to watch it as well. K Paul run out (Bumrah) 0(0)

Bumrah to Axar, out Bowled!! Full, all-pace, dead straight on middle. Well, certain things in life are just too good. This one was better than that good. Poor Axar, he tried backing away to carve it through sweeper, but ended up missing it all ends up. It's middle's turn to get uprooted. Axar b Bumrah 26(23) [4s-1 6s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Rabada, out Caught by Pollard!! It's a new entrant into the Dinesh Karthik school of catching - taking blunders after dropping lollies. And this is tough-er, with Rabada throwing his hands at a wide one and inside-outing the carve over extra cover. Pollard's at the boundary - running to his right, taking it palms pointing sideways. Rabada c Pollard b Hardik Pandya 9(8) [6s-1]

Rahul Chahar to Dhawan, out Bowled!! That looked a good shout for leg-before, and probably would've been given. But the umpire didn't need to bother eventually, as Dhawan managed to drag it back into the stumps somehow. Leg-break that straightened on middle, Dhawan missed his reverse-sweep and was struck low on the pad. It then ricocheted onto his gloves and was deflected back into the stumps. Dhawan b Rahul Chahar 35(22) [4s-5 6s-1]

Rahul Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Holes out at long-on. Advanced down for a big shot, not quite getting to the pitch of the leg-break, so it came right off the toe-end from Shaw. With the hardness of the ball fading, and with both openers dismissed, it's getting difficult for Delhi now. Prithvi Shaw c Hardik Pandya b Rahul Chahar 20(24) [4s-2]

Krunal Pandya to Munro, out Bowled!! Yorked! 108kph from Krunal again as he fires it in from round the wicket, and it slips right underneath Munro who was late on the ball. Knocks over the base of off stump. His struggle at the crease, worth 9 balls, ends. Munro b Krunal Pandya 3(9)

Rabada to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Pant!! Excellent reflexes from Pant, KG has his man! Goes wide of the crease and digs the short ball into the surface, doesn't get as much bounce and the ball grips enough to mess SKY's plans to scoop it over the keeper. Takes the toe-end and flies to the right of Pant who adjusts nicely to pouch it safe on the dive. Suryakumar Yadav c Pant b Rabada 26(27) [4s-2]

Rabada to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Pant!! And Rabada has his man. The pacer's ego was hurt. And he retorts with a bumper. Hardik Pandya is late on it and the ball scooped up for the keeper to take it. Superb bouncer as it was at the body and cramped the batter for room. Hardik Pandya c Pant b Rabada 32(15) [4s-2 6s-3]

Mishra to Rohit, out Bowled!! Peach from Mishra. Absolute peach. Knocks over Rohit's middle-stump with a ripping leg-break and he's off. 150th wicket for Mishra in IPL - only the second bowler to achieve that feat. What a start for him and DC draw first blood. It was pitched on middle and leg, Rohit was waiting on the back foot and misjudges it. It also stayed low and spun sharply to make it difficult for the MI captain as he was rooted to the crease. Rohit b Mishra 30(22) [4s-3 6s-1]

Axar to Cutting, out Lbw!! Cutting misses a sweep and is trapped plumb in front. He doesn't even bother to review and walks off. So, the promotion not working for MI. Always dangerous to sweep someone like Axar, who is a skiddy customer and very accurate. Cutting premeditated it, sank low and it just zipped through quicker to rap him on the pad. Too quick for the Australian as he failed to get any bat on it. Umpire Nigel Llong raises his index finger and he's spot on. It was crashing the middle stump and Mumbai have lost two wickets in two overs. Cutting lbw b Axar 2(4)

Axar to Suryakumar Yadav, out de Kock Run Out!! Needless stuff from Mumbai. Will this prove to be a game-changing moment? SKY cut this flat delivery straight to Rabada at backward point and he instantly ambled forward before aborting his sprint midway down the pitch, de Kock though was committed on the run and he kept racing to the other end seamlessly. Rabada spotted the hara-kiri and fired a smart throw to Pant who relayed it back to the bowler to catch de Kock a country mile short of his crease. de Kock run out (Rabada/Pant/Axar) 35(27) [4s-2 6s-2]

Steyn to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Kohli!! Steyn is thrilled to bits and he totally deserves all of it. A full inswinger and Chris Lynn's lack of feet movement meant he chipped the drive straight down the throat of Kohli at mid-off. Came right off the cue end. Chris Lynn c Kohli b Steyn 1(2)

Stoinis to Uthappa, out Caught by Negi!! That brings an end to Uthappa's struggle. Finally! This innings has actually taken the life out of the chase. Too much to do! Guess even Russell can't do anything from here on. A short ball around off, Uthappa goes for a pull and mistimes it horribly. Negi at deep square leg takes a comfortable catch and out walks Dre Russ to a huge cheer from the crowd. Uthappa c Negi b Stoinis 9(20) [4s-1]

Moeen Ali to A Russell, out A Russell Run Out!! Russell walks back after playing a gem. So near yet so far. He did all that was possible, but even that wasn't enough. Swings this one to deep mid-wicket and finds him short at the bowler's end as Kohli fires in a rocket throw at the bowler's end. A Russell run out (Kohli/Moeen Ali) 65(25) [4s-2 6s-9]

Navdeep Saini to Narine, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Sees Narine making room and pounds the short ball wide of off-stump, Narine couldn't control his instincts having cleared his front leg way too early, finds a thick top-edge on the swat pull. All Parthiv Patel needed to do was amble back a few inches to pounch the catch, good pace from Navdeep Saini. Narine c Parthiv Patel b Navdeep Saini 18(16) [4s-4]

Steyn to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Kohli!! Juggling take by Virat Kohli. RCB have three, Steyn has two. Pinned this full ball at the base of off-stump asking the youngster to go aerial if he can, Gill obliges and seeks to loft it over the infield but doesn't get any timing on that. Skews it off the cue end and it loops up over mid-off where Kohli gathers the rebound with his left hand after having juggled it twice on the first attempt. Shubman Gill c Kohli b Steyn 9(11) [4s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, out Caught by Prasidh!! And Kuldeep Yadav has the final laugh but the damage has been done. What a knock from Ali. He's put RCB in a prime position. Kuldeep went round the wicket and slowed it up, Ali sits low and attempts a big heave. Miscues it big time and skies it as far as long-on. Prasidh neatly settles under it and some respite for KKR. Moeen Ali c Prasidh b Kuldeep Yadav 66(28) [4s-5 6s-6]

Gurney to Kohli, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Finally, he's been dismissed. Fullish on middle, probably a tired shot from Kohli as he can't middle this swipe. It comes off the bottom and picks out Shubman at deep mid-wicket. Kohli c Shubman Gill b Gurney 100(58) [4s-9 6s-4]

Narine to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Nitish Rana!! Parthiv and a slog can't be kept away for long. He'd tried it against Prasidh's pace and taken blows on his tummy, he does against Narine, only for a top-edge. One-kneed, stepping away from his stumps and then swipes across the line. Gets only height on this miscue, for Rana - at deep mid-wicket - to run and juggle. Parthiv Patel c Nitish Rana b Narine 11(11) [4s-2]

A Russell to Akshdeep Nath, out Caught by Uthappa!! Well this was coming. Nath was scratching around, playing a couple of shots every ball, and he succumbs to it again. It's more of a skidder this time, cramping Nath for room as he pulls across the line, only to sky the top-edge. Uthappa runs in for it, so does Russell and neither call. But Uthappa's just a touch quicker, plucking it from right over Russell's nose. Akshdeep Nath c Uthappa b A Russell 13(15) [6s-1]

Binny to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by D Kulkarni!! Gone! He had no choice but to go after the bowling. There is plenty of batting still left for Mumbai. Slower short of length delivery and Suryakumar is backing away, all cramped up he tries to pull but only manages a top-edge to deep backward square, Kulkarni covers ground to his right and takes a well-judged catch. Suryakumar Yadav c D Kulkarni b Binny 34(33) [4s-1 6s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to de Kock, out Caught by Stokes!! Back to back wickets for Rajasthan. Two new batsmen at the crease. Not what Mumbai would have wanted. de Kock needed to be smarter and batted through. He decides to take on Gopal's googly and miscues it horribly towards long-on, Stokes settles under it and he ain't dropping those. de Kock c Stokes b Shreyas Gopal 65(47) [4s-6 6s-2]

Unadkat to Pollard, out Bowled!! Unadkat has the last laugh and boy look at him, he's pumped! After bowling a length delivery the left arm pacer comes back strongly to get KP with a slower one. Pollard never really read it and was too early in his shot. Tried to play across the line as the off-cutter went through him and took down the sticks. Pollard b Unadkat 10(7) [6s-1]

Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, out Lbw!! Rajasthan review against Hardik! Looks very close but might probably be umpire's call. In fact, it's out. Pitching in line, impact in line and it's hitting the leg-stump. Terrific yorker by Jofra as Hardik couldn't connect his flick. The ball struck the sole of his shoe and replays confirm that he's a dead duck. Hardik Pandya lbw b Jofra Archer 23(15) [4s-2 6s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to Rohit, out Caught&Bowled!! Innocuous dismissal for Rohit, lovely stuff from Shreyas - this was the wrong 'un, Rohit came down the track, didn't get close to the ball, with bat and pad close-by, he pushed with hard hands, a simple lobe back at the bowler and it's celebration time amongst the Royals. Rohit c and b Shreyas Gopal 5(7) [4s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Smith, out Riyan Parag Run Out!! 1 run completed. Rocket armer Cutting. Smith actually does decently to chip it softly through mid-wicket, and calls for the second immediately. But Cutting's quick to get to it and fire it back really flat and one-bounced to Pandya, waiting right next to the stumps. Well, well, well, Parag ain't becoming the youngest ever IPL 50-ian. But leave that, have the favourites turned? Riyan Parag run out (Cutting/Hardik Pandya) 43(29) [4s-5 6s-1]

Bumrah to Turner, out Lbw!! Duck. Duck. And Ashton Turner's Indian journey after the miracle at Mohali has been a real disaster. Bumrah - meanwhile - is doing what he does best, fire it in quick, dead straight on the stumps. Turner doesn't help his cause either, shuffling a little too much and then getting beaten for pace as well as he tries to tuck it away. The mother of plumb. Turner lbw b Bumrah 0(1)

Malinga to Rahane, leg byes, 1 run, Mumbai Indians review against Rahane! Rohit took his time, had a discussion with his team mates and signals for the review with just a second to go. Looks a bad call though. Rahane was way outside his crease when the ball struck him and the replays confirm the ball to be missing the stumps by a fair margin. He was trying to flick across the line but got beaten as the ball struck him on the pads. Impact was umpire's call and it was going over the stumps

Rahul Chahar to Rahane, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Chahar comes into the attack and gets the breakthrough straightaway. Got three crucial wickets in the previous match too. Invites the batsman by tossing this one outside off and Rahane falls for it. Chips it towards cover where Suryakumar takes a catch diving forward. Rahane c Suryakumar Yadav b Rahul Chahar 12(12) [4s-2]

Rahul Chahar to Samson, out Caught by Pollard!! Advances down looking to go all the way, but Chahar hasn't allowed him to get to the pitch. As a result, there's some room for the ball to turn, which is enough to take the outside half of the bat. Goes straight up and MI couldn't have asked for anyone better than Pollard to get underneath. Desperately needed this wicket, the visitors. Samson c Pollard b Rahul Chahar 35(19) [4s-6 6s-1]

Rahul Chahar to Stokes, out Bowled!! Chops it back on! Poor from Stokes. Hardly has had his eye in, and tries to cut a leg-break from off stump. Gets inevitably cramped for room. Mumbai have more than an opening now, especially given Royals' track-record this season. Stokes b Rahul Chahar 0(2)

Viljoen to Dhawan, out Caught by Ashwin!! That's a fantastic catch by Ashwin. Takes a well judged catch at mid-wicket running to his left. Even Gayle was circling around but it's the skipper who takes it eventually. Just as we were praising Dhawan for playing another gem of a knock he's thrown it away. Got outfoxed due to the slower delivery as he swung across the line and got a top-edge on his drag. He has done his job though. Should be a walk in the park for Delhi unless they face another dramatic batting collapse. Dhawan c Ashwin b Viljoen 56(41) [4s-7 6s-1]

Viljoen to Pant, out Caught by Sam Curran!! Pant throws his wicket as he tries a fancy shot. Goes down on his knee to pick the length delivery over deep square leg but ends up getting a top-edge. Curran settles himself under it and pouches it safely. Hopefully the batsmen to follow next bat sensibly. There was no need for Pant to try out anything like this. Pant c Sam Curran b Viljoen 6(7) [4s-1]

Shami to Ingram, out Bowled!! Sweet sound of timber! Ingram walks down the wicket to play this but Shami slips in yorker and nails it to perfection. The batsman couldn't do nothing there as the middle stump was uprooted. Is there a twist in the tale? Surely not! Ingram b Shami 19(9) [4s-4]

Shami to Axar, out Axar Run Out!! 1 run completed. This match is turning out to be a humdinger. Second wicket in as many balls. Axar plays this one with soft hands towards deep square leg and called for two. While charging back for the second Shami somewhat got in his way and hence the batsman couldn't really take off. Mayank fires in a throw at the striker's end and Patel is nowhere in the frame. Drama! Delhi don't like easy wins, is it? Axar run out (Agarwal/Rahul) 1(1)

Viljoen to Dhawan, out Prithvi Shaw Run Out!! Confusion^confusion. Shikhar calls, runs half way down, but is ball-watching all through as he does. Shaw responds, only to be sent back. And hence when both of them are stuck half way down the pitch, Mandeep nails the direct hit. How did it get to Mandeep? Well, it was a msicued chip to cover. Prithvi Shaw run out (Mandeep) 13(11) [4s-1 6s-1]

Lamichhane to Rahul, out Stumped!! Appeal for a stumping and Pant looks confident. He's on the line and that means KL is OUT. That's some comeback from Lamichhane, a beaut of a leg-break, drifted in from outside off, dragged Rahul forward and then spun past his outside edge. Rahul was lunging forward in defence, dragged his right-foot out and Pant is quick enough to whip the bails - even as Rahul's feet stayed static on the line. Good bargain for Lamichhane, 10 runs and a big wicket so far. Rahul st Pant b Lamichhane 12(9) [4s-1 6s-1]

Lamichhane to Gayle, out Caught by Axar!! Stunning work! This is the perfect definition of team work by Ingram and Axar. Lamichhane has traveled a lot but will be relieved to see the back of Gayle. The wrong 'un which is fraction short, Gayle does not get enough power behind the pull shot, skies it to deep mid-wicket where Ingram is waiting, he takes it right on the edge of the boundary cushion and since the momentum was taking him over, he threw the ball all the way to Axar near long-on. The back hand flick was just perfect as Axar didn't have to move much. Huge moment in the game. Gayle c Axar b Lamichhane 69(37) [4s-6 6s-5]

Lamichhane to Sam Curran, out Caught&Bowled!! Second wicket in the over. What a day Lamichhane is having. Belted by KL, picked his wicket. Smashed around the park by Gayle, sent him back as well and now picks another. The googly which sticks in the surface a tad more than Curran expected, he is early into the back foot push and lobs a dolly back to Lamichhane. He flings it up and pumps his fist. Boy isn't he delighted. Sam Curran c and b Lamichhane 0(4)

Axar to Mandeep, out Stumped!! Some really smart bowling. Mandeep gives away his cards early, running down the pitch even before Axar gets into his delivery stride - allowing him all the time to fire it short and well outside off. Obvious miss, sneaking under the bat and Pant's gloves almost outdo Dhoni. Mandeep st Pant b Axar 30(27) [4s-1 6s-1]

Rabada to Ashwin, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Skiddy 143.4kph bumper into the ribs. Ashwin had to go after everything, obviously it is the 20th over, and he tries a tennis-like-pull on this one. But can only mistime it to long-on, where Iyer, after misjudging, does well to dive in front to pluck it cleanly enough. Ashwin c Shreyas Iyer b Rabada 16(14) [4s-2]

Rabada to Agarwal, out Caught by Rutherford!! This was always coming! Four dot balls and Mayank throws his wicket away, came down the track way too early - Rabada saw it and went short, good pace and good bounce - cramped for room, Mayank's attempted cross-batted swat went nowhere, straight up in the air and towards cover-point. The debutant Rutherford was under the ball, watched it like a hawk and completes the catch. Agarwal c Rutherford b Rabada 2(9)

Axar to Miller, out Caught by Prithvi Shaw!! One shot too many and KXIP batsmen are throwing away their wickets - trying to match Gayle's power. Not a smart shot from Miller, ran down the track, got himself too close to the ball, went through with the lofted on-drive, plenty of height but not the distance. Shaw settled underneath the skier at deep mid-wicket and holds on. What are KXIP trying to achieve? This isn't a 200 wicket for sure. Miller c Prithvi Shaw b Axar 7(5) [4s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Rinku Singh, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Rinku Singh departs after a handy knock! Time for Dre Russ to walk in next. Was a short ball around middle and leg and Rinku pulled it straight to deep mid-wicket. The Afghan leggie charges to his left and takes a fine sliding catch to bring an end to Singh's stay at the crease. Rinku Singh c Rashid Khan b Sandeep Sharma 30(25) [4s-1 6s-2]

Khaleel Ahmed to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Williamson!! Lynn runs out of patience. Frustrated with a flurry of mistimed strokes he decides to smash this over cover and could only chip it inside the ring. Williamson runs to his left from cover and times his slide to perfection to claim a fine catch. Chris Lynn c Williamson b Khaleel Ahmed 51(47) [4s-4 6s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to A Russell, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Oh, the Dre Russ fireworks has been cut short. It's the best Sunrisers bowling combo that does the trick. Bhuvi looks to pin the yorker but feeds a low full toss on the pads instead, Russell batters it off the cue end and he didn't get as much of an elevation as he would have liked. Straight down the throat of Rashid at deep mid-wicket. A Russell c Rashid Khan b Bhuvneshwar 15(9) [6s-2]

Rashid Khan to Chawla, out Caught by Bairstow!! Chawla has done all sorts of Bollywood moves whilst at the crease. It's very hard to hit Rashid Khan with such constant shuffly movements. So, Piyush Chawla tries to reverse swat Rashid Khan over short third but all he could manage was a fine tickle on the glove. Sharp reflexes from YJB. Chawla c Bairstow b Rashid Khan 4(8) [4s-1]

Khaleel Ahmed to Narine, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! But KKR will reckon he has done his job. Khaleel is pumped. He tried the short ball - didn't work. Tried the yorker - didn't work. What was left? The slower ball - worked. The off-cutter and it holds up on the surface, Narine is through his heave early and the ball arrives later to uproot the leg-stump. Narine b Khaleel Ahmed 25(8) [4s-3 6s-2]

Khaleel Ahmed to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Shankar!! Another slower delivery. Another wicket. Khaleel might go for runs but he's a wicket-taker. Angled it across the right hander, Gill wanted to drive but was into the shot early, sliced it towards backward point where Shankar takes a good catch. SRH pulling things back after that quick start. Shubman Gill c Shankar b Khaleel Ahmed 3(4)

Bhuvneshwar to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Bairstow!! Brought back and Bhuvi strikes first ball. It is the in-form Rana who has to depart. Short of length and bit of extra lift in the corridor around off-stump, Rana tries to steer to third man but is undone by the bounce, the outside edge carries at a nice height for Bairstow. Nitish Rana c Bairstow b Bhuvneshwar 11(11) [4s-1]

Nadeem to Karthik, out Karthik Run Out!! 1 run completed. KKR have lost four wickets and Rashid Khan is yet to bowl. 4 overs of him remaining. This was a suicidal second by DK and he's livid with himself. Had flicked the flatter delivery to deep mid-wicket and two was the call straightaway. He decides to take on one of the best fielders in SRH's team though. Shankar charges in towards the ball, gathers it neatly and gets rid of the ball in the blink of an eye. Bairstow collects the ball and takes down the bails and DK's dive ain't enough as he's well short of the crease. Karthik run out (Shankar/Bairstow) 6(4) [4s-1]

Yarra Prithviraj to Warner, out Bowled!! And Yarra Prithviraj exults. He has got his first IPL wicket and that is Warner. He would want to cherish this amidst the gloom surrounding KKR. The KKR camp can hardly celebrate. Slower delivery at the sticks, Warner was through with his slog a little too early and the wickets were disturbed. Warner b Yarra Prithviraj 67(38) [4s-3 6s-5]

Steyn to Watson, out Caught by Stoinis!! The away swinger does it. Spills the ball outside off and Watson looks to drive and edges it to the man at first slip. That flew off the blade and was taken by the slip fielder who sat under it and took it over his head. Nice carry off the wicket as the batter threw his hands at it. CSK have lost Watto early, again. Watson c Stoinis b Steyn 5(3) [4s-1]

Steyn to Raina, out Bowled!! Whatta delivery! Between the legs and the bat to rattle the sticks. Steyn guns down Raina here. Back-to-back wickets for RCB and Steyn. Inch-perfect yorker with the new nut. Chinnaswamy erupts as well. RCB fans have found their voices again. Game on! Steyn, what an inspiration. Raina b Steyn 0(1)

Chahal to Rayudu, out Bowled!! Chahal has broken through. Just what RCB needed of him. It's the drift that gets Rayudu here. Curves in nicely towards leg-stump, slips past the inside edge into the front pad, before ricocheting onto the stumps. Brilliant from Chahal. Rayudu b Chahal 29(29) [4s-2 6s-1]

Navdeep Saini to Dhoni, out Jadeja Run Out!! Both batsmen are at the striker's end, and Saini calmly picks the ball up and runs at his end for the run out. He had rushed Dhoni for pace with this short ball, inducing a mistimed pull shot beside the pitch. Dhoni initially came down for a single, which set Jadeja on his way, but then turned his back on him. There was no turning back for Jadeja from there. Jadeja run out (Navdeep Saini) 11(12)

Navdeep Saini to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Short of length on off, Bravo swings wildly but only manages a top-edge through to the keeper. There's a check on the no-ball but Saini is fine, just. Dwayne Bravo c Parthiv Patel b Navdeep Saini 5(4)

U Yadav to Dhoni, out SN Thakur Run Out!! What drama! What unbearable drama. But RCB, who almost looked like having a meltdown in the final over, have been bailed out by a direct-hit from Parthiv Patel. Very brave from Umesh initially to go for the slower off-cutter. And his execution is spot on, as it sneaks through Dhoni's attempted cut. They have to run, and Parthiv is alert to it. With the ball bouncing just in front of him, the gather couldn't have been easy, but he makes no mistake and his throw at the stumps is on target too, finding Thakur just short. SN Thakur run out (Parthiv Patel) 0(0)

U Yadav to du Plessis, out Caught by de Villiers!! Short ball, gets big on the batter and du Plessis looking to pull, gets a top-edge for ABD to take it. Almost collided with Nath trying to take it. But completes the catch without any fuss. CSK are three down now and in deep trouble. Once again are three down inside the powerplay. RCB have turned this game around on its head. du Plessis c de Villiers b U Yadav 5(15)

U Yadav to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by de Villiers!! RCB pacers are on fire and we haven't said that very often in the history of IPL. Ah, this is some night for the RCB fans. Umesh kept rattling the batsmen with pace and something had to give; Jadhav tries to go across the line and doesn't bother to move his feet while at it. It takes the thick top-edge and lands straight in the bucket hands of AB at mid-off. Kedar Jadhav c de Villiers b U Yadav 9(9) [4s-2]

Jadeja to Akshdeep Nath, out Caught by du Plessis!! Jadeja gets rid of Akshdeep Nath. He shimmies down the wicket and lofts the delivery high up in the air. The ball went miles up in the air but it could travel as far as deep mid-off. du Plessis charges in from the deep, settles underneath the skier and takes it safely. Akshdeep Nath c du Plessis b Jadeja 24(20) [4s-1 6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Watson!! Parthiv departs after getting to his fifty. That has been the problem with him this season. Not able to carry on and get a big score. Makes room and slaps the short ball straight to Watson at who was stationed close to the ring at covers. Time for Moeen to walk in next. Parthiv Patel c Watson b Dwayne Bravo 53(37) [4s-2 6s-4]

Tahir to Stoinis, out Caught by (sub)Shorey!! Catch of the season? Faf has done something remarkable here. Heaved down the ground, Faf held his balance at the fence and scooped it up for the man at long-on - Shorey - who was closeby to take it. Credit to Shorey as well not to distract Faf and also linger closeby in case something like this happened. Superb presence of mind to throw the ball away in the nick of the time. Stoinis c (sub)Shorey b Tahir 14(13) [6s-1]

Chahar to Negi, out Caught by Rayudu!! Scoops up a length ball which bounced a touch higher and the man at point takes it. That got big on him, Negi could not keep it down and the man at point took an easy catch. RCB have been poor at the death. Negi c Rayudu b Chahar 5(6)

Dwayne Bravo to Moeen Ali, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Looks to launch the slower ball and holes out at long-off. That was touch slower off the deck and Moeen Ali wanted to muscle it down the ground only to find the man in the deep. Thakur after it taking does a gig. CSK continue their good work at the death. Moeen Ali c SN Thakur b Dwayne Bravo 26(16) [4s-5]

Chahar to Kohli, out Caught by Dhoni!! Gone! Chahar has the big wicket and he's unstoppable. He goes off on a run like Tahir. Perfect start for CSK. RCB's lynchpin is sent back early. Good length ball outside off, Kohli drives without accounting for the swing and the outside edge is found, Dhoni dives to his right and takes it safely. That is the area to bowl to Kohli in whatever format - on a good length and outside off. Kohli c Dhoni b Chahar 9(8) [4s-2]

Jadeja to de Villiers, out Caught by du Plessis!! de Villiers gone! Faf judges it perfectly. Jadeja gets the big wicket. RCB's backbone is back in the hut within 7 overs. de Villiers shimmies down the wicket, isn't to the pitch and the ball turns a bit as well, the cue-end skies up towards long-off and Faf is right on the edge of the boundary rope. He takes it with his fingers pointing upwards. de Villiers c du Plessis b Jadeja 25(19) [4s-3 6s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Riyan Parag!! Much- needed wicket for Royals. It was a flighted delivery on a fuller length, Prithvi Shaw wanted to dispatch it over long-on. It spins away and due to that Prithvi Shaw failed to time it as well as he would have liked it. Parah at long-on came under it and takes it with utmost ease. Prithvi Shaw c Riyan Parag b Shreyas Gopal 42(39) [4s-4 6s-1]

D Kulkarni to Rutherford, out Caught by Riyan Parag!! Staright to long-off. A short little cameo from Rutherford! He has helped bring down the required rate but would have wanted to take his team home. It was a slower one on a back of a length, Rutherford wanted to lift it over long-off ends up finding it where parag makes no mistake. Rutherford c Riyan Parag b D Kulkarni 11(5) [4s-1 6s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, out Stumped!! Gopal's come back superbly. He's spotted Dhawan advance down the pitch, and so he's fired this well wide outside off to beat him. Samson completes a nice stumping. Dhawan st Samson b Shreyas Gopal 54(27) [4s-8 6s-2]

Riyan Parag to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Stokes!! Iyer holes out at deep midwicket. Maybe the perils of good form, which gave him enough confidence to go after the bowling straightaway. But this comes right off the toe-end as he heaves it from outside off. Easy catch for Stokes. Shreyas Iyer c Stokes b Riyan Parag 4(5)

Rabada to Rahane, out Samson Run Out!! Absolute waste of a wicket! Samson is livid as he walks back to the hut but he is also partly to blame. Was an in-angler on a good length and Rahane dabbed it towards the short mid-wicket region. Always was a risky run with Rabada quickly moving across in his followthrough and there is a massive mix up with Samson way down the track. All three stumps to aim at and Rabada doesn't miss. Not the start that the Royals were looking for. Samson run out (Rabada) 0(0)

Axar to Smith, out Caught by Chris Morris!! How often have we seen this? A batsman throwing it away after reaching the milestone. Smith uses his feet, looks to go straight and throws his weight into the lofted hit over mid-off, he seemed to have got enough height on that but Morris set himself cleverly on the edge of the long-off boundary to claim a well-judged catch. Smith c Chris Morris b Axar 50(32) [4s-8]

Chris Morris to Stokes, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Stokes is disappointed with himself and rightly so. He's failed to take toll of a full toss. Doesn't really move around the crease, just looks to power it away over mid-wicket but doesn't get the required timing on that. Catching practice for Shreyas Iyer at long-on. Stokes c Shreyas Iyer b Chris Morris 8(8) [4s-1]

Ishant to Turner, out Caught by Rutherford!! Hat-trick of golden ducks for Turner! Becomes the first ever batsman to get out for five successive ducks in T20 cricket. Can you believe it! Things going from bad to worse! Gets deceived due to the slower delivery once again and chips the fullish delivery straight to Rutherford at extra cover. Turner c Rutherford b Ishant 0(1)

Rabada to Binny, out Bowled!! You miss, I hit. Rabada goes full and straight, very close to a yorker. Binny makes room to smash that but the speed is enough to beat him. Goes through his flashy drive and knocks over the middle-stick. Picks up the ball and hands over to Rabada too. Binny b Rabada 19(13) [4s-2]

Rabada to Riyan Parag, out Bowled!! Bull's eye! Rabada cleans up Parag with a full toss as the batsman backs away to smash the ball away. At the speed of which Rabada is bowling, it's never so easy. The leg stump is uprooted but Rajashtan have managed to post an excellent score of 191/6. Riyan Parag b Rabada 4(3) [4s-1]

Rashid Khan to Raina, out Stumped!! Walks right past the googly, didn't have a clue about it! Fuller length from Rashid, pitched around middle and Raina was looking to work it through the on-side, expecting a leg-break. But he's wrong. He's also reaching for the ball, as it has pitched well short of him, and so the balance - the lack of it - takes him out of the crease. Excellent stumping from Bairstow. Raina st Bairstow b Rashid Khan 38(24) [4s-6 6s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, out Caught by Bairstow!! Watson is walking! No century but hasn't he put on a show tonight or what! Was a good short ball from Bhuvneshwar and Watson got rushed on the pull. There was a definite top edge as it went through to Bairstow who took a stunning one-handed catch, diving to his left. The umpire was probably blinded and didn't know what to do. Watson did the right thing, would have been out anyway if SRH reviewed this. Ends a sensational knock from one of IPL's and T20 cricket's legend. Watson c Bairstow b Bhuvneshwar 96(53) [4s-9 6s-6]

Sandeep Sharma to Rayudu, out Caught by Shankar!! Anti-climax for the CSK fans in the stadium. Rayudu wanted the winning hit but departs. Ends up miscuing the pull and top edges it straight in the air. Dolly for Shankar at mid-off and he gobbles it up. It's been a scratchy season for Rayudu and today is another innings of that kind. Rayudu c Shankar b Sandeep Sharma 21(25) [4s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to du Plessis, out du Plessis Run Out!! Appeal for a run-out taken upstairs! It's a direct-hit, mind you. Looks very close. Although du Plessis had put in a dive at the bowler's end, it's not enough. Touch and go! The batsman had driven the ball to Hooda at mid-off and a direct-hit at the bowler's end brings curtains to the South African's stay at the crease. Another awful start for CSK this season. du Plessis run out (Hooda) 1(7)

Harbhajan to Bairstow, out Caught by Dhoni!! An excellent IPL comes to a sorry end for Jonny. And Harbhajan as he has done throughout this IPL delivers for CSK with the new ball. It was a quicker one and was wide of off, it skids off the deck, takes the outside edge of Bairstow who plays down the wrong line. And Dhoni makes no mistake, he never does! Bairstow c Dhoni b Harbhajan 0(2)

Harbhajan to Warner, out Stumped!! Gives it plenty of air and catches Warner on the move. No balance from pocket rocket, swings wildly and the bottom hand comes off while doing so, his back foot got dragged too far in the process and Dhoni ain't missing that stumping chance. Warner st Dhoni b Harbhajan 57(45) [4s-3 6s-2]

Chahar to Shankar, out Caught by Jadeja!! Deepak Chahar ends his spell with a wicket. Just 7 runs in that over. Shankar was looking to clear the deep mid-wicket fence with this heave but he couldn't get the timing right. Holes out to the fielder in the deep and that brings an end to Shankar's handy cameo. Shankar c Jadeja b Chahar 26(20) [4s-2 6s-1]

Moeen Ali to Rahul, out Caught by Southee!! Ali strikes with his very first ball. His introduction was too tempting for Rahul, who advanced down and wanted to loft it straight. But he gets too close to the pitch of it, and miscues it off the toe-end for a simple catch at long-off. Kohli explodes in celebration, probably even gave a send-off. Two new batsmen at the crease now. Rahul c Southee b Moeen Ali 42(27) [4s-7 6s-1]

Navdeep Saini to Miller, out Caught by de Villiers!! ABD dives and ABD snaffles it. Kohli with the fist pump. It was a length delivery on the stumps, Miller wanted to smash it over long-on. He hasn't timed it all evening and he failed to do so on this occassion also. ABD dives to his right emphatically and takes a beauty! Miller c de Villiers b Navdeep Saini 24(25) [4s-2]

Navdeep Saini to Pooran, out Caught by de Villiers!! ABD takes it again. He is having a dream of a match. And the dangerous Pooran departs. RCB are surely winning it now. He fails to get under the delivery, swings hard at it. It goes a long way up in the air and lands in safe hands of ABD. Pooran c de Villiers b Navdeep Saini 46(28) [4s-1 6s-5]

U Yadav to Ashwin, out Caught by Kohli!! No, no, no. Ashwin is no Dhoni. And he has hit it straight to Kohli who it seems was asking Ashwin what the heck he was doing? Ashwin fails to get under it and mistimes it, hits it straight to Kohli at long-on. Ashwin absolutely throws his gloves after crossing the fence. He is frustrated, well that's an understatement. Ashwin c Kohli b U Yadav 6(2) [6s-1]

U Yadav to Viljoen, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Two in two for Yadav. And he will be on a hat-trick! Umesh has won the match for RCB. It was a short of length delivery near the left shoulder, Viljoen was hurried on the pull shot. It clips his glove and Parthiv takes a good catch diving to his left. Viljoen c Parthiv Patel b U Yadav 0(1)

U Yadav to Gayle, out Caught by de Villiers!! Gayle's gone, Kohli is pumped. Umesh Yadav shortens his length and Gayle is a touch late into his stroke. The southpaw was trying to heave it away and got it slightly off the top edge. Almost went the distance, but there was a fielder manning the fence. AB, at long-on, takes a calm catch. Gayle c de Villiers b U Yadav 23(10) [4s-4 6s-1]

Stoinis to Agarwal, out Caught by Chahal!! He's got this pull high on the bat, and the miscue is taken at midwicket. Stoinis screams in celebration, Kohli screams louder. Short of length, it was onto Agarwal quicker than he expected, and so there was no timing on the shot. Much needed for the RCB. Agarwal c Chahal b Stoinis 35(21) [4s-5 6s-1]

Shami to Kohli, out Caught by Mandeep!! Kohli throws it away once again. Looks to thump the drive over the ring, but gets hit high on the bat and Mandeep takes a dolly of a catch (head-high) at extra cover. Shami always gets a bit of extra zip with his pace and the ball seem to have arrived much quicker than Kohli anticipated. Kohli c Mandeep b Shami 13(8) [4s-2]

Murugan Ashwin to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Ashwin!! The Ashwin duo does it. Parthiv Patel stands in disbelief, he is cursing himself as he walks back to the pavilion. A well flighted delivery around middle and leg and thus, Parthiv thought he could flick it away into the leg-side, wasn't to be. Might have played the shot a touch too early and the leading edge pops up straight to the KXIP skipper at extra cover. Parthiv Patel c Ashwin b Murugan Ashwin 43(24) [4s-7 6s-2]

Ashwin to Moeen Ali, out Bowled!! Ashwin is jumping in joy and he has every reason to be so. Throws in a slider and he has beaten Moeen Ali all ends up, there was a huge gap between bat (on the lazy drive) and pad and the ball snuck through at a cunning pace to rattle middle and leg. Moeen Ali b Ashwin 4(5) [4s-1]

Viljoen to Akshdeep Nath, out Caught by Mandeep!! Stunned silence at the Chinnaswamy. They lost three wickets in three overs and are now in big trouble. Clever change of pace, on a length as well, Nath presses forward and has to check his shot, spoons a sitter to cover. Akshdeep Nath c Mandeep b Viljoen 3(7)

Aaron to Chris Lynn, out Bowled!! Chopped on! Aaron strikes and early troubles for KKR. A back of a length delivery at 140.9kph wide of off. It was there to be hit, but Lynn was lethargic as he threw his bat at it without any feet movement. Gets a big inside edge which cannons onto this sticks. Replays show that the ball nipped in a touch. Chris Lynn b Aaron 0(3)

Jofra Archer to Karthik, out Narine Run Out!! Oh no! What have you done Karthik? KKR didn't need this against the run of play. Slower delivery is nurdled in front of fine leg, Karthik is always looking for the second but he should know his partners well, Narine is not the swiftest and he's relcutant to go but does so after seeing his skipper next to him. Aaron throws to the bowler's end and Narine is nowhere near the frame. Narine run out (Aaron/Rahane) 11(8) [4s-1 6s-1]

Thomas to A Russell, out Caught by Riyan Parag!! Thomas wins the Caribbean battle. Third time lucky for RR. Binny and Chopra can't breathe easy now. No fireworks from Russell today. A good short delivery that had height on it, Russell had to fetch the pull from above his head, he cue-ends it and picks out Parag at deep mid-wicket. The youngster didn't flinch while taking such a high pressure catch. A Russell c Riyan Parag b Thomas 14(14) [6s-1]

Unadkat to Brathwaite, out Caught by Rahane!! Gone! Brathwaite does not make a mark at Eden Gardens. Another cutter and Brathwaite wanted to heave it into the crowd, does not generate enough power and mistimes it towards deep mid-wicket, where the safest hands are under it. Rahane runs to his right and takes a good catch. Brathwaite c Rahane b Unadkat 5(3) [4s-1]

Aaron to Shubman Gill, out Bowled!! That's a beauty from Varun Aaron! The slower knuckle ball from the pacer swung in sharply and Gill couldn't account for it. He was looking to ease it through the off-side and ended up playing outside the line of it. A faint inside edge and the ball crashes onto the stumps. Varun Aaron has removed both the openers. Shubman Gill b Aaron 14(14) [4s-2]

Shreyas Gopal to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Aaron!! KKR are struggling here. Varun Aaron in action again. A quick-ish googly that skids through off the deck outside off. On seeing the line, Nitish Rana went hard on the cut. He didn't bother to keep it down and paid the price. Offers a dolly to backward point and Aaron doesn't err. Nitish Rana c Aaron b Shreyas Gopal 21(26) [4s-3]

Chawla to Stokes, out Caught by A Russell!! Miscues the googly off the toe-end, and this is a brilliant catch at the edge of the boundary from Andre Russell. He leapt up, grabbed it overhead with both hands, and then landed with his feet just inside the ropes. Stokes is done for this season, a rather disappointing one for him! Stokes c A Russell b Chawla 11(10) [4s-2]

Chawla to Binny, out Caught by Rinku Singh!! Binny goes for the slog-sweep and holes out at deep midwicket. Considering spin has done all the damage so far, and that this is Chawla's final over, this isn't the smartest shot. He doesn't connect as well as he would've wanted, and gives Rinku Singh a simple catch in the deep. Binny c Rinku Singh b Chawla 11(11) [6s-1]

Prasidh to Shreyas Gopal, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Full ball on off, Gopal's loft is a mistimed one, and it's taken comfortably by long-off running in. Probably didn't need to press the trigger so early. Shreyas Gopal c Shubman Gill b Prasidh 18(9) [4s-4]

A Russell to Riyan Parag, out Hit Wkt!! Oh dear, Parag's bat has clattered into the stumps. He was rushed for pace on this short ball, just managed some glove on the attempted pull but proceeded to disturb the stumps on the followthrough. That's a bit unlucky, if you can call it that. What a knock he's played though to put his team in pole position. Riyan Parag hit wkt b A Russell 47(31) [4s-5 6s-2]

Narine to Rahane, out Lbw!! Narine gets the first breakthrough for KKR. Eden has found it's voice back. It was pitched in that brilliant area around off and on a fuller length, it straightened after hitting the deck. Rahane plays down the wrong line. It pinned him on the pads and looked plumb. Rahane did well not to waste a review for it. Rahane lbw b Narine 34(21) [4s-5 6s-1]

Chawla to Samson, out Bowled!! Cheekiness gets the better of Samson. He was trying to be too cute there, wanted to paddle it first then realised the line isn't there to play that shot. And went for a steer, in the end he got himself in a tangle and played a nothing shot. The googly went between his bat and pad and smashed the stumps. Chawla is pumped! Samson b Chawla 22(15) [6s-2]

Narine to Smith, out Bowled!! Narine has gone through the defence of Smith. And this match has changed all of a sudden in the last couple of overs. Sensational spell from Narine. There was nothing special in the delivery, Smith just misses it and it smashes his stumps. The decision of DK to give the extra over to Narine has worked brilliantly. Smith b Narine 2(6)

Malinga to Watson, out Caught by Rahul Chahar!! Malinga could have conceded three boundaries in the over but luckily for him Watson picks out the fielder at short fine leg. The Sri Lankan had fired this one down the leg side and the Australian flicks it straight to the uncapped Indian at short fine leg. Watson can't believe his luck but such is cricket. He was dropped in the last game by Bairstow but not tonight. Watson c Rahul Chahar b Malinga 8(4) [4s-2]

Anukul Roy to Shorey, out Caught by Rahul Chahar!! Scuffed off the inside half, taken at long-on. He wasn't quite to the pitch while going for the loft, and hence the miscue. CSK struggling to get the spinners away. Shorey c Rahul Chahar b Anukul Roy 5(8)

Bumrah to Vijay, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Has that been taken? They've gone upstairs to check, but it looks like a superb grab from Suryakumar. Soft signal is out. Short of length outside off, slower one, Vijay mistimes the cut in front of backward point. Now then, Surya was diving forward there. Did he have his fingers underneath? The ball has bounced into his palm, but did it bounce off the fingertips, or the ground? Tough call with the replays that are available. Soft signal is out, so that may be telling. Or does the third umpire have enough evidence to overrule the soft signal? No he doesn't. OUT on the big screen. CSK dugout doesn't look too happy. But based on all evidence and the soft signal on the field, that's probably a fair call. Vijay c Suryakumar Yadav b Bumrah 38(35) [4s-3 6s-1]

Malinga to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught&Bowled!! All the deliveries have been off-paced ones this over. Finally, it pays dividends for the Sri Lankan veteran. The cutter at 122kph and Bravo was early to close his bat-face. The ball popped up off the leading edge and Malinga had to take a couple of steps backwards to gobble it up. Dwayne Bravo c and b Malinga 20(17) [4s-2]

Bumrah to Chahar, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Krunal takes a good running catch! A seam-up short ball and Chahar had to go after it. Looks to pull/heave it away and was a touch late on the shot. Gets it off the lower part of the bat. No timing, whatsoever. Krunal runs in from deep mid-wicket, keeps watching the ball, dives forward to complete a superb catch. Chahar c Krunal Pandya b Bumrah 0(2)

Malinga to Harbhajan, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Third wicket for Malinga! The slower ball does the trick again. The cutter at 114.4kph, it was actually in the slot, but Harbhajan couldn't generate enough power with his big-swing of the bat. Holes out at long-on. Harbhajan c Hardik Pandya b Malinga 1(3)

Malinga to Santner, out Caught by Pollard!! A low full toss at 119kph, Santner goes for the lofted on-drive. Doesn't get the required elevation and Pollard takes a calm catch at long-on. Mumbai Indian win by 46 runs! Santner c Pollard b Malinga 22(20) [6s-2]

Hardik Pandya to Raina, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! That's a horrible shot by the CSK skipper! Swings hard at a short of a length delivery and miscues it completely. It's Suryakumar at backward point who takes the dolly, he ain't gonna drop those folks! Wicket on the first ball for Hardik, he got three against the same side at Wankhede a few weeks back. Raina c Suryakumar Yadav b Hardik Pandya 2(4)

Krunal Pandya to Rayudu, out Bowled!! That last ball, which gripped, must've had a bearing in this dismissal. Rayudu, expecting some turn this time, plays outside the line of the ball which sneaks through and crashes into middle and leg. 99.1kph from Krunal Pandya, just zipped through with the arm from round the wicket. Rayudu b Krunal Pandya 0(3)

Krunal Pandya to Kedar Jadhav, out Bowled!! Failed twice at the cut shot in the previous over from Chahar, and now Jadhav has perished to it. The line's too close to him this time as it skids in from round the wicket, absolutely no room to free the arms. Chops it back onto the stumps off the under-edge! Krunal Pandya is having a ball out there. Kedar Jadhav b Krunal Pandya 6(11)

Santner to Lewis, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! Taken! That ball was in the air for quite some time but Bravo was calm and composed to gobble it up. Lewis had to go after the left-arm spinner, he heaves it with all his might towards deep mid-wicket, but got more air time than distance. Bravo never looked in trouble while taking that. Lewis c Dwayne Bravo b Santner 32(30) [4s-3 6s-1]

Tahir to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Santner!! Tahir returns, Tahir strikes. Krunal was sent to counter the left-arm spinner and the leg-spinner but he perishes while doing so. Flighted around off-stump, Krunal kneels down and slog sweeps, he didn't get it anywhere close to the middle and ends up offering a sitter to Santner at deep mid-wicket. Krunal Pandya c Santner b Tahir 1(3)

Santner to Rohit, out Caught by Vijay! Santner is amidst a magnificent spell, choking the Mumbai batsmen with his spin. Tosses this one up around off and Rohit has to stretch in order to reach out. Lifts the ball high up in the air but fails in his quest to the clear the long-on boundary. Tired looking shot by the skipper but he's laid the foundation. Hopefully, Pollard and Pandya finish it off in style. They need to play out Santner first. Rohit c Vijay b Santner 67(48) [4s-6 6s-3]

Chahar to de Kock, out Caught by Rayudu!! He was put under pressure by de Kock in this over and he has responded in the best possible fashion with a wicket. Quality of a champion bowler. It was a well-disguised slower delivery, de Kock was totally taken aback by it. His bat swing came down much much early, it clipped his top-edge and went straight up in the air. Rayudu with the gloves takes it with ease. And Chahar picks up his mandatory wicket with the new cherry. de Kock c Rayudu b Chahar 15(9) [4s-1 6s-1]

Shakib to Rahane, out Caught by Warner!! Rahane throws his head back in disappointment as Warner completes the catch at long-off. He wanted to drive this much wider of him after giving himself some room. But couldn't open the face enough on contact. The timing is sweet, which is what brings Warner into play as it carries all the way to him. Rahane c Warner b Shakib 39(34) [4s-4 6s-1]

Khaleel Ahmed to Smith, out Caught by S Kaul!! Khaleel ends his spell with a wicket. Cramps up the batsman with a short ball and Smith takes one hand off his bat as he looks to pull it away. The timing wasn't great as he miscued it to fine leg. Kaul was the man in the deep who almost made a mess of it. Smith has done his job though as his team is within touching distance of an emphatic win. Smith c S Kaul b Khaleel Ahmed 22(16) [4s-3]

Rashid Khan to Livingstone, out Caught by Saha!! Flat leg-break turning away from off, Livingstone looks to whip it through the on-side but only manages an inside-edge which is taken smartly by Saha. He did have a word with Rahane about the review, may not have been entirely sure, but was happy to keep walking after getting little encouragement. Definite edge. Respite for the Sunrisers. Livingstone c Saha b Rashid Khan 44(26) [4s-4 6s-3]

Thomas to Warner, out Caught by Smith!! Smith has pulled off a stunner! And, Warner can't register his sixth successive fifty. A pacy short of length delivery from Thomas and Warner had backed away to slap it away. A hint of extra bounce and hence Warner couldn't time it as well as he would liked it to. The ball ballooned up and Smith ran back and to his right from mid-off before putting a full-stretched dive. He kept his eyes on the ball and completed a superb catch. Snaffled it with both hands and ensured that the ball didn't pop out when his elbows made contact with the ground. A much-needed breakthrough for the hosts. Warner c Smith b Thomas 37(32)

Shreyas Gopal to Manish Pandey, out Caught!! Well, Gopal was not sure why the third umpire was called. In the end, he has the wicket of his fellow state-mate. It was the googly and Manish Pandey was cramped for room. He was looking to guide it to third man and it went off the face of the bat. Samson caught it and then dislodged the bails. Wierdly, the keeper didn't appeal for caught-behind. The TV umpire was called for a stumping appeal and Pandey's back leg was in the air. He was out twice and I reckon the dismissal will be changed to caught! Manish Pandey c Samson b Shreyas Gopal 61(36) [4s-9]

Aaron to Shankar, out Caught by Unadkat!! SRH are falling apart here. A short ball at 130.5kph - the off-cutter, Shankar didn't pick it and was early into his shot - the pull/heave. Got it off the cue end. Unadkat ran in from deep backward square leg and took a sharp low catch. Shankar c Unadkat b Aaron 8(10)

Unadkat to Hooda, out Caught&Bowled!! Unadkat is on fire!! He has managed to hold on to a one-handed specky. Bowled a loopy full ball on off-stump and Hooda clearly didn't pick the change of pace on that, just checked his push and chipped it straight in the air towards the bowler. Unadkat had to control his momentum, leap up to his full height and grab it one-handed mid air. Hooda c and b Unadkat 0(1)

Thomas to Saha, out Caught by Samson!! Ah, this is more conventional and straightforward. Bowls a pacy short ball and keeps it straight on the stumps, Saha came charging down the pitch and the extra bounce was always going to create trouble. As expected, the short ball got slightly big on him and he feathered a thin edge straight to Samson behind the stumps. Saha c Samson b Thomas 5(5)

Unadkat to Shakib, out Caught by Shreyas Gopal!! Unadkat roaring back into this game in some style. Bowls the slower ball and hits the pitch hard while doing so, it sat up nicely for Shakib outside off but lack of pace means he had to power it really hard off the middle. Shakib seemed to have found the middle but couldn't manage the desired distance as Gopal takes a fine running catch at long-on (to his left). Shakib c Shreyas Gopal b Unadkat 9(10)

Aaron to Bhuvneshwar, out Caught by Unadkat!! Excellent running catch from Unadkat. Ran all the way from short fine and caught this around the backward square area with a splendid dive. Bhuvi just chipped a back of the hand slower ball without any conviction and then the theatrics from Unadkat, the fielder. Bhuvneshwar c Unadkat b Aaron 1(4)

Shreyas Gopal to Williamson, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! Gopal adds Williamson to his prodigious list. The googly and Williamson did not pick it, he stayed rooted to the crease and tried to read it off the surface, too late. The ball spun back in hit the front pad before ricocheting onto the stumps. A much needed wicket after a sloppy start. Williamson b Shreyas Gopal 13(14) [4s-2]

Chahal to Dhawan, out Caught by Washington Sundar!! Dhawan perishes after reaching his fifty. Boy! RCB needed that badly. Chahal as he ususally does for RCB, gets the wicket in the middle overs. Dhawan premeditates the sweep shot, Chahal saw that and he is astute enough to drag his length back and bowled well wide of off. It clipped his top-edge and Sundar takes a dolly at short fine leg. Dhawan has done his job though, over to Pant and Iyer now. Dhawan c Washington Sundar b Chahal 50(37) [4s-5 6s-2]

Chahal to Pant, out Lbw!! Whatta comeback from Chahal. After being clobbered for two sixes, he has come back with the vital wicket of Pant. It was a leggie which spins into Pant, he wanted to work it to the leg-side, plays down the wrong line. It misses his edge and raps him on the pads. It looked close and umpire gave him out instantly. Rishabh challenged the decision but was proved wrong within minutes. Pant lbw b Chahal 7(7) [4s-1]

Washington Sundar to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Kohli!! Spinners are doing the trick for RCB in the middle overs. Shreyas Iyer wanted to smash it into the crowd again, Washington Sundar realized that and bowled it a little slower. It gripped in the surface. The spin on the delivery forced Shreyas Iyer to mistime it and he ends up finding Kohli at deep mid-wicket. Shreyas Iyer c Kohli b Washington Sundar 52(37) [4s-2 6s-3]

Navdeep Saini to Ingram, out Caught by Washington Sundar!! Gone! Saini wins the final battle. Struck for a four and a six and the local boy responds with the wicket of Ingram. Very big moment at this stage. Slower ball that is dragged back on seeing Ingram move across his stumps, the scoop lacks power or pace and Sundar completes a dolly near short fine leg. Ingram c Washington Sundar b Navdeep Saini 11(7) [4s-1 6s-1]

U Yadav to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Edged and gone! Oh, wait PP is down on his feet and the umpires decide to go upstairs. The soft signal is OUT! It's been grabbed by the keeper and Prithvi Shaw has to walk back. Parthiv got hit on the chest before snaffling it with his mitts. It would have definitely pained and hence he went down. Coming to the ball, it was a back of a length delivery wide of off. Shaw stayed in his crease and went for the cut shot. A hint of extra bounce and that induced the edge. Prithvi Shaw c Parthiv Patel b U Yadav 18(10) [4s-4]

Rutherford to de Villiers, out Caught by Axar!! Has this sealed the match for DC? A superb running catch at deep mid-wicket and yet another long hop has got them a wicket - this was short and AB rocked back on the pull, don't think he hit it all that well - Axar ran across from the deep, kept his eyes on the ball and then latched onto a fine overhead catch. He then had to make sure that he didn't step onto the ropes, which he did. The third umpire has a look and sends AB on his way. The equation has just got tougher for the men in red. de Villiers c Axar b Rutherford 17(19) [6s-1]

Mishra to Klaasen, out Caught by Pant!! Pant takes a blinder to get rid of Klaasen. The South African was looking play the scoop but makes a mess of it eventually. The ball catches the cue end, deflects on to his helmet grille and lobs to the left of the keeper. Pant charges to his left, puts in a dive and pulls off a stunning catch to bring an end to Klaasen's short stay at the crease. Klaasen c Pant b Mishra 3(3)

Mishra to Shivam Dube, out Caught by Dhawan!! RCB sink further as Dube departs. Fails to read the googly and swings across. As a result of the wrong 'un a thick leading edge is induced and Dhawan at cover-point takes a well judged catch. Looked good for his knock of 24 but the onus will now be on Stoinis to brave the visitors out of trouble. Can he? Shivam Dube c Dhawan b Mishra 24(16) [6s-2]

Ishant to Gurkeerat Singh, out Caught by Pant!! Edged and taken! Full and wide outside off, Gurkeerat goes hard at it and gets an outside edge to the keeper. Quality over by Ishant so far. Things getting tougher with every delivery for RCB. Gurkeerat Singh c Pant b Ishant 27(19) [4s-2 6s-1]

Rabada to Washington Sundar, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Delhi Capitals inch closer to booking a place in the play-offs. Rabada bowls a slower delivery on middle and leg, Sundar looks to go big and gets deceived due to the slower delivery. Mistimes his loft to long-on and Iyer completes the formalities. Washington Sundar c Shreyas Iyer b Rabada 1(2)

Rabada to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Axar!! A smart catch from Axar at backward point and Rabada can afford a smile now - much needed wicket for the Capitals - this was short and well wide of off, Parthiv made room and crunched the cut - didn't keep it down and didn't find the gap, straight to Axar who does well to hold on. Parthiv has done his job, but he will be disappointed at having thrown another start away. Parthiv Patel c Axar b Rabada 39(20) [4s-7 6s-1]

Axar to Kohli, out Caught by Rutherford!! Oh dear! That's a killer blow for RCB, Kohli has pulled a half-tracker into the hands of Rutherford at deep mid-wicket. He looks gutted and all of a sudden, RCB have lost two quick wickets. It was dropped short and at the stumps, Kohli rocked back on the pull, but he couldn't have placed the shot any more perfectly for the hosts - straight into the big hands of the West Indian. Kohli c Rutherford b Axar 23(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Lewis!! For a moment, Shubman seemed to have got hold of the shot - but he got plenty of height but not the distance, good catch at deep mid-wicket from Lewis - backtracking as he was, it was the slower ball and that did Shubman in, had to drag his shot and didn't get the requisite power behind it. Walks off to a standing ovation and after the customary check for a possible front-foot no-ball. Shubman Gill c Lewis b Hardik Pandya 76(45) [4s-6 6s-4]

Rahul Chahar to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Lewis!! Chahar and his funky bowling action has the better of Lynn - this was the leg-break, pitched outside leg and spun across the right-hander, Lynn opened himself up for the big slog, got underneath the delivery, ended up slicing it high and towards wide long-on. Lewis kept his eys on the ball and takes a reverse-cupped catch. Chris Lynn c Lewis b Rahul Chahar 54(29) [4s-8 6s-2]

Narine to de Kock, out Caught by A Russell!! de Kock goes back without troubling the scorers. Narine was amongst the wickets in the previous match. Gets rid of the dangerous opener in his very first over. It was the carrom-ball from Narine that went through with the anlge (over the wicket). de Kock went for the sweep and only managed a top edge. Russell comes in from deep backward square leg to snaffle it with ease. de Kock c A Russell b Narine 0(4)

Narine to Pollard, out Caught by Nitish Rana!! Narine comes back into the attack and breaks the partnership that was turning out to be a threatening one. A floated delivery delivery leg, Pollard flicks it towards deep mid-wicket in his quest to clear the fence but doesn't get the timing right. Rana who was stationed near the fence, charges forward and puts in a dive to complete the catch. Pollard c Nitish Rana b Narine 20(21) [4s-2]

Gurney to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by A Russell!! That brings an end to Hardik's belligerence. That was some knock! He set Edens on fire! Goes hard at a slower short delivery and mistimes it to deep mid-wicket. Dre Russ is the man who gets under the skier and takes the catch safely. A round of applause for Hardik who walks back to the pavilion after playing a quality knock. Hardik Pandya c A Russell b Gurney 91(34) [4s-6 6s-9]

Chawla to Krunal Pandya, out Caught&Bowled!! Piyush Chawla becomes the third bowler in the history of IPL to claim 150 wickets. Calls for the catch, sprints back and takes it eventually. Was another googly and Pandya got a top-edge as he tried to slog it across the line. Krunal Pandya c and b Chawla 24(18) [6s-2]

Gurney to Rohit, out Lbw!! Rohit goes for the big hoick, gets hit on the back leg. KKR players go up for an lbw appeal and the umpire has raised his finger. Rohit decides to review it. Legal ball. No bat involved. What does the HawkEye say. Umpire's call on hitting wickets. The on-field call stays. Rohit has to walk back. While going back, Rohit has a word or two with the umpire. He knocked down the bails with his bat at the bowler's end too. It was an in-slanter from round the wicket and Rohit wanted to play it across the line. Missed it and was struck on the back leg in front of middle. The ball-tracker showed it to be clipping leg-stump. Rohit lbw b Gurney 12(9) [4s-3]

A Russell to Lewis, out Caught by Karthik!! It is Russell's day. He can do no wrong today. Strikes with his first ball. Back of a length in the channel around off, Lewis looks to force it from the crease and the outside edge nestles into the safe mitts of Karthik. KKR are running away with the game. Lewis c Karthik b A Russell 15(16) [4s-1 6s-1]

A Russell to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Karthik!! He's getting wickets of full tosses. That smile on his face says it all. Russell is enjoying every minute of it and he also has a quick jig for the KKR supporters. Full toss around knee height, Suryakumar goes for his favoured pick up shot but gets only a leading edge, straight up and Karthik settles under it. Suryakumar Yadav c Karthik b A Russell 26(14) [4s-2 6s-2]

Khaleel Ahmed to Pooran, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! Bhuvi has made amends. He has taken a spectacular catch at fine leg! And the orange army supporters are on their feet in the crowd. Umpires have gone for a review just to be absolutely sure. Soft signal is OUT and he is OUT. It was a terrific short delivery on the face, Pooran was clearly beaten by the pace there. The situation demanded him to play another big shot and he went after it again via: A pull shot. Gets it off the top-half, Bhuvi at fine leg, charges forward, dives in a dramatic fashion and takes a beauty. Pooran c Bhuvneshwar b Khaleel Ahmed 21(10) [4s-2 6s-2]

Rashid Khan to Miller, out Caught by Shankar!! Second for Rashid. Not the greatest of deliveries but SRH won't be complaining. Another one of KXIP's big hitters is back in the pavilion. It was a half tracker and Miller picked it early, went back and pulled it flat to deep mid-wicket. He just could not place it better. Miller c Shankar b Rashid Khan 11(11) [4s-1]

Rashid Khan to Ashwin, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Rashid is on a hat-trick. Ashwin coming ahead of debutant Prabhsimran doesn't pay off. What started with a boundary has ended with two wickets. Googly outside off, Ashwin spotted it off the hand and heaved it with the spin, but could not generate power to clear long-on. Pandey takes a sitter. Ashwin c Manish Pandey b Rashid Khan 0(1)

Khaleel Ahmed to Rahul, out Caught by Williamson!! Fine catch! Khaleel picks up his third wicket. He's been the pick of the bowlers along with Rashid. Change of pace and Rahul went after it, cleared his front leg and swung as hard as possible, came off the toe-end and went straight up, Williamson ran across from extra cover and took it near mid-off. It was in the air for a long time and the skipper had to put in a dive to take it. Rahul c Williamson b Khaleel Ahmed 79(56) [4s-4 6s-5]

Sandeep Sharma to Simran Singh, out Lbw!! Looked a 50-50 call and that's why only Sandeep went up for it. A slow dipping yorker and Simran swings blindly without watching the ball, the ball lands in front of him and strikes him on the back leg around leg-stump. Ball-tracking has to be kissing the stumps. Simran Singh lbw b Sandeep Sharma 16(17) [4s-1 6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Mujeeb, out Bowled!! It was a matter of Sandeep getting it on target. Another knuckle ball and Mujeeb slogs without a clue in the world, the ball arrives later to mess up the stumps. Is it going to be a double wicket maiden for Sandeep? Mujeeb b Sandeep Sharma 0(3)

Khaleel Ahmed to Gayle, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Khaleel Ahmed strikes as Manish Pandey takes a skier. No special knock by the Universe Boss tonight. Goes hard at a length delivery and gets a top-edge that goes miles up in the air. Manish at point settles under it and takes it, not on the first but on the second attempt. The ball almost popped out of Manish's hands who did well to cling on the catch eventually. Sunrisers on top! Gayle c Manish Pandey b Khaleel Ahmed 4(3) [4s-1]

Rashid Khan to Agarwal, out Caught by Shankar!! Mayank gets greedy there. And he pays the price for it. Rashid is so skilfull a bowler that you just can't hit him for consecutive sixes. It was a flighted delivery on the stumps, Agarwal goes down on his knees and wanted to launch it over deep mid-wicket, fails to connect as well as he would have liked. And ends up gifting a catch to Shankar at deep mid-wicket. Agarwal c Shankar b Rashid Khan 27(18) [4s-2 6s-1]

Ashwin to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Shami!! Ashwin removes Pandey. Finally, a wicket for KXIP which should give them some lift. Wasn't that great a delivery from Ashwin. Rifled it quick - the carrom ball and down leg, Pandey tried to be cheeky and thought of helping it over the man at 45. But he didn't get the required timing to clear the fielder and hits it to Shami at short fine leg, who clings onto it. First wicket for Ashwin and let's see if they can put the brakes from here. Manish Pandey c Shami b Ashwin 36(25) [4s-3 6s-1]

Ashwin to Warner, out Caught by Mujeeb!! Wow! Is this the game-changing over from Ashwin? He's gotten rid of both the set-batsmen in this over and Warner is livid with himself as he thuds his bat onto his pads. But doesn't matter because he's played a fabulous knock here. The Hyderabad crowd gives him a rousing reception. It was the round-arm darter from Ashwin, bowled it quick outside off. Warner with a tired looking shot as he threw his bat and skews it up towards point, who takes a couple of steps back and grabs it. Warner c Mujeeb b Ashwin 81(56) [4s-7 6s-2]

Shami to Williamson, out Caught by Murugan Ashwin!! That's a stunning catch by Murugan Ashwin at cover as he times his jump to perfection and plucks it out of thin air. Was a back of a length delivery and Williamson had chipped it in order to clear the infield, however the fielder does well to pull off a blinder. With 10 balls remaining, Williamson had to go for it and perishes in his quest to get some quick runs. Williamson c Murugan Ashwin b Shami 14(7) [4s-1 6s-1]

Shami to Nabi, out Bowled!! Shami has ripped the stumps apart. Dishes out a sizzling full length delivery and it was the pace that got the better of him. Nabi swung hard but there was daylight between his willow and the ball - end result is that the sticks are rattled and it's game over for Nabi, at least with the bat. Nabi b Shami 20(10) [6s-2]

Arshdeep Singh to Rashid Khan, out Bowled!! Wickets are tumbling towards the death but the total is more than enough. Arshdeep Singh nails his yorker right and uproots the leg-stump as Rashid Khan fails to squeeze it out. Some decent death bowling by Kings XI Punjab. Rashid Khan b Arshdeep Singh 1(2)

Murugan Ashwin to Saha, out Caught by Simran Singh!! Murugan draws first blood! Was a quickish slider and Saha wanted to pull across the line. Got a tiny under edge and Simran Singh who had looked awful initially, held on to a brilliant catch. The fun part began after this, because the appeal for caught behind wasn't given at first. As KXIP were about to review, the umpire raised his finger but Saha didn't probably see that. He was standing with Warner, which made it seem like he wanted the review. It seems like he wasn't clear of the decision and once it was clarified, he walked away Saha c Simran Singh b Murugan Ashwin 28(13) [4s-3 6s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, out Caught by Livingstone!! The fun comes to an end for Kohli. Bunny alert! Gopal gets the prized scalp of the RCB skipper for the second time in the tournament. What a tournament he's having. Some relief for RR here. It was tossed up luringly at the stumps, Kohli flexes his arms and slogs it, didn't connect it as he would've liked and picks out Livingstone at long-on, who comfortably holds onto it. Kohli c Livingstone b Shreyas Gopal 25(7) [4s-1 6s-3]

Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, out Caught by Riyan Parag!! Wowza! It's two in two for Gopal. Pin-drop silence in the ground. Put your hands together for this young leggie. He's been a star for RR and continues to impress. Well-flighted delivery again, drawing de Villiers into a false shot. AB wielded his bat hard, loses his balance and shape completely. Skies it into the night sky as the timing goes for a toss. Riyan Parag at extra cover calls for it and settles under it. Big setback this for RCB. Gopal on a hat-trick now. de Villiers c Riyan Parag b Shreyas Gopal 10(4) [4s-2]

Shreyas Gopal to Stoinis, out Caught by Smith!! He's done it. Hat-trick for Shreyas Gopal, take a bow. Look at him celebrate, totally deserves it. RR dugout is over the moon. RCB fans are stunned as they are quaking now. Loopy delivery outside off, Stoinis gets under it and bashes it airly. Finds Smith at mid-off. Gopal is off on a celebratary run. Stoinis c Smith b Shreyas Gopal 0(1)

Riyan Parag to Gurkeerat Singh, out Caught by Lomror!! The procession continues. Parag joins the party as he removes Mann. Also, breaks into a jig. RCB have lost the plot completely. Drifted quicker on middle and leg, Mann heaves it across the line and miscues it totally. Only succeeds in finding the fielder at deep mid-wicket. Gurkeerat Singh c Lomror b Riyan Parag 6(3) [4s-1]

Unadkat to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Thomas!! Another soft dismissal and another instance of an RCB batsman throwing his wicket away. Patel tried to be cheeky and walked across his stumps to lap it over the fielder at 45. But unfortunately, he ended up hitting it straight to Thomas, who accepts it with glee. PP can't believe it, couldn't have placed it any better. Parthiv Patel c Thomas b Unadkat 8(5) [4s-1]

Thomas to Klaasen, out Caught by Livingstone!! Klaasen perishes. Fast, fiery and full outside off, Klaasen was beaten for the pace as he loses his shape attempting an across-the-line mow. Slices it off the outer half and it balloons towards sweeper cover where Livingstone grabs it with ease. Klaasen c Livingstone b Thomas 6(7)

Thomas to Negi, out Caught by Samson!! No escape for Negi this time. Thomas picks up his second wicket. Short of a length delivery outside off, Negi slashes his willow and gets an outside edge which is gobbled up by Samson. Negi c Samson b Thomas 4(3) [4s-1]

Chahal to Samson, out Caught by Negi!! This is a big wicket! Chahal strikes. Flat, quick and outside off, Samson had to reach out and he tried to go over extra cover. The ball lobs up off the outside half. Negi settles under it at backward point and gobbles it up. Samson c Negi b Chahal 28(13) [4s-2 6s-3]

Axar to du Plessis, out Caught by Dhawan!! Taken! It was in the air for a long time but Dhawan kept his composure to snaffle it well inside the rope. A big cheer engulfs Chepauk as MS Dhoni makes his way out to the middle. Axar gives is not afraid to toss it up and du Plessis is down the track to go big again, he gets it somewhere close to the bottom and Dhawan steadies under it at long-off. He had run in and needed to track back, took it with his hands over his head. du Plessis c Dhawan b Axar 39(41) [4s-2 6s-2]

J Suchith to Raina, out Caught by Dhawan!! Suchith has his man. But Raina has done his job. He resurrected the innings after a slow start and given them the impetus going into the final 5 overs. He looks to go across the line against a ball that is angled across him, slices it off the outer half towards backward point, Dhawan gets into all sorts of tangle as he runs back, but he manages to hang on to it. Kept the hands close to the body and used it as a shield for the ball. Raina c Dhawan b J Suchith 59(37) [4s-8 6s-1]

Chris Morris to Jadeja, out Caught&Bowled!! That's a brilliant running catch from Morris. The slog was miscued by Jadeja, it went a long way up in the night sky and was about to land in no man's land. But Morris for some seconds became Usain Bolt, he charged towards mid-wicket, just about reached it and takes it wonderfully well in the end. But a brilliant cameo from Jadeja! Jadeja c and b Chris Morris 25(10) [4s-2 6s-2]

J Suchith to Watson, out Caught by Axar at mid-wicket! He's picked him out! A half-tracker that stays low, picks out the ONE man at cow corner with the pull - a shot he nails every time. Hasn't managed to get it over the boundary and he's out for a nine-ball blob. More disappointment for Watson, after what might be a false dawn. Watson c Axar b J Suchith 0(9)

Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Raina!! Shaw has hit it straight to Raina at cover and he looks bamboozled. Chahar has yet again picked up a breakthrough with the new ball. It was on a good length and there was lot of width. Prithvi Shaw was enticed by the room, he went hard on his trademark punch shot, fails to control it and ends up gifting a catch to cover. Prithvi Shaw c Raina b Chahar 4(5) [4s-1]

Tahir to Axar, out Caught by Watson!! More energy expended by Imran Tahir in celebration. Tiring just to watch. He floats this googly wide outside off, makes Axar reach for it, and then turns it away further. Flew off the edge to Watson at slip who took a sharp catch. Delhi slide further. Axar c Watson b Tahir 9(9) [4s-1]

Tahir to Rutherford, out Caught by Chahar!! Tahir on a roll. Third wicket for him in just his second over. Another googly wide of off, and in throwing his hands at it, Rutherford has sliced it to backward point. Delhi sinking quickly. Rutherford c Chahar b Tahir 2(4)

Jadeja to Chris Morris, out Stumped!! That's another addition to the Dhoni collection of brilliant stumpings. Morris's back foot barely lifts up for a brief moment, and that's enough for Dhoni as he whips the bails off in a flash. Superb delivery to begin with from Jadeja, managed to turn it at pace to which Morris had no answer. Chris Morris st Dhoni b Jadeja 0(1)

Jadeja to Shreyas Iyer, out Stumped!! Beaten on the edge, and more brilliant glovework from Dhoni behind the stumps. He's not got him, has he? Oh dear, Iyer's back foot is in the air slightly when the bails are taken off. He's gone. Another brilliant delivery from Jadeja. Flat through the air, still manages a good deal of turn from a length. Delhi crumbling. Shreyas Iyer st Dhoni b Jadeja 44(31) [4s-4 6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to J Suchith, out J Suchith Run Out!! Such has been the day for CSK today that even the least athletic fielder in their unit manages to break the stumps. Thrown wider of off, Suchith leans across and pushes it to point. Watto sprawls across, collects it and nails the stumps at the non-striker's end. There was a slight hesitation in the running as Suchith was ball-watching. He stopped mid-way and lost his balance, ended up running himself short of the crease. J Suchith run out (Watson) 6(15)

Tahir to Mishra, out Caught by Dhoni!! Is there an edge? Yup, up goes the finger. How fitting is it that it's the combo of Tahir-MSD which has capped it off for CSK. Tame surrender this by Delhi. This is their biggest margin of defeat for the season. Coming to the ball, it was another slowish leggie that spun away sharply outside off, Mishra on this occasion gropes at it and nicks it off behind. CSK reclaim the top spot! Mishra c Dhoni b Tahir 8(11) [4s-1]

Harbhajan to Dhawan, out Bowled!! Rambunctious roars from Harbhajan Singh in celebration as Dhawan is cleaned up. He'd got down to sweep this off-break but missed it completely, beaten by Harbhajan's extra bounce. Much needed for the Super Kings as they seek to reign Delhi back. Dhawan b Harbhajan 19(13) [4s-1 6s-1]

Tahir to Pant, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! Now he goes uppish, hits it flat and hard, and finds long-off. Tahir is off celebrating in some part of Chepauk, while Pant is left to rue his choice of shot, not for the first time this season - an area where he has a long ways to go yet. Pant c Dwayne Bravo b Tahir 5(3) [4s-1]

Jadeja to Ingram, out Lbw!! Spins in and traps Ingram on the crease. Up goes the finger. The ball was spinning sharply, which probably prompted the review, but it wasn't enough to save him as it would've clipped the top of leg stump. Delhi go from 52/1 to 66/4. Ingram lbw b Jadeja 1(5)
