Khaleel Ahmed to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Straight down the throat of sweeper cover. Suryakumar Yadav is gutted, can't believe his luck. Another instance of not converting a start from SKY as Ahmed gets his second wicket. It was pitched fuller and SKY made room slightly and bent low, slapped it firmly. It was flat and went straight to Rashid in the deep, who gleefully accepts it. SRH anthem blares in the background. Suryakumar Yadav c Rashid Khan b Khaleel Ahmed 23(17) [4s-3 6s-1]

Nabi to Lewis, out Caught by Shankar!! Lewis' patchy form continues, he was looking clueless and ends up gifting his wicket to Nabi here. Mumbai have lost two wickets in two overs, slightly under the pump now. Very well bowled by Nabi, didn't offer any pace and kept it slower. Lewis goes down on his knees and attempts an ugly mow across the line. The timing goes haywire and he hits it towards deep mid-wicket. Vijay Shankar swiftly moves across and grabs it. Lewis c Shankar b Nabi 1(6)

Bhuvneshwar to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Nabi!! Hardik Pandya has been worked out. This is a crucial wicket for SRH as we all know how dangerous Hardik can be towards the back-end of the innings. It was banged in short, the batsman wasn't expecting it. Gets cramped for pace and room, went for the pull and poor connection sees him slicing it off the top half of the bat to long-off. Nabi takes the sitter. Hardik Pandya c Nabi b Bhuvneshwar 18(10) [4s-1 6s-1]

Khaleel Ahmed to Pollard, out Caught by Abhishek Sharma! 120.9km/h, a slower bouncer on the body, the off-cutter, the easiest of all slower balls, and he foxes Pollard. Early into the pull, induces the top-edge as the ball goes high in the air towards deep backward square leg and Abhishek Sharma rushes in to take an impressive catch diving forward. Pollard c Abhishek Sharma b Khaleel Ahmed 10(9) [6s-1]

Khaleel Ahmed to Rohit, out Caught by Nabi!! Rohit would be gutted with himself. He was timing the ball beautifully but the pressure of five dot balls that de Kock consumed in the previous over probably got to him. And he played an overambitious pull-shot. Khaleel Ahmed got the ball to bounce extra off the deck. It hit the splice of the bat and popped up in the air, Nabi takes a sitter of sitters at mid-on. Rohit c Nabi b Khaleel Ahmed 24(18) [4s-5]

Krunal Pandya to Shankar, out Caught by Pollard!! The nudge and nurdle around ploy comes to a halt. With required rate shooting up SRH had to find momentum and in the process of finding some, Shankar goes after a floated up delivery and toe-ends the loft to long-on. KP moves a few yards to his right and takes it comfortably. Shankar c Pollard b Krunal Pandya 12(17)

Hardik Pandya to Abhishek Sharma, out Caught by de Kock!! Hardik Pandya ambles forward with a smile, doesn't even bother appealing for he knew Abhishek nicked it. There was a sense of doubt as Abhishek stood his ground momentarily but he started walking off soon as the umpire gave his verdict. Short, skiddy and angling away outside off, Abhishek looks to steer it square on the off-side and sends a fine bottom edge through to the keeper. Excellent low take from QDK. Abhishek Sharma c de Kock b Hardik Pandya 2(3)

Hardik Pandya to Nabi, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Gone this time. This one looked like a six to the naked eye, wasn't to be. A full ball outside off, Nabi went for the loft over extra cover but he skewed it off the toe-end and offered a dolly of a catch to SKY at wide long-off. Nabi c Suryakumar Yadav b Hardik Pandya 31(20) [4s-2 6s-2]

Bumrah to Saha, out Caught by Lewis! On a back of a length and just outside off, Saha gets low and tries carving it away through backward point, but fails to find the gap, picks out Lewis at backward point and that's the end of the road for Saha tonight. An excellent catch by Lewis, diving to his right, and a bit of a send-off by Bumrah. Saha c Lewis b Bumrah 25(15) [4s-5]

Bumrah to Guptill, out Lbw!! Guptill's first game is cut short by a Bumrah nip-backer. SRH are off to a flier but have now lost both their openers. This is a typical Bumrah wicket - fast, angled in from a length and just beats the batsman for pace, Guptill went nowhere with his footwork and remained rooted to the crease, pinged right in front of middle and ball-tracking showed it to be crashing into leg-stump. Second wicket for Bumrah and he's keeping the game in balance. Guptill lbw b Bumrah 15(11) [4s-1 6s-1]

Krunal Pandya to Williamson, out Lbw!! Huge wicket and the blue flags are hoisted up at the Wankhede. Rohit is jubliant and so are rest of his mates. They know the value of this wicket. Williamson could have played anchor to this chase and he has been sent back early. The SRH skipper premeditated the paddle and missed it completely, the ball struck him around the thigh pad in front of middle, it was going on to hit leg-stump. Williamson lbw b Krunal Pandya 3(7)

Ashwin to Uthappa, out Caught by Agarwal!! Ashwin strikes! KXIP needed a wicket and the skipper delivers. He pumps his fist in delight. Carrom ball around off, Uthappa makes room to go over extra cover, but hit it straighter than he would have liked, Mayank didn't have to move much and took it with his fingers pointing upwards near long-off. Uthappa c Agarwal b Ashwin 22(14) [4s-2 6s-1]

Shami to A Russell, out Caught by Tye! GONE! The top-edge is not good enough this time, as the short in-angler cramps him up, beats him for pace and bounce (just about) and induces a top-edge that falls just short of the cow corner boundary. Tye picks up a good catch at the rope and he's pumped - as are the rest of the KXIP team. They seem some light at the end of the tunnel, now that the DreRuss-shaped Frankenstein's monster isn't eclipsing everything. A Russell c Tye b Shami 24(14) [4s-2 6s-2]

Tye to Chris Lynn, out Caught&Bowled!! No, not his night. But he's gotten KKR off to a flier. Tye is relieved and delighted - throws the ball away after taking the catch in frustration. 127.1ks short of length delivery and Lynn looks to pull it to deep mid-wicket, the top-edge takes it straight up and Tye moves to his right to reverse cup it. KXIP needed that badly. Chris Lynn c and b Tye 46(22) [4s-5 6s-3]

Nitish Rana to Pooran, out Caught by Warrier!! DK's ploy to bring Nitish Rana works wonders for KKR. It was that sort of a delivery where you have too much time and end up tripping over while playing the shot. Short, slow and drifting in, Pooran rocked back and nailed the pull as hard as he could, sends the toe-end flat to the fielder at deep mid-wicket. Warrier, who's been involved in all three dismissals so far, claims the catch with ease. Pooran c Warrier b Nitish Rana 48(27) [4s-3 6s-4]

Narine to Mandeep, out Agarwal Run Out!! 1 run completed. Mayank Agarwal and his never-ending love affair with thirties. Lost the count of number of times he's been dismissed around 30s in the last two seasons. So Mandeep flicks this to the left of deep mid-wicket and calls for two straightaway, Agarwal responds and had to put in a desperate dive to have a sniff at survival, wasn't to be. The throw from Rinku Singh was sharp and adjacent to the stumps, Narine doesn't gather it clean but manages to deflect the ball onto the stumps off his palm, totally unintentional but effective nevertheless. Agarwal run out (Rinku Singh/Narine) 36(26) [4s-2 6s-1]

Gurney to Mandeep, out Caught by Uthappa!! Uthappa takes it without much fuss. And Kings lose another one at the wrong time. It was a slower one on a back of a length, Mandeep moves back, makes room, he wanted to thump it over mid-off. It comes off the bottom half of the bat and pops up in the air. And Robbie makes no mistake at mid-ooff. Mandeep c Uthappa b Gurney 25(17) [4s-1 6s-1]

A Russell to Ashwin, out Bowled!! Ashwin drags it back onto the stumps. This innings is coming apart for Kings! It was an off-cutter around off, Ashwin went for an old-fashioned heave to the on-side. It comes off the inside edge and shatters the stumps. Ashwin b A Russell 0(3)

Warrier to Rahul, out Caught by Chris Lynn!! The knuckle's fooling enough. And Chris Lynn - miked up and talking to the on-air comms - is still awake enough to judge the miscued chipped loop going over his head to lap it reverse-cupped without fuss. So it was full, and Rahul, early into his flick, ends up without control. And succumbs to give Warrier his maiden IPL wicket. Rahul c Chris Lynn b Warrier 2(7)

Warrier to Gayle, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! It's no big secret that Punjab are way too top heavy, but KKR have successfully knocked out the snake's head. Warrier - with another - lets out a nice back of a length sitter on the hips. Gayle lines up for a half-hearted swat as well, but the ball just doesn't come on. Ends up taking the upper half of the bat and picks out the only man out there, deep square leg. Gayle c Shubman Gill b Warrier 14(14) [4s-2]

Ish Sodhi to Ingram, out Caught by Rahane!! And when Pant's extravaganza doesn't consume him, Ingram's cheek will. So he tries to be cute, with a late fine sweep past the keeper. But in his pre-guessing, gets a little too early into it and the length's just too full for it as well, resulting in a glove, popping up off his shoulder to a very-alert Rahane - at slip - who runs to where a leg-slip would've been. Ingram c Rahane b Ish Sodhi 12(23)

Shreyas Gopal to Rutherford, out Caught by Livingstone!! Brave. He might have been smashed for a six, but now with nothing to lose - except this match which is alrady lost - Gopal tosses his googly up. Rutherford charges down, doesn't really get close enough but still goes through with the hoick. Ends up with a massive miscues to long-on, where Livingstone runs in to, and then adjusts really well to the ball dipping behind him. Rutherford c Livingstone b Shreyas Gopal 11(6) [6s-1]

Ish Sodhi to Dhawan, out Caught by Riyan Parag!! What was the hurry? First ball from Sodhi and Dhawan wants to take him on. Charged down the track, decided to launch it in the 'V' but gets it off the bottom part of the bat. Skies it up in the air and Parag from mid-on calls for it, keeps his eyes on the ball and cups it safely. RR have their first wicket, can they nip out a few more? Dhawan c Riyan Parag b Ish Sodhi 16(12) [4s-2]

Ish Sodhi to Prithvi Shaw, out Bowled!! Chopped on. Sodhi gets two in two and he's on a hat-trick. It's jitters in the DC camp now as RR are back in the game. Another flop show from Shaw - getting dismissed again for a single-digit score. The top-spinner from Sodhi, gave more loop and Shaw opted to play it on the off-side staying back in his crease. Goes hard away from the body and gets a thick inside edge which shatters back onto the stumps. Sodhi is elated. Prithvi Shaw b Ish Sodhi 8(8) [4s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Livingstone!! Perks of having a leggie in your team. Shreyas gets the prized scalp of Iyer, who can't believe his luck that he's holed out to the fielder. Shreyas continues to grow from strength to strength and provides his team a crucial breakthrough. Throws it up luringly, Iyer takes his front leg out of the way and launches it down the ground. The timing goes haywire and picks out Livingstone at long-on, who didn't have to move an inch. Shreyas Iyer c Livingstone b Shreyas Gopal 15(9) [6s-2]

Mishra to Shreyas Gopal, out Stumped!! This was always on the cards. And MishraJi wins this battle between leg-spinners! It was a well flighted delivery and was well wide of off, Shreyas Gopal dashes down the track to play a glory shot. It spins away, goes past his willow and Pant takes off the bails in no time. Shreyas Gopal st Pant b Mishra 12(18)

Mishra to Binny, out Caught by Pant!! Mishraji is turning it on at Kotla. He will be on a hat-trick. It was a leggie wide of off, it spins away, clips the outside edge of Binny who was probably playing for the wrong 'un. It clips his outside edge and Pant takes it with ease. Golden duck for Binny!Binny c Pant b Mishra 0(1)

Mishra to Gowtham, out Caught by Ishant!! In the air and taken. What are RR doing here? This is the most ordinary batting performance we have seen by any side in this year's IPL. It was a flighted delivery on the stumps, Gowtham charges down, wanted to loft it over long-off. He failed to time it as well as he would have liked and ends up gifting a catch to long-off. Gowtham c Ishant b Mishra 6(6) [4s-1]

Boult to Ish Sodhi, out Caught by Mishra!! Mishraji in action again! You cannot take him out of the game today! Brilliant with the ball and now brilliant in the field. It was a slower one around off, Ish Sodhi wanted to turn it to the on-side. He closes the face of the bat early, it clips the leading edge of the blade. And 36-year-old Mishra, dives forward and takes a mighty fine catch. Ish Sodhi c Mishra b Boult 6(11)

Ishant to Rahane, out Caught by Dhawan!! That's a soft dismissal for the captain - a leg-stump half-volley from Ishant, Rahane was looking to work it to the on-side, closed the bat-face early, gets a fat leading edge, high and behind square on the on-side. Dhawan called for the catch, gets across from deep backward square leg, watches the ball all along and completes the catch - cuts to his trademark thighslap celebrations, the Royals have lost an easrly wicket. Rahane c Dhawan b Ishant 2(4)

Boult to Riyan Parag, out Caught by Rutherford!! Riyan Parag will find the fielder. He is disappointed with himself. But cheer up young man, you have just played a special innings for your team. It was on a fuller length again, Riyan Parag wanted to dispatch it over long-off, he wasn't balanced at the point of contact. And lost his shape, it comes off the bottom half of the willow and Rutherford makes no mistake at long-off. Riyan Parag c Rutherford b Boult 50(49) [4s-4 6s-2]

Ishant to Livingstone, out Bowled!! The fallacy of the Kotla wicket does Livingstone in - this wasn't a slower ball, but there's no pace on this off-cutter - Livingstone came down the track and was way too early on the slog - completed the shot even before the ball arrived, let a big gap between bat and pad - the ball found its way and rattled the top of middle-stump. Ishant loved it, his second wicket of the day and the Royals have lost both openers. Livingstone b Ishant 14(13) [4s-1 6s-1]

Axar to Samson, out Samson Run Out!! Oh dear! This is disaster for the Royals - zero communication from both batsman - Lomror kept screaming at his partner who was oblivious to his call, kept running down the track aand then had nowhere to go. This was tossed up on off and Samson pushed it towards cover-point, he took a step down the track and stopped, so did his partner and then suddenly Samson had this urge to run - kept running even as his partner asked him to go back. All Shaw had to do was to pick the ball and throw to the kepeer - he does better and finds the stumps with a direct hit. Samson run out (Prithvi Shaw) 5(8)

Ishant to Lomror, out Caught by Pant!! The Royals are in a shambles at the moment - a nothing shot from Lomror and Ishant has his third wicket of the day. He shortened his length and angled this one across the left-hander, Lomror's feet went nowhere as he looked to guide it towards the off-side, hung his bat out and the edge carried nicely through to the keeper. Lomror c Pant b Ishant 8(3) [4s-2]

Bhuvneshwar to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! The best batsman in the tournament for RCB flops in the final game of the season. Rare failure for PP as RCB lose their first wicket. Lenght delivery that gained some extra bounce, Patel was rooted to the crease and whips his bat across. Thick leading edge is found and it goes up in the air. Local boy Manish Pandey sets himself under it at point and pouches it. Parthiv Patel c Manish Pandey b Bhuvneshwar 0(3)

Khaleel Ahmed to Kohli, out Caught by Saha!! Khaleel Ahmed crashes Kohli's party. And he's off. Gets rid of the Indian captain, SRH have their tails up. It was short, it was wide and there was width. Kohli wanted to have a piece of it, throwing his bat at it. Only succeeds in feeding an outside edge. Saha grabs it in front of his face and Ahmed didn't wait for the catch to be taken. Roars and redeems himself after getting slammed for a four and a six earlier in the over. Pin-drop silence in the stands. Kohli walks off for one last time in this tournament, not a great IPL by his standards, definitely. Kohli c Saha b Khaleel Ahmed 16(7) [4s-2 6s-1]

Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, out Caught by Shankar!! Hetmyer has found the fielder there. And he is furious with himself. Look at the anger on his face. It means a lot to these players. Kohli appreciates the effort from the balcony. It was well wide of off, Hetmyer wanted to lift it over long-off. It wasn't timed as well as compared to his previous shots. And Vijay Shankar takes a brilliant catch at long-off. He knew exactly where the ropes were and made sure he didn't touch it. Hetmyer c Shankar b Rashid Khan 75(47) [4s-4 6s-6]

Khaleel Ahmed to Gurkeerat Singh, out Caught by Y Pathan!! Oh dear! Gurkeerat follows Hetmyer in the dressing room. Don't write SRH off yet, they are still in the contest. And Khaleel Ahmed just can't stop taking wickets. It was a slower delivery on a back of a length, Gurkeerat Singh picks it off the hands. He wanted to steer it over short third. It bounces more than Gurkeerat anticipated and hits him high on the bat. Pathan at backward point makes no mistake. Gurkeerat Singh c Y Pathan b Khaleel Ahmed 65(48) [4s-8 6s-1]

Khaleel Ahmed to Washington Sundar, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! RCB in Kamikaze mode here at the Chinnaswamy. And Khaleel Ahmed with the breakthrough again for SRH. He has been absolutely superb for his side. It was another well disguised slower one and was wide of off, Washington Sundar wanted to lift it over mid-on. He was taken aback by the slower one, he miscues it horribly and Pandey at mid-on takes it with utmost ease. Washington Sundar c Manish Pandey b Khaleel Ahmed 0(1)

Bhuvneshwar to de Villiers, out Caught by Guptill!! ABD goes. Big, big wicket for SRH and they are cock-a-hoop. Like Kohli, it's a sorry end to de Villiers' IPL campaign as he falls cheaply. But it was a nothing shot from the South African. It was shortish and curled away outside off, he just flirted his bat at it without any intent and guided it straight into the hands of Guptill at slip. VVS Laxman is all smiles in the dug-out. RCB in all sorts of trouble now. de Villiers c Guptill b Bhuvneshwar 1(2)

Washington Sundar to Shankar, out Caught by de Grandhomme!! Yup, a little too greedy. Shankar tries tonking another, revealing his cards a touch too early as he commits down on a knee. Sundar spots, shortens his length a wee bit, letting the ball spin in, which it does to take the eventual top-edge, and CdG isn't messing up the skier, waiting patiently under at short fine leg. Shankar c de Grandhomme b Washington Sundar 27(18) [6s-3]

Chahal to Y Pathan, out Caught by U Yadav!! 100th IPL scalp -- and Chahal celebrates it by kissing the RCB badge and just in case you didn't get the message, making a heart as well with his fingers pointing towards the sky to make it all the more apparent. He does it with a pretty innocuous-looking short-wide sitter outside off, but it's foxed Pathan to go hard at it, which he does without a lot of control. Slicing off the outside half in picking out the fielder out there at deep sweeper perfectly. Y Pathan c U Yadav b Chahal 3(4)

Navdeep Saini to Nabi, out Caught by Gurkeerat Singh!! Just not in control. Another Hyderabad batsman falls in the quest to pump one over, somewhere, but once again, cannot time it one bit. So Nabi picks long-on in trying to go over with a lofted hoick, but ends up getting it high on the bat, dragging it away to Gurkeerat - who runs in, overruns perhaps, but does decently in the end to take it with tummy-support. Nabi c Gurkeerat Singh b Navdeep Saini 4(3) [4s-1]

Khejroliya to Rashid Khan, out Caught by Hetmyer!! Another pull, another miscue. Hurries Rashid into this one, and he tries some sort of a tennis forehand in the end, which ends up getting spooned tamely to deep mid-wicket this time. Hyderabad are falling apart, quite badly too. Rashid Khan c Hetmyer b Khejroliya 1(2)

Navdeep Saini to Saha, out Caught by U Yadav!! This was coming - Saha was throwing his bat with gay abandon, change of pace does the trick for Saini - the slower ball outside off, Saha didn't spot it, went hard on the drive and dragged it to Umesh at mid-on. RCB needed this wicket - Saha though has done his job. Saha c U Yadav b Navdeep Saini 20(11) [4s-4]

Washington Sundar to Guptill, out Caught by Kohli!! Pace off the ball and Guptill has clipped it straight into the hands of Kohli at mid-wicket - yelps in despair, but he can now go and cool his heels in the dressing room. Flatter and at the stumps, perhaps it straightened a bit off the pitch, Guptill went back on the clip, didn't account for the drift and the leading edge went straight into the hands of the opposition skipper. Guptill c Kohli b Washington Sundar 30(23) [4s-2 6s-2]

Washington Sundar to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Hetmyer!! Smart catch from Hetmyer, but think he's unsure about the catch. The umpires will go upstairs and the soft signal is OUT. Did he get his fingers undernath the ball? It's a fair delivery and it's a fair catch, but has the ball touched the ground as he rolled over? Was he under control? Sunil Gavaskar thinks it's NOT OUT as he wasn't in complete control. But what will the third umpire think? He thinks Manish is OUT. Two wickets in the over and RCB are pulling things back - this was dropped short and Manish's eyes lit up - rocked back on the pull, didn't get hold of the shot, was in the air for a long time, Hetmyer got across from deep mid-wicket, slid forward and completed a good two-handed catch. As he rolled over, the ball might / might not have touched the grass. Tough call, but the soft signal was OUT and the third umpire had no conclusive proof to overturn it. Manish Pandey c Hetmyer b Washington Sundar 9(12) [4s-1]

Sam Curran to Raina, out Caught by Shami!! There's the sucker-punch. Curran's the partnership breaker. This should soothe some nerves in the KXIP camp. Went shorter and cramped Raina for room, he tried it help it fine but ended up hitting it straight to Shami at 45 - who gobbles it up. Fine innings from Raina comes to an end. Curran spotted that the batsmen didn't cross, so alerts the umpire about the same. Smarty! Raina c Shami b Sam Curran 53(38) [4s-5 6s-2]

Sam Curran to du Plessis, out Bowled!! Fiery response from Curran. Very impressive delivery from the youngster. It was full, it tailed in sharply and du Plessis was all at sea as he falls over. Gets rapped on the pad, then it deflects onto the stumps. Unfortunate end to what's been a thoroughly entertaining knock from the South African captain. The ton was definitely there for the taking. Good sportsmanship from the bowler as he pats Faf on the back. du Plessis b Sam Curran 96(55) [4s-10 6s-4]

Shami to Rayudu, out Caught by Mandeep!! Straight down the throat of Mandeep at deep mid-wicket. Rayudu is disappointed, reckons he should've got it away over the ropes. Fullish, nipping back in a bit and Rayudu wallops it off his pads. Didn't impart enough power to clear the fielder and Mandeep doesn't drop those. Rayudu c Mandeep b Shami 1(2)

Shami to Kedar Jadhav, out Bowled!! This is turning out to be an outstanding final over from Shami. CSK falling away. Another top-notch full delivery, straightening on and Jadhav exposes his stumps. Trying to make some room and misses it completely. The stumps are shattered and Shami picks up his second wicket. Kedar Jadhav b Shami 0(1)

Sam Curran to Watson, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! Watson's struggles continue.. Apart from one innings, he has looked woefully out of form. Fuller than a good length and Watson wanted to steer it to third man, too close to him and the off-stump is pegged back. CSK once again lose a wicket in the powerplay. Watson b Sam Curran 7(11) [4s-1]

Harbhajan to Rahul, out Caught by Tahir! A sigh of relief, as the breakthrough arrives! Looks like the topspinner, that straightened naturally a little from the over the wicket angle, Rahul charges down the wicket to loft it out of Punjab (Udta Punjab?) slices it high in the air and Tahir at extra cover settles under it. Rahul c Tahir b Harbhajan 71(36) [4s-7 6s-5]

Harbhajan to Gayle, out Caught by (sub)Shorey! "Wickets in packs" - that was Bhajji's catchphrase when he played for India, and it has reappeared all these years later. A gentle half-tracker, Gayle rocks back and nails itflat towards long-on but picks out Shorey to perfection! Gives Gayle a little smile, and he looks shell-shocked, does Gayle. Gayle c (sub)Shorey b Harbhajan 28(28) [4s-2 6s-2]

Harbhajan to Agarwal, out Caught by Jadeja! Can you believe it? He's dragged another rank half-tracker with a pull straight to Jadeja at deep backward square leg. What a meltdown. I'm out of words - which can be a pivotal drawback in my line of work. Agarwal departs. Agarwal c Jadeja b Harbhajan 7(6) [4s-1]

Jadeja to Pooran, out Caught by Dhoni! Gone! Another short one, a bit of extra bounce and topspin, Pooran tries getting low and carving it away behind point, gets a little big on him, take the top-edge and into the gloves of the unerring MS Dhoni. Another one down, and that delays CSK's inevitable doom. Not a phrase you use very often, and perhaps one that has made several mortals on the sidelines swallow their words, but this one isn't looking great. Pooran c Dhoni b Jadeja 36(22) [4s-2 6s-3]

Malinga to Karthik, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Krunal has plucked it out of thin air. This might be a blessing in disguise for KKR. They need Russell out in the middle. Karthik and Uthappa were going nowhere with this innings. Full and on the stumps, Karthik whipped it cleanly and thought he had got it over the man at mid-wicket, but Krunal uses his height and times his jump to perfection to catch it with both hands. Karthik c Krunal Pandya b Malinga 3(9)

Malinga to A Russell, out Caught by de Kock!! Oh dear! The faces in the KKR dugout tell it all. Russell picked the wrong day to fail. His first single digit score and it has come in a crunch game. He doesn't walk back to the dugout but climbs up the stairs and goes into the dressing room. Malinga's ploy to bowl round the wicket has worked. Dug in short and gets it to climb near chest high, Russell arches back to evade it but leaves his gloves hanging mid-air, there is a brush and de Kock does the rest. Umpire Nandan took his time but eventually made the right decision. Russell didn't bother to have a word with Uthappa for the review as he knew he had got something on it. A Russell c de Kock b Malinga 0(1)

Malinga to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Pollard!! Gone! He had to go after every delivery and this time he mistimes it. Third wicket for Malinga. Rana's cameo is cut short. Another slower delivery, Rana went deep in the crease and got underneath it, but could not generate enough power to clear the incoming long-off fielder. KKR needed Rana to play through as he was looking more dangerous out of the two batsmen. Nitish Rana c Pollard b Malinga 26(13) [6s-3]

Bumrah to Uthappa, out Caught by Rohit!! The pain, the suffering comes to an end. The off-cutter from Bumrah and it dips on Uthappa, who looks to go across the line, the toe-end goes straight up and Rohit settles under it near extra cover. He walks back to the dressing room and would love to be a fly in there. Uthappa c Rohit b Bumrah 40(47) [4s-1 6s-3]

Bumrah to Rinku Singh, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Taken! Bumrah ends the innings with a couple of wickets. A fast full toss on the stumps, Rinku Singh gave it his all to clear the field near long-on, but could not get the distance. Hardik is well inside the rope as he takes it calmly. Rinku Singh c Hardik Pandya b Bumrah 4(6)

Hardik Pandya to Shubman Gill, out Lbw!! Gill walks off after having a chat with his partner. The golden arm of Hardik strikes for MI and KKR lose their first wicket. Gill wasn't looking fluid from the start, found it difficult to get going and Hardik has trapped him. It was the off-paced delivery, dipped upon pitching and the batsman was caught playing down the wrong line. Completely missed it, getting struck in-line with the stumps. HawkEye confirms that it's crashing into middle and leg stump. The blue flags are out and MI fans are elated. Shubman Gill lbw b Hardik Pandya 9(16)

Hardik Pandya to Chris Lynn, out Caught by de Kock!! Hardik Pandya is turning it on for MI. "You cannot keep Hardik out of the game," chirps Kevin Pietersen on air. It was the slower ball, lands it well outside off making Lynn to fetch for it. The batsman accepts the challenge and reaches out aiming for a biggie. Terribly mistimes, slicing it up off a top-edge. QdK back-tracks, calls for it and nestles in his gloves. Huge blow for KKR this. Chris Lynn c de Kock b Hardik Pandya 41(29) [4s-2 6s-4]

Prasidh to de Kock, out Caught by Karthik! What a deperately fantastic catch that is! A short one at the body, de Kock isn't second-time lucky with a top-edged hook, skies it towards fine leg, looks, for an eternity, like it will land in no man's land, but Karthik, the stubborn Karthik, chases it down from the 'keeper's stop and dives full-stretch to take a magnificent catch. It's that kind of inspirational moment by the skipper, the kind of fairytale moment, that can turn a match, or even a tournament, on its head. de Kock c Karthik b Prasidh 30(23) [4s-1 6s-3]

Rahul Chahar to Vijay, out Stumped!! A ripper of a leg-break and Rahul has struck with his first ball of the comeback over - a top delivery and even better keeping - Vijay looked good during his stint, but he has to walk back to huge roars - that's because the next man in is MS. A quality delivery from Rahul, drifted in, dragged Vijay forward with the length, made him think he could work it to the on-side, then the ball gripped and turned past the outside edge - quicksilver work from de Kock and Vijay was stranded way outside the crease. Vijay st de Kock b Rahul Chahar 26(26) [4s-3]

Rahul Chahar to du Plessis, out Caught by (sub)Anmolpreet Singh!! Chahar strikes first ball! He lets out a roar too and why not! This is a massive strike for the Mumbai Indians as CSK's last match hero du Plessis goes. Was a similar shot to the one he survived in the previous over, went hard on the cut this time and it was a fizzing leg break that turned quite a bit. The bounce also undid Faf who sliced it straight to backward point. Super Kings dented early! du Plessis c (sub)Anmolpreet Singh b Rahul Chahar 6(11) [4s-1]

Jayant Yadav to Raina, out Caught&Bowled!! Another massive strike! This is another severe dent made by the Mumbai Indians. Rash from Raina who goes for the wrong option on a spinning pitch - against the turn. Wanted to hoick across the line but could only sky it high in the air. Jayant himself called for it, trekked back and got under the skier with ease. What a start this is for MI! Raina c and b Jayant Yadav 5(7) [4s-1]

Krunal Pandya to Watson, out Caught by Jayant Yadav!! Brilliant catch! Jayant is the man at mid-on and he had to go with his back to the ball. Such catches are never easy but he made it look effortless. Once again a wicket due to poor shot selection, the partnership was budding and Watson opts for a pull off the back foot. Against the turn and ends up mistiming it down the ground. Wasn't in control and perishes. Pressure mounts on CSK! Watson c Jayant Yadav b Krunal Pandya 10(13) [4s-2]

Chahar to Rohit, out Lbw!! Rohit has been given out lbw, he has a chat with QdK and reviews. Did it pitch in-line? That could be the only factor saving Rohit here because there's no bat, HawkEye confirms it. Pitching - In-line. Impact - In-line. Wickets - Umpire's call. It's crashing the top of leg-stump. Rohit's a goner. Huge strike for CSK. Glum faces in the MI camp. It's a similar delivery that trapped Chris Lynn. The outswinger again, pitched on a length and straightened viciously leaving Rohit all at sea as he plays down the wrong line. Gets beaten on the outside edge and it clicks him on the back pad. Umpire Nitin Menon was quick to raise his finger and he's spot on. Rohit lbw b Chahar 4(2) [4s-1]

Tahir to Ishan Kishan, out Bowled!! Beaten by pace, and by the length. Flat and quick from Tahir, looked like the flipper which gained pace off a length and went right through Kishan who was in the middle of an attempted pull. Completely misjudged the trajectory. The off stump is knocked over. Ishan Kishan b Tahir 28(31) [4s-1 6s-1]

Tahir to Krunal Pandya, out Caught&Bowled!! Chipped back to Tahir. A yorker length delivery that was squeezed back off the toe-end, and not many CSK players appeared too excited about it. They thought it was a bump ball. But Tahir went up straightaway. And he's right. Third umpire verifies that it landed on the pitch, then came off the bat. Krunal Pandya c and b Tahir 0(1)

Harbhajan to de Kock, out Caught by du Plessis!! Trap set, trap sprung. de Kock couldn't have placed it any better and Faf takes a smart catch at long-off. Floated up by Harbhajan, de Kock creates room seeking for the inside-out loft and ends up lofting it towards du Plessis at long-off who moved to his right and gobbled it up. The fielder was a bit wider and de Kock intended it to go more squarer there. Unfortunately, picked out the fielder. Both openers back in the hut for MI. CSK fans find their voice back. de Kock c du Plessis b Harbhajan 8(12) [4s-2]

Khaleel Ahmed to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Saha!! Khaleel gets the breakthrough and he is absolutely loving the celebrations, mimics a phone ring as soon as he sees Saha gather the catch. Bowled it in that uncertainty channel outside off and caught Shreyas Iyer poking at it sans any conviction, a thick edge and Saha does the rest. Shreyas Iyer c Saha b Khaleel Ahmed 8(10) [4s-1]

Khaleel Ahmed to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Shankar!! One brings two!! Is this the game changer? It's a slower short ball outside off, Prithvi Shaw went for the pull but didn't really move his feet in terms of trying to reach the line of the delivery, it was well wide of him and that meant he got a thick top-edge which has been snaffled by Shankar at point. Prithvi Shaw c Shankar b Khaleel Ahmed 56(38) [4s-6 6s-2]

Rashid Khan to Munro, out Lbw!! Fuller and flatter, Munro missed the clip for the ball to thud his front pad. Bruce Oxenford had his finger up and Munro after some deliberation with his partner decided to review. But that was in vain as it was three reds. SRH are still breathing.. Munro lbw b Rashid Khan 14(13) [4s-1 6s-1]

Rashid Khan to Axar, out Caught by Saha!! And Axar is not a happy man trudging off. Don't think he gloved that flattish leggie. Looked to cut, was cramped for room and the ball jammed off his thigh pad into the gloves of the keeper. DC had lost their review earlier in the over and Axar had to proceed with his walk towards the pavilion. DC are in disarray!! Axar c Saha b Rashid Khan 0(3)

Bhuvneshwar to Rutherford, out Caught by Nabi!! Is there a late twist? Slower delivery going across, Rutherford lifts the ball away and has been taken by the man at long-off. Was that shot needed? A few dinks here and there would have done it. But Rutherford wanted to go for the glory shots and slammed it away uppishly without any timing to be caught. Rutherford c Nabi b Bhuvneshwar 9(12) [6s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Pant, out Caught by Nabi!! Length delivery going across and was a slower delivery, Pant tried to take the skin off the ball and miscued it for the man at long-off to take it. This is one frustrating aspect of his batting. Looks to finish it with a glory shot and perishes. Three wickets remain. Can SRH script something miraculous? I feel its too late. Pant c Nabi b Bhuvneshwar 49(21) [4s-2 6s-5]

Khaleel Ahmed to Mishra, out Obstructing the field!! This is drama. Some thriller novel will struggle to match up to this. Mishra ran completely in the middle of the turf and the throw hit him. SRH first went up for a caught-behind call and then for obstructing the field. Mishra obs 1(2)

K Paul to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Rutherford!! This isn't happening, not for Manish at least - after taking plenty of time to settle, he's thrown his wicket away. The two West Indians in action - smart bowling from Keemo, spotted Manish making room and followed him with a full ball - with no room to free his arms, Manish shovelled the lofted drive into the waiting hands of Rutherford at long-on. The partnership was beginning to grow, but it's all over now. Manish Pandey c Rutherford b K Paul 30(36) [4s-3]

Ishant to Williamson, out Bowled!! The perfect riposte from Ishant, saw Williamson backing away and then went straight with the yorker - right at the base of off-stump. Try as much as he could, Williamson was never going to dig this one out - the zing bails go flying and the Sunrisers have lost their fourth wicket. Williamson b Ishant 28(27) [4s-2]

Boult to Shankar, out Caught by Axar!! Gone! Shankar's cameo comes to an end. He is disappointed with himself. Slower short of length delivery and Shankar picked the bones out of that, struck right off the meat but he couldn't have picked the fielder out at deep mid-wicket better. Axar didn't have to move much to take that. Shankar c Axar b Boult 25(11) [4s-2 6s-2]

K Paul to Nabi, out Caught by Axar!! He might go for runs but Paul has the knack of picking wickets. An off-cutter outside off, Nabi reaches out for it and slices it straight to sweeper cover. Another sitter for Axar in the deep. Nabi c Axar b K Paul 20(13) [4s-3 6s-1]

K Paul to Rashid Khan, out Caught by Pant!! Paul has his third wicket. Another slower delivery outside off, the ball dips in front of Rashid and he is down on his knee to play the slog, the top-edge lobs to Pant and he makes no mistake. Rashid Khan c Pant b K Paul 0(1)

Ishant to Saha, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! The hard length inevitably does Saha in! He wasn't shying away from getting on the front foot, even to deliveries that didn't warrant it and that brings about his dismissal in the end. Ishant kept it on the hard length and Saha tried to go big down the ground. Never in control and the result is a miscue that Iyer takes at mid-off after trekking back a few yards. Saha c Shreyas Iyer b Ishant 8(9) [4s-1]

Mishra to Guptill, out Caught by K Paul!! Mishy provides the massive strike! Guptill was looking ominous and DC badly wanted to see the back of him. That's precisely what their senior most bowler has done in his very second delivery of the match. Floated it up, inviting the big shot but the length wasn't there for the slog sweep as Guptill went through with the stroke. Skews it towards deep mid-wicket where Paul took a fine tumbling catch. DC have sprung to life with this wicket! Guptill c K Paul b Mishra 36(19) [4s-1 6s-4]

Boult to du Plessis, out Caught by K Paul!! Mistimed pull, in the air and it's a very good catch by Keemo Paul running forward and diving low at deep square leg. Short ball, Faf tried to take the bowler on, the ball caught him high on the bat. End of a fine innings. Faf's counter-attack in the powerplay was very crucial with Watto taking his time at the other end. du Plessis c K Paul b Boult 50(39) [4s-7 6s-1]

Mishra to Watson, out Caught by Boult! GONE! A premature end to the pyrotechnics. A loopy leg-break on a nice length, Watson is enticed into running down the wicket and lofting over the straight boundary, gets it off the outside half and slices it away towards wide long-off where Boult picks up a catch. Makes some amends for that hat-trick ball. Watson c Boult b Mishra 50(32) [4s-3 6s-4]

Axar to Raina, out Bowled! He's been extremely iffy this over, and finally gives in! Angles in, some turn, Raina tries cut it away, chops it onto his stumps trying to cut and looks disgusted with himself. Just at the stroke of the strategic time-out. Raina b Axar 11(13)

Ishant to Dhoni, out Caught by K Paul! He's gone! This is the very definition of disappointment - from the crowd AND from the CSK dug-out. A short one, with the pace off, Dhoni goes for the signature six to finish with a pull towards cow corner where he picks out Keemo Paul. You can hear a pin drop at Vizag. Dhoni c K Paul b Ishant 9(9) [4s-1]

Tahir to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Raina!! Brainfade for the Delhi Capitals skipper. A googly around middle and leg, Iyer goes down in order to slog it but ends up getting a top-edge. The ball skies up towards Raina at point who settles underneath it and takes it safely. CSK on top, Delhi in trouble. Shreyas Iyer c Raina b Tahir 13(18) [4s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Axar, out Caught by Tahir!! The champion strikes! Time to bring out those moves. That shot looked good for a moment but the lack of pace on it results in Axar's downfall. Was a short one around off and the southpaw guides it straight into the mitts of Imran Tahir at third man. Had there been some more pace on the ball, it would have probably gone the distance. Axar c Tahir b Dwayne Bravo 3(6)

Harbhajan to Rutherford, out Caught by Watson!! Bhajji strikes again and brings out his fist pump to celebrate this wicket. Rutherford plays one shot too many and has to pay the price for it. He had struck a six already and there was no need to go after the offie. Goes hard at it and gets a thick outside edge that flies to short third man. Watto completes the formalities inside the ring. Rutherford c Watson b Harbhajan 10(12) [6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to K Paul, out Bowled!! DJ Bravo gets the better of Keemo Paul. And the GANGNAM is on. 130ks yorker from round the wicket, goes slightly wide of the crease and pins it at the base of leg-stump, Paul looked to hammer it down with a violent bat swing but his leg peg goes cartwheeling; dips under the bat and crashes into the woodwork. K Paul b Dwayne Bravo 3(7)

Chahar to Pant, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! Pant had to go for the big shot and unfortunately for DC, he loses balance as one hand comes off the bat. Hits the slog flat and DJ Bravo times his jump to perfection at wide long-on to gobble the catch. Pant c Dwayne Bravo b Chahar 38(25) [4s-2 6s-1]

Jadeja to Boult, out Bowled!! Clever from Jaddu. Bowled the arm-ball and managed to beat the inside edge. Boult expected it to be around off-stump and poked at it without much conviction, the ball dips short of him and smashes the leg bail. Boult b Jadeja 6(3) [6s-1]

Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, out Lbw!! Excellent review and Shaw has to go! He was looking good once again tonight but falls prey to his addiction for the pull shot. The length wasn't really there on this occasion and he missed it altogether to be hit on the back knee as he crouched a bit. CSK were confident on the LBW appeal and sent it upstairs after the umpire's rejection. Nothing on UltraEdge and HawkEye shows Three Reds. Good review. Prithvi Shaw lbw b Chahar 5(6) [4s-1]

Harbhajan to Dhawan, out Caught by Dhoni!! Dhoni takes it on the second attempt! Sharp catch as this was a healthy edge and the dangerous Dhawan has to depart. Was the quicker one and he wanted to essay the back foot cut. Got a thick nick that bobbled up off Dhoni's gloves for a moment and he held on. Dhawan c Dhoni b Harbhajan 18(14) [4s-3]

Jadeja to Munro, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! Jadeja gets rid of the set batsman. Munro was looking so good, until he played this shot. Once again he goes down on his knee to play the sweep shot but fails to keep it on the ground. Dwayne Bravo stationed at deep square leg takes a regulation catch and Delhi sink further. They'll have two new batsmen at the crease now and Imran Tahir is yet to bowl his first over. Interesting passage of play on the cards. Munro c Dwayne Bravo b Jadeja 27(24) [4s-4]

Bumrah to Rayudu, out Caught by de Kock!! They sense it. Mumbai are gaining the upper hand. This is such brilliant captaincy from Ro. CSK just lost a wicket and he brings his key bowler back for an over and prises out another. Rayudu with a very lame attempt to pull/hook this short ball, wasn't going really hard at it, the ball takes the edge and QdK makes no mistake as it grabs the ball with a jump. Big roar for MSD as he walks out. Rayudu c de Kock b Bumrah 1(4)

Hardik Pandya to Watson, out Dhoni Run Out!! 1 run completed. Phew! What drama! CSK have lost their captain in a big pressure final! This was an overthrow which Dhoni was trying to steal and he will be unhappy with himself for doing something like this in a final. It was a short ball which Watson got the glove on the pull shot, he hit it to Malinga's left and Slinga fired an overthrow at the bowler's end. The ball went only as far as mid-off, but Dhoni tried it take on the fielder but Kishan hit the bulls eye and ignited the stumps. This was a very tough decision to make. One angle showed Dhoni was on the line, but there was another angle which reckoned Dhoni may have just sneaked in. Thoughts of benefit of doubt going to the batsman circled, but Llong took a long time. Saw various different angles and pressed the red button. Dhoni run out (Ishan Kishan) 2(8)

Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught by de Kock!! 148.5kph of a brute. It's lethal. It's murderous. Bumrah keeps the seam up, bangs it some more on his neither-here-nor-there lengths and Bravo continues backing away to have punchy wafts over extra cover at them. But this one's too fiery to not be nicked, and a kiss on the outside splice will do just as fine. Just when you thought things were slipping out, eh!? Dwayne Bravo c de Kock b Bumrah 15(15) [6s-1]

Malinga to Watson, out Watson Run Out!! 1 run completed. Wide yorker. Squeezed away to deep point. But suddenly, for some weird reason Watson then doesn't want the second. Yes. No. Yes. No. And the half-hearted yes without proper consent ends up with him falling short, clearly short. The throw's f;at, which Quinton collects from well behind the stumps and under-arms it onto the stumps. Watson run out (Krunal Pandya/de Kock) 80(59) [4s-8 6s-4]

Malinga to SN Thakur, out Lbw!! Slower off-cutter, and things don't dip in the slot any better. 2013. 2015. 2017. 2019, you don't mess with Arithmetic progressions and you don't mess with these mathematical Mumbai Indians. Thakur - poor old Thakur - sent ahead of his usual position - walks across his stumps, freezes bang in front of middle looking to flick it across the line. But again, it's the finals, he chokes, misses and is trapped plumb, bang in front of middle. Oh Malinga, you really couldn't have redeemed yourself any better. SN Thakur lbw b Malinga 2(2)

Krunal Pandya to du Plessis, out Stumped!! Krunal has the final say. He spots du Plessis's charge early, and yorks him with a quick, wide dart. Animated celebrations from the Mumbai Indians. After the stick he got for most of the over, this was much needed for Krunal. du Plessis st de Kock b Krunal Pandya 26(13) [4s-3 6s-1]

Rahul Chahar to Raina, out Lbw!! Raina's hot and cold season comes to an end with him eating up a review in an all important final when he was absolutely dead in front. Lovely bowling from Rahul Chahar. Leggie from the leggie, Raina was hanging back to defend, missed the ball, the impact was on the front pad first before it smashed into the back pad. Impact in line with middle and it's hitting the top of middle stump. Mumbai have an opening now. Can they put CSK under serious pressure? Raina lbw b Rahul Chahar 8(14)

Tahir to Suryakumar Yadav, out Bowled!! Tahir is off and running here in Hyderabad - big wicket in the context of the innings, Suryakumar was one who could have anchored this innings for MI - the slider from Tahir, pitched around off and kept going straight, Suryakumar was perhaps playing for the wrong 'un, made room and pushed limply - with a horizontal bat, the ball grazes the inside edge and bounces through to the middle-stump. Suryakumar Yadav b Tahir 15(17) [4s-1]

SN Thakur to Krunal Pandya, out Caught&Bowled!! That's a top-catch from Shardul - he called for the ball, sprinted a long way towards square leg, got to the ball and then juggled it, but doesn't panic - holds onto the second attempt and MI have lost their fourth wicket. He's on a roll, the Mumbai speedster. This was a well directed bouncer, short and climbing onto the left-hander, cramped for room, Krunal still went for the pull, gets a big top-edge, high and towards square leg. MS went for the catch, but the bowler called it out and then held on. Krunal Pandya c and b SN Thakur 7(7)

Tahir to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Raina!! What have you done mr. Kishan? Was that needed? Tries to go for a big slog sweep against a googly, gets a huge top-edge and Raina takes a dolly at cover. And Tahir becomes the leading wicket-taker of the tourney. Is it a game changing moment? Might well be. CSK fans erupt. Ishan Kishan c Raina b Tahir 23(26) [4s-3]

Chahar to Hardik Pandya, out Lbw!! That dropped chance might not hav cost a lot of runs as Pandya is out LBW. Chahar nailed the yorker against a rampaging Hardik Pandya. Hardik Pandya looked to whip it staying deep in his crease and missed it. He was given out LBW and challenged it immediately. But it was three reds. And Pandya had to walk off. Excellent thinking on the part of the young man. Hardik Pandya lbw b Chahar 16(10) [4s-1 6s-1]

Chahar to Rahul Chahar, out Caught by du Plessis!! Chahar gets his younger brother. Length delivery curling away, Rahul Chahar looks to go down town and slices the ball away to mid-off. Simple catch for the fielder who accepts it with ease. Pollard couldn't crossover either. MI being dented here. Rahul Chahar c du Plessis b Chahar 0(2)

Dwayne Bravo to Pollard, out McClenaghan Run Out!! 1 run completed. McClenaghan sacrifices his wicket trying to get Pollard back on strike. Was struck down the ground over the bowler's head as another wide yorker was executed. The man at long-off zoomed the throw to the bowler's end for the bowler to whip the bails off. Bravo shows emotions as well and bangs the ball on to the turf after whipping the bails off. McClenaghan run out (du Plessis/Dwayne Bravo) 0(2)

SN Thakur to de Kock, out Caught by Dhoni! Short ball, and that does the trick! Right at the body, really brave bowling, he's hurried on the pull and top-edges it - hardly any bat on that and Dhoni comes around, moves to his right, to take the citter of the century. A huge wicket in the context of the game, and Shardul has taken a key wicket here. de Kock c Dhoni b SN Thakur 29(17) [6s-4]

Chahar to Rohit, out Caught by Dhoni! The slower one has done it! 119.8km/h, the knuckle ball, that wobbles unpredictably in the air, swerves away, courtesy a falling seam towards the on-side, and Rohit has been done in by the lack of pace - can't decide when to get his weight forward and has a waft at a transfer-of-weight drive into the off-side - his bottom-hand has come off the bat, no control, and he gets a healthy edge. Dhoni dives forward to pick up the catch that's dipping on him. Both the openers have departed, and CSK right back in it! Rohit c Dhoni b Chahar 15(14) [4s-1 6s-1]

Boult to Watson, out Lbw!! Sweet vengeance for Boult as he comes back on the very next ball having conceded a boundary. Full, quick and swinging into the batsman. Watson goes for a drive with lack of footwork and gets rapped on the pads. Impact on middle and this would have crashed into middle and leg. Good call by the openers to not opt for the review, else they would have regretted it after watching the replays. Watson lbw b Boult 4(5) [4s-1]

Rahul Chahar to Rayudu, out Caught&Bowled!! Nobody's taking his catches, and so what if he needs to sprint backwards for this. Yeah, he does. Rayudu, third time unlucky, has a dance, a hoick, only getting the toe-end and skewing up a skier. It's somewhere around mid-on, and the run-dive's more than good enough. But forget that, it's been a top knock from India's best number four who wasn't in the World Cup. Rayudu c and b Rahul Chahar 71(48) [4s-6 6s-3]

Krunal Pandya to Jadeja, out Lbw!! Plumb. Dead. Gone. A straight delivery, angling in and the Jadeja's been fooled by the pace as he plays all around this with his flick after plonking his front leg in front of off. It can't get easier for umpires, and for Jadeja with the decision to not review. Jadeja lbw b Krunal Pandya 10(5) [4s-2]

Bumrah to Sam Curran, out Caught by Pattinson!! Misbah moment? A scoop, after shuffling across to a slower delivery, but unlike Sreesanth, Pattinson has to backpedal and hold on. Doesn't matter, this game's sealed. Sam Curran c Pattinson b Bumrah 18(6) [4s-1 6s-2]

Pattinson to Vijay, out Lbw!! Gone this time! Faf du Plessis was asking him to opt for the review, but Vijay thinks otherwise and decides to walk back. This one shaped into the batsman on a fullish length and beat Vijay's across-the-line flick. Struck in front of middle, but looking at the replays, I think it might have clipped or probably missed the leg stump. Vijay lbw b Pattinson 1(7)

Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Sam Curran!! In the airrr, has he timed this? No pace on the ball, to be honest can't blame the pitch for this dismissal. Was right in the slot to tee off, but Suryakumar was hanging back for this one, didn't go through fully and sort of chipped it, long-on steadies and takes this around his left shoulder. Suryakumar Yadav c Sam Curran b Chahar 17(16) [4s-2]

Jadeja to Saurabh Tiwary, out Caught by du Plessis!! Faf and his magic at the boundary. Those spring ankles take over. Tiwary powered this flighted delivery down the ground, but Faf, very mindful of the boundary, jumped, landed on the left foot, released the ball as he was about to cross the boundary as he was overbalancing. Then quickly recovered to pouch it safely. A really handy innings from Tiwary. He's impressed for sure! Saurabh Tiwary c du Plessis b Jadeja 42(31) [4s-3 6s-1]

Jadeja to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by du Plessis!! You are kidding me Faf! Surely you can't be taking these nimble footed catches twice in an over. Jadeja bowled full, so Pandya went for a loft over long-off, hit it really flat and hard, Faf had to move to his right a bit this time, yet he timed the jump brilliantly, released the ball as he was going over the rope and then swallowed it again. Big wicket this for CSK, will make a difference of 10 runs at least to the final total. Hardik Pandya c du Plessis b Jadeja 14(10) [6s-2]

Ngidi to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Dhoni!! That's a soft dismissal! Nothing back of a length delivery down leg, Krunal tried to glance fine, but got an edge and Dhoni was sharp moving to his right and grabbing that. Unlucky! Krunal started walking before the decision. Can CSK stage a comeback and stall MI? Krunal Pandya c Dhoni b Ngidi 3(3)

Ngidi to Pollard, out Caught by Dhoni!! Edged and taken. All those bowlers in the CPL, hope you note this length. Back of a length is the toughest to hit. If you have pace, it's a no brainer for you to use at the death to power-hitters than bowling freebies in the name of trying the fancied yorker, for which the margin of error is very less. Pollard slogs and gets a thick outside edge through to Dhoni. CSK have stolen 10 runs off the total. Pollard c Dhoni b Ngidi 18(14) [4s-1 6s-1]

Ngidi to Pattinson, out Caught by du Plessis!! Catch numer three for Faf and wicket number three for Ngidi. What a turnaround this has been from him. 29 in the first two overs, now has three. Sticks this back of a length delivery into the pitch, a brilliant option on slow surfaces, Pattinson looks to pull, high in the air and Faf has it easy. Pattinson c du Plessis b Ngidi 11(8) [4s-2]

Chahar to Boult, out Bowled!! Leg stump out of the ground. Length delivery on the leg stump, Boult slogs and misses. Oh Chahar is limping after delivering that ball. Looks like the hammie. He's stretching it. Hope it's not too serious as he wants to continue. Boult b Chahar 0(1)

Chawla to Rohit, out Caught by Sam Curran!! Such a soft dismissal as Rohit just chips this into the hands of mid-off. Half-hearted loft, never went through with it and to make it worse the timing isn't there at all. Bounces off the toe-end and it's a dolly for Curran. The MI captain gone early. Rohit c Sam Curran b Chawla 12(10) [4s-2]

Sam Curran to de Kock, out Caught by Watson!! Okay, the slowness of the surface is really coming to the fore here. After Rohit, de Kock toe-ends one. And it elicits a mighty roar from Ngidi who took some punishment from the left-hander. Back of a length around off, stops on de Kock as he heaves it straight to midwicket. Curran might've rolled his fingers across it as well. de Kock c Watson b Sam Curran 33(20) [4s-5]

Shami to Dhawan, out Dhawan Run Out!! A poor dismissal for the Capitals and Dhawan walks back for a duck. He might have actually been reprieved first up, think he gloved the pull and KL spilled it - the ball rolled wide of him and Dhawan thought there was a single on offer - dashed way down the track only to watch his partner motionless at the other end. Too late to return, KL ran across, collected the ball and lobbed in a throw at the striker's end - Gowtham was waiting for it and breaks the stumps, with a disconsolate Dhawan stranded in the middle. Dhawan run out (Rahul/Gowtham ) 0(2)

Ravi Bishnoi to Pant, out Bowled!! Maiden IPL wicket for Ravi Bishnoi. Nice comeback, young man. Long way to go! Bowls the wrong 'un, gets it to spin away outside off. Pant tries to do an encore, didn't sort of get into a good position and morever had to fetch it from outside off. Ends up dragging it onto the stumps via an inside edge. Bishnoi is upbeat and a crucial wicket for Punjab as Pant - the dangerman departs. Pant b Ravi Bishnoi 31(29) [4s-4]

Shami to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Jordan!! One brings two as they say. Two wickets in two overs for Punjab and both set batsmen back in shed for Delhi. Not a wise shot from Iyer at this stage. It was fuller just outside off, Iyer knew the mid-off was inside the ring, so got tempted and wanted to lift it over him. But his bat turns in his hands at the point of impact and as a result of which he miscues and offers a dolly to Jordan. Third wicket for Shami, brilliant. Shreyas Iyer c Jordan b Shami 39(32) [6s-3]

Cottrell to Axar, out Caught by Rahul!! Has this been taken? KL and Cottrell are ready to celebrate but umpire Nitin Menon pauses them, he isn't sure if the catch is clean. So, they are referring it to the third umpire. Axar is also asked to wait. No doubt about the glove, it's all about the catch. It's dipping on the way to Rahul and seems like he's grabbed it cleanly. OUT is the decision and the batsman can continue his walk back to the hut. Delhi are falling away quickly. A back of a length, veering down leg. Patel wanted to tickle it fine and he ended up gloving it to KLR, who went to his right and took a good low catch. Axar c Rahul b Cottrell 6(9)

Cottrell to Ashwin, out Caught by Shami!! There's the salute as Cottrell gets a wicket off his final ball. Went for the short delivery and it worked for him. Ashwin hopped back, opened his bat face and flayed it up in the air to third man. Couldn't find the distance and Shami pouches it comfortably. Ashwin had the licence to go for the kill, but eish.. Ashwin c Shami b Cottrell 4(6)

Shami to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Jordan!! This is a reckless start from the Capitals - short of a good length and well wide of off, not the length to be attempting the pull - Shaw goes for it, gets it low off the bat and it spoons high and towards mid-on. Jordan is the man under it and you don't expect him to drop those. Number two for the Kings and no wonder their management and owners look thrilled. Prithvi Shaw c Jordan b Shami 5(9) [4s-1]

Shami to Hetmyer, out Caught by Agarwal!! This is turning out to be a awful start for the Capitals - another soft dismissal and Shami is on cloud nine. He shortened his length and got one to angle across the left-hander, Hetmyer was looking to work it to the on-side, closed the bat-face early and the front-edge looped straight into the grateful hands of Mayank at extra-cover. As simple as it gets and the Capitals have been reduced to 13 for 3. Hetmyer c Agarwal b Shami 7(13) [4s-1]

Axar to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by Prithvi Shaw!! The pressure gets to Sarfaraz and he holes out to long-on. Advances and tries to dispatch Axar Patel over long-on, but the connection ain't sweet and he could only skew up a bottom edge to Shaw at long-on. Half the side back in the hut at the half-way stage. Sarfaraz Khan c Prithvi Shaw b Axar 12(12) [4s-2]

Rabada to Gowtham, out Caught by Pant! That's a shot of panic, and lack of faith in his technique. 142.7km/h of oomph on that one, Gowtham backs away and tries to use the pace, attempting to steer it away towards the third man area - gets a feather of a top-edge to Pant who holds onto the simplest of catches! More pressure on Agarwal now! Gowtham c Pant b Rabada 20(14) [4s-1 6s-1]

Stoinis to Agarwal, out Caught by Hetmyer! The agony! It was a full-toss, just a moment too less for Mayank to process this, flays this on account of the width, trying to slice this over deep backward point for six, but ends up finding the ONE fielder at the boundary - Hetmyer. Screams at the heavens for snatching this moment away from him, but he has only himself to blame, does Mayank. Just hasn't managed to finish this off! Agarwal c Hetmyer b Stoinis 89(60) [4s-7 6s-4]

Stoinis to Jordan, out Caught by Rabada! It's a super-over! A full-toss on the leg-stump, and he's flicked this straight to Rabada at short square leg, who holds on! A nightmare start to the over, from Stoinis, and he's managed to bring it to a tie. NOW NOW! Jordan c Rabada b Stoinis 5(6)

Mohit Sharma to Rahul, out Bowled!! First breakthrough for DC and it's a big one. Rahul chops this onto his stumps. A 134.2ks inswinger from Mohit Sharma, managed to pitch it on a good length and that sharp inward movement meant Rahul played it slightly outside the line of the delivery (he was trying to flick on the leg-side) and the timber's been rattled. Takes the inside edge and hammers the woodwork. Rahul b Mohit Sharma 21(19) [4s-2 6s-1]

Ashwin to Nair, out Caught by Prithvi Shaw!! A wicket off his first delivery against his former side for Ravi Ashwin. Loops it up teasingly and lures Nair into a big hoick on the leg-side, poor connection and he top-edges it high into the night sky. Prithvi Shaw at short fine had ample time to settle under it. Nair c Prithvi Shaw b Ashwin 1(3)

Ashwin to Pooran, out Bowled!! Got him and Ashwin has two in five balls. What a sweet revenge for the former KXIP skipper. Tosses this around middle and leg and gets it to rip sharply off the surface, Pooran was leaning forward but wasn't ready to counter the extra bounce as it kisses the pad before hitting the top of off. Left-handers against off-spin will always be a challenge and wasn't long ago we witnessed CSK send a left-hander against left-arm spin. Tactics, strategies...ah! What do the data analysts know? Pooran b Ashwin 0(3)

Rabada to Maxwell, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Not falling short this time around, Shreyas Iyer has his bucket hands wrapped around the dolly of a catch. Honestly, it's catching practice! Maxwell once again is early into his shot as he tries to loft the 144.2ks delivery over long-off. Doesn't get anywhere near the middle and Iyer does the rest. Maxwell c Shreyas Iyer b Rabada 1(4)

Shankar to Devdutt Padikkal, out Bowled!! Yep, another aimless heave and the inside-edge doesn't need fielders to catch it; it takes care of crashing it the stumps. So Padikkal didn't quite want to be playing sensibly anymore and not-find the boundaries with Kohli and AB sitting inside. And he clears out his front leg, swings big, and misses it completely. He swung so hard that his top hand slipped off the handle as well. Devdutt Padikkal b Shankar 56(42) [4s-8]

Abhishek Sharma to Finch, out Lbw!! Oh plumb. A harmless straight delivery, on a length, on middle and not really turning either. Finch sweeps, or at least tries to. And misses big time to find himself trapped, dead. Finch lbw b Abhishek Sharma 29(27) [4s-1 6s-2]

T Natarajan to Kohli, out Caught by Rashid Khan !! It's a thing with Kohli and the left-arm angle going across. This time it's no poke though, it's a slog in an innings that was looking for a step-up gear. So he tries to take on the longest boundary he has - cow corner - and he does it against Natarajan's slower cutter. It didn't sound bad or miscued in the way he connected, but, no, this is no anti-gravity Chinnaswamy; it's a sea-level Dubai. Long-on's there, inside the ropes. Kohli c Rashid Khan b T Natarajan 14(13)

Bhuvneshwar to de Villiers, out de Villiers Run Out!! 1 run completed. Drilled through the covers again, and flies full-length in trying to get back in for the second as well. But Manish's throw is flat, bang on top of the stumps. Yea, he's an AB on the field. de Villiers run out (Manish Pandey/Bairstow) 51(30) [4s-4 6s-2]

Bhuvneshwar to Shivam Dube, out Shivam Dube Run Out!! Just top skills. The field was set for a yorker -- long-off, long-on, deep mid-wicket. But Kumar does the double bluff, going for the quick bouncer. Dube meanwhile had himself committed to his front foot, and by the time he can rock back and look to pull, has the ball going over comfortably. Anyway, then he decides to step out for the single and doesn't even bother getting back in after getting nothing from Philippe as Bairstow runs to the stumps to whip the bails off. Okay, 163 then .. Shivam Dube run out (Bairstow) 7(8)

U Yadav to Bairstow, out Warner Run Out!! This is so unlucky. Warner is run out at the non-striker's end off a delivery that was smashed back by Bairstow. Another ordinary delivery that's pitched right up, it's hammered back down the ground but Umesh somehow gets a hand and deflects it onto the stumps. What a massive wicket in the middle of an over that's been dreadful up until this point. Redemption for Umesh I guess. RCB certainly see it that way. Warner run out (U Yadav) 6(6) [4s-1]

Chahal to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Navdeep Saini!! Gets him this time! Chahal once again lures Manish Pandey with the flight and the attempted loft doesn't find the middle, skews it off the bottom half of the bat and offers catching practice to the fielder at long-off. More pressure on Bairstow now... Manish Pandey c Navdeep Saini b Chahal 34(33) [4s-3 6s-1]

Chahal to Bairstow, out Bowled!! There's the wicket and there's the man for RCB. Kohli is absolutely pumped and rightly so. Must say it's a poor shot from Bairstow. The leggie from Chahal and Bairstow looked to send it to mars with a I-do-not-care-one-bit heave-ho on the leg-side, the flight and lack of pace meant Bairstow couldn't get under it and the leg peg has been shattered. Brave from Chahal to toss it up and invite the big hit. Bairstow b Chahal 61(43) [4s-6 6s-2]

Chahal to Shankar, out Bowled!! Chahal is on a hat-trick! The googly and it has gone right through the gate. A huge forward stride from Vijay Shankar, but he clearly misread the delivery there and played for the leg-break, not to be. It's RCB's game now and SRH will need some magic if they are to pull it off from here. Shankar b Chahal 0(1)

Shivam Dube to Priyam Garg, out Bowled!! Talk about unfortunate dismissals and SRH have two now! Must say it's a poor shot selection from Priyam Garg for there is no pace on offer from Shivam Dube. Garg shuffled across his off-stump and looked to scoop it past the keeper, lack of pace meant he failed to get any proper connection and ended up deflecting the ball onto stumps off his chest. Priyam Garg b Shivam Dube 12(13) [4s-1]

Shivam Dube to Abhishek Sharma, out Abhishek Sharma Run Out!! 1 run completed. It's getting chaotic out in the middle and Rashid Khan was ball-watching as he tried to complete the second, didn't realize he was running in the same line as Abhishek Sharma and both batsmen collided mid-pitch which led to an easy run-out. In fairness, there was never a second there and it's pressure that's consuming SRH at the moment. Abhishek Sharma worked it to deep square and by the looks of it, he wanted second right from the onset. Abhishek Sharma run out (U Yadav/Philippe) 7(4) [4s-1]

Navdeep Saini to Bhuvneshwar, out Bowled!! PACE.FULL.STRAIGHT. Always a deadly combination against the lower order batters. A 143ks thunderbolt from Navdeep Saini and the middle pole is absolutely hammered. Bhuvi plays a nothing shot as he tries to slog across the line and only swishes thin air. Bhuvneshwar b Navdeep Saini 0(2)

Navdeep Saini to Rashid Khan, out Bowled!! Off pole this time. Navdeep Saini likes hitting the stumps and we have seen a lot of that in the domestic cricket. A delivery that was too good for Rashid Khan. 144ks coming in from slightly wide of the crease and Rashid Khan is opened up by the angle, plays outside the line of the delivery and loses his off pole. Surely he's not 100 percent. A normal Rashid would have smashed that full ball over the rope! Rashid Khan b Navdeep Saini 6(5) [4s-1]

Shivam Dube to Mitchell Marsh, out Caught by Kohli!! Told ya, it's boom-or-bust and in all fairness, Marsh didn't have too many options there. Went for a mighty slog against a slower full ball and the moment it left the bat, he almost fell backwards before limping awkwardly behind the stumps. The slog came off the toe-end and Kohli accepts the dolly at long-on. Marsh is being helped off the field by the physio.Mitchell Marsh c Kohli b Shivam Dube 0(1)

Steyn to Sandeep Sharma, out Caught by Kohli!! It's all over. RCB start their campaign with a victory and it's their second successive win over SRH. Sandeep Sharma gets pace but this time there isn't enough width and all he could do with the incoming angle was miscue the pull into safe hands of Kohli at long-on, who took a splendid catch sprinting across the boundary rope to his right. Sandeep Sharma c Kohli b Steyn 9(6) [4s-1]

Tom Curran to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by Samson! Charges, and tries to swing this over the on-side, but gets it close to the shoulder of the outside edge and almost over the 'keeper, but Samson can do no wrong today! Leaps to take that one, and it sticks! Maginificent catch to get rid of Jadhav! Kedar Jadhav c Samson b Tom Curran 22(16) [4s-3]

Jofra Archer to du Plessis, out Caught by Samson! Short at the body, du Plessis loses his shape, instinctively worried about his fingers - he has history - and goes for a half-hearted hook. Gets a top-edge, as it lobs up towards the leg-gully area where Samson comes across to collect the catch. du Plessis c Samson b Jofra Archer 72(37) [4s-1 6s-7]

Rahul Tewatia to Watson, out Bowled!! The pull, the famed Watson pull, has brought about his downfall. Problem is the length isn't short at all. He's just trying to manufacture it out of nothing. Fails badly as this skids through onto his back pad and crashes into leg stump. May have been fooled by the trajectory actually. Tewatia kept it quite flat, pushing it through off the front of his hand. May have caused him to believe it was shorter than it was. Watson's furious with himself. Watson b Rahul Tewatia 33(21) [4s-1 6s-4]

Shreyas Gopal to Vijay, out Caught by Tom Curran!! Gopal's not only gotten away with a short ball, he's got a wicket for it. Vijay toe-ends his pull straight to deep square leg. Took his time, made a run-a-ball 21 and now departs. This will hurt CSK. Vijay c Tom Curran b Shreyas Gopal 21(21) [4s-3]

Rahul Tewatia to Sam Curran, out Stumped!! Tewatia gets the better of him this time. He shortens the length far enough to give room for the googly to turn past the outside edge. Curran, who's running down the pitch again, doesn't back out despite not reaching to the pitch. He slogs in vain. And because he is so far down, there's no going back either despite a valiant effort to do so. Neat stumping from Samson. Sam Curran st Samson b Rahul Tewatia 17(6) [4s-1 6s-2]

Rahul Tewatia to Ruturaj Gaikwad, out Stumped!! Charges down first ball and is nowhere near it. Ruturaj Gaikwad, finding a place in the team today, goes for a duck. Third wicket for Tewatia, who kept this wide outside off and once again ensured the length's short enough. Easy stumping. Ruturaj Gaikwad st Samson b Rahul Tewatia 0(1)

Ngidi to Samson, out Caught by Chahar!! That is the end of the Samson show - he's furious with himself as he walks back. Would have been a wide had he let it go - but the adrenaline was pumping and he couldn't hold back - went chasing after that and lifted it towards deep cover - Chahar ran in, took it awkwardly around his chest, reverse cupped - it threatened to pop out, but he manages to clutch it safely. Was the slower short ball and Samson didn't have the pace on the shot. Some relief for the CSKians, they clearly looked rattled. Samson c Chahar b Ngidi 74(32) [4s-1 6s-9]

Ngidi to Smith, out Miller Run Out!! 1 run completed. Appeal for a run-out at the bowler's end, Miller dived, has it saved him? A flat throw and a good pick-up. No, the dive's not good enough and Miller falls for a diamond duck on his Royals debut. Unfortunate way to get dismissed - it didn't help that Miller lost his bat as well, could have saved him else. On a length and at the stumps, worked in front of square on the on-side and it was Smith's call for the second. Miller responded well, but lost his bat as he dived - good throw from Gaikwad and Kedar was at hand to break the stumps. Miller run out (Ruturaj Gaikwad/Kedar Jadhav) 0(0)

Chawla to Uthappa, out Caught by du Plessis!! A chance and Faf has grabbed it cleanly. Redemption for Piyush, he struggled in the first two overs, but is pulling things back a touch. A poor start for Uthappa in Royals colours - came down the track, got close to the ball and drilled the drive - went flat, hard and straight to long-off. Was perhaps looking to go over cover, but ended hitting it a lot straighter - was dying onto Faf, who slid forward and held on. Uthappa c du Plessis b Chawla 5(9)

Sam Curran to Rahul Tewatia, out Lbw!! That looked plumb and Rahul Tewatia has been given OUT LBW. He has a chat with his captain and decides to review. It's a fair delivery, looks like no bat and UltraEdge confirms it, directly onto his toes, bang in front of middle and it's crashing low into the middle. Three REDS and Rahul Tewatia is OUT. A poor review from Tewatia, think he thought he got an inside edge. Almost the perfect yorker from Curran, turned out to be a low full-toss, Tewatia swung all around it and missed. Rahul Tewatia lbw b Sam Curran 10(8) [4s-1]

Sam Curran to Riyan Parag, out Caught by Dhoni!! Edged and caught - A straightforward dismissal and the Super Kings are pulling things back nicely. Two wickets in the over for Curran - shortened his length and angled one across the right-hander, Parag was looking to run it past the keeper, got it too fine though and MS did the rest - dived across to his right and the ball got stuck in his fingertips, he clasped it cleanly on the second attempt. Riyan Parag c Dhoni b Sam Curran 6(4) [4s-1]

Sam Curran to Smith, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! CSK are pulling things back very nicely, this was a length ball at the pads, Smith shuffled across and whipped it firmly, hit it in the air and straight down the throat of Kedar at deep mid-wicket. Smith is annoyed with himself as he walks back - suddenly, 200 looks very distant now. Smith c Kedar Jadhav b Sam Curran 69(47) [4s-4 6s-4]

Chahar to Jaiswal, out Caught&Bowled!! Oh no! Good comeback by Chahar. He persisted with the short ball and got it higher than the previous ball. Jaiswal went for the pull and only managed a top-edge, goes straight up and both Chahar and Dhoni converge, in the end it is the bowler who gets there first. Jaiswal c and b Chahar 6(6) [4s-1]

Rahul Chahar to Karthik, out Lbw!! DK and his slog, well, the love story isn't screening tonight. Chahar's kept it simple -- quick, straight, on off, no room, no spin. Karthik goes one-kneed early, premeditatingly, and misses the sweep all ends up. Yep, plumb, not even worth reviewing a review. Karthik lbw b Rahul Chahar 30(23) [4s-5]

Pollard to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Pollard has his first IPL wicket since 2015. But no, forget that. That's not the best part. Hardik Pandya's a credit stealer .. with Rana slicing yet another off-paced delivery outside off. But that means he's got to manufacture all the pace on this himself, which he can't with these 70-meter-boundaries. Anyway, here's what Pandya does: he's at sweeper, and the ball's quickly flying wide of him to his left. So he runs, intercepts while running, side-on, and makes sure he doesn't overbalance. Sorry, words will never do justice. Nitish Rana c Hardik Pandya b Pollard 24(18) [4s-2 6s-1]

Bumrah to Russell, out Bowled!! That's it. Get on with the handshakes. Rohit's killed it by persisting with Bumrah. And Bumrah's killed it with simple sheer lack-of-pace. He's leg-cuttered it in full, angling in on leg-stump, and Russell's clearly beaten on his hoick of sorts with his bat going through with the swing only to hear the rattle of death behind. Russell b Bumrah 11(11) [4s-2]

Bumrah to Morgan, out Caught by de Kock!! Edges. And KKR are happy to get generous with their wickets. They aren't doing a CSK. So Morgan backs away in trying to slap this over the covers, but Bumrah - with yet another cutter - gets it well across, taking the outside-edge and down the keeper's throat. Morgan c de Kock b Bumrah 16(20) [4s-1 6s-1]

Boult to Nikhil Naik, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Sharp bouncer, a left-arm round angle that climbs up around the head, which Naik has no option but to try pulling off his front foot. Top-edged, tame, and deep mid-wicket. Nikhil Naik c Hardik Pandya b Boult 1(3)

Pattinson to Cummins, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! The fun's over. A length delivery, in the slot you'd think at this stage of the game and with pace. But Cummins goes a little too hard on his bat-swing, inside-halving the miscued balloon to deep mid-wicket. Cummins c Hardik Pandya b Pattinson 33(12) [4s-1 6s-4]

Boult to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Pollard!! Gill gets carried away and picks out Pollard at mid-wicket. He's aghast and well, Rohit, who's back on the field enjoyed that. Banged in short outside off, it was getting big and Gill wanted to pull. Was in no control and the timing also went for a toss. Boult draws first blood for Mumbai. Shubman Gill c Pollard b Boult 7(11) [4s-1]

Rahul Chahar to Shivam Mavi, out Stumped!! Gives away his cards early with a charge down the pitch, which Chahar pulls his length back to and makes sure Mavi never gets there and finds himself stuck half way down. That sums up KKR tonight: Stuck cluelessly half way down with no chance of return. Shivam Mavi st de Kock b Rahul Chahar 9(10) [4s-1]

Pattinson to Narine, out Caught by de Kock!! That's how you pluck a fruit from a tree. Nonchalance from Qdk. Narine's feathered an edge and has to walk back. Never looked comfortable at the crease to be honest. Pattinson just kept it short and took it away from him. The Southpaw went for the cross-batted pull and it didn't really come off for him, de Kock timed his jump to perfection and snatched it with one glove. Pattinson roars and KKR have lost their second wicket. Narine c de Kock b Pattinson 9(10) [6s-1]

Shivam Mavi to de Kock, out Caught by Nikhil Naik!! Mavi strikes in his first over. That was in the air for an eternity, but the fielder there - Nikhil has managed to pouch it.
