Back of a length delivery by the young pacer and de Kock plays an-across-the-line wild hoick, A thick top-edge is induced as the South African gets caught at mid-wicket. de Kock c Nikhil Naik b Shivam Mavi 1(3)

Narine to Rohit, out Suryakumar Yadav Run Out!! 1 run completed. Yadav knew too. He put in the desperate dive but stayed down as he knew he had not made it in. Rohit steps out and is met by a back of a length delivery, he nudges it into the empty mid-wicket pocket and calls for the second, Narine chases after it and throws it to the bowler's end, Morgan gathers the ball and lights up the stumps. Even with a full length dive Yadav was six inches short. Suryakumar Yadav run out (Narine/Morgan) 47(28) [4s-6 6s-1]

Narine to Saurabh Tiwary, out Caught by Cummins!! Much needed wicket for KKR? I ask that because it brings more dangerous batsmen out to the middle. This was sort of a knuckle ball from Narine, Tiwary made room to go over extra cover but was deceived for the lack of pace, hit it much straighter than he would have liked and Cummins settles under it near long-off. Saurabh Tiwary c Cummins b Narine 21(13) [4s-1 6s-1]

Shivam Mavi to Rohit, out Caught by Cummins!! A fine knock comes to an end. Cummins might not be bowling well but he is catching everything that is coming his way. It was a juicy full toss but a tired Rohit did not have enough in the tank to capitalize, he miscues the big heave and holes out to long-on. Mavi picks up his second and he has done a decent job this over. Can he finish it well? Rohit c Cummins b Shivam Mavi 80(54) [4s-3 6s-6]

Russell to Hardik Pandya, out Hit Wkt!! What happened there? Pandya starts walking. Karthik then sees the the stumps light up. Pandya has brought his bat down in such a way that it has clipped the off-bail. Russell went round the wicket and spears in the yorker outside off, Pandya goes deep in the crease to play that but as he is about to bring his bat down, he hits the stumps. Walks off with a smile on his face. Russell too had no idea as to what had happened. Hardik Pandya hit wkt b Russell 18(13) [4s-2 6s-1]

Shivam Dube to Pooran, out Caught by de Villiers!! Oh no! Pooran has nailed this but straight to the fielder. Dube's golden arm strikes again. Big call to trust him with this over after Saini had gone for a few, but Pooran has just thrown it away. Charges down, converts it into an overpitched delivery and drills it straight to AB at mid-off. The idea was to place it wide of the fielder like he done to Umesh but Pooran was not able to do that. Pooran c de Villiers b Shivam Dube 17(18) [4s-1]

Shivam Dube to Maxwell, out Caught by Finch!! There's something about Dube. Batsmen feel they can take him on but that has not been the case. First Pooran and now Maxwell. Those are two big wickets especially in such a situation where they have to license to go after the bowling. Maxwell backs away and takes a step down, Dube cleverly bangs the slower delivery into the surface, the flat-batted shot does not have the elevation to go over, Finch takes a good low catch at cover. Maxwell c Finch b Shivam Dube 5(6)

Chahal to Agarwal, out Bowled! Knocked him over! Agarwal has no clue about that googly, hasn't read it out of the hand, leaves a gaping hole between the bat and pad trying to play the expansive inside out drive, as if to a leg-break, but that one turns in and crashes into the stumps of Agarwal. It's Yuzi again, who's picked up the King-pin (from the last game at least). Agarwal b Chahal 26(20) [4s-4]

Cottrell to Devdutt Padikkal, out Caught by Ravi Bishnoi!! The young man perishes. The run rate might have had a role to play. More than 10 per needed from ball one and Devdutt Padikkal tried for an over enthusiastic pull. Backed away, top-edged it and the man at mid-on took it. The 'Salute Celebration' is back as well. Devdutt Padikkal c Ravi Bishnoi b Cottrell 1(2)

Shami to Philippe, out Lbw!! That was plumb! The ball landed on a length, angled in and hit the batter dead in front of the sticks. Philippe looked to play across the line and missed it to be in trouble. The umpire didn't take much time to make his decision. Philippe lbw b Shami 0(3)

Maxwell to Shivam Dube, out Bowled!! That's the problem of being rooted to the crease. Never one to use his front foot well to the spinners, loves to play off the back foot. If Maxwell spotted that and deliberately fired this in on a good length, then full credit to him. Ill-advised flick off the back foot and that too off balance when he was trying shift back. Off the pad and into the sticks. Shivam Dube b Maxwell 12(12) [6s-1]

Ravi Bishnoi to U Yadav, out Bowled!! No, no! This is so poor from a senior pro who knows how exactly the IPL pans. Why not play out the overs! Yadav goes for an almighty hoick, he does muscle them long if he middles, but he misses and it crashes into middle and leg. Second wicket for the youngster. U Yadav b Ravi Bishnoi 0(2)

Ravi Bishnoi to Washington Sundar, out Caught by Agarwal!! Ravi Bishnoi, in his debut IPL, bags the purple cap in the second game. Five wickets for the youngster, third of the game. Oh scratch that, actually got only one wicket in the first game. So doesn't have the cap yet. Needs one more. He nicely floats and invites the lofted hit, Sundar was tempted to back himself and go for the big hit, mistimed it to long-on. Washington Sundar c Agarwal b Ravi Bishnoi 30(27) [4s-2 6s-1]

Murugan Ashwin to Navdeep Saini, out Bowled!! Shake of the head from Murugan Ashwin. Why did he bowl the leggie to the tailender and not target the sticks with a googly like this one, says Ashwin to himself. Saini lofts over the top, or he wanted to, misses and sneaks through the gate. Navdeep Saini b Murugan Ashwin 6(7) [4s-1]
Murugan Ashwin to Chahal, out Lbw!! Misses the sweep and the finger goes up! 97-run win for KXIP. Woah! Thats massive. Chahal lbw b Murugan Ashwin 1(3)

Cottrell to Kohli, out Caught by Ravi Bishnoi!! Bangalore pressing the self destruct button now. This shot from Kohli reminds me of his dismissal in the 2015 WC semis. A left-armer digging it short and getting the better of him thanks to an ungainly top-edge. This was caught easily at mid-on. That was short and angled across after a couple of fuller deliveries. Nicely set up by the bowler. He bent his back on this delivery and got his reward. Kohli c Ravi Bishnoi b Cottrell 1(5)

Ravi Bishnoi to Finch, out Bowled!! The quickish flattish leggie does it for Ravi Bishnoi. That beat Finch on the outer edge as he looked to punch it and missed it for the off pole to be disturbed. The young man has a huge scalp. The partnership was building and has been broken now. Punjab get an important wicket to stop the momentum. Finch b Ravi Bishnoi 20(21) [4s-3]

Murugan Ashwin to de Villiers, out Caught by Sarfaraz Khan!! The bat face turned on impact and has been taken at deep cover. The googly has done it for Murugan Ashwin. ABD has problems against leggies and has been exposed once more. The run rate also had a role to play in the dismissal. RCB have lost their top half and don't have much on the board. de Villiers c Sarfaraz Khan b Murugan Ashwin 28(18) [4s-4 6s-1]

Nortje to Kedar Jadhav, out Lbw!! That is plumb in front! Impact right in front of off stump. You can't be slogging with a pull shot when it's not really short. Hit around the kneeroll. Jadhav seemed to be rushed by that length delivery and DC have a breakthrough! Okay, was a slower delivery, so he was trying to adjust and that's why he missed. So far, a top over from Nortje. Kedar Jadhav lbw b Nortje 26(21) [4s-3]

Rabada to du Plessis, out Caught by Pant!! Edged and into the hands of Pant. Is that the game for DC? Death bowling is all about watching what the batsman does. Faf was backing away, so KG fired this short of length delivery wide of off and forced him to fetch, Faf tried to reach but only managed to kiss it to Pant as he overbalanced playing the shot. du Plessis c Pant b Rabada 43(35) [4s-4]

Rabada to Dhoni, out Caught by Pant!! Dhoni walks! Slower short delivery, Dhoni early into the pull shot, gets a thick edge that lobs in front of Pant who dives forward to complete the catch. This is so good from DC. Oh a bit of glove love between KG and Jadeja too. Nice to see. Dhoni c Pant b Rabada 15(12) [4s-2]

Rabada to Jadeja, out Caught by Mishra!! Cut straight to hand and Rabada has three. Nice end to a comprehensive win from DC. Short of a length, Jadeja guides and that's catching practice for Mishy. Jadeja c Mishra b Rabada 12(9) [4s-1]

Axar to Watson, out Caught by Hetmyer!! Watson walks straight into the trap set by Iyer and Co. For a second, I thought Hetmyer misjudged it by running in too far, but he keeps his calm and holds onto it. Another game, another instance of CSK losing an early wicket. Watson will be kicking himself there, couldn't have placed it any better. A short delivery begging to be hit, Watson jumped back and pulled it uppishly, didn't have the power to clear the fielder at deep mid-wicket. Very poor.. Patel is pumped. Watson c Hetmyer b Axar 14(16) [4s-1 6s-1]

Nortje to Vijay, out Caught by Rabada!! This was inevitable. With the way, he was timing it, you'd sensed it, a wicket was round the corner. Vijay's painful stay at the crease comes to an end and has he played his last game for CSK? You never know. DC are a happy bunch. A simple back of a length delivery just outside off, some extra zip and pace did the trick for Nortje. Vijay just swung his bat, got it high on the bat and spooned a dolly to Rabada at mid-on. CSK two down and in a spot of bother. Vijay c Rabada b Nortje 10(15) [4s-1]

Axar to du Plessis, out Ruturaj Gaikwad Run Out!! This is the last thing CSK would've wanted at this stage. Needless. Patel lasers in the armer, du Plessis is cramped for room as he inside-edges it towards square leg. Ruturaj was keen to get to the other end as he races across the pitch only for Faf to send him back. Pant quickly sprints across and flings in a sharp throw to the bowler. He put in a full-length dive but wasn't enough. Axar cleanly breaks the stumps and he's a goner! Ruturaj Gaikwad run out (Pant/Axar) 5(10)

Chawla to Dhawan, out Lbw!! Gone! Just the wicket they were looking for. He was playing so well, there was no need to play the reverse sweep. Actually the reverse heave. Chawla goes very full and the batsman gets beaten and rapped on the pads. The impact was around middle and this might have gone on to crash into the off-stump. Nevertheless, this was also the highest opening wicket stand for Delhi since 2016. Dhawan lbw b Chawla 35(27) [4s-3 6s-1]

Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, out Stumped!! Chawla gets rid of both the openers in successive overs. Prithvi Shaw walks down the wicket to play the flatter delivery and gets outfoxed. Comes off an inside edge, rolls back off the pad towards Dhoni who had to lunge forward to get the ball and stretch to break the bails. No chance of getting back in and that's the end of an impressive innings by the Capitals' opener. Can CSK get a few more wickets and stem the flow of runs? Prithvi Shaw st Dhoni b Chawla 64(43) [4s-9 6s-1]

Sam Curran to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Dhoni!! MS files to his right and takes a superb catch. What a spectacular over by Curran as he concedes only four runs. Slightly short ball outside off, Shreyas Iyer swings across the line and gets an outside edge which has been taken. A rather rusty knock comes to an end. Shreyas Iyer c Dhoni b Sam Curran 26(22) [4s-1]

Khaleel Ahmed to Narine, out Caught by Warner!! The start SRH would have wanted after being restricted to a modest score. Look at Warner go, he's pumped up, this could lift his team as well. Back of a length and at the stumps, Narine was slightly cramped up on the pull, gets a steepling top-edge towards mid-off and Warner made sure that everyone else stayed away. Watched it all along and held on, a fist pump from Khaleel Ahmed as he exults. Narine c Warner b Khaleel Ahmed 0(2)

T Natarajan to Nitish Rana, out Caught by W Saha!! A loose moment and Rana finds himself back on the way to the dressing room. He would be livid with himself, looked a million dollars, only to throw it all away. On a good length and a hint of shape away from the left-hander, Rana's feet went nowhere as he drove, gets a thick audible edge and Saha snaps it up. A wicket against the run of play, a wicket that would raise the hopes of SRH once again. Nitish Rana c W Saha b T Natarajan 26(13) [4s-6]

Rashid Khan to Karthik, out Lbw!! Celeb appeal and the umpire's finger goes up for LBW. Think DK was happy to go, but he then chatted with his partner and decided to review. Pretty sure the 15-second time gap had elapsed, but here we go. It's a fair delivery and there's no inside edge on that. Was the wrong 'un and DK didn't read it one bit. UltraEdge confirms that there's no bat on that, Hawk-Eye in and it's three REDS. Karthik is OUT and KKR have wasted their review. Lovely delivery from Khan, slipped in the wrong 'un and Karthik didn't spot it - ended up playing outside the line as he lunged forward. Past the inside edge and struck adjacent to middle, was going on and crashing into the middle-stump. SRH keep themselves in the hunt with timely wickets. Karthik lbw b Rashid Khan 0(3)

Russell to Manish Pandey, out Caught&Bowled!! A high full toss at 139.4kph, and is Manish Pandey is out caught-and-bowled? The umpires send it upstairs. It's below the waist and Pandey has to walk back. This is a big wicket. A full toss just below the waist from round the wicket, Pandey was initially looking to run it down to third man and later decided to work it into the on-side. In the end, the ball lobbed up off the splice of the bat. He was taken aback by the full toss. A simple return catch for Dre Russ. Manish Pandey c and b Russell 51(38) [4s-3 6s-2]

Russell to Nabi, out W Saha Run Out!! 1 run completed. Better length from Russell, full and outside off, Nabi batters it to long-off. Saha decides to come back for the second, but Nabi is unmoved. The former spots it only after coming halfway down the pitch. Cummins fires a good throw to the keeper's end and Karthik completes the proceedings. Easy call for the TV umpire. W Saha run out (Cummins/Karthik) 30(31) [4s-1 6s-1]

Russell to Abhishek Sharma, byes, 1 run, 140.6kph, shortish ball outside off, Sharma wafts and is beaten by the pace and bounce. The batsmen decide to sneak a run via byes. Karthik lobs it to the bowler, but Russell misses the target at his end

Cummins to Bairstow, out Bowled!! Knocked him over. So, he doesn't last long then. Cummins cleans him up. He's been excellent today, rarely has bowled a bad ball. Just sticks to the traditional length and targets the stumps. Bairstow follows a similar approach of making room and exposes all the three stumps. Misses it altogether on this occasion and the off-pole takes a beating. KKR have struck early here. Cummins is delighted with the breakthrough.. Bairstow b Cummins 5(10)

Chakravarthy to Warner, out Caught&Bowled!! First IPL scalp for Varun Chakravarthy in this edition of IPL. And it's the big fish - Warner. A blip in concentration for SRH's captain after the break. A nothing shot really. This gave an impression of stopping upon reaching the batsman. Teased Warner into pushing at it, he went a bit too hard and chips it back to the bowler. Chakravarthy doesn't drop those. It was catching practice indeed. KKR camp are elated. Warner c and b Chakravarthy 36(30) [4s-2 6s-1]

Washington Sundar to Rohit, out Caught by (sub)Negi!! First time Sundar has opened the bowling this season and he has got the big wicket of Rohit. Just the start RCB wanted especially after an expensive over from Udana. Rohit had enough of defending and was looking to go for the biggie, the length was fraction short and he was quick to pounce, pulls it high and that would have gone the distance in any other ground but not in Dubai, Negi settles under it at deep mid-wicket and hangs on comfortably. Rohit c (sub)Negi b Washington Sundar 8(8) [6s-1]

Zampa to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by (sub)Negi!! The celebration from Virat Kohli and Co. just tells you this wicket meant a lot to them. Zampa strikes gold for his team as Hardik Pandya departs. Got a lot of height on this mow, it's a big boundary at deep mid-wicket, it required more power to clear the fence, but sadly he couldn't generate it. Ubiquitous Negi circles around and pouches it safely. Massive blow to MI. Hardik Pandya c (sub)Negi b Zampa 15(13) [6s-1]

Udana to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Devdutt Padikkal!! More twist. More drama. Kishan's fallen a solitary run short of his century. Uff! A slower ball from Udana, trimmed his length a bit and Kishan slogged it hard, doesn't have power to clear deep mid-wicket and Devdutt clasps onto it. Take a bow, Kishan though. He's played a gem and has taken MI closer.. Ishan Kishan c Devdutt Padikkal b Udana 99(58) [4s-2 6s-9]

Udana to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by de Villiers!! RCB have two now. They had a solitary wicket in the powerplay before today and that too a lucky dismissal of Warner and now they have two in the space of four balls. Short of length delivery angled across the right hander, the ball bounces more than Suryakumar anticipated, he goes for the steer and edges it behind to the keeper. AB has a juggle before completing the catch. Suryakumar Yadav c de Villiers b Udana 0(2)

Chahal to de Kock, out Caught by (sub)Negi!! This was on the cards. de Kock never looked comfortable at the crease and with the required rate shooting up he had no other choice but to go after the spinner. Chahal is not afraid of getting hit, he tosses it up generously but gets it to dip on the southpaw, de Kock goes for the slog sweep and miscues it horribly, a much simpler catch for Negi at deep mid-wicket this time. de Kock c (sub)Negi b Chahal 14(15) [4s-1]

Rahul Chahar to Kohli, out Caught by Rohit!! No. no. no! You don't want to see that if you are a Kohli fan! That was a painful stay, but credit to Rahul Chahar. He troubled Kohli and deserved this wicket. Was the leggie, probably that diagonal over the wicket angle is troubling him - he was bowling most deliveries to Kohli from that angle. However, this was bowled with a conventional run-up, pitching on a length and turning away, Kohli loses one hand on the handle and chips it to cover. Kohli c Rohit b Rahul Chahar 3(11)

Boult to Devdutt Padikkal, out Caught by Pollard!! Pollard takes a really good catch. Boult dropping the slower ball short and wide of off, forcing Padikkal to fetch, Padikkal went for the pull, hit it decently, but big Pollard ran to his left, used all his height to great effect to take a gentle leaping catch. Well played young Dev! Boult's actually on a hat-trick, got Finch off the last ball of his previous over. Devdutt Padikkal c Pollard b Boult 54(40) [4s-5 6s-2]

Boult to Finch, out Caught by Pollard!! Catching practice for Pollard at long-off - the threatening partnership has been broken. Change of pace and Finch was done in completely - the slower ball and Finch had to manufacture all the pace on this attempted lofted drive - was looking to go over cover, but it skewed off the inner half and lobbed down towards Pollard at long-off. He didn't have to move, a fine knock from Finch comes to an end. Finch c Pollard b Boult 52(35) [4s-7 6s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Bairstow!! There is the edge.. Bairstow takes it neatly in front of his face and Bhuvi strikes in his first over. Got extra lift on this outswinger, beautiful seam presentation as it nibbles away outside off. Shaw with zero feet movement chases and nicks it behind. Early jitters in the DC camp. Prithvi Shaw c Bairstow b Bhuvneshwar 2(5)

Rashid Khan to Dhawan, out Caught by Bairstow!! SHR review an edge: A googly, spinning sharply across Dhawan's heave. And there's a little tickle off the toe-end. Bairstow's heard it, but he whips the bails off before appealing, confusing the umpire. So again, the excuse of blaming it on the loud noisy crowds for umpires missing nicks stands exposed. Dhawan c Bairstow b Rashid Khan 34(31) [4s-4]

Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! One bobble, second pouch. Kumar - bringing all his experience into this - keeps it slow, outside off and forces Hetmyer to reach out and slice it to the longest part of the boundary at long-off. Doesn't matter, he'd miscued it alright as Pandey runs in from the boundary, and holds on with some help from his chest. So SRH finally are into their home territory of small defences, choking out teams at the death. Hetmyer c Manish Pandey b Bhuvneshwar 21(12) [6s-2]

Rashid Khan to Pant, out Caught by Priyam Garg!! Rashid Khan, rare loop, rarer flight and a Rishabh Pant freaky sweep -- mix it, and a disaster's a certainty. So it starts with Pant premeditatingly shuffling across his stumps, Khan tossing it up on leg-stump, extracting bounce, getting the top-edge and going down deep square leg's throat. Pant c Priyam Garg b Rashid Khan 28(27) [4s-1 6s-2]

T Natarajan to Stoinis, out Lbw!! LBW reviewed compulsively with the knowledge that he's the last remaining batsman with the skill to stand up to this bully of a bowling attack. Natarajan keeps it the same, very full, on middle, and Stoinis in a hope to manufacture something funky out of this, shuffles across, misses his flick and finds himself plumb in front of middle. Yea, that's exactly what HawkEys also says - hitting the base of off in three reds, dark reds. Stoinis lbw b T Natarajan 11(9) [4s-1]

Khaleel Ahmed to Axar, out Bowled!! Through him. A big hoick across the line, and not that he had much of a choice here did Patel, but clearly wasn't even close to the line, that manages to drift in through the air and come in with the angle to drag off the inside edge to leave an LED-lit mess behind. Axar b Khaleel Ahmed 5(6)

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Abdul Samad!! Goneeee! Just needed two balls to get a breakthrough. Iyer wasn't in his zone tonight. Wanted to slice it over extra cover, the bat face turned in his hands at the point of contact and as a result of which, he skies it to deep cover. Samad runs in, doesn't panic and grabs it. His first catch in IPL and DC have lost their second wicket. Rashid is thrilled. Shreyas Iyer c Abdul Samad b Rashid Khan 17(21) [4s-2]

Mishra to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Rabada!! Weird shot from Pandey!! He had just come in and this isn't the easiest of surfaces to start on. Looks to take Mishra on with the slog sweep but is done in flight and gets a top-edge that's pouched comfortably at deep mid-wicket. It's that longer part of the ground which undid MI yesterday in Dubai, and just like that here in Abu Dhabi, has taken out Pandey today. He was clutching his hamstring last over, so did that play a role in this shot? Either ways, DC aren't complaining. This is a fab phase for them. Manish Pandey c Rabada b Mishra 3(5)

Rabada to Bairstow, out Caught by Nortje!! You can't deny Rabada for long at the death. He thrives in these situations and has struck a vital blow here. Cross-seamer from Rabada, very full and Bairstow made room for the loft. Didn't get any timing whatsoever and absolutely sent this straight up into the night skies. We've seen many such ones dropped, but Nortje holds his composure and takes it near the deep mid-off region. Bairstow falls after an workman-like innings. Bairstow c Nortje b Rabada 53(48) [4s-2 6s-1]

Rabada to Williamson, out Caught by Axar!! Holes out to deep mid-wicket. Slower ball, wide outside off and Williamson has to really fetch this one. Looks to wrist this away but these are big dimensions on that part of the ground. Doesn't get the distance on the stroke and picks out the fielder to perfection. A priceless cameo from the NZ skipper though. Williamson c Axar b Rabada 41(26) [4s-5]

Mishra to Warner, out Caught by Pant!! Another attempted reverse sweep and Pant reckons there was some glove on that. The Capitals have reviewed the caught behind call. This looks close, think Warner might be in trouble, looked like a feather on the glove. UltraEdge in and there's a minor spike when the ball is past Warner's gloves. That's enough for the third umpire to overturn the original call. Warner is OUT. Think it's a fair decision from the third umpire, Chris Gaffaney. The spike wasn't huge, but there seemed to be a deviation when the ball went past the gloves - Warner was attempting the reverse sweep to one that drifted across him - caught the glove and Pant stood low to hold on. A wicket against the run of play, the dangerous Warner departs. Warner c Pant b Mishra 45(33) [4s-3 6s-2]

Rahul Tewatia to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Riyan Parag!! Tewatia gets Rana. A floated delivery around off, Nitish Rana looks to take on Rahul Tewatia and fails in his quest to clear long-off. Lofts it high up in the air, but fails to get the distance. It's Riyan Parag who completes a safe catch in the deep. This has been the problem with Rana this season. He's getting those starts, but he's not really able to convert them. Nitish Rana c Riyan Parag b Rahul Tewatia 22(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

Jofra Archer to Shubman Gill, out Caught&Bowled!! And Archer strikes. He was brought back to take out Russell but Rajasthan won't mind this. The set batsman departs and it is two new batsmen out in the middle. 140.5kph back of a length delivery angled in to the right hander, Gill is a tad early into his flick and the leading edge balloons up, Archer calls for it and tumbles backwards as he completes the catch. Shubman Gill c and b Jofra Archer 47(34) [4s-5 6s-1]

Jofra Archer to Karthik, out Caught by Buttler!! Archer is on fire. This is a jaffa to remove the KKR captain. A typical Archer wicket. Pounds it hard at 147.3kph on back of a length and gets it to straighten a tad, just a tad and Karthik ended up playing the wrong line, the outside edge settled nicely into Buttler's mitts. Karthik c Buttler b Jofra Archer 1(3)

Rajpoot to Russell, out Caught by Unadkat!! And gone! Rajasthan have their man. Russell cannot believe it as he walks back with both his hand along with the bat over his head. KKR in trouble now with half the side back in the dugout. There was a plan and Rajpoot has bowled to it. Third man was up, deep backward point was in place and a deep extra cover. Rajpoot went for the wide yorker and even nailed it, Russell bends down and slices it straight to Unadkat at deep backward point. That was right off the meat but the long boundaries did not help him there. Russell c Unadkat b Rajpoot 24(14) [6s-3]

Tom Curran to Cummins, out Caught by Samson!! Wow! Has Samson hurt his head? Landed badly on it. Slower short ball and Cummins takes it on, he miscues the pull to deep backward square, Samson misjudges it slightly as he overruns it but adjusts well to leap up and take it over his head, he tumbles backwards and that's when he hits his head onto the ground. Seems to be fine.. Cummins c Samson b Tom Curran 12(10) [4s-1]

Unadkat to Narine, out Bowled!! Oh yeah, Robbie will be a relieved man! His prayers have worked, and the dropped catch hasn't cost much. Unadkat sticks to his slower ones and he has managed to knock down Narine. Rolled his fingers, pitched this one on a good length. Narine like always, swings and misses. Failed to get him in his previous over, but has managed to get his man eventually. First wicket for Unadkat this season. Narine b Unadkat 15(14) [4s-2 6s-1]

Rahul Tewatia to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Riyan Parag!! Tewatia gets Rana. A floated delivery around off, Nitish Rana looks to take on Rahul Tewatia and fails in his quest to clear long-off. Lofts it high up in the air, but fails to get the distance. It's Riyan Parag who completes a safe catch in the deep. This has been the problem with Rana this season. He's getting those starts, but he's not really able to convert them. Nitish Rana c Riyan Parag b Rahul Tewatia 22(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

Jofra Archer to Shubman Gill, out Caught&Bowled!! And Archer strikes. He was brought back to take out Russell but Rajasthan won't mind this. The set batsman departs and it is two new batsmen out in the middle. 140.5kph back of a length delivery angled in to the right hander, Gill is a tad early into his flick and the leading edge balloons up, Archer calls for it and tumbles backwards as he completes the catch. Shubman Gill c and b Jofra Archer 47(34) [4s-5 6s-1]

Jofra Archer to Karthik, out Caught by Buttler!! Archer is on fire. This is a jaffa to remove the KKR captain. A typical Archer wicket. Pounds it hard at 147.3kph on back of a length and gets it to straighten a tad, just a tad and Karthik ended up playing the wrong line, the outside edge settled nicely into Buttler's mitts. Karthik c Buttler b Jofra Archer 1(3)

Rajpoot to Russell, out Caught by Unadkat!! And gone! Rajasthan have their man. Russell cannot believe it as he walks back with both his hand along with the bat over his head. KKR in trouble now with half the side back in the dugout. There was a plan and Rajpoot has bowled to it. Third man was up, deep backward point was in place and a deep extra cover. Rajpoot went for the wide yorker and even nailed it, Russell bends down and slices it straight to Unadkat at deep backward point. That was right off the meat but the long boundaries did not help him there. Russell c Unadkat b Rajpoot 24(14) [6s-3]

Tom Curran to Cummins, out Caught by Samson!! Wow! Has Samson hurt his head? Landed badly on it. Slower short ball and Cummins takes it on, he miscues the pull to deep backward square, Samson misjudges it slightly as he overruns it but adjusts well to leap up and take it over his head, he tumbles backwards and that's when he hits his head onto the ground. Seems to be fine.. Cummins c Samson b Tom Curran 12(10) [4s-1]

Unadkat to Narine, out Bowled!! Oh yeah, Robbie will be a relieved man! His prayers have worked, and the dropped catch hasn't cost much. Unadkat sticks to his slower ones and he has managed to knock down Narine. Rolled his fingers, pitched this one on a good length. Narine like always, swings and misses. Failed to get him in his previous over, but has managed to get his man eventually. First wicket for Unadkat this season. Narine b Unadkat 15(14) [4s-2 6s-1]

Rahul Chahar to Pooran, leg byes, 1 run, Pooran tried to slog-sweep the googly and missed, luckily the ball pitched outside leg stump. Mumbai needlessly reviewed, only to lose. QdK was blinded by the batsman, so he couldn't tell the full story

Pattinson to Pooran, out Caught by de Kock!! A game of angles, nothing else folks. You would think how on earth did a set batsman of Pooran's ability not muscle that juicy full ball over the ropes. but there's a lot on the technical side in this game. Pooran took the invitation without knowing there was trap, he swung too hard and lost a bit of shape which is why he couldn't find the middle. Edge to QdK who takes a simple catch. A lot of times people wonder why Cottrell and not Jordan in a team. It's all about the angles. Left-arm angle to right-handeed batsman isn't all that easy. Pooran c de Kock b Pattinson 44(27) [4s-3 6s-2]

Rahul Chahar to Maxwell, out Caught by Boult!! Okay it's so simple. If you have a leggie in your team, make him bowl into the wicket/not too full and get it to turn outside off stump, Maxwell can't resist slogging across the line, unfortuanly the bat keeps turning in his hands and he slices them. This had a lot of height as he tried to fetch a pull shot, Boult moved a few paces forward and catches it. Maxwell c Boult b Rahul Chahar 11(18)

Bumrah to Neesham, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Caught off a high full toss, they are checking but it's just below the waist and a legal delivery. When it's not your day even the full toss go to fielders. Neesham wanted to smash over mid-wicket, miscued it high and actually a good grab running back from backward point over his right shoulder.Neesham c Suryakumar Yadav b Bumrah 7(7)

Pattinson to Sarfaraz Khan, out Lbw!! That's a toe-crusher at the base of leg stump. Sarfaraz couldn't get that away with the attempted flick shot, ump raised the finger. Batsman reviewed, but he knew he was a goner. Sarfaraz Khan lbw b Pattinson 7(8) [4s-1]

Boult to Ravi Bishnoi, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! SKY has been really busy in the last few minutes. Full and into the sticks, Bishnoi actually squeezed that well, but hit it straight to backward point. The fielding show should lift SKY after the run-out today. Ravi Bishnoi c Suryakumar Yadav b Boult 1(5)

Bumrah to Agarwal, out Bowled!! Castled! Massive breakthrough as Bumrah goes right through a dangerous Agarwal. Pitched right up, finds movement off the seam as it comes in off the deck. Agarwal hadn't bargained for it. He threw his hands on the drive without any footwork. It's a shot you play on a flat pitch. This, however, has something in it. Bowls him through the gate. Agarwal b Bumrah 25(18) [4s-3]

Krunal Pandya to Nair, out Bowled!! Nair chops on! He attempts to cut this ball away from close to off stump but never has enough room to do so, despite his effort of stepping into the leg-side. The length isn't all that short either. Been up and down the order in this tournament, and this duck will only add to the pressure. Nair b Krunal Pandya 0(3)

Rahul Chahar to Rahul, out Bowled!! Rahul steps across to paddle sweep and is bowled behind his legs. Oh what a massive wicket. Just went too far and then missed it, getting done by the pace at which this skidded through. Probably only clips the leg bail, but that's all it had to do. Mumbai in control now. Rahul b Rahul Chahar 17(19) [4s-1]

Cottrell to de Kock, out Bowled!! Cleans him up, right through everything. It's that pre-covid-Starc dismissal -- which Quinton's looking to whip against the outswing. Clearly he's in no position to connect, but Cottrell's perfectly in position and pose in his salute. de Kock b Cottrell 0(5)

Gowtham to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Nair!! Ishan Kishan's struggle comes to an end. Probably, a blessing in disguise for Mumbai Indians. Time for Pollard and the Pandya brothers to take charge from here on. Was down on his knee to play the slogsweep as Kishan finds the man at deep mid-wicket. Two contrasting knocks for Kishan then. 99 the other night, and only 28 tonight. More importantly, he has used up too many deliveries in this innings. Ishan Kishan c Nair b Gowtham 28(32) [4s-1 6s-1]

Shami to Rohit, out Caught by Neesham!! Tag-team effort by Maxwell and Neesham has helped Punjab get rid of the Hitman. Maxwell did all the hard work there, but Neesham makes sure that his effort isn't in vain. Was lofted towards long-off by Rohit as Maxy grabbed it and just when he was about to overhaul the boundary, he parried it to Neesham who was charging across from long-on. Shami has been the strike bowler for Punjab this season, and here's why. Rohit c Neesham b Shami 70(45) [4s-8 6s-3]

Ravi Bishnoi to Rohit, out Suryakumar Yadav Run Out!! Direct hit, and Punjab are already celebrating. Yadav clearly underestimates Shami - the short fine leg - as Rohit's sweep goes to his right and decides to take his aim and his arm on with the quick single. Yea, nothing helps when it's a direct hit, not even a full stretch, and just like that, Surya finds himself run-out for the second time in these four games. Suryakumar Yadav run out (Shami) 10(7) [4s-2]

Rashid Khan to Jadeja, leg byes, 1 run, SRH review. It's a referral against Jadeja for an lbw. But I think this was sliding down the leg side, and Hyderabad will lose their review in that case.. As I look at the replays, it's pitching outside leg as well. Jadeja tried to whip it through the on side, but couldn't connect it..

T Natarajan to Jadeja, out Caught by Abdul Samad!! Jadeja departs after an enterprising knock. Gets a short ball to have a go after and he has swung it straight to Samad at deep square leg. Looked a slightly tired shot, but he has made up for that strike rate. Was struggling initially, but this innings will give him some confidence going forward. Jadeja c Abdul Samad b T Natarajan 50(35) [4s-5 6s-2]

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, out Bowled!! Chopped on - Have to say this was coming, Watson was never at home against Bhuvneshwar - short of a length and just outside off, a flat-footed Watson aimed at the cut, cramped for room - all he managed was a big inside edge, the ball bounced back onto the off-stump and the lightened up bails signals Watson's sorry exit. CSK have once again lost an early wicket in this season's tournament. Watson b Bhuvneshwar 1(6)

T Natarajan to Rayudu, out Bowled!! A peach and the in-form Rayudu has been sent packing. Lapse in concentration? Could be the case, but this was a cracker of a delivery from the Tamil Nadu pacer - hit the deck hard around leg and then seamed away sharply - Rayudu was completely opened up as he looked to tuck, past the closed the bat-face and the ball went on to hit the top of off-stump. A dream dismissal for any left-arm pacer. Rayudu b T Natarajan 8(9) [4s-1]

T Natarajan to Kedar Jadhav, out du Plessis Run Out!! A direct hit would have definitely run du Plessis OUT, but is he still short? Great work from Bairstow as he pushed the ball at the stumps. du Plessis is definitely short, but was it the ball hitting the stumps or did Bairstow break the stumps without the ball in his hand? Actually, the ball slipped out of his hands, but think it inadvertently went on to hit the stumps. OUT is the call. That's a massive blow for the Super Kings - the in-form du Plessis has been sent packing. Never a run there and Kedar must cop the blame for it - tucked it to the right of mid-wicket and set-off for a single. Garg was quick on the ball and has a shy at the striker's end - he missed, but Bairstow was covering for the throw. The ball did slip out of his hands, but luckily for him, it fell onto the stumps. Either way, du Plessis was well short. Replays suggest that du Plessis didn't really sense the danger first-up, was a bit slow to start and by the time he realised his mistake, it was all too late. du Plessis run out (Priyam Garg/Bairstow) 22(19) [4s-4]

Abdul Samad to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by Warner!! Chennai in trouble as they've lost almost half of their side. Abdul Samad strikes in his first over. Played a handy cameo a few days ago and strikes right away today. Tempts the batsman with a loopy legbreak around off and Kedar chips it straight to the SRH skipper at covers. Good reflexes shown by Warner as he completes the catch and isn't he delighted? Kedar Jadhav c Warner b Abdul Samad 3(10)

Chahar to Bairstow, out Bowled!! Gets him with a peach of an inswinger. Full and swinging in towards middle and off, Bairstow looks to flick over mid-wicket and plays all around it. Gets completely beaten by the inward movement and the woodwork is all over the place.Bairstow b Chahar 0(3)

Chawla to Warner, out Caught by du Plessis!! Faf is making a habit of pulling off these boundary-flirting catches and he makes it look so easy. Warner is disappointed and he knew he was in trouble from the moment it left the bat. Huge wicket for CSK. Warner danced down the track and perhaps got a little too close to the pitch of the delivery, miscues the loft off the toe-end, it did seem like going for a maximum but there's always a risk involved when you take on a fielder like Faf. He Leaps up full length, grabs the ball on the jump and quickly realizes, he's gonna go over the ropes. What does he do then? Just maintains his composure, lobs the ball in the air before going over the ropes and collects the ball with ease on the second attempt. Warner c du Plessis b Chawla 28(29) [4s-3]

Chawla to Williamson, out Williamson Run Out!! This is disaster of the highest class. Williamson flicks it to mid-wicket and calls for a quick single, Priyam Garg barely responded and Williamson was left stranded mid-pitch. There was never a single there and Rayudu at mid-wicket had all the time in the world to lob the ball to Dhoni who does the rest. He looks upset, not sure if it was his call, but having played it to the right of mid-wicket, there was no single on there. Williamson run out (Rayudu/Dhoni) 9(13) [4s-1]

Chahar to Abhishek Sharma, out Caught by Dhoni!! Abhishek's fun-filled innings is over, but he has done his job. Banged in short and angling across the left-hander, the attempted slower bouncer from Chahar - Abhishek was looking to nail the pull wide of mid-wicket, gets an audible edge and MS does the rest. Abhishek Sharma c Dhoni b Chahar 31(24) [4s-4 6s-1]

SN Thakur to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Sam Curran!! Manish Pandey perishes and instantly shadow-practices the execution. It was a cross-seam delivery from Shardul Thakur and the length - full - lured Pandey to go for big shot. He looks to slap-drive it over mid-off but doesn't get the timing right, skews it off the thick toe-end and offers catching practice to Curran at mid-off. Manish Pandey c Sam Curran b SN Thakur 29(21) [4s-5]

Jofra Archer to Devdutt Padikkal, out Bowled!! Timber! 145.7kph, very full and attacking the sticks from round the wicket, Padikkal backs away a long way and is too late to bring his horizontal bat down. Crashes into the base of off and middle. First wicket for Archer, is it too late though? Devdutt Padikkal b Jofra Archer 63(45) [4s-6 6s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to Finch, out Lbw!! It's that man again - Shreyas Gopal, who strikes for Rajasthan. He usually does well against RCB and has got a wicket in his first over. Flighted just outside off - the googly which spun back in - Finch was alerted by his partner about this threat, still he went low to sweep and failed to connect. The impact was in-line and the only question was whether it was hitting the stumps. Gopal was proved right and RCB have lost their first wicket. Finch lbw b Shreyas Gopal 8(7) [4s-2]

Chahal to Uthappa, out Caught by Udana!! Uthappa looks to go big against Chahal and he has found the man at long-off. Was a loopy legbreak around off and Robbie miscues it completely in his quest to clear the fence. Udana takes a comfortable catch in the deep and Chahal has just bagged his second wicket of the match. Sunrisers were in a similar situation yesterday. 70/4 when two youngsters braved them out of trouble. Uthappa c Udana b Chahal 17(22) [4s-1]

Udana to Riyan Parag, out Caught by Finch!! The experience of Udana overcomes Parag. He looks to slap the short ball, but fails to get the distance. Mistimed to long-on where Finch moves forward and reverse cups it. Right then, time for the miracle man - Tewatia to come in and take charge. Do we have another Tewatia special on the cards? Riyan Parag c Finch b Udana 16(18) [4s-1]

Chahal to Lomror, out Caught by Devdutt Padikkal!! Chahal brings an end to Lomror's stay! Keeps this one slightly wide outside off and the batsman has to reach out for it. Throws his hands at it, as the ball is miscued towards long-off where Padikkal isn't going to miss out. He'll be disappointed that he couldn't get a fifty. Right then, it's Jofra time.. Lomror c Devdutt Padikkal b Chahal 47(39) [4s-1 6s-3]

Udana to Smith, out Bowled!! Chopped on! Smith is livid with himself. It was there to be hit, short and wide but the slowness of the deck, and the lack of bounce does him in. Udana had offered no pace and so, Smith's attempted cut stroke results in a big inside edge that disturbs the furniture. Udana is elated, his slower ball menu has finally found success. Smith b Udana 5(5) [4s-1]

Navdeep Saini to Buttler, out Caught by Devdutt Padikkal!! What a way to start your spell! This is a massive strike first-ball by Saini. The dangerous Buttler is out of here. The umpires wanted to refer it upstairs for a bump ball but Jos was already walking. He knew it was a fair dismissal. Raw pace probably did him in here, very full and outside off, Buttler tried to squeeze the drive but could only get a thick edge. Padikkal was placed at a wide slip, perhaps strategically and it's straight at him. Sharp low catch and RCB are absolutely pumped. Dream start for them. Buttler c Devdutt Padikkal b Navdeep Saini 22(12) [4s-3 6s-1]

Chahal to Samson, out Caught&Bowled!! And he strikes first-ball! What a catch from Chahal! They're checking for a clean catch. Soft signal is OUT. Seemed alright in real time. Okay, the replays are quite confusing. It does seem like a bit of his fingers are under the ball, but also a portion of it seems to be touching the ground. The third umpire isn't sure but he feels there isn't enough evidence to overturn the onfield call. So, Samson has to walk. Huge, huge wicket this. Was doled out full by Chahal and Samson moved leg-side to drive through the covers. Got it off the inside part of the bat and the ball was travelling to the right of the bowler. Chahal stuck his right hand to pouch it. A very fine reflex attempt. RR in disarray here. Samson c and b Chahal 4(3) [4s-1]

K Nagarkoti to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Nagarkoti has his man. He has gone for quite a few but this should give him some relief. [Pounded it back of a length and Shaw backed away to hack it into the leg-side, but only manages a toe-end towards long-on, Gill runs and settles nicely under it. A fine knock comes to an end. Can KKR apply brakes now? b]Prithvi Shaw c Shubman Gill b K Nagarkoti 66(41) [4s-4 6s-4][/b]

Russell to Pant, out Caught by Shivam Mavi!! Better from Russell. More the area he needs to bowl. This is right up there, near to yorker length, Pant goes deep in the crease and plays the helicopter, but doesn't get enough to clear long-on, Mavi does not have to move much as he takes a simple chance. A perfect cameo from Pant but he would have wanted to bat a bit longer. Pant c Shivam Mavi b Russell 38(17) [4s-5 6s-1]

Russell to Stoinis, out Caught by Chakravarthy!! Stoinis cannot believe it. He moved across his stumps and reaches out for a slow delivery way down leg, the cue-end balloons towards short fine and Chakravarthy takes a dolly. It would have been a wide had he let go but at this stage batsmen want to put bat on ball all the time. Stoinis c Chakravarthy b Russell 1(3)

Chakravarthy to Dhawan, out Caught by Morgan!! Has struck a couple of sixes with his sweep shot. This one though goes straight up off the top-edge. It was the one that turned away from Dhawan and got him closer to the toe-end, hence the error. Morgan is underneath the skier at square leg. Swirls under it. Eventually has to put in a bit of a dive, but grabs it with both hands. Dhawan c Morgan b Chakravarthy 26(16) [4s-2 6s-2]

Nortje to Narine, out Bowled!! Knocked him over! Nortje is pumped up. Another failure for Narine. 147.6kph, Narine is expecting a short ball, the bowler smartly bowls a length ball. The left-handed batter backs away in an attempt to hoick across the line. Too quick for him though. Gets beaten on the inside edge and the ball hits the top of leg. Narine b Nortje 3(5)

Harshal Patel to Nitish Rana, out Caught by (sub)Axar!! It's not that Rana had much of a choice apart from hopeful bat-swings. But Patel had this shorter, slower, hence ruining the timing on Rana's attempted heave over mid-wicket. The miscue is a top-edge, and the Patel-unity will do it by the boundary. Nitish Rana c (sub)Axar b Harshal Patel 58(35) [4s-4 6s-4]

Harshal Patel to Karthik, out Caught by Dhawan!! And the game's killed. Go on, shake your sanitized hands and move on with life. Patel digs in a short-quick one, hurrying Karthik into his pull for a top-edge that balloons and dips in front of mid-on. Fhawan's there, diving into it, and thigh-slapping. Karthik c Dhawan b Harshal Patel 6(8)

Nortje to Cummins, out Caught by Harshal Patel!! Top-edged splice. 151ks, back of a length, outside off and Cummins attempted carve over point ends up at third man, where Harshal does rather well to get low and under. Cummins c Harshal Patel b Nortje 5(4) [4s-1]

Nortje to Morgan, out Caught by Hetmyer!! Brave delivery this -- back of a length, into the body and Morgan in fact swipes it rather well. But no, it's flat and straight to a waiting backward square leg. The trick was that this one skidded along more than normal, getting Morgan crouched more than normal. Okay, now, surely game over? No? Okay. Morgan c Hetmyer b Nortje 44(18) [4s-1 6s-5]

Stoinis to R Tripathi, out Bowled!! Yorker. Timber. Stoinis finally gets it right, dipping under Tripathi's yet-another one-kneed-hoick and sneaking further to clean him up. R Tripathi b Stoinis 36(16) [4s-3 6s-3]

Mishra to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Pant!! Amit Mishra breaks the 64-run stand. He conceded just 2 runs in his opening over, should have scalped Nitish Rana too. Nevertheless, he has nipped out Gill. A floaty leg-break, spins away a bit, Gill gets down to slog-sweep and only manages a top edge. Went a long way up in the air and Pant moves towards the square leg region to pouch it. Shubman Gill c Pant b Mishra 28(22) [4s-2 6s-1]

Rabada to Russell, out Caught by Nortje!! Rabada has the last laugh! 144.6kph, dug in short, Russell wants to hit another six. Despite not being in a great position, hurriedly plays a pull shot and gets a big top edge. Nortje runs in from third man and holds onto it safely. Rabada is cock-a-hoop! Big wicket for Delhi Capitals... Russell c Nortje b Rabada 13(8) [4s-1 6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Rohit, out Caught by Bairstow!! Massive wicket for Hyderabad. Superb review from them. There was a sound but umpire Illingworth was not convinced. It was short and way outside off, close to being called a wide but Rohit goes chasing after it and gets a toe-end, Bairstow does the rest behind the stumps. Replays also show a clear deviation in the path of the ball. Rohit c Bairstow b Sandeep Sharma 6(5) [6s-1]

Rashid Khan to de Kock, out Caught&Bowled!! A miscue from de Kock, Rashid called for the catch and Rashid takes the catch - running all the way to mid-wicket. The quicker delivery from the Afghan maestro - was the wrong 'un and de Kock didn't spot it, was setting himself for the pull and ended up playing against the turn. A massive top-edge and the ball was in the air for a long time. Rashid was always under the delivery, watches it keenly and takes it over his shoulder. End of a fine knowck from the MI opener. de Kock c and b Rashid Khan 67(39) [4s-4 6s-4]

Sandeep Sharma to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Now, now - this is simply sensational from Manish. He's had a shocker by his own high standards today, but he has pulled off an absolute ripper now. Kishan will consider himself desperately unlucky here, length ball and he flat-batted the lofted drive to the right of long-on. Had enough power, but not the elevation. Manish rushed across from long-on, threw himself at the ball - was parallel to the ground when he completed the two-handed catch and then had the sense to make sure that it didn't pop out when his elbow hit the ground. Ishan Kishan c Manish Pandey b Sandeep Sharma 31(23) [4s-1 6s-2]

S Kaul to Hardik Pandya, out Bowled!! The perfect yorker, this time by Siddarth and he has Hardik's stumps in a mess. Came from round the wicket - fired it very full and at the stumps, Hardik was opening himself on the helicopter shot, missed and the ball pinged the leg-stump, off his back-pad. If it hadn't hit the stumps, he would have been OUT plumb LBW. Hardik Pandya b S Kaul 28(19) [4s-2 6s-2]

S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by T Natarajan!! Horrible cricket from both Kaul and Yadav. This was another rubbish delivery from Kaul. Full and spraying down leg, like Rohit, Yadav goes chasing it and flicks it straight to Natarajan at short fine leg. He could have let it through and collected a wide, he could have hit it along the ground but instead Yadav picked out the fielder. Suryakumar Yadav c T Natarajan b S Kaul 27(18) [4s-6]

Boult to Williamson, out Caught by de Kock!! Boult has deceived the NZ captain with a slower delivery. Off-speed, on a shortish length and just outside off. Williamson arched his back to play a late-upper-cut. He was through with his shot and only managed a faint outside nick. Simple catch for the 'keeper. Williamson tried to pull his bat in, but it was too late. Williamson c de Kock b Boult 3(5)

Krunal Pandya to Priyam Garg, out Caught by Rahul Chahar!! Full toss and out! Garg shapes up to slog-sweep, gets the timing wrong - courtesy top edge - and Chahar has pulled off a brilliant catch at deep square leg. The leggie moved to his left, and reverse-cupped it. He was very close to the boundary rope and tumbled to complete the catch. Did he touch the boundary rope while tumbling and getting up? The TV umpire has been summoned and he rules it rightly in the favour of the fielding team. Priyam Garg c Rahul Chahar b Krunal Pandya 8(7)

Pattinson to Warner, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Pattinson has his man! It's the slower ball off the back of the hand, wide outside off at 110.8kph, Warner chases it for a cut and gets a thick top edge. Kishan dives to his right at short third man and completes the formalities. The fielder is pumped up, I'm sure the entire MI set-up is. Warner c Ishan Kishan b Pattinson 60(44) [4s-5 6s-2]

Bumrah to Abdul Samad, out Caught by Rohit!! 146.8kph, Bumrah goes full, the line is around off, Samad wants to slog across the line. The ball pops up off the leading edge and Rohit completes the formalities in the extra cover region. Abdul Samad c Rohit b Bumrah 20(9) [4s-1 6s-2]

Bumrah to Abhishek Sharma, out Bowled!! The middle-stump has been uprooted! Goes for the yorker, bowls a low full toss at 141.4kph, Abhishek Sharma moves across to scoop and doesn't connect. Hears the death rattle! Abhishek Sharma b Bumrah 10(13)

Boult to Bairstow, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Superb bowling! Slower bouncer from Boult, kept it wide outside off and that meant Bairstow had to really fetch it on the pull. He is clearly foxed by the variation, and one hand coming off during the shot execution doesn't help either. Straight down the throat of deep square leg. Brilliant cricket from MI. Bairstow c Hardik Pandya b Boult 25(15) [4s-2 6s-2]

Pattinson to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Pollard!! There's the wicket MI were looking for! Precisely why Rohit brought Pattinson on, and the plan has worked. Fuller and wider outside off, might have been a tad slower than Pattinson's usual deliveries and Pandey doesn't get the timing on the loft. Picks out Polly at long-off and he ain't dropping these, not even with this 'catching flu' that's caught the IPL. An enterprising little knock from Pandey ends but he'll be gutted to go at this point. Manish Pandey c Pollard b Pattinson 30(19) [4s-4 6s-1]

Jadeja to Mandeep, out Caught by Rayudu!! A fine low catch by Rayudu brings an end to Mandeep's cameo. Slightly up outside off and Mandeep plays an uppish drive straight to the man stationed at cover. Looks skyward does the batsman as he's disappointed at his dismissal. Was looking for a boundary and has perished in the process. Mandeep c Rayudu b Jadeja 27(16) [6s-2]

SN Thakur to Pooran, out Caught by Jadeja!! Cross-seamed one in the slot, which Pooran's shaping up to smoke somewhere into the desert outside deep mid-wicket. But, but, there's something called not finding the middle, and as shocking as it might sound in this innings for Pooran, this delivery was that. He gets a lot of height, but Jadeja's swirling under at the boundary, reverse-cupping a seriously good catch. Pooran c Jadeja b SN Thakur 33(17) [4s-1 6s-3]

SN Thakur to Rahul, out Caught by Dhoni!! W.W. And just like that, both set batsmen who'd laid this platform for the final assault, won't be the ones doing it, if it ever goes on to happen. A full wide delivery that Rahul throws his bat out to, but doesn't get close to the line, ending up outside-edging the squeeze to a diving MSD -- who has his 100th IPL catch. Wow, quite the equivalent of 400 Test wickets. Rahul c Dhoni b SN Thakur 63(52) [4s-7 6s-1]

Chawla to Agarwal, out Caught by Sam Curran!! Chawla get Agarwal! The leg spinner strikes on his first ball. Was a short ball by Piyush as Agarwal pulled it straight to Sam Curran at deep mid-wicket. Looked a tired shot and the batsman will have to make his walk back to the pavilion. That's also a time-out.. Agarwal c Sam Curran b Chawla 26(19) [4s-3]

Moeen Ali to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Devdutt Padikkal!! Fantastic catch by Padikkal. Huge wicket for RCB as it is the in-form Delhi skipper walking back. He does fancy clearing the rope against the spinners and would have as well if he was playing in Sharjah or Abu Dhabi, but not here. Flighted around off, Iyer goes with the spin and heaves it to deep mid-wicket, Padikkal settles under it and clutches with both hands, then throws the ball up, goes outside the boundary rope and comes back in to complete the catch. Excellent awareness shown by the youngster. Shreyas Iyer c Devdutt Padikkal b Moeen Ali 11(13) [4s-1]

Siraj to Pant, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! Siraj has his man. The partnership has been broken but the damage has been done. The slower delivery from Siraj, rolled his fingers across the ball at the last second, Pant goes on his knee to play the slog sweep but is through the shot early, the ball clips the inside edge brushes his thigh and ends up on the stumps. Pant b Siraj 37(25) [4s-3 6s-2]

Siraj to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by de Villiers!! RCB have the breakthrough and Kohli is pumped up. Shaw has been bounced out. A head-high bumper on leg from Siraj, gets a bit big on Shaw who got inside the line to hook it away. The ball trims the glove on its way to the keeper. AB moves to his left to pouch it. End of an entertaining knock from Shaw. Prithvi Shaw c de Villiers b Siraj 42(23) [4s-5 6s-2]

Udana to Dhawan, out Caught by Moeen Ali!! Holed out! 134.4kph, full on the stumps, Dhawan stands outside leg-stump and backs himself to clear the ropes. The bat turns at the point of impact and robs all the timing. It comes off the bottom part of the bat too. Moeen takes a couple of steps forward from long-on to complete the catch. Dhawan c Moeen Ali b Udana 32(28) [4s-3]

Axar to Moeen Ali, out Caught by Hetmyer !! It's the longest part of the boundary at cow corner, but Moeen thinks his forward-charging-hoick would do it. Nope, much like his innings, and much like RCB, this goes nowhere .. and that nowhere is straight down deep mid-wicket's throat. Moeen Ali c Hetmyer b Axar 11(13) [4s-1]

Rabada to Kohli, out Caught by Pant!! So Rabada's now got Kohli thrice in seven innings -- Bunny worthy? Anyway, Kohli didn't have much of a choice here. He'd realized he's got to everything left by himself, and so what if it's the Delhi's best bowler, He charges down, swipes across the line and ends up getting a thin inside-tickle through to the keeper. Kohli c Pant b Rabada 43(39) [4s-2 6s-1]

Rabada to Washington Sundar, out Caught by Ashwin!! 141kph. Short. Head-lined. Sundar looks to make room. Pulls. Zero timing. Negative control. Mid-wicket inside the circle. And just like these broken sentences, RCB crumble further. Washington Sundar c Ashwin b Rabada 17(11) [4s-3]

Rabada to Shivam Dube, out Bowled!! 143kph bolt -- full, into middle-stump, and Dube's aimless swing isn't even close to connecting. Yea, sheer pace, and sheer-er accuracy, going under the bat and making a real mess of the stumps. Shivam Dube b Rabada 11(12) [6s-1]

Rabada to Udana, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! WW.W. Rabada's putting up a spectacle here, courtesy Udana's top-edged slice, barely clearing the infield as Iyer - the extra cover - runs backwards and takes it without fuss. Udana c Shreyas Iyer b Rabada 1(3)

Nortje to Siraj, out Bowled!! Typically tail-ender like. Siraj clearly (and smartly) keeps backing away to save getting hit and this time Nortje's not taking chances. He's kept it really full, on middle, and is uprooting middle. Siraj b Nortje 5(4) [4s-1]

Ashwin to Devdutt Padikkal, out Caught by Stoinis!! Ravichandran Ashwin gets the man in form. An off-break by Ashwin, that was bowled a lot slower through the air. Devdutt Padikkal swings his bat and gets it off the cue end as Stoinis takes a comfortable catch at deep mid-wicket. The pressure of big scores, he's yet to deal with that, is Devdutt Padikkal. Even against Punjab when RCB were set a big target, Padikkal failed to get going. Same is the case today. Devdutt Padikkal c Stoinis b Ashwin 4(6)

Axar to Finch, out Caught by Pant!! Finch has been dismissed, finally. So, the couple of dropped chances haven't cost much. This pitched outside off and spun away sharply from the batsman who tried to flirt with it and got an outside edge. Sharp reflexes by Pant as he takes it. Both RCB openers are back to the pavilion as the Delhi spinners are choking their opposition at the moment. Finch c Pant b Axar 13(14) [4s-1]

Nortje to de Villiers, out Caught by Dhawan!! Royal Challengers Bangalore in trouble as AB de Villiers walks back. Was a length ball by Nortje and the batsman completely miscued it. Tried to hoick across the line and mistimed it towards mid-wicket where Dhawan takes a comfortable catch. In the battle of two South Africans, it's the younger bloke who comes out on top. de Villiers c Dhawan b Nortje 9(6) [4s-2]

Jofra Archer to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Shreyas Gopal!! Of course he can. That's Archer at his best. Exploits the weakness of Krunal and sends him packing. Short of length delivery at the ribs, Krunal is not comfortable anything around there, he gets all cramped up as he attempts the pull, it is a tame one and Gopal gobbles up the dolly at mid-wicket. Krunal Pandya c Shreyas Gopal b Jofra Archer 12(17) [6s-1]

Kartik Tyagi to de Kock, out Caught by Buttler!! Maiden IPL wicket for Kartik - beaten for sheer pace was de Kock - banged in short and at the stumps, de Kock was rocking back on the pull, the ball kept getting big on him, he was in no control over the shot, gets a top-edge that spills straight up - Buttler called for the catch and holds on with ease. de Kock c Buttler b Kartik Tyagi 23(15) [4s-3 6s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to Rohit, out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! A soft soft dismissal for Rohit - he falls to leg-spin once again. The wrong 'un and Rohit read it well, came down the track, got close to the pitch and was then looking to launch it back over the bowler's end. Unfortunately for him, the bat turned slightly on impact and he ended up heaving it down the throat of Tewatia at long-on - didn't have to move an inch and the Royals have their man. Rohit c Rahul Tewatia b Shreyas Gopal 35(23) [4s-2 6s-3]

Shreyas Gopal to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Samson!! Back to back wickets for Shreyas, but what was Ishan Kishan trying to do? First ball and he looks to slog Shreyas out of the park - was the wrong 'un and he didn't get anywhere near the ball, sliced it high and over cover. Samson circled around it, kept his eyes on the ball and pouches it with glee. All of a sudden, Shreyas finds himself on a hat-trick. Ishan Kishan c Samson b Shreyas Gopal 0(1)

Boult to Jaiswal, out Caught by de Kock!! Jaiswal gets back into the team and gets a duck on return. Back of a length outside off, just a hint of shape for Boult, nothing great. But this is a bad shot. Plays away from the body looking to run it to third man, only succeeds in nicking it behind. Jaiswal c de Kock b Boult 0(2)

Bumrah to Smith, out Caught by de Kock!! A replica of his dismissal against Cummins in that game against KKR, where he looked so frenentic. Was more composed at the crease in the time he spent here, before this happened. Tries slogging Bumrah off a length and inside-edges it behind. De Kock flies to his left for an excellent grab. Royals in a hole. Smith c de Kock b Bumrah 6(7) [4s-1]

Pattinson to Buttler, out Caught by Pollard! That is an incredible catch! I mean, he did make things difficult for himself to be honest. Not sure he knew where the boundary was. Buttler just got under a really full one and tried to launch this over long-on, but hand to take on the tallest fielder in the opposition - Pollard ran towards the left and leapt up, got a hand, but the ball bounced out in the first attempt - and yet, he was quick enough to grab it in the second attempt! Buttler c Pollard b Pattinson 70(44) [4s-4 6s-5]

Pollard to Tom Curran, out Caught by Hardik Pandya! Curran's gotta go! Doesn't quite have Buttler's bottom-hand, and with the pace off, he's tried to club this with a dominant bottom-hand over long-on - doesn't get much distance, and Hardik runs in from wide long-on to comfortably hold on to a catch. Tom Curran c Hardik Pandya b Pollard 15(16) [4s-1]

Bumrah to Rahul Tewatia, out Bowled! Knocked him over! The form-temporary-class-permanent thing is the cliche of all cliches, but he's nailed another yorker at 142.1km/h. Tewatia has to move around and improvise to get under that and score some much-needed runs, but it's not going to happen. Not tonight. The bails light up and Rahul Tewatia has to go. Rahul Tewatia b Bumrah 5(6) [4s-1]

Bumrah to Shreyas Gopal, out Caught by de Kock! Oh this is Vintage Bumrah. Maybe Bumrah isn't old enough for the word VIintage to be associated with him, so lets say "typical" Bumrah! Angling in sharply, brute-forcing even this unresponsive Kookaburra to straighten off the seam, and take the hopping batsman's outside edge to the 'keeper for a catch. QdK just about keeps that off his face. Might consider a helmet. Shreyas Gopal c de Kock b Bumrah 1(2)

Bumrah to Jofra Archer, out Caught by Pollard! Tries getting under it, but doesn't do so well enough to a really full ball, and the result is that he can't quite get the desired height - and that would mean Pollard at long-on has to hold on to a ridiculously easy catch. Jofra Archer c Pollard b Bumrah 24(11) [4s-3 6s-1]

Pattinson to Rajpoot, out Caught by Rohit! That's the end of a comprehensive performance from the Mumbai Indians. Rajpoot backs away and tries slicing that over cover, but Rohit inside the circle takes a catch above his head to end a memorable night for Mumbai. Rajpoot c Rohit b Pattinson 2(5)

Boult to Samson, out Caught by Rohit!! Mumbai pacers on fire again. And not for the first time in this tournament has Samson been dismissed after being rushed on the pull. So after a great start, he's had three successive failures. The ball just comes onto him quicker than expected as he camps on the front foot. Spoons it up off the splice to mid-on. Royals losing this match in a hurry. Samson c Rohit b Boult 0(3)

Rahul Chahar to Lomror, out Caught by (sub)Anukul Roy!! Different ways to get your name out there. He probably won't get a chance to showcase his left-arm spin this season, but Anukul Roy has pulled off a blinder as a substitute fielder. Sliced off a thick outside edge as Lomror tries to go leg-side. It goes up and behind Roy at short cover. He runs back, eyes on the ball which is going further and further away, but he races after it and dives with both hands, parallel to the ground while taking it. Stunning. Lomror c (sub)Anukul Roy b Rahul Chahar 11(13) [4s-1]

Karn Sharma to Narine, out Caught by du Plessis!! Just Jadeja things! Takes an absolute specky, at deep mid-wicket, diving parallel to the ground to his right and just when he was about to skid onto the boundary triangles, tosses the ball to Faf (running from long-on) to complete the catch. Was loopier and the line teased Narine to go for the big one, attempts a heave, only to be bettered by the fielding brilliance of CSK. The KKR management won't be too disappointed and we could see Narine play more of such roles for the rest of the IPL. Narine c du Plessis b Karn Sharma 17(9) [4s-1 6s-1]

Sam Curran to Morgan, out Caught by Dhoni!! Huge wicket in the context for CSK and it's Curran who's got his England skipper. Surprises Morgan with a short ball and gets good fizz off the pitch to get it climbing and restrain the timing on the shot, Morgan was probably aiming for the deep square region, but the shot lacked intent and MSD does the rest behind the sticks. Morgan c Dhoni b Sam Curran 7(10) [4s-1]

SN Thakur to Russell, out Caught by Dhoni!! Shardul Thakur has been terrific with his lengths and variations today. Bowls the cross-seam delivery and pitches it much shorter than it did against Gill. A similar dismissal though. Russell looks to go over mid-wicket with a cross-bat swipe and sends a crisp edge through to the keeper. Russell c Dhoni b SN Thakur 2(4)

Dwayne Bravo to Tripathi, out Caught by Watson!! First wicket for DJ Bravo in IPL 2020. Pushes this fuller and in the outside off zone, Tripathi looks to play a cheeky dab with an open bat face but the ball takes the bottom half and lands in the bucket hands of Watto at short third man. Bravo went up straightaway and so did Watson, the umpires just wanted to be sure as they deemed the soft signal in favor of the bowler. Tripathi c Watson b Dwayne Bravo 81(51) [4s-8 6s-3]

Sam Curran to Karthik, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Gone this time. Thakur juggles once and takes it on the second attempt. Short and got big on DK outside off, he still tries to force the upper cut and hits it flat and straight to the fielder at square third man. Karthik c SN Thakur b Sam Curran 12(11) [4s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to K Nagarkoti, out Caught by du Plessis!! Catching practice for Faf at mid-off. Bravo is back to doing what he does best, take wickets in the death overs and unleash his dance moves. Deceives Nagarkoti with a slower ball outside off and a tame chip to mid-off meant curtains for the batsman. K Nagarkoti c du Plessis b Dwayne Bravo 0(2)

Dwayne Bravo to Shivam Mavi, out Caught by Dhoni!! Goodness me! That is a spectacular catch from MSD. Sheer commitment and his athleticism was on full display while grabbing the catch. Dhoni seemed to have signalled something to Bravo just before this delivery and I'm guessing it's something to do with lack of pace. Keeps it in the shortish length area does Bravo and induces a thick outside edge on the slog. Dhoni dives full length to his right, juggles it on the first attempt and then takes the rebound with a sharp spring to his right. 150th IPL wicket for Bravo! Shivam Mavi c Dhoni b Dwayne Bravo 0(1)

Dwayne Bravo to Chakravarthy, out Chakravarthy Run Out!! 1 run completed. Jadeja and Dhoni, goodluck taking risk against this duo. Chakravarthy powers this low full toss to deep mid-wicket and there was never a two there, KKR still run in hope and hope is all that'll remain for them. Jaddu fires it quickly and MSD was in perfect position to deflect it onto the stumps. Chakravarthy run out (Jadeja/Dhoni) 1(1)

SN Thakur to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Dhoni!! Big loud nick. Thakur has Gill for the third time in as many IPL innings -- this time with Gill throwing it away after losing patience, losing shape and losing his timing. He tries a cross-batted heave but the length's a little too full to be doing this, and ends up getting a tickle on the under-edge through to the keeper. Shubman Gill c Dhoni b SN Thakur 11(12) [4s-1]

Karn Sharma to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Jadeja !! Miscued slog-sweep. It's a normal leg-break, but Rana's adventures of wanting to smoke this over the longest part of the ground - cow corner - ends up in the hands of the fielder out there. Clearly not full enough to be slogging these .. Nitish Rana c Jadeja b Karn Sharma 9(10) [4s-1]

Karn Sharma to Narine, out Caught by du Plessis!! Just Jadeja things! Takes an absolute specky, at deep mid-wicket, diving parallel to the ground to his right and just when he was about to skid onto the boundary triangles, tosses the ball to Faf (running from long-on) to complete the catch. Was loopier and the line teased Narine to go for the big one, attempts a heave, only to be bettered by the fielding brilliance of CSK. The KKR management won't be too disappointed and we could see Narine play more of such roles for the rest of the IPL. Narine c du Plessis b Karn Sharma 17(9) [4s-1 6s-1]

Sam Curran to Morgan, out Caught by Dhoni!! Huge wicket in the context for CSK and it's Curran who's got his England skipper. Surprises Morgan with a short ball and gets good fizz off the pitch to get it climbing and restrain the timing on the shot, Morgan was probably aiming for the deep square region, but the shot lacked intent and MSD does the rest behind the sticks. Morgan c Dhoni b Sam Curran 7(10) [4s-1]

SN Thakur to Russell, out Caught by Dhoni!! Shardul Thakur has been terrific with his lengths and variations today. Bowls the cross-seam delivery and pitches it much shorter than it did against Gill. A similar dismissal though. Russell looks to go over mid-wicket with a cross-bat swipe and sends a crisp edge through to the keeper. Russell c Dhoni b SN Thakur 2(4)

Dwayne Bravo to Tripathi, out Caught by Watson!! First wicket for DJ Bravo in IPL 2020. Pushes this fuller and in the outside off zone, Tripathi looks to play a cheeky dab with an open bat face but the ball takes the bottom half and lands in the bucket hands of Watto at short third man. Bravo went up straightaway and so did Watson, the umpires just wanted to be sure as they deemed the soft signal in favor of the bowler. Tripathi c Watson b Dwayne Bravo 81(51) [4s-8 6s-3]
